Reviews.Title: “Great service for what should be a great vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer792
Reviews.Content: My head was absolutely spinning when it came to planning an early summer trip to Orlando, but the reservations center at Lake Buena Vista was an absolute godsend. The vacation advisor, Wyatt, was extremely helpful was extremely helpful with guiding me along with the whole process. I absolutely can't wait until I go to soak up sun around the pool, and soak in the exciting life Florida has to give me. I'd definately suggest this to any and all of my friends! Summer fun, here I come!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it all”
Reviews.Author: Melissanan
Reviews.Content: I was in a hole trying to plan a stay somewhere with my family and when I called to plan wyatt was amazing in helping me and giveing me info that I needed ad help out so much. The hotel it self was just how he made it sound and the pool was amazing, along with the spa was so relaxing and my family loved the big bed and te shops near by xD I loved it all and he sold me on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Disneymom472
Reviews.Content: I was in a rut when it came to planning my vacation but the reservations center at the hotel helped me so much. Wyatt was extremely helpful. He made it easy peasy lemon squeezy. I was so worried. But he lifted the weight off of my shoulders. The pool was great, the spa was great, everything fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Stay”
Reviews.Author: gar40
Reviews.Content: We told the front desk our room beside the elevator was noisy could they find us another room, we were also above the games room."They said the place was full and would check and get back to us later but never did". Ear plugs worked and they should be given out at the front desk, too bad they didn't sound proof the walls when constructed you can easily here people in the halls.The rooms were nice and clean older style TV's.the beds were a little hard but comfortable.Nice large tub used it only once to soak but the shower was just fine.The kitchen was well equipped and we used it for breakfast and some dinners.Was awaken one night at 3 am by some jerk car drifting in the round-a-bout he eventually hit the curb and it stopped his car the police and rescue were there and dealt with it.I asked the front desk if everyone was OK and he said he knew nothing about it(typical).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place to stay, no complaints just not "extraordinary"”
Reviews.Author: TribeFan19
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this resort. We went with my 2 children (5 & 3 years old) and my mother & father in-law. We stayed in building #3 in a 3 bedroom/2 bath. The place had basically everything we needed/wanted. Anything that was missing such as a cookie sheet we just got at wal mart. We never called the front desk because we figured it would be faster just to get at WalMart. Per the other reviews the beds are very average & the pillows and sheets are nothing close to being as nice as a Hilton (which is where I usually stay when traveling on business or with my wife). The kids really enjoyed the pool. I would definetly recommend renting a car at this resort in order to make quick runs to wal mart for supplies and odds/ends. I was able to get a mini-van for $180 for my 6 day stay. The place was clean when we arrived, however the trash from the previous tenant was still under the sink which I just took out myself. The location to Disney is awesome and very convenient. I never used the shuttle but it is available, however they only have a few set pick up times which doesn't work well with small children. All in all I would say it is a good value for your dollar. We stayed at this place for $850 for the week and were able to save tons of money by taking all of our drinks and packing our lunches while at the parks. We also made sure we filled up with a big breakfast before we left for the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Not all its cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: mero1
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a two week stay in mid April 2012. I chose this accomodation due to the supposed free wifi in every room. However this should read "wifi free" in every room. The signal strength is appaulling, when I told the reception I could not get the free Wifi as advertised they just shrugged and suggested I call technical support. Gee thanks! Technical support were even less helpful. Suffice to say, DO NOT STAY HERE if you think you're getting in room wifi. As for the rooms themselves, we stayed in a 2 bed apartment in building one. There always seemed to be a stale musty smell eminating from the room and the floors looked liked they could do with a serious steam clean. I suppose the reason is, unless you pay up an additional $30 your rooms don't get cleaned, which brings me onto my other point: HIDDEN CHARGES. After you've booked in a been charged a non-refundable RESORT FEE of $10 a day they charge you extra if you want your room cleaned, evidently, none of the previous occupants of room 1606 had taken up this additional cost! There is a convenience store on site which charge astronimical amounts for everyday items. i.e on my first night there, i was fleeced $40 for a pizza a small bottle of water and a box of cereal and milk. I actually think the assistants were embarrased to take my money! Speaking of overcharging, the onsite bar "Frankie Farrells" also charged silly amounts for basic food and had the audacity to automatically include a 15% gratuity to every bill. Which puts you in the awkward position of questioning the waitress upon bill settlement.(I will review the food in a seperate article) The swimming pool is good for kids as it has a walk-in area and fun slide. However, due to the tall buildings surrounding the pool, you will not get a full day of sun and most of the pool is covered in shade which leaves only one small area in the sun in the afternoon. You'll need the sun to warm up too especially as the water is pretty cold, despite the claim it's heated. There is an outlet mall located next door which is pretty bland and not much to write home about so I won't dwell on this. The location is great for Disney which gives it an additional star, however, there are many other like accomodations in the area such as Vistana, Floridays, Blue Heron which I will give a chance if ever staying in the area again over this particular resort. I personally wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “"Policies do change ma'am"”
Reviews.Author: EStone_77
Reviews.Content: I've never stepped foot on this resort and I already know I will be booking elsewhere for my family's vacation. I booked a 2-bedroom suite online tonight (4/28/12) with a total for a 6 night stay being $1271.25; after searching discounts sites and finding a cheaper rate that would have saved me $300, I contacted the resort for a price match as I read (on Tripadvisor.com) one recent vacationer did the same and the resort matched her price. I called and was informed they could match the price but the price from the discounted site did not include the $10.50 nightly resort fee, I was ok with that because I would still save $190. I was told by the female customer rep to cancel my online reservation and call back to book with the matched price. After cancelling the reservation, I contacted the resort and was greeted by a male who after giving me the run down of a 'new found' special they were having, stated in order for me to get the discounted price I had to book through the discount site as they DID NOT match prices. I informed the guy what his co-worker informed me less than 20 minutes earlier and he replied "policies do change ma'am." Wow....if policies change that quick I hate to be a guest and experience their quick draw action first hand!

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort Village”
Reviews.Author: tonylisa1991
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel. We enjoyed it thoroughly! First: GREAT location. It is very convenient to the airport, parks, attractions, outlet shopping, and groceries. Second: CLEAN! We were amazed with the spaciousness of our suite (4bedroom/4 bathroom/full balcony) as we were travelling with my sister's family. The kids LOVED having their own space (boys got their own room and bath/same for the girls) Third: The service provided by the staff was wonderful! They were very helpful with any questions (restaurant recommendations, directions, discounts, etc..) and requests. Fourth: Our families liked the fact that there were pools, restaurant, take-out place, grocery store, work-out room and outlets located right on the property. Fourth: We booked through travelocity and got such an AMAZING deal! For the price each family paid, we would get a hotel room in NYC for ONE night; we stayed at LBV for SIX! The carpet was old but CLEAN and the televisions were not HD, but this was not an issue with neither the adults (4) nor children (ages 11-14). We are all looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined stay”
Reviews.Author: JGB62
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week vacation at Lake Buena Vista Resort. We stayed in a four bedroom on the 15th floor of building 5. Overall the condo was clean and in good condition. The only negative was the stained and soiled carpeting in the living and dining area. Unfortunately, I just couldn't get past this issue and it put a damper on the entire stay. Also, it was hard to believe the pool was really heated. Everyone at the resort was friendly and helpful. Would not stay here again sight unseen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: C-town77
Reviews.Content: This place is excellent. I was so happy to see the location was very close to magic kingdom and looked very nice from the outside. Got to check in early and had a friendly customer service person. Got the room i wanted based on previous reviews (building 5) and was soooo happy to see how beautiful the room and view was! Most everything was clean, newer and luxurious! We had a great view of the awesome pool as well. I had forgotten there were 2 bathrooms, which was an added bonus. The only negatives i saw at this place (which were very minor)-some mold in the master shower, but nothing major. Btw, the jacuzzi tub was awesome for my son to play in! And the shower also dripped, which was annoying at nite because you heard the drip and the drain gurgling-i would assume maintenance could fix, but we rather someone not be in our room, so we lived with it! The only other thing in the room was that the couch could of been replaced-a little well worn. I did also have 2 issues with staff-i had called the front desk once and the guy who answered was quite rude, and the pool bar was very understaffed and food took a long time. But overall very very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: 1stclasspreferred
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights over March break in a 3-bedroom, 2-bath unit (Barbados). The unit was in good condition although the carpeting was a bit ill-fitting in places (it was in good condition). Staff was warm and friendly at check-in. Upon entering the suite, problems immediately noted with the air conditioner not operating, period. Required multiple calls to the Front Desk to get Engineering up to look at it; the outcome was the unit had frozen and we had no choice but to wait until the cover ice dissipated (problem due to previous guests 'likely' running the unit set to very cool and having the balcony door open; moisture issues). Engineering fellow said he would be back in the morning to ensure it was operating. While a warm and uncomfortable night for sleeping, not totally horrible (no other suites available, or so I was told). I was offered, and accepted, an appropriate discount on the suite. By next morning, the A/C had cleared and operated fine for the remainder of our stay. This suite was in the building (apologies for not recalling the Building #) that contained the grocery store, Pizza Hut Express (these were in the same space and operated by the same folks), as well as Frankie Farrell's Irish Pub & Grille. Our suite had a 'fireworks view' which placed it at the same building end as Frankie's. Unfortunately, sitting outside on the balcony at any time during opening hours (which means all day, every day) was met with billowing wafts from Frankie's kitchen. Normally, I like the smell of food but this was really the greasy residue that drifted upwards and stayed a while. Quite sickeningly thick at some points. Avoid this location if at all possible. As for 'Fireworks View', well, as has been reported previously, you hear nothing and see only marginally more from EPCOT and Magic Kingdom. Quite a distance away. I'd rather opt for the additional bathroom and forgo the 'view.' The grocery store on the first floor is very pricey for standard staple items, you are better to head down the road to the Supercenters or Publix, all within a few minutes' drive. The Pizza Hut Express served up the basic fare and was decent. Frankie's was ok, too, not great, but not bad. Good place to bring the kids. Speaking of kids, the pool area with pirate ship is quite nice with food and beverage service close at hand. The area surrounding the pool (and the hotel, generally) is a bit sparse and unfinished. Don't expect lush landscaping or exotic foliage. A few seagulls, perhaps. Parking on the property was challenging as the resort was at capacity but a little walk never hurt anyone. The Spa was reasonably priced and provided good service. All in all, a reasonable choice with good value in return for our price-point and accommodation needs. Might consider returning in the furture but truthfully on the fence.

Reviews.Title: “great location and fun with kids”
Reviews.Author: eric_woelkers
Reviews.Content: perfect location near disney, universal studios, and seaworld (10 mins from any of these places). there is an outlet mall just a few minutes walk from the resort. we had a 2 bedroom which was great. pool area was awesome for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “It was the best in customer service and beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: htchrunik
Reviews.Content: Just want to say thanks to Trish at the main desk for going the extra mile to make sure we would be happy with our stay! We tried to check in early however our room was not quite ready, but she called us when room keeping was finished so we could get into the room and freshen up after a very long flight. Thanks so much! Also the rooms were fully equipped, and spacious, and beautiful. They were large enough so that we could also get away from each other and have some quiet time. Absolutely would stay again! And the cost is much, much less expensive than other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean But Worn”
Reviews.Author: wehinks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa April 15-19, 2012. Booked through Hotwire, I was surprised that it was rated as high as it was (4 Stars). The hotel was clean, the kitchen was fairly new with granite counters and working appliances, and the furniture, for the most part, was old and fairly comfortable. My only problems were that the rooms we were in (2 bedroom suite) were quite worn. The furniture and carpet were worn out and obviously had not been replace for many years. The pillows were hard and flat, and there were none to replace them. When I asked at the front desk, they said all the pillows were being replace in the months to come, too late for me. The wrong size blanket (a maybe queen size on king bed) with a couple of holes in it was on our bed. There was no maid service at all unless you wanted to pay $30 per day extra. It was nice having a kitchen at our disposal, and there was a convenience store in our building that had just about everything (including a Pizza Hut), but was a bit pricey. There was a nice balcony to sit on, and again, the place was clean. I think this resort is better suited to people with young children who don't want to have to worry about damaging or breaking something in a nicer hotel room. My kids are older now, and we're used to something a little bit more upscale, so, although it was an OK resort, I would not rank it higher than a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “family”
Reviews.Author: gismariely
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent withing walking distance to downtown disney. Relaxing, snack bar ,clean, room are a very good size.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: soleil_0402
Reviews.Content: Stayed at LBV resort with hubby & 3 kids in April for a week. Conveniently located close to EVERYTHING: Walt Disney, SeaWorld, Universal, Premium Outlets, Restaurants & a Walmart. Had a 2 bedroom condo; clean and just big enough for a family of 5. Pools were clean but unfortunately, a bit cold as the mercury would drop considerably at night. Kids didn't mind!! If you are looking for a place to stay with more convenience than a hotel room and a way of cutting down on restaurant costs, LBV resort is it!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Alison D
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks in a 2 bedroomed condo in Building 1. Immaculately clean and everything provided for an enjoyable (though exhausting) Disney holiday. We didn't have a car but took the shuttle to the parks and a short taxi ride to Walmart. The onsight food store very expensive but ok for the first day and top ups. Our 8 year old granddaughter loved the pool area (as did we all). Just make sure that if you require accommodation in a specific building or floor you contact the hotel itself rather than the central reservations. I requested via email (to central res) on several occasions no higher than 2nd floor (one of our party height phobic) and on arrival we'd been designated floor 8 ! However the helpful hotel staff sorted us out. A thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful clean resort.”
Reviews.Author: Toni C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only because we were relocated from the Enclave after a bad experience there. Wasn't sure what to expect here either but judging by the pictures we received on the paperwork, the resort looked beautiful. Had a late check in but everything went smoothly and quickly. We were told by the concierge we were staying in a 3 bedroom suite and we were elated since there were 6 of us. The room was lovely, spacious and very clean. Big kitchen with all the amentities one would need while on vacation. The master bedroom was HUGE with a big tub in it. The beds were very comfy and we all slept great. My biggest regret is that we didnt stay here longer to utilize the pool and the room. My only two complaints about the resort is parking is hellacious, it took us quite some time to find a space every time we had to park the car. And secondly, you do not automatically receive turn down service for the rooms. You have to request it and I believe it was only done if you paid a small fee for it. If you want new towels you will have to go downstairs and get them yourself. But besides those minor details we loved Lake Buena Vista and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good family location”
Reviews.Author: Jewel-71
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 adults/2 children) visited Orlando in February 2012 and stayed at Lake Buena Vista resort for 10 days. The resort was easy to find with the help of our Sat nav and the staff who booked us in were warm and friendly. The condo's are spacious and clean, they are a 5 minute drive from Walmart and a 10 minute drive from the Magic Kingdom. I would have given the resort a 5 star rating except for three small issues, 1) The furniture looked a bit tired, 2) There was a smell from the condo which hit us everytime we entered the front door (could not put my finger on what had caused it) 3) The bottom sheet of the super sized bed felt like a single, my husband and I regularly had a tug of war :-). The points raised look bad however these were very small issues and would quite happily go back there again next year, on the plus side the parks are virtually at the door, there is a good washing machine/dryer in each room and there are some good restaurants nearby, the Olive Garden and the longhorn steakhouse. We did go to a place called the Golden Corral I would suggest you give this place a wide berth, the food is mediocre at best. The shop on site is really expensive, even if you get in late following a long day it would be more advisable to go to Walmart down the road as it is a lot cheaper. It was just over $20 for milk, cereal and a couple of soft drinks, what a rip off. You do have to pay extra if you want your room serviced the price depends on what you require, we asked for a full service a week into the holiday I cannot fault this as the rooms were cleaned to a very good standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marita M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the lake buena vista for 2 weeks at the end of March. We were a little apprehensive after reading the reviews, but we had no reason to worry. Checked in with very helpful staff and stayed in a 3 bedroom condo in building 3 on floor 13. What a view!!! The condo was very clean and smelt really fresh. The condo was huge and had everything we required. Our boys room had a view of the pirate ship pool and they couldn't wait to use it, It didn't disappoint. We hired a car which was great as we could go everywhere we wanted to go. The shopping mall was great and got some real bargains. We eat at the Irish bar and the food was good. We eat at Santa Fe one night and it was brilliant. The weather was gorgeous for the whole 2 weeks. Would definitely recommend this place. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: Leo C
Reviews.Content: Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa was the perfect place for us. In fact we'll be returning again this September for an extended stay with the family. I can't say enough about the courteous staff and the great accommodations especially with a large group. The hotel surroundings were active enough but also a place to relax and enjoy ourselves after a hard day at the parks. Close to everything also. I have already recommended this location to many of my friends and co-workers who have had the same experience. Thanks again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in our 2 bedroom condo, more closet space than I have at home. Staff was friendly and the unit was clean and well equipped. The location was just minutes from Disney and Universal. The on-site convenience store was well stocked and we had two great meals at the Irish Pub on the premises. Hope we can get back for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: OscarsDad007
Reviews.Content: Having read all recent reviews I did Email ahead to see if we could be located in Block 5. However when we got there we were told that they were fully booked and were allocated an apartment in Block 5. No problem with that with underground parking so your car didn't get too hot in the full sun of the day, as well as parking outside of the block. First impressions were of a huge apartment although a like on the dark side . Could maybe do with a lick of white paint just to freshen it up slightly. Loved the spa bath in the bedroom. The plug leaked initially but maintenance soon replaced that. If Buena Vista read this just a couple of suggestions : 1. make the rubbish / recycling bins by the lifts larger , they soon get full , particularly first thing in the morning 2. Please , please supply electric kettles. It takes a absolute age to boil a kettle up on the electric hob. Good accommodation though which lived up to its website description and Trip Advisor postings - almost! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Young411
Reviews.Content: We loved our home aay from home. Our children could not wait to get to play in "their bedroom". i personally have trouble sleeping in hotels and I found the beds very comfy and warm. The rooms were very clean and decorated with towel art. The location of the hotel is very convienent with everything at about 15 mins away or less and a walmart 2 mins away.. Super awsome to have a shoping area right beside!!!! We were to stay in building 5 but they upgraded us to building 3...no issues what so ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: RachaelNorthampton
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at LBVR+S and and had brilliant time. My 3 children loved the pool and my husband (Tom) and I loved the pool bar. The staff were very welcoming, helpful, kind and funny. So a big thank you to Amanda, Tom, Chris and the gang for making our holiday extra special. We had a 2 bed app and could have packed a lot lighter due to loads of bath, shower and pool towels provided. We used hotel shuttle to disney once due to it only going out and returning at set times once a day. Taxis to most parks cost $30 and $5 to wallmart down the road. Food at Frankie's and pool bar were both nice and reasonably priced. We were all sad to leave and will definately hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Read All reviews”
Reviews.Author: justme028
Reviews.Content: The resort is nice as long as you are not in building One! I rented a 4 bedroom unit, nice size but needs updating. If you plan on cooking, bring your own supplies, kitchen has 1 pan and 3 small pots, no veg. peeler, no steamer, etc. The pool that's in between building 1 & 2 is small, during my stay garbage was left by others and never picked up, dirty towels were left all weekend to pile up. Second pool is okay for small kids, over priced bar and if you leave your drink and walk away the staff will come and take it away. The Irish pub on site needs a good cleaning, the store they have on premises is way over priced. The outlets next door play the outdoor music day and night, that's right, all night, so put on the A/C cause if you don't the music will keep you up. Don't bother complaining to mgmt., I tried.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney D
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at the LBV Resort Village and it was fantastic! We stayed in Building 5 again and had a great view of the pool. The 2 bedroom condo was perfect for our family of four, although we barely used the second bathroom because our kids always wanted a bath in the "big bathtub" or "big shower!" We used the shuttle service to Sea World one day, which was nice...saved us some money for parking. And I love that I came home with nothing but clean clothes in our suitcases, thanks to the washer/dryer in the room. One little thing could have improved our stay...a bottle of Windex. There was a pretty glass table in the dining area, but with a 2-year-old child, that glass became a smudgy mess very quickly. I would have loved to clean it, but wasn't going to go out and buy cleaning products. I think most guests would gladly tidy up a bit if a few cleaning products were provided...which would also make the clean-up easier for housekeeping after check-out. But, I can't really complain about not having the opportunity to CLEAN on my vacation! We'll be back, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family base”
Reviews.Author: Louise T
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful family break. We stayed in a 2 bed condominium which is basically a 2 bed suite. The condo is perfect for families giving the flexibility of an apartment but with the convenience of a hotel. It's literally a 3 min drive from the enterance to Disney and a Walmart superstore. A car is advisable, the hotel does have a free shuttle to lots of parks but we liked being able to have the flexibility to come and go as we pleased. The pool area is great and the pirate ship even has a water slide, 3 hot tubs also kept us adults happy. The designer outlet mall was great we stocked up on beautiful clothes, tip dont take many clothes as you will not be able to resist the bargains. Weather lovely for an Easter break hot and sunny but not uncomfortable, parks busy but they always are. A great room with a huge jacuzzi in the en suite, everyone very friendly, convenient location great base would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Trip Mar. 2012”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great room, great hotel. Planning to stay there again. Will however never write another review. I do not need to be treated like an uneducated moron because i do not want to write a review that is at least 100 characters long. With this review I have now in effect written two, First and Last one. Have a great life.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: NickM_ZA
Reviews.Content: 1) The rooms and bathrooms are spacious, clean and have great facilities. 2) There is free wifi throughout the hotel. 3) The hotel is a great base for visiting all Universal and Disney parks. 4) Take yellow-cab taxis (metered), not the ones the hotel provide as they are much more expensive. 5) There is a great Irish Pub which serves pretty decent food across the road. We didn't eat at the hotel ever so can't comment. 6) The Expedia help desk, situated in the hotel, has staff available until late in the evening. They offer fantastic advice on which parks to visit (based on your demographic), which parks have shows (and when) and what tickets to purchase (which you can purchase through them). 7) We stayed in a 3 bedroom, self-catering, villa. We had 6 people and had more than enough space. My wife and I stayed in the main suite which had a large ensuite bath with a shower, and toilet. 8) The beds were very comfortable. Overall, great experience at a really affordable rate. This was my second trip to Orando in 7 years.

Reviews.Title: “I should have taken notice of previous poor reviews”
Reviews.Author: vegnomeat
Reviews.Content: I had booked a 3 Bedroom Barbados Suite with Fireworks View, arriving on the 2nd of April along with my wife and two children. Let me start off by saying that I am in the Royal Air Force and had recently returned from Afghainstan and this was the opportunity for a two week break with my family. Upon arriving at the resort reception I was informed that they didn't have a 3 bedroom apartment available and that we had been allocated 2 x 2 bedroom apartments on the same floor but not connecting. My wife had booked the 3 bedroom apartment in January of this year and to say we were dissapointed is putting it mildly. A family holiday now meant that we had to share two apartments which weren't connected. Quite frankly the Staff were appalling. The following day I used guest services to book some Sea World tickets, I asked if a discount was available for Military personnel and was told that no discount was available at Sea World. However, we subsequently found out that Sea World do not charge an admission fee for Military. I am certain that Guest Services knew of this but wouldn't turn down a sale. In summary, despite booking 3 months in advance (and paying up front) we didn't get the apartment we wanted, we didn't have a fireworks view, and we ended up paying for Sea World when we didn't need to. Terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sandra C
Reviews.Content: We were really delighted with everything about Lake Buena Vista resort and spa. There was 7 of us in a 3 bed apartment. We had loads of room and everything we needed for our 2 week holiday. We stayed in Block 3. There are 2 pools both were refreshing after a day at the parks. plenty of sunbeds and pool towels were provided. All the parks are easy to get to and are all within 15 to 20 mins away. Walmart was 5 mins down the road and sold everything you could imagine or possibly need on holiday. Up the road were loads of restaurants to suit everyone. Sizzler breakfast was excellent. Would definitely stay here again and would recomend to anyone reading these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “"Just Average"”
Reviews.Author: frozenathome
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights after staying on Disney for 10 days. I would highly recommend staying on Disney if that is the purpose of your trip. This resort is off a very busy road and is often backed up with traffic. We stayed in a spacious 3 bedroom in the newer building #5. We could see the pool from two of the bedrooms. From the balcony we could see the highway, swamp land and the pool from only 1 side. This corner unit was fairly clean though we noted mold on the window and blind of the 2nd bathroom and some on the walls of the en suite shower. The kitchen was modern and well equipped. We appreciated having a washer and dryer in the unit, but the washer was very loud when in use. Our biggest issues were the carpet in the main traffic areas was worn and a bit dirty looking. The sofa was worn and should have been replaced a few years ago. We can not imagine having to use it as a sleeper sofa. The en suite shower had no shelves large enough to hold shampoo etc. There were no room darkening shades/curtains making it difficult to sleep. We were fortunate to have 2 double beds instead of twins in the 3rd bedroom. The elevators were very fast and efficient. The building has 2 levels of parking underneath. The spots were very tight and it was difficult to find a space later at night. We were told by another guest not to park on the 1st level as she had her car vandalized there on a previous visit. There is outlet shopping within walking distance and a very busy Walmart near by. The key card often stopped working and we had to get it fixed at the front desk. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful which is the biggest plus of this place. My daughter wanted to stay here because of the pirate ship. She reports unless you are under 7 it is no fun because the slide tube is small and it is easy to bang your head. We will look elsewhere next time as there are many other choices around this area.

Reviews.Title: “it was okay”
Reviews.Author: jule256
Reviews.Content: the room was spacious and the kids were excited about the pirate ship pool. There were some things that I did not realize upon booking, so please be advised. 1) The huge pirate pool is NOT heated and was cold during spring break trip; also, the kids cannot get on the ship - it is only a slide. 2) There is NO free housekeeping options - not even to exchange towels or change trash; you are on your own. 3) Although the rooms were huge with high ceilings; it was very plain - no towel racks, no place to put shampoo in shower, no DVD player, not many extra linens. The pull out couch was not appropriate to sleep in for long (can feel springs), sample shampoo only in one bath, no sample laundry detergent to get you started. No extra frills basically. 4)The pool side "restaurant" was just 2 very unorganized bartenders that were taking drink orders and food orders/preparing food at the bar (no kitchen). On the good side: we enjoyed the Irish Pub, there was a parking deck - adequate parking, we had a great view of the pool, it was fairly close to everything - but there are tons of hotels along that strip. So, it was just okay to our party. We stayed in the Floridays 2 years ago and didn't realize how good we had it. They had a heated pool, towel service included, nicer/newer rooms, and upgraded us from a 2 bedroom to a 3 bedroom at no charge. It had a much grander lobby and better service. With so many hotels to choose from; the pirate ship pool was what drew us in to this hotel but the kids were too cold to enjoy it and it was 85 degrees outside.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, wonderful staff,great for families.”
Reviews.Author: Terrianne A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lake buena vista resort village and spa in march/april 2012. We arrived in our 3 bed appartment and were amazed at the size cleanliness and facilities, well exceeded our expectations. The pool area was imaculate , free towels and full toilet facilties and a well stocked bar with friendly and chatty staff. We had a lot of great tips regarding park entry from one of the local bar staff who was floridian born and bred. Frankie farrels was a huge surprise as,as english person we expected it to be a bit tacky, it was completely the opposite. Full of character, friendly staff and great food at resonable prices, try the new york strip and the apple pie. Fabulous. We did have slight issue with a noisey neighbour who liked to rise early and had noisey kid. We complained and our complaint was taken very seriously and dealt with quickley and courteous. Thank you daryl, manager, good job.

Reviews.Title: “Some practical advice”
Reviews.Author: Noah585
Reviews.Content: So many good things have been written about this place that i don't need to repeat them. Yes the pool is great, building five /pool view wonderful and the space in a 2 bed unit is just briliant for a family. However the downside is that you really do need a car if you want complete freedom. We used the hotel shuttle bus frequently and found the normal driver, David charming, very helpful and always on time. The only problem is that at peak times the park has already been open for several hours before you arrive and so fastpasts etc have often gone and queues are long. Personally I would be happy to pay a small charge and have more frequnet service.A Taxi to Epcot is $20 each way. Walmart is massive but you cannot walk there. There are no pavements or road crossings and jay walking is just dangerous as it is a very busy 3 lane road. A taxi is $8 each way but still cheaper to do a big shop at the start of your trip and eat in, as hotel shop is expensive and low on fresh goods such as decent bread. The Pizzas from the shop are great though. Disney Gear at Walmart is cheap but the outlet centre has even better prices for small disney gift items, hats etc. Yes pool towels are small, use two! They occasionally ran out but were re stocked quickly each time. The water on the first week of our holiday was lovely but on the second week it was freezing, Did the refill the pool or turn the heating off! The slide is too vicious for under fours! height resriction of 122cm (i think) and I was allowed to go on it once with my daughter who had been really looking forward to it. We both hated it but other kids seeemed to enjoy it. Other than Frankie Farrells ( not impressed) and the food court at the outlet centre and the pool bar there are no restuarants within walking distance. The Ponderosa steakhouse is closed although the concierge staff did not know this when i asked if it was ok to walk up the roadside to it. Went out to eat a couple of times and used taxis which are plentiful. Had a really good Steak at Johnnie Hallidays at The Crossroads shopping centre following a game of crazy golf but expensive and very noisy, felt a bit under dressed in casual clothes although not in shorts! Taxi to hotel from airport cost $45 one way and $50 on return, probably upset the driver by not giving him a tip but decided the overcharging made up for it. Many taxis are not metered. We were still quids in by not hiring a car, but did suffer minor inconvenience as a result. I think next time i would hire a car even if i didn't use it every day. People complained in the reviews about not being able to get rid of rubbish. in our block (5) you could acccess the trash shute from the top floor. The washer drier / hoover etc and the hugh number of towels provided made it unnecessary to use maid service. And yes the sheets did slip off a couple of times, but it took a couple of seconds to sort, not exactly a holiday spoiler! My main gripe was the rubbish television programmes. Millions of channels to chose from, but try and find a weather forecast or decent kids programme for smaller kids- no chance. The disney channel is NOT Disney Junior. Some better assistance in the room on channels and how to use some of the applicances would be good, us English don't have such complicated ovens/air con units etc! Can't really see the fireworks, so don't get stressed about not having that view, pool view is much nicer. All in all a good place to be, particulary if you have a range of age groups to cater for, but sorry to say won't be back. Orlando, been there done that.... Have a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to take on Disney”
Reviews.Author: DaisyTwinklestar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week-long trip to Disney recently, and I'd definitely recommend the condominium set up Lake Buena Visit Resort offers! Our check in was pleasant and uneventful, and we really did not have much interaction with the front desk the rest of the week. They gave us several coupons for the amenities that the resort offers. We enjoyed the close proximity to the parks. The Disney property is only a mile or two away. Staying in a 3 bedroom condo was also a plus. Splitting the cost with someone, like the grandparents, makes the stay cheaper than lodging on the Disney property. Plus, the kids get their own room, and the adults can hang out in the living room and watch TV, or sit on the balcony, after the kids go to bed. There's a kitchen, so you can keep snacks and breakfast items on hand, which helps control costs, too. We even made a quick spaghetti dinner one night when we were tired of eating out. And finally, there is a washer/dryer in the unit so we could throw in a quick load of laundry as the week wore on. There's a pub on site which a few members of our group visited. The food was good, but somewhat pricey. The kids enjoyed the pool, but we didn't use it much as we focused on getting our time in at the parks. We had planned to celebrate my daughter's birthday with pizza and cake by the pool, but found that outside food is not allowed there. The few complaints we had: The furniture was worn, and we had dresser drawers that stuck badly. The bathroom had too few towels for the number of people staying. There was no clear trash disposal site. We called the front desk, and they weren't sure where to dump it, and finally someone directed us to a room on the floor to throw our trash bags. Some other complaints that might crop up that didn't bother us: The shuttle service is too limited. We knew that ahead of time and planned to drive on our own. Parking is $14 per day and good at all parks, so you don't have to pay each time you hop to another park, or return later in the day. The cleaning service is extra, but as we were staying in a weekly rental we had no expectations that anyone would come in and clean the place for us. If we do Disney again, I'd definitely stay here again. Good value, pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Could not more strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LBV Resort 4/5/12 to 4/7/12. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and resorts and never been inspired to write a review, although I confess that I use TripAdvisor religiously in my planning. LBV Resort, you got me to write my first review! LBV Resort is not a Ritz or a Waldorf, but that's not what you want in a family trip to Orlando anyway. If you are looking for a user-friendly place where kids can be kids and adults can be adults at the same time (yes, it is possible!), this is the perfect place. The Resort is surrounded by a discount outlet mall (with 2 discount Disney stores with prices that run about 60% off the park prices for merchandise and apparel). The pirate ship water park within the Resort is a blast, especially with the full bar and snack poolside service. Disney is right around the corner. The free shuttles from the Resort to Disney are great, but parking is so cheap and easy at Disney that we found it better to just drive. The rooms at the Resort are huge, updated, and clean and run about 80% less than staying at a Disney hotel for the same features and space. The staff at the Resort almost seem to, or perhaps literally do, enjoy working there and helping people. The Resort is surrounded by restaurants, shops, grocery, and everything that you would need to get on the trip. Staying at Disney pretty much requires that you eat at Disney for every single meal. The fully equipped kitchen in the room at the Resort gave us the option of cooking or just heating frozen stuff, resulting in a limitless menu at a fraction of the cost of staying and eating at Disney. When I researched where to stay on our trip, I must have spent at least two dozen hours looking at all of the options in and around Orlando. Every search that I did came back to this place. I am always skeptical when an option in a research project seems so clear and obvious, so I was at best cautiously optimistic when we arrived. LBV Resort blew away my best hopes. Please let me save you the time, energy, and angst of extensive research to essentially blindly pick a place to stay for such an important family vacation. Just book this place now and forget about it. You will never regret it, and you will have 23 more free hours that you otherwise would have spent researching Orlando lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: MomN2Travel
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to Orlando and our first time staying at LBVRV. Our family of 4 (kids 8 & 10) loved it. It was spacious, responsibly priced, built in kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms & nicely appointed. We are so used to being cramped into a typical hotel suite, this was a nice change. It was conviently located 5 min from Walmart. We stocked up on snacks, frozen pizzas, breakfast items & saved ourselves a bit of money by having a meal per day at the room. The kids (and the parents) loved the pool area. Kids liked the pool, having many kids to meet & play with. The parents liked having beverages & wi-fi so we could relax while kids played & had fun. If you're feeling lazy & have the extra cash, their is an expensive convenience store on the site. Yes, I paid $20 for a $10 bottle of wine, but I didn't have to go anyway. Call it a convenience charge. We didn't get a chance to try the Irish pub or Pizza Hut, but the prices looked very reasonable. We will definitely stay here next time we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Ensure your pre booking requests have been received by the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AWX
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the accomodation late on Good Friday, April 2012. After reading numerous articles regarding Lake Buena Vista Resort and Village we decided to forward a request for accomodation in Block 5 with a pool biew. Prior comments suggested that other areas, in particular block 2 were sub standard. When checking in we were allocated a room in block 2 and advised that the accomodation was standard thoughout. After travelling from home in North East England to Manchester and then Orlando the last thing we wanted to hear was that the reception staff had no notification of our request. I advised the person we met on reception that we had specifically requested accomodation in block 5 on account of that we had done some prior research and specifically did not want to be in block 2. I was advised that there was no accomodation in block 5.and that the the resort was fully booked. I agreed to see the room in block 2 to draw my own conclusions. On inspecting the room in block 2 my family and i felt that the room was sub standard, definitely not 2 or 3 star never mind 4 star! The room had an unpleasant odour, it was dour and there were cigarrete end on the balcony of this no smoking room. We returned to reception and voiced our concerns and then met by a female member of the mangement team,who to say the least was one of the most rude and unfriendly/ uncompramising member of hotel staff which i have come across! I outlined our request for a room in block 5 and the fact that my family and i were very tired and frustrated from a long journey. This person was the most unfirendly hotel member of staff i think i have ever met. Her attitude left my wife highly upset in that we were advised that there were no other rooms in the accomodation and either take the room in block 2 or nothing! I hope that the Lake Buena vist resort and village take note of this issue and this unfriendly person and offer her training in people skills! She certainly lack any personality and front of desk attitude! Fortunately our issues was raised to another member of staff, his name ws Chris and he was able to in the first instance offer us accomodation in the more up to date block 3 with the option for to view and move into block 5 the following day. This request was offered and we viewed the room in block 5 and moved the followiung day! In summary we are now in block 5 and enjoying our holiday! the moral of this is that Make sure any requests are acknowldged by your accomodation well in advance of your holiday and some people are helpful and have good people skills to deal with customer issues and others should be either trained or given non people facing roles. We are now enjoying our holiday! If booking this accomodation please avoid block 2!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rayven12
Reviews.Content: We holidayed in Florida dec 27th 2011 to 11th Jan 2012 and stayed here for our first visit to Florida and loved it!!!! We stayed in a 3 bed suite and had loads of room, the bedrooms were spacious, the full kitchenette was brilliant and the living space was huge. We were in building 3 on the 7th floor. We had no trouble getting parking no matter what time we came back at. We didn't take up the house keeping but they dropped in new towels/bins/toilet rolls regularly. While it was about a 20 min drive to Disney it suited us to be a bit far out as we could relax when we got back to the room. Kids loved the pool which stays open till 10pm so even if we got back at 9pm the went straight over, it was great for winding down the 4yr old. Frankie Farrells pub which is on the corner of the complex serves great food and will deliver to your room, we had a couple of meals from the and would have no complaints. The Outlat stores are within 2 mins walking distance from reception and we found the good value, DD loved the converse and the Oshkosh and Carters were good value. We're hoping to return in 2yrs and plan on returning here.......we loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: Brendan D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort every year from 2008 and I am booked to return in July of this year. In my opinion this is a first class resort . the resort is perfectly located for Disney and also for eating out and shopping at the major outlets nearby in addition the accommodation is spacious and I have always found it to be clean. buildings. 1 and 2 do require to be updated and I am sure the management team will be looking at that. the swimming pool(pirate ship) is fantastic for families to spend a lazy day away from the parks. the Irish pub on site is handy for bar type food and the wallmart nearby is handy for all essentials. In short, this resort ticks all the right boxes and provides a great base for a fantastic family holiday in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort”
Reviews.Author: golfkrazy2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take my mother, our two (2) children, their spouses, and our four (4) grandchildren to Walt Disney World, Florida during spring break (April 2, 2012 to April 6, 2012). After doing extensive research, we decided to rent two (2) 3 bedroom / 2 or 3 bath condominiums at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. Instead of booking directly with the Resort, I used the website www.vrbo.com in order to book directly with one of the private owners, in this case Sahota Dream Vacations. I have done this at many locations throughout the United States and as a result, generally receive better rates and more personalized service than what is offered by the Resort. After booking the two (2) condominiums with Mr. Sahota, he forwarded me the official reservation confirmations, which included all of the pertinent information. When we arrived, we were truly impressed. Both condominiums were nicely decorated and very clean. The kitchen was modern with a large refrigerator. Two (2) of the bedrooms were master suites, with a large Jacuzzi tub and a separate walk-in shower. The units were on the second floor, which was fine for our family. The grounds around the resort were clean and well maintained. Both pools were very nice. The resort offered a complimentary shuttle to the various theme parks, which we used each day. We were even able to purchase our Walt Disney World tickets with the Expedia concierge, located in the Resort lobby. There is a Walmart Super Store located less than one (1) mile from the resort. They have all of the groceries and other items you would need for your visit to Orlando, FL. Attached to the resort is Frankie Farrell's Irish Pub. We ate there the first night and could not believe the food. The portions were large and prices were very reasonable. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We also ordered food “to go” on another occasion, and found it to be just as good as the first night. I would highly recommend the Resort, Sahota Dream Vacations, and Frankie Farrell's Irish Pub.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suite -- Wonderful Price”
Reviews.Author: VoxPop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa for the last three days of our vacation, after spending our first six nights in a family suite at the All-Star Music Resort. Let me say that there is no comparison in terms of value. Our room at the Lake Buena Vista was far more spacious and much, much more luxurious. The suite was clean and well appointed. My wife and I loved the master bedroom -- the jacuzzi tub was a nice touch. My children were also happy with the two double beds in the second bedroom. The only thing the suite didn't have was laundry soap, but when we called the front desk, they sent it up within about fifteen minutes. The suite was also very convenient for visiting Disney. It was actually quicker to get to Downtown Disney from it than it was from our Disney resort hotel (ten minutes by car as opposed to half an hour on a bus). We also visited Epcot and Animal Kingdom, and the drive in was quick and easy. My children loved the pirate ship pool, begging us to leave the parks early so we could go back for a swim. My only complaint about it was that they kept the water a little too cool, making it difficult to get in once the sun was off the pool area (around 5:00 pm). We made one visit to the outlet mall next door, but I found it kind of creepy. It seemed like one of those places that is built and then no-one shows up. We ate at the food fair there one night, which was a mistake. It seemed really run down and the food was bad and overpriced. I would strongly recommend against going there. We also ate at the Irish restaurant next door. It was much better. Apart from that, however, I had no complaints about this hotel. The only advice I would give is to make sure that you have a car, because you are going to want to drive to wherever you are going if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: xmcnickyx
Reviews.Content: We stayed during December 2011 for a 2 week trip. It wasn't the easiest place to find but that might be because there were a million hotels with 'Lake Buena Vista' in the title and I was very tired when driving trying to find it and my sat nav had no battery. However, once we got there and had figured out where we were it was actually a really straight run from the airport. It's very very close to Disney by car, took us no time at all to get to the disney parks. Universal was a little further away but still really handy and easy to get to by car. Check in was easy, gave us a load of coupons which we didn't even use but it was still nice to get them. Staff were all really friendly and helpful when we needed them and that wasn't very often because everything was great. The pool was really good according to the kids and my husband who used it. The appartment was brilliant, we were in building 3 on the 10th floor and it was really great, not the best view ever but we loved it. 3 bedrooms and loads of space, beds were comfy, place was clean and well equipped. Everything was really easy to use and we had absolutly no problems. It was nice an quiet all the time, hardly even ran into other guests, couldn't have been better! It's right next to an outlet mall which was alright but there is a bigger, better outlet mall a short drive away, on the way to universal. We used to Pizza Hut on the first night which was really nice and reasonable (we had a coupon for a free pizza we didn't use d'oh). The onsite shop is ridiculous though, we called it the $5 shop because EVERYTHING was $5. Loaf of bread, carton of milk, juice...$5! A bar of chocolate was ridiculously expensive! Save your cash and go to the walmart 5 minutes away! Really can't fault the place (apart from the $5 shop!) We didn't use all the facilities (spa, food etc) but as a base for the parks it was perfect. Would definitly return and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, convenient location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: WalkerTravellers
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit overdue as we stayed here in Oct/Nov 2010. We got a fabulous deal on a nightly rate through American Airlines. We stayed in a 2 bedroom in the building above the Irish Pub. The condo style with the full kitchen and washer/dryer was great for a two week stay. There was plenty of room for the 5 of us, 2 adults and 3 kids with a King size bed in the master bedroom, 2 twins in the second bedroom and a hide-a-bed couch. I loved the jacuzzi tub with the glowing flourescent lights after a long day of walking. The seperate shower and two bathrooms were appreciated as well. Walmart was close by which was a great savings for food/drinks. We prepared lunch to take with us to the parks most days and occasionally came back for dinner as well. We enjoyed one dinner at the Irish Pub, a bit pricey but good food. The pool was great and enjoyed by both the adults and kids. The waterslide is only available when there is an attendant which is a great safety factor. We took advantage of the free shuttle to the parks each day. You just had to make sure to book with the Expedia clerk the day/evening before. The outlet mall behind the resort had a few good deals and was open quite late in the evening. The only disappointment was that we left bathings suits and a sarong (that had special meaning to my daughter) in the dryer when we left. We phoned the resort from the airport and were told to phone the housekeeping department as they were seperate.....left a message and no one returned our call. My fault for forgetting them but a response would have been appreciated. Otherwise, the location, amenities and price were wonderful! Hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Would return to the resort - please read review”
Reviews.Author: K w
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort twice in three weeks during our vacation in March 2012. I had contacted Daryl the manager prior to my arrival as I have a son with acute autism and he cannot be on high floors or in a dirty environment. Daryl was helpful and put us in a low floor apartment in building 5. The building was in need of renovation but the apartments were roomy and reasonably clean. It was nice for my son to have a room to himself with a TV - we booked a two bed apartment. The sofas in the apartment are in need to replacement and due to the state of the sofa I had to request a cover for it as it made my son feel ill. During out stay we had a full clean at a cost of $30 - I requested that this be done while we were out. However, upon our return it had not been cleaned. I went to reception and they said it would be done in the next 1hr. We went for a drink in the coffee shop at the shopping outlet next to the hotel. We then made out way back to the apartment - my son went running up to the door to find it open! The cleaner had left the door to the apartment open and the spa tub was still dirty - the beds had not been made (the bottom sheet was on the bed then it was covered by what they call a comforter- there was no top sheet and blanket on the bed it had been left on the chairs in the bedrooms. - I went to the reception and Jason the assistant manager said he would meet me at the apartment - he came with the housekeeper who instucted the cleaner to sort things out. Again we went out - when we came back the tub had been cleaned but the beds still not sorted - I did it myself - however, when I rang and spoke to Jason he was abrupt and said that he thought he had rectified my issues and that this was the third time he had spoken to me that week! (The first time was with regards to the sofa cover I requested). I am not sure that he even apologised for the cleaner leaving the apartment door open - we were lucky nothing was taken. The reception staff were very helpful especially Trish, Tyler and Jean. We kept getting lost around the disney area and they kindly printed us google maps to all our destinations and I cannot thank them enough. We then went on a cruise for a week and then returned to Lake Buena Vista for 5 nights before returning home. On the second occassion we stayed we were allocated by Trish building 4 which in my opinion is better than building 5. Everyone on trip advisor says to ask for building 5 but I am not sure why. Apartments in building 4 have nicer covers on the beds but apartment from that are the same. Again the sofa was old and dirty and I just put a blanket on it to cover it up. It was just the feel of building 4 that I like better given that it was in the main reception building. It was also more secure as you needed your room key to use the lift. This was not the case in building 5. We did not use the pool or the pub therefore, I cannot comment on these facilities. They did however, appear to be popular I even saw people in the pool at 7.30am! All things taken into consideration I would return to this property due to its location etc. and I would request a room in building 4. I also understand from the staff at the resort that the sofas are to be replaced this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue and wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: Scrabbler2003
Reviews.Content: We reserved a two-bedroom, two bath with complete kitchen at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa and it was ideal for us. The location was excellent as many restaurants and outlets were close by as well as the parks. The pool was great, also. The food and service at the Irish Pub restaurant on the premises was very good. My only complaint was that we could not get a decent cup of coffee pool-side. Then, we used coffee maker in the kitchen with the same awful results.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, nice suite, close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: samanne
Reviews.Content: We picked the Lake Buena Vista Resort because it was close to Disney and offered two bedroom suites for our family of four (3 year old, 4 month old and two adults) for a good price. We were happy with the decision! We were in a suite in Building One facing the front office. We asked for a room in Building Five when we checked in but were told there would be an additional charge. Building One was fine. It was in the same building as the Irish Pub and store so that was convenient. We could see the Disney fireworks from our balcony. Parking (although not covered) was available right outside the elevator doors. It's not fancy but if you are looking for a place for kids with a nice pool this is worth checking out. PROS: - Short drive to Disney (10 min). We saw a shuttle bus picking up and dropping off at the hotel, too, but we didn't use it. - Master bedroom big enough for a pack n play for our 4 month old with pleny of space to get around. - Master bedroom bath's jacuzzi tub was a big hit for the 3 year old. - Deck had lots of room and was shaded. Great place to have breakfast and a glass of wine when the kids are asleep! - TV in living room was big and had tons of channels. - Kitchen was well equipped with dishes, coffee maker, etc. They give you a starter roll of paper towels, little bottle of dish washing soap and one pack of clothes washing detergent. - Washer/Dryer! It was great to be able to wash our own stuff all during the trip! - Irish pub had good food for takeout. - POOL! The pool area had some shady spots to hang out with the 4 month old and the 3 year old loved the pool! You can get towels poolside. Lots of families with kids so be aware if you aren't into lots of kids. However, it wasn't loud and crazy. Just lots of families making use of the pool. We didn't eat at the pool side restaurant but looked like they had some good snacks and drinks. They were open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. CONS: - The bed and pillows were hard as a rock and the blankets are not soft. I wasn't excited to snuggle into my bed at night. - We couldn't figure out how to use the AC/fan. It was either really cold or started to get warm in the room. However, we didn't call the front desk to ask how to use it so maybe there's a trick that we didn't try to regulate the temp in the room. - The Irish pub was the only restaurant within walking distance. We got delivery from a local pizza place one night but that was it for variety. Of course, you can get in the car and find more but with two little kids we were hoping for more places close by. There is a Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts about a 2 mile drive down the street. - The store has lots of variety but is really expensive.. as you would expect. Try to go to a grocery store at the start of your trip to get everything you need to avoid having to use the store. - The pack n plays were delivered with a standard twin sheet so if you want to have sheets made specifically for a pack n play you need to bring your own. Also, make sure you have them reserved. When we arrived, they told us we got the last two. - The second lock on the door is really low. My three year old could reach it to get out of the room. This is why we chose for him to be in a pack n play instead of possibly being able to open the door in the middle of the night. - We didn't see any outdoor space for the 3 year old to be able to run around. (We just spent lots of time at the pool when we were at the hotel). Overall great visit and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: LocalFLtravelor
Reviews.Content: Could not ask for a better place to stay near Disney! Pool was awesome. We stayed in a 2 bedroom on the 14 floor. The large deck was a nice touch and the condo was way more than expected. I would highly recommend over stay on Disney property. The irish pub was great and the outlets were a nice extra bonus! Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated...”
Reviews.Author: BeachGroup
Reviews.Content: Orlando has seen some pretty awful construction in the past 10 years, but this place takes the cake. I dont think the developer spent a single dime to upgrade anything. CHEAP. Parking is very difficult, not enough spaces for the size of the buildings. Beds and pillows very uncomfortable. But the biggest issue...I requested a crib for my 1.5 year old. When I arrived they said that they did not have any "Pack and Plays". Said a previous guest went to WalMart and bought a crib and that maybe I could do that. They promissed a crib the next morning and the night clerk wrote a note. The next morning I made sure to call and remind them as we got very little sleep with the baby in bed with us. I was told that when the maids were out for turns they would get a Pack and Play to our room. Upon returning from Disney at 10:00 at night...SURPRISE...NO Pack and Play. I called the front desk and was rudely told they were "Still looking for one" Avoid this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 332Happy_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time reading reviews and although most were good there was always the odd one that filled me with dread. I did as others had suggested and sent an email requesting Building 5 with a pool view. When we arrived we'd been put in Building 1. However when the clerk checking us in saw a copy of my email he quickly said he would check availability for Bldg 5. He couldn't get us a pool view but offered to upgrade us to a 3 bedroom condo with a firework view in Bldg 5. It was amazing! Clean, spacious, everything we could need for a family of 4. Later we were glad not to have the pool view as a large party of schoolgirls arrived and often made a lot of noise. I must also say that the free wifi in the condo was terrific. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would visit again and would recommend with some warning...”
Reviews.Author: hb9911
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 nights mid-march. Check in was fine. Nice staff, friendly, etc. we were in a 3 bed 2 bath in building 3, on the 6 th floor. The suite had an odd smell when we opened the door. Kind of a chemical type smell which we decided was cleaner? It was a good size with full kitchen. The furniture was definitely due for replacement (stained and threadbare in spots). The fridge and oven were very clean, which was a nice surprise as overall we felt we needed to clean the rest of it (counters were dirty, utensils needed a wash). Carpets were stained, albeit clean (no dirt on my kids white socks). Tile in bathrooms were also stained, had paint drips, etc. we also scrubbed the air return vent for the a/c as it was completely coated with dirt. I don't think it gets any attention. Overall, it is due for a reno and needs a bit more attention by the cleaning crew but was otherwise comfortable. The sheets didnt fit the king bed and the pillows were awful but the mattresses were new and clean so that made up for a lot. Be prepared to buy supplies (cleaning, dishwasher soap, toilet paper) as there isn't any provided (1 roll of tp per bathroom). Pool was nice, the Irish pub just so so (I won't eat there again) and it is central to everything. Walmart is 5 minutes up the road, disney parks are 5 minutes and sea world, universal are both within 10 minutes. A great selection of restaurants are a quick 5 minutes as well. There is a small outlet "attached" and a huge premium outlet mall 5 minutes up the road. I would recommend with warnings to book in a newer building and book directly rathet than via expedia or the like. I believe any place is going to be more prepared to please if you aren't all paid up prior to arrival. Overall, not bad. I didn't get the feeling things weren't maintained, but just in need or replacement (in terms of furnishings). It works great for a family as you all have space to spread out not feel like you are on top of each other at night, which is the only time we were in the suite. I am sure we could have rectified the cleanliness issues we found had we called the front desk, but we needed supplies anyways so we just dealt with it on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Coba5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in a 3 bdrm, 2 bath condo in Building 1. Quiet condo at the end of the 4th floor hall. A very comfortable stay with all the amenities needed for a condo rental. The small kitchen was equipped with basic necessities for simple meals - only had breakfast at condo. The washer and dryer combo was very useful. The beds were comfortable however the bedsheets are too small and did not fit the mattresses. In room safe was great to have. Good location. Close to supermarkets. Easy driving to Sea World, Aquatica and shopping outlets. Also easy drive to many family restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort near Disney.”
Reviews.Author: Tracy M
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights at a very reasonable rate through Hotwire. Hotel had everything we needed. Great high ceilings gives the suite a felling of being at home and not in a hotel room. Kids had their own room with twin beds and parents had seperate bedroom with King bed and soaker tub. Beds comfortable and all had a good nights sleep which I rarely get in a hotel. Quiet even though we were near main doors on ground level. Shuttle service could be better. It goes to Epcot then you have to take a bus from there. We did not take the shuttle for that reason. We drove without any problems. It is conveniently located near Disney and a Walmart. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would I return again ?”
Reviews.Author: clanchiefScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 14 nights and booked 14 nights prior to arrival after reading the good reviews on trip adviser(which were justified). Check in was friendly,smooth and efficient. Notice had been taken of my e mail request for a high floor and I was given a 3 bedroom room in block 3 on the 15th floor. We had extensive views on all sides. The room was surprisingly quiet at all times given that it was school break. Only problem experienced was the room safe had been locked by the outgoing occupant. First call I made to reception was not responded to. The response to the second was immediate and an apology was given the engineer was polite and efficient and the safe was fixed. Importantly all the elevators worked without problem throughout my stay. Indeed when I entered the elevator on one occasion someone departing brushed against the control panel activating the call button. This was responded to immediately..Reassuring should a problem arise. At no time during my stay did I feel threatened or insecure. The parking was adequate and I especially liked the undercover parking on the second floor of our block. All the bedrooms had flat screen TV's with built in DVD players. The sitting room had a large screen TV. All the appliances worked throughout my stay. Dishwasher,hob,oven,washer and dryer were up to standard. All the staff at the resort were friendly and good spirited and responded helpfully when spoken to which added to the ambiance of the place. Used the onsite Irish pub. Food and service was very good as was the beer. Good on a Saturday for watching the English Premier League football..Never tried the take away pizza. The minor problems. It would appear that either the sheets have shrunk or the wrong size was purchased as they do not fit the king size beds. Owners on site are aware of the problem so I guess management should also be aware. A bit disconcerting to be lying in bed and turn for the fitted sheet to go twang and shoot off.No directions for the garbage disposal room. Found it by chance. Pool towels are tiny. WiFi was very weak and the signal was frequently lost. I forgot my cable so I never tried it hardwired. However I was still able to check emails etc. As you can see these problems are minor. Overall we had a great holiday. Would I return. Absolutely. However we got such a good deal with the tour operator we booked through (Thomson Holidays) I would want the deal again if I returned. I believe this is a great location for families and couples alike. Like most places a car is essential to get the most out of the vacation although there was a shuttle bus to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great for family”
Reviews.Author: flyinghighFlorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights was upgraded to 3 bedroom, clean lots of room great location. We usually stay on Disney property but was going with a friend and her two kids was nice to be able to spread out. Went down to pool one morning but pool did not seem to be heated was a disappointment and beds were not that comfortable thats why only gave 4 star. Great location

Reviews.Title: “Large room...great for families”
Reviews.Author: Go-GBP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3br, 2ba unit. Very spacious for 3 adults and 2 kids. Nice kitchen...we cooked all our own meals. Huge savings over staying on Disney grounds. 7-15mins to each park. Nice pool. Housekeeping not real attentive to our needs...seemed understaffed. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and will return!!!”
Reviews.Author: Reg_Daphne
Reviews.Content: Booked a package deal at a great price for 7 days in March. Two adults and one teenager. We had a fantastic time. The accomodations are self contained with full kitchen, living room, dining table, washer, dryer, bathroom and private balcony. We had the two bedroom unit on the 13th floor (very cool) with a view of the pool. One king sized bed (sheets were a little small from shrinkage - no big deal) with a private en-suite jacuzzi and the other room had two doubles. There were 3 flat panels, soap for dishwashing, one pkg of laundry detergent, two rolls of toilet tissue and hand towel, plenty of bath towels in both bathrooms, enough cutlery and dishes and basic pots and pans,coffee maker, toaster, blender, iron and ironing board oh yeah and a vacuum. It was clean and we opted out of asking for any housekeeping (extra charge - light/medium and heavy service at reasonable prices). We emptied out our own garbage (garbage chute at the end of the hall). The (pirate) pool is a good size with two hot tubs, games room was average, the convenient store was convenient. The walmart is a two minute drive away (for groceries). The location was perfect for golf, parks, shopping and restaurants. My son loved it and met so many other teens/kids because the pool was open until 10 pm. We will definitely return and this time I will pack light... because having all the amenities of home made it all the more comforting. Internet was a bit choppy sometimes but overall it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: leann27
Reviews.Content: Not far to the Disney theme parks, Literally right next door (within walking) to the factory outlets and an amazing spa! Plus, they offer shuttle service to Disney theme parks at various times. They have a pretty neat Pirate ship in the outdoor pool, but we didn't use it because it was too cold then. The Spa is fantastic, my husband and I both had appointments. He had a great massage and I had an awesome pedicure. The rooms were fantastic. We got a 3 bedroom suite for about $100 per night and it had 2 bathrooms, one of the bathrooms had a 2 person jacuzzi tub with jets. Plus only feet away from the hotel are restaurants like Pizza Hut Express and an irish pub.

Reviews.Title: “Great second to a Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: chrgrchick
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here for our son's first Disney vacation and brought his godparents with. About four miles away from Disney, it was a great alternative to staying on the property. Our room wasn't ready early, so we drove to downtown Disney for lunch. When we came back, they had run out of 3br suites so they upgraded us to a 3br 3ba suite for free to our surprise . They were very friendly and helpful and very kid oriented while keeping the elegance of a resort property. Our room was huge, and I mean HUGE with two of the bedrooms having their own master suites. HUGE Jacuzzi tubs, great sized full kitchen, and large balcony along with your own laundry in-room. We had an Irish pub and a convenience store/pizza hut express in our building. The main building had a bar/grill poolside at the waterpark which had a big pirate ship slide. Both open early and close late but have no fear, you can't hear anything once you close your slider door. There is also a separate, more quiet pool in another building. All buildings were within walking distance, as in across the street from one another. Concierge was outstanding and had discount tickets and package deals for dinner after.
