Cab rides averaged 15-20 to get to the Parks, and were also friendly, honest and clean. The convenience store is very expensive, but worth it being open till 1am and you need cold medicine! If not, the Walmart and CVS are about a Mile away. Hammocks by the pools and breakfast By the pirate ship and beautiful landscaping to walk through really focus on relaxing and enjoying yourself. One tip - make your spa reservations the minute you check in. We had a spa credit and couldn't use it because they were booked solid the last two days of our trip. There is also no housekeeping unless you request it, which even with the in room safe makes one feel better about no one coming into the room. It was a lovely trip only made better by the staff and resort, and I would highly recommend for the price and amenities. The only thing id do different is stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Family”
Reviews.Author: trvlbg
Reviews.Content: My family (adults, grandparents, and kids below ages 5) had a great stay at this hotel during the five nights we were there. I booked it via American Express Travel but later found out they actually used Travelocity. This place is more of a cross between an hotel and apartment because there's no housekeeping during the stay (pay extra if you want it), no one opening the door, valeting your car, no Coast Guard or towel kiosk at the pool, nor a bar inside the hotel. If you keep this in mind, you'll know what to expect. But if you ask you can get a Pack n Play for free to use and extra toilet paper. The hotel exterior and interior was clean. We had a 3 bedroom apartment in building 5 and had a view of Disney Magic Kingdom's fireworks from the side of the balcony. Each bedroom was clean, beds were firm, and the 2 bathrooms were clean and had shampoo, soap, conditioner, and small hairdryer. There were plenty of towels and extra bedding was available in the closets. The kitchen had a full size refrigerator, sink, stove, and dishwasher. There were enough dishes and a few basic pots and pans for the one morning we decided to make breakfast (went to the nearby Walmart where it had decently priced for water, bread, etc). If you're not into cooking, nearby Waffle House is a great budget friendly and pretty good place for breakfast or lunch. Our apartment was quiet except the one night someone decided to practice their race car driving skills outside. As for the service, front desk was very friendly and they had two computers with printer for guests to print their boarding pass. The only point I would take away is that if you need something from housekeeping, it will take some time so don't expect it immediately. Location is great. Disney resorts were 15-20 minutes away, Universal 20 mins, and there were plenty of chain and fast food restaurants. If you decide to eat the chain restaurants, be sure to call ahead to find out the wait time. You're in the midst of tourist town so there are plenty of people eating out. Parking wasn't an issue for us since I knew that if the garage was full, I could park on the street. It's right next to the parking lot. Overall I would definitely come back to this resort but will stay with Building Five since it seems more new than the others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Phil D
Reviews.Content: Just spent two weeks at the resort on holiday from the UK. Apartment was large, well equipped and ideal for a family stay. Close to all major attractions, shopping and other amenities. Pool on site was great for the kids at the end of a long day! Only criticism was that location was not well signed, we arrived in the dark during a heavy rainstorm and finding it was a bit of a challenge! Would definitely return here, great value and just what was needed.

Reviews.Title: “Anxiety relieved.... great vacation”
Reviews.Author: hjoyo
Reviews.Content: Booked this room through hotwire in January and started to read the reviews. I was a nervous wreck, cleanliness and safety are big concerns with me traveling with a toddler. I called the night we were driving in and Trish gave me good directions and as we were talking I told her I wanted Building 5 if possible based on the reviews, she said she would put me in her favorite rooms that had recently redone. We got there after getting lost (our fault) and we pleasantly surprised, check in was easy, we stayed in Bld 4, which is the main building. 2 bedroom great size, the minute we walked in I was so relieved. I scoured the rooms looking for "something wrong", something dirty, anything, all I came up with is a bobby-pin on the floor. The kitchen was super clean and smelled of bleach and the bathrooms were clean. I could see where some people complained of the pillows as they are hard and small, but we prefer hard over soft and they worked for us. Overall we were super happy with our room and LBV. We cooked in it 2 nights and it really is just a 5 minute drive to Disney. It was perfect with a toddler, we just drove back for naps and then back in the evening. The pool looked so fun, but as we were coming off swimmers ear this trip, we didn't get to enjoy it. Overall, I was very happy with this hotel, we're used to staying in nice places, but really enjoy having "condo' style with a kitchen. We would stay here again. BTW everyone complains about the outlet, it's not huge, but has a NIKE, carters and Osh'Kosh, seemed ok to us...and the Wifi really did suck. As far as the parking goes, we came back at "toddler" time around 8pm and never had a problem with parking, one night we came back at 11p and all the spots were full, but I ran in and asked were to park and one of the guys helped us and we parked right in front of the front doors. So wasn't a problem for us and they were at full capacity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kylie M
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome,rooms were massive, we ate downstairs at the Irish pub, great food, free wifi and parking, the outlet shopping centre next door was excellent, got some massive bargins.Walmart up the road,(we so need one of them in Australia) so close to drive to downtown Disney and Disneyworld, Amazing resort, will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacations in Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: Viviaguilar
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel every time we go to Orlando and we go very often. Since we knew about this hotel we loved it, the rooms have a very good size and they have different size of rooms and the price is excellent as is the attention. It is also close to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartments, just be aware of the extra charges”
Reviews.Author: northgang
Reviews.Content: Family spent 6 nights at LBV, overall it was all right. We were in just 3 and got a 2 bedroom apartment, extremely spacious for us. Hotel is at a very easy driving distance from everything around and we pre-booked getting a decent price. Service was not the friendliest I could have asked for... considering you are near so many parks, it would be good if people did give you a bit of smile while serving you... still everyone was professional and did their work. My only disappointment was not knowing that cleaning service is charged aside (30 bucks a day). I later found this into their website (may be it was my bad not reading the fine print).... also we got some daily extra charges of 10 bucks related to Orlando stuff... So, even after having a pre-booked pack, I ended with a bill of 200+. Make sure you do your math as sometimes the cheapest option is not really the best one...

Reviews.Title: “Great week in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl63
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its close location to the parks as we were running in the Disney Princess Half marathon on Feb 26th. Our suite was a 3 bedroom in building 1. We had lots of room for my husband and , two 18 year olds and a 21 year daughter. Only real complaint was lack of pans to cook breakfast on. one very old frying pan...other than that, the beds were comfortable. We had housecleaning come once to replace towels, etc and do a general cleanup. Other than that, we used the washer & Dryer.. The boys enjoyed the hot tub at night, however none of us used the pool due to the cool weather the week we were there. Close to groceries and shopping and Disney. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bar2ns
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just spent 3 weeks at this resort, we were very impressed. The apartment was large and very well equipped, clean and a great view of the pool area. Room 8106. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful when needed. it is ideal for the LBV factory stores and Frankie Farrell's Irish Bar & Grill which are in walking distance of a few minutes from the resort. We would certainly stay again if we return to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied for the price”
Reviews.Author: GigEm2011
Reviews.Content: Just spent 7 days at LBV and stayed on the 11th floor - building 5 facing Disney fireworks. Prepaid for a 2BR Suite for less than $150/night. Wifi worked great. Air Conditioning worked fine. Suite was spacious. Pool was great. Beds were comfortable. Elevators were fast and never crowded. Game room, Irish pub/restaurant and store were added bonus as were the Outlet stores just 1 block away. Checkin on Saturday night took all of 5 minutes. Minor complaint was the pool towels were tiny and fit my 4 yr old. Way too small for adults. But we brought our own so wasn't a problem. Staying on the Disney fireworks side proved to be of little use. The fireworks are over 3 miles away. Overall, very satisfied with the facilities and did not have any noise issues at all. Very quiet and was not disturbed by other rooms noise. Also is a great location in and out to Disney, Universal and Legoland. Upon check in, was provided printed directions on how to get to Legoland. Would recommend to friends and families to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: laurip13
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay in a 3 bedroom, 2 bath suite. Great room for the money. Plenty of room for our family of 5. The kids had their own space to get away from each other when necessary. The room was showing signs of aging, but clean. I do have a few complaints: weird smell in hallways, pillows hard little rocks, sheets did not fit quite right on some beds, trash bags provided very thin and rip very easily, could not access wifi in our room (signal too low). With all this said, our stay was very enjoyable and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms for families”
Reviews.Author: COMahoney
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 bedroom to stay for our 1st Dworld parks adventure, large rooms with full kitchen and living room is great for families, close to parks, but definately need a car, shuttle or cab to get there. Pool is nice for the kids, having a washer and dryer made it easy to pack for the long trip. Bar at pool is overpriced and food not good, don't bother with convenience. The service at the concierge was poor. Both times I visited to ask questions, I got rolled eyes and poor service. Jen at concierge was rude and needs to be taught some etiquette and helpfulness to guests who may be visiting for the 1st time.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsiderate of Guests”
Reviews.Author: CWill2222
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived at LBVR and was very pleased with the cosmetics of the property, as it was very pleasing to the eye and modern looking. We entered the lobby excited and ready to begin our vacation. We were a little early, but decided to attempt to check in anyway. Although our room was not ready to be occupied, the front desk clerk gave us coupons to eat at the nearby pub while we waited, we were very pleased with his service and hospitality. Finally, 4 o clock came and we were ready to check in, sadly we were greeted by a line of other guest waiting to check in, not a big deal as the front desk staff worked vigorously to get the many guest checked in. When we got to the desk we checked in. We entered our condo #2305, to find that the television had to be programmed to find channels, but even more disturbing, in two out of the three bathrooms had hair in both the sinks and tubs, as if they had not been cleaned after the previous guest had departed, and we also found an empty potato chip bag and a piece of starburst wrapper in one of the dresser drawers, how this happened is beyond us. Though this was very unpleasant, we did not get angry, but instead just wanted them to be cleaned properly so we could enjoy our vacation. We called the front desk, who quickly sent up two staff members. While I was away at the store, the men started cleaning, however when I returned one of the tubs was still dirty, and my fiance informed me that the cleaning staff said, and I quote, " We are not professional cleaners, and this tub is not dirty, and therefore does not need to be cleaned." We cleaned the tub ourselves, and this gave reason for my first of five attempts to contact the "Manager on Duty", named Darryl. This was the biggest disappointment of our vacation. Even if the cleaning staff did not believe the tub was dirty, it would have been very pleasing if they would have cleaned it, because it was soiled with toothpaste residue as well as hair. I attempted multiple times to speak with Darryl, but at no success. I did speak with his secretary who said that she would ensure that he contacted me. It has been more than a week since the first attempt to contact him, but still he has not returned any of my messages, I starting to wonder if Darryl actually exist. Despite what the lobby sign reads, Darryl seemed to never be on duty, rather at lunch, or out doing property inspections; whatever that means. We are not pleased with Darryl's consideration for his guest, or the cleaning staff. Other than those experiences the front desk staff were very understanding and accommodating. We enjoyed the nearby outlet malls, and the pools at the resort. Most staff were very friendly and considerate. However, because of the Manager's inconsideration we will probably seek accommodations elsewhere for out summer 12 vacation to Orlando. Overall, LBVR is great for families and can prove to be very enjoyable, hopefully future guest have a little better experience with the cleanliness of the rooms than we did, as we know our stay was during a very busy week.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great pool, but needs a serious tuning.”
Reviews.Author: Portkey7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo in Building 1, 4th floor, for 7 nights. First, the PROS: this resort is about 10 minutes drive from the major parks (Disney and Universal Studios); a Walmart (open 24 hrs) is nearby, so you can buy fresh food and other goods any time (BTW, we heard that Florida uses "recycled" water, perfectly safe to use however I definitely recommand you drink bottled water), a "small" outlet is also from walking distance; the kitchen is well equiped, but if you prefer dining out, there are several restaurants in less than 30 minutes drive, and also a Pizza Hut Express in the convenience store located at Building1; the washer / dryer were a bless, so you don't need to pack too much clothes for the entire week; the pool is nice and clean, we found the pirate ship a brilliant idea. As for the CONS: the carpet of the room and in the hallway is old, stained and ... smelly; the Internet connection is feeble inside the condo, our teenagers (who can't live without the Internet (!)) had to stand in the hallway to get a decent signal. And ... Ewww ... we found a cockroach wandering on the wall just outside our door once! Just hope we did not bring one home in our suitcase!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Thief River Falls, Minnesota, United States
Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Becky S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here January 21-28, 2012. It was easy to locate since they said on their website which address to use if using a GPS. It was very close to Disney, and not very far at all from Universal also. When we arrived, we planned to get some groceries, so to save some mone on the trip, and cook some of our own meals. There is a SuperWalmart located about a half mile from here, which was also very easy to find. The room was nice sized, and handy with a small kitchen, etc. We faced Disney, so we could watch the fireworks every night from our balconey. The kids really enjoyed the pool area, and we liked the little tiki bar that was located at the pool. There is a little convenience store, which is handy, along with an outlet mall you just walk to. The pub was nice, we went there twice--good food. All in all, our experience was great, and I would definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for famlies!”
Reviews.Author: Sillymom1115
Reviews.Content: We picked this place initially for the giant pirate ship in the pool but booked it because of so many other great amenities--like having a two bedroom, two bath "apartment" which was perfect! We put our 1 1/2 year old and 5 year old in their own room and we actually had some adult mom and dad space! This hotel was very well laid out, clean and very convenient to Disney World. We had a wonderful, but short (only 3 full days) vacation and our only regret is that we wished we had planned an entire day to hang out at the pool. The pirate ship water slide was so cool and my pirate loving 5 year old couldn't believe his eyes when he saw it from our balcony. The zero entry pool was also great for my younger child. The kitchen allowed us to have nice leisurely mornings--no rush to try to get to a restaurant. All the comforts of home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: morainepup
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the LBVR from February 27th to March 6th. At check in Trish upgraded our family of 3 adults and 2 kids [ages 7 + 11] from a 2 bedroom to a 3 bedroom suite in building 5 with a view of the fireworks. Couldn't have asked for more and it made our stay! It was a great suite with lots of room to relax. The kids LOVED the giant tub in the master suite. Room was very clean and well maintained. The tv in the master bedroom didn't get all the channels so when we called maintenance they responded within 5 minutes. After trying to resolve the issue unsuccessfully, they swapped the tv out - problem solved! The only quibble was the size of the kitchen meant little counterspace. We typically had breakfast in the room and made lunches to take out for the day and there wasn't enough counter to accommodate dishes and prep area. I was happy to have the choice of how frequently we chose to have maid service rather than having the cost bundled into the room price. The pool was great - the kids loved the slide + spray features and the adults loved being able to sit poolside with a drink. The hibiscus cocktail from the bar is highly recommended. Even though LBVR calls itself 100% non-smoking there were smokers around the pool @ the bar. We did find ourselves affected by the cigarette drift from the bar a couple of times while poolside. Parking was conveniently located under and around the building - we parked under to keep the car out of the sun. The resort is conveniently located - we had a rental car and were easily able to get to grocery stores + all the attractions with ease. The on-site convenience store is fantastic - everything you might need if you don't want to go off site. I don't normally use these kinds of stores as I find them overpriced and limited in variety but that is not the case here. The woman who runs it is delightful - very friendly and helpful. So much so, we almost found ourselves making excuses to go back and visit her! This is a great, clean, well provisioned hotel for families who want convenience and a home-away-from-home. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “my first trip to florida”
Reviews.Author: jessica d
Reviews.Content: very clean rooms..pool was GREAT my kids loved it..staff at check-in and check-out where so pleasant..resort was close to All Disney parks..hotel gave me the Best View it was more than expected..would recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: jpuckey
Reviews.Content: We got a 3 bedroom suite, it gave us plenty of room to move about. The furniture and TVs were okay, they could use some updating. The room was clean, and the pools were very nice. It was nice that they didn't close the pools until 10:00 pm so people could use them after being at the parks all day. The walls between the rooms are a little thin, we woke up a couple of mornings from the people in the room next to us talking. The store that they have available was nice, but the prices were a bit high so we ended up going to the local Walmart to get anything that we needed. The hotel and grounds were nice and we would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bit surprised”
Reviews.Author: shauna t
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Feb 21,2012 to Mar.6,2012. We were pleased with the room, we booked for a 2bedroom suite as we had 4 kids one being only 6mths.All went well until Feb.29. We got it late as disney was open 24hrs(leap year day).With the baby sleeping,us and our 15 and 12yr hungry and ready to fry up a few burgers we opened the door to....no power.The room was black.Approx.1:30am it was a little scary,as we weren't sure what was going on.We called to front desk who promptly sent up security to check out our suite. The kids hungry and tired we waited until about 2:30 and they gave us another room(a 3 bedroom).With no help and no available trolley we hauled what we might need for morning down the hall and up one level to another room.By the time we were done it was 3:30.Next morning we spent more time moving as well.The did agree to reimburse us for the groceries we lost. During the rest of the week 4 times our key did not work.being in building 2 you have to go across the street to front desk!In the end they were still going to charge us $50.00 for late check out(3pm) as our flight didn't leave until 6:30pm.It was on our last day were one of the keys didn't work!What a way to spend your last hrs on a holiday!!So they agreed to not charge late fees.Unfortunately my 7yr old bumped into a tall lamp in her room and it crashed...an honest and easy mistake(the lamp is taller than the little table it sits on).Well they still charged $90.00!!!!! Sure seems like a lot of hassle for a vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa N
Reviews.Content: Could not have been happier with our stay. Very clean and comfortable. Friendly, helpful staff. Well equipped kitchen and comfortable beds. All at a great price! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Suites at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: GrahamCFC
Reviews.Content: This place is incredible. We stayed in a huge 2 bedroom suite with separate living room and full kitchen. Very clean with great facilities and 5 minutes from Disney

Reviews.Title: “OMG FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: freedom982
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing I loved our room in Bldg 3 on the 6th floor it was facing the pool. Having the outlets right there in walking distance was great I shopped so much. we ate at Frankie's and the food was great. I have never stayed in a better place and we did not want to leave .My daughter loved the pool I could not get her out of it. The rooms were clean and the staff were so polite and helpful. The fact that I could have a drink while sitting by the pool was amazing. I do not understand the people that gave this hotel a bad review because I have stayed in bad places and ok places and thid hotel is a palace compared to them and not to mention I am a clean freak. The location was close to everything and you did not even need a car to get around. All I can say is thank you for making my family and I feel so at home and welcome and we loved it so much we are even considering buying one of thier condo's and I have told all my friends and family that this is the place to stay!! great place for families and for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: Diane K
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for a week in March and had a wonderful time. The rooms are very spacious and clean and the service was excellent. The Tiki Bar staff was exceptional and very friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice property”
Reviews.Author: lindsey79
Reviews.Content: stayed at lake buena vista resort on on 1st of january 2012 for 18 nights.when arriving resort entrance was lovely and clean and is quite a big property.was very pleased with apartment.one master bedroom with jacuzzi bath and shower cubicle and toilet.nice to have separate bathroom from kids.kids had twin room with bathroom next door.lounge/dining room was nice.kitchen fully equipped with everything you will need.could do with more storage for food as every cupboard had crockery and cookware in so not much room for anything else.had a washer/dryer which was great.done all my washing before went home so didnt have loads of washing to do when got home.had a balcony overlooking pool which was nice.if book with virgin as we did you receive voucher for free pizza and dvd player and dvd.supermarket across the road which we used once as to expensive.factory stores right on property which was good.and pub which didnt use.kids enjoyed pool with water slide. bad points: coudnt always find parking and couple of times had to park in street.had fire alarm go off for over an hour from block opposite which was on first night which was awfull after 10 hours travelling and jetlaged.could of done with daily clean as was there long time and had to pay so only done it once as was 30 dollars for one clean.and dont use phone to ring england,had to ring bank couple of times and cost me over 100 dollars.overall would definetly return and would recommened to others.is in great location to disney,seaworld and universal.and very short drive to lake buena vista for restaurants.especially love olive garden on international drive.p.s need to provide pillows as were incredibly hard and small.need to provide cleaning service in room rate beds were to big to make on own and part of holiday is you dont have to

Reviews.Title: “Ok setup for families, decent location”
Reviews.Author: senor_boom
Reviews.Content: Lets get the semantics out of the way- this isn't a resort. What it is is a nice setup for families in a location very convenient to WDW. The rates are also hard to beat. Grounds are very nice, pools are fine (although don't let the pirate ship fool you- it's really only a water slide and not a "water park" by any stretch of the imagination). Service is pretty much non-existent, since you're basically renting an apartment. Rooms are fine, with a decent sized living area, functional kitchen and, for some reason a master with an enormous bathroom. Little things were weird- odd cleaning chemical smell in the unit, a fridge that constantly leaked water, an awful master bed, and questionable cleanliness. Overall, the location and ability to have a somewhat normal routine with two toddlers made this a fine choice, but I would certainly consider other options if ever in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at Lake BVRV”
Reviews.Author: J E
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights in late February/12. Our second visit to the property. Great value for the cost. Kitchen is fully equiped as advertised (only possible addition would be wine glasses) and the in-suite laundry is very handy. Front desk staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful -- had an issue with the safe malfunctioning and someone was at our door within 10 minutes to take care of it. Close to Disney and other Orlando attractions, and a WalMart superstore/gocery store is 2 minutes away by car. Automatically on the short list for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Cynlatma
Reviews.Content: Great rental condos on an excellent run property. I have never seen a better run property at this price point. The management thought of everything. The apartments were stocked with everything one would need. It was a pleasure to see such efficient management.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: JomaStockholm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 4 (where the reception is) in a 2 bedroom apt. Really great room with everything you could ask for - except wine glasses. Pool area is absolutley brilliant and the parks are at a convinent distance. The only downside is that the rooms are a little bit worn out. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation - Late February, 2012”
Reviews.Author: KC11746
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LBV Resort and Spa for 7 days / 6 nights at the end of February, 2012. Check in was a breeze and the first impression of the 2 bedroom unit (#4404) was very favorable. The kitchen was reasonably stocked - although a sponge for dishes would've been nice to have. The washer/dryer is a stacked unit that is of small to medium sized capacity and is located just next to the kitchen area. We did not use the appliances during our stay, but made use of the washer/dryer on a daily basis. The bathroom facilities are fine and included a jacuzzi tub in the master, but it would be nice to have had some shelving or seating area within the master shower which could be used for storing of toiletries. The only issue that we encountered in the bathrooms was a poorly installed towel rack, which came off the wall easily. The living area was good-sized and included a wall mounted flat-screen. There are also flat screens in the bedrooms, but the one in the secondary room was smallish - not a big deal for us, since we had small children in that room. Oddly, there is no garbage chute or receptacles in or near the room, so we had to leave trash outside of the room and call the front desk in order to arrange for someone to come and retrieve. The single worst part of the room is the bed sheets and pillows! The bed itself was reasonably comfortable, but the sheets and comforter seem to be about a half-size too small and the pillows are the type that you would use for decorative shams, but they are not comfortable for sleeping. We bought some cheap pillows at the local Wal Mart and left them when we checked out. This was a big disappointment - especially for a place that uses the word "Resort" in it's name, and hopes to sell you on time sharing. The staff at the facility were all friendly and the pool is very kid friendly. There are limited food options on-site, but we made use of the pool-side bar and Frankie Farrell's, which is a nice Irish pub which is located in building #2. The pool-side offerings are basic and on the pricey side ($6 for a hot dog and bag of chips; the chiken strips were doughy and should be avoided). Frankie's is a nice room and the food is certainly better, but not great. If you plan to go there, you can get coupons at the front desk for $5 off of a $30 bill. I had asked for menus from other local eateries for take-out, but the concierge had a very limited inventory. One of the pizza shops that had been referred informed that the resort imposes a pretty steep charge to them for delivery, and that the charge was passed along to the tenant. It turned out to be easier to go pick up the food on my own. You might be better served by ordering from the Pizza Hut Express (building 2), which we did not use. Parking is alright - so long as you are back to the facility by 6 or 7pm. Thereafter, it gets quite crowded and there are lots of cars parked in the street and in other areas that are not intended for parking. Overall, the facility has the feel of someplace that is not fully completed. The area behind the pool appears to have been cleared in advance of additional construction, but there are no signs of activity. Additionally, the road that runs near to buildings 4 and 5 dead-ends and looks as if it is designed to be finished at a later date. We have not stayed at any other hotels/resorts in the area, so do not have a basis for comparison. In the end, the resort met our needs and we would certainly consider re-visiting.

Reviews.Title: “All that Glitters is not Gold”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFam74
Reviews.Content: The LBV offers many of the amenities that are comparable to many of the finer Disney or Loew's resorts. However, they do not compare. The bedding is that of a motel. The mattresses were hard and as for the couch bed thin. The pillows extremely too firm and the thread count a stiff 200 if that. Not to mention none of the bedding fit properly. The jacuzzi tub blew out black mold and even after I brought it to managements attention it was not cleaned properly. Staff was very nice, but never resolved any issues. The sheets were changed to ones that did fit however, the housecleaning department never checked the bedding before removing it and collected my child's favorite blanket. The resort management has done nothing they promised in regards to follow up on the blanket and sending a complimentary future night. Another surprise was that I booked through Groupon and had an additional $94. fee upon arrival. If you stay be sure to bring an air mattress, your own bedding and per mgmt. avoid Bldg. 3.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Clean, Comfortable and Very Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: JCN01887
Reviews.Content: We rented two condos for 10 adult family members from 12-10 to 12-17. Very roomy and comfortable. Convenient (within 10 minutes) of Disney Parking Lots. The Front Desk Staff were friendly and efficient, Housekeeping was discrete and dependable, On-site Pub, Pizza and Convenience Store were appreciated. Stayed again for two nights in January with parents in their late 80's and found the same level of service. Missing the lavish extravagance of some of the Disney Properties but about half the cost. Whether you're on a budget or not, you shouldn't be disappointed. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Bari B
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my family and I stayed here, and it was a wonderful week. So good, in fact, that we extended our stay at the last minute. The staff was lovely, the suite was extremely comfortable, and the food at Frankie's was fantastic. We plan to return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: Disney_Nana
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in the past and been pleased. Not so much this time. Beds were uncomfortable. Pillows were AWFUL. Dishwasher didn't work in one unit and the door came off in the other unit we rented. Internal doors didn't lock; light under microwave didn't work. Sheets did not fit the bed properly. Could use new bedspreads. We didn't have a coffee table in our room. Minimum of stocking of rooms. We also requested to have our parties together ahead of time and we were 10 floors apart. No security. When we last stayed you could not enter from the parking garage without using your key. Now anyone could enter in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space!”
Reviews.Author: jrabbit3
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at LBV Feb. 22-26, 2012. Check-in process was quick and easy. Room was clean and well stocked-- only complaint was the hard beds and pillows. Awesome jacuzzi tub in master bedroom. Old tvs but they still worked. Pizza Hut express was nice- order 7 minutes ahead of time and you're ready to go! Very close to Disney, Sea World/Discovery Cove and Universal parks. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Return guest. PLEASED”
Reviews.Author: mikomo
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit after being there while construction was going on last year which made us very unhappy. Management went out of their way this time. They placed us in the main building which they said had been renovated. It was cleaned to perfection and the beds had the bedbug protection sheets so we felt comfortable with the added protection most hotels don't have. We enjoyed the attractions being so near, but yet not near all the congestion. The outlets on the premises was a plus with the coupons supplied by the most curteous staff I have seen in years. The spa was another extra added touch relaxing while on vacation, the other lady's new adventure she was quite pleased for her first facial ever. Definetly a return.

Reviews.Title: “Best All Around Stay”
Reviews.Author: Timothy C
Reviews.Content: Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa was outstanding. The two bedroom suite was fabulous with the full kitchen and Dining / Living room area. The master bedroom was huge with a walk in shower and jacuzzi type tub. The pool and outdoor jacuzzi is a great place to relax after a busy day at the parks or just to take it easy. The factory shops were close to walk to and the number of great restaurants to choose from was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again”
Reviews.Author: Katy365
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 7 night stay and enjoyed our visit. Our rooms were spacious and exceeded our expectations. Our friends were booked right across the hall which we appreciated. Kitchen were large and spacious. Our only concern was where to dump our trash as we chose not to have housekeeping come into our suite. The work-out room was adequately equipped and the children enjoyed the pool. Easy access to all theme parks and the outlet mall was a bonus as it was right behind the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen V
Reviews.Content: Suites are very spacious and well appointed. Went a little overboard on the foyer and hall deodorizers - a bit strong. Have stayed here before and never noticed any smells though.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy”
Reviews.Author: Ruby M
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my family and I have stayed at this resort and we had a wonderful time. Our visit during the 2011 Christmas season was great. We had a room on the 14th floor with an amazing, calming view. I love all the room we have there. Because we are a family of 6, we need lots of room. The kids had a great time and enjoyed not being on top of each other which is what certainly would have happened if we stayed in a regular hotel room. We will visit the resort again. I would like to suggest that they add free wifi to their amenities. At the price of this resort free wifi should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip to Florida”
Reviews.Author: TraceyEvans
Reviews.Content: Booked here after reading reviews on tripadvisor was not disappointed the hotel was fantastic. We (a party of 5) arrived on 06/09/2011 for a 2 week holiday. After a long flight we were pleasantly surprised to be met at reception by really friendly staff. We were originally going to be put in building 1 but when I asked if we could change to building 5 the lady did this for us no problem. The 3 bedroom suite was very spacious with a whirlpool bath and huge separate shower cubicale in the master bedroom. There were 2 further bedrooms one with kingsize bed and the other twin doubles. There was a further bathroom with shower a living/dining area with a full kitchen including dishwasher and a separate washer and dryer. We were 12 up and had a balcony with fantastic views. The hotel itself was lovely with a pirate ship pool with flume which my 9 year old daughter loved. There was also 3 whirlpools and kids club games daily. We used the pizza hut on-site quite a few times which was really handy (my daughter says they taste better than the ones back home). The hotel is very close to the disney parks only about 5 minutes drive away!! There is also a walmart just down the road and also the factory outlet is within walking distance. I would definitely go here again and would recommend booking if visiting the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous visit - hope to return again.”
Reviews.Author: Sargie47
Reviews.Content: The fact that this is the third time we have stayed at this resort shows how much we like it. (We were visiting from the UK in February, with two children aged 8 and 11). Had had a little problem at checkin when our reservation couldn't be found but it was quickly sorted out. We stayed in building 5 - the rooms are large, clean and have all the facilites you'd expect, plus a washer and dryer. The pirate ship at the swimming pool is a real plus for the kids. We used the free wifi for our phones and laptop, very easy to connect (we were on floor 5 but I heard that the higher up you go the connection gets worse but never tested this!!!) The location is brilliant as you have an outside shopping area right next door and just a mile or so down the road is Walmart so you can stock up on whatever you need. Both Disney and Universal are an easy drive from here. All round a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing return visit.”
Reviews.Author: Joshua_Salas
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel with our family back in May, which was why my wife and I decided we would return for our 10th anniversary from the 15th of Feb 2012 to the 26th of Feb 2012. We stayed in unit 3510 (Bldg #3, 5th floor). We had minor issues at check in, a key that didn't work, and a squeaky fan in the master bathroom, both were resolved in a reasonable amount of time. Things were great the first 2 nights. Then the 3rd night we decided to stay out at the Disney parks later, got back around midnight. There was ZERO parking. We went to the front desk to ask where to park, the lady working the counter just kept saying they were 100% booked and if there wasn't any spots in the garage, lot, or street (yes the street) that she didn't know what to tell us. We got the "pleasure of parking essentially 2 city blocks away in the adjacent strip mall. We had a similar issue the following night. Thankfully we didn't have our kids with us this time, because after walking miles upon miles at the theme parks the last thing sleeping toddlers want to do at night is walk more. Well, Monday I contacted the manager on duty who tried to help by pointing out some places to park that were "almost always open". The problem with these spots is they are still a good distance from the units and on an unlit street. So if you want your car to be somewhere safe, there is not really a lot of options for parking at night here. We continued to have this problem almost every night and were told parking is, "First come, first served". So basically, come back early or don't complain. On one of my morning trips to retrieve my vehicle and move it to a more secure location, I ran into a family switching hotels because of the parking, and noise issues (more on that later). In the elevator was a person that I can only assume is a resident (I guess some people actually live here in purchased units?) While the mother of the other family and my self were complaining in the elevator about the parking and the noise, the resident says, "You think it's bad visiting, try living here." Next is the internet, long story short the issue is always your computer, not their lousy wireless bridge setup. Even if the same issue was occurring on My laptop, my wife's laptop, my work laptop, and my wife's work laptop. All of which worked fine when we got home by the way. They also worked fine if I just tethered from my smartphone. The only solution that was offered to me was to spend my time on the phone with a third party tech support that could help me diagnose the issues with my computer(s). Last is the noise. Starting on Friday when they were 100% booked, we started having issues with people in the hallways, yelling, banging and running, well past 3am. Then it would start back up around 7am. Several times I went out and asked them to quiet down (Usually different folks each time). This continued all week. The last few days we had a family check in across the hall from us. They spoke Spanish, very loudly into the very late hours. You could hear them all the way in the master bedroom, and we were woken up several times. Thursday night there were several groups of Spanish speaking folks in the hallway at 1:30 a.m. yelling at the top of their lungs. We called the front desk, and they assured us they would send security to check it out. Sure enough we heard security breaking it up 15-20 minutes later. It got quiet for about 30 minutes, then started right back up. They finally stopped around 4 a.m. Then the noise started back up around 7 a.m. We wound up deciding to cut our stay two days short. We had to eat the cost on one of those days even with all of the issues. It is not all negative, if you can deal with the inadequate parking, under trained staff, bad internet, and excessive noise, the rooms are a great size, the full kitchen is nice, location is good, the in unit Jacuzzi tubs are awesome. However for us the frustration and lack of sleep have made it so we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel will be coming back”
Reviews.Author: Clare760
Reviews.Content: Just got back we had a 3 bedroom suite on the 7th floor - the rooms are lovely, clean and spacious - a plus point with two small children is having a washer and a dryer. Everything you would need in a room is there. The pool is great and my son and daughter loved it. The staff are so helpful and any request is dealt with immediately. We will definately be returning :)

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortable beds = I won't be returning.”
Reviews.Author: TwistyBlank
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Groupon for a 3 night stay at this resort. Upon arrival, the front desk staff was very friendly and we checked in quickly. I was provided with the spa credit and a map of the facilities. Our room was located in Building One, which I was told was one of the newly renovated buildings. Our 2 bedroom suite was clean and welcoming, we even had a view of the fireworks (which we hadn't requested, so that was a nice treat). The bathtub in the master suite was delightful. Unfortunately, 2 of our 3 room keys wouldn't work, so we had to go back to the front desk to have those replaced and the toilet in the second bath kept stopping up easily. What was with the very very old projection TVs? Awful picture! The beds were horribly uncomfortable, even my 5 year old had trouble sleeping. The walls were paper thin as well, I could hear our neighbor snoring as if he was in the bed next to me. The wi-fi was unusable, kept dropping off and not connecting. I could live with all those other little irritations if the beds had been comfy...

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FamilyPCanton_CT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 4 bedroom condo on the 15th floor with another family. It was huge! We had a great time. The spa bathtub is amazing, the great room is huge and the kitchen is perfect for vactioners. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a Disney vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: sanselment
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 (kids ages 7, 5, 3, 1) and grandma stayed at LBRV Feb 15-20th. We had a 3 bedroom suite on the 3rd floor of building one. The room was perfect and was huge!! Having a full kitchen and washer and dryer was great. We actually came home with all clean clothes. We also had 3 large bathrooms which was a plus. Two of the bathrooms had huge showers and whirlpool tube which we did use. The only gripe I had about the room was a balcony view of the parking lot and the outlet shopping mall which is right next door. I had called last fall requesting a good view and got stuck with a pretty ugly one but I got past that. One thing we did to save some money was we went to Walmart which is just blocks down the road and stocked up for the week bringing it back to our room. With 4 kids eating out every day wasn't an option. The pool is great and heated. The giant pirate ship was a hit with my kids and they loved going down the water slide. A bar is also by the pool if needed. There is also 3 hot tubs which I could see. Just remember this resort does not have housecleaning unless you pay for it. We did not care and just treated the room like our house and cleaned ourselves. It worked out great. In our building there was also a Irish Pub restaurant, kids arcade, and a mini store with Pizzz hut. We used all of these except the Irish Pub. Overall this resort was perfect for us and our needs. You are only mins from Disney and all the other parks and attractions in the area. If you want to save some money and not stay on Disney property I recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “More then we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsten C
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful and we can't wait to go back! The rooms were spacious and the staff was very attentive, especially Trish and Jean. There were a lot of kids there, but we didn't hear them as the rooms were quiet. We had a pool view and my 5 year old had as much fun in the hotel as he did the Theme parks (probably because he got his own room with a tv)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value!!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkbobo11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family for 5 days. It was well worth every penny! We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom with a view of the pool area. When we checked in, Trish was VERY helpful and friendly! As soon as we got to our room, she called to make sure the room was alright! The zero entry pool was perfect for our toddler! The restaurant/bar at the pool was great, including free wifi!! The washer and dryer in the unit was so helpful!! I also went to the spa for a massage and it was FABULOUS!! This is not a 5 star resort, more like a 3.5 to 4, but clean and has everything you could need!! You DEFINITELY get everything and more than you pay for!! The rates can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place & Value for us”
Reviews.Author: GreatJoeDad
Reviews.Content: We were there a week, had a nice two bedroom, two bath (both had tubs, one was jacuzzi and separate stand up shower), with full Kitchen. One room had two twins, master had a King. 8 nights, rental van, and air for 3 from Boston was less than $3000. Was clean, and outside of a few minor issues was good. It is right near disney, has lots of shops next to it, the hotel pub seemed pretty good (we did a breakfast), and either way within 3 minutes are all the restaurants and shopping you should need. They gave us a $100 spa credit we never got around to using, but the people at the spa whispered ;) "if we passed it on to a friend the spa would honor it." We'll see. The minor stuff : -We got there at 1:30 and they said our room wasn't ready, and we had to come back at 4pm, when we did, they said it still wasn't ready and moved us to another room, I wish they had done that in the first place and saved us an afternoon of time killing. -The pool was good, but could have used a few more heating circulators, and the pirate ship has just one water slide for the kids on the whole thing, which could have been thought out better with more kid stuff. -Drinks are $9 at the pool side bar. The master bed room could have used a black out curtain. -We lacked a baking pan for the oven. -The hallway door handle had to be turned up to open the door, or the latch would stick. Nice of my visiting nephew to figure that out. (told them that at checkout, might be fixed by -now) -The internet worked well till they fiddled with the router, then it took a day and a half for it to come back and work well again. -One night the parking lot was packed and I parked on the street so I didn't have to tread across the entire parking lot to get back to our room. -Master bed was very FIRM, so it was not great to sleep on. That's pretty much all of it, but was a good value, we would consider going back if the same deal was there.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: la-gski
Reviews.Content: Another stay-cation at the Lake Buena Vista Resort- more great times- more wonderful family memories. At the mere thought of needing a little vacation, time away from home, work and the mundane day-to-day ... Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa is our destination! The staff is always superb, and the suites provide just what you need to relax and enjoy. We stay with these fine folks several times a year and look forward to many more visits. I am thankful for the knowledgeable staff for all their help, Caitlyn and Matt especially, they are the best ever. A few things I feel deserve a mention: Although our room was lacking the Guest Services binder, I wonder if it would be worthwhile to place a notice within the Guest Services information regarding the advertisements that so often find their way under the doors in the middle of the night. I know that most reputable hotels & resorts do not approve of this method of advertising from local pizza shops/take out spots but there is little to be done to combat the issue. That being said, we have been told on a few occasions that these places should be avoided as some of them are scams. They offer great deals at attractive pricing, but once your order is placed and they have your credit card information- your pizza never comes. Calling them back only gets you a million excuses why YOU are at fault for not getting your food. We have had two such flyers under our door with different names of the pizza shop but the same phone number...hmmm.... The staff has always been spot-on in recommending a great eatery. They are, after all, locals and frequent these establishments themselves. Building 2 needs some upgrades to the rooms. The televisions are very old, and the large one in the living area is near impossible to watch during daylight, even with the blinds closed. Reflections spa- I've had a gift certificate for the Spa for almost a year now and each time I've called to inquire about services, I've gotten a less than pleasant reception, an off-putting attitude, and have never been able to make an appointment. Either they "don't have time" or are not properly staffed to accommodate the services they offer. I have the feeling my gift certificate will go to waste, sadly. I have joined the "Sky Guest Reward Program" more times than I can count, yet nothing ever comes of it. I've never gotten a 'your email is already registered with us' response when I re-join, never received special notices in my email, or points, or well- any kind of reward whatsoever. When I ask about this "reward" program during the reservation process, no one seems to know. (FYI: the reservations staff is a central reservations dept for all the Stay Sky properties, not the staff located at Lake Buena Vista Resort ) Some clarification on this program would be greatly appreciated :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Sprinkles81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family holiday with our 3 year old daughter. Our apartment consisted of 3 bedrooms (one with ensuite / jacuzzi/ shower / walkin wardrobe), kitchen come dining area & sitting room. There rentals are fitted with absolutely everything you will need for the perfect vacation & they are very spacious. I Definatly wouldn't waste my time staying in a tiny hotel room. There is a large pool on site & bar. We hired a car for our entire stay which meant we were within minutes of everything (especially Disney & Seaworld). Check out Bahamas breeze for food. Outlets beside hotel are not great so we went to the outlets off international drive (15 min drive). Can't recommend this property enough. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Outstanding rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: Generro_Houston
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here during our visit to Disney World Parks in Summer 2010. The rooms were outstanding just like a luxury apartment with everything you need. The pool and pool side bar were great, a little pricey but as expected. From the location to the parks, near by restaurants and next door outlet malls and on site ATM and convenient store and concierge. We loved the place and definitley will stay there again on our next visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Timeshare Rental”
Reviews.Author: LaineO
Reviews.Content: This resort pretty much fit our needs. I was traveling with my daughter (11), and a friend of mine with her daughter (12). We wanted something bigger than a hotel room and close to Disney and that's what we got. The room was your typical timeshare rental. Not luxurious, but fit the bill. We had 3 bedrooms, 2 baths, small kitchen, living room, table, and balcony. I'm pretty sure all the rooms are decorated the same. We didn't opt for the daily maid service, but we requested extra towels so we wouldn't have to wash while we were there (even though the unit comes with a W/D) and they brought us a huge bag of towels. The cleaning fee for your stay is $95. After adding the cleaning fee, resort fee, tax, and visa charge, the total was $211/night even though the room rate was $150. We rented on www.vbro.com. It was an easy transaction. No problems. The blinds fell down in one of the bedrooms as soon as we got there and they promptly came to fix them (after a couple of calls). Although we really weren't at the room very much, the girls enjoyed swimming in the heated pool our first day and sliding down the small water slide in the pirate ship. There is a Wal Mart about 1.5 miles away and it's the nicest Wal Mart I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Good location NO customer service”
Reviews.Author: Muchara
Reviews.Content: We paid for an extra day since our plane arrived at 6:00 am and check in is at 4:00 pm. I called twice to advice reception that we would be arriving on 2/11 at 6:00 am for our reservation set for the 10th. Just to make sure. I could not believe that when we arrived (with our 6 month old baby and a 3 year old) they said sorry the reservation had been dropped. After lots of conversation they finally found us a room. No help at all from the front desk to bring the luggage to the room or even find a cart. When we got to the room, It stunk like cigarettes. We called front desk, they sent someone that started spraying the room with air fresher. Not what we wanted at all. We asked them to stop and went to front desk directly. No help again. Basically a "to bad if you don't like it just leave it". After over 30 minutes talking they finally got us into a room. The room size is great but it needs updating. The carpet, couch and chairs are OLD.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Expected”
Reviews.Author: SunshineSteve
Reviews.Content: Returned today from a brilliant 2 week break at the Lake Buena Vista Resort. Can not fault this resort in anyway, it was everything we expected, and did not fail on any aspect. We have 2 small children who loved the spacious 2 bed apartment we had, as they had total independence from us, their own room and bathroom! The kitchen was far more than we required, as we rarely "Eat-In" when on vacation. There was a totally functional washing machine, and drier, that was utilised several times during the break, which enabled us to keep the kids in clean clothes, and bring all the clothes home pre-washed, and just needing an iron over to rehang!!! It is conveniently sited, central for all the 192 & theme park attractions, and with a Walmart just across the road there was no need to use the over-priced on-site grocery store! The guys at the pool bar were really friendly, and if it wasnt for having children I am sure we would have spent more time there lol!! All in all I would have no trouble recommending this resort as a cracking base for anybody going to Central Florida, either to take in the wonderful sights of the "Natural" Florida, or a flat out vacation, like ours, visiting all the theme parks, especially Disney, an absolute ust if you have kids!!!

Reviews.Title: “fab base for a fab holiday”
Reviews.Author: Sarah D
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed in these apartments .They are huge,almost as big as our house!and all for the same price as a hotel room with just two double beds and a bathroom.I know which I would prefer.Our apartment was clean and well equipped.We were booked in block 3 but asked if we could stay in block 5 as this is the newest block and they changed us without any trouble. Located only a ten minute shuttle bus ride from Disney,15 mins from sea world and 20 mins from universal.A large Walmart is a 5 min taxi drive away to buy supplies as the onsite shop was expensive. We used the hotel shuttle bus to Epcot, Sea world and Universal and then the park shuttles or i-ride trolley /lynx busses to get to most places,even the Florida Mall and Old Town so saved a fortune not hiring a car and parking fees $15 a day at a park. We could see the Magic kingdom fireworks in the distance from our room. There is an Irish pub (Frankie Farrells) and a pizza hut onsite which we used a few times and were fine. Would highly recommend these apartments.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC ACCOMODATION!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy M
Reviews.Content: Myself and My Partner and our friends (married couple) visited this hotel in late September last year!! After reading various reviews on here we were not exactly sure what to expect but WOW.... what a pleasant suprise!! Upon pulling up to the hotel, we noticed the outlet stores (literally afew minutes walk!) which immediately pleased us ladies of course! Entering reception we were greeted by a lovely Receptionist (Kevin I believe) who was extremely friendly and helpful and was able to answer any questions we had! We checked into our room in Building 5, which I would definately recommend as you are able to park directly outside the entrance and also have great access to the pool! We had a 2 bedroom apartment with Lake Buena Vista Views, and the apartment was PERFECT!! Very spacious living and dining room area, 2 great sized bedrooms, ensuite to master bedroom with THE BEST bath EVER! Family bathrooms just next to the twin room which and everything and all was sparkling clean!! Oh and the most towel art I have ever seen!! lol The kitchen had everything you need for nights in if you are too tired from walking around the parks all day! The Pool and Bar area.....again just perfect..... we had a few pool days and also used the pool after a tiring day of walking around the parks (the hot tubs are a perfect cure for tired achey feet!) As we arrived quite late on the first night we ordered food to be delivered from Frankie Farrels Irish Bar (on site) - Food was great, just what we needed! Also if you can get a room with Firework views - everyday at 9pm you can see the fireworks at Disney from your balcony!! BRILLIANT!! All in all I dont have a bad word to say about Lake Buena Vista Suites..... Perhaps just that we wished we had stayed for longer!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room great employees”
Reviews.Author: rosyrose01
Reviews.Content: I honestly can't see where all the good reviews are coming from. We got to our room late afternoon after being up from 5am. Mold in on the shower curtain, dark stains on the carpet, orange splatter marks on the blinds in the master bedroom, bed sheets were too small for the mattresses--woke up in morning mortified that we were sleeping on a bare mattress. One of the comforters had large yellow stains. We had to put an extra bed sheet on the couch as it was so dirty. There was leftover food crust on the stove burner. The dish towels were dingy and dirty. A sunbeam was shining in the family room from the window and I was horrified a the dust dancing around. My mother took out the vacuum cleaner and sucked up a good amound of dust and dirt from the carpet and from the couch. Note to management--don't believe me, we were in 3802. Got a call asking if everything was OK--My mother in law said everything looked ok--but that was before we really had a chance to look around as we were exhausted. I called reception afterwards and mentioned the bedsheets and this horrible musty smell and the dirty stove. The lovely employee said they would send someone up to disinfect and take care of the problems. We went out for the afternoon, came back a few hours later and nothing was done. I called back and at this point said there's no point in cleaning the stove--we cleaned ourselves because we had to eat and couldn't wait for someone to come and that we vacuumed. She sent up housekeeping with fresh bedding for all the beds as I was too grossed out to spend another night like that. Guys came replaced everything--a manager came up to make sure the bedding was ok. The smell was gone because we had food cooking, but really it was disappointing. I would have loved to change rooms but at this point with 2 kids, having already unpacked everything, vacuuming etc etc I really couldn't be bothered. Trish and GM Darryl kind of made up for everything by fulfilling my request for a late check out but I really wish I had been more vocal during my stay and requested another room. We were originally booked in building 1 with a view of the outlet mall parking lot and we were able to change that to building 3 to be closer to the pirate pool but I honestly don't think that the room we were checked into has been used in years. I wouldn't say don't stay here because a lot of people were happy, but please if you get a room that is as dirty and gross as the one I had--please address it to management and I'm sure they will make it right--but ask for what you want. Note to management--we left the vacuum cleaner in the closet, it's half full with debris we collected off the floor in living area and couch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Judy B
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay at this hotel. The rooms are large, clean, and a suite could easily accomodate 4 without crowding. I would definitely recommend it for families going to Disney World. Prices are very competetive!

Reviews.Title: “Relieved and delighted. Stayed July 2011.”
Reviews.Author: Emma W
Reviews.Content: Having booked to stay, I started to get anxious when there seemed to be a run of negative reviews on here. On arrival check in was nice and easy. We were in the building over the pub, which some people had been unhappy with so I was very nervous on entering our room. However, it was clean, spacious and well equipped with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, comfortable furnishings, 3 TVs, well equipped kitchen and nice balcony - and we did have a view of the fireworks. The children loved the pool and it was nice having some shops next door that you could walk to. Huge walmart just down the road and a very easy drive into Disneyworld- literally 5 minutes. Universal a little longer but not a problem. We had a great time here - we had stayed at Vista Cay the previous year which personally I preferred, although the children preferred staying here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: JanKeats
Reviews.Content: We loved this place!! The only thing we didn't like about it, is we were unable to walk anywheres, we could see Super walmart but were unable to walk there, we didn't want to dodge a 4 lane hwy (we did not rent a vehicle) We had gotten an awesome rate, the place was super clean, loved that there was washer/dryer in room. Loved having Cabana bar, went to outlets right beside a few times, they were ok, not too many stores, but could have been worse. We would stay again but we are not finding as good of rate as before so we are opting to stay somewhere else next time, the rate and not be able to walk anywheres are the only thing holding us back from not rebooking. Would totally recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort”
Reviews.Author: humpchrome
Reviews.Content: We had a nice two day stay at the LBV Resort. Great location rooms were nice. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No more hotel rooms for me”
Reviews.Author: CarrieH1444
Reviews.Content: For the same price as a hotel room, we got private bedrooms (2), full kitchen, two full bathrooms, living room, dining room, balcony, 2 pools to choose from, a convenience store/grocery store in the complex, beautiful work out room, pub restaurant, etc. The staff is top notch; the grounds are gorgeous - everything is accessible - no stress. Located perfectly for a very short drive to Disney Parks, Universal Studios, or if you want to venture to ocean beaches or Tampa. If you're not driving, complimentary shuttles are available. Everything you need is here - whether you are a party of one or a party of 12. If you try this place, you will never go back to a hotel room

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great property, amazing staff. Especially the managemenWell outperformed my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin F
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great property, amazing staff. Especially the management. Very nice and CLEAN!! rooms. Well outperformed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent place to bring the family”
Reviews.Author: Joseph J
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and was amazed at the amenities. It was like our family had a fully loaded two bedroom condo to stay in while on vacation. Kitchen, jacuzzi, spacious rooms. Kids loved the pool and waterslide, wife loved the spa. Staff was accessible and friendly. This is the only way to go when you bring the family to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: edmb
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time my wife and I have stayed at this resort. I previously reviewed this resort and its amenities, and not much has changed, so I will skip details about the resort as the main purpose of our trip this time was shopping, so we spent little time at the resort. I will say that we got a terrific rate on a 2 bedroom suite through expedia, roughly $120/night. When we checked in we were given a room in building 1, the oldest building and the building that houses the gym and pub. When we entered the room, the smell was overpowering. It smelled of mold and mildew covered up by strong carpet cleaner. I promptly called the front desk and we were immediately given an apology and moved to building 5, the newest building and the building with a view of the Epcot fireworks. The customer service is great at the hotel when needed. I'd like to focus more on the location of this hotel. My first time here I felt a little like we were far from everything but Disney, but after being to Orlando a few times now and knowing my way around a lot better, this location is ideal. You are outside of the main traffic areas, so its not busy around the hotel. But within 5 minutes you can be at any of the Disney parks or Downtown Disney. If you continue to drive straight on Apopka and avoid the highway, within 15 minutes you are on West Sand Lake right by "restaurant row" near Dr Philips Drive. Continue driving straight and within a couple of minutes you are passing universal blvd and international drive. So within 15-20 min of non-highway driving you can access Disney, Universal, dozens of fine restaurants, international drive, 2 premium outlets, mall at the millenia, florida mall, etc. This time can be cut in half if you take I4, which has a ramp a couple of minutes from the hotel. Also, of note to shoppers, if you take a left when leaving the resort and get on Osceola Parkway, within 5 minutes you are at a great shopping area called The Loop. Its a quiet, new shopping development with nice restaurants, a theatre, a huge babies r us and many of big box stores. There are outlets adjacent to this hotel, and although they have vastly improved since our last visit, they still do not compare to the premium outlets a few minutes away. Travel tip, avoid the coffee house at this outlet, they sell expired food! it happened to us twice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Mitz15
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on a two bedroom unit. Stayed in building 4. Had a great view of the pool. Very clean unit. Beds were comfortable. Kitchen was fully equiped. Enjoyed the jacuzzi in the master bedroom. Very spacious bedrooms, living area and kitchen. Balcony was large. Washer snd dryer very useful. Very quiet environment. Pool was very clean. Staff were very accomodating. Had a relaxing stay. Excellent hotel. Would definitely go back and will also recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best condo in the area!”
Reviews.Author: angeandalex
Reviews.Content: Located two miles from the park entrance is this wonderful resort. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, large master suite with garden tub and walk in shower and pull out couch. This place was amazing!! This will definitely be our Disney place!!

Reviews.Title: “Would have been a 5 but...”
Reviews.Author: Samheartsjavi
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was great! The room was big and plenty of room for my group, the reson I am giving this hotel a 2 is because their customer service was horrible! I have stayed in a lot of these resort type places and this one just does not meet th bar! First off they provided a coffee maker, coffee pockets that had coffee cream sugar stirrers and NO coffee filters! Really?! Then one of the main reasons we booked this location is because it states that they shuttle to the Disney parks! Translation- we have one shuttle that runs once in the morning and once at night and only goes to Epcot no other parks! Another thing again most of these other resort places don't come and clean ur room so i was ok with that but get this!! You want clean towels sure $5 per towel!!!! We stayed there for 6 nights! Luckily our room had a washer and dryer so we cleaned our own towels but that was ridiculous. So again in comparison to other resort places like this that I have stayed at this place just did not cut it! Giver your gets some clean towels four god's sake!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations!!!”
Reviews.Author: psipperly
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Resort. Great customer sevice. Accomodated all our needs. Flora was very professional. Beautiful room, very clean, great beds & pillows. Love the Bathroom area., tub , jacuzzi, & shower. Beautifully decoated. Would stay again, when we get back to Florida. We went through travelocity and got a grea tdeal on a 2 bedroom condo. Loved it! Perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!”
Reviews.Author: TillyNotts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LBV from 19th Jan - 2nd Feb 2012 and must say for all the hotels etc we have stayed in, in Orlando this is by far the best. When we arrived we had a three bedroom apartment with kitchen, laundry area, two bathrooms, balcony etc, the room was clean, although a little bit dated, that was the only bad remark I can make. The hotel is right next door to a shopping centre which has some great bargains for adults and kids, there is a walmart supermarket down the road which took is 5 mins to walk to and then $6 back in a taxi with the shopping, the walmart is very cheap it offers everything you could imagine and also has a subway in it, may i recommend the hot food counter which was excellent (oh and the cupcakes !!) The hotel offers a shuttle service to parks which compared to shuttles at previous places we have stayed such as doubletree, quality inn and international palms is by far better, you dont pick up a million other hotels and also the return journey was often by taxi just for our party of 6 which was great. The reception staff were very helpful and answered every question we had and we cannot fault them at all. Downtown disney was close by and cost $15 ish in a taxi which was great for evenings and meals. We didnt use the hotel bar, and only visited the shop once. Both pools were excellent, spotless and plenty of loungers etc. I can only compliment this hotel and it was that great that we are looking into buying an apartment there !! The only slightly bad comment I can make is that the rooms are slightly dated but I do believe they are being refurbished and also the hotel shop was very overpriced ($7 for 6 waters - walmart was $1 for 6 !!), I think if it was priced more reasonable more people would use it and wouldnt go to walmart and they would still make a profit. Fab Fab hotel and will go back without fail ! Virgin on the other hand were a huge letdown and have gone downhill greatly !!!!!!.........................................

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VALUE. AMAZING SERVICE. AMAZING LOCATION...”
Reviews.Author: andy k
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I needed a place for us and our 2 kids for a 5 day Disney world vacation. We used hotwire and were surprised but nervous when we booked a 2 bedroom "condo" for 84 bucks a night! This place is amazing for us. Trish at the front desk welcomed us and was super professional and accommodating. She even followed up with a call to make sure our room was ok. It was great. 2 bedrooms, a living room, free wifi, full kitchen and view of the Disney world "wishes" fireworks show. we had a Jacuzzi tub and a flat screen tv in every room. 6 minutes (we timed it) to Disney world and 4 minutes to Epcot. This location is close to hundreds of restaurants, wal mart and every thing else you could imagine. The heated themed pool was great. Our one gripe was the bed in our room. King size and decent sheets but hard as a rock. The management might consider changing them to pillow tops. Anyway, between the value, the location and the service, this kind of room on Disney property would have cost 5 to 600 dollars. Thanks LBVR for making this a memorable vacation. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: mcoleman
Reviews.Content: I hotwired a good deal here for four nights. The location is about 10 minutes from parking lot to Magic Kingdom parking lot (with no traffic). Pretty close by, i'd say. We rented a 2br condo - very spacious master bedroom with walk in closet and an obscenely large shower. And of course a jacuzzi tub. The other bedroom has two twin beds in it and a bathroom next door. Kitchen is stocked but we didn't really eat much. It's very comfortable and has everything you need (except maybe enough toilet paper) but I wouldn't classify it as luxury or anything, but for the price I wasn't expecting luxury. Just comfort and clean - which it was. Didn't get to the pools but they look nice. We were in building 1 with the convenience store downstairs - i paid $40 for stuff I could have bought for less than $20 at a kroger or CVS, but hey, it was convenient. And they have a big selection of stuff. It's not a hotel and it's not a timeshare - there is not daily maid service but you can pay extra for maid service. I had to pay a resort fee at check in which was unexpected. 10 a day, I think. Not a ton of restaurants directly near by but a lot of chains within a 10 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully fantastic :)”
Reviews.Author: kassandra h
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here several times and this will always be my #1 choice when staying in orlando. the rooms are huge, clean, fully stocked with everything you need, and beautiful. the main pool is amazing. having the "kid area" is great for those of us with little ones. front desk serivce was great and trish was more then helpful. cant wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: john p
Reviews.Content: I was in a 2 BR condo unit. It was very clean and comfortable and spacious. This room is exactly as advertised. My first stay here and will def stay here again. Tremendous value. Great location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Christina G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort for 4 nights and loved it! Although my kids are a bit older (13 and 11) they loved the pirate ship pool and waterslide. Rooms were beautiful and very large. Loved the kitchen unit. Great location, close to outlets and many restaurants.
