Walmart was very close and we were able to buy groceries for our breakfasts and lunches. Took the shuttle to Universal...very convenient and saved $15 in parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Infrequentvisitor
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay - we visited for the second time in October 2011. We were in building 3 this time, and (the much discussed) building 5 last time. They were both exactly the same standard of accommodation and I do think people get a little carried away recommending exact rooms etc. You are in Orlando, seriously, how much time will you spend in your room anyway? If you want absolute luxury then pay for it, this is well priced, spacious, conveniently located accommodation. Parking gets busy later in the evening, but we always got somewhere within a short enough walk of our building. The pool is nice and was well used during our stay; Frankie Farrells is good, if a little expensive, and the location is very convenient for all parks, but particularly Disney resorts. Wifi was available and free, but not great, furnishings are nice and we had a lovely view of the pool. I would recommend to anyone, the space is perfect for families - the only reason I may stay elsewhere if I return to Florida would be the proximity to restaurants. As the only driver in the family I would have liked to eat somewhere other than Frankie Farrells in order to have a glass of wine with my meal - but Orlando is built for drivers not walkers, and this is not a criticism of the resort by any means! Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartment Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jubylu
Reviews.Content: Located just behind the Premium Outlet Mall. The resort is a hotel come apartment hotel and we booked a 3 bedroom apartment. It was amazing. Huge bedrooms all en-suite. Main bedroom with huge walk in shower and equally as big jacuzzi. The place had everything you would find as at home. I would have moved in for good if i could. The pool was great and big with several areas to swim around and alot of space with an on hand waiter service bar and eating facility. Excellent for children as pool is enclosed and a huge pirate ship in the pool provides hours of fun, yet is not intruding on the adults relaxation as there are many places to hide from the hustle and bustle of the children. Bars and restaurants on site. A great place to stay. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Big, clean well equipped rooms, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Serial_Shopper2010
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this great resort. Everytime we go back to Orlando we will always stay at this resort. Location = Great location, opposite a massive Walmart, within 5 minutes from the Walt Disney World Resort, 15 minutes from Universal, Seaworld & Wet n Wild. Easily located and easy to find on a map! Staff = Uber friendly and always helpful! Rooms = We always have a 2 bedroom apartment, even though there is just 2 of us! Bedroom one with a massive (very comfy) double bed, jacuzzi tub, shower, double sink, wc. Bedroom 2, 2 smaller double beds, separate bathroom with bath, shower, sink and wc. (hairdryers in both bathrooms) Kitchen, fully equipped, oven, microwave, dishwasher, washing machine and dryer (we always come home with a suitcase full of clean clothes!) Living / Dining Area = 2 comfy sofas, dining table, and flat screen TV's in ALL rooms. Balcony with furniture. This is a genuinly GREAT resort. We left something in the room which cannot be replaced and when we landed home I phoned the resort, the lovely chap on the front desk ran up to the room, retrieved it, and kept it in their safe until a family member went over to Orlando in January, THAT is customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for families going to Disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: MrsT2
Reviews.Content: The accommodation is a brilliant size and equipped with everything that a family with young children would need. Some aspects of the hotel are very tired and need replacing ie the hallway carpets, room carpets, sofas. I felt everything was clean so this is purely cosmetic. The location was very good and it's an easy 10 minute drive to the Disney parks. The pools were never crowded but it was a little cold even for us in January. I found that the smaller pool was warmer than the larger pool with the pirate ship. The rooms have full kitchen facilities with everything you would want to cook a basic meal, dishwasher, washing machine & dryer were a big positive to staying here instead of a Disney property that we have stayed at previously. The hotel has plenty of parking spaces and free parking. We could also pick up wifi so we had the Internet throughout our two week stay. We had a meal at the Irish bar which I wouldn't reccomend at all. I feel the meals were small, bland and not at all value for money. There are so many great places to eat, they are no contender at all (sorry!) Go to the Irish bar at Downtown Disney. We used the pizza hut service at the shop which was great. It's handy after a busy day at the parks. Overall a great holiday and good place to stay would recommend to families as the facilities and extra space makes life so much easier!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: Had a great time the entire weekend I was there. The bartender at the Lani's Luau Poolside Bar & Grille was awesome. Everything was great the pool was awesome, location to disney and Universal. Very clean. I only had one complaint so I suggest to buy a pillow before you arrive or bring your own from home, unless you like laying your head on a rock. I will definitely stay again and suggest to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: EM R
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in January, while my husband attended a conference. When we arrived, the room had an off-putting odor, probably from a meal the previous guest had made. We advised the front desk and they promptly had someone from housekeeping come up to air the room and refresh it, taking the odor away. The staff was friendly and helpful. The accommodations were spacious, clean, and well appointed with a jacuzzi tub, full kitchen and laundry. The only thing I would add are black out curtains in the bedrooms, which only have blinds, for those of us that like to sleep in a bit. We were on the 9th floor with a balcony overlooking the pool area that had a pirate ship, hot tub, and bar...very nice. The resort is walking distance to an outlet mall and there is an onsite restaurant, convenience store (pricey but convenient), and Pizza Hut Express. We only stayed two nights, but wished we could have extended our stay. We will definitely return for a longer visit and bring the kids. Great place at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Brand new resort near Disney. Stayed in spacious condo with view of fireworks.”
Reviews.Author: Dancerjk
Reviews.Content: For an additional fee you can stay in a room that has a view of the fireworks from Disney. We had a new two bedroom condo that was clean and very comfortable. Would definetly stay here again. Poinciana Blvd. does not show in the GPS. Call the resort for an address that works.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: PhilipWei
Reviews.Content: stayed here in February 2011. The hotel was nice and clean, staff at the front desk were helpful. Even had a good location for getting to and from Disney world which the hotel offered a shuttle to and from daily. While the first room they put us in had a defective door which you could pop the lock with by putting your shoulder into it, they promptly fixed it and put us in another room on a different floor. The pool was quite nice with the cute little pirate ship in the middle of it. There's a walmart down the block or an easy cab ride if you don't want to make the trek anyways where you can load up on groceries which we did while we were here. Overall I would say the most impressive thing was about the staff, seems they listened and went above and beyond to recommend things to do. A+++ I would for sure stay here again if I ended up in the Orlando area for a vacation again. Though I might rent a vehicle for the entire stay rather than simply having one for a day or two since other than the disney shuttle getting to and from locations was a little hard since the outlet malls and most shopping like mall at millenia are quite a distance without them. Also of note the cab is fairly pricey sitting around 35 to MCO so it could be worse, but those are minor things considering the hotel was still really good.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized 2BR suites in good location”
Reviews.Author: terpnut
Reviews.Content: Like most other vacation/suite properties in this area, this place offers families a lot of space and privacy for the money. Its location is not really Lake Buena Vista but is still very convenient to all the theme parks or the Convention Center. Being next to the Outlet Center turned out to be a small bonus as we picked up some good deals there when we had some down time. As for the negatives: 1. Mandatory resort fee was not disclosed. 2. Kitchen floors and counters could have been bettered cleaned. Smelled of fish. 3. Most vacation/suite properties offer complimentary 1-2/week maid service, but this place charges per service so nothing is included. 4. Beds are made with a flat sheet, a thin blanket and a bedspread only-it would be nice to have a decent comforter to sleep with. 5. Some mechanical noises emanating from upper level woke me overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!! Great new year's celebration”
Reviews.Author: ARamirex
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time in Orlando and we had a great time! The condo was perfect, way much more than we expected. Bedrooms were all very comfortable, including the pillows (of which I always complain about). The service at the front desk and Consierge was very helpful in purchasing the tickets and transportation to the parks was perfect. Thank you for a wonderful vacation and will return for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Walt Disney World Area”
Reviews.Author: Canuck72
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Florida for Christmas and decided to extend my stay and head over to Orlando to run in the Disney World Marathon. I wasn't sure whether or not I should stay at a Disney hotel, but wasn't too keen on having all of my meals at restaurants and having to pay extra for things like internet access. I found the Lake Buena Vista Resort & Spa on hotwire and am very happy with the accommodations, as well as location. The hotel is right next to an outlet shopping area and is not far from the Wal-Mart, pharmacies, and is only 2 miles outside of Disney World. This hotel caters mainly to families with a pirate ship in the main pool, but the apartment style suites are great. It was very convenient to be able to do my laundry, cook my own meals and there was no additional charge for parking. I also like the fact that they charge for clean up service during your stay...if you want it. I opted not to have it, so was never bothered by a cleaning lady arriving while I was in the apartment. There is a "resort fee" on top of what you pay when you book online. It was $40 for the four days, which I thought was ok, but I don't really see what the fee covers. They mentioned a shuttle, but you really need a car if you are going to stay here. It makes grocery shopping and visiting the parks much easier.

Reviews.Title: “holiday with grandkids”
Reviews.Author: lilianjane
Reviews.Content: We have been to this resort for the last 3 years in May. Good location, ideal when traveling with small children. washing machine and drier used every day. Handy for wal mart, and all the parks. kids loved the pool area best time in the morning as the sun goes behind the buildings in the afternoon.The rooms could do with an upgrade, noticed this more on the last visit, but were clean and tidy just a bit run down. We used the weekly housecleaning everything changed for the second week. The pool food wasnt up to much poor quality and micowaved. Over all had a great time , staff friendly,

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for family”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in January in a two-bedroom suite. Overall very nice. Pool water is heated. You can pack light because there is a washer and dryer in the room, but they don't provide any clothes detergent so you have to bring or go buy your own. There is also a dishwasher, but no detergent. Room was clean. Couple things needed small repairs in the room (kitchen faucet worked but you couldn't move it, refrigerator was leaking inside but worked, couple bulbs out, etc.). Not a big deal, but I feel a place such as this should have everything in working order. You have to pay extra for room service; they offer three levels ($30 extra per day for "full" room service, $25 for next lower service, and $5.00 if you want clean towels). Fine, but clean towels daily should be complimentary in my opinion. One last thing is I was surprised they had not upgraded to flat screen TV's.

Reviews.Title: “Practical yet luxurious, conviently located with great amenities,good value!”
Reviews.Author: Nuskinny
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa! I consider myself pampered. Great customer service with outstanding accommodations ! We reserved already for a return trip with our grandchildren! Family Friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Good but .......”
Reviews.Author: RASSIG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good for families , I was travelling with my husband and kids and got a two bedroom suite , but the biggest problem of this hotel is that they do not have housekeeping , you have to pay if you want the suite to be cleaned , you have to pay even if you want the towels changed and they do not mention this when you are booking it was a bad surprise when I was checking in and they told me that . I payed on day for the cleaning and it was an awfull cleaning so I gave up and did thje cleaning myself.If you need to use internet forget about using their wi-fi the signal is awfull and when I complained about it they gave me a cable to connect. The shower of the main bathroom had no presure and I had to complain twice to have it fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Not in Lake Buena Vista and zero housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: lufcpaul1
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very nice.....STOP Check in was very poor. The lady who checked us in talked on the phone. Thank fully a lady at the ticket desk was able to help the 4 or 5 people in line behind me. We were in Building 1. A family of 4 took over the elevator with about 100 bags of "stuff" from Macy's and Bed Bath and Beyond" 5th floor for 4 nights - We had zero house-keeping. Now building 1 sits above a "bar/restaurant" which claims to be Irish. A small gym that is used by everone who lives in the area and a small convenience store. Parking is a nighmare and finally the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa sits at the edge of the Lake Buena Factory Stores - Neither of which are in Lake Buena Vista - Across the road is Walmart, at least they tell the truth and say Kissimmee, FL 34746 Osceola County.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria Teresa P
Reviews.Content: We just returned. Very nice clean hotel. Great condo hotel. Nice amenities, convinience store and pizza hut in hotel very practical. I recommend this place for families. Not great for very young children. Beware of the slide in the pirate ship!!!!!!!! Very dangerous and sign is misleading. Height requirement gives parents a false sense of safety. Children 44 inches and higher can use slide but it DOES NOT SAY THAT THEY HAVE TO KNOW TO SWIM beacause the area of the pool where the slide is is over 4 feet. I had to jump in after my daughter as well as another father. Child panicks once they have gone down the slide and realize they don't reach the floor. Very dangerous!!!!!! If parent is not right beside child could drown. The employee that they had the day we were there by the slide is not a life guard, and was fully clothed listening to music on his mp3! Terrible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Kingy7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LBV for 10 nights in a 2 bed apartment over Xmas and New Year 2011 booked with Virgin Holidays. As like most guests I did request a room in block 5 but did not get it. This was not a problem as the room we were given was very nice (block where reception is located) I agree with the comments about the jacuzzi bath that unfortunately the jets do spray out alot of dirt. I realised this after my first bath and was horrified to think initially all this dirt came off me! However, the rest of the apartment was great and I found the washer/dryer really handy (no returning home with a case of dirty clothes). Also it was nice that the children had their own bathroom too. Didn't really cook in the kitchen as we tend to eat out on holiday, but it was very well equipped should you want to. Tip: Do not use the onsite shop, it is very ridiculously expensive for example a small bottle of water is $2.99. It is open very late though which can come in handy. Walmart is literally just up the road and so cheap and even sells all the Disney merchandise at a fraction of the price of the parks My children enjoyed going to the onsite games room and we did eat at Franky Farrells pub a few times and had very nice meals. Convenient when you really have had enough of driving and just want to walk to a pub and as my husband drove all holiday I think he was glad we had somewhere walking distance so he could have a pint of Stella! The pool are was nice and they do provide towels so no need to bring your own from home. Ate from the bar menu a couple of times and to be honest, not that great and drinks etc again expensive. We also were awoken in the early hours of January 2nd to the sound of an alarm and someone speaking over a tannoy. We got rather concerned when we went out on to the balcony and saw about 4 fire engines approaching the hotel. I rang reception and the receptionist told me that it was not our block that had the fire. However, we still felt quite uneasy seeing all the people outside in the night clothes and the fire engines approaching, so my husband dressed and went outside to see what was going on. The lack of sleep we could of done without as we were heading to Magic Kingdom early in the morning. And as other guests commented , there did not seem to be any sort of procedure in place. Apart from this we had a great holiday and I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ease, Relax and pure Enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Bud K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa from January 2nd, 2012 til January 5th, 2012 and would like to tell everyone who is trying to decide where to stay, that this is where it is at. Shopping and the Resorts were within minutes of the Resort and the onboard restaurants were impecable. Activities are abound especially the pool and the pool bar. We would definately return in the future and consider the value for what you get can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel though should be 3 star rating”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Marie F
Reviews.Content: This hotel complex is fairly vast with five apartment buildings separated by a road between them.It's a quiet resort and sufficiently far away from the highway. My family consisting of 5 had a three bedroom apartment. It was a good size though the standard of cleanliness wasn't great and I did have to go round and clean up upon arrival. Whilst the three bedroom apartment was supposed to sleep/service 8, kitchen items such as crockery and cutlery fell far short of this. Pool complex was brilliant especially with the pirate boat slide which keeps the kids amused for hours. Would say that the pool bar food is very basic comprising pizza, burgers and fried chicken warmed in a microwave - expected more for a four star rated hotel. Kids club was there for two days of the fourteen and when queried, hotel staff said they hadn't managed to fill the position on a permanent basis, again a bit disappointing. This hotel is a great location for shopping since you can walk right out on to the factory outlets. All in all, I would rate this hotel three star.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: JDWeaver
Reviews.Content: The Resort is in a great location for many reasons. You are walking distance to a very nice outlet mall(spent alot of time there) Wal-Mart was a 7 minute drive which was great for us because the condo has a great kitchen. There are many places to eat in a 5 to 10 minute drive. You are also very close to the front gate to Disney World. The pirate pool was great if you have a family and there is also another pool if you need some quiet time pool side. The pool bar was also very nice good atmosphere and great drinks. The bartenders were fun!! The grounds were beautifully landscaped. There is also a mini mart on site(a little high) good in a pinch. There is also a Pizza Hut on site which was great after a long day at the parks. We were not happy with parking. If you are lucky to park outside not problems,but the parking garage was very tight. The front desk staff was great. Caitlyn checked us in and after a 16 hour drive I has thrilled that it took all of 15 minutes to check us in. Furniture was slightly worn and I felt like the carpets could use a good cleaning,as our feet and socks were dirty if we took our shoes off. 2 out of 4 of our party would not return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: This resort is excellent. The suites are beautiful and havind stayed 10 nights in a wonderful Disney hotel first it was pleasurable to be in a suite with separate bedrooms for adults and children and to be able to relax on an evening and eat in/cook your own food. The amenities of the suite were excellent. The washing facilities were excellent. The pool is lovely and the nearby Irish pub Frankie Farrells serves excellent food. Better still because we were a Virgin traveller we received discount! Would certainly recommend people to stay here. A lovely plaza of shops very close by too, and the resort is very well situated for the all routes.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, especially with kids”
Reviews.Author: Dave151
Reviews.Content: Very impressed by the whole resort. Rooms were great. Stayed in the 2 bedroom suite in building 2. The only update they may want to consider are the TVs: two in the bedroom are tube; the one in the living room is an old box projection-type. The kids loved the pirate ship waterslide. Pool was great too! Weather wasn't great, but cannot fault the resort. The little "grocery store" on site is convenient but expensive. There is a big grocery store just north of the Downtown Disney gates.

Reviews.Title: “xmas and new year 2011”
Reviews.Author: lynda0
Reviews.Content: When we booked this holiday in Jan 2011 i contacted the hotel straight away to request building 5 and fireworks views for our 2 & 3 bedroom apartments. This was followed up twice again during the year(once by phone to hotel reservations) when we checked in we were told there was no request on our file and as the firework views had already been paid for by other guests we were out of luck(we were never once told we could pay extra as we would have done it) our first apartments were on floor 13 when we got in the two bedroom apartment smelt really bad and the three bedroom had hole in the bath and a broken blind in one of the rooms. I rang the front desk and was advised 'not to worry as we wouldnt be charged for making the hole!) it took another two calls to the front desk for them to move us. During one of the calls we were even told if we used the toilet before we moved we would be charged cleaning fees! The first lady we spoke to was very unpleasant and very unhelpful but eventually the matter was taken over by a lovely young man called Tyler. He showed us round rooms on the fifth floor in building three and we moved there. My son was sick one night and whilst we managed to wash the sheets on his bed the blanket and bedspread were far too big. I called the next morning before 8 am and was told they would be replaced when housekeeping came in at 9. By late afternoon it still wasnt there and the bedding covered in sick was still in our apartment so i called front desk again, they advised they would get someone right up. we went out and didnt get back till 1.30 am and surprise surprise the dirty bed clothes were still there and still no clean ones so i rang the front desk again. they offered to send security up with a blanket but given fact they hadnt stuck to any arrangements so far i had to put my son in with us as i couldnt keep him up any later. the following morning i called the desk again and housekeeping arrived with a blanket, it was soaking wet and they still left the dirty bedding. after another visit it was sorted. as mentioned in previous reviews the sheets do not stay on the beds and the pillows are not great, the wireless internet was patchy in the two bed and non existing in the three and the bath in our two bedroom apartment could not be used due to scum from the spa jets but if im honest i wouldnt even mention any of this had it not been for what happened next. One of the party in our three bed got up to use the toilet in around 4.10am and heard a muffled recording which seemed to be evacuation alarm. he woke us and i went out to hall but message was still muffled so i called from desk, they said we had to evacuate, we rang the two bed and they hadnt heard a thing but we all went to evacuate. My parents are both 72 and both disabled, mum was using an electric scooter but we had to get them down the stairs. when we got down it was pure chaos, nobody knew where to go, people were struggling and there wasnt a member of staff to be seen. we were left outside(it was only building three evacuated) no blankets, no roll call, no organisation and no consideration from the hotel staff(wherever they were!) the fire brigade asked if we were ok and told us when to go back into the building. there was no structured evacuation procedure and given the size of this place its a disaster waiting to happen. i had put comments on the Facebook page which can still be seen(posted 31st December originally under my name Lynda Jones) the hotel did not respond until we checked out! We cant fault the size of the apartments but thats about it. we wouldnt dream of giving a negative review but when safety is an issue we have no choice. We have been to Orlando many times and will keep coming but not to this resort. A resort that values its guests so little is not value for money. I'm very thankful nobody was hurt but that was more good luck than good management.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: eiwhit
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay over the Christmas Holidays for a few days. The price of this Resort was very reasonable and much better than the Disney properties. The rooms were spacious and we weren't on top of each other. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and there was 5 of us. The location is very close to anything Disney and several outlet malls were close by. The resort still seems to be in its building stages because half of the view is the highway. My suggestions would be better quality food especially pool side and invest in some pool towels. I would recommend bringing beach towels because the resort towels are very small and very thin and you need 2 at least per person. The Irish Pub - Frank Farrell's was great. Other than that the place is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Abosolute best value in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: mcjmn
Reviews.Content: You will not find a place with this much room, at this price anywhere in Orlando, especially on Disney property. Stayed in the 4br Grand Cayman "penthouse" suite. I recommend these rooms because they are located in the best and newest buildings on site. The size of the room is increadible. Very convenient to Disney. Plenty of parking for the rental cars. Pirate pool more than adequate to entertain the children. I notice a lot of people complain about stuff that, if only they read the website, would not be a problem. For example, this is a condo hotel, so there is not housekeeping every day. You have to schedule and pay for housekeeping. If you think this is a rip off, then I recommed you go someplace else and pay twice as much for a smaller room. You will get your housekeeping there. If you have a large group, want to stay together, but still have privacy, this is the place for you. The 4br suite has two Master suites on each end. You can close them off and have your own private suite. Outside the door of each private suite, is another BR for the kiddo's to stay in. Across the hall from that is their own private bath. I could go on and on. Basically, this is the place to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option!!!”
Reviews.Author: LymarisLL
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel!!! Close to parks and shopping malls. The service is excellent!! I recommend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY AT LAKE BUENA VISTA RESORT”
Reviews.Author: Alana V
Reviews.Content: thank you ever so much to the wonderful resort and staff of lake buena vista resort and spa. what a wonderful time we had. our accomodation was super and clean and spacious. tom at the poolside bar was very helpful with all his advise and directions around the florida area, thanks tom. my daughter loved the pool and the pirate slide and spent many hours in the pool at night. the jacuzzi (3) to choose from was an added bonus when we got home after long days in the parks, we did hire our own car but many a morning saw guests lining up to use the resort buses to disney. what a wonderful and truely amazing time we had. wish we did not have to leave. regards alana & david vincent - south africa

Reviews.Title: “Unaccomodating”
Reviews.Author: Katy C
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here but will absolutely NOT be returning next year due to the staff's refusal to accommodate a late (1:00 pm) check out. We come every year for the DIsney Marathon weekend and have stayed at several properties who are happy to oblige with a 1:00 check out for runners. My boyfriend finished his race and we went to the desk at 11:50 only to be told we had to check out by 12:30 to avoid a charge. So, after being up since 3:15 am for the race and running for hours, he is hurriedly showering and packing. How disappointing that the inconsiderate staff refuses to be flexible with guests who would have returned year after year. RunDisney events generate lots of revenue for your property and I would have thought you'd would be more mindful of that.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: SylvesterW
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms that sleep 6 for family of 5; 2 adults and 3 teenagers during our recent Christmas break vacation in Orlando. I wished I have more time to spend on the resort itself because it is a very wonderful home away from home. The resort is closed to all amenities; Factory outlet, Disney World theme parks, Walmart Supercenter, etc. A rental vehicle can definitely enhance your vacation in your own convenience but make sure you have a GPS. We had 2 incidents though during our stayed. Firstly, a fire alarm at 4am in our building. I wished they have another system to warn each affected guest room. Secondly, an annoying car alarm the next morning about the same time as the fire alarm. My family has a whale of vacation in Orlando; theme parks visiting and outlets shopping. Next time around, we definitely planned for a longer stayed to enjoy the resort more!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartments near Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas T
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay off Disney resort and on the recommendation of our travel agent chose the Lake Buena Vista Resort. It was the best decision we made for the whole trip. The only thing you need to do is make sure you have a car (which we did). The $ saving from staying off resort and even with the cost of the hire car factored in, was huge. It also gave us the freedom to come and go as we pleased. Apartments were large and rooms very generous in size. Only complaint was that the common area corridors to the lifts had a bit of a weird smell, but this smell did NOT carry into the apartments. Staff were very helpful with all queries we had. Overall a great place to stay. A warning though - do NOT eat at the Pizza Hut in the convenience store located in the complex!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but won't return again”
Reviews.Author: EMMLEE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at lbv Resort and Spa over Christmas and New Year it was the 2nd time we have stayed here. We had a three bedroomed apartment in block 3 despite for the last 6 months requesting to be in block5!! The accomodation was very tired the sofa needed replacing and there were many things looking tired. The main spa bath was never able to be used as it was deposting black grime from the jets after complaining 5 times we finally gave up and just got on with it. There was a constant dripping tap in the other bathroom and a very sticky floor in the third bedroom only minor niggles but when you've spent alot of money for a special holiday you don't expect them. The LBV Spa is in a good location for malls, disney etc so def good location as a base. The only other MAJOR concern I had was we were awoken one night with the fire alarm going off in the building we quickly got the children dressed and out and made our way to the main reception to be greeted with nothing no staff helping, no one advisng what had happend what to do where to wait etc. Just one poor Receptionist who didn't seem to know what to do, Eventually we found out (via the fire men not the Hotel that there had been a small fire but it was safe to go back in as long as we wern't on a certain floor. I just wonder if it has been more serious what would have happened and for that reason would never return to the Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa. I have stayed at Rosen Plaza previously and Residence Inn and would rate them over this place but thats just from personal experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, but poor lost&found department”
Reviews.Author: Lisagkp
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights there with our 2-year-old son. Overall speaking, a good place for family, nice facilities and we loved the swimming pool a lot. Just one thing, I left a book in the hotel room when we checked out, and found it when we were back home. I tried to call the lost and found, but they were hard to reach. And I left my number, they only called once to asked the name of the book again, and no more responde. Kind of disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: julie w
Reviews.Content: Our party consisted of 3 adults and 2 children (15yrs , 5 yrs), we had a 3 beddroomed unit in block 5. Our holiday was booked as a package through Virgin Holidays. The unit was very spacious and could easily have accomodated 8. The unit was very clean, we could not find anything negative to say about it. We did not use the maid service as we kept the room clean and tidy ourselves (as you would do where ever you were). The washer and dryer are a great plus, if we'd have know how good this was before we went we would have taken half as many clothes as my lot didn't wear half of what they took. We shopped on the mall next to the hotel and also at the Orlando Premium Outlet, both were fantastic we bought loads of bargains back, so make sure your well under weight on your luggage on the way out to accomodate for the bargains you will buy. .... We didn't have a car, I'm the only driver and to be honest the thought of driving in America was just to frightening for me.... We used the shuttle to get to the parks, however we didn't return on the shuttle as we preffered the flexability of returning when we pleased, a taxi from Epcot to the hotel would cost us approx $13, a taxi from Universal or Wet 'n' wild would cost about $20-25. When you want to go to Disney the shuttle will take you to Epcot, from there you will either need to get the Monorail or Disney bus to the Disney Park of your choice, its really simple and everything is clearly sign posted, there are also loads of Disney people around to ask if your not sure. The hotel also runs a shuttle to Universal which also stops at Sea World, if you want to go to Wet 'n' Wild you should get the shuttle to Universal, and then jump into one of the many taxis, a taxi from Universal to Wet n wild will cost about $5. If you want to go to Aquatica you should get the shuttle to Sea World, there are free shuttle buses that run between Sea World, Aquatica and Discovery Cove (as these are all the same park owners). Remember when booking the shuttle to do so the night before and to arrive at about 20 minutes before the shuttle is due to leave as you will need to collect your shuttle voucher which they will not give to you until the morning of the shuttle. The hotel reception staff would order a taxi for us, but to be honest every taxi driver you have will give you a card and offer you a discount on future trips.. As we were often very tiered after full days at the park, we used the Pizza Hut and Irish bar on a couple of occasions, both were fine, the irish bar also deliver to the room which is fantastic. We did do a main shop at Walmar (about $5 each way in a taxi) and used the supermarket which is also the Pizza Hut for small items (its not worth paying for a taxi if you only want a bottle of milk), but it is expensive but very convenint if you only want a couple of items. Top Tip We took our spending money on a Travelex cash passport which was fab, however if you need to get cash off this type of card the cashpoint in the hotel will charge you (ALOT), believe it or not the cash points in the Universal, Sea World and Wet n Wild parks whilst they still charge its only small ($2.50 compared to $18 at the hotel).. Next time we go to Florida we will deffinatley be staying here. If you have any queries please feel free to contact me directly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: FFNDUARTE
Reviews.Content: Guys, I definitely recommend this hotel. Very affordable, great location, especially considering Walt Disney Parks, and really decent apartments. We stayed in a 4 bedroom and enjoyed all the space. Cleaning is an issue, especially if you are traveling with a big party. We used 2 full cleaning services in 2 weeks and with everybody effort we managed to maintain the bedroom in a good order. Had some minor maintenance problems (washer, drier, garbage disposal) but everything was fixed in a very short time, but had to complain more than once about each problem, which was the only down side I would highlight. I would definitely come back, it is a fantastic place to stay in Orlando, especially when you have a big party.

Reviews.Title: “Huge living area. Great value. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: MC005
Reviews.Content: The 4 BR/4 BA Suite was perfect for our extended family of 8 for our 3-day trip to both Universal and Disney parks. Two master BR's with jacuzzi tubs and two BR's with two twins in each. The living area was absolutely gigantic... great communal space. Two kitchen areas. Four bathrooms, which was wonderful with 4 teenagers. Front desk staff were very helpful regarding park times, suggestions, etc. We only wish our stay was for more than two nights, and that we had more time to spend in the resort area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Lake Buena Vista”
Reviews.Author: PHILIRENE1992
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 6 people travelling to Orlando to visit Disneyworld. We enjoyed a lot our stay at Lake Buena Vista Village. The 3-room unit was very large and clean, the staff nice and ready to help. The kids loved the swimming pool with the pirate ship. The hotel is also conveniently located to visit Disneyworld (5-10 minutes by car). Will definitely return for a future visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Big suites, great location”
Reviews.Author: sherlex
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay! Two bedroom suite was huge and complete with all you need including washer and dryer. Great location, especially if you only plan to do disneyworld one or two days-much better to stay offsite.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and fantasic location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from December 20-28 of 2011. After we booked the unit, I read some of the less than flattering reviews and became a bit nervous. Needless to say, my fears were unfounded. We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit, which was clean and well maintained. The master suite was a hotel room unto itself; with a king sized bed and a Jacuzzi tub large enough to fit 2 people comfortably. The other 2 bedrooms were spacious, and kept our kids happy. The kitchen was modern and well equipped. It was great for cooking meals and making snacks in the evening. The store carried pretty much everything you needed to live, and the Walmart (a very short drive) carried everything else. Our kids loved the pirate ship pool, and spent the cool evenings in the hot tubs. The in-room laundry meant that we could pack light. The staff were always courteous. My only complaint would be the wireless internet – it was mediocre at the best of times. I had read this somewhere else, and brought my router from home. After a little finagling with their wired system, I managed to set up my own wireless network that worked fantastic. I think the best part of the resort is the location – we could be at any of the Disney parks, Seaworld, or the Premium Outlet Mall within a couple of minutes - and without having to travel on I-4. The only attraction that was any distance was Universal, which was still only 10 minutes in good traffic. AND of course, the ability to have space to relax in the evening helped keep the parents sane.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...Booked again!!”
Reviews.Author: AliceNiamh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2010 and have just booked to go April 2013! We had the most amazing time here. We arrived in FL around 7pm and drove 30mins to the complex and checked in straight away-no problem. When we arrived at our apartment we went straight to bed. In the morning we had a look around the rooms and could find NO PROBLEMS!! the kitchen area and bathrooms were spotless. There was so much room and space to store cases and purchases! In order to get over the jetlag we went swimming in the pool and the poolside refreshments were lovely, everything there was clean too. We walked over to the shops to see what was there and discovered a huge number of top brands and places to eat. As we hired a car we went for a drive to find a place to buy groceries etc. Less than 5mins away was Walmart. We found everything there and went back after every park to buy fresh food! THIS RESORT IS INCREDIBLE!!! It is: clean, staff are friendly, spacious and is in a GREAT LOCATION. If you want to know more ask! x

Reviews.Title: “This resort is magnificent”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here a week before Christmas for a Christmas vacation. We are Disney passholders & usally stay at a Disney resort. This resort is better than any Disney resort we have stayed at!!!!! The rooms are very spacious, especially the master BR. The tub was great for relaxing after a long day at the parks. The kids & grandkids loved the pool & the adults really enjoyed the hot tubs & tiki bar!!!!!! Arrived at 10:00 A.M. did not really expect our rooms to be ready, but they were!!!!!! Never had that happen at a Disney resort. Not only that but had two people check us in so we got both rooms done at the same time!!! And the entire staff is extremely courteous & efficient. LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: debbie b
Reviews.Content: we took our 7 year old daughter and stayed in block 3 the apartment was fab, clean and everything was in full working order, all linen and towels were in great condition, and what a wonderful treat after a long hard day at the parks or malls to be able to lay in the hot tub !!!! had the most wonderful time the staff were very helpful and friendly. If we get the chance to visit again we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “just a plain jane place”
Reviews.Author: jr84k
Reviews.Content: Well i got the fireworks view in bldg 5 , like all the previous reviews told me to request, since it was a newer bldg. from our experience on the 11th floor of the 5th bldg. i dont wanna see what the older bldgs look like. lol. the furniture in this place is used up and couches should be replaced. the comforters are horrible. it is located in a decent spot and located next door to one of the outlets. i wasnt expected much becuase i felt it was a bargain price for a 3 bedroom. but i will not be staying here again since we like a higher standard of living.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Faith D
Reviews.Content: By far the best place we have stayed in many trips to Orlando. So much better than a hotel room. Lovely, multi room suites with full kitchen and -- how absolutely fantastic -- a washer and dryer. Suites are well-appointed, spacious, great views. Staff is helpful and gracious. We stayed for a week in November and then came back for another week just three weeks later. That's how much we liked it. I'm rating a 4 only because the suite this time wasn't quite as nice as the one we had in November. Everything was a little more used. Next visit (Yes, we will definitely go back!) I'll mention that I would like a newer 2-bedroom suite. All in all, it was a wonderful site for a family holiday get together and we have great memories of our two stays in November and December.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Carol L
Reviews.Content: We recently took our 3 year old daughter to Orlando to visit Universal's Islands of Adventure and Disney's Magic Kingdom. This property was perfect on so many fronts: very close to both of the parks we visited, the awesome Pirate Ship in the pool, the full kitchen and the jacuzzi (for Mom after the activities of the day)! Even though these attractions are close to our hometown of Tampa, we opted to make a vacation of it, and this hotel only added to the fun. Highly convenient, great service and a wonderful spa - we can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: DECEMBERCREATION
Reviews.Content: My first extended stay in Orlando and celebrating a birthday so I had a few expectations and LBVR did not disappoint...as a concierge myself, i understand the importance of great customer service and from the moment we checked in with Matthew to our checkout, we were pleasantly surprised. For those novices to the area the resort is in an ideal location for access to the factory stores, dining and entertainment....though this was a short trip for us, we will definitely be back! Thanks to Matthew, Trish and Kaitlin for all of the info provided and for making us feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Arun K
Reviews.Content: We checked in the hotel for 4 night stay in a two bedroom suite(Nov -28 -Dec 2,2011).Within a few minutes,I discovered that the coffee table's leg was totally broken and I made acomplaint to the lady at the reception.She said somebody would remove it the next morning and till we left nobody did.I had accidentally left my nine year old's Nintendo DSi with all his chips and all in a bag in the room and when I realised it,we called them.They assured me nobody had checked in after us,the room was still unoccupied and the manager went to check.They couldnot find it!I was informed that by lost and found head,Juan,that they would conduct an internal investigation and somebody would get back to me.If nobody else had checked in after us and they couldnot find it where I left it,that leaves only the housekeeping.Nobody got back to me and when I called,they said I signed a waiver that says they are not responsible if anything is lost or (left behind?).I donot understand thier attitude and the logic of what they are saying.'Nobody checked into your room after you left,only the housekeeping went in after you,but we will not hold them responsible for your lost item and we will not take responsibility'.When my husband called Paul's supervisor Jason and left a message,his call was never returned.My nine year old is miserable and with the Nintendo DSi and chips,it's worth more than $500!!My children are unhappy and because of the not so clean housekeeping, their holiday was ruined and I cannot beleive the hotel's approach towards their dishonest employees!Bad,Bad,Bad experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place for Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: WandaMaria
Reviews.Content: We visited the Orlando, Florida area for a week in July, 2011 and stayed at Lake Buena Vista for the entire week. Overall, it was a wonderful experience and we would definitely not hesitate to stay there again. The rooms are spacious and clean. We stayed in a 2 bedroom hotel, complete with living room, dining room, full kitchen, 2 bathrooms and a washer and dryer. The master bedroom contains a large whirlpool spa tub and a separate shower which came in handy for quick showers after all-day treks to the resorts in the humid Florida weather. Four of us stayed comfortably in this room - me, my husband and our 18 and 23 year old kids. We loved the fact that we did not have to eat out all of the time due to the full kitchen. There are grocery stores nearby where you can stop for groceries and prepare your own meals, which we did quite often. The kitchen is fully equiped with a refrigerator (complete with icemaker), coffee pot, toaster, oven/stove, pots, pans, dishes and utensils. (My only suggestion would be that if you are going to shop at the nearby Walmart for your groceries, you avoid going there on Sunday evenings. The place is packed to the point where you are cart to cart and shoulder to shoulder with other customers. The lines are huge and it's worse than shopping during Black Friday Christmas sales, if you can believe that. Apparently, from what we were told, that's because all of the tour buses and the like come into town on Sundays and everyone has the same idea about grocery shopping on Sunday evenings. You are much better off getting necessities at the nearby Walgreens or Publix which are much less crowded if you absolutely have to shop on Sunday night.) The washer and dryer was compact but big enough if you wanted to wash clothes every other night or so. The resort provided enough detergent to do 1-2 loads, but after that, you had to purchase your own detergent which was no big deal. It was a nice convenience having our own washer and dryer. Since there were 4 of us on the trip and we packed lightly, we washed clothes every other day. There is a large pool at the resort where we spent many mornings and evenings in between visiting the area attractions. We loved it. There is a bar area near the pool that serves refreshments and beverages. In addition, we took advantage of the day spa that is located at the resort. I had the pedicure and my kids had the pedicures and full body massages. We enjoyed being pampered on our trip. The resort staff were friendly and helpful. A great experience! Will gladly stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: Earon P
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this particular resort. We enjoyed our previous stay, so when we were booking I looked for this particular resort. When we arrived, I asked the gentleman if he could upgrade us to a room with a view of the pool, he said sure. When we arrived to our room, we were presently surprised to find not only did were we upgraded to a pool view room, it was also a 2 bedroom. I would stay again. All attractions and shopping are only a few minutes drive. Free wi-fi and parking.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent and Convenient Base”
Reviews.Author: GraemeKeillor
Reviews.Content: These generous apartments were very comfortable and well appointed and clean with everything you needed. The staff were on hand to assist but you were free to come and go without feeling restricted in any way.We had read before staying that servicing of apartments was a bit sporadic but we never experienced this and could not fault the overall service. The swimming pool with it's pirate ship theme was pleasant and a good place to spend a few hours in the sun when not visiting the parks. I also found the spa very professional and reasonably priced. The location was very convenient for both Disney and Universal with most attractions no more than 10-15 minutes drive away.( Remember if you have a hire car and take it too the parks it with cost you in the region of 12 dollars so you may wish to use the courtesy bus to Disney from the hotel), Plenty car parking but suggest you get into the covered part so that you car in cool when you get into it. All in all I would stay at the resort again and would regard it as good as a villa and better located. Eating out was restricted on site with the pizza outlet being excellent value but pub was average. If you want goof food at a very reasonable price drive, head back up the junction and towards I drive and find the nearest "Outback" You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay as usual!”
Reviews.Author: Lobster514
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort 4 times now. Each time we stay, the staff is courteous, the rooms are clean, and it is very quiet. We love the fact that you can stay in a 2 or 3 bedroom condo for less than half the price of a one bedroom hotel room! The place is very clean and extremely centrally located to everything. It takes 10 min to Disney, 10 min to good food, and grocery stores. Oh, and did I mention that you have a full kitchen with stove and microwave, washer and dryer, and a balcony. The pirate pool with slide and water area is heated so, we were swimming just a few days ago. A must see!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort, PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: nyctla123
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Orlando for my husband's conference(in the resort) so of course his employer was paying for the resort. This hotel/resort is absolutely amazing, very clean, comfortable, the bathrooms and the jacuzzi were awesome. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite with a kitchen, 3 flat screen TVs, it was just perfectly amazing. A shuttle goes to Disney twice in the morning and they bring you back too. You just have to make sure you sign up for it. The balcony view was gorgeous, the palm trees just put a smile on my face. There is a small outlet shopping center within walking distance. We weren't able to enjoy the pool but it sure did look fun. I don't know if we would have stayed at this hotel on our own cause it was just the two of us and we really didn't need all that space and I can't imagine the cost. But if you are going with your family or friends, DON'T miss this amazing resort. I am sure if couples want to stay here, they probably have smaller suites or rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family”
Reviews.Author: tinrose
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us and we had a 2-bedroom unit. The master bedroom have a king size bed, private shower, bathroom and Jacuzzi tub which was great for nights when I was too tired to go to the hot tub. We were in building two, and there is a pool, hot tub and convenient store right next to it. I like having the convenient of a full kitchen and the options of laundry and housecleaning. The beds are not the most comfortable especially the pull out couch and they only provided a thin pillow and blanket for each bed, other than that the staff is very friendly and this is a great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: hank r
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay . we were here in December 2011, we had a 2 bedroom condo, lots of space, nicely furnished. great location, near everything. No reason to go to a Disney property spend a lot more and get less. Front desk people were as nice as could be. Will definitly be back we are seasoned travelers and have seen a lot and this place is teriffic.

Reviews.Title: “3 weeks, ideal location for all parks!”
Reviews.Author: LoveUSofA
Reviews.Content: 5 of us (4 adults 1 child) spent 3 very enjoyable weeks here in November, we were in building 1, which I believe is one of the older buildings, the furnishings where worn, but everything was very clean, bedding, towels, kitchen, bathroom. Very spacious, huge jaccuzzi baths, which we did not get chance to try:( We opted for no house keeping and just washed our own bedding and towels with the washer and dryer in the room. Which were a god send. Building one is ideally located, the shop, pizza hut, irish bar, gym and games room where all located in our building. We also had the smaller pool, which we had all to ourselves all holiday! The pirate pool as lovely and the tiki bar and food fine. The Irish bar was also ok for when you cannot be bothered going out again! Although the hotel is not gated we all felt very safe and co fident walking round. The outlets shops were great to, very nice to be able to walk there easily. walmart was literally half a mile away and easily walkable....if there was a footpath, which unfortunaltey there isn't. We checked in and out really quickly and easily. The Expedia expert booked tickets for us for various shows too which was very handy. We used the free transportation to Seaworld which again was fine but times are limited but this is quite usual for hotel transport. You do need a car to stay at this hotel ideally, but this is the best location we have stayed in whilst staying in Orlando, Disney property is literally 2 miles away and consists of one right turn and one left turn! Seaworld and international drive are again really easy to get too, a 2 right turns then a left and your there! would definatley choose to stay here again excellent value for money, excellent location, great facilities!

Reviews.Title: “Very well placed for all needs”
Reviews.Author: BrixhamColey
Reviews.Content: Second stay and as good as the first time, clean and tidy. All staff most helpful and friendly to us. Concierge was very good service to use,nothing she could not help us with. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: rockyviewmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from Nov 9- 13( 4 nights 92USD/night, tax, resort fee total is 463USD) , 2 bedroom suite (called Antigua) at Building 5. The room looks new, tidy and clean. The reception desk is very friendly. The Antigua suite is about 1100-1200SQF. One bedroom has a king bed, the other has two double beds and the living room has a sofa bed. 4 adults, 2 kids are very comfortable with that space, full kitchen and 2 full bathrooms. Downstairs has a small premium outlet. Walmart ( open 24 hours) is 5 mins drive across the street and you can find the best price of disney ticket, kennedy space center ticket in addition to milk, fruit, etc. The condo also has shuttle service (shared service) to major attractions. But I'd say renting car is much more easier becuase anyway you need to drive to walmart or restaurnts. In summary, it is a home away from home. We very likely will choose it again if we return to Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but a few things could be better”
Reviews.Author: Flmum
Reviews.Content: Overall I would stay here again. That being said I'm giving them another chance hoping my room next time will be better. For Orlando, for the price, this was top notch. Pros- shopping center connected to it. Very nice and convenient. Walmart 3 min away. Disney is a straight shot 8 min away. Old Kissimmee was 10 min away. Very centrally located. Plenty of parking. Plenty of restaurants. Great pool and fitness center. Cons- room was clean as far as floor, sheets, beds, towels. Guest shower was so full of hair that it was clogged and all 6 of us had to use the master suite. Tile looked dirty like it hadn't been cleaned in awhile. The tv stand was covered in dust. Overall though the room size and amenities was worth the minor imperfections.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than a Disneyworld Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Harpreet P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 3 children to Disney World for the first time this past November. Our boys are 5, 3 and 1, so I did extensive research to ensure that i pick the perfect accommodation for our family. After several calls to Disney World and soliciting opinions and feedback from friends and family who had traveled to Orlando ..... the jury was out and I couldn't decide on whether to stay on the resort at Disney or nearby off the resort. I ended up booking 3 nights at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa and 3 nights at the Carribean Beach Hotel at Disney World. Firstly, I have to say that the value for the price we paid at Lake Buena Vista was amazing. We had a beautiful 2-bedroom, 2 bathroom condo style suite with a kitchen, laundry in the unit, a large bathroom in the master bedroom and a balcony overlooking the pool. The pool is very well maintained, amazing for children with a great shallow end and deep end for older kids and adults. It also features two hot tubs, towel service and an outdoor restaurant and bar. After enjoying 4 days at Lake Buena Vista (did I mention that there are 3 amazing brand name shopping outlets within a 15-minute drive)? And then there's every Mother's necessity - Walmart is a 5-minute drive up the road! Anyways, after enjoying 4 days at Lake Buena vista, we were excited to move over to Disney and start exploring the parks. The minute we entered our room at Carribean Beach Resort, my heart sank. It was a small, dark room with two double beds. I knew that the room would not be huge, however on the phone, I was told that there would be enough room for a playpen for our infant son ..... not the case at all. My husband and I quickly realized what a mistake we had made and after enjoying a day at the park we called Lake Buena Vista and were lucky enough to get another suite for the remainder of our trip. We were only a short 7-minute drive to Disney and we had the luxury of cooking in the unit when we didn't feel like eating out, doing our laundry as needed and had more than enough space for our family to be comfortable after a long day at the parks. We definitely look forward to returning and would choose this resort over any accommodation inside of Disney hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for families! Thanksgiving weekend 2011.”
Reviews.Author: Robyn S
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this resort at the end of our seasonal passes to Disney. Wish I had found this sooner! I read a lot of reviews on any hotels we stay in; if there are a few negative reviews, it's no big deal -- we'll give it a try. Like most, we found that parking was not the best -- but, that's because they allow you to have as many cars as you need and don't charge you anything. We never had to park on the road, though. We were able to always find a spot in the garage. We typically have 7-10 family members traveling with us most of the time; we normally get 3 separate rooms. It was so nice to have three bedrooms and two baths in one unit! Plus a kitchen, living room and balcony where we could see the fireworks! The pirate ship slide at the pool was great for the kids. Kelsey at Lani's Luau was wonderful! Check in was perfect; check out was perfect; room was perfect (just didn't have washcloths ...strange); beds were a little hard, but okay. Cooked breakfast in our room and was able to sit and enjoy without being rushed. Truly a great experience and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort for an extended vacation”
Reviews.Author: Alicia S
Reviews.Content: This place is truly a home away from home. We were there for five days and four nights, and we did not want to leave. The rooms are fully equipped to meet your every day needs, and the staff was amazing!!! It is located near all of the main attractions. It also supplies a shuttle to some of the Disney Parks. Truly a great experience. We will be back next year with the entire family! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Eddie K
Reviews.Content: We were only a short way from home, but will most certainly return for extended stays at this resort. Very comfortable, spacious and clean. Opportunities for kids and parents to relax and unwind, and it's close to all of the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: C_Cheung52
Reviews.Content: This was our third time for staying at LBV Spa and Resort . We stayed in Bldg 4 on the 5th floor. Very happy with our suite, very, very clean. Large TV in living room, master.. good size TV but second bedroom had a small TV but not a big deal. Beds were a little hard but OK to sleep. Convenient to theme parks and the Premium Outlet Mall, Downtown Disney and restaurants. After checking in with a very friendly staff we received a call to make sure everything in our suite was suitable. Was that a nice surprise. It was very quiet until Saturday and then you could hear some noise but I believe most of that was from the Spa from the floor above. Great view of the pool. I will definitely stay here for again.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: 2mules4sistersarah
Reviews.Content: Family of four and we just love this place. The rooms are well equipped it relaxing and just a short distance from all the attractions. We have stayed there 4 times and are never disappointed. See ye again soon. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: PhotoBob79
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here three times, twice for the Thanksgiving weekend. This is a great place for a relaxing getaway. The rooms are quiet. Full kitchens allow for cooking and eating. There is an Irish Pub (open on Thanksgiving) within the complex as well as a Pizza Hut Express and a small convenience store. We've eaten at the Pub a couple times. Good food. There is a small outlet mall next door with some good shopping. They are usually open on Thanksgiving Day. Target, Walmart,Publix (groceries), CVS and Walgreens are all within easy driving distance. Not far from the parks, though we just hang out at the hotel most of the time. There are a host of restaurants within easy driving distance as well as 20 theater movie house and the convention center. Since these are condos, maid service is an extra cost. We don't worry about it and just throw towels into the washer and dryer as needed. Over all, this is a great value. Highly rocommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort we have ever vacationed at!!”
Reviews.Author: TMHOPE
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at your resort last week, and I can not say enough great things about it!! The resort staff was very accommodating, our two bedroom suite was modern and immaculate, the resort was perfectly located, and the pirate ship at the pool was a huge hit with the kids!! We will recommend this resort to all of our family and friends, and will definitely be staying with you on our next trip to Orlando!! Thank you for a great stay!! T. Hope

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: LarryW54
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, Room paint and appliances good. Couch, needs to be replaced due to age. Dining seat cushions need cleaning. Nice pool area. Pool towels are small, but plenty available. Hallway carpet dirty. Would stay here again when renovations finished.

Reviews.Title: “nice pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: 123caro
Reviews.Content: very nice and affordable pricing to. excellent hotel to go to Disney world...

Reviews.Title: “Vacation at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Mary G
Reviews.Content: My family had a wonderful time staying at Lake Buena Vista hotel & Spa..The hotel was like staying in an apartment..it had all of the space and amenities..The pool area with the pirate ship was a big hit with the kids! The pool Bar was a big hit with the adults! it has everything you need..We were all very comfortable and very pleased with the hotel and the cleanliness and it was only 5 min. from Disney...We will definitely stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Love this place ALWAYS stay there when I am in town”
Reviews.Author: carla s
Reviews.Content: 4th Trip to the condo's. Love them! Clean!! Jean at front desk my favorite. Attentive to problems, quick to solve any solution. Condo's spacious, love the location. Would recommend to every traveler. Parking is somewhat congested, but location, amenities and all the comforts of home and more. Thanks for another great stay at your location. Can't wait until our next trip to Orlando, very relaxing and amazing!

Reviews.Title: “second stay at LBV and once again”
Reviews.Author: laob
Reviews.Content: it was wonderful! and the price cannot be be beat! neither can the firework view! we saw all the fireworks wed, thurs and fri night! sat night went to bed early as we were over and out sunday morning. check in was smooth wed evening. helpful and quick. we had requested the same room as last year (bldg 5 #909) it was booked so they gave us bldng 5 room 1009. went to 2 bdrm. dh off to walmart. dd wanted to hit the pirate pool...it was chilly, but she was excited! slide was closed. she swam a bit and then the hottub. then up to condo and bed for dd. dh and i watched the fireworks on the patio and had some wine. thurs - hit HS and then back to the pool for a bit then to family for dinner fri - hit SW and then to pool and dd had a great time! made some little friends and got to do the slide and swim and do the hottub. then showered. then outlet next door for a bit. had a bite at irish pub. sat - gatorland. pool and hottub again for dd. service at the pool bar is very good. condo was clean. twice during the stay, one elevator would stop working but seemed to be quickly repaired or back on track. we will definitely be back again next thanksgiving!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sandra b
Reviews.Content: myself and 5other family members stayed for 19 days from the 1st of nov 2011.we were on the 6th floor and in block 3.they immediately upgraded one room so we had the same (two rooms).we had a disabled appartment but it was fine.only difference was the loo was out in the open but it did not matter as you just lock the door to the bedroom.!we all loved the apartments and will definately go back again and again!but you do need a car if you want to go around during the evening as you cant walk anywhere.(no pavements).the bus takes you to the parks for free.i just wish i was still there!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean?!”
Reviews.Author: crb42256
Reviews.Content: I have to agree, great location and the pool is great for the kids. No problem with the staff either, very friendly and responsive. But all these people who say the rooms are spotlessly clean must have stayed in a different part of the resort than we did in building 3. The kids socks were black from running around on the carpets; the carpet itself was in dire need of repair, along with the couch. In terms of the couch, how anyone could sleep on the bed inside of it is beyond me. The toilet would not flush properly, and the dishwasher would not work properly either due to the soap dispenser being stuck. The only place dirtier our family has stayed at was a Motel 6 in a pinch for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Bobbi0516”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi0516
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! Our room was just as pictured on the website! It was very clean, the view was spectacular! The room was spacious, everything in the kitchen was spotless and in working order! Our stay was excellent and we will be retunung there definately next year, but will get the 3 bedroom suite because we will be bringing our kids! Also the resort is very close to everything; Disney resorts, outlets and WalMart! Definately enjoyed our stay!! The pub was very good, my husband relly enjoyed the fish and chips, and the convience store was good, it had eveything we needed!! I already recommended this place to everyone I know!!

Reviews.Title: “spectacular Location”
Reviews.Author: Debbie W
Reviews.Content: We are South Florida residents,we we come to orlando for the Florida Classic or Highschool state games the is our spot, it's home away from home. The apartments are always clean and we have everything we need. I have other friends who always stay here also. We always return home to lake buena vista resort when we are in Orlando. The location is great, great,great, did i mention the location was great?! I always tell my friends about this Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: Stewpot706
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at these apartments, I was only there for three nights and didn't use all facilities however I was very impressed. Our room was a three bedroom with two bathrooms, was spotlessly clean and seemed to be well equipped for self catering, even including a large tumble dryer which was handy for swim wear and towels. A good hint would be to take your own beach towels as the ones provided for the pool area are tiny and rather thin and rough. The pool area was lovely though and I was very jealous of those there with their children as I was in a work related trip! The huge pirate ship feature and fountains would add extra interest for kids.it was plenty big enough as not many guests around but would guess may get a bit busy in high season. The apartments are well placed for disney and it was nice to be away from the tacky International Drive area but it is a little further out if you are visiting universal studios parks and I would def. recommend a car as there was little choice of eating places close by. I would definitely stay here with my family if I was visiting Disney

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: lisa a
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this place and it was great the only problem was we did'nt have long enough there as we moved from another place and finished our holiday at lake buena vista Would 100% stay here again as it has everything you need

Reviews.Title: “Turner family”
Reviews.Author: Anthony T
Reviews.Content: We Have just returned from a fabulous time in Orlando and our stay at lake Buena vista hotel and spa was amazing. The rooms were superb and spotlessly clean, very spacious, had block 5 on the 11 th floor with a firework view which was amazing. The staff are so friendly nothing is to much trouble for them (thanks Andrea on reception) for looking after us!! This hotel is smack bang in the middle of everything, I can't find anything bad to say it was five star and recommend this hotel to anyone!! We will definitely be returning back here on our next visit!!!!!! Thanks for making it so memorable for me and my family xxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Gret place to stay - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Donna S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa from Nov 3-12 and loved it. We checked trip advisor before we booked and felt satisfied by what we read. We did request building 5 as it is closest to the pirate pool. I never even saw the other pool as the pirate pool was just so convenient. The room was basically your own apartment. We booked the two bedroom. It had a full kitchen, laundry closet, livingroom, dining area, balcony, 2 bedrooms and two full sized baths. I spoke to the front desk about in fact that we needed internet (as my husband was still partially working while on holidays) They put us on the fifth floor as you tend to lose wifi internet the further you go up. Internet on the ipod was fine but on the laptop it was not so good. No problem though just requested a cord and all was good. The room was clean (and I am picky). The only suggestion I would make to the management would be to provide extra blankets in the room and I don't know why but the king sheets did not seem to fit the bed too well. Location wise it is close and convenient to everything. We rented a car but the hotel does have a shuttle to Disney. If we were to go back again this is the place I would stay and I would recommend it to anyone looking.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Raul G
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa very much. Everything was very clean and well taken care of. The room was spotless. The balcony was very spacious. The pool area was fun for the kids. The convenience store in the next building was a life saver. It is very close to Disney, which is the reason we were in Lake Buena Vista. NEGATIVES: not enough parking and the sign off of the main road was not very well lit. Overall, this is a great place to stay and we'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa”
Reviews.Author: Hardy12375
Reviews.Content: I am pleased to say that for me to book a holiday at short notice and without much time to spare, I looked on Trip Advisor to give me peace of mind. The reviews of this resort lived up to what had been reported. I am always apprehensive of arriving at a resort and being disappointed, on the contrary, this resort was beautifully clean and well equipped kitchen, bathroom, laundrey facilities with Tumble Dryer. A bonus was to also have complimentary washing powder, washing up liquid, dish washer tablets. There is no electric kettle but a hob kettle as I understand this is because it is not the American culture to drink tea. The view as requested over looked (albeit at a distance of a few miles the Disney Park so that it was possible to see the firework displays). The staff were all very helpful and be advised to not buy postage stamps at the Pizza Hut local to the resort as they charge $1.15 per stamp to send cards home to England. Buy them for 80 cents at the Supermarkets such as Walmart which is literally just around the corner from the resort. The resort for us was perfectly distanced from the hussle and bustle of Down Town Disney. The only cautionary observation was that the room overlooked a busy main road but quite honestly the slight noise is not an issue as generally speaking the doors and windows would be shut to maintain the air conditioning. I did ask for a room on a higher level and if you haven't a head for heights then ask for something around the floor 4 or 5 mark.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely time and would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Tuffymuffet
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very easy to find. We were upgraded to a two bed apartment, which was comfortably furnished. Didn't think too much of Irish Pub (over priced) for what they served up. Plenty of other good restaurants within a short drive to the Old Town. We would definitely return to this hotel in the future. To finish the holiday my wife had a glorious massage in the Hotel Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, couldnt have been happier!!”
Reviews.Author: alisha6687
Reviews.Content: We are very sad today is our last day at Lake Buena Vista Resort, We have enjoyed every minute of our stay and wish we had booked more time to stay and relax. Lake Buena Vista Resort has been a VERY relaxing, quiet, and extremely clean stay. It's like we had our own private condo as we stayed in the 2 bedroom suite. When we walked in the doors we were so impressed with our next days ahead to enjoy every moment of our stay.
