We had a fully equiped kitchen, Washer & Dryer, Huge living area, dining area, Master bed with a huge jacuzzi and a balcony overlooking the pool. We stayed here on our honeymoon and we couldnt have picked a better place. Lake Buena Vista was reffered to us by a friend who previously stayed as well and she enjoyed just as much. We cant wait to come back again and this time we will bring some familys with us to enjoy with their children. Thank you for everything... I would reccomend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a stay near Disney or just a vacation to come relax and put your feet up.... Lake Buena Vista is the place to stay :)

Reviews.Title: “We never tire of visiting this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jane33763
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple visited Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa this past week-end while attending Epcot's Food and Wine Festival. We are repeat customers to this hotel whenever we come to Orlando. We enjoy the very large bedrooms, jacuzzi, living room, separate dining area, complete kitchen with washer and dryer and patio. The price for what you get is amazing! We have stayed in traditional hotel rooms before, of course, and always come back to Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa for its cleanliness, spaciousness, and quality pricing. The landscaping on the property is pristine as well. This hotel is always #1 in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Annie H
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Lake Buena Vista Resort - friendly helpful staff, clean rooms, great view, fun for all in the pool. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Disney Retreat”
Reviews.Author: rsulliva
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific resort that provides apartment-style units at bargain prices. It's only 15 minute drive to any of the Disney parks. There is a restaurant-pub (2-star at best), a convenience store, and a pirate-themed pool area on the property. A 24-hour Walmart five minutes down the highway makes it easy to lay in supplies when you want to get away from all the Disney. The units are clean, comfortable and well-appointed. Furnishings are a little old and faded but who cares? A full size fridge and stove made it possible to have most dinners at home. Some people want to go all-Disney-all-the-time. We don't. By the end of a long day at the parks, being able to come home and have a light supper of soup, eggs, pasta, or the like, made it possible for us to get up and start over again the next morning. Important to note that rooms are not serviced on a daily basis. We liked that as we could just live in the unit for the week without anyone traipsing in. It was no problem to empty the garbage in the hallway, and the en-suite washer and dryer meant you could wash your own linens and towels if you wanted to. You can pay extra for cleaning services if you want. The resort is right beside a lower-end outlet mall. Handy if you find out you forgot to pack a bathing suit, or the weather changes suddenly. The staff is very courteous and helpful. I complained about a ceiling fan that rattled and they came to fix it right away. The concierge staff could be a bit more conscientious. You kinda have to push them to help and they can make some pretty colossal errors. I asked for a printed out map of directions to a theme restaurant and they sent me totally the wrong way. We realized later that they inputted the wrong address into Google Maps. Thank goodness for iPhone's GPS. We toured a Disney resort and came out absolutely confirmed that we made the right choice. While the resort was much higher end and right in the park, all that Disney was too much. The food at the resort was grim, and the pool area nowhere near as good for kids. I guess it depends on how you want to travel, but having a comfortable, accessible, and private space where you can get away from Disney was very important to us. And the price cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, fun family resort.”
Reviews.Author: jama d
Reviews.Content: This resort's atmosphere and amenities were a nice break from Disney craziness during a recent three-day weekend. Our 3 kids (ages 9, 5 and 4) loved the huge, resort-style pirate pool, water slide and organized kids' activities. We enjoyed the hot tubs, poolside sports bar and the fact that the kids were having fun, making new friends, etc. We had the 2 BR, 2BA in bldg. 3. The rooms were very clean and very nice, kitchen was well-equipped, beds were comfy and staff was responsive. We brought groceries and saved money by cooking our own meals. Upon discovering that the can opener was broken, we called the front desk and they promptly brought a new one, along with extra towels, blankets, etc. Note: This is not a traditional hotel. That's why there's a washer/dryer combo. Laundry is up to you. As for us, we appreciated being able to go back home with suitcases full of clean clothes. We chose LBV for its proximity to Disney but found many more reasons to like it. We hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you had no other choice.”
Reviews.Author: Navdon
Reviews.Content: The inconvenience started at the front desk, the receptionist took a long time to get us checked. This was also in part because she there were a lot of people checking in at that time. She finally got us checked in, but when I put my key to the door, it would not work. I then proceeded to go back to the check in desk to report the problem. I soon find out that the key does not work because I was given the wrong room assignment. I proceeded to move my family and our luggage into another building across the street. This after flying from Seattle, my family and I were exhausted. When we get to the right room, we find the security guard loungig on the couch. The room also smelled like cigarettes. And wifi was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable.”
Reviews.Author: buckeroo1
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. The staff is remarkably accommadating and I would not want to stay in any other hotel. Great pool. Off the path yet not a trap. It is so worth it and all your ? Are answerwed by the great people that work there. I can't wait til next year to get back here. Don't hesitate 2 come here. This is. Hakunna matadda

Reviews.Title: “Vaction Rental”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: It was 25 wedding Anniversary get away. We could asked for a better room. The view was awesome. the bed very comfortable. The room had everything we needed and more. It felt like home. Room was very clean.The staff was very help full.We wished could have stayed longer.The Iris Pub was fun . Even the outlet mall was fun to shop. Will recamend to my friends. Will look at staying here in the future

Reviews.Title: “First Rate”
Reviews.Author: gatorgal100
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. Grounds are like a theme park with a beautiful pool. We stayed in Bldg. 5 in a 3 bedroom suite. We had rented a 2 bedroom, but when we checked in they upgraded us to a 3 bedroom. They had put us first in a room over the pub and after seeing that we were just ladies by ourselves, they changed the room saying that sometimes over the pub could get a little noisy. This was much appreciated, our room was so quiet. Master bedroom has a jacquzzi tub. We were only there over night, and understand that on longer stays you have to pay to have your room cleaned and sheets changed. Very convenient location off I-4 and near the Disney area. Shopping outlet is adjacent to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug free, great place, great stay..minutes from all parks”
Reviews.Author: Melimess
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying my husband and I found this place after realizing being cramped on a Disney resort was not our thing. I found LBV 3 years ago and we loved it! We came back for a second stay 2 years ago and now this past week we stayed after convincing family not to stay on the Disney resort but to try this place out. They were a little hesitant to give it a try but after much convincing and pricing..they gave in. For the deals you can find on this hotel, you get a great deal. We had the 3 bedroom 3 bath in building 2. Both king size bedrooms have a whirlpool jacuzzi in it. Very spacious, kitchen, washer, dryer,..etc. The description says it all. Upon arriving..very warm friendly check in...absolutely NO bugs..including a Bed Bug inspection because they are in lots of hotels now a days, clean rooms and a nice feel. I saw some people complain about the rugs but what can you do?? I have a 2 year old and they spill things..it happens. They are not the worst rugs and I'm sure you've seen worse. I don't understand why people are complaining about the beds since everyone in my party had amazing sleeps. Anything you need is at the walmart down the block...enough said. I'm writing this review because everyone in my party was not on board at all for this resort and upon checkout...everyone thanked me and LOVED this place. My parents are coming back and staying here, we will be here again and my brother will be using it also. The only regret we have is not having enough time there to take advantage of the pirate pool this time. Too many parks to squeeze in this trip in a short time. Thanks again LBV for a great stay..thank you Jean for being friendly..it really helps. Hopefully we can see you sooner then waiting another year!

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: SimonSpeakeasy
Reviews.Content: Room size was large (we had a 2-bedroom 'suite') and the kitchen fairly well-equiped, but the decor was all rather faded. It's worth noting that the rooms are *not* serviced. We were there for 9 days but you had to pay extra to get the sheets changed or the room cleaned. I wasn't overly impressed about this. Despite asking for a room with a view, what we got was a room overlooking the road outside. Not a huge drama, but given the choice . . . This also made the balcony sub-optimal as a place to sit and eat/drink. Shuttle bus times to the theme parks were limited to 1 per day (pickup was about 0940). And in one case the time was not good - the park closed at 1700 & the bus did not come until 1930 One of the biggest issues was the pool. The visit was at the end of October, so although the weather wasn't exactly cold, it wasn't that warm either. The problem was that the pool was COLD. Nice hot Jacuzzi though. Overall. 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: APP2MXJ
Reviews.Content: large rooms, well equipped kitchen, building 5 has proximity to pool and covered parking - additional advantages at no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean, however no cleaning services. A one bedroom for four people is pushing it tho.”
Reviews.Author: ScubaJoolie
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded from a one bedroom to a two bedroom for three people and it was perfect. However, they say that a one bedroom is good for up to four people, which I think would have been quite crowded. No cleaning services, which was suprising. $15 for a quick clean, more for sheets, towels, etc. There's a washer and dryer in the suite which is awesome! But for the price, it was just great, and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality beds”
Reviews.Author: S B
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for a discount price on Groupon. We checked into a room and had to change rooms because the room smelled of cigarette smoke. The beds and pillows are very uncomfortable. They are HARD and stiff. My back and neck was killing me after I woke up. I will not stay here next time. Internet is slow and you have to reset your lap top multiple times due to poor internet connection even though the computer says you have full strength. There is limited TV stations and some of the major tv stations (hbo) are not there. They do not provide measuring cups in the kitchen. You have to pay for cleaning service. The ship in the pool is nice, and there is one big hot tub and two little hot tubs. There is a parking garage you can park in and take your stuff straight to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MIke W
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in a 3 bedroom suite last December. The suite was very reasonable and very comfortable. Centrally located to everything we wanted to do! We enjoyed it so much that we are returning this December. We were very impressed with the customer service we received on check in and throughout our stay. Especially Trish who went out of her way to take care of us. Thank you, Trish!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...Period!”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin851
Reviews.Content: The post by "cockles52” (3 below this one) is not worth the read. They have no clue what they are talking about. We just spent 8 nights with 3 kids and two adults. We had a three bedroom 12 floor, 5 Building. My parents had a two bed room, and my sister had a two bedroom also. So that's 9 in total. Sure the carpet may need to be upgraded in the halls, but so what. That's the only issue we had. But guess what, we spent all of our time offsite, enjoying Disney not the Condo. The condo itself however, was well maintained, and had everything we needed. We had a big family dinner, with only 6 settings and nobody died. We are all okay. There were no swings or play area for the kids, but I never saw that on the website. Oh and did I mention we were in the BIGGEST playground in the world. Not sure if Cockles52 missed it, but Disney is just down the road. This place was fantastic, like all the other posts speak of on this review site. Everything we needed and more. It's a pillow, a TV and a place to store my beer until I leave the next morning to hit the Parks. I have been to Orlando 7 times and this was the best place we ever stayed....PERIOD! If you want to stay at the Ritz, go there. They have a great website that defines the whole accommodation experience, so there is not need to take legal action. Don’t you think by going that far you just put a damper on your kids once and a lifetime vacation? Just saying. I would have slept in my car just to see my kids faces when we visited the parks. Priceless!!!! As for the slide, LBV resort mandates a staff member at the slide the every time it is open for safety. It's awesome, I went on it too! Nobody bothered us, ever. We actually made friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: bmelo
Reviews.Content: We actually had an excellent time at LBVresort. Being a party of 3 the 2 bedroom suite was more than enough. The full kitchen, washer and dryer proved very helpful. The location is absolutely convenient, close to I-drive, Downtown Disney and Disney Parks. Cleanliness was the only drawback, but not a major one: When I checked in I found two half eaten pizza slices left over the balcony table. The room was OK though. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Pub nearby is actually nice and the LBV outlet stores that are part of the complex are also OK. The swimming pool is great (better in the morning. In the afternoon it is shaded by both towers 4 and 5). Overall it was definitely worth the money and I'll certainly return if prices and servcies are kept at the same level.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad- and there was no ugly!”
Reviews.Author: Sandienyc
Reviews.Content: My husband’s job often sends him to Orlando for conferences. In the past ten years we have been to Orlando around 10 times and we have stayed at a lot of hotels -Boardwalk, Yacht & Beach, JW Marriott, Port Orleans, to name a few. I’ve always said that if we were paying ourselves I would not stay at a Disney or high end property as there are lots of deals to be had. I booked The Buena Vista Resort for a long weekend, with the criteria being that I was looking for a great pool and a 2 bedroom unit at a good price. After reading lots of reviews I booked the 2 bedroom unit with a fireworks view at a great price, I watched the price on line and it was reduced, I called the hotel and they were happy to reduce my price so the deal even got better. As our trip approached some of the reviews were very critical and I was a bit worried. I’m not sure what those people were complaining about!!! It’s not perfect but for the price….I could not have been happier. The pool was great, not crowded, and 3 hot tubs so if one were busy it seemed that there was always one free. Bar right at the pool to have a drink and some snacks- the food is not great but if your hungry they have a few things. We had a room on the 14th floor so we have the extended balcony- everyone loved the room, the kids enjoyed having their own room and TV, my husband and I enjoyed the hot tub in our room after a long day in the park. Our 2 bedroom unit had 3 TV’s and 2 baths, a full kitchen with unexpected equipment like a blender, electric can opener and such. The kitchen had everything you would need to make a simple meal. The only thing we could have used would be coffee filters- but we did not request any. One thing I read on tripadvisor is the sheet issue- for the king bed the sheets did not fit. I find this point a bit frustrating as its been reported on tripadvisor numerous times, management must be aware of it. I called the front desk and they promptly brought up new sheets that fit, so they do HAVE sheets that fit. The front desk acted as if they had never heard this issue with the sheets before which I found a little strange but, whatever, the issue was taken care of quickly. The beds were not the softest, but adequate. The shower in the master bath had terrible water pressure, I took a shower in the second bathroom which had very good pressure so it was not an issue. We did not use the cleaning service and did not miss it. Parking was ample all day, we had no issues. The pool was open until 10pm which I appreciated after getting back from the parks. One thing I would advise is not to pay extra for the “fireworks” view- the fireworks are really far in the distance, you probably will not be in your room at the exact time the fireworks are going off and honestly I did not appreciate the view or sound of the highway which is the ‘view’ you will see most of the time, next time I would probably prefer a pool view. Critical reviewers mentioned wear and tear- I did not think it excessive, the hallways could use some new carpet- but in our room I felt the carpet was in reasonable shape. One thing I should mention is the wireless signal is terrible, if you have work to do and rely on a steady computer signal you will be frustrated as it keeps dropping off. I went to the lobby and tried to use the computers offered but they wanted to charge me something like $2.95 per minute which I did not appreciate. They do allow you use of the computer and printer for free when checking in with your airline and printing barding passes. So it was not perfect but I think a great hotel for the price. We have paid double the amount at Disney hotels for one room with 2 double beds. At Buena Vista we were able to spread out and relax in our room. I would recommend this hotel, for families I suggest requesting buildings 3, 4 or 5 which are close to the pirate ship pool. Buildings 1 and 2 are across the parking lot and near the quiet pool which might be better for guests without children. I would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Both good and average”
Reviews.Author: MTLC1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in October 2011, a family of 4 with 2 children aged 9 and 4. We had a great time. This is our 3rd visit to Orlando and we have previously stayed in Villa's so this was something new for us. We decided to stay here as it was more of a resort style and with our eldest son being 9, we thought he would appreciate some interaction with other kids his age. Also on our last visit we also decided we wanted somewhere more central rather than having a half hour drive to the parks. So firstly the good. The location really is fantastic. Expect no more than a 10 minute drive to any of the parks (other than Busch gardens obviously) Sea World, Wet N Wild, Aquatica, Universal and Disney can all be reached with a very quick hop in the car. There are also 2 large discount malls - one within a short walking distance, the other a 5 minute drive. The pool area is great. My youngest can't quite swim yet and there was plenty of paddling areas for her to splash in and a surprisingly fast slide in the pirate ship to keep my son occupied for hours. The pool is warm and clean. The Jacuzzi’s (of which there are three) were a bit too hot! The pool area is a great place to finish off a hard day at the parks and my kids were always playing with other kids. The rooms are perfectly adequate. The bedrooms are big and the pictures available on this site accurately reflect exactly what you get. There are washing machines, dryers, dishwashers, a well equipped kitchen, a very big spa bath and probably the biggest shower I have ever been in. The balcony will also sit 4 people comfortably. We were only awoken once, at 3 am with a very noisy party above us. We phoned reception to complain and the party finished 5 minutes later. The front desk were very helpful on each occasion that we sought their advice. Secondly the average. We stayed on the 5th floor of building 5 (which I understand is the newest of the blocks) I thought it looked a little tired. Having previously stayed in Villa's that have had the 'wow' factor our apartment did not. I would also like to have seen a parental lock on the door to the balcony. With a resort that will attract parents with young children we were surprised that this was not a standard feature. The question for me in conclusion would be if I went again would I stay in a Villa or here. Well there are good and bad for both but I would stay here again over a villa.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Sarah011968
Reviews.Content: This resort offers excellant value for money and is ideal for young families - we were very impressed with the standards of the units. We have stayed here several times in the past and will definitely be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place, Perfect Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth M
Reviews.Content: Just took my new family of four to Orlando for a theme park getaway. Stayed at the LBV Resort in a 3BR suite in Bldg. 5, which apparently is the newest building. Our room overlooked the pool with a spectacular view from an upper floor. Accomodations were perfect for a family on the go. Furnishings were in great shape and the gorgeous kitchen and washer/dryer were ideal for our needs. Toiletries and laundry detergent were an unexpected and welcome surprise. We loved the location away from the hustle & bustle of the parks, and the staff was extremely warm and helpful. The pool is a drawing card unto itself. Pure Fun! And don't pass up the spa if you have a chance. The service was excellent and the rates very reasonable This is obviously a very popular resort, because good parking spots close to the room were tough to find at night! The only hiccup in our entire weekend was we never got facecloths with our bath towels, even after calling housekeeping. But with all the LBV Resort has to offer, it wasn't worth complaining. I travel a lot, and I definitely would bring my family there again whenever we return to Orlando on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Orlando!!!”
Reviews.Author: MFKsmom
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa when my husband went to a medical conference and have returned every year since for business and vacations. The rooms are very clean, large and have every amenity that we need. There is also restaurants and a big outlet mall next to the hotel, and free shuttle service to tourists attractions. The rooms have internet service. It is like home away from home with the washer/dryer, fully equipped kitchen, lovely dinnette area, living room bedrooms, awesome bathrooms (one with a large jaccuzzi and an extremely large shower. The pool area is fantastic with the ship/slide that my son looks forward to going on all the time. Special thanks to the wonderful staff, especially Trish, Jean, Eric and Matt who were constantly friendly and always promptly helped us with all of our needs during our stay there. We highly recommend Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa to everyone : ) !!!!!!!! C. Kubacki & family

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: Talk about convenience! The Irish pub, convenience store (with Pizza Hut Express) and outlet mall all within quick and easy walking distance. We reserved a 3-bedroom suite and the accommodations were clean, spacious, and cozy. The parks are close by and fairly straightforward to get to using nearby I-drive. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “My Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Shanna B
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa since they opened five years ago. I book a block of rooms in November for Florida Classic Weekend. Every year, someone new joins our group is is sold on this resort. I love this place and can't wait to see them in two weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MSNM
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families and/or groups. The size of the bedrooms and living areas was perfect. The 2-bedroom unit can accommodate 6 people comfortably. The kitchen and washer/dryer stackable makes a longer stay more manageable. The swimming pool, complete with pirate ship and slide, makes this resort even more fun. I recommend you bring your own pool towels as the ones provided are very small. Also, make use of the complimentary shuttle from the hotel to Epcot Center. Very comfortable, reliable service. Oh yeah, and check out the Irish Pub across the street (i think that's Bldg 1). Really nice restaurant with a great vibe and good food. Will return to LBV Resort Village & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Goldenisles7
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom suite in Building 5 overlooking the pool. It was our 50th anniversary and the staff could not have been nicer. We had a lovely gift in our room from the staff and management which was great. Trips to Disney Parks was easy and quick. Super clean suite and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: Nina K
Reviews.Content: We had 3 bedroom 8th floor St. Lucia suite in building 1. The condo was very spaceous and clean. We loved it! We had a lovely large balcony facing LBV Factory Stores and flat TVs in every room. Kids loved the pool area and so did adults. The staff was friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Best location but bad management”
Reviews.Author: Texas2211
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days, location was super close to Disney and had restaurants and store on site, tiki bar food was horrible was from microwave and charge fee for this service, Irish pub had great service and food, the little store had everything any one could ever need, lady and guy in store were very helpfull to us and very friendly with our 8 month old baby and 6 yr old, bath room in our room had meldew so I came to front desk and women manager with white blonde hair little older came to talk to me, her eyes were red and smelled of acohol she didn't resolve my issue, overall the hotel was what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “The best part of our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Alanna G
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband, and our kids tried this place out for the first time after a friend had reccomended it to us (she is also a travel agent) so we were pretty excited. we got to the hotel around 1pm after a long drive from GA. Check in was at 4, but the girl checking us in by the name of trish was able to get us a room that was ready for us to move into!! She also gave us a FREE pool view, (which was about $10 extra per night) but she said after a long drive we deserved it. The room was exceptionally clean. We were in building three on the 12th floor. The furniture was fine, all kitchen appliances seemed new. The couch was a little outdated, but that was it. No worse than mine at home! Pool was the next thing we ventured out to. Kids LOVED the slide. Relaxing music. just great! Went to see the concierge (who works for expedia and not the hotel) about some tickets. she had long light brown hair, i think her name was jen? She was quite rude with a guest who didnt spead very good english in front of us. poor women just wanted to inquire about the shuttle but the cocnierge was so frustrated, and so mean. This turned me off. I ended up buying tickets from AAA office, much cheaper than what I was quoted at anyways. I wish the hotel sold tickets! Rather buy them from the front desk staff then expedia rep. Checked out threedays later around 12pm. Avery at the checkout had given me a late one!! (we needed it). After packing, Avery and matt, helped me sort my bill out. I forgot I ordered tiki bar drinks (apparently one too many haha) but I was so happy with the convenience of being able to do that. Who wants to bring cash and wallets and purses down to a pool anyways? This was a great stay, the front desk staff I dealt with was the cream of the crop. (concierge jen not so much) Pool was the best pool I have ever encountered at a resort, almost as good as a theme park pool! the rooms were clean, the grounds were lovely. will be coming back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jamie D
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel last week and loved it. Our check in was very easy and the person assisting us (Trish) was was very friendly and helpful. My son told her that it was his birthday and later in the day she sent him a card wishing him a happy birthday and some snacks to our room! We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in building 3. The room was great, plenty of space and everything that you need on vacation. The kitchen had a toaster, coffeemaker, and other appliances. The washer and dryer worked well and was very convenient to have in the room. They do supply you with small box of tide, but if you need more there are several stores nearby. We went to Magic Kingdom, Universal Studios and Downtown Disney during our trip and they were all easy to get to and not too far. We did not visit the mall in front of the hotel, but it looked pretty nice. We would definitely stay again and look forward to our next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: samlydia
Reviews.Content: Just got back from weekend stay at Lake Buena Vistat Resort. Got this place through Hotwire for great price for 2Br/2Ba condo but was still apprehensive because I have never heard of this place. Location is a little out but not terrible you must have a car to get around. Kitchen was very nice and master bedroom was good but we were given handicapped room so master bathroom was completely open so no privacy and no shower door. Just felt wrong for us to be in handicapped room. Second bathroom was good and balcony was good. Now 2nd bedroom was not so hot for two 18yr olds who are both 6ft and above, they have twin beds in this room so they were not comfortable at all in those beds. Pool was nice but it was too cool for us to get in. We have stayed at Floridays and Hilton Grand Vacation so this hotel misses on the extras that they bring but overall this stay is ok,average. We got what we paid for

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if your with a group!”
Reviews.Author: Joe D
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando for a wedding. As we are all young couples, we tried to keep our costs down. We also wanted to stay near each other, and still have a fun time over the weekend. This seemed perfect; enough room for the entire group, close to the wedding, and at a price that wouldn't break the bank. It was pretty darn close to the best hotel experience I have ever had. The washer-dryer, full ironing setup, and ample closets were perfect as we were traveling with formal wear. There was plenty of space to get ready, as we were likely to stumble over one another in a smaller place. The staff was very helpful, the rooms were clean. We didn't need room or housekeeping services, so you really couldn't beat what we got for the money we spent. Just be aware if you do expect those things, its a bit extra. We will absolutely consider coming back, especially if we go as a group. The property is well maintained, and I felt safe walking to my car at 1AM. There are some Orlando hotels where I can definitely say that is not the case.I have no reason but to give Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa my full endorsement!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ! Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nanauskange
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 9 days vacation and stayed at this hotel. This was our "10th" trip to Disney and so far this is our favorite hotel. Great location, close to everything. Room: lots of space, really good size room and bathroom, always had hot water. Living room and kitchen area excellent. For you who's wondering whats included in the kitchen: dishes, ustenstils, coffee maker, wine opener, cans opener, pots, pans, dishclothes, plastic bowls, juice jug, mixer etc ... (see photos) and if you need something, Walmart if just across the road. My kids loved the pool, it was heated (but not enought for me ahahah) They also have a second pool who's more quiete. No maid service, it;s A la carte service: 5.00$ for change of towels and garbagge remove. Did not have the time to try the spa ... was surprise they have a lots of activities for kids: movie night by the pool etc... and never had to wait a long time for the elevator. Just positive thing to say about this hotel, We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “We Love This Place...”
Reviews.Author: Robin1164
Reviews.Content: We will never rent a hotel room again now that we've stayed in this huge condo. It was 2 bedrooms and was lovely. The check in was easy - no crowd- and when I asked for building 5, they accomodated us with no problem and even gave us "fireworks view". All no extra charge. We got an excellent hotwire rate. The condo had a beautiful masterbath with jacuzzi tub (huge) and separate shower (huge), We were all pleased. Building 5 had underground free parking with a quick ride right up to the room - very convenient. This place is attaced to a factory outlet mall which we went to but didn't care for. Frankie Farrel's is an irish pub we ate at. Fish n Chips were good. The Condo's are a few miles from a 24 hr Walmart that also carries a boatload of Disney Souvenirs at a much reasonable price! You do need a car to get around from here but it is close too all attractions 10 - 20 min away for everything. The pool at bldg 5 has the pirate ship- pool was nice as were the 3 hot tubs. Our kids (older teens) had a blast playing pool, swimimming, hot tub, videogames, etc... There is a pizza hut express on the property and it was good. It was very quiet there--never heard any neighbors...The furniture was nice, the people were nice and the spa looked great with good prices and specials. We would definately stay here again! Loved it! The kitchen was well equipped right down to a corkscrew!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Michele T
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this property. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was huge and boasted amenities like a whirlpool tub and granite countertops. Maid service is not included unless you pay extra, but we knew that ahead of time, and the price of the room was more than reasonable. The front desk was very helpful with extra towels or other necessities when needed. The location was perfect, only 10 minutes from Walt Disney and very accessable to everything.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions weren't good.....however”
Reviews.Author: Bart S
Reviews.Content: This hotel would've received a higher rating from me if it hadn't been for a horrifying check-in. Upon our arrival, after driving 17 hours, we were told OUR room wasn't ready. I emphasize OUR because the second half of our party, who had driven down as well, got in their room immediately. We had asked for early check-in, however, the front desk didn't have any record of our request..oh well. This extra time allowed us to visit the pool bar, very nice. The drinks were well poured and the bartender, I believe his name was Steven, was very accommodating and friendly. Added bonus for the pool area...all Jimmy Buffett all the time. Upon a third check to see if our room was ready we were again told no....but wait...one of the other front desk folks whose name alludes me, intervened and found not one, but several rooms we could have. The girl who was working with us (the same girl who had informed us our room wasn't ready before) finished our check-in and sent us on our way. Again, I don't recall her name, however, she looks like Madison Pettis (Sophie) of Cory in the House. Anyway, once we arrived at our room, bags in hand, we inserted the key, got a green light, turned the handle, and......the thingy that prevents the door from opening all the way stopped us in our tracks. At this point the person actually occupying the room rushed to the door, visibly shaken, informing us in a loud voice that someone was already in the room. Needless to say my wife, my mother, my sister, my daughter, and I were beyond embarrassed. I immediately went to the front desk and asked for the manager. The manager, a very nice young man with a very thin beard(?) immediately went to work to rectify the situation. He apologized over and over and insisted on accompanying me back to my family with keys to another room. I am happy to say that this room was guest-free. The room itself was very nice. It was clean and spacious and a welcomed comfort for weary travelers. The rest or our stay was nice, and event free until the last morning. The morning of our check-out was going along just fine until I made the mistake of asking the woman behind the bar at the pool for some ketchup. We had made breakfast in our room that morning and my daughter wanted some ketchup for her potatoes. I went downstairs to the pool bar, where I believe they serve breakfast every morning, and asked for some ketchup. The woman behind the bar's reaction went like this....."we're not supposed to give this stuff out" (this stuff being ketchup packets) and very rudely slammed ONE packet of ketchup down on the bar in front of me. As she slammed the packet down she immediately turned and walked away before I had a chance to thank her for the ONE packet of ketchup. All-in-all this hotel is very nice and the staff very accommodating, however, based on the two not so small hiccups I couldn't give it higher rating. Will we return? I don't know. We are supposed to return to Orlando in January or February and we haven't made up our minds where we intend to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome HHN trip”
Reviews.Author: xUselessDelusion
Reviews.Content: Basically this was a short weekend trip to go to Halloween Horror Nights at Universal Studios. We wanted a bigger place since it was two couples and a fifth wheeler. the two bedroom, two bathroom room was more than ampule space. The place was very clean and every staff that we encountered was super friendly. What else more could you want? Well there was one little issue with not being able to pick up wifi from my phone in the room, but other that it was smooth sailing. I've been going to HHN for the last 5 years and this place has been my favorite so far. Also don't forget to check out the pirate ship slide. It's goes faster than you think.

Reviews.Title: “It will suit your requirements, but dont expect too much!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren H
Reviews.Content: The hotel was reasonably clean and generally comfortable. My party consisted of 4 adults and 2 children. We stayed in a 3 bed apartment on the 15th floor. I was slightly concerned prior to arrival as some reviews has reported mould and worn / damaged furniture. I am pleased to say that I didn’t encounter any of these. The actual suite had the air of a well used holiday let. The carpets were well trodden, there were marks on the walls, the lounge area coffee table was chipped round the edges were I suspect it had been used as a footstall by previous guests. That said the suite was clean and the towels and bed linen were clean and fresh. On the subject of bed linen, on the two double beds the fitted sheet was too small and did keep pinging off during the night, which is undesirable. I didn’t report it to reception so there is no way of knowing whether they could have provided larger bed sheets had I asked. The master suite was of an open plan design, including the toilet area which offered no privacy if you needed the facility during the night! Definitely not ideal! This could be because we were staying in an adapted apartment for disabled guests. There was the family bathroom that could be used as an alternative, but does somewhat defeat the idea of an en-suite. It may be worth clarifying with reception when you check in. The kitchen area is reasonable. It does not seem designed for guests to cook an evening meal, more to prepare a light breakfast. It lacked work surface space. It was stocked with pots pans and all the basic kitchen equipment you would expect to find. The balcony offered a reasonable view, and patio furniture was provided. The communal areas of the hotel are cleaned daily and are spotlessly clean, if a little shabby in places. This is excluding the reception which is immaculate and belies the rest of the hotel somewhat. The hotel reception and the concierge staff were polite and knowledgeable. I personally did not go in the main pool, but I did accompany my party to poolside. The main pool is open from 7am to 10 pm daily. The pool is definitely designed for a children / family perspective, which suited us, but might not suit couples. The galleon ship is actually a single water slide. There is a much smaller second pool. All pool facilities were clean and well maintained. The pool bar provides drinks and refreshments, but is rather costly, and you are not permitted to take your own refreshments to poolside. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi which you have to register for at reception. While this facility is there is is sometimes hard to to get a signal on the 15th floor of the 3rd block. From a location perspective, this hotel is ideally suited if you have a family with impatient children as you are literally 5 minute drive from the main Disney road network, and only about a 10 – 12 minute drive from the Seaworld area and International Drive. There is a main shopping outlet area immediately over the road which you can walk through to from the hotel. Wal-mart is a 3 – 4 minute drive away. There is a resturant, Frankie Farrells opposite which serves Irish / british style food - with an American take on it. Its a bit pricey but good quality, though the resturant does lack atmosphere. The shuttle bus service only operates at limited times to selected parks, so it not ideal as the only transportation link. It is however easy to book and arrives and departs punctually. Ideally you do need your own hire car. Overall I would probably recommend this hotel for families, but probably not for couples. However it is fairly expensive, and you can get better facilities for less money, but this can be offset against time spent travelling to and from attractions. If you dont expect frills and fancies, then you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull resport”
Reviews.Author: Sherridan7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 17 days in September 2011 so good I have booked 17 days in May 2012 had a wonderfull time appartment are wonderful, clean, big, everything you need so much more than a hotel room, location is exellent for everything.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Alison B
Reviews.Content: just back from lbv and had a fab time , the appartment was spotless and had everything you could need . washing mashine and tumble was ace as was the pool and irish pub . only small negative was the shuttle busses were only at scheduled times and if you miss them you have to taxi it , but do not use the taxis that are at the reception at the hotel as they are very expensive and there is a checker cab stand over the road at the outlets which are half the price , which we didnt realise untill we had spent a fortune !!! would deffo recomend this place as it is so close to everything and the staff were very friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SMIRF44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in april for two weeks Lake Buena Fista did not dissapoint... I requested to be in building 5 and not too high up on there webpage and they did exactley as i requested. The reception was lovely and the lady was friendly .. Condo was amazing and so big with 3 beds and two bathrooms main bedroom haveing large bathroom in it which includes seperate toilet and super large shower and amazing hot tub which was used everynight after a long day in parks...every thing was availiable fully stocked kitchen and tumble dryer, washing machine which both were used most days...we were overlooking the pirate ship pool lovely view..the conciage was also fab and extremley helpful best to go early as he /she does get busy .went to frankie ofarels couple nights ... the shop was ok for basics like milk bread but very expensive...there is a walmart about 5 minutes down the road just turn left at the entrance...we did not hire a car so used the free shuttle.this has to be booked the day before for parks so they know how many people are going .. advised to get there early in the morning as a lot of people also use the shuttle and you have to pick up the bus ticket at reception before you can board the buss... we had a few problems in the morning with not enough busses to pick us all up so they had to get taxis for us and once not being picked up from parks till late but this was the only problem with this hotel...hopefully this maybe sorted a bit better now. shopping centre is good to look around. All in all the place was amazing and we had a brill time so i highly recommend staying at this wonderful hotel......

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a anyone heading to the Parks or outlet shopping”
Reviews.Author: ILoveStars28
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed at a condo type lodging before so we were a little skeptical as to what it involved. Upon check-in we were very pleased. We stayed in building 5 on the 6th floor. Our patio view was a wood area and we could see some of the outlets at an angle. The condo was clean and appealing to the eye. The kitchen was spacious and had granite-like tops and like new appliances. The fridge and freezer were very clean and ice cold. The bedrooms were great. The master bedroom was gorgeous! It included a king size bed, jacuzzi tub, walk in shower, private toilet area, large dresser, and double sinks. There was also a walk-in closet. The blinds were modern white wood blinds in both rooms. It was nice because it kept the light out in the morning. The second bedroom had two twin/full beds a closet and a dresser draw. Each room had a decent sized television, night stand, and lamps. The washer and dryer was perfect. They also provided a complimentary Tide detergent. We declined room service so we washed our own towels and kept the place tidy. The bath towels could use improvement. Although they were soft the quality was poor and would shed cotton as you were drying off your skin. Which really isn't a big deal it is just an observation. The dining room area was spacious and the chairs and table were in excellent condition. I liked the pineapple dining table since pineapples represent hospitality. The living room had a sleep sofa and two large comfortable chairs. The second bathroom would be your standard hotel bathroom. It was clean and neither bathroom had any mildew or mold issues which is hard to stay away from since it is Florida. The pool area was so much fun. There is a pirate ship and the kids had a great time. The pool smelled like chlorine which is always a good sign. There is a pub/restaurant on-site and also a Pizza Hut. The Lake Buena Vista Outlet is in walking distance since it is in the same loop as the resort. There was more than enough parking and there was also a parking garage which was great since it was raining when we were there. The resort fee is very low compared to other hotels in the Downtown Disney/LBV area. Is there a little wear and tear in our condo? Yes, but it would not hinder me from returning to this resort because it is not anything out of the ordinary. It is close to Wal-Mart and Target and many restaurants. It is a perfect location for Downtown Disney and the WDW parks. We had a great time at the Food & Wine Festival and plan on returning to Disney and Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa soon. If you need a place to stay this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Average just about describes this resort”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: The resort looked absolutely fabulous in the brochure but I'm afraid that when i got there and throughout my two week stay I found it little better than average. The rooms and corridors were not dirty but they definitely needed a Sping clean. The paintwork and carpets looked tired and faded and definitely needed freshening up. The room we were allocated was designed for disabled guests and was on the 15th floor of block 3. None of my party was disabled. I have to ask why disabled accommodation is on the highest floor of a building. The main bedroom was open plan. The bed was large and comfortable though my wife complained that the bedclothes were too small for the size of the bed. I see there have been others who have made the same criticism. The ensuite shower was an open wet room and the shower Had barely any pressure. It was as if you turned the tap on and relied on the force of gravity to get the water to fall out of the shower head. The toilet was also open plan and offered no privacy whatsoever. Moving on: the apartment was described as self contained. One would expect there be facilities to fall within that description. There perfectly good washing machine and tumble dryer which was utilised. There was an excellent fridge/freezer. But there was no work surface on which one could prepare a meal. There was no cupboard space to put shopping. The limited amount of cupboad space in the kitchen area was full of glasses, crockery and saucepans. There was a very small bottle of wasing up liquid but no wash cloth provided. There was just one small tea towel. The message was clear, the idea was for you not to self cater but use the affiliated restaurant Frankie O'Farrels. Frankie O'Farrels, what a disappointment that place was. The place lacked atmosphere. I went there on two occasions. The first time was on a Sunday. There was no more than 12 people in the place. I then went again on a Friday mainly because I had a discount voucher given to me when I checked into the resort and which I had not used on my first visit. Again the place was virtually empty. The food was at best average but was expensive. Part of the problem methinks. The pool area was OK. I have seen better pools but I have seen a lot worse. My grandchildren enjoyed it however, so that was alright. I don't want to appear to be a whinging tourist because I'm not. This is the first time I've ever written a review. The resort was adequate for my needs although I had expected more. I really don't think it lived up to it's billing. I've been to better for a lot less money. This place just did not tick all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Annual family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Andy A
Reviews.Content: Great place for your family to enjoy, relax and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location not in GPS though”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa in September. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, and it was in a great location. 5 miles from Disney and 1/4 mile from a Super Walmart. We appreciated the full kitchen as it helped to save us alot of money. There weren't a ton of cooking supplies, but enough to make simple meals which was fine by us. We also loved the jacuzzi tub and used it every night. We were usually quite sore and tired from all of the walking we had done during the day. We rented a car and drove ourselves around which was very nice. We did have a hard time finding the hotel as the address was not recognized by our GPS. I had heard this complaint before. To future travelers, when leaving from the Orland International Airport type in Lake Buena Vista, FL as your destination, once you get off of the highway exit turn in the opposite way your GPS tells you to, as you are not going into the center of LBV but the outskirt. The resort will be on your left about 1 mile down the road. We will definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brittany D
Reviews.Content: I would go back in a heartbeat, and I will be telling everyone about this hotel! The staff was very helpful and polite, we had a room in building 4. It was very clean, we could see our car from our room, had a very nice view of the pool and it was super quite! The rooms are very spaced out, we never heard anyone in the halls or in the room next door. Great location, very close to everything in Orlando, only 45min-1 hour drive to Cocoa Beach, and about an hour to Tampa, about an hour and half to Clearwater Beach which I HIGHLY recommend. We booked through Expedia and booked a tour through Florida Dolphin Tours...great time! I can not wait to go back, I have been back for 3 days and I have already started saving!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Lyn S
Reviews.Content: My daughter, her husband, our two granddaughters, my husband and myself stayed at this resort for the first two weeks in October. Having read previous reviews after having booked, I was expecting the apartment to be quite dirty. In fact it was quite clean on the surfaces but was dusty throughout. The kitchen was quite poorly designed and equipped with almost no worktop space. We cooked only once because of this and also because there was only one small tea towel and no washcloth. We bought a washcloth so that we could at least wipe surfaces down. I agree with reviews saying the bedclothes are too small. The sheets pinged off at the corners throughout the night. We stayed on the top floor, the 15th, of building 3. The room we were in was equipped for Handicapped guests, even though none of our party is handicapped. This in itself was no problem except for the master bathroom area. The shower was a large wetroom with a very meagre hand held showerhead. The toilet was not in a seperate room but within the bedroom itself, in the corner. Not an ideal situation, as you can imagine. At the very least we should have been asked if we were alright with this situation, few people would be happy with an exposed toilet I'm sure. We were quite disappointed with Frankie O'Farrells. There was no atmosphere, which you would usually expect in an Irish Pub, few patrons and at best food and service which could only be described as average. The girls enjoyed the pirate ship in the pool though. The Shuttle runs to Epcot only, none of the other Disney Parks. However it is ideally situated for all the theme parks if you are travelling by car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: LTerrell71
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Florida and this hotel proved to be an excellent base. The suite we were in was a 2 bedroomed and was fully equipped with washer, dryer, anerican fridge freezer, cooker and dishwasher. The room had 2 bathrooms one ensuite with a huge spa bath. The rooms were immaculately clean. There was 4 places to eat onsite. It is right on the edge of Disney world, about half a mile to international drive, and about a minute away from the I4. Huge shopping outlet just at the back of the hotel and 2 swimming pools. Expedia rep onsite for advice and tickets etc. was absolutely perfect :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kat164
Reviews.Content: What can i say, great place to stay, convenient to all locations, shopping across the road. Staff that we dealt with were lovely and always pleasant. we had a 3 bedroom apartment which more than met our needs, lovely size rooms - especially my bedroom with adjacent spa bath and seperate shower....kitchen well equiped, plenty of free parking - would def use these apartments again, my only critisism if it is one, is it would have been nice to have fresh bedding done for us at least once during our 2 week stay rather than us having to wash dry and put back on, when we had so much else to see and do...However that to one side the accomodation was everything and more that we needed....

Reviews.Title: “Kickback & relax..............”
Reviews.Author: ttdread
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome property, everything you ever wanted including jaccuzzi tub, scenic balcony, & spa....... outlet shopping for the girls & sports bar for the guys all in walking distance. Just minutes from theme parks & Walmart just up the road. Can't wait to get back. My european friends loved it and me too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: markhampton
Reviews.Content: My parents recently rented a 3 bdrm rental here at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. I only stayed with them 2 of the nights I was in town and the accomodations were fantastic. I had to catch a shuttle to the airport and the front desk agent was very helpful in making the arrangements and making sure that I was picked up in time. The location is great and everything you need is within walking distance. Rooms were very nicely furnished and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a place the whole family loves!”
Reviews.Author: kristin a
Reviews.Content: Im a local in the city and my family and me have year pases to disney. Sometimes it is nice to splurge and stay away from home when we go there for the weekend. weve stayed at a sheraton once or twice to no avail. tried this place after seeing it rated so highly on tripadivsor ( i was always a secret trip advisorer, but made an account today just to rave about this place ) we got here around 12:45pm, very early considering checkin is at 4pm. I was expecting to leave all the luggage in the closet and we would pick it up when we got back from the park. I arrived at the desk to be greeted by two workers. Trisha and avery. they were all smiles and greeted me together, working like a team! trisha gave my son a sticker while avery surprisingly found a ready room, right over the pool! he had even noticed my low floor request before i asked for it!! we walked inn and loved the space. i have 2 sons and a daughter, so running around is a must. the balcony is large and has a higer railing so we neednt worry about the kids out there. rooms were clean everything was lovely. disney was so empty cosidering it was a saturday afternoon! make sure to bring extra clothing though, as it was rainy throughout the day. I would recomend a car. the area is great, but i noticed many international people commenting on this, and i know they depend on buses., but being an orlando person myself, there arent many frequest buses on THIS side. rent a cars are worth it there are many in downtown disney!! I work along side many family groups, and will definitley be tlling people to go to this place. i will tell them that with people like avery and trisha, and rooms this size, that they can not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: saddlemefancy
Reviews.Content: This Was our first stay and we very much enjoyed it. Rooms were very clean and spacious full kitchens so we could cook if we wanted too. Property was very clean staff was very courteous and helpful Pool area was great and a great place for the kids and love the idea they have someone come out for activities for the kids. We had a pool view and enjoyed the balcony every night. i love the fact that it is the only hotel on the property. Will surely stay again and recommend to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra101PalmBay
Reviews.Content: Staff was very welcoming and friendly, rooms were clean and nice, and the ammenities are great! Great place to stay, especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brian b
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to this hotel,rooms are clean & comfortable,staff all very pleasant & helpful,we would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area,we had a room with a view of the fireworks in the distance,liked it so much we will be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION, PLENTY OF ROOM,CLOSE TO HIGHWAYS”
Reviews.Author: CHICAGO049
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this LBV Resort 5 times now. Excellent Location, Close to Highways, Several Shopping centers within 2 miles. Cheaper to book a 2 or 3 bedroom villa here, than renting a suite or several rooms at a Hotel. Note there is a 9.95 a day Resort fee whether you use the pool or not...Parking can get tight during high season or over holidays. Wal-Mart nearby for easy grocery shopping for Kitchen supplies. Several discount stores within walking distance. You have to drive up to RT # 192 to find a long row of 30 restaurants, Denny's, Shoney's, Red Lobster, pizza, steak houses etc.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: This was our second time here. The first time was back in May 2011 and despite some negative customer service reviews, we gave this property the benefit of the doubt. We are so glad we did because it has been an excellent experience. Customer service is 5 stars. This time we asked for a room with view to the pool and they placed us on Bldg 5, in the 12th floor facing the pirate ship. What an amazing view! We love the fully equipped kitchen with even a blender for our margaritas! Rooms are very clean and spacious. Resort location is excellent! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “50th B-day vacation”
Reviews.Author: debw1961
Reviews.Content: My 50th b-day family fun vacation. hotel we were very impressed. very nice staff and very helpful. would stay again. great pirate pool. we all had are own rooms and own bathrooms, we had 4 adults and 2 children, plenty of space. also had everything we needed for cooking are meals at hotel. a store was handy when we forgot something. 2 pools to choose to swim at, never had a parking problem.we were very satisfied with are room and would stay again. and recommend this hotel to all are friends and family. even the kids loved hanging at the hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Wake Forest, North Carolina, United States
Reviews.Title: “We will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie0818
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights, with 6 adults and 3 kids. We had the Bahama suite, so plenty of room! The kids loved the pool, wanted to go to the pool instead of Disney one day, prices at Lani were good, and very friendly staff. The location was awesome if you are going to visit Disney, Sea World and even Universal Studios. There is a Super Wal-Mart down the street for groceries and any other necessites. Maintenance needs to spend about an hour changing out remotes and light bulbs. The washer, dryer and carpet was in need of replacement and the TV's were not Resort quality. Overall we were very happy with our stay and will stay again on our next adventure to the area in a year or two!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Sue103
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently and had a 2 bedroom unit (there were 3 of us). The unit was very spacious and quite luxurious. Full kitchen was a great bonus and spa was lovely after our long flight. Jean at the front desk was lovely when we booked in. If you choose to stay here you will probably want to bring/hire a car as most are attractions are a fair distance away. (But they do have a shuttle bus service to some attractions.) Pool area is a nice place to relax in the evenings. I consider this resort/hotel to be very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Just stayed at this resort”
Reviews.Author: Kay S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at this resort with our son and his family. We don't think it deserves a 5 star rating. It was close to Disney World. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. Our bedroom had two single beds which looked like beds you would stay in a 2 star resort. Our bathroom tub was clogged but they did unclog it. Our towel rack kept falling down. The fan in the bathroom sounded like a jet engine it was so loud. We have stayed in much better places for less.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: Roxannn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The pool was great the Pirate ship was cute with the water slide but that is all there is to do at the pool. We asked for a pool view when we made the reservation and they put it in the record but they didn't give us one and when we called they said we had to pay extra for it. They didn't tell me that when I called.. The rooms were really nice, the master was big the other bedroom was small and had 2 full beds in it.. The kitchen was good it had utinsils for us to use.. The only problem we had was when we went to Disneyworld we could never find our way back so have a GPS with you, it was really hard to find without one... For the price it was a fantastic place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “A fab location for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jahqui
Reviews.Content: We have visited this accomodation three times since it opened and have never been dissapointed. The accomodation is excellent, home from home. The pools are clean and child friendly. Its a good base for visiting the attractions or just to relax by the pool. The outlets are a few minutes walk and have greatly improved over the years , so if your thinking of booking this hotel do it you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “2 Week vacation @Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa in Orlando,Flo.”
Reviews.Author: Frank C
Reviews.Content: Great location just 12 miles from airport,convenient for shopping at Walmart,Target to stock up your kitchen in room to save on going out to eat. The two swimming pools are nice, one of the pools are more quiet staged for a calmer surroundings, second one has more activity. Pillows on beds need to have a chose of firm or soft, We perfer soft,the ones in our room were to firm for us. The carpeting needs updating or shampooing.Over all had a very nice time, this is are 3rd time here, would go again for sure... Frank from Muskego,Wisc.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation for EVERY Age in the group”
Reviews.Author: hrdcoresymphoni
Reviews.Content: AMAZING resort for every one in the family to stay entertained. Surrounded by an outlet mall coupled with the MOST incredible master suite jet pool over-sized hot tub surrounded by columns but open to the TV in the room. The view (straight down onto the pool to watch the kiddos while you chill on the deck) spectacular. The staff was super sweet and so were the bus shuttle teams.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic for larger families”
Reviews.Author: paul p
Reviews.Content: Great location just off international drive, and perfect for outlet shopping even a wallmart within walking distance, very close to Disneyland and sea world. Rooms have everything that you could possibly need including washer dryer in the room, ideal for families of 5 or more, the rooms are big make that very big. Pool great for relaxing in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “I never stay anywhere else on my yearly trip to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: Glamazon1123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute hidden gem in an area full of mediocre, overpriced hotels. I've stayed here with my 5 person family 5 times now after trying out many different area hotels for our yearly trip to Disney World. We rent the 2 bedroom antigua suite and it's amazing! The in room laundry makes packing light an actual reality, the fully stocked kitchen is so convenient to make a good breakfast before hitting the parks, the bathrooms are spacious, the balconies are comfortable (with BBQ's!), the lving and dining room are the perfect size with very comfortable furniture throughout the unit. The staff is extremely friendly and are always available to help with anything we need. We did have a problem with a stove on one of our trips and maintenance took care of it very quickly and were very polite and professional. The pool area is fantastic, even though there is only sun for part of the day because of the layout of the towers, the pirate ship watersilde is my son's best friend while we are there, the bartenders remember your name and are always quick with advice about what to see and do in the area and the food is delcious! I use the workout facilities everytime we go and they are not only clean and secure with updates machines but they are open 24 hours a day. The onsite grocer is a bit pricey, butu that's to be expected. It does come in handy for last minute items we always seem to need. The Irish pub on property is fantastic as well and is VERY kid friendly- even with kids who have just spent an exhausting day at the parks. The hotel is only a few miles from Disney. 2 turns and you're there. There is a grocery store nearby as is the incredibly premium outlet mall which you should not miss! I recommend this hotel to everyone I know traveling to the Orlando area. The rates are ridiculously cheap for what you get. I can't believe more people don't know about it yet!

Reviews.Title: “Easy A!”
Reviews.Author: integraprncess
Reviews.Content: Everytime we go to Orlando, we stay at Lake Buena Vista Resort & Spa! This hotel is perfect for families, groups or even a couples retreat! Hotel Rooms: The rooms are incredibly spacious and they all come complete with a full kitchen area, dining room and patio! They range from a 1 bedroom to 4 bedroom suite! We've had 10 people in the same hotel room and it fit all of us comfortably! (Random: The master suite tub has an option to turn on lights that change color in the bath!!!) Amenities: The have a spa at the hotel; however, i've never been to it so I cannot say if it's worth the money or not. They recently added a Pirate ship pool that has a water slide that goes through it! The pool has a seperate area for little kids and a fun little play area. But there is also a play area for the adults at the poolside bar :). I recommend trying the Irish Pub which is on the 1st floor of the second building. Don't eat the food!!! Just enjoy the drinks and the wonderful atmosphere! Also, they have a convenient store, pizza hut and an arcade room on the 1st floor of the 2nd building! Parking: The hotel recently upgraded their parking area by adding a 3 story parking garage, which is a big help if you are on the other side of the campus. If you are in the 2nd building - GET THERE EARLY or You will have to park around the building. It's not that far of a walk, just a little annoying if it rains! Location: PERFECT! It is so close to I Drive, theme parks and shopping! In fact, there are 2 shopping centers on either side of the hotel! You can pretty much walk anywhere and find what you need! Service: We have never had a problem! Staff is always helpful and friendly! In fact, they give you coupons to restaurants and attractions! How nice is that?! I guarantee that once you stay here, you will never want to stay anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay..lots of space...great pool”
Reviews.Author: kathleen a
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort many times over the past few years traveling with a sports team. These are not hotel rooms but condo's with 2/3/4 bedrooms, nice kitchens, washer/dryer/balcony etc..the swimming pool (a recently built pirate ship) is great and will keep the kids busy. We brought staples for the kitchen and ate out at night. The master bedroom has a great bathroom with lots of closet space..tv's in every room. Would recommend this to any family traveling to Disney...front desk is professional...you take care of your own room for the length of you stay...there is a convenient restaurant on the premises. Overall a very nice place..oh and you can see the fireworks at night from Disney! Price is reasonable for what you get...looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family resort”
Reviews.Author: OrleansTripper
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice big rooms, hot tub bath was very nice, good size kitchen, everything you need in the room, big pool, several hot tubs, food at pool-side, quiet area. Cons: Limited dining close by (one pub, one express Pizza Hut), need car unless you're there for shopping only or you're willing to take shuttle to parks at times provided. Must pay for room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: LisaXmas
Reviews.Content: We wanted a 2 bed condo for a couple of nights before returning to the UK and this was well priced and had a spa. We paid extra for the 'firework' views. Check in was great, we were given discount vouchers for the adjacent outlets, and we were given a 2 bed in Building 5m (which we understood from other reviews was the best building). Our unit was great with every convenience and some nice touches (washing powder, origami towel swans...) and my daughter loved the pirate ship in the pool. Views from the pool were uninspiring (and pool bar drinks pretty expensive) but you couldn't complain at the accommodation price or the firework views - we saw Epcot, Magic Kingdom and Universal fireworks from the balcony and both bedrooms - brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: christiane2002
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay at, nice pool. The room was just wonderful, huge, luxurious

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Buttercuplou
Reviews.Content: Apartments are a good size and comfortable and with everything you need, washer, dryer, kitchen area etc. I would stay again because it was nice, but wouldn't rush back to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Cookndales
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Wallmart, the Target is a quick drive away. Walking distance to Outlets Mall. Pool good size with Pirate Ship for fun. The pirate ship was only a slide, but it was nice for a ride. Not many kids activities at hotel but a person goes to Orlando for the theme parks. Front staff was amazing, and was never overcharged and got a great rate. The gym was put together by someone who doesn't use a gym regularly. There were lots of pieces but the pieces didn't go together to give a complete workout. It pays to book a hotel and flight separately. Will never use dollar car rental again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but more like a 2.5 star”
Reviews.Author: LivetoGo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and got a great deal for a 2 bdrm unit with a fully loaded kitchen (dishwasher, washer/dryer, etc.), 2 bathrooms, etc. however the decor is so outdated, this hotel is like a budget hotel. Disliked: fitted sheets too small for beds, no black-out curtains, our children couldn't even use the Pirate Ship waterslide as it's for older kids, no a/c in bedrooms... Although the hotel was sort of close to Disney World, it's still in the middle of nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Other things not so great.”
Reviews.Author: Zorrosowner
Reviews.Content: On reading other reviews here I thought that most of the negative ones were a bit extreme, however, some of it was definitely not. So here goes. KITCHEN, great fridge, hob could do with being cleaned with a good quality ceramic hob product, as could the bottom of the kettle to prevent further damage to the hob surface. Dishwasher ok but not as good as mine. I suspect that it doesn't get hot enough and certainly doesn't go for long enough! I can't comment on the microwave or oven as we didn't use them. Washing machine again didn't get hot enough or work for long enough to really get clothes clean I'm somewhat annoyed that i will need to rewash all our clothes when we get home as they are not clean enough (my whites are cream and none of the staining from sun protection products has been removed even on the so called hot/heavy wash and I haven't been overloading the machine). BATHROOMS shower had an icky film on the floor when we arrived, and we too had pink mould spurting out through the outlets in the whirlpool bath (I had run the bath for nearly 5 mins before climbing in as I had read other comments on the website) but it obviously wasn't loosened enough by that point! BALCONY had cigarette end dissolving on the floor when arrived and the table top is not attatched to the legs (I can only assume this is to make it easier to move furniture indoors in the event of a hurricane, but it makes it look shoddy. LIVING AREA yes the carpets have seen better days. But believe me I've seen much worse! And the sofa could have done with a bit of a clean but again it wasn't that bad. This is the first time we've stayed in an apartment so don't have a lot to compare it with! It is spacious, and in a great location for the same price as 2 rooms at the cheapest Disney resort, and we have all the facilities we need, would as stay here again, I'm not really sure, we are in building 5, which is supposed to be the better block.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go again.”
Reviews.Author: LuvmykidsAnL
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing! The rooms are spacious and very clean. My kids loved the Pirate ship they have in the pool. We are booking our next trip soon and we'll be staying here again. Family friendly and close to Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Thes best every time!”
Reviews.Author: cookie4rue
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed here, and the first time with our daughter (The other two were our honeymoon and our anniversary). This place is amazing. It has a huge jacuuzi tub, a pool with slide, great resteraunt (Frankie Farrells. YUM!) and is walking distance to shopping malls. bIt has a spa and kids activities on site as well. I definately recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will return”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 bedroom apartment in block 5, spacious, like new, great location for all attractions, and easily reached from Orlando International Airport. Great pool with bar.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every minute will be back”
Reviews.Author: Helenkemp10
Reviews.Content: A few minor complaints A few holes were found in the blankets,horrible blinds in the bedrooms curtains would look better. There was no lifeguard on duty only somebody watching the slide, the pool towels were to small The hotel had a shuttle service to the parks return times are 6.30pm 10.30pm. Also a earlier time like 3pm Apart from that we stayed in building 3 on the 12 floor we had an amazing view the appartememt was clean and spacious. We needed the enginneer a couple of times who arrived within minutes. Thankyou to all the staff we had a brilliant time and maybe one day we will be back From the Kemp Family

Reviews.Title: “Huge suite with lots of room - minutes from Disney- Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Cwell76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with family to go to Disney. We had a 3 bedroom suite with a full kitchen and master suite. The room was clean and comfortable. This room was very reasonable almost hard to believe for what you got. It had a washer and dryer to which was nice. It rained the whole time we were there so we didn't get to experience the pool.
