I would recommend this place which is only about 5 mins from Disney. Also there is a outlet mall right in front of this resort as well.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: ktb335
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay with the kids! The pirate ship pool was fun! It is a bit off the beaten path so we found it quiet but not "isolated". There were outlet shops next door that we walked to. I had read that the sheets didn't fit the beds and other things that made me a bit leary but we did not experience any of that! The reservations said there were 2 twin beds in one of the rooms and they were actually double beds. You do have to take your own trash out and there is not a daily housekeeping service unless you pay extra. We did not find that to be an issue at all......... All of the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. Wal Mart is 1/2 mile down the road for anything you might need. The location was great as well. Plenty of places to go out and eat if you choose and easy access to the theme parks. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location, reasonable rates.”
Reviews.Author: CJtravelerDenver
Reviews.Content: This place is in a good location. It's close enough to many attractions, shopping, etc., but is away from the the traffic and congestion. We stayed in a 3 bedroom, 3rd floor, and had plenty of room. It had a small washer & dryer in the room, and a nice screened-in porch. (However the locks on our sliding glass doors were broken.) There was a TV in every bedroom along with one in the living area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & Service - But Skip The Upgrades!”
Reviews.Author: GirlShrink
Reviews.Content: I have visited Orlando several times and typically stay in a 5-star hotel, but wanted to try a "suite" so I could cook breakfast. I must say that I was surprisingly pleased with the quality and cleanliness of our two bedroom suite and it was more than enough room for a family of five. BUT when I booked the room, the staff tried to sell me several upgrades, one being a balcony view of the fireworks at Disney and Sea World. The cost was about $140 USD for six nights, but the fireworks were too far to really see and so the kids were disappointed and we had to end up watching them in the park anyway. So I think that particular upgrade is not worth the money. Oh - I had a great hot stone massage at the spa too. Worth going, and I would recommend this place to friends and family. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Best Mother's Day gift, love the resort.”
Reviews.Author: DjonesFlorida
Reviews.Content: Place was great with smooth fast elevators a plus when u are staying on the upper floors. Our unit was very clean a little to clean with white tiled bathroom I could smell bleach which i am highly sensitive to but with one call to the office i was moved to next building with stone tile and a light scent of cleaning products not bleach. Great stay every thing u need even pizza hut on site for the kids. We had enough space with balcony and kids bedroom windows over looked the pool & big pirate ship they had a blast playing in. and with shopping plaza next door. I would come back and stay her again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms great location”
Reviews.Author: st28ten
Reviews.Content: we stayed in building 3, 14 floor overlooking the main pool for 4 nights. 2BR was the largest suite we've stayed in so much room. Matster bedroom with king sized comfy bed, fabulous jaccuzi and seperated shower and toilet all in an open plan area. Seperate living areas and kitchen had more than enough space for us and the 2nd twin single bed room was fine for my 18yr & 13yr old plus seperate 2nd bathroom. flat screen large TV in the lounge area but older style TVs in the bedrooms ( we didn't use them anyway) We didn't hear any noise or music from the pool area as we were high up you might if you're on a lower floor. The balconies on the top two floors are huge whole lengh of the suite, the other floors were average size from what we could see. We didnt use- the gym but it lookes ok, the spa sevices or the irish bar ( we thought about it for breakfast but for a much better deal we used the nearby Golden corral - opens at 7. 30 everything is ready so we were in and out and ready for the parks at only $ 7 each! ) pool was lovely and spacious and towels are provided and plentyful. Reception staff really friendly and helpful. happy to answer any questions

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: lauraemma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Lake Buena Vista Resort this morning, the condo is home from home.We arrived at eight in the morning and they kindly gave us a room even though we should not have been given the room until 2 o'clock. The condo was in block 4 over the reception, beautiful 2 bedroom 2 bathroom fully equipped kitchen including washer and dryer so no dirty washing today !! The resort was quite peaceful we had a good nights sleep with no noise. We had free use of wifi which was really useful to see times of parks openings.My only complaint is that the pool towels are sooooooooo small so maybe take your own. Another thing was that they never had any duvet cover on the bed.We didn't use the maid service even though they also offered us a free one day clean and we were there for three weeks. I would recommend this resort if you are looking for a home from home experience and close to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding All Around”
Reviews.Author: vacationtime2010
Reviews.Content: Our family booked a week's stay at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa and had an outstanding time. We went for the purpose of doing the whole Disney experience and found that the location was excellent. We were minutes (literally) to the parks and had no trouble getting around from the hotel. We booked a 2 bedroom suite and got an outstanding rate and had PLENTY of room. I couldn't imagine the 4 of us in a Disney room, especially compared to a 2BR 2BA suite with a 20 foot balcony on the 14th floor. The resort was very clean and the pool was a LOT of fun for the kids. I guarantee we will be back to stay in this resort the next time we come to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE BUT YOU WILL NEED A CAR”
Reviews.Author: vanessa h
Reviews.Content: 24 of us arrived at the Lake Buena Vista to celebrate my father in laws 60th birthday. We were put into block 5 which I have read on previous reviews that thats the best place to stay. The rooms were adequate for what we needed the only down side is the 2 girls had to sleep on the pull out bed in the lounge which made it very hard if we wanted to stay up late etc. The beds were very comfy and our sheets fitted the beds. After checking through the crockery i rang down reception and listed the items we were missing of which they were all brought to the room straight away. I found there wasnt a great amount of towels but we did have a washer dryer so could wash them easy enough. (Although it is very loud and sounds like an aeroplane taking off the same as the dish washer. ) Take coat hangers with you as not very many of them. Everything worked, big fridge and freezer. Wal Mart is close by but quite busy road to walk too so we got taxi. The local shop is very very expensive so dont go in. Ate in the Irish bar a few times on the evening and a couple of times for breakfast. Was very nice, do advise that on the evening you take a jacket or something as the air con is very high and I would freeze. THe teenagers used the gym a few times and my partner had a few massages at the spa, he said very very good and would highly recommend it. Kids loved the pool with the pirate ship and was a great place to sunbathe. THe layed on buses had to be booked 24 hours before and only at set times. we ended up having to pay for taxis alot of the time and spent an absolute fortune. I would def recommend getting a car as the fuel is very cheap, the hotel is not on international drive so doesnt have frequent buses to and from the park. Overall loved my experience in Florida and want to go back again, would stay on international drive if I went back as would save a fortune on transport. Oh by the way WIFI shocking, couldnt get it, my next door neighbours could but we couldnt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic , again”
Reviews.Author: Muzzyman123
Reviews.Content: What a great place this is, this is our second time here and we took along some friends.we were a little nervous about coming back as sometimes you feel it cant be as good a 2nd time aroind, we were pleasantly suprised to find it was still great. Clean rooms , great pool for the kids and a mega location. I would say the only negative is that the pool bar prices are OTT. The staff are all friendly and helpfull. This time we were in block 5 which was as nice as block 3. , the great thing about block 3 is ,if you have a pool view you can see the theme psrk fireworks of a night. We would defo come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hands Down - AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: PJackkand
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in (2 couples) the greatness never stopped!! The two young ladies who checked us in were very pleasant and helpful. We were in newest building, building #5 which has the Pirate Shop Pool and Pool Bar. The complex is awesome! There is an amazing Irish restaurant/bar - the shepard's pie was the best ever according to my fellow travelers. The drinks were perfect and the price was awesome! There is a little convenience store located on the property which has a little bit of everything -came in very handy for those late night beer runs! For people with kids there is a game room which has air hockey and pool - and some pretty awesome video games, excellent for kids and adults who act like kids ;-) In the next complex over is a HUGE stripe mall of outlet stores - which is perfect for last minute sneaker replacements, bathing suits, or even some Mickey Mouse items!! We had a two bedroom suite, we were in the King Bed room which had an awesome tub and a very roomy shower!! The other room had two double beds - and plenty of space. The living room was excellent had a balcony, and a dining area which offers up some space to spread out. The staff we came in contact with were awesome - and I will be going back for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for an Orlando parks holiday”
Reviews.Author: BJLEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in July 2011. This was a family trip including Disney World, Sea World, the Kennedy Space Center, Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. The location here is absolutely ideal. It's close to and easy to get to all of the parks. Minutes away from the 4 Disney Parks and only a few minutes more to the others as well as a very reasonable drive to the Atlantic coast. It's easy to get to the hotel from the airport too. We had the St. Lucia suite and it was unbelievably spacious. We had only our family of 5 in the suite. Our son met some other people at the pool who had two families staying comfortably in a same-size suite. It was fabulous to come back from a long day of family fun at the crowded parks and to be able to relax, spread out, and have some breathing room! The kitchen in the suite was all we needed and it was a great plus to have a washer and dryer right in the room. The suite was very clean and there is a vacuum cleaner in one of the closets for you to use if you are not paying for extra housekeeping. We enjoyed the two pools as well, even though we often were not back to the hotel until evening. The pirate-themed pool was cute, but the kids actually preferred going in the smaller pool near the convenience store. The outlet mall next door had some good sales and deals even though, again, we didn't have a lot of time to shop. But, if not for the outlet mall, we wouldn't have gotten any non- gift shop shopping in at all! We also liked the pub downstairs and enjoyed a meal there our first night in. One other night we got take out pizza from the Pizza Hut right downstairs. The convenience store downstairs is quite expensive. Better to go to the Walmart which is only a few blocks away for supplies like cold drinks, snack and breakfast items and toilet paper (!) (Because the housekeeping is not included, you will not have toilet paper restocked for you and it's expensive downstairs). Do NOT use the ATM in the lobby if you can help it at all. It charges an outrageous user fee. The jacuzzi tub in our suite didn't work at first. We mentioned this to the office and it was fixed by the time we got back that night. Our only real complaint is that the sheets did not fit the king size beds or twin size beds very well, and we all found that the sheets kept coming off the beds all night for all of us. They need to provide mattress pads for the beds and also get some sheets that fit better. Over all, we would highly recommend this to anyone taking a parks vacation and we would definitely stay here again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “''Wicked LBV''”
Reviews.Author: Susanne S
Reviews.Content: .After reading the Negative reviews on LBV before hand I was were really apprehensive about staying here, especially after it being recommended.. Well on arrival the staff were very good. Our 3 bedroom apartment was EXCELLENT even though it was directly above the car park/exit ramp. Building 5. 'It was not noisy though' so we were more than satisfied, We could see the side veiw of the Pirate Ship & Pool & the Lake & could see Sea Seaworld Fireworks in the evening.. No complaints on the rooms especially the master room with jacuzzi!! & massive shower, & twin sinks,. Loads of wardrobe/ cupboard space. Washer/Dryer excellent. The Kitchen was good & well equiped although could of had oven trays for chips etc as none were provided. There is a large safe & we had to call room service to open it as we mucked up the number, opps! ,also the front door handle came off in our hands & the boiler in the kitchen started flooding & even though it was spurting out lots of water we had to wait quite a while for someone to come. We chose not to have Maid service as we felt it not neccessary. We got loads of Leaflets under our door for Pizza etc, the outside doors were open for ANYONE to enter by even though they should have been Card/Key entry only! The Pirate Pool was good & relaxing but the Bar was expensive for everything as they have the monopoly on site as there is only them & the 'Irish Bar'!! we could not believe how LBV is perfectly central for all the Theme Parks, We had car hire so did not use their Transport.The local shopping mall was roughly the same price as everywhere else as we went to a few. There is a Walmart 2 minutes down the road, The on site supermarket was expensive. Also Walmart was the cheapest for Disney Tickets etc if you had not already pre-booked yours. Be warned that all theme parks go on finger recognition so be careful when buying from resale tickets. . The younger Adults in our party used the Gym & said it was ok, but there were sometimes young children in there with their parents mucking around on the machines so they were unable to use the machines, the parents just let there kids carry on :( There should be an age limit as to whom should be allowed in the gym area. Wifi rubbish, we had to go to the reception to get connected.. kids not happy, oh well.. :) Even though it seems like I am negative, believe me they were minor incidents that can happen anywhere & would definatley RECOMMEND Lake Buena Vista. Excellent, Clean, Lovely Staff, Well Situated. Our stay was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Gail12316
Reviews.Content: This is how second time in this resort and we loved it just has much has last year we stayed in building 5 we saw the fireworks every night the apartment was very clean the staff very helpful very good value for money we asked for building 5 again and they put us in there with no trouble just round the corner is walmart you can walk but you can take a taxi for 5 dollars which is well cheep we have no promblems with the two holidays we have had at resort village and spa and would go back any day maybe next year

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, perfect for families!!”
Reviews.Author: flyerfan_ca
Reviews.Content: Close by to all the attractions Orlando has to offer. We had a two bedroom suite which was plenty for our family of 5. Kids had their on bathroom and parents their own seperate living space. Laundry in the room was awesome, especially with kids!! The kids loved the pools especially the Pirate Ship. They were able to swim and adults could enjoy a cold drink after a long day!!! I would recommend this place for any family and with everything close by (Walmart with 2 minutes) you can go out and ring whatever you need back.

Reviews.Title: “"Great place and I am picky!"”
Reviews.Author: Michelle C
Reviews.Content: Like I said , I am picky, I am the one who notices everything, good and bad. I liked our room very much. It was spacious and I liked the furnishings. It felt like home rather than a hotel..We only stayed a few days but the staff was helpful and the pool was really nice. We had dinner at Frankie Farrell's Irish Pub and Grille on property and enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. Note: Housekeeping is not included in the price of your room. You have a choice of how much or how little services you would like from full cleaning to a fresh touch or no services at all. That may be a negative for you but for me only staying a few days I did not request service at all. i don't mind cleaning up after myself , we were not in the the room very often to make a mess of it. It was also nice to have a dishwasher and washer and dryer in the unit. If you are heading to Disney there is shuttle service but times are limited. I hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Sara P
Reviews.Content: We held a family reunion in Orlando and chose to stay here. The rooms were very spacious and accomadated our big family. There was plenty of space and everything was very updated. The staff was very nice and made our stay enjoyable. It is very close to all the parks and places to eat. If I return to Orlando I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: walleyworld
Reviews.Content: Purchased this resort stay thru a Groupon vacation. Accomodations are 1-4 bedroom suites, living room and full kitchen. Suite was perfect for our 4 day stay in Orlando. Everyone was able to stretch out after long days at parks and attractions. Full kitchen allowed for breakfast and snacks on hand. Pool with pirate ship kept our grandson entertained for hours. Spa on site very nice. All resort staff very pleasant. It was a great stay, highly recommend if looking for relaxation while visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Smooth480
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through expedia and got a great deal on a 2 bedroom unit. I read a ton of reviews and decided to ask for a room in building 5, which was wonderful. The unit was really clean and close to the pool but far enough away for it to be totally quiet in the evenings. We had a view of the Disney fireworks since we were on the 7th floor which was great. The hotel is close to Disney and Universal so we were able to drive back take naps and then return to the parks until closing. There are tons of shops in the areas and the Irish pub has great food for a decent price. The amount of space we had and tv's in every room was great considering we were a group of 3 adults and one teenager. We really enjoyed our stay. The only downside was the horrible Internet service. We called to try to connect to the wireless service and that never happened. We had to end up getting a cord for Ethernet service and even that barely worked. Also it would be nice if you could request cleaning services the day you need them instead of in advance. Theses were minor setbacks and overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wont stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Floridafan015
Reviews.Content: Very shabby apartments, the worst I have stayed in during numerous trips to Florida. Long overdue refurbishment. As per other comments the sheets do not fit the superking bed in the master bedroom and do come off. Air conditioning good in the lounge area but not so good in bedrooms. We had to buy a frying pan because everything stuck to the one provided and we also had to buy a spatula and kitchen tea towels as the ones provided were disgusting. The staff had no record of our booking when we arrived and we were offered a choice of two 3 beds but both were very tired looking and disappointing. The jacuzzi bath in the master bedroom also did not work. The staff were however very helpful at the front desk-usually. On checking out there had been a bar bill added to our room which was not ours and I was sent to the bar myself to query as the front reception informed me they are a separate company! Car parking was an issue in building 1 after 5pm as there were not enough spaces out front. If you are happy to drive then the location is fine, just across the road from Walmart and right next to the LBV Outlets with the Premium Outlets just 5 mins away. Also very close to the Disney parks and Universal too but you need to drive to restaurants or get a taxi. Not the best and I would not recommend staying here - try the Sheraton Vistana Village instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location”
Reviews.Author: BHtrade
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at the LBVR. Friendly check-in staff allowed us to check in 2 hours early and the 2 bedroom suite was perfect for our family of 4. Huge master suite, great pool view. We got a great deal via Hotwire (was considered a 4 star by their criteria). I do, however, believe the hotel should be rated 3.5 stars, not 4 as much of the furniture was a bit worn and a few of the kitchen amenities were broken (wine opener, 3 of the 8 bowls, 1 pan). But we would definitely stay there again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but could do we a face lift!”
Reviews.Author: bobbygHove
Reviews.Content: Cheked into these suites as a last minute option. Have been here three times before but this time they only had an apartment in bulding 1. This was the original building and it has not been refurbished for some time now. Had to call handy man three times....carpets in family room were flooded due to faulty air condition unit, drying switch was broken off and one of the toilets was blocked!. Would have thought all this would have been checked before they released the room to us!. My recommendation would be to make sure you book an apartment in the new part...think that is buildings 3 or 5...... Great location in terms of it being a minutes walk to the mall...also free schuttles to the disney parks....still think you need a car though as there is only one resturant in the complex which is OK....btw recommend the fish and chips there.....best I have ever had!. There have been some bad comments re the staff there but we found them really helpfull...guess it depends who is on that day!!!. Only one other comment is if you are unlucky enough to be in buliding one....try and stay away from the pool area....as it is meant to close at 2200 but I have found this to be the case and kids/families were still there at 2300 and beyond making all sorts of noise!.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: Teresa808
Reviews.Content: Okay, so we stayed here from July 21 - July 29 in room 1205 which is right above the arcade. I got a good price thru VRBO and I paid in full 2 weeks before our trip for a 3 bedroom 2 bath unit. We were horribly delayed by United Airlines and did not arrive to the property until 3:30am on July 21. I had tried calling the hotels reservation line twice while we were delayed in LAX in order to inform them of our delay, however the call was dropped and did not go thru. So, since I had paid in advance for my unit anyway, I figured our unit would be held. That was not the case. We got there exhausted from over 24 hours of travel and a 1 1/2 hour car trip from Tampa to find the hotel was pretty booked. I was also chastised for not calling to inform them how late I was going to be. They then informed me that my room had been given away! Luckily for me, they had a 3 bedroom 3 bath available and thankfully they did not charge me for the difference. Because my original unit was paid in full, they should not have had the option of giving it to another guest. Room Condition: Overall the room was nice and very large. The furniture has the "sat-in" look to it. The rugs were pretty warn though. The stackable washer and dryer worked great. The Central AC is AWESOME!! We had two jetted tubs in each of the master bedrooms. My sister had a tub with lights, she felt like she was in a dance club and loved it whenever she took a bath. My tub did not work well. It took us 10 mintues of pressing all the buttons until it finally kicked on. I got into bed after my bath and the darn tub kicked back on twice by itself. Very weird, so I ended up never using the jets. The tubs are extemely deep and wonderful after all the walking we did at the parks. You can also watch tv right from the tub! The bathrooms were nice and the shower was large and I never ran out of hot water. Each unit has its own large water heater! The kitchen was great. I was really hoping that each unit would have items left behind like condiments and laundry soap from previous guests. Unfortunantly, the condo's are completely empty so you will have to purchase EVERYTHING. There was only one extra roll of toilet paper so we had to purchase that the very next day along with paper towels. They did leave a mini bottle of dish soap to hand wash dishes and 1 extra garbage bag. Note to the resort: You should keep all of the unused portions of laundry soaps, TP, paper towels etc. for future guests. I know when I checked out, I left almost a full bottle of laundry soap and fabric softener, half a package of TP and an extra roll of paper towels. The worst issue I had with our room was the bed. It was not very comfortable and it was bowed in the middle from all of the use. Had I stayed at the hotel a little longer, I would have purchased a mattress topper! The pillows were pretty lousy too, just your basic pillow. We were able to sleep because of how exhausted we were from all of the walking. The beds were the same in all rooms. The rooms also were not very sound proof. My sister was woken up one night to country music being played at 3am. I also heard the neighbors yelling at their kids accross the hall one morning. Parking: The parking lot was always full but I was able to find parking on the street right in front of our condo most nights. If you come back really late at night, like we did once, parking could be a challenge. And one time, I parked on the street and some jerk reversed his car really close to mine so I got pinned in the stall. Took me some maneuvering to get out. Location: The hotel is in a great location. You are right next to the outlet mall. Walmart is very close along with many restaurants and there were a few miniture golf places near it. It took about 10 minutes to make it to each park. Overall, my stay was okay but the bed was a real deal breaker for me. Parking was not the best either and the room was a little noisy. On the plus side, the rooms were very large, clean and safe. Out of 10, I would give my stay a 6.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time at this resort and still loved it”
Reviews.Author: alangr40
Reviews.Content: Right from the start of our holiday the staff were very welcoming and helpful especially Trish. Our room had a great view looking out towards Kissimee and Downtown Disney. On the one occasion we had to call out maintenance (an electrical storm had stopped the air conditioning) they arrived within 20 mins. Location is ideal for access to all parks, 2 mins from the crossroads to the Disney parks, 5 mins from the I4 for international Drive and Universal Studios. The shopping outlets are great, 2 mins walking and you are there. Apartment was clean but the carpets and couch could have done with a shampoo. Think they should include cleaning in with the price as not everyone cleans up after themselves, not many people were willing to pay the extra for cleaning and $8.00 a day for use of facilities (whether you use them or not) is a bit of a rip off, this covered the shuttle to parks, use of pool, fitness centre etc. Saving up already to go back next year:)

Reviews.Title: “No regrets! Great Disney Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: lotekgirl
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on Expedia during a sale, so I don't know what the normal rate is here, but we got a great value for the $$ paid. Stayed here for the first half of our FL trip while we were doing Disney. The location is excellent! The hotel is right down the street from Walmart, right down the road from Disney, within walking distance of an outlet mall and close to several restaurants. Both on-site restaurants (island grill & irish pub) were good and prices were reasonable. There's an on-site convenience store and the prices are okay. We reserved a one bedroom suite and planned on our son using the sofa sleeper, but we were given a two bedroom suite as a free upgrade. The room was enourmous, about the size of our house. There were two bathrooms and the one in our room had a jetted tub with colored led lights in it. We were very comfortable during our stay here and didn't want to leave! The pool area was great and my son liked that better than anything else we did on the vacation. There's a small arcade near the convenience store and Irish pub. There's also a fitness room and barber shop in the same strip. There's a spa at the top of the main building where you check in. We had no issues with the front desk or our room. The kitchen was stocked with dishes and cookware and everything worked perfectly. This place was nice and quiet and I really have no complaints or regrets about staying here other than I wish I would have shaved a day off of our beach vacation to stay here one day longer!

Reviews.Title: “loved it loved it loved it”
Reviews.Author: christinedumbarton
Reviews.Content: three of us stayed in a 2 bed apartment in block 5. spacious., well equipped- i even enjoyed doing the laundry! had views over Orlando so was able to watch fireworks 4 times a night- bliss! had read some negative reviews but i could not fault this place nor the staff. see Michael at the spa for the best ( and i mean best) manicure and pedicure - excellent attention to detail and friendly but not in an intrusive way . only tiny complaint- the prices in the on site supermarket- $20 for a bottle of wine!!! taxi to walmart pays for itself! if you want to do a number of Dinsney parks - just hop on the bus and then get on any disney bus- it's all free. best kept secret- boardwalk- can't remember the name of the shop but try out the double scoops of ice cream at the ice cream parlour- OMG- delish. then hop on a water taxi to epcot or holly wood studios. buy your water spray fans at walmart rather than disney- about a third of the price and boy do you need them!

Reviews.Title: “Three times a charm!!”
Reviews.Author: mizmuffit
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by searching online last year (2010) and decided to give it a try, wow, what a find!! This place is amazing!! The rooms are huge and perfect for a family!! They have the most amazing pool with a great pirate ship and tiki bar. We have stayed there 3 times since July of 2010, the most recent July 2011. Everytime we go to Orlando this will be our spot, we love this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Definately Need A Car!”
Reviews.Author: loobylou2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April and the main reason was because it was close to DisneyWorld. The apartment that we had was fine, all the furniture was nice, everything was clean and worked. The only downside was that the apartment smelled of smoke and being non-smokers this was unpleasant. The aircon worked very well and kept the apartment very cool as it was very hot when we were there. The washer and dryer were excellent. The pirate ship in the pool was fun for the children, although you could only go on it at certain times and you could only use it as a slide and not to play on the boat itself. The pool itself was lovely as was the hot tub in the corner. The poolside bar was very expensive - buy your stuff in Wal-mart as it is so much cheaper. The nearest shop is a small mini market and although has general supplies it is very expensive. It does have a pizza hut cafe, which is ok. There was a small gym on site, which looked quite good but we didn't use it. There was also a games room with a pool table etc. There is a Wal-mart down the road which is excellent and it is worth going and stocking up. Only problem going to Wal-mart is if you are walking is that there are no footpaths and you are walking right next to the very busy interstate and it seemed very dangerous. We would get a taxi to and from Wal-mart which was approx $6 each way. The bus came to take you to Disney twice a day, this had to be booked 24 hours in advance and to be honest was always a daily drama! One bus broke down one day and that was it to be honest, the service was very hit and miss!! The bus times were not that convenient and when you returned there were only two times that you could come home. The fireworks at the Disney parks tended to end at about 9pm so you had to hang around for an hour and a half to get the bus back, and that was if it showed up on time. With young children this was not ideal. The bus service was free. There is an outlet village right next to the apartments which was fine, they had some good disney stuff which was half the price! Wal-mart was excellent for all Disney items and very good value for money. Don't buy anything at the hotel (eg poncho's) as they are only 99c at Wal-mart and the hotel charged about $6!! The only thing I would say that if you are staying here you do need a car to get around as there is not much near by and you half to walk by the very busy interstate which with young children is not ideal. There are not many eating places nearby. We had problems with the company that the hotel uses for it's taxi's as they do not turn up on time and we missed a very expensive trip that we had booked. Unfortuantely the tour operator where very unhelpful (they just wanted our money, and tough luck was the response!!!) and so were the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quality not as nice this time but a great place nonetheless”
Reviews.Author: Teacher72
Reviews.Content: We came back here in March and were disappointed in our room. It was well loved to say the least. Had I been the first in our party to arrive I would have requested another room but we love the location and the pool (the best in any place we have ever stayed). I would still highly recommend these condos but perhaps request the buildings around the pool. Great to have free parking as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: grannyjane18
Reviews.Content: We came to the Orlando area with 2 grandsons, ages 4 and 1, and stayed 5 days. Since we were going to attractions other than Disney, we chose to stay off the Disney property. For the price of a room at other places, we had a large two bedroom two full bathroom suite with a well equipped kitchen and laundry facilities. The large pool area was perfect for relaxation after frantic park activities. The suite was clean and attractive. We opted for a mini housekeeping service once during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time was even better”
Reviews.Author: IS3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year for a short trip but this year we decided on a week for the whole Disney Park Hopper experience. The distance to the parks is great, just a short drive to any of them. This time it was even better than last. The room was great and spacious and the price was perfect in May. Our daughter (4) loves the pool and slide with the pirate ship. We will be back again for sure and will continue to tell family and friends about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel , Great Loaction, Poor Maintainace”
Reviews.Author: CBCBCB11
Reviews.Content: Its a good property. Staff is very good. great rooms with little low maintenance. We had 2 bedroom apartment and we knew they will not clean the room, unless paid for. However, Carpet in the Lobby stings badly thats only bad point about the hotel.Hotel provides daily shuttle to Park ( They drop to Epcot only- in case of Disney parks). This saves your 25$ one way, to the park. Overall it has been a good hotel

Reviews.Title: “It stings”
Reviews.Author: ASDFLKJH1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Suites (Tower No.3) during 22nd June to 30th June. Condition of suites is not bad . It was a beautifully planned 2 BHK with Balcony facing pool,but the carpet in the long passage stings so strong that it becomes difficult to pass thru. ALso they advertise that WIFI is free which is not the case and when asked, they said it doesnot work on IPAD2, which I have not understood so far.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying here and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieVandenabeele
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a trip to Disney for an extended family vacation. We thought we would save money by not staying at a Disney Resort and wasn't sure what to expect. Our expectations were met and exceeded at the LBV Resort Village & Spa. We LOVED our room. We had a three bedroom condo, and with three families it was plenty of room. The kitchen had everything we needed to make our meals before we left for the park everyday. The best part was of course the pool! The kids loved it and on the 100+ temp days the pool was cool and refreshing. We spent one whole day at the pool and even ate dinner there, the food was great and don't forget to have a pina colada! We are already planing our next trip to say at the LBV Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Onsite Spa, Pirate Ship Pool & More”
Reviews.Author: southmiamijill
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the last two years and each time, I love the experience. I have stayed in everything from a one-bedroom unit to the mac-daddy four-bedroom and I must say, each unit offers a bit of luxury with a whirlpool bath, granite kitchen, washer & dryer, balcony, and flat screen TVs. One of the highlights of this resort is the pool. It's an easy walk on a path behind the units to this family friendly area. There's an enormous pirate ship with slides, they do hair braiding and wraps, they have a separate area for little ones with those mushroom-tree water features, and their pool bar and grille is uber convenient and good. I have also enjoyed the onsite SPA. First, you won't believe the size of it - it's big! They offer mani/pedis and a variety of body treatments. The treatment rooms are lovely, too. Sit in the relaxation area and enjoy the saltwater fish tanks and soothing lighting. Ahh. Loved it. Gift shop onsite as well, found some cute trinkets that I haven't seen anywhere else. Location! Walk right across the parking lot to the Outlet shops. Can't beat that - even get a discount coupon book at check-in. Want pizza late at night? There's a Pizza Hut onsite (well, on the other side of the lot but they deliver or you can pick up). And Frankie Farrell's Irish Pub is righ there, too. We had a party of 8 and everyone was pleased with the choices and their meals. Eat in, take out, not sure about delivery for them. Shepard's Pie was yummy. Theme parks are just a few minutes away, as is Downtown Disney. Hate to write all this good stuff about them because next time I go to make a reservation, I won't be able to get one. But had to share - this place rocks, especially for families. Only thing I miss when I stay here is a Kids Club. One flaw. I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME spacious condo and the pool was what closed us!”
Reviews.Author: louischick
Reviews.Content: My family lives all over the country. I am expecting baby 2 in 8 weeks so I wanted to get the cousins and family together for a last hurrah! It was a short weekend so we had limited time at the parks and wanted to be close, economical yet fun and upscale. This property hit all of our expectations. 3 BRs, full kitchen, 2 baths, full LR and DR. Perfect for 7 people with 3 small kids. The pirate ship pool closed our decision from the beginning. Adults and kids all had a blast. Shopping directly next door at the outlets was a bonus and the onsite grocery store had EVERYTHING from beach towels, toys, to coffee every morning, wine and beer. We will be back for sure. Thank you for accomindating us so nicely on such a short stay but we left with a ton more memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Rooms were spacious with full amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Scouts40830
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. We booked a suite to accommodate two families with children. We had a full kitchen, laundry facilities and enough bathrooms for everyone! The pool was great, too. It was a bit of a walk from our hotel building. (The hotel has four or five buildings on the property). The location was very close to the Walt Disney Parks and grocery shopping. There was even a small outlet mall next door! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, WAY downhill from last time!”
Reviews.Author: obrien221
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort in December 2009, and had a splendid time. Obviously, we wanted to return on our next trip in July 2011. Boy, what a disappointment. One of our favorite things from last time was our interaction with the friendly and helpful staff. Sadly, they are all gone! We only recognized one clerk from last time, and when we asked what happened to everyone, we were told that a change in management caused everyone to leave! Well, as our stay progressed, we found this to be true. We had an issue with the cleanliness of our room, and left word for the manager to call us... three times. Nobody ever did. The entire attitude of the staff and management has changed since our last visit. The front clerks are apathetic and poorly trained, they let the phones ring off the walls, and when we finally did speak with TWO managers at check-out, neither of them seemed to know what was going on. We spoke with the "Guest Service" Manager, and she wasn't even interested. We stopped a young man, the "Assistant General" Manager, and he looked like a deer caught in headlights when we tried to talk to him. We were brushed off as if to say, We already have your money, so we don't care! Such a change from the delightful manager we dealt with last time. Aside from the staff, The pool was overcrowded, and there were considerably less chairs than on our last visit. They have abandoned their Kid's Activity Program, which my kids loved last time, and the rooms seemed dingy and dirty. MOST of this could be overcome by a friendly staff, but all the new people are clearly a result of their new managers; uninterested and not helpful or knowledgeable at all! We will never stay here again, and we encourage you to stay away!! So sad!!

Reviews.Title: “Great roomy condo close to Disney with fun pirate ship pool”
Reviews.Author: Shawn R
Reviews.Content: We (mom, dad, 11-y/o, and 6-y/o) enjoyed our stay here. We stayed in building 5 and paid the extra $20 to get a fireworks view, which was also a parking lot and highway view. I'm not sure that fireworks view was worth it because a pool view would be nice too and the fireworks were far away; however, it was nice and relaxing to see them in the distance on the last night of our Florida vacation. We had a two bedroom condo with one master bedroom/bath combo with nice 2-person Jacuzzi, huge shower (my 6-y/o loved hearing the echo in here when showering), toilet, large closet, plenty of storage, TV, and big comfy bed (can't remember if it was a king or queen). The second bedroom had two double beds, a TV, and storage with a separate larger bathroom next to that with full tub and shower, sink, and toilet. There was a compact washer/dryer combo in a closet/pantry off of the kitchen, which we used to do all of our laundry before going home in between eating dinner, swimming, getting ready for bed, and watching fireworks. It worked awesome. The kitchen included everything you could need to make any meals such as full stove, full fridge with great ice maker, microwave, coffee maker, pots, pans, lots of silverware, knives, glasses, can opener, etc.; however, I think it depends on what room you get on what the extras are included. The sitting area was large with a nice sofa and a few extra chairs, which were all clean and comfy. The balcony was right off of the living room and was nice at night. There was plenty of space in the two bedroom four a family of four and possibly more. We thought it might be nice to try the three bedroom with a group of friends for a nice economical way to do Disney, which, by the way, was very close. The pool area was great. We started our trip off with a pirate theme at Pirate's League at Magic Kingdom and the pirate ship sitting in the middle of the pool on our last night made a perfect end to this. Our younger son liked splashing around in the shallow end most of the time and our older one loved the pirate slide into the deeper side of the pool. We sat at a table right behind the ship and could see both playing at the same time. The staff were great at the pools and really watched the kiddos, especially on the slide. The drinks at the bar there were very very good and reasonably priced compared to other hotel bar areas we were at during our trip. There is an Irish Pub that looked great and was reasonably priced. The front desk clerk had even given us an additional coupon for here and we really were considering it. However, we ordered in some pizza and pasta from a nearby restaurant that had extremely cheap prices and delivered because we wanted to get some of our packing done for our flight out the next morning. It was very good, but I cannot remember the name of it now. :( This resort was a great value and we would highly recommend to larger families or groups of people planning on going to Disney. For families with young kids, we also liked Nickelodeon Suites. Our boys loved both!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much happy with everything”
Reviews.Author: epe105
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of the reviews before I came here so I followed a lot of the tips people put down in other posts. I called the week before and asked for a fireworks view in building 5. It's not guaranteed unless you pay 20 dollars a night, but they gave it to me when we checked in. Very happy about that. The fireworks view isn't great, but having a room in Building 5 is very clean and seems newer. We did not get the cleaning service. We took out our own trash, vacuumed, and did our own laundry. My 1.5 year old daughter loved the pool. We would go to the pool every afternoon after a morning at Disney. The zero entry was nice for my daughter. She also loved the mushrooms. Speaking of Disney, the location was great to go to the parks in the morning and come back to take a break before heading out again late afternoon. Walmart is an easy drive. The outlets next door is OK. I suggest going to the premium outlets 2.5 miles away on Vineland Avenue. They are much better and have a decent selection. The wireless internet was actually decent in our room. Check In was fast. The guy was very nice. We got a pack and play and a high chair. Parking was never a problem until one night after Magic Kingdom we stayed til the end. So we got home around 1AM. I parked on the street in front of Building 5. There were plenty of cars there, so I don't think it was an issue. But getting home at 10:30 every night, we never had an issue finding parking in the garage. We pretty much cooked breakfast and lunch everyday. So we had everything we needed. Overall, I had nothing to complain about and was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “NICE ROOM, FRIENDLY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: takethatrobbie
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very impressed. Our 2 bed apartment was huge, very clean, felt very safe here. Loved the balcony for sitting out eating and watching the world go by. Excellent central location to all the parks and great shopping. We liked the smaller pool - it was nice and quiet here. The staff were all very friendly and very helpful. Parking could be a problem if you came back later in the evening. - We always managed to park on site but had to walk a bit further some evenings to get to our apartment. -This was not a problem for us! We would all definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: UKCaptainscarlet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks as a family of five and had a 2 bedroom apartment in building 5. I was worried when I read the reviews before we went, which were mixed. On the positive side reception staff were very helpful. Our apartment was clean with good kitchen facilities - microwave, full cooker, large fridge etc, washing machine and dryer was excellent. Beds comfortable as were the pillows. We had flat screen tv's in both bedrooms and the living room. This is in contrast to other posts which seem to indicate there is a lot of variability between buildings with regard to cleanliness and equipment/facilties. On site there is a small convenience store with a pizza takeaway. The manager was very friendly and helpful. Internet wifi was available close to reception area or we managed to borrow an internet cable from reception. Gym facilties were poor. Didn't really go down to the pool much, as children were older but it seemed a very limited food menu from pool side bar. It certainly didn't entice me to try breakfast there. If we wanted a pool day we went to Aquatica which the kids loved. We didn't use the new spa facilties/book any massage/beauty treatments so I can't comment but overall it seems incongruous that it should have a new upmarket spa facility but no on-site decent restaurants (we never went to the Irish pub on site). I completely objected to paying for room cleaning-we were there for two weeks so I would have liked at least a weekly clean in the price. Location was convenient for several theme parks eg Aquatica, Sea world, Disney etc. . It was an easyish drive to Universal too. You do need your own car though. Outlet centre next door pretty poor but okay for an hour or so if you have time to spare. Would I stay again -no but it was fine for the time we were there and perhaps we were lucky with our apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Okay. Wish I could give it more praise.”
Reviews.Author: AmyLa1227
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 6 days at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. To make this review user-friendly I will point out the pros and cons: Pros. 1) Price was good. Plus we were upgraded from a small 4-bedroom suite to the large 4-bedroom suite. 2) Suite was huge! 3) Location to park was pretty convenient IF you had your own transportation. 4) Drinks from the poolside snack bar were gooood! 5) Free towels were supplied at the pirate pool. 5) Nice kitchen in suite. 6) Walmart close by to purchase food – good prices if you are used to Northeast pricing like we are – but must have own transportation. 7) The Irish Pub in the resort compound had good food and was decently priced. Cons. 1) Decor and furniture very tired and borderline outdated. Our furniture was dirty, a little ripped, and the drawers stuck on our dresser, so I kept my clothes in my suitcase. 2) Shuttle to parks was very inconvenient – only ran twice a day and you had to reserve it 24 hours in advance. 3) The elevator in our building backed up to our bedroom and made noise throughout the night. When we complained about it, they said we just had to deal with it or they would move us to another room. There were 8 of us, so we dealt with it. 4) Funky smell in hallways and suite. 5) The overall maintenance was lacking. The ‘resort’ could use a little TLC. 6) Our room keys intermittently worked. 7) Snack bar food was horrendous and criminally overpriced. 8) TVs were pretty old. 9) You had to pay extra for maid service - so we didn't. The place was fine. We will try another place if we go to Disney World again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: haegrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort June 20 - 26th, 2011 and the resort was nice on the outside but crappy on the inside. They were stains on the carpet and furniture. The jet bath tub was broken and it was very noisy. I will never stay there again. There are many resorts in Orlando and this is not one of their best. Parking was also awful. We had to park on the street every night. They need more parking spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! So much fun for the entire family!”
Reviews.Author: beavair
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 5 overlooking the pool and it was awesome. Great room, view, and especially location! If only those Florida thunderstorms would have cooperated so we could have enjoyed the pool more. My kids (and husband) loved the slide! And I enjoyed a drink by the pool. (A bit spendy, but had one for a treat.) Internet was painfully slow, but only needed it for maps, etc... Front desk was super friendly. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “We're definitely going back!!!”
Reviews.Author: jevoch
Reviews.Content: It was very relaxing for the whole family! We had an amazing view of the pool. The kids enjoyed the giant pirate boat with a built in slide. The location was very conveneint: right next to an outlet mall. We could basically walk to go shopping. The kitchen was excellent because I saved money not going out to eat every night

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: momzillas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in May 2011 as part of a 2 part package holiday booked through Virgin. We chose this accomodation as we were holidaying with friends who were staying on Disney and this was only 5 mins drive from where they were. We were staying at this hotel as a party of 4 adults & 2 children therfore we had booked a 3 bedroom apt. When we arrived the check in was quick & smooth & the lady on check in was very friendly and advised us we had been given a room on a high floor as you get great view of the fireworks from Disney which was great for the children however as we were so high we didnt use the balcony as I didnt like being so high with young children and in future would choose a lower floor over the view of the fireworks. Having read some of the reviews before we came I was slightly worried as to what the standard of the room would be and as we went up to the room I was still concerned as the communal areas are quite dated and could do with a redecoration but this is purely cosmetic it is still nice and clean. When we arrived at our room we were delighted, our apartment was FAB, it had a lovely modern kitchen with a big oven, hob, microwave and fridge freezer. The dining area had a lovely big dining table, it is open plan with the comfortable lounge area and 3 spacious bedrooms all with plasma tvs and a family bathroom with shower. The master bedroom had a large shower, jaquzzi bath and a seperate toliet. It also had a walk in wardrobe. As were were only staying here for 8 nights we didnt really use the pool area apart from once for about 20 mins just to let the children have a swim before we went out on the evening but from what we saw it was great for kids and has a pirate ship with waterslide. The hotel is in a great location it was 5-10 minsdrive from all the Disney parks making it easy to return to the hotel to get changed and go back on the night. It is about 15 mins from international drive & universal studios. The bar / resturant next to the hotel "Frankie O Farrells" is typical pub food but tasty and good value for money and if you ask at the hotel reception they will give you discount vouchers. There is a small supermarket on the complex which has a pizza hut takeaway inside but for basics like milk etc it is very expensive you are much better going to Walmart which is 5 mins away. It is really easy to find you turn left at the traffic lights as you leave the hotel then it is a straight drive 5 mins (max) up on the right hand side. If I was to find a fault, the only one I could find with this hotel was when we checked in we asked if there was a cot in the room as we had requested this as an extra when booking for our 2 year old as they only come as standard for under 2s. The lady said that there wasn't but She would arrange for one to be sent up straight away. We then went to our room unpacked and went out for dinner however when we returned to the room 2 hours later there was still no cot this was not ideal at 9pm when we had a tried 2 year old who had been on a long flight, without much sleep and awake for nearly 20 hours ! We rang the reception to complain and they promised they would have a cot to us within half an hour but we said as we were so tired just to leave it until the morning and the baby would sleep in our bed, we then when we had got everyone settled and went to bed however we woken an hour later with the arrival of the cot !!!! Overall though we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “resort is nice but condos need updating badly”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELMOMS2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 2301 building 8100 (Owner had told us building 8000 but when we got there there was no building 8000 the hotel desk had our reservation and it was 8100) I assume he must not stay there much. Where to begin... The grounds are beautiful and the pools are fantastic. Our third floor balcony overlooked the small pool and that was very nice. ALL the kids teenages and six year old LOVED the bigger pool/splash area and slide on the pirate ship side. The pools were a lot of fun.. The condo however... well... Carpet is very dirty.. You can see the stains on it everywhere. Furniture in living room looks old dirty and VERY worn out. Air vent in bedroom in of the bedrooms wasn't working or wasn't working well (not sure they were too high to tell) but one of the bedrooms stayed hot unless the rest of the unit was freezing. Stocked kitchen was anything but. As far as the cookware.. You got one skillet a small pot and a large pot.. that's it.. There was no baking sheet for biscuits, no spatula, the toaster pops up sometimes. The worst is the first two days we drank really icky tasting coffee. We thought it was just the water wasn't the greatest there. We bought gallon of spring water and it was still bad.. Come to find out the coffee pot had MOLD in it.. Once I cleaned it and ran some vinegar few it a few times the coffee was fine but my family drank mold water for two days.. When you pay around 1300 for a week it should at least be clean and updated, we could have got a place like this for much less money but we wanted something nice.. Oh the TVS are not the flat screen they are the older big projection tv in the living room and two older smaller tvs in the bedrooms. . Oh and while I am on bedrooms.. The beds are hard, the bedspreads weren't clean and I bet reused because they are the old fashioned motel type bedspreads. We put them in the closet. The pillows were the hardest I ever felt. We went to walmart and bought the 4.00 pillows and then slept much better. Oh some nights we couldn't find a place to park and had to park at the other end of the block or leave car on street because the lot was full. They were also struck by lightening and the internet was not working or messed up most of the week. Oh one more positive is there is a hot tub in the master. The hot tub in the master bedroom has cool lights in it and is very nice and relaxing after a long day at the parks.. We will not be staying there again but a different unit may be much nicer because like I said the grounds were great. We even saw lizards all over the place and it is close to disney..

Reviews.Title: “Very loud hotel-up to 2am every night by loud family above us and partiers”
Reviews.Author: mkcbcn
Reviews.Content: I would not say this is a family place. When I first arrived I should have known better as I held the elevator door open for 2 twenty something guys using the luggage cart to roll in several cases of beer. Although there are many families staying here, there are also alot of partiers and non families using the inexpensive prices and suite sizes to have a cheap, party vacation. Its basically spring break to alot of these people. So lets go through the good and the bad. The good: good location. Close to Walmart, gas station, route 4 both to Tampa and Orlando. Lots of places to eat within a close driving range. The suites have kitchens & washer/dryer. The bad: the suite needs a renovation. the sofa was gross. I wouldn't let my son sit on it. Mystery stains on the carpet in several places as well as mystery splatters on the walls in all the rooms. I had to use soap& water to clean the outside patio furniture so we could use it. Parking is bad. Not enough spaces. The Pool is fine during the week but on the weekends it is pure chaos. Wall to wall people saving the seats with towels. The pool water was a slick of sun tan lotion floating ontop of it. The first night was fine & quiet but Sunday night was a different story. A family checked in above me & their kids would run across the floor until 2am. I thought ok they are excited &it's their first night in Disney. But no this lasted every single night for the next 7 nights. They would start up their jet tub between 1 and 2am which sounds like a boat motor running above my bedroom. I called the front desk every night starting at midnight & they claimed the family was portugesse & didn't understand english yet the management never offered to move me. I spent every night of my vacation suffering underneath this ignorant family. At one point I resorted to banging the ceiling with the ironing board at 2:30am to try &make the kids stop running. Again, Management did nothing except say they were sorry. On the last night, the same thing from the family above me heightened with a new twist-a balcony party from the room a floor down. 5 guys drinking and shouting on the balcony until 4am. Again, Management couldnt stop them. In fact they claimed security couldnt figure out what room it was. Excuse me? Hello walk outside, look up and there they are-5 guys drunk off their butts at 2am screaming on the balcony. How can you not tell who was doing it. I got got two hours of sleep before I had to get up to catch my plane. My son who is only 11 was kept up every night as was I. We were both so tired from a week of ignorant people and spineless management. I actually couldnt believe I actually paid money for this. Even when I checked out, not one offer to compensate me or any offer to have a manager speak to me. I really cant recommend this place to any family. Management should be ashamed of themselves for letting their hotel be so out of control. One last comment is in reference to the on site Irish Pub-went in on the second night. Arrived at 4pm. hardly anyone in the place yet the floor was filthy. My shoes were sticking the floor under our table and I actually had to push food to the side with my foot that was on the floor. Food was ok. Not bad not great. Ok. As we were leaving I noticed the back of my son's shirt was covered with ketchup. I went back to the booth and saw that the booth seat had ketchup all over it. it was not from him as it was half dry and smeared all over the booth seat and backing to the seat. So I cant even recommend the restaurant. I normally do not leave comments at all when I have a bad experience but I stayed here based on the reviews from trip advisor people and did alot of research on the best family place to stay and really thought this was it. It wasnt. Do not let anyone fool you into thinking this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantsatic hotel/condo, we had a fabulous time, would definately go back.”
Reviews.Author: anna2302_11
Reviews.Content: Easy transfer from the hotel, not many people on the coach so arrived much sooner. Fast check in and extremely helpful and very plesant staff. Asked for pool view (which we got) we were in building 5 over looking the pirate ship. Absolutely fantastic huge room, 2 bedrooms plus sitting room/diner and balcony ( very safe for kids) we were on the 7th floor, our kids 11, 10 &3. We had a kingsize bed and kids had 2 doubles in their room + a sofa bed which we did not need to use. Fully equipped kitchen, plus iron/ board and hoover. After each day walking around the parks, it was a pleaure to come back to our room. There was room service for an additional fee but with having a washer/dryer/ hoover etc we were happy to do it ourselves. We had a couple of rest days as we were exhausted from walking around the parks so the pirate ship/pool was superb, we all had a great time on the slide!! We used hotel transport to and from the parks, this really was our only gripe, the bus was usually full and you do have to stand, but a 2nd bus would also turn up (which was empty) pick up those who could not get on the 1st bus and then still go to the same destination!! This we did no understand! apart from that, it as always on time both to pick up and drop off and was daily. The parks are very near and the bus drops you at epcot/univeral/sea world. We did not drive so the walmart was around $8 in a taxi. There is an onsite shop which was extremely expensive $4.99 for a litre bottle of water. $1 for a gallon of water at walmart!! The LBV outlet stores are next door and were great. Altogether we had an amazing 3week holiday at LBV and would definately stay here again!! got and our room

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKaren1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 br/3 bath condo from June 11th through 17th. Pros: The location is great - easy to get to all of the Disney parks, restaurants and shopping The onsite restaurant is good and reasonably priced for both food and drinks. Maintenance responded very quickly to our tv and dryer issues late one night - they arrived within about a half hour even though they were short-handed that night. We also got extra towels promptly after checking in. The condo was very spacious - we had plenty of room in both the bedrooms and common areas. (Note - there were five adults and one child in our party) The price was great - we couldnt have gotten three hotel rooms for what we paid per night at this place. Plus, we were able to save money by eating breakfast in our condo every morning. Cons: The fitted sheet on the king size bed came off every night like other reviewers mentioned. This just got to be annoying after a couple of days and waking up on the bare mattress is kind of gross. The furnishings could probably use updating. I realize that a lot of people who stay here have kids and kids are tough on sofas and such, but they should consider replacing the furnishings in the near future. They seemed to just have a "funk" about them with stains and wear. The line to check in was long. I guess this wasn't really a "con" for me because I was just glad to be standing and not sitting in the car anymore (long drive) but I can see how this would be frustrating for others. I would recommend this hotel to people who have reasonable expectations about traveling. I've stayed in countless Hampton Inns and Courtyards and found this to be comparable in cleanliness and furnishings. You get what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Friendly staff convenient amenities.”
Reviews.Author: trapoza
Reviews.Content: Nice condo complex. Large! Everything you need for a family of 4 in the 2 bedroom suite. Good price. Wifi is fair. Parking not good. Everything else was great especially my check-in. Erik was very welcoming, accommodating and enthusiastic. It truly seemed important to him that I felt taken care of and could call him with anything I needed. Thank you Erik for your dedication to your position.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hardly a Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StarlightAZ
Reviews.Content: This is the first time Tripadvisor reviews have let me down. I was truly disappointed with our stay at Lake Buena Vista. Pulling up to the resort my first impression was that it was a nice resort. The location is great. The rooms are a nice size, however I couldn't believe how poor they maintained the furniture and accessories. The master bedroom's dresser corner was banged up, the chair in the living room had a stain or possibly a bleach spot, the television remote had tape on the back to prevent batteries from coming out (very tacky). But, to top it off as I was tucking my daughter into bed I noticed a stain on the blanket (yuck). When I asked for a replacement we received one with an orange stain on it instead. In addition, the parking is terrible. We drove around for 10 mins before realizing we would have to park by the front desk and walk through the resort. After a day at the parks, its the last thing anyone would want to deal with. Also, the free internet service was nice to have if you could stay logged in. Our laptops kept freezing up. The pirate ship pool looked like a lot better on the photos. In person it looks low budget. Its not what you would expect from a resort that is marketing itself as a luxury facility. it definitely was NOT worth paying $141 + taxes/per night. We were suppose to have stayed for 3 nights, but I just didn't trust the cleanliness of the resort, so one night was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: travlinmatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in the 3 bedroom suite. It was nice and roomy. It seemed very clean and fresh. We had a large master bedroom with king size bed, garden tub and spacious walk in shower. The pool was very nice and quite chilly even in June! The kids loved the pirate ship and towels were provided at poolside which was nice. Here are the negatives. 1. The bed was not very comfortable or plush. I am a little picky and don't find many hotel beds comfortable. It was a little to firm for my liking. 2. The window in the bedrooms had faux wood blinds but no black-out shades which allowed a lot of parking lot light through the window. I like it dark. 3. The Irish pub-goers were a bit noisy in the parking lot late at night. Probably wouldn't be a big deal if you stayed in the other buildings but the pub was right below us. The noise didn't keep my daughter up which is good. Overall it was a nice place for the money and I would recommend it for families looking to stay in a suite for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: sniff12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 31410, had a view of the pool and pirate ship slide. We originally booked a one bedroom but they put us in a 2! The master bedroom had a king bed, 2 sinks, bathroom, huge walk in closet and garden tub. The kitchen was nice with all utensils and pans and plates you needed. The 2nd bedroom had 2 twin beds, closet and a bathroom as well. The resort was quiet at night, We did eat at the irish pub but not the pizza hut. We swam in the pool everyday, my son loved the pool, hot tub and pirate ship slide. They do have a tiki bar by the pool, but be careful, it is expensive! I ordered a pina colada which was 8.75 and my husband got a crown and coke which was 9.10!!!!! If you rent a car ( which i suggest you do) go to the walmart which is about 5 minutes away and stock up on food and drinks there to save you money! check in and check out was fast. I loved having the washer/ dryer in the room, we took home clean clothes which was nice. This place is very nice and close to everything, about 5 minutes from walmart, about 8 min to Target and plenty of restaurants and things to do around orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Great time but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: mjiukdey
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful, very attentive to requests and the kids loved the pool with the pirate ship & slide. We loved the condo style with separate bedrooms & full kitchen, but the maintenance should be far better to earn 4 stars (Hotwire). The furniture was old & damaged and the carpets need replacement. We will stay there again, but not expecting a 4 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, great location”
Reviews.Author: Oshawagal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently on a trip with our children and mother in law. We had a 2 bedroom unit which was perfect! 2 beds in 1 room (they list them as single beds but these were bigger than any single bed I have seen...almost a double bed I would say), pull out couch in living area, great balcony we ate breakfast on every day and a huge master bedroom with king size bed. The full kitchen had everything we needed - dishwasher, utensils, plates, pots, full size fridge & stove/oven. Even had a washing machine & dryer and 2 full bathrooms. It was a great location - right in the middle of it all without being in the crazy busy area. It was a 10 minute drive to Disney and a 10 minute drive to Universal. Easy access to nearby restaurants although they had an amazing Pub in the complex - great food & drink. Also within walking distance was a great outlet mall with everything you could need. Great pool for adults & children - has a pirate ship/waterslide that the children loved! Pool was a little chilly on the cloudy days but great otherwise. Staff were excellent! Very friendly & accommodating. You will want a car being here though. They do have a shuttle that you can book to Disney - it drops you off at a certain time in the morning & only comes back once in the evening - so you have to stay at the park all day. With a car, you can come & go as you please. Mother in law tried out the spa & said it was amazing! This is the only place I would stay in Florida now - we loved it & will come back again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shayla_bug
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at this resort for 6 days and loved every minute of it. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo in the new bulding 5 right next to the pool. Each condo is alittle different when it come to the items stocked but it stocked enough to prepare a meal. The convience store is extremely high. We needed hot sauce, it was 3.99 for a bottle. There is a walmart about a mile down. The location was great only 5-10 minutes from the parks!!!!! My girls loved the pool and the hot tubs!!! The check in was a breeze. This is a great place for a family on a budget,. We will definately be back

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: cathybSavannah_Ga
Reviews.Content: As frequent travelers to Disney, I have to start by saying that we always stay on Disney property. But since we were doing more than just Disney this trip we decided to stay elsewhere. We had the 2 bedroom unit and it was mostly just as nice as units we have stayed in at Disney, for 1/4 the price. I was pleased with the cleanliness of the unit. It was quite large. Plenty of room for the 4 of us. The shower in the master bath is HUGE. Although the bathroom floor was a bit sticky, but that is just a small thing. I can overlook that. Location is good. Only a few minutes drive to any of the parks. The pool looked nice, but we did not have time to use it. Wish we could have found the time. Also did not try the pub or any of the other amenities. All and all, I would recommend this resort and would stay here again. I give it 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey, but no regrets!”
Reviews.Author: kdjl
Reviews.Content: Since this is a timeshare resort, we made reservations via Expedia. Our family loved the two bedroom villa. The rooms were clean and comfortably accommodated our family of 4. Although the price was a little higher than we anticipated, we were pleased with the accommodations. The resort was clean and well maintained. If you're thinking about purchasing a timeshare, please reconsider. The investment just doesn't add up. This applies to any timeshare you purchase, not just the particular resort. After paying your mortgage, you still have to pay a yearly "maintenance" fee plus property taxes. Furthermore, you're pretty much stuck with the same place year after year. However, if you just have to have a timeshare, this one is pretty nice. When we decide to visit Orlando again, this place will be on our "Top 5 List" of places to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: ive95
Reviews.Content: Front Desk service over the phone is TERRIBLE!! I thought the client was supposed to be well assisted. Their computer system sucks. They say we are not in the system. And how they charged our credit card?? We stayed 3 nights and need a receipt, and can't have it because we are NOT in the system. Plus, the air conditioning didn't work properly all weekend and never fixed it, the fridge didn't close and never fixed it, the sofa bed was missing two springs and that they fixed, we asked for extra pillows when we got our room around 11 pm and received them at 6 am on a Saturday, that with a don't disturb sign on, still knocked twice to give us the pillows! We definitely won't return!! And this is my experience. I'm glad that many people had a nice experience. That's why there are many choices, for different preferences! Don't criticize because you don't believe me. This is a venting tool!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: AEL77
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a large, inexpensive suite for our family plus grandparents and aunt to stay while visiting Disney and this was perfect!! At first we had booked a 3 bedroom suite but realizing that it wasn't close to the pirate ship pool and restaurant, we asked to upgrade to the 4 bedroom. Unfortunately, the 4 bed was not available at the time but when we arrived to check-in, we had it!! The manager that we had worked with had noted our request and had upgraded us - it was a fantastic surprise. The suite was perfect for our family - everyone had their own room, the kitchen was updated, everything was clean, and the common area and balcony were huge! My kids had ample space to move around as did all the adults. We also loved the pool and enjoyed a dinner at the Irish Pub. The grocery store on property is very expensive, but the Pizza Hut was good and fairly priced and a Super Walmart and Publix grocery store are minutes away. We highly recommend this resort and thank all the employees for their wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: SouthFLAFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Cons Very poorly maintained rooms . . . Broken curtains in living room No sun/light block curtains in rooms, which made it difficult to sleep past 7 a.m. after sunrise. Additionally, the pool lights (similar to stadium lights) which illumnated both bedrooms made it difficult to sleep. The lights were still on at 10:30 p.m. Extremely worn and dirty couches. Lots of stains and pulled threads. Extremely dirty showers and bathrooms. We took photos of the mold and dirt that could easily be removed with some Clorox Clean Up. There's a $5 charge for fresh towels and trash removal. I guess times are tough. Bring your one Purex 3-in-1 laundry detergent to do your own towels. The minimal kitchenware available was dirty and over used. Extremely dirty carpet and tile (the kids' feet were black in minutes). Very long check-in line and long wait time.
