Hallways dirty and smelly. No DVD player in the room. Paper thin sheets that didn't cover whole master bed. Bathroom sinks do not drain. Sludge/mold in bricks on pool deck. Long line at check out. Pros: Kids thought pool was fun (only went after 5 pm). Bartender remembered our name and was friendly. Location is close to Walmart for groceries (and cleaning supplies to sanitize your room). Close to Disney parks. Good parking garage. I found the ad for this resort in the AAA Going Places magazine, so I thought we'd give it a try. We most definitely will not be staying here again. There are two other very nice condo/time share rental hotels in the area that are much cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent self catering suites”
Reviews.Author: Luvlylynn
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat everything already said in previous reviews... these are fantastic, large, well equipped self catering suites with a lovely jacuzzi tub in every room, and a great pool for non-park days. Perfect for the independent traveller, able to get themselves around... use taxis and shuttles if you don't have a car... be brave and walk to Walmart, it's literally just across a busy road or $7 each way in a cab. Be there early if you want the busy 9.00 and 18.20 shuttles, it's that simple... the drivers do their best to accommodate everyone, but with unpredictable numbers, there are sometimes delays. The reception staff are courteous and very helpful, and the Expedia concierge service is very useful for park tickets and reservations. I would definitely book again and recommend to anyone wanting to stay a bit closer to Disney but away from the madness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, rooms fab, location perfect (5 miles from Magic Kingdom)”
Reviews.Author: MRC500
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 14th May around 6pm, check-in took about 20mins as there was a small queue, however we were dealt with efficiently. One thing to watch out for here was the Hotel Resort fee of $9.50 per day? We booked through Thomas Cook and were told nothing of this, this to be fair is not the Hotels fault but Thomas Cook's and have taken it up with them, we still had to pay the Hotel on departure though and claim the money back in the UK. We requested building 5, was told this was the newest building, not too high up as the hotel has 15 floors! and a view of the nightime fireworks....we were given the lot. Level 8 which was perfect and a great view of the fireworks at night, this was thanks to Daryl the General Manager of the hotel, thank you very much. Rooms were fabulous, spacious and clean. We had a three bedroom apartment and had TV's in each of the rooms together with a larger TV in the living/ dining/ kitchen area. Our appartment had Air-Con which worked well at night and wasn't noisey and our room had a Spa which I have to say is worthwhile using after the Theme Parks. Every room had a double bed which my kids thought were great and ample space to hang up clothes etc. There was no room service but to fair we only slept in our appartment, we were out from 0900 till 9pm. Pool was fun and fairly quiet, we used this around 3 times to chill out. Pool temp was a little cold but to you soon got used to it and the beach effect is great for small kids. There is one flume which is situated in the boat and fairly tame. Pool loungers were comfortable and they also offer pool towels, albeit a little small but useful, you just help yourself to as many as you need. Pool Bar was good, served lager, soft drinks, snacks etc and charged $4.70 for a Bud/ Bud light which was reasonable. The pool bar stayed open to around 10-11pm. Minor point to note here was that after 5pm the pool is shaded, which may suit some people if they have been by the pool all day, however if you have been at the parks all day and want to lie by the pool in the evening sun, forget it! Although the pool is open until 10pm so the kids can play all night. There is a small shop on site which is open untill 1am so fairly handy for bits and pieces, however v expensive - example milk, water and bread came to $19. If you have a car and I would suggest that you do have one if you are staying at this hotel, drive out of the hotel turn left and you have all the major supermarkets you need - Target etc, there is also a Wallgreens which is a chemist, out of the hotel, turn right which is handy for bits and bobs. To top this there are also outlet stores within walking distance - Nike/Timberland/ Gap to name a few which are open from 10am-9pm. Driving to all of the Disney Resorts takes no more than 20mins, this hotel is the perfect location - Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, Typhoon Lagon - great place to go with the kids, they have a huge wave pool and every 2 mins send a 6ft wave which is great to ride on! Blizzard Beach is the other Water Park and is fab, this is better for younger kids as they have a Training area, up to 12yrs only, and has some great areas for the kids. The Hotel does provide free transport to the Theme Parks however we used our own car, be aware that Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom all charge $14 to park you car! If you are heading to Florida and need somewhere to stay near the Theme Parks this is the place to stay.....only 5 -8miles away from Disney Resorts! Thanks again Daryl and his team at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa! Cheers Mike

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: fawkesette
Reviews.Content: This was our very first trip to Orlando so we took time to choose the correct Hotel for our family of 9!! What can i say, the 3 bedroom apartment was very spacious and had outstanding facilities, particularly in the kitchen. The guest service were brilliant too, giving us advice on where to eat and even providing us maps on how to get to places. The location is very good, about 10/15 mins drive to the Disney parks, close to Walmart and lots of good places to eat. It is also a wee bit away from the biz of some other hotel areas. The pools were good, the large pirate ship one was great for the kids and the quieter pool was perfect for chiling in the peace and quiet. As for complaints about the pool being cold, that's just daft when its 35 degrees u need it to be refreshing!! Yes wifi in our hotel room did come and go but it was perfect in other areas of the hotel, i guess with such a large complex its not going to be perfect everywhere, and hey u r on holiday ditch the internet and chill. I don't understand why anyone is complaining, they must have been on a different holiday from us as we thought the hotel was wonderful, not outdated!! A superb holiday and would def go back!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE TO STAY BUT DONT BE RIPPED OFF”
Reviews.Author: onlinebakerysupplies
Reviews.Content: We arrived just after 5pm and check in was very quick and efficient. We stayed in a 2 bed appartment in building 5 over looking the pool. Floor 7 The appartment was huge, and spotless Great facilities, including full kitchen, lots of cooking utensils, massive fridge with ice maker - Brilliant Cant understand why anyone would want to moan about the appartments, and I disagree with everything that has been said about them being dirty. Housekeeping is extra if you wanted to pay for it, but we managed fine as there is a large washer & dryer, hoover, iron etc. The bed sheets also fitted fine lol The convenience store, located near building 1 is handy for bread and milk, but prices are scary. Walmart is a short taxi ride away, as is publix. We just got everything there that we needed. Frankie Farrels, irish pub on site is also good for meals, and we ate there several times, and catered for ourselves in the appartment most evenings. There is also a pizza hut situated in the convenience store, and several leaflets for room delivery, Frankies also provide a room service, which was great The hotel taxis are a complete rip off and will charge you at least $10-$15 over and above the actual cost of the yellow metered cabs to take you to disney world etc eg. we were charged $28 to get to Hollywood Studios from the appartment, but took a yellow cab home at a cost of $13 The hotel offers free shuttles to and from Epcot (where you can pick up Disneys own shuttles around the rest of Walt Disney) Universal, Sea World Times can be a bit restrictive, but we managed ok. A car would definitely be ideal and recommended, as all major attractions are only around 10-20minutes away Blizzard Beach is highly recommended, especially with younger children Dont miss the Fantasmic Show at Hollywood Studios - definitely the best show - we made the mistake of queing for 2 hours, as we were told that it is very popular (which it is) but, you can quite easily get good seats in the ampitheatre just before the start of the show, as you will be able to see everything from wherever you are. The only downside of the parks for us was the extreme heat, it was very very hot & humid, with queues for the most popular rides taking up to 90 minutes in some cases in the extreme heat. So it is advisable to get there early to avoid the longer queues, as the parks were extemely busy The pool was a great feature to return to after a hot day in the parks, yes it is cold to initially get into, but once you`re in it is fab. It stays open to after 10pm THe pool bar is good for snacks, but not the best choice ever Overall we had a fantastic holiday, and would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great spot-a gem for the family!”
Reviews.Author: famillecouturier
Reviews.Content: You cannot be asking for a better place to stay. The 2 bedrooms condo are very spacious. We really appreciated the kitchen, the dishwasher, washer/dryer, 3 TVs and mostly the pirate ship pool. Kids just loved the place...so did the parents. So close to everything (Disney, Universal Studios, Sea World). For even more convenience, there is a pizza, small general store and restaurant right there! Even a wal-mart a block away or the outlets shops. Many restaurants near by as well. The condo was in prestine conditions. Would highly recommend for family or extended family.

Reviews.Title: “great place ,,would recommend”
Reviews.Author: MARKREA32
Reviews.Content: very nice appartment ,main bedroom shower is huge could fit a family of five in one go !!also got jacuzzi walk in wardrobe large chest of drawers ample storage space - safe in walk in wardrobe along with iron and ironing board - kitchen well fitted dishwasher ect, also washer and tumble dryer ,main living room good size with fold out sofa if req ?? Poolside bar BEN ,JASON you guys are cool ( pool bar needs to have an happy hour to keep it busy and buzzing all day long) - the pool is realy good for kids and adults Frankie o''farrells bar is good when its full up after pool bar is closed lot of people give bad reviews for food price and portion size no complaints from me ,,fish and ships huge and tasty also simple sandwhich like ship buttey /fried eggs yum yum all in all we had an awsome time and would recommend for everybody -PS go out the main entrance turn left Walmart straight up the road for all your provisions / turn right 2 miles down road and youve got crossroads ect -only negative point you will find it very hard to find the location via your GPS/SATNAV

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you come prepared! Read my suggested "BRING" list”
Reviews.Author: DeFamily_x4
Reviews.Content: We traveled with another family with small children, making 8 of us total. Stayed in the 3BR, and were placed in Building 2. I have no complaints about cleanliness - everything in our unit seemed clean, no mold or dust anywhere. The kitchen is well stocked with dishware, but a little lean on pots and pans. We're very glad we brought our own pans, since nothing was nonstick. There also was not a flat pan, which I brought my own for pancakes. Coffee maker worked well, and there was a set of bowls that came in handy for fruit and salad and for mixing ingredients. NO MEASURING UTENSILS or CUPS, so bring your own if you need them for anything. Note to all: Don't forget any food if you're bringing your own, because the "convenience store" on property is like $5 and up for EVERYTHING (items that would have been about $2 or less at Walmart). If you have time, run to Walmart just down the road. The whirlpool tub in the master bathroom was lovely. Ended up using it every night, and even gave 4 kids a bath in it. Master shower was spacious enough to add a couple kids, too. No blackout shades or even curtains in the bedrooms - just wood blinds. Worked better than most to block out the light, but if your kids need absolute dark, you will be disappointed. Bedrooms were roomy. We managed to squeeze 4 kids in the twin bedroom, including a floor air mattress and a pack n' play. I rarely heard other guests while in our unit. Sometimes heard some noises, but in general I was barely aware of our neighbors. Check-in took awhile. It was past 4 o'clock, and just ONE person behind the front desk with a mounting line of guests. I was 3rd in line and it took 20 minutes. Seems like they should have had more than one person helping for CHECK-IN! Also request more towels if you have a large group. I think we had 4 bath towels in our 3 BR unit. The proximity to Disney is awesome. My daughter actually said, and I quote, "Wow! Our hotel is REALLY close to Disney!" upon passing the gateways to the kingdom after only a few minutes in the car. By far my biggest complaint is the comfort of the beds. I noticed a lot of people complaining about the bedsheets not fitting, so we checked ours before sleeping and tucked them in nice and tight, and never had a problem during our stay. However, the PILLOWS are like bricks. I have heard people talk about hard pillows before, but honestly have never had truly hard pillows until now. I meant to take a picture of them, but forgot. If you press your hand into them, nothing moves. Your hand will not press into the pillow, it just stays there on top. Imagine sleeping on that. After a sleepless night I asked the front desk if they had any softer pillows, but the skeptical look on the clerk's face told me this was it. The 2nd night we all took the pillows from the couches, covered them with spare bedsheets, and slept much better. For the price, this is a really great place to stay, so long as you're prepared to bring a few extra items. Things that were there: paper towels, dish soap and sponge, dishwasher detergent, coffee, shampoo conditioner bar soap lotion, teapot, blender, can opener, saucepans, skillet, nesting set of plastic bowls, service for 8. BRING: Wipes to clean off surfaces, since there's no housekeeping during your stay Soft pillows, since I'm pretty certain the 3rd little pig used these for his house Extra cooking supplies and measuring cups if you plan to cook while there Clothespins or clips to attach blanket to windows if you need complete black in the bedroom Coffee filters (coffee provided, but no filters - we used paper towels and it seemed to work okay)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative to staying at expensive Disney resorts!”
Reviews.Author: jntsuperstars
Reviews.Content: My party consisted of 5 adults and 1 toddler. We stayed in a 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom (St. Lucia) suite in Building 2. The set-up of the suite was spacious and had a nice patio space on the balconey. The suite was relatively clean but I did wipe down the counters and tables before using them. There were definitely a lot of crumbs on the floor and under the appliances from prior guests and I believe that is why tiny little bugs were roaming around the kitchen (but once I bleached the counters they were gone). Two annoyances come to mind. One was that the mattress pads did not fit any of the beds and kept coming undone while you slept or laid in bed: this occured for both king beds and both twin beds so seemingly the resort is using the wrong sizes or they shrunk over the years of use. Annoying but not a deal-breaker for me. The other annoyance was that the blinds in the bedrooms were not room-darkening which would have helped naptime for our toddler. Our solution was to use an unused comforter to block the window which made a huge difference. Again, not a deal-breaker. We were on the 7th floor and it was quiet at night which we appreciated. We never had to wait long for an elevator or to check-in/out and parking was not an issue for us (we were usually back at the resort by 9pm). The pub is convenient and the food was decent. The pool was clean and has a pirate ship with a slide going through it but please note this is not meant for toddlers and young children. The lobby conveniently allows its guests to print out their flight boarding passes for free and guest services made good recommendations on restaurants and places to go. All the Disney parks are within 15 mins of the resort and the outlets are right next store (walking distance). The grounds of the resort aren't exactly a beautiful spa-like atmosphere but it was clean and we felt safe in our surroundings. All in all a nice place to stay without paying Disney prices.

Reviews.Title: “Started off bad with a 45 minute check-in...”
Reviews.Author: Valvelifter
Reviews.Content: Currently staying in bldg 5 Cons: - bedsheets wrong size - carpets horribly dirty, socks are black after a 15 minutes - daughter has some mysterious "mosquito" bites, we are seriously wondering if they are bed bugs... - took me 45 mins to check in, staff were useless. - wi-fi is horrible, always asking to reauthenticate, kicks me out every 15 minutes - pool is cold!! It is right in the middle of 2 large buildings, not enough sun to warm the pool comfortably - not enough parking - guest services never calls back when asked Cons - spacious apartment - kitchen new, fridge, stove work properly

Reviews.Title: “Could be perfect with a few updates”
Reviews.Author: clpapaof3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights at the LBV Resort. The place was packed when we arrived and the check-in took about 30 minutes. We had pre-paid a while back and put on our reservation that we requested Building 5, as we heard it was newer and closer to the pool. The reservations mistook our words for please not building 5 so we did not get that request. The lady at the front desk tried her best to switch our room but there was simply nothing available. They put us in the 3BR 2BT in Building 1, which actually turned out to be better as we were closer to the store, the game room, and pub. Everything about the room was outdated, from the TV's to the carpet. The toilet paper roll in the master bathroom was installed to far apart and would stay on the hinges. Don't know how you could install it wrong, moreover leave it wrong. All of the drawers in every room were difficult to open due to bent hinges. We turned in a long list of items broken or about to break when we checked out. They seemed shocked at the front desk so it will be interesting to see if they do anything to fix the items. Besides the "out-datedness", everything else was perfect. They provided us with a pack-n-play and high chair for our 20 months old and they worked out perfectly. The pool could have been fun, but it, even in 90 degree heat, the water was quite cold and my children were more apt to wanting to get in the hot tub than be in the pool. Location was about 3 miles from the Disney World property with just a matter of 2 turns. This was awesome after those long days when you just wanted to get back home and rest. We had a blast there and we would quite possibly return if we could get the same deal. However, we visitied some friends who were at another off-site resort quite similar to ours and the atmoshpere was much cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: ronsuetaylor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the area many times, but have never stayed here before. This was a hidden gem. Just a very short drive from the Disney Village (3 minutes). Cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I loved it and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt have high expectations but pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: natnath
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this resort. We got a very cheap deal and where not expecting much. The apartment although not modern was clean and well looked after. The rooms and living area are spacious. There is a charge for housekeeping during the stay. There are 2 pool areas. One in the main building that is busier with a pool bar and slide, and one for the different tower blocks that is quiet. The lobby is big and very nice with free wifi, wifi not available in tower blocks. The staff are very friendly and helpful, we booked our Disney and dinner reservations through them and got a deal- special thanks to ant! The resort has a small grocery store as well as a pub. Right around the corner is an outlet centre. Besides that everything else is far so I highly recommend renting a car. There is a shuttle to Disney only twice a day.

Reviews.Title: “Building #1”
Reviews.Author: kcmomofbrandon
Reviews.Content: I am not sure how the other buildings measured up because we stayed in Building #1 but here is what we experienced: there was mold in the master shower, the whirlpool tub would come on at all times of the day and night whether there was water in the tub or not, the table about fell off the table legs in the living room and there was a burned out light in the shower. We called the front desk two different days regarding the tub and shower problems and they said they would send someone up and never did. In addition the carpet was horrible and if I had a crawling child, they would not be let down to crawl on the floor. We wore socks the whole time. One of the two elevators was broken. The garbage disposal backed up into the other side of the sink, leaving a smell. The pool was in the middle of the buildings so it never got sun and was very cold. I assumed it would be heated but it couldn't have been. One plus was the washer and dryer. We should've packed fewer clothes because they were a good size and worked very nicely.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10!”
Reviews.Author: lukers2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as it has been recommended to us by several people and we certainly weren't disappointed. Our 2 bed apartment was very spacious and you could see the fireworks from Disney from our balcony (albeit a bit in the distance!). The staff were very friendly and were very helpful in recommending places to go and with local information. The only down point in our opinion was the hotel shop was VERY expensive, but there is a huge walmart about 5 mins down the road.Also, the hotel is located within close proximity of all the parks and had ample parking for our rental car .They also offer free WIFI at selected places around the resort and if you have a laptop, they will give you a cable to use in your room. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising!”
Reviews.Author: sc00ter2
Reviews.Content: The number one reason we booked this resort was how it advertised the free shuttle to and from DisneyWorld. We arrive to find out that the free shuttle has to be booked 24 hours in advance and only leaves at 9:00 and returns at 6:20 or 10:00. We book for the 9:00 shuttle, get in a long line up & wait for well over 45 mins. Then a bus pulls up takes the first few in line & then we wait some more, finally a 12 seater van shows up and proceeds to cram the rest of the group (at least 16) into this van. Being a mom with my two small children who had to sit on my lap I was very unimpressed. Needless to say we give a second chance and have another horrible experience. We ended up not getting to any parks on those days in time. Plus the one day the park charged our free shuttle $14 because the bus went in ahead and after our driver argued with the lady, he finally paid and of course we all chipped in - what a joke! Not the drivers fault but still it was horrible. Would not stay at this hotel again just because of that, many others offer more reliable transportation from what I have heard! We spent well over $1000.00 on taxi's to get to the parks on time thanks to the shuttle service!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Perfect to see Disneyworld, SeaWorld, Universal.”
Reviews.Author: NicTravelsAround
Reviews.Content: Good to stay for the attractions of Orlando. The suites have all you need, the Resort also features a pool and... The Outlet Mall right with it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the Orlando area for families!”
Reviews.Author: odsanchez
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa 4 times now. Each time we are truly pleased with our experience. My first stay was for a girls weekend which included a trip to their fabulous Reflections Spa & Salon. The second time was for a weekend with friends to visit Epcot's Food and Wine festival. The proximity to the parks is so nice and if needed they do offer transportation. The rooms are so clean and the living space is nice when traveling with other families. Our most recent was a few weeks ago and the kids just loved the pool and water-slide. Almost every night we ate at Frankie Farrell's Irish Pub & Grille and the food and service was excellent. We were traveling with other families and had a total of 7 kids and 6 adults. Prompt service, good food and reasonable prices. We travel to Disney World a lot and will always try to stay here first.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value and Great Facilities”
Reviews.Author: harrisbabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a 3 bed apartment for 2 weeks in April 2011 with our 2 children, 10 & 12. The rooms were very spacious with the master bedroom having a jacuzzi bath, double shower, toilet and walk in wardrobe. All bedrooms had 32" TV's in them with cable so great for the kids. The lounge had a huge 50+" TV with comfy sofas and a dining table. The kitchen area had a full size cooker, massive fridge freezer, dishwasher and full equipment. It also had a full size washer and dryer. We loved it here, if I had to say 1 bad thing about it I would say the decor needs updating, its a bit tired and dated but was clean. The hotel is made up of 4 blocks, we were in block 1 on the 6th floor with a balcony that overlooked the pool which was great as we could watch the kids in the evening. Parking was excellent and reception were really helpful and free WiFi. All in all we really enjoyed here and would definately go back, if you are looking for a clean, spacoius, well appointed place to stay that won't break your budget then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we would have gotten rooms were reserved.”
Reviews.Author: grandmaof432
Reviews.Content: The resort was a nice hotel & in a great location. but our check-in was a bad experience. Upon arrival, the front desk clerk informed us that they had so many guests stay over past their departure date, that he was not sure if they had the 3 bedroom 3 bath that we had reserved. he had to check. After a prolonged time, he returned to tell us that they did not have the suite we had reserved. they did have 3 bedroom,2 baths or two suites with 2bd,2bath. we asked if they were connecting because it was 3 adults & 4 kids that we did not want to separate(they said no).. we asked to speak to the manager to see if stayover guests could be moved & he informed us that because of state law, they cannot move current guests to another room if they request to stay longer than their reservation.(I have worked at hotels & this was never the case.. The manager did give us a discount on our room & would call us if room became available. . we decided to stay put because it would be too much trouble pack up & move. Other than this & terrible internet connection, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl1972
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Daryl, the manager for helping us on reserving a room at such a busy time of the year. The hotel and their staff were as wonderful as usual. The outside grounds and pool areas are always clean and inviting. The rooms are nicely furnished and the halls are quiet through the night. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great, as always”
Reviews.Author: clintongael
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth straight year we have stayed here, and it was great as usual. The size of the rooms and the large living area is great, and the convenience of having a washer and dryer in the room is very helpful always. The kids love the Pirate pool and sitting by the pool with a drink from Luau Lani's after a day at the parks is really a great way to wind down. For the price, the living area and the proximity to Disney, it can't be beat

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Convenient Location - Happy To Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: savapauk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a pool facing 2 bedroom suite in block 5 for two weeks mid-April 2011. As described in other reviews the apartments are big, well kitted out and ours was certainly very clean on arrival. The drive to the hotel from Orlando airport was very straight forward via the South Access Rd and the 417 (2 toll booths). Walt Disney World and SeaWorld parks are around 10 minutes easy drive and if you come out of the hotel and turn left onto the 535 within half a mile there is a Walmart on the right and a Publix supermarket on the left; so 10 out of 10 for convenience for us (we didn’t visit Universal, however, looking at a map it looks like on the I4 (no tolls!) it’s just a few miles past the SeaWorld exit. The hotel’s free gym, while not flash, is certainly more than adequate with running, biking, cross-training and resistance machines. There is 24 hour access using your room key and complimentary sweat towels. Free wired room internet access generally worked well (I didn’t try the Wi-Fi by the pool or in reception). On a couple of occasions I couldn’t get on-line on my first attempt– I’m guessing the router hit its maximum capacity. However, this didn’t prove to be a problem as in both instances I was able to connect a few minutes latter and I never had a connection dropped. In reception there are a couple of pay to use PCs with a printer. What is a nice touch, however, is these PCs have been configured with free access to airline websites so you can check-in online and print boarding passes all for free. This certainly saved us some time at the airport on the way home where the Virgin check-in desks had a fair size queue but no wait at the bag drop (unlike Gatwick – but that’s another story!). In summary we were very happy with stay at the hotel The only negatives I can think of are the on-site convenience store is expensive (but it is convenient) and the room have blinds rather than curtains/drapes so it’s not easy black-out all the light. However, these are only very minor gripes that didn’t impact our enjoyment and so based on our experience are more than happy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go someplace else...”
Reviews.Author: Acarbine
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to have booked this hotel through Hotwire and read many reviews here on Trip Advisor. But I guess no one had stayed in the room we received. We were put in Bldg. 1 and had the worst room I have ever seen for a 4 star hotel. The first thing we noticed was the thick layer of dust on the TV and the next the carpeting as I had tripped and was laying on the floor. The carpet was rolling all over and completely stretched out and stained. The tables are all marked up, the bed was hard and the sheets did not fit and the living room furniture was stained. The tub in the 2nd bath would not drain, we stopped at the front desk and it was fixed that day. The kitchen was ok, the ice maker worked great. But the stove was a disaster. It was hanging by an edge of the lip and was so slanted it was difficult to cook on and worried that the frying pan would slide off. The parking is also bad for building 1 there is not enough. If you have to park in the back, there is no entrance into the building. You have to walk all the way around to get in and I felt very unsafe doing that one night at 2am. It says that you have to have a card key to enter the building after 10:30pm, but that is a lie it is always open so no security. Did I mention the view, we had a lovely view of the roof of the shopping center. Did you want to sleep in? Forget it!! Every morning we were awaken by either garbage trucks emptying the dumpster or the best was the beer delivery truck at 7am banging empty kegs in the parking lot under our windows. Or it was the kitchen help washing mats or taking a break, smoking cigarettes so we couldn't enjoy our breakfast on the balcony. Whatever you do....don't go to the garbage room!!!!! It was so disgusting, it was like walking into a rotting dumpster, I needed to shower after that visit. On day one they said they were booked solid and could not change our room but we could check back the next day. Well we decided that we didn't want to go through the hassle of repacking everything and change rooms. As the week went on, I wish we had. I also wrote everything out on the survey to make management aware of the conditions. I was told they read them everyday....HA! Do yourself a favor, stay someplace else!!

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: mrnjmn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from April 14-20 in a 3 bedroom and 2 bath condo. I am a hotel snob and this did not meet my standards for several reasons. First, we stayed in building 5, which is supposedly the new building and which has only been open for a year. However, the couch was old and sagging, the beds were hard and the pillows flat. My husband said he felt like he was falling off the bed. The bedspreads were thin and dated and were certainly only for decoration, but that left us with only a sheet and a thin blanket. The bathroom fans were obnoxiously loud (I didn't think that would bother me but it did) and this was a problem in the master because the bathroom opened into the bedroom. There were no room darkening shades at all and so we all woke bright and early with the sun beating in. On the positive side, it suited our needs. We were barely in the room, so I didn't really mind these small quirks. There was a washer dryer which was awesome for me and we cooked and ate breakfast every morning in the condo. The price was EXCELLENT for being this close to the parks (Disney AND SeaWorld) and during the very busiest season of the year. My 8 year old twin boys loved the pool with the slide off the pirate ship, wading entrance, and 3 hot tubs. I should have got the bartenders names, they were really terrific. We received a reminder call everyday that the poolside restaurant was open for breakfast (annoying) and we finally made it down there on the last day. It wasn't very good at all. We did like the restaurant Freddie Farrells (I think) which was on property. Ate there twice, both good meals with no waiting. All in all, I would have to say that it suited our needs, but with so many hotels in the area catering to young families visiting Disney, I wouldn't stay again unless I won a free stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value resort”
Reviews.Author: ClaireB76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 5th for 14 nights and had a great time !! The resort is ideally situated to get to all theme parks and shopping malls. Our 2 bedroom/2bathroom apartment was in building 3 and we had a lovely view of the pirate pool. The apartment was very spacious and the washer/dryer was very useful. My only complaint with the room was that the carpets were a bit dirty and would benefit from a deep clean. There was plenty of parking and ample lifts. The trash room was always tidy, however, they maybe should consider some recycling bins for newspapers and cardboard etc. Avoid the store if possible as it is really expensive - $4.99 for a packet of cookies !!! Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - WOULD GO AGAIN, EVERYTHING YOU NEED IS AVAILABLE”
Reviews.Author: nicolanee
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from the lbv village and spa,, check in was great,but be aware that this hotel does not cash travellers cheques even though they stated that they do this was the only problem on this hoiday, rooms were fantastic we had a three bedroom apartment everything avaiable that we needed,supermarket was not expensive the only thing that upset us was that the hotel taxi ripped us off, we arranged for him to pick us up from discovery cove, and after makling us wait 30 minutes he picked up another fare att thesame time and charged us $22 dollars per family even though the fare should have been $22 overall argued this with him but still had to pay and then put a complaint into the hotel, "my advice to anyone dont use hotel taxi u will get ripped off" we had no other problems the hotel was fantastic, we maintained our room ourselves and was easy enough and had no bill to pay at end of the holiday. unfortunately we didnt have time to use the jacuzzii wish i had as it looked coolL. my son aged 7 didnt want to come home he loved the pirate ship at the pool , there was so much to do overall. the disney parks were great, bit disappointed with the kingdom as they had closed toonland at magic kingdom and not imformed people about this , also found that there was not many characters walking around as normal, but still had a great time. hollywood studios, was fantastic by far the best park, daughter dragged me on rockin roller coaster, it was awesome,, go and see fantasmic at end of the night show lightsand fountain water show special effects are great.. went to water parks typhoon lagoon is great for the little ones .also beaware that this hotel is about 6 miles from downtown disney and can be expesive in a taxi it cost us 20$ one way which is about £12, you may need to hire a car.. you will have a great time and now we did....

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious and excellent alternative to Disney resort hotels”
Reviews.Author: tdeprins
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we have stayed here and in one word our stay was excellent. We went on a Disney vacation in April 2011 and in spite of some good Disney discount hotel deals we decided to stay here in stead mainly because of the extra rooms that would allow us extra comfort after the kids were sleeping + the other benefits an apartment has to offer (as a comparison the cost of this 2 bath 2 bedroom apartment + 7 day disney park tickets and rental car was about the same than the cost of just staying in the Caribbean Beach Resort for the same time). This 2 bedroom 2 bath apartment was excellent in each and every way. First of all everything looked new, fresh and clean. Very spacious with a full kitchen, washer, dryer, 3 TVs (the 42" living room TV also supports external video input), a spacious terrace with tables/chairs, excellent and quiet central AC etc... everything in the apartment was there to enjoy a great vacation and everything was also very clean. Besides the room the hotel facilities were also great with the nice pirate ship pool and bar area, a small store, free indoor parking, a pizza hut and Irish pub on site etc... after our stay here we went on to a 4 star resort in Fort Lauderdale only to find out this was a lot more buck for a lot less... next time I pass through the region I will definitely stay here again. There were not many negatives that I can think off. Maybe the only suggestion for improvement would be to add extra darkened curtains in the bedrooms as these get very bright very early in the morning. I want to end with some feedback on other reviews here: we stayed in a room with a view of the Disney fireworks but this is not really worth asking for in my opinion as the hotel is too far away to really enjoy this (about 4-5 miles). We also checked out the stores in the outlet mall but compared to what we find in North New Jersey these were not really worth the visit and in 1 store they tried to rip us off on the price (the so called discounted price was higher than what we paid back home without any discounts).

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Julie20111965
Reviews.Content: This place was really great. We had a two bedroom apartment with lots of space and a lovely view of the pool. It's really close to Disney and a very easy route. Only 25 minutes to Universal and maybe 15 to Seaworld and DIscovery Cove. There's an outlet mall that you could walk to and a pub which is fine for tea when you are just too tierd to go out again. The shop is expensive -$15 for a bottle of wine. The same bottle but twice the size was $6.75 in the Walmart just five minutes up the road. Stock up there as soon as you can. The kitchens did have an odd set of equipment. A full set of pans, an electric tin opener, blenders, food mixers etc but nothing that could go in the oven and no frying pan. Plenty of crockery and cutlery and we managed fine. The pool is great for the kids but is in full shade by 5pm. We thought this was a real positive because the children had had enough sun by then and it was still really warm and busy every night until 10pm. There was free wi-fi in reception but not in the rooms. I would recemmend you try this place. We loved it .

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Orlando to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lisabordis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Orlando. AS always we stayed at LBV resort and spa. It gets better every time we are there. The staff is very friendly and willing to do anything to help out. It is clean and taken care of very well. My son loved the pool because he could walk in it and play in the beach like entrance. Everytime we stay in Orlando we stay here. It is defiantly the place you want to stay when you are visiting Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SherylLB
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa. The rooms were great for traveling with several couples. The bedroom with the King bed and spa tub and shower was great. Had all the amenities you need to have breakfast or other meals in the unit. The pool looked great but didn't get to use it due to the weather. It is only 10 minutes from Disney World and so much easier than waiting for buses, etc. WE WOULD DEFINITELY STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: snaveyrag
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa, the second this year. The accommodations are an excellent value. They are very roomy and luxurious, just like home. Very clean and comfortable. We have recommended them to everyone we know who is planning a visit to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lauriegardner
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. After staying in our condo here, I dont think we will travel and stay in anything but a condo with a kitchen and washer/dryer. I travelled with my husband and one and a half year old daughter. The pool was great. I loved that it had a beach like gradual entrance so our daughter could walk into the water on her own. We enjoyed the big pirate ship in the pool for the shade it made as we didnt want our daughter out in the full blown sun. The water fountains in the pool were great to take away the background noise of other kids playing in the pool (thought the the kids were all very good.) We were able to get a table and chairs to use by the pool as long as we were down there by 9am. There were always chairs up on a tanning deck, but it was very hot. Pool towels are a bit thin and small, you may want to bring your own full size beah towel. Pool was a bit chilly... especially in the evening. We were lucky enough to get a room overlooking the pool, so it was fun to sit out on the balcony and see what was going on. Our unit was clean and we felt at home in it. The only thing I would recommend them changing is the linens on the beds. Most nicer hotels have down comforters on the beds... this was not the case. I thought the pillows were very comfortable tho. There were no curtains to make the rooms darker during the day for naps for small children... we ended up placing the pack and play in the walk in closet and that worked out fine... it was dark and we left the door half open so she could breathe. =) Fans in the bathrooms were loud, but these are the only negative things about the unit. It was wonderful to have the space and we utilized the kitchen and washer/dryer a lot. We were always able to park in the parking garage which was really nice. Food at the Irish Pub was fair... wouldnt rush back there. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. We loved it and commented all week about how economical and perfect it was for us. I am a travel agent and have done a lot of traveling and stayed in many hotels. I give this one two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Resort....we will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: lovemytwingirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa at LBV Resort March 19-26th with our 8 year old twin girls. This was our second visit to Orlando. Our first visit was 100% Disney. We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge and used Disney's transportation. In our opinions, we thought it would be hard to top that visit. We got a great deal on this property and were a little hesitant prior to our visit. A week before we checked in, I emailed the property stating that I had young girls and requested a room close to the Pirate Ship Pool. I received an immediate response from the manager of the complex stating that he was happy to accommodate my wishes and would be placing us in Building 5. We rented a car this trip b/c our girl's wanted to do Universal as well as Disney. This property was extremely easy to find and the free parking was a great surprise. We only had an issue finding a space one night when we returned late to the resort. Otherwise, we were always in the attached garages. Check in was very smooth and we were in building 5 with an awesome view of the pool from our balcony. The unit itself was very large. We expected twin size beds in the girl's room, but were pleasantly surprised to see 2 full size beds. We took advantage of the Pizza Hut Express and there were always plenty of fliers from Pizza/Italian restaurants with free delivery (we had at least 3 of these a day slid under our door:) We did eat at the Irish Pub and the prices were very reasonable. The service there was very slow and would not recommend it if you had plans for the evening after dinner. The pool was great (if a little cool) and the outlet's are a nice bonus as well. Disney was only 5 minutes away and Universal took us about 15-20. The location could not be better. We were so impressed with this resort that upon our return, we contacted a Real Estate Agent with interest in buying our own unit. If you get a good deal on this resort, DO NOT HESITATE!!! It's a great place. We were worried that we couldn't compete with our 1st visit to Disney 3 years ago....this visit exceeded our expectations and we would love to return to LBVR.

Reviews.Title: “Loved apartment... but there is room for improvements”
Reviews.Author: joesbutterfly
Reviews.Content: We stay at LBV resort and spa for 7 days March 15-22. we were unable to check in early, but was able to check in after 4pm. (just went and shopped at Walmart while waiting) the rooms very nice. kitchen, nice fridge with ice maker. stove could use updating. big microwave, coffee pot, starter soaps, garbage bags, coffee. could have used a baking sheet and spatula. did not love pans... things stuck. but it was nice to be able to cook. Upon entering we notice one of the chairs was not cleaned, it had fingerprints and food all over the wood. i guess housecleaning missed it. stained carpet in hall. Nice quiet rooms, fast elevators. the master bath jacuzzi tub was awesome. enjoyed by children and adults. nice shower, big closet. bed could use updating... very hard. washer dryer worked great. we were in building 3, 3rd floor. corner view of courtyard, and from bedroom window the pirate pool. the walk to pools... through garage was ugh, then a long walk to pirate pool. pro they didn't seem to mind bringing your own drinks. wish the pool was a little warmer.... visited both pools. nice. only thing didn't work in room was the ceiling fan in livingroom. everything very clean. did not use housekeeping ...washed and dried towels myself. internet, got a cord on check in, it worked about 50% of the time we tried using it. didn't visit the spa or restaurant. ordered pizza from local delivery menu that was under the door, it was not good. next time would try pizza hut. best to have a car. staff friendly and helpful. short drive to disney Loved it... sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: beavermom
Reviews.Content: We chose the Lake Buena Vista Resort for Spring Break because as a family 0f 5 with 2 teens and 1 young adult, we needed a spacious set up. This is our 3rd trip to Orlando, the first 2 times we stayed at a Disney property. The pros: There were several very appealing aspects of the LBV Resort. For one, the price. We had a 2 bed/2bath with a fully furnished kitchen and washer and dryer for under $150 per night. Compare this to about $300 per night for Disney's value resorts (which are like a Motel 6 with Mickey bedspreads). The location was great, about a 12 minute drive to WDW, many great restaurants within 10 minutes and a great outlet mall right next door. When staying at a Disney property we always drive to the parks as the Disney transportation system is time consuming and frustrating, so the drive time did not bother us. The complex was clean and well cared for. Though it was spring break and the resort was full, it never felt crowded. We never had to wait for an elevator, and our room was quiet. The pools were nice, although the "adult" pool is mostly shaded by 2:00 in the afternoon. The pirate pool was much more crowded, but the snack bar was convenient and the food was OK. The in-room washer and dryer were fabulous and allowed us to pack light for the trip. The cons: While the name suggests the property is a resort, I feel this is a stretch. I did not get the feeling that this was a resort. I would call it more of a condominium hotel. When I think of a resort, I think of great service and picturesque scenery, which was not the case here. The hotel is located on a swamp next to an outlet mall, hardly a "resort-like" setting. Yes, the property does have some resort-like amenities, but it really is not set up to feel like a resort. Another con was the service - if you want great service, don't stay here. It is not set up to be a service oriented facility. For example, the first night of our stay we returned from WDW after midnight and opened out the pullout bed, which was not made up. We searched for sheets and could not find them, so we called the desk and were told that we would have to come down to the office and get them. The property is very large - 4 buildings - so I was pretty frustrated by having to take a hike to the office after midnight. But, for $149.00 per night, I was not expecting the Hyatt. Speaking of the "beds" - ugh!!! The beds were terrible. The mattresses were rock-hard. The sheets were cheap, thin (nearly thread-bare), and did not stay on the beds. The first morning, 2 of my kids woke up on bare mattresses because the sheets were so small they would pop off. The same happened to the king bed that I was sleeping on. What could be worse than waking up on bare mattress at a hotel? We ended up getting some extra twin sheets (another hike to the office) and doing some nifty bed making to make sure the mattresses stayed covered. The pillows were hard foam in the shape of pancakes - not good. Also a con was the parking, the garage and lots tended to fill by 10 pm, so we would have to search for on-street parking if arriving back late/ This was not a big deal as we were with teens, but if you had to pack small children who are tired from a day at the parks, it would be problematic. Overall, I would say that if you are looking for a full service resort, this is not it. You are not going to get the Disney magic, but then again, you don't pay for the Disney magic. However, for us it worked out well. However, if you desire a spacious set-up at a great price, this would be a good fit. For us, the pros outweighed the cons, and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “spacious condos only a short drive from Disney - Bldg 5 (newer bulding)”
Reviews.Author: cmllana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bed 2 bath condo at LBV Resort Village and Spa during our Spring Break trip to Disney and loved it! We even tried to stay an extra night just to relax and hang out at the hotel pool but the hotel was booked solid. The entire condo was spacious and clean - everything worked fine. We stayed in Bldg 5 which is the newer building and I would recommend it. The condo has all of the comforts of home such as washer/dryer, kitchen, bathtubs etc. I would have liked to have some basic cleaning supplies such as windex or some sort of anti-bacterial spray to wipe the glass table with after we ate. The placemats did not do much to keep the table clean with a 3yr and 7yr old eating. I would also have liked a few extra pouches of detergent for the washing machine. Since we drive, I had bought my own detergent expecting this to happen. I also bought my own toilet paper and was very pleased. The tp provided is your typical cheap single ply toilet paper. We all enjoyed the balcony that overlooked the pirate ship pool. The interet was only available via cable that we got from the front desk but that was not a huge concern for us since we were there for a vacation and not work. The pool was great for my 7 year old but too cold for us parents and the 3 year old. The pool towels are smaller and thinner than your average bath towel. I had read this in a previous review so we bought our beach towels from home. My hubby and I enjoyed the pool bar. We did not interact with the front desk staff beyond check in/out but when we did they seemed very nice and helpful. We never witnessed anyone having a problem during the 2 times we were in the lobby. The shuttle service is so limited that it is practically useless. We has hoped to use it to avoid paying for parking and dealing with the parking lot traffic. It took us about 10-15 minutes to drive to the parking lots of each Disney park. I am not sure how LBV Resort Village and Spa determined they were 2 miles away. My odometer said it was more like 8 miles from the hotel parking lot to the parking lot of each Dinsey park. Overall, I will go back to this resort again and would happily recommend staying in building 5 to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great View,Great Time”
Reviews.Author: chipnme1962
Reviews.Content: We spent our spring break at this hotel and we were very pleased with the staff, accommodations, pool and service. We were happy with the size of our room and the kitchen facilities. The staff was very friendly. Our kids loved the pirate ship pool. Our room was in Bldg 5 with a pool view. The balcony outside our room was huge. We will stay at this beautiful resort again

Reviews.Title: “Blew our minds”
Reviews.Author: AndyMc1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks and I can honestly say that we thought the apartments were amazing. The apartments were completed to a high standard with large comfortably furnished rooms. A fully fitted kitchen including dishwasher made self catering a joy - although we never cooked dinner once! A widescreen TV with cable in every room kept everyone happy. My highlight was the jacuzzi bath in the master bedroom, I wanted to pack it into my suitcase. We even had a washing machine and dryer which meant that we didn't need to go back with smelly clothes in our case. The complex was good, it had an Irish themed pub on sight - food was okay at it. There was also a store which as you would expect was pricey - a huge Walmart is 2 minutes drive away, so bear this in mind. The store though did have its own Pizza Hut takeaway - so comfort food was right on your doorstep. The outdoor swimming pool wasn't the biggest or the brashest but it kept me and the kids happy. The complex also had a spa which my wife visited and she raved about it - so it must have been good. There was a teen area with some pool tables and arcade games, so really the complex had something for everyone. A great bonus of this complex is that you also have a discounted brand shopping outlet as part of the complex - we certainly spent a few dollars there. Negatives were that you really need a car when staying here as it is not served by public transport well which I think is a general problem in most resort areas in Orlando. Overall, we had a great time in Orlando but our stay at the Lake Buena Resort made it all the more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: alsam11
Reviews.Content: Perfect place for family vacation. Very close to Disney, nice shopping outlet walking distance, pool was awsome, very clean. Suites were very spacious and very clean, everyhing you need. Would surely go there again and would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Radek99
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (two young kids) spent a week there March 2011. The fact that the weather was great helped with everything of course and made everything feel better. Pros: nice clean room (4th floor of building # 5 - overlooking the pool), great pool - with slide and three hot tubs, nice grounds (where they are finished), restaurant, spa, games room all a bonus, walking distance to outlet mall was good also, prompt service (our safe got locked, one of the pool ladders broke, etc.), good proximity to Disney, stores, good price. Cons: unfinished resort (I knew this so it was no surprise) means fencing off unfinished property, no tennis courts, no kid playground, the water in the pond was low so it looked a bit like a wasteland, garbage in and around the pond - people being messy but I expected it to be cleaned up within the week. Access to pool area is through the garage - not very elegant, the carpets in the hallway on the 4th floor looked stained, Internet access in the room worked only half the time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort for large family”
Reviews.Author: EaglesMom
Reviews.Content: The resort was very nice. We requested a 3 bedroom 2 bath room overlooking their pirate pool, but upon check in was given a building far away. I told the girl at check in that we requested, months ago, a view with the pirate ship. She said she didn't think she had any room remaining, but quickly found one. When we when in we love the big and roomy rooms. This was very nice for a family of six adults. The room we got was in building 5 on the 14th floor, the overlooked the highway and the pool area. Kitchen area had basic things that you needed, we did go to the Walmart the first evening and brought some other pans and plastic utensils that we needed. We left them there at the end of the trip, so someone may find good use for them. My teenage son and my son in law loved the pool and thought it was AWESOME, this coming from 26 and 16 year olds! We ate at the Irish Pub the first evening, it was good, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there. The beer was 6.00 a pint, which I thought was alittle overpriced. Pizza Hut on site, was great. The rugs in the hall and rooms do have to be clean, I really don't know how they get so dirty looking!? Loved having a washer and dryer in the room and not having housekeeping coming in all week was great. It always seems they come at the wrong time. It was like renting a condo for the week. All in all for the money I paid it was worth it it and I would stay again. I didn't get to see or try their spa area, so maybe next time for that.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome "Resort", great rooms, great pricing”
Reviews.Author: TacticalMedic2722
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in August 2009 as part of a road trip back from Key West from our Wedding. Had Wife, 1 yr old, and Parents with. Got the two bedroom, and had plenty of room. Nice full kitchen, 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms, full size refridgerator, living room, dining room. Had plenty of space. Very close to all the parks, resorts. Buy food and bring it with you to save $$ with the nice kitchen. Nice pool with pirate ship, open at night as well. Nice bar down on ground level. Parking can be an issue, as seems to be limited spots. Sometimes had to drive around for 5-10 minutes looking for a spot. Right next to Outlet Mall for shopping. Short walk next door to great budget shopping. Will definately stay here again this year when stopping in Orlando area for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Good value self catering resort”
Reviews.Author: arstrobelt
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Lake Buena Vista Resort village for a 11 nights stay at 2 p.m. room was not ready yet and I was told to check back in about an hour. We checked out the pool in the meantime which was excellent. Zero entry pool with pirate ship waterslide. Pool towels were provided but a sign posted mentioned no outside food and drinks permitted. There was a pool bar with quite high prices. Pool was not too crowded. When I checked back with at the reception there was a line and only two people checking in people. We were provided with four room keys for our party and a bunch of coupons for the outlet mall next door. Two of the key cards did not work. Our three bedroom three bathroom suite was in building one on the fourth floor. Building one has a game room for kids, the gym and a separate smaller pool area. Buidling one does not have a parking garage on the first two floors like the newer buidlings so it was outside parking only. There is some parking in front of the entrance of the building available but most of the times we had to parallel park in the street which was also okay. The hallways are interior, however, the carpets look quite old and could use replacement. Upon entering our suite we were welcomed by lots of masking room deodorizing spray. The suite was very clean but the furnishings were very torn (Carpet, sofa, furniture in bedrooms). Furnishings was exactly as it looked on the pictures in the internet including the old-fashioned (non flat screen) TV in living room. There also TV sets in all bedrooms. Bathrooms were okay. The bath rooms in master bedrooms had jacuzzi tubs which was very nice. There were three sets of towles in the master bathrooms which are not replaced for free during your stay. Towel exchange is $5 and full clean for our three bedrooms suite was $40. We did not have our suite cleaned during our stay so I cannot comment on this service. There is a washer/dryer combo in the suites but the dryer is no good. We were better off airdrying our towles on the balcony. The kitchen is well equipped with fullsize fridge but at least our coffee maker was in very bad shape. There is free wired internet access in the suites. LAN cable is provided from the reception. WiFi is available in the lobby and pool area. The Lake Buena Vista Resort is a self catering resort and we got exactly what we expected from reading the reviews. We got a good advance payment rate booking from the hotel's website which was about 40% of the rack rate. Would stay there again even though the suites could use some updating. The resort is close to Disney and right next to a smaller outlet mall (not comparable to premium outlets). Walmart is only about a mile away but a rental car is in every case strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and I am really fussy!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Millar-Bond
Reviews.Content: Thought I should write a little review about this hotel.... Now I'm a fussy traveler and I was so Happy :O) .... Last year we had a family holiday and I mean family there were 13 of us all ranging from 60-2yrs old we had 3 apartments between us all. They were all clean, well equipped with all that you would need to be fair it was a bit like home from home. The apartments were huge. The pool was great and we were really happy to let the older kids 17-10 go to the pool on their own really safe. Car parking was fine we did read that there was some issue before we went but not once on our 19 day stay did we have an issue. We did pay for the bed and towels to be changed as we were there for such a long time. We all managed to also get rooms that overlooked the Disney Fireworks so should we get home before the parks closed we did not miss a thing always got to see the fireworks..... all in all a great hotel close to everything..... We had a great time and it will be a holiday we will all remember for ever....

Reviews.Title: “What can I say besides Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: bradshaw24
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Saturday night Feb.26 at around 9:30pm and although late the front desk attendent was friendly, courteous and very accomodating. This is our second time at the resort and I can't say enough about the cleanliness of the rooms, grounds, pool area ect. All the staff are very friendly including the great people at the Pool Bar and Grill...cheers! The Expedia travel desk on site was very convenient for bookinh the shuttles to the park and the shuttles were clean, friendly drivers and on time. We have a 6 and 9 yr old and they love the resort! The pool is very fun for all ages and again the staff at the resort from Manager to pool staff make you feel like home! Thanks for a great vacay...see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great two bedroom two bathroom apartment, great pool and service.”
Reviews.Author: Rosie255093
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 9 days at this resort with extended family. The 2, 2 bedroom apartments were great, 2 bathrooms, tv's in all rooms and balconies. The service and staff were great. The only critisism is the carpets in hallways and apartments could do with an upgrade as there was a slight musty smell. We had a couple of problems which were solved quickly. If we were to travel to Orlando again this would be our choice of accommodation. The children had a ball in the pirate ship pool! Adelaide Australia Guests.

Reviews.Title: “Meets Expectations Again”
Reviews.Author: tuirch
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights at the LBVRS location in March. Rooms are spacious and quiet. This hotel/condo resort has a great location and is fairly priced. The pool area is nice. The drinks at the pool bar are a bit over-priced as is the food. But overall, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Place in Florida to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: FunTravels2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place back in 2007 when it was first open and came back this year. It was a great place to stay back then - NOW, it's even better!! The pools/whirlpools are wonderful. The staff is very polite and helpful. The eating establishments are nice with good food and friendly staff. The best part of this place is the rooms and the value for the price. A family can spready out and enjoy privacy, yet stay together. The facilities allow for cooking which help to save money. The hotel is in close location to grocery stores/pharmacy and shopping and yet close to the major attractions which are easy to find. I cannot say enough good things about this place. I hope they keep their rates affordable and their rooms as nice as they are. We will stay there every time we are in Orlando!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Markybaloo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from Feb 21st still March 10th in building 5. Excellent accommodation, very spacious rooms and well equipped kitchen, we also had a great view overlooking LBV. Ten mins from Disney and well situated for other amenities. We had no problems with the accomodation or with the staff. We will be returning again to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for Disney Parks - if you're fairly self sufficient”
Reviews.Author: l0uise123
Reviews.Content: Positives - we were thrilled by the quality and spaciousness of accommodation at this hotel - probably the best we have stayed in (and we have stayed in luxury resorts). We had a two room suite in building 4 (where hotel lobby and spa is located). This appeared to have been fairly recently refurbished and was spotlessly clean. We were amazed that we had a huge master suite with whirlpool bath, large walk in shower, walk in closet area. separate bedroom with two double beds, its own bathroom, dining area, lounge area, fully equipped kitchen with large fridge/freezer,dishwasher etc. For three of us, it was huge and our 3-year old was delighted that we had three TVs in the suite. Some basic items (toilet rolls, kitchen roll, dishwasher powder etc) were provided but we needed to stock up on some of these items during the stay. The facilities allowed us to fully self cater during our stay - highly recommended especially if you have small children - finding healthy food in American eateries is a challenge. A Publix supermarket is only 5 mins drive away and is far better than the closer Walmart. Disney parks and other attractions are only a 10 - 15 minute drive away and the resort is right next to a fairly decent outlet area (although there are better outlets within a short drive - Orlando Premium Outlets for example). Minor gripes - I don't think the swimming area is heated as is advertised - maybe by the sun but the water temperature was very cool. As a result, we didn't spend as much time by the pool as we would have liked. Also the pirate ship is just a slide and not suitable for young children. Own food/drinks are not allowed by the pool which doesn't sit well with the self-catering facilities. Also, there isn't much in the way of service - concierge was not well up on the local area and there was always a long queue at the Expedia service desk. Advertised as buy tickets here to avoid queues but I think you'd be better off buying the tickest at the parks - certainly in off peak season. Fortunately we had bought out tickets in advance and had done some research on the area so this wasn't a big issue for us. In summary, the room facilities here are fantastic and we were delighted with our choice but if you need 5 star service and advice and guidance all the way, this might not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice if you don't need anything!”
Reviews.Author: ranndella
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently checked into this hotel for our honeymoon. We chose the hotel based on the location, advertisement of a complimentary shuttle to Disney and Universal, and the spacious rooms, that were apartment style living. We checked into the hotel and the guy at the front desk congratulated us on our marriage and gave us a room with the view of the Disney fireworks so we were off to a good start. Unfortuantely, this was the end of our excitement with this hotel. The rooms were spacious with the comforts of home, like a fridge, stove, etc. We brought lots of food with us knowing we could save some money by cooking in our room. We unpacked everywhere and had dinner reservations at a Disney restaurant and so called the front desk to arrange to get on the "complimentary shuttle''. We were quickly told that the shuttle only leaves for Disney at 8:55 am and 11:30 am and ONLY to Epcot, none of the other parks. So obviously we had missed those since check in wasn't until 3pm. We then asked if we could take the shuttle back from Disney to at least save half of a cab fare, and they said no, they needed 24 hour notice to pick us up. So we called the shuttle service ourselves and they said they could accomodate us for sure and to tell the hotel to give us vouchers. We argued with the hotel for hours and they would not help us and so my husband called the shuttle service and the manager agreed to let us ride even though the hotel refused to help us. We spent $30 on a cab to get there, though, and thought it was very odd to advertise a shuttle service with such meager hours. (Note pick up was either 6:20 or 10:20, neither convenient times. So we get back to the room after the dinner and are exhausted and are woken up periodically throughout the night from people screaming above us. We took the shuttle the next morning, but had to pay another $30 to get back since we didn't want to be at the park from 8:55 to 6:20. When we got back we heard the screaming again and could hear a woman getting abused by her husband and we heard the kids in the room screaming so we called security at the front desk who did nothing. We witnessed the abuse for several more minutes before telling the hotel we just were going to check out as the last thing we wanted on our honeymoon was to be stressed and sleep deprived. We packed up all of our stuff and hightailed it out of there. They did agree to refund our money which was good, but still not worth the hassle of staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Superb ! Best stay ever in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: MonikaFleischer
Reviews.Content: This is a real Gem, one almost does not want too many people to know about it but we have to give credit where credit is due. The rooms are clean , large and ours had a spacious balcony from which we could see the Disney Fireworks at night while sipping our wine. The staff is helpfull and always with a smile ! This is definitely our top choice for Orlando and we will be using it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and no bugs !”
Reviews.Author: romans2690
Reviews.Content: We had a great week here, rooms are very large and in great condition, ours was spotless and like new. Great flat screen Tvs in lounge and bedroom. No noise from the other rooms. 4 lifts in each block mean your never waiting around. Irish bar opposite very good with free wi fi that was very quick. Pool good with nice shallow end for our 2yr old. Walmart nearby handy and the outlet mall adjacent is worth a visit Only downsides were there is no Wi fi in the rooms as advertised and theres not a lot around you within walking distance but we had a car with us so that wasnt a problem .. would go back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family or group of people”
Reviews.Author: toddmac29
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel because we had 4 people. We got a 3 bedroom apartment and was amazing. Room was very clean. The pub downstairs was good too. Nice meals and cold beer. :-) it's great that the outlet shopping is right next-door too. Am definatly going to stay next time I come to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “I'd book here again!”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee911
Reviews.Content: Except for the overwhelming odor of bleach on our entry to our room everything was as expected. Very comfortable accommodations and easy access to Disney, Epcot and Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellet location, large and good rooms, good price but poor service”
Reviews.Author: docarva
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be a 5 out of 5 if it wasn´t for the lack of services. If you need anything or if you have problems with the internet you are by your own. But that is the only bad thing, all the rest is great, large rooms, spa, pools, right beside a good outlet shopping, close to Disney World. Perfect...

Reviews.Title: “Great clean place for everyone, nice pool, pirate ship, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: lugoh20water
Reviews.Content: We loved it! We were in town in January and spotted this hidden treasure. complete with its own pirate ship in the pool. Decided to book the weekend of March 4th - 6th. I rented a 3 bedroom suite. (the st lucia) The first unit they gave me had quite a few problems and was unexceptable. They quickly put me in a second unit that was near perfect. As for comfort, it was very comfortable and very clean. the space was perfect having 3 teenagers with us and our oldest child stayed in the 2nd master bedroom with her husband and our 2 yr old grandson. The kitchen had everything we needed to cook a wonderful meal. (wish they had more roasting pans) and the utensils needed changing due to burned tips. however, the resort itself was great! I recommend this place to anyone with children or teenagers, nice game room, gym and frankies restaurant has great food!!!! I had the fish and chips the first night and she ordered the sampler. the kids ordered pizza from pizza hut they are located on site. I have already booked my next weekend for April. This resort is also very close to the attractions, Disney is 10 minutes away and downtown disney only 5 minutes away. shopping is also right next to the resort. this place had everything we needed. they also have a nice computer room in the main building. the lobby also has a nice fireplace and a great place to relax and read. We didn't get to use the pool or the hot tubes in the pool area, maybe next time. I will be recommending this place to everyone I know. special thank's to eric and trish!!!!

Reviews.Title: “New Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: krangel67
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing place to stay. We were welcomed by the most friendliest staff when we checked it. They were very helpful and informed us of everything we needed to know. The suite was gorgeous nicely furnished and had all the essentials. The master suites both had jacuzzi tubs that were to die for after spending the day in the parks. Nice and quiet nights on the balcony. Very clean and well maintained. The gym and gameroom were nice and the onsite store had anything you ever needed to buy, we made breakfast each morning. I was sad to check out but have already looked into a return trip. I have been to Orlando many times and so glad I have now found my new home away from home!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, SUPER location.”
Reviews.Author: DRNH
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at the Lake Buena Vista Resort and we loved it. We traveled with3 children ages 1,5,8 and the property was perfect for them. We've stayed at other Orlando resorts in the past (including Disney) but this has been the best. The zero-entry pool with pirate ship was perfect for the smaller kids. Some of the past reviews have mentioned cleanliness,etc. The carpets could definitely use a deep cleaning but other than that the rooms were fine. Staff was attentive and efficient as well as very friendly. We ate twice at the Irish pub on the property and it was excellent. The mini-mart really did have everything however there is a Super Wal-Mart just down the road when we wanted more substantial groceries. The location to the parks is great and it never took more than 5 minutes to drive to the parks. The poolside pub was great for snacks, ice cream, light meals, and drinks. I wish there was a restaurant onsite that offered breakfast but there are many within driving distance. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay to do self-catering in the Disney Area!”
Reviews.Author: qcumbers40
Reviews.Content: We were really delighted with this resort and amazed at how lovely the rooms were, in terms of size and quality. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, and it had a good size balcony and a huge living/dining/kitchen area! The kitchen was really well equiped with a big fridge freezer and all the utensils etc that you would need. The kids (9 & 7) loved the pool, with the pirate ship slide, hot tubs and good size pool area. The location is right next door to Buena Vista Factory Outlets, so very hand for some clothes shopping, and there is a local shop next door selling almost everything you need and fresh pizzas etc too.
