Also has an Irish Pub next door which is a nice place to eat. There is a shuttle for the parks but we drove and within 15 mins we were on the mono rail into Magic Kingdom. I would highly recommend this venue.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: LBV_11
Reviews.Content: This resort was an excellent choice....beautiful pool/slide, rooms exceptionally clean and hotel well maintained. Very comfortable and felt very safe here. A walk away to outlets LBV!!! Great food at the poolside.I would highly recommend this hotel to families and friends! Thanks for a great vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice codo, awesome pool, short trip to parks!”
Reviews.Author: nayjab21
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the 3 bedroom 2 bath condo. It was a short trip from walmart for food and supplies. Disney was only about 10 minutes in the car. The room was pretty well stocked even had a blender! The kids loved the pool. (ages 2, 4, and 10) This condo was plenty of space for myself, hubby, kids, and sister (5 total). They also provided a pack and play for the 2 year old for sleeping! The only downside i found was the front desk was slow, we couldn't get an early check in and that messed up our plans a little. On checkout again I was waiting 15 minutes because there was only one person working the desk, and answering calls, with only 1 person ahead of me. I was checking out on a Wednesday. I would think they would have a speed checkout since i didn't even have to sign a thing. It was kind of a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey_Hanger65
Reviews.Content: Right, here we go. Travelling to Florida as a party of 8, with 3 Disabled wheelchair using Teenagers could have been a nightmare. 2 years ago we did the same trip, with the same kids, but stayed in the Quality Inn Plaza on I-Drive, which was very basic, almost like a Motel. This year, we went upmarket to LBV Resort Village & Spa. RECEPTION We arrived on Saturday tea-time after a full days travelling and were given two Wheelchair Accessible rooms, in Building 5, as requested! ROOMS WOW!!! What can I say? The apartment (3 bed) on the 3rd Floor (5301) was simply stunning. Plenty of room to move about (very important when you've got a Teenager in a Power Wheelchair!) and the Kitchen..well it hadn't been used! Seemed totally brand new. The Roll-in shower was huge, plenty of space in the bedrooms and the Jacuzzi bath in the Master Bedroom was massive. A nice balcony would have been improved by not having a 3" lip on the door (Disabled Access??!) but this is a very minor point. Huge TV in the Living Area and one in each bedroom..just Top-Notch. The washing machine and drier were a GODSEND, so much so, we didn't need Room Service at all! EATING OUT Right..Frankie Farrells Irish Pub, on the site across the road literally one minute away, was superb. A great selection of beers, cracking food reasonably priced and nice staff too. Problem is, that was it! There are no other Restaurants withing walking distance. There IS a "Food Court" at the excellent LBV Factory Outlets shopping centre (which is right next door and excellent!) but this is more like a collection of take-aways with a few seats in the middle..and none of the big guns (MacD's/BK/Taco Bell/KFC) are here. We found Frankies great..but it needs some competition! There is a Pizza Hut take-away in the Mini-Supermarket too, which was nice once or twice. SURROUNDING AREA For me, LBV was a bit isolated. Apart from Frankies and the Outlet, there was nothing else within walking distance. The huge Walmart was in fact only 5 minutes walk away, but there was no road crossing over a very busy highway. You COULD get across at quiet times, but it's probably safer to get a cab, get stocked up, and live to tell the tale. It was only 3 dollars cab ride! SHUTTLES There was bound to be a negative, and here it comes. We booked this holiday through Co-Operative Travel, and obviously when planning a trip with 3 kids in Wheelchairs, the transport has GOT to be right. Two of our party can't transfer at all, they are stuck in their chairs. The transport from Orlando Airport was spot-on. Two vast wheelchair mini-bus cabs, top-notch. Sadly when we went to book the first day's shuttle to Universal, we were told that no accessible transport was available! Endof, a flat great-big no. Sadly no Manager was around but the next morning the situation was QUICKLY reversed. The hotel would pay for 2 taxis every day (as long as they were at the shuttle times) which was great. Luckily the first taxi that arrived was City Cabs number 653, driven by Brian, from Mitcham in Surrey!! Thanks to Brians promptness, reliability and patience we managed with him and one or two others to get around really well. There WAS one glitch mid-holiday when the Petty Cash ran out so they couldn't pay Brian but again, that was sorted the next day. THE POOL Magic!!! Really well heated, good bar/snacks and a lovely way to relax. Brilliant for kids (the Pirate Slide! Wow!) and a real asset to LBV. T'INTERWEB THINGY Patchy! No wireless in the rooms and patchy in the lobby..kids I-pod touches worked but my lappy struggled. IN SUMMARY WE WILL BE BACK!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bigger Disappointment that Expected”
Reviews.Author: travelingfool4
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read more hotel reviews before booking this hotel! I don't consider myself to be a picky traveler and I consider the hotel, just a place to stay when you are not out having fun. I tried to ignore the short falls of the hotel but in the end there were just way too many!! We arrived late at night on Feb. 20th. They put us in a corner room in building five and everything seemed great. As we start unpacking (11:30 pm) we notice that we are in a 3 bedroom 2 bath instead of a 3 bedroom, 3 bath. We called downstairs to find out what was going on and then found out that they had no 3 bedroom 3 baths open, and that we would have to wait until the next day after checkout (9am - 11am) to move. I couldn't believe they wouldn't have told us that at the desk when we checked in???!!!! They just put us in the wrong room and acted like nothing was wrong. So the next morning we had to then repack everything and delay our kids from going to Disney. We hung out in the lobby for an hour waiting for word on our room. Finally at 11 they told us to go to Disney and that they would move our belongings to our new room and everything would be ready when we came back. Lie #2 Nothing had been done when we returned back to the hotel. We had to move all of our things to tower one, a dirty room overlooking the parking lot of the Factory outlet. Lie #3 They then told us how sorry they were and that they would comp our room the first night. (Read Below - this was another lie) Lie#3 My husband was in Orlando on business and had to have the internet. He called the hotel ahead of time to make sure they had wifi. Needless to say, we were never able to get any internet connection in our room. He went out and purchased a cable and we were still never able to get any access. The hotel then lied again to say usually they do have access but it was down. When we finally moved into our room in tower one at 9:30 pm my young kids were worn out and ready for bed. We went to make up the couch bed only to find the sheets were the wrong size. We called to get sheets and they told us they would be right up(Lie #4). 35 minutes later still no sheets. I had to get dressed and go down to the lobby to get them to send sheets up to our room. We wore flip flops in our room because it was so dirty. We stopped using the kitchen because there were small spider looking bugs everywhere. We didn't notice them at first, but they got into our cereal boxes. So we threw everything away and ate at Dunkin Donuts for breakfast and the Irish pub for dinner. The burger there was delicious! We spent no time out on our balcony because it overlooked a parking lot - very disappointing. The kids did enjoy getting in the tubs in the bathroom every night and relaxing after a long day in the parks. My kids complained a few times that they had bites behind their knees and underarms. I ignored it thinking maybe mosquitoes. After reading reviews since I returned from my trip I see many people have complained about bed bugs. I am wincing in disgust hoping that I did not bring any home with me. If I did there will be a major PROBLEM! The swimming pool was great. The kids loved the slide and the hot tubs were very relaxing. The life guard had to leave the slide closed several times to constantly get more towels, that was kind a bummer for my boys. Also, plan well, because as the sun goes down the pool is shaded and cold. They told us they were not going to charge us for the first night. At checkout they then told my husband they were not going to charge us for two nights because of the problems with the room and internet. Upon getting our bill we noticed that they only discounted our bill for the resort fee for two nights - that's 20 dollars. Careful with the taxi drivers at the hotel they wanted to charge us 30 dollars to bring us to the parks and 65 to the airport. Sadly we paid that not knowing we could get it a lot cheaper. Shame on them for taking advantage and shame on the hotel for letting them. We rented a van so my husband could get back and forth to his class. Parking was very limited and sometimes you just had to park on the road or park far away from your tower. In conclusion ( after reading reviews about this hotel for the last year) it seems like the hotel is going downhill rapidly!!! There may still be some good rooms left in the newer towers. If you are staying here you may want to contact those people who wrote good reviews and ask what their room number was. I was in building one on the 7th floor - I would stay away from this whole tower! Good Luck If my bill is not resolved I am considering reporting this hotel to the better business bureau. I am definitely following up on the bed bug investigation someone mentioned in their post.

Reviews.Title: “This is our vacation home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: humfrey5000
Reviews.Content: I love this resort. It is our vacation home away from home...The staff is extra ordinarily friendly. All that my family needs to get excited is to say that we are going to Lake Buena Vista. The pool is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to Go Back again, We are telling all of our friends to stay here. Great overall value”
Reviews.Author: dwe19
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa was Excellent! The rooms were big with a good layout. Our room was very clean and quiet. We never heard anybody from next door or up above. The hotel was also completely filled! We had a Fireworks view of the Disney from our room also, which made it good with the younger kids. The kids are still talking about the pirate ship water slide! A definate hit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Highly Recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: retsasgt
Reviews.Content: If you want a little peace and quite and still have your finger on the pulse of Disney, Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa is the place to stay! It's less than a 10 min cab ride to the Disney Parks which cost $15.00! We found a cabbie named "Sam" who had an extended Black Van and was like our private limo driver!(His #407-283-9333) The Hotel has a pool with a large pirate ship in the middle of it with a few hot tubs to boot! Lots of pool towels also! There is a slide that goes thru the ship that even adults (like me!) had a blast going through!! I highly suggest that you request a room overlooking that pool area. The pool area has a large bar that also has "Finger food". There is an Irish Pub that is right there as well as a small conveinant store that has a Dominoes pizzeria in it. That was awesome to have a couple of pizzas poolside without breaking the bank. Best of all is there is a Wal-Mart that was a 5 min walk, and yes they sell Wine!! The rooms have high ceilings and a nice size balcony. Regular size refridge and nice size kitchen and two bathrooms.The washer and dryer were a huge bonus so all we travelled with on carry on baggage! No need to keep calling the desk for more towels! We stayed in a two bedroom that was huge. The master bedroom came with a king size bed and Jacuzzi Tub and shower! The TV in the living room was also a nice size flat screen. Definitely family oriented and relaxed!!! Staff was also another bonus!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: majorhamilton
Reviews.Content: I researched the hotel before we made our trip and thought i knew everything about this place. I was greatly suprised by the unit, the location and o fcourse the staff! Very helpful and friendly. My family really had a great time and I loved the pool! I will be coming back to stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent VFM”
Reviews.Author: usefactor50
Reviews.Content: Location- ideal for disney, celebration, the malls and easily accessible from the airport. walmart just down the road which sells everything! 3 bed room apartment - Fantastic main bedroom and the spa bath very nice after longs days walking around the parks. Nice touch that British visitors are provided with a UK newspaper. 2 double beds in one room and a huge bed in the 3rd as well as a sofa bed in lounge. Most importantly the beds were very comfortable! Amenities - Everything you could need. lovely pool area (although a bit of a hike if you're in buildings 1 or 2 - they do have their own smaller relaxing pool however). Some of the corridors/carpets looked a little tired given that this is a new hotel and the decor was quite traditional verging on old-fashioned. The rooms however were well furnished and clean. firework rooms can be requested but not guaranteed. the food at the irish bar was exceelnt and the staff were very helpful. Staff - reception staff generally very helpful and friendly. There is a woman at the 'expedia local expert desk' who we mistakingly thought was there to generally advise regarding travel plans, sightseeing. She is clearly on commission for selling dinner shows and was unwilling to help on anything else! Our friends who have stayed in the disney resorts previusly said they would come back to this hotel. This hotel is excellent value for money given the size of the accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, we were quite pleased.”
Reviews.Author: IlliniHimey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from Friday - Friday, 2/18 to 2/25. Had room # 31302. We had booked our reservation online about 2 months in advance and paid the lower internet rate. Booked a room in building 5 that would give us a view of the Disney fireworks. Upon arrival, the employee attempted to give us a rom in building 5, but only on the 5th floor. I told him that that would not be high enough to see the fireworks. He responded with, "Oh, I am sorry sir, you need to have a reservation to enjoy one of those rooms." From there I gave him my confirmation letter clearly stating that I had one of these rooms. From there, he spent about 10 minutes punching away at his computer. From there, he informed me that someone had overridden my reservation, and there were no 2 bed/2 bath rooms available with the fireworks view. Not a good way to start the vacation! I told him that we had a problem. I told him to bump whomever was in my room. From there, he spent another 10 minutes or so upgrading our reservation. We ended up in a 3 bed / 2 bath room. While we could not see the Disney fireworks, we could see the EPCOT version. The room was nice. 2 of the 3 bedrooms had King sized beds. The 3rd bedroom and 2 twins. Kitchen was nice. Sure, not a ton of utensils, but certainly plenty to get by. Master bedroom was nice, as was the bathroom. Washer/Dryer were very handy. Also, being on the 13th floor provided some very nice views of the Disney grounds, specifically, Downtown Disney. If I had 1 major complaint about the room, it was the carpet. At first glance, everything appeared clean. However, after walking around the room for about 10 minutes, our white sox were completely black on the bottom. That was a tad disturbing, but we lived with it. Just wore shoes/sandals in the room. 1 minor complaint had to do with the master bed. While it was King, it was very old. Very uncomfortable bed, but with pillows, I got around it. The Pirate Pool was very cool. We hung out there for 3 of our 7 days. Very clean, very safe. The pool lounge was a popular spot as well. Enjoyed many of the drinks there, and we had lunch there 2x. Each experience was great. The convenience store was exceptional. This place really had everything. Only problem I had was that the employees working there did not speak the language well. Had trouble when I had to ask questions. Also, whenever I was in the back of the store, I felt as if they were watching me like I was a thief. My son dragged me to the game room daily. Good enough for what is needed. Games are a bit old, but they work fine. The irish pub was very nice. I was pleasantly surprised there. We ate there 2x, and both times the food was great. Good enough beer selection. Kind of a Hard Rock atmosphere, as they have Rock pictures on the wall- most of which are for sale. We went to Disney on Wednesday, so that morning I went to the concierge to purchase tickets. The employee was very quick to try and sell me some other package deals (Arabian Knights and some sort of pirate themed event). I will give the employee credit- she would not give up in trying to sell me. Problem is, I did not want to be sold. I just wanted tickets to Disney. After about 3-4 minutes of haggling, I could sell that she was mad. She closed with, "Sir, I can sell you Disney tickets, but you are actually going to pay more here." To be honest, this really pissed me off. The outlet mall next door was nice. We spent 1 afternoon there and actually found some pretty good deals. All in all, we would probably stay here again. With a nightly room rate of $160, I felt the value was there. We did not experience the bed bugs that others experienced, so that was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for family disney magic”
Reviews.Author: powellsdisney
Reviews.Content: Just home from Florida. We spent 2 weeks in this hotel and loved every minute of it. The rooms are big, clean and have everything you need. The location is fantastic for disney, universal, seaworld, water parks, shopping, walmart and hundreds of restaurants. We did have a slight delay in booking in at reception, as Virgin hadnt sent through our booking, but the hotel staff dealt with this very professionally. The weather was a bit chilly the first few days but warmed up lovely and we had high temperatures in the 80s. We spent the odd afternoon by the pirate ship pool which was nice, the water was fine so we all had a swim. Pool drinks were a bit expensive but your on holiday!!! Having walmart around the corner is fantastic as you can fill the huge fridge with everything you need. This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone. We will be booking again for next year..... My only comment re this hotel, would be that although we booked a year ago and did request block 5 and that both our parties were near each other, on our arrival we were told that preferential treatment had been given to short stay groups and that all the rooms in block 5 were allocated. We were told by reception staff that if we wished to move we could do this after the weekend, but this is an upheaval that you do not want while on holiday and should not have to do. We ended up in block 3 which was fine, but my other party had a view of the scrubland at the rear of the complex, which was not what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Vacation thanks to the folks at Lake Buena Vista!”
Reviews.Author: HazelLando
Reviews.Content: We want to thank all the employees at Lake Buena Vista for being so pleasant and helpful. They all took time to answer our questions, give us directions, and just talk to us. They were always smiling and friendly. This makes vacations much more fun. We did not run into one "Grumpy" person during our visit...except at Disney of course!

Reviews.Title: “Okay!!”
Reviews.Author: Bailey016
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at the hotel for a week. I do have to admit from reading all negative reviews I was trying to change hotels days before arrival but decided to stay with this one. The pros of this hotel is that the staff were very nice. Especially Bill who did the activites with the children, the concierge (male - did not get name) and also Matt at the front desk. The restaurant was nice and handy and the bartender (with glasses) was great and always smiling. It was great to have all of the space in the condo. The Cons of this hotel is the cleanliness. Not so much the bathrooms etc but the carpets were badly stained so much that we wore our flip flops around the condo even at night and I had my 3 year old wear her socks the whole time in condo. The furniture in the sitting area was also badly stained. So first impression was not great and when initially walked into condo wanted to walk back out. Also word of advice if you do not have a rental car and need to cab it do not take the cabs at the hotel. They will rip you off. The first three days we took them and just paid what they said and then returned to locations towards the end of the week with metered cabs and were charged less than half. So they were charging us double. So lesson learned is to always take a metered cab (Yellow cab was great) and DO NOT take the ones outside hotel. The staff being so friendly made up for the CONS but we would not stay here again due to the cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, convenient, well appointed.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirluk2010
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this property for a high school gal friend reunion. We booked the three bedroom three bath suite with full kitchen and large eating area with roomy balcony; and we used the Spa facilities during our stay. We found this hotel online last year and decided to rebook for this year. There is a nice outlet mall next to the property, very close to I-4, International Drive and the Disney properties.The property provides transportation to the parks, although we did not use this service. Can't say enough about how accomedating the staff at the Spa were, the manager Marisa and her staff could not have been nicer or accomedating. We didn't use the pool facility but it looked great from the view from the Spa balcony as we were eating our lunch! The market was well stocked and had a large selection of necessities although there are grocery stores/Walmart nearby. The Irish Pub on property is fine, and there is also a Pizza Hut inside the market. Some disappointing items are the kitchen was lacking enough cooking utencils. Since we live in Florida we'll make sure we bring what we need next year. The two mastbaths have large walking showers, huge closets, seperate toilet area and a large jacuzzi. The bedding was outdated, pillows were like a board, blankets were the "foamy" type (yuck). The bath linens could be of a higher quality. And there is no wireless at the property so I would suggest you remember to pack your network cable as there is internet access in each room. We'll definately book there again and if you are planning to drive to Orlando, make sure you pack the extras. Over all I would highly recommend this property. With a little bit of updating (or BYO Stuff) you'll have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this one!”
Reviews.Author: LibertyLady195
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. The room was very clean and the staff very friendly. I would have given five stars except for one thing... We ordered drinks at the pool bar, the bartender automatically adds in a 15% tip but does not tell you. My husband paid by cash the first time so we did not notice, we just thought the rum-runners were over-priced and they did not even come with a floater. He left a cash tip. The second time we paid by credit card. We were presented with a check (by a different bartender) with a space for a tip. When we got home I went through the receipts, that's when I noticed the tip had already been added on and so with our additional tips both bartenders made about 30% off us. We were so upset we called the resort. We were told the pool bar is owned by a different company. Tipping is an option and I don't even think the bartender deserved the 15% he added on since it was almost $3.00 for making two drinks. And then we unknowingly tipped more. We told him we were from South Carolina and used to live in Florida so he knew we know how to tip. This upsets me because I used to work in a hotel and I'm pretty sure it is illegal, It's stealing. Other than that we loved the resort and will definitely come back. PS- the Irish Pub does not add on a tip but beware there are no prices for beer and a draft beer will run you $4.95. Neither place has drink specials or happy hour, and the pub only has live music on St. Patrick's Day.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is unhealthy”
Reviews.Author: frannietraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unhealthy. I just got back from the Doctor and found out that I have a severe case of bed bug bites. I stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort for the weekend and had bites the day of check out. The rooms were not well kept and many things were broken. will not stay again as bed bugs are almost impossible to get rid of.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ptmorrow
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice, Feb 2010 and Nov 2010 and are going back Feb 2011 for 10 days. The suites were very clean and the kitchen well equipped. The staff was excellent except for one very small problem with washcloth quantity. We enjoyed our "fireworks view" room and our grandson enjoyed the gameroom. We soooo enjoyed the whirpool. Publix and Walmart are close by so we stocked our kitchen for the stay. We would recommend Lake Buena Vista Resort to anyone. It is definitely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: ThomasC45
Reviews.Content: Our party recently stayed 2 weeks and the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa and had a most wonderful experience. The resort is a first class place to stay. The rooms or units are extremely well kept and afford all the amenties that you need. Having a kitchen with all necessary appliances and utensils make the stay more afforadable. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. If you're looking for an affordable and just plain nice place to stay, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!!”
Reviews.Author: linchien
Reviews.Content: We liked the room, the location and amenities. We love the service.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dotrese
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights and 4 days in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite with my mom and sister-in-laws. I loved the area and the convenience of the outlet mall. WE had the most wonderful time with our spa treatments at the Reflections Spa. The pool was to be heated, but it was not. The pub resteraunt was good, but it took 45 minutes for our food and it was luke warm, not hot, by the time it was served to us. Even though the poolside bar, the pub and spa were very well advertised, but they never mentioned the opening and closing times. I would recommend this resort and hope to return again real soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW...this is the palace to stay, close to everything...Outlet next door!”
Reviews.Author: cathyyount
Reviews.Content: Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa is a wonderful enviorment for familes or adults. The pool with the ship in it is cool..the view of the marsh lands is nice, quiet, Irish Pub with GREAT food. The message offers and being able to book all parks there with very short distance to the "World Drive" entrance for pleasure island is great also. You are out of the noise district and walking distance to any shopping you need within the circle in front of the hotel lobby. Parking is a plus with the 2 floors of indoor parking next to the elevators! DON"T stay anywhere other than here....it will be a waste of your time!!!!! BIG Value, for the price you pay, which is very resonable!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully relaxed vacation”
Reviews.Author: mscrivens
Reviews.Content: Evidently our room was to be in a different building on the complex, but when girl at the front desk found out it was my birthday, she gave us(my daughter and 3 daughters-in-law) a nicer room in the newest building(right under the spa). Very nice 2 bedroom/2 bath suite with a balcony overlooking the fountain in front and the outlet across the way. We were pleased with the fully equipped kitchen, washer & dryer, master bedroom suite on one side and the second bedroom & bath on the other. Anytime we needed anything, the front desk made sure it was delivered in a timely manner. Our only complaint was a chemical smell each time we returned to our suite. It quickly disappeared when we open the sliding glass door to the balcony. We all thoroughly enjoyed the spa and it's staff. They were very accommodating, friendly and fun. It was also nice to have 3 hot tubs by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Guy's!!!”
Reviews.Author: Camorcio
Reviews.Content: One thing that really define a company focused on customer satisfaction is when they need to support a customer when he needs help. I made a reservation few days ago for my vacations on July, based on my friend's recommendations. Few days later I faced a big issue with my local agency travel and was necessary cancel everything. I called them to cancel my reservation due to this problems and I receive a super support for that. Thank you for Plinio to help me to solve my issues and provide me a very good support. These guy's are concerned about customer satisfaction! Sergio Batista

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: barney5011
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this resort to my family and friends.We stayed here for the first time and we had a great time at the pool.It was a very beautiful set up with the pirate ship and the shallow ends for the smaller kids.The kids had a great time swiming and going down the slide.The bartender was very nice also.He was very helpful with anything you needed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value - great location!”
Reviews.Author: JubuOui
Reviews.Content: When I first saw the prices on these rooms, I kept looking for "a catch". There isn't one. Our two-bedroom unit was perfect! The proximity to Disney is super (five minutes to Downtown Disney) and the freeway is very close so even the drive to Universal Studios was only about 15 minutes. The restaurant on-site had great Irish-pub food. It was a bit cool for swimming, but the pool looked appealing. We didn't try the shuttles as they only went to each park one time each day, but with the money we saved on accommodation there was plenty left over for car rental. I'll never stay anywhere else in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort & Location”
Reviews.Author: CDM6
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days @ Lake Buena Vista - had a 3 bed /3 bath unit. Loved the resort. Staff very helpful - especially Eric B. Food & service at Frankie's was excellent. Location was fabulous - close to Wal-Mart, Downtown Disney and all Disney parks. Nice to have the Outlet next door as well. Definitely recommend this resort and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY. EXCEEDED OUR EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: beaubrummie51
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Virgin Holidays for 12 Nights. We mailed to LBVRV & Spa a few days before departing UK to request a room in Block 5 after reading other reviews. To our suprise the Asst. Mgr replied and said he would try to accomodate our request. On arrival hey presto we had a 10th Floor 3 Bed Aptment, in Block 5 with a nightly view of the Disney & Epcot Fireworks. Thanks Mr. Girard, much appreciated. This is our 3rd visit in 3 years to Disney and and our first to this resort. It was by far the best we have stayed in. Aptment was huge and facilities fantastic for our group of 7. We took some spare Loo Roll, Dish Washer & Washing Machine Blocks and Bin Liners, but we had a good supply left in the room to get us started. Weather was hot during our second week and we came back from the Parks to find the Pool & Pool Bar still open until 10pm with a supply of clean towels and a Life Guard on duty. Pool spotless and the Pirate Ship/Water Slide great fun. We didn`t think the drinks were too expensive at all, also visted the Irish Pub, equally fair prices and we were given some discount vouchers to use towards our meals. Food very good especially Fish & Chips. Reception Staff were lovely, location for all the parks/shops great. Our stay could not have been better and we will definately use this resort again. Also would like to recommend Publix Supermarket`s much nicer than Walmart. Smokey Bones, Logans Roadhouse and Chili`s for evening meals. Hooters LBV also a fun experiance especially for the males in the party (including our 11 year old son!!) The Swiss Cheese, Mushroom, Bacon Burger was to die for. How anyone could leave negative comments about this resort is baffling. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond super!”
Reviews.Author: unclepaul44
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of the experience exceeded well beyond my my expectations. I have traveled the world for more than two decades. The service and the atmosphere were stellar. I would resoundingly recommend this hotel experience to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing, quiet, comfortable, spacious”
Reviews.Author: Margie1722
Reviews.Content: January 2011 my sister myself and our husbands stayed at LBV Resort. The 2 bedroom suite was perfect for us. the location was good as we had a car. they did provide a shuttle to Disney and such. the pool was nice, not deep, good for kids. 2 small Jacuzzi's. however, it was too cold to use any of this. we were on the 7th floor it was very quiet and beautiful restful. and fun to come home to. the grocery store just off the sight and the shopping next door was fun, and convenient. Parking for our was very convenient and safe. the full kitchen was nice, we were on the go most of the time. but for kids and family's, the kitchen is fully loaded Very clean and ready to go.

Reviews.Title: “exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette5958
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 week stay at the Lake Buena Vista resort village and Spa and can find very little to find fault with. It exceeded all our expectations. Tjhe condo's are very spacious and absoluely spotlessly clean. we stayed in a 2 bedroom condo on the 8th floor in block five with a view of the pirate pool. The kitchen was fantastic, our only complaint was the lack of utensils to cook food in the oven. We bought foil disposable bakeware from ther local Walmart. Saves on washing up although there was a full size dishwaher installed that we made good use of. The fridge was huge and had a very spacious freezer compartment. It took a while to navigate the cooker controls for the oven but we managed to cook a variety of meals. Food has increased in price since our last visit to Florida in march 2010 but the local Golden Corral has not increased their prices so was still a good option for breakfast and lunch. $7.99 pays for the breakfast buffet which is very extensive and would cater for everyones taste. if you arrive just before 11 am you still pay the breakfast price but also have access to the lunch menu. A great place to eat for a special event was the rainForest cafe. There is one at the animal kingdom and one in Downtown Disney. Great food and amazing decor. The kids will love it., it even has its own tropical storm every half an hour. Average cost is about $25 - 30 dollars a person but is well worth it. During our stay at the lake Buena vist resort village we twice booked the full clean service for $30 dollars, this was definately worth the money and the cleaning standard was superb. This service includes a change of sheets and towels, all the kitchen equipment washed and put away and a general clean, hoover dust and polish.. We found reception very helpful and polite. I have read some reviews that state the reception service was not very good but this was not our experience. Both the pools were heated. The whirlpools were a little too hot for my taste but none the less were very popular til late into the evening. You are not allowed to take your own food and drink into the pool area. There is a bar there but prices are pretty high. There is both indoor and outdoor parking. we never had a problem finding a space although it does get very busy at weekends when all the locals flock to Orlando. There is a outlet centre right next to the resort village but we found the Premium outlet village about half a mile away much better. The disney store there sells disney items at a really good reduced price. Much cheaper than the parks. The only negative thing we can say is that the advertised wirefree internet was mainly non existant. Reception gave us a wire so that we could connect to the internet that way but it was not really very sucessful. We had to go down to the reception area and use the wifi there or use the hotels computers which cost about $8.00 dollars an hour. This is just a small moan but we would still give this accomodation full marks. cannot praise it enough. In all we had a fab holiday and would definately recommend The lake Buena vista Resort village to anyone that wanted luxury accommodation - the bathroom was fab-. we were only a short Drive from the parks and when we return to Orlando in 2012 we will definately be booking this accomodation again. One last point is that the Spa is very expensive. Much better to use the huge jacuzzi bath in the main bedrrom.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay with your family for vacation.”
Reviews.Author: drswills
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay with your family for a vacation, the rooms were clean and nice. The 3 bedroom suite had plenty of room for all of us, you have a choice for your swimming pools too, the slide in the ship pool is awesome!(Even for us big kids) Close to Disney and other theme parks. Getting in and out of this location was ok, heads up on the round about. The coffee in the room and on the property was not so good, and limited internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a nice resort close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: kmh73
Reviews.Content: There are so many resorts to choose from in the Orlando area, but this one was unique in that a party of 7 could stay in one unit. We were in Orlando off-season and got a 4 bedroom/4 bath huge condo for $240 a night. The Disney resorts look so nice, but I just can't justify spending several hundred dollars a night for a small hotel room when you can spread out in a place like this. The condo was in building 5. The huge balcony faced a busy road, but it didn't bother us, particularly because our unit faced the Disney area and we could see the fireworks every night. The unit was immaculate, included a full kitchen and washer/dryer. There is a Publix and a Wal-mart a few mins away and nice outlets you can walk to if you forget anything. As well, the convenience store carries a good selection of snacks, drinks, toiletries, etc. The Irish Pub at the resort has great food and drinks and there are plenty of other close dining/delivery options. The resort itself is quiet and the pool area is great. The drive is an easy 10-15 mins to the Disney Parks and just a bit longer to the Universal area. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoNurse1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed at LBV January 19-24th along with my husband and in-laws. We were in buidling number 1, room 1609. Our suite was a 3 bedroom 3 bath (with two master suites on opposite sides). The room was clean and kitchen well stocked. We cooked a majority of the meals to save on restaurant expenses. My mother-in-law's only complaint was lack of serving and cooking pans. You will need a car!! You can walk to Wal-Mart, partially without a sidewalk. There is also a small outlet mall directly behind our building. We did not use the shuttles to the parks, nor the internet. Just an FYI---you need a cable to connect to the internet in the room. The front desk had one to borrow which we were unaware of until check-out. We used our smart phones instead without any issues. The gym is small and pathetic in my humble opinion. There are a few weight machines....I prefer free weights.....as well as several treadmills, elipticals, and bikes. No free weights, jump ropes, bosu balls, medicine balls, etc. There are towels, but no way to clean off machines after using them. I ran outside instead. The pool is nice and so is the bar!!! My husband really enjoyed the pirate ship slide! Overall, it's a pretty decent place to stay. No major issues or complaints!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Fully Equipped, Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: BrendaSegal
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at this resort hotel and I was more than pleased. I was in the smallest available room. In spite of this, the room was gigantic and had all the amenities I could possibly need: full kitchen with utensils, 3 TVs, 3 beds, 2 bathrooms, and an incredibly relaxing whirlpool bath. Not only this, but the hotel offered many services like lots of tourist information, complimentary shuttles to major theme parks, a fully stocked convenience store, a pool, and much more. The location was also great. You just had to cross the street to access Lake Buena Vistory Factory Outlet mall. On the whole, I have absolutely no complaints and I will certainly be coming here on my next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Huge Room”
Reviews.Author: louise_nz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early Jan 2011 - amazing room, very clean and great location. Pool looks great (weather wasn't quite warm enough for us adults, but the kids in our party LOVED it). Convenience store onsite has all the necessities, and is open late. Air conditioning was a little noisy at night. Recommend getting a rental car, as Orlando is a sprawling city. Discount shopping mall next door is fantastically convenient and has a good range of stores. We loved this hotel and will definitely stay here again if in the area. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: 5_ticos
Reviews.Content: Although it was hard to find at first we got a very nice surprise once we were in the room. Check in was a bit long since there was only one person at the front desk and a few people in line. The suite was great!, big, super clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were spotless and so was the kitchen. We did not want to pay extra for housekeeping service but did get the towel service at $5 a day. Location was very convenient (once we found it!), next door to outlet mall and 5 min way from premium outlets and 10 min from most parks. My only complain is that when checking out our bill included a $9.50 per day for resort services. Since on my reservation it was not mentioned they deducted it from the bill, but the resort should make sure people know about it before charging it, also internet is not wireless in the rooms and the jack to plug in is in a very uncomfortable place and there is no desk to work plus they had problems all week with the internet service. I suggest they put an extra jack close to the table so guests can use it as a desk Overall experience was great

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelwithfamily8
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location and great resort amenities. We stayed in a 3 bedroom, 2 bath suite that was spacious, comfortable and well appointed. The heated pirate ship pool, with zero depth entry for the little toddlers and 5ft maximum depth was a blast for the kids. Loved the hot tubs as well as the pool side bar which served food. With outlet stores next door, a wal-mart 2 a block away, a 7 minute drive to Disney World and a 15 minute drive to Gatorland, you could not ask for a better location. Highly recommend the resort as the value for the price we got was really fantastic (it was low season pricing).

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms at a cheap rate and located near Disney”
Reviews.Author: Essexboy999
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in December with wife and kids on the “theme park mission”... Our room was a three bedroom apartment. Rooms were large with plenty of space. Had a couple of issues with air conditioning, TVs and cleanliness. Some of our concerns were dealt with eventually and after reminders but not all issues. We gave up on some which was disappointing, especially as we were in low season and there was virtually nobody else staying in the block we were in. Check in/Check Out (or just an enquiry) should be planned carefully as the peak times provide a significant dent into your day. The staff were pleasant to deal with just a bit under the pump at times. Kitchen was functional but would greatly benefit from some additional basic kitchen equipment. It would be a challenge if you were planning on feeding the family each day using the facilities available in the kitchen. (In reality, you probably won’t try to do this given the amount of food available within a short drive. There is a faux Irish pub opposite which serves a good selection of drinks but the food is faux Irish pub - don’t expect much (and check the bill). Go to “Sweet Tomatoes” for healthy food. Do NOT go to Johnnie’s Hideaway for Dinner.) Swimming Pool area has a bar and in the pool is a pirate ship with a slide which the kids enjoyed. The pool is properly heated so swimming was possible despite the lower than usual temperatures. Don’t be fooled by “the join us for breakfast at the pool” invites - it is not what most on holiday would call breakfast - very limited basic selection available but better than nothing and the guy there was happy to have a chat. The surrounding area is either a shopping factory outlet complex right next door (but we’re not shoppers so no idea on price or quality - sorry), some wasteland (when we made enough money from these condo’s we’ll build on the next block?) and the main road, so you are not staying here for the views or general ambience. Overall, the main positives here are the location in relation to Disney (in a car) and the price. It was very cheap for the size and overall facilities. So, if you get a good deal and if you are doing the theme parks and do not need to (or more likely will not have enough energy) wander along International Drive then I would happily stay here again. If you want to walk to some cafes and restaurants in the evening then don’t.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Holidaytraveller85
Reviews.Content: I was wary about this hotel as I had read some bad reviews but everything was fantastic. I travelled with children ranging from 3 to 14 and would definately go back to this hotel again. Room had everything we required for self catering down to a tin opener! Rooms were spacious, jaquzzi was fab and staff were helpful and friendly. I would definately return and recommend this hotel for families

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robyn10_10
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. we were upgraded from a 2 bedroom apartment to a 3 bedroom one, so plenty of space for all. The apartments are well equipped with kitchen utensils. Massive master bedroom. We would have liked wifi internet rather than cable. The apartment building did have a strange smell about it. The room smelt better with balcony door open. You definitely need a car though as the complex is a fair distance to restaraunts/ Walmart etc. Loved the outlet mall next door. I was charged a daily resort fee on checkout that I was not expecting. I booked through Agoda and there was no mention of this charge

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa196711
Reviews.Content: I felt that i had to write this. We came over Dec 2010 for christmas we were booked into a different hotel but after a terriable journey from the uk and booked into the wrong hotel which was disgusting our rep managed to get us booked into yourselves. And i have to say how fantastic you was with us we were very tired and upset of how we have been treated ERIC one of your receptionists there was brillant very kind and very very helpful. He gave us a lovely suite which was big very clean and had everything we needed and what a lovely bath of which i didnt want to get out of. I will recommend your hotel to everyone its in a lovely area the only thing i would say that your games room needs to be bigger and updating and another restaurant on site would be good. Also very easy to get to the disney's.THANK YOU VERY MUCH. MRS STROUD

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: dpmariani
Reviews.Content: We were a family of six adults (19 - 52) and we all loved this resort. Our room was beautiful and clean. Check in was a breeze. Shuttle to Disney ran right on time. Our guys loved the pub and the selection of sports on the tv's. We had 3 bedrooms and two bathrooms for less than the cost of one room during Christmas week anywhere on the Disney property. Our room overlooked the quiet pool and we never heard a sound from the other rooms. We will never cram our family into overpriced hotel rooms again!!! The outlet mall was an added bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing lack of quality”
Reviews.Author: CPA95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Jan. 6-11, 2011. We had 2 families with 9 people in total, so we rented 2 three-bedroom, two-bathroom units.  Fortunately the units were next to each other. In all, this place is mediocre. There is a parking garage on the first two floors of each building, which is convenient. The units are spacious and the master bedroom was large with a separate shower and jetted tub; however, there is no separate door on the master bath; it is just an extension of the bedroom. The sofas in our rooms were worn and saggy and the carpets were filthy and stained throughout. The tile near the elevators on our floor was loose and cracked. The beds were fairly comfortable but the pillows were terrible and we had to buy our own to avoid getting headaches. The kitchen was nice, with granite countertops, but we were missing several utensils and some of the pieces were broken. The icemaker didn't work. The washer and dryer was a great bonus but no laundry soap was provided, so we had to make a separate trip to buy our own.  All of the bathrooms were missing washcloths, and although I called and requested them on our second day, they were never delivered. In order to get the room cleaned and/or obtain fresh towels, there is a charge of at least $5. The spa was beautiful and the massage was fantastic...definitely the bright spot of the hotel.  We used the free shuttle service to Epcot, which is the only Disney park that is serviced from this hotel.  The shuttle only departs at 8:55 am & 11:25 am, and return trips are either 6:20 pm or 10:30 pm. The hotel is fairly close to the parks & there is a nice Walmart down the street.  We probably would not stay here again.  The staff members obviously do not care about customer service and guest satisfaction.  This hotel is ok if you are on a limited budget and need more than one bedroom, but don't expect quality service or furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable & clean well worth the value.”
Reviews.Author: Anne181757
Reviews.Content: when we arrived, the desk clerk was useless, he origionally said he did not have our reservation, until I pulled out our confirmation documents, he did not explain any of the resort policies regarding the shuttles to disney parks e.g booking it, times that they are avaiable ect... or that we needed to obtain a voucher for the shuttle. The times that the shuttles were avaiable were not good eg: times to go were 8:55am and 11:20am and return was 6:20pm and 10:20pm(the last park closed at 9pm so you had a 1 1/2 hour wait to take the free shuttle(cost for a taxi was $30.00 which was crazy. The cars that are parked outside the resort to offer alternative transportation to parks and other places you may want to go were extremely expensive(do not take them) call your own taxi Julia's taxi service was the best cost. Do not pay more than $5.00 each way to go to walmart, and do not ask resort employees to call one for you, they will call most expensive ones. We much enjoyed having a lot of space eg 3 bedrooms 2 bath, 4 tv's, as we had 3 teenagers with us. it made for a comfortable stay. The master bed and bath were superb, and luxurious. The pool was excellent( the drinks at the poolside bar were too expensive. Do not count on going to the convience store way too costly, go to walmart for groceries. We called to front desk our can opener was broken, was told someone would bring another one up, no one ever did. it was hard to get additional toiet paper and dish soap. toilets were very slow, plugged up very easily and frequent, we had to plunger it ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Been to Disney many times and this is the best hotel stay of all!!!”
Reviews.Author: cprice312
Reviews.Content: Took my family to Disney as part of their Christmas present and could not of been happier with the accomodations. We stayed in the 3 bedroom condo and it was perfect for 6 people. Very clean,spacious & after a busy day at the parks the resort is very quiet and relaxing. Also the pirate themed pool was a big hit for our 10 yr. old son.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a lot to offer”
Reviews.Author: cjw345
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa the week before Christmas 2010. Even though we had planned the trip since February, there's still the uncertainty about whether or not the correct research was done to find the best place to stay. We were not disappointed. Our trip was specifically focused around Disney, so we liked the hotel's proximity to the parks. 5-10 minutes in the car, and you're where you want to be. Walmart is about 1/2 a mile away, and another grocery store is a few miles past that. That's good because the convenience store in the hotel, while very well stocked, is pricey. The location had one drawback, though. The area around the hotel did not have a lot of offerings for eating out. We went out to dinner a couple of times and had a hard time finding a place. We ended up finding another major road, which had more variety. The room was very spacious, and fit our needs well. We liked the kitchen and the washer/dryer. The hotel in general was very quiet. The sofa in the room was pretty worn, and the beds were not comfortable at all. While we didn't spend much time in the room, it would have been nice to get better sleep when we were there. One other thing that bothered me was the internet in the room. While every room has internet access, an ethernet cable, which the hotel will provide for free, is required. However, I went to the office each of three successive mornings to ask about availability of the cables, and was told that they didn't have any, but I should check back after checkout around 11:00 AM. I planned to be enjoying my vacation at 11:00 AM not sitting around the hotel waiting for an ethernet cable. I finally just went to Walmart and bought one there. Once I was able to hook up, access was quick and readily available. We didn't use the pool since the weather was a little cool for us. However, the pool must be heated because other people were using it. It looks like fun, so if we go back when it's warmer we will try to check it out. All in all, this hotel was very nice. We got a great rate on a very spacious room that had a lot of nice features. The parking garage at the bottom of the building we stayed in was convenient, and we were usually able to find a spot. The spots are kind of narrow, though, since they have to fit them in between the buidling's support columns. The best bet is parking in one of the middle spots. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and will be returning”
Reviews.Author: Breezy101
Reviews.Content: This resort is fantastic for a number of reasons: The location is excellent, being close to all the attractions, shopping and eateries. The apartments are spacious, with lots of amenities within the apartment. The Spa Bath in the main bedroom just has to be tried, particularly in early morning jet lag!! The Mall next to the resort is within walking distance and with the discount vouchers offered at the hotel upon check in, make the prices better than the malls on I-Drive. (We got some excellent bargains!). There are additional vouchers available at reception - so dont be afraid to ask! The pool is brilliant ... to have a slide within the Pirate ship was great and there was always a lifegaured there. There are a couple of downsides: On walking into the room, you could tell that it had not received a "big" clean! This wasn't a problem though ... we booked a full clean and although we should have said something, on paying for the service on departure, we did mention it, and they immediately gave us 50% off and apologised. The shop on site is really majorly expensive!! For Bread, Milk, small OJ, small margerine and some cheese slices cost $26!! We did a full shop at Walmart half a mile down the road the following day, which if you can wait to do some shopping ... do so ... the on site shop is just a rip off! We have presiously stayed at the Bahama Bay Resort and on balance, we would return to the LBV Resort and Spa without a doubt!! A great holiday and cant wait to go back - already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: MistryLady
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Orlando on Monday - we were due out on 19 Dec 2010 - but got delayed due to the snow at LHR - so only arrived on 21st Dec. The hotel unfortunatley did not have details of our delay and so were not prepared for our arrival. However, they were very accommodating and arranged for our room to be ready as soon as possible. The room was very clean (although did have a slight smell of sausages/bacon?! which i assume the previous occupants had for breakfast! And in the rush of getting the room ready for us, it was not fully aired out). The room otherwise was nice and comfortable and enough space for 3 adults + 2 kids under 8. I requested a room with a view of the fireworks at Disney and thats exactly what i got- they were amazing to see from our balcony! This hotel was in a great location - only 15mins from most of the popular Disney and Universal parks. The staff were friendly and always ready to help. There is also a great outlet mall within walking distance of the hotel - perfect for GAP, OshKosh, Reebok, etc. For all shopping its cheaper to buy from Walmart rather than the hotel shop which is very expensive. Walmart is only a 2min drive away and its basically an Asda - so you'll find everything you need. The only down side was the lack of parking for our building (5) - when we returned from the parks-usually at about 9/10pm - there was no parking on the 2 levels or outside the buildings. This was annoying but not enough to put me off the place!! I would def recommend this hotel and will (once we have saved again!...) go again to the same place!

Reviews.Title: “BACK NEXT YEAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: harryhh98
Reviews.Content: me and my family have been really looking forward to this stay this year and was NOT let down by the hotel. this hotel is one of the most expensive hotels we have stayed in when in orlando but it was worth evrey penny, the brand new pirate ship in the pool is a neat touch but blocks out all the sun light fot people triying to tan there selfs but is great for children. the service in the hotel was fantastic, the rooms a big clean and very comfy!!! the complimentary bus service is a lot faster then some of the other hotels. Just down the road there is a supermarket witch was good for us because we had our own kithchen and made the most of it!! we will be back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Fit for 3 Generations”
Reviews.Author: mbr1217
Reviews.Content: We were taking our daughter, son-in-law and 2 grandchildren (6 and 9) to Universal Studios and decided to try a large suite (3 BR) instead of crowding into regular hotel rooms and it worked out perfectly. Full kitchen to store drinks, snacks, etc., we weren't tripping over suitcases and souvenirs all the time, we each retired to our own rooms at nights, flatscreen TVs in every room, a dining room for our pizza night after an exhausting day, This resort had very helpful people at the front desk, a Pizza Hut, Irish pub and convenience store on the premises, nicely furnished suite, and could not have worked out better. We were about 7 miles from Universal but it was straight highway and took only a few minutes. All 6 of us were pleased, and the price was unbelievable. Cost was comparable to taking 1 hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: timeoff30
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4nights starting Dec. 18th. Had 2 bedroom suite in building 5 overlooking the pool. Place was very nice. Not sure where these people that give bad reviews come from. We had stayed at the Hilton in St. Augustine prior to our arrival at twice the price and this place is nicer. Security and parking was excellent. Other reviews had mention small children in the jacuzzi which we encountered. We have small children that were with us and would never let them use the jacuzzi like a kiddie pool. A family and kids literally camped out and when we went over and my wife was actually jumped on by a child the lady actually felt the need to tell us kids were allowed in the jacuzzi. Some parents have no clue I guess--it is 110 degrees. She then stared us down the rest of the time. I hope she reads this. Thanks for the entertainment. You should join Disney.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: deanhancock
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for 4 years in a row and have always had an enjoyable time hence why we go back. Arrived at this hotel on 9 December 2010 with my partner and 3 children, upgraded at the reception to a 3 bedroom. On the morning of the 10th my daughter woke covered in spots with heads we thought she had chicken pox great no it turns out she had bed bug bites and was covered. The hotel is currently doing an investigation. The rooms have gone so down hill over the last year and our room was on the 11th floor facing the outlet. The carpets are all stained, the lock on the balcony door had been removed and the secuirty lock on the front door had been pulled off. All the kitchen utencils had to be put through the diswasher before we could use them as there was still food dried up on the forks etc. The standards have definately dropped and we would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodation, good location”
Reviews.Author: tedbates
Reviews.Content: Billed as "luxury" condos, these are roomy, reasonably well-maintained lodgings. Pros: loads of room, good kitchen, well-equipped, close to attractions & shopping. Good pools onsite. Cons: Furniture old and does not match, mattresses & bedding worn and second-rate. TV is large screen but old rear-projection is blurry and not HD, no DVD. Wi-fi only in lobby. Staff friendly, but seem overwhelmed and not entirely competent at times, with long lineups at front desk. Summary: If you're going to be at the parks all day, and want a roomy spot to eat and sleep, this is a good pick and a reasonable value. But it's not a "luxury condo".

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, great location, affordable”
Reviews.Author: patriotsgirl12
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 3 days here, including Christmas day. We had a wonderful time. Check in was super easy. Our unit was beautiful! Even more than we expected. We stayed in a 3 bed/3 bath and there was plenty of room for the 7 of us. Also the pool with the pirate ship is awesome!!I recommend this resort for families. With the full kitchen and washer/dryer in the unit we saved a ton of money. It is very affordable and you can't beat the location! Walmart and Publix were less than 5 mins away and it took us 10 mins to get to magic kingdom. We even left something in our unit after we checked out and within a week management called me and our belongings were returned to us. All in all we were impressed and we're already planning to go back to the resort next Christmas!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shamurocks
Reviews.Content: My family and I have now stayed in this hotel twice, once in October 2008 and again in April 2010 (we have also booked for a week in February 2011). For us, it is perfect. We stay in a 2 bed, 2 bath room and there is an enormous amount of room for the price. The kitchen is well equipped, the bathrooms clean and the bedrooms are comfy and cosy. The complimentary shuttle to the theme parks is useful if you are good at planning your day (they only leave at certain times) and the drivers/staff are friendly. I would recommend trying to get a room at the top of building 5 as it provides great view of the area and a glimpse and the fireworks at Magic Kingdom at night. Overall I would totally recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever....”
Reviews.Author: crystaljj
Reviews.Content: I reserved 3 bdr & 2 bth and they gave me AN old dirty and smelly little terrible place......ahahahah! I went back to' the recepiton and they told me my apt was the bes t.... DO NOT STAY HERE! Worst place ever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: saharmel
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY IN THIS PLACE This is the worst place ever I have been . We are currently in this place in room 2701 and today is our first day here. Eveything is just awful, the furniture are so old and dirty, the kitchen is not fully equipped, the lamps don't work, the blender doesn't work, the carpets are very dirty, We are looking for another place to leave here but we can't find anything, All places are sold out. Please people don't stay here, the picures and their website are very deceiving... The only thing good about it is being close to some of the outlet stores. We care a lot about cleanliiness because I have a toddler but this place is so dirty. The internet was supposed to be wireless but now we have a cable connected ....

Reviews.Title: “This place is fabulous and we will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: loopygig
Reviews.Content: My husband and 6 year old grandson and I stayed from December 10-19 in a 2 bedroom unit in bldg 5 on the 9th floor. It was totally perfect. The unit had everything we needed, it is close to shopping, eating places and grocery stores and it was a quick drive to the attractions. The grandson decided that we should just stay forever and there really was no reason to go back to snowy Minnesota. He thought the rest of the family could just come visit. The only warning I have for people not familiar with the Orlando area is that you really need a car. This is not a place to stay if you are planning to rely on public transportation or park shuttles. When we were there, it wasn't crowded or busy at all. I think that at a busier time of year, our experiences might be different. If the building had been fully occupied, it would have been noisier. Since we never travel to Florida during peak season, this place is perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: natashacampbell77
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, we stayed in a two bedroom, two bathroom unit. It was huge! Great big kitchen, washer dryer, 3 televisions. I wanted to move in!! So spacious and beautifully decorated, great place for families. Convenience store on site that stocked absolutely everything at reasonable prices. Outlet centre 1 min walk. The pool was UNREAL! A huge pirate ship with water slide! There was also a quiter adult pool. You would be mad not to stay here if your in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space - Great choice for families”
Reviews.Author: Gremio
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome if you are visiting Disney World with your family. We got a 2 bedroom apartment for 3 adults and two children. The apartment was big. It had a full kitchen with everything one could ask for. There was also washer and dryer. Really convenient. It rained pretty much every day during our trip, hence we ended up using the room a lot! The locations is perfect. Really close to the Disney parks. There was indoor parking, which was very helpful since it was raining. Also, there is a mini market in one of the buildings which is handy. An outlet shopping center is located next door, you can walk there. There is a super WalMart very close to the hotel as well. In fact, there are plenty of restaurants and stores in that area. We did not use room services, but that is an additional service. The pool was great. The kids loved it! There was a nice pool bar as well. I really recommend this resort for families.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: JMerriam
Reviews.Content: We stayed with this resort for 8 days. The room we had (Antigua, 2 bedroom) was beautiful. It was clean and nicely furnished. There was plenty of room for the 4 of us to not be on top of each other for the times we spent at the resort. My kids are 13 and 3 and they shared a bedroom. Not ideal in the 13 yr olds view...but it worked well. The public areas of the hotel were clean and clutter free and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. I was disappointed that the pirate plunge pool was not heated, as it was downright COLD the week we were there. The in-room washer and dryer was a HUGE asset and with a Wal-Mart right down the road we were able to keep up with our laundry and didn't need to pack as much. I also washed towels as needed, instead of asking for more. The on-site store had everything, but was expensive, still if you absolutely needed something, they had it. Over all, I would say this resort was absolutely perfect for our family. It was about 20 minutes from Universal and less than that to Disney. It was good to come "home" and be a little ways away from the hustle and bustle. Parking was easy and ALL buildings required key access to even the public areas (elevators etc), which was sometimes a hassle, but made us feel secure. I highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Holidays089
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel after visiting Disney World. Wanted a quiet hotel to relax. Prepaid this hotel with a travel agent. When we arrived they had no record of our reservation, had to show them the confirmation number and then get our travel agent to phone them. No apology actually didn't care at all. The rooms were very spacious perfect for our family of 7. At this hotel you need a car, which we did not have, so we relied on taxies. DO NOT get them to call a taxi for you from the hotel, they call there own and charge almost double. With their taxi to a resturant was $16.00 and with one we called on the return trip was $9.00, also they had wanted $70.00 for a taxi to the airport and with yellow cabs we paid $43.00. Overall a decent hotel just don't expect great service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: emrogerspa
Reviews.Content: My hubsand and I stayed here one night in November. We could not take advantage of the "resort services" as we were short on time. The front desk service was a little slow, but they were very pleasant and helpful during check in. The room was a good size - we had a resort view balcony, which was nice. The bed was very comfortable, but the walls were a little thin. The room next to us had a toddler who was either talking or crying - Disney does have that effect on kids! The bathroom shower curtain did have some mold on the outside of it, and as others have mentioned on this site the hotel did have a moldy smell to it. We did not use valet parking & we did have a bit of a walk to our car (didn't help that we were there during a cold snap). We probably would not stay again secondary to cost. The location is great for anyone visiting Downtown Disney & plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: RGEM
Reviews.Content: After reading some bad reviews, I was nervous about checking in. We arrived early and were able to check in right away. The Lobby is beautiful and the whole complex was keep up well. You can tell this resort is fairly new. Our room was in the 5th building with 2 bedrooms and 2 baths overlooking the HWY. Everything was very clean & we had no issues at all with our room. My 3 and 1 year old slept very well!! The pool was amazing and warm in the sun, the other heated pool felt like bath water. There are 4 hot tubs total. We ate at the Irish pub, the pool bar and the pizza hut all were good. Also love being walking distance to the outlet mall. They have some good stores. We rented a car, so no need for other transportation. Walmart was literally a 5 min drive we were able to get all our groceries in one shot! We are already planning our trip back to this resort in 2 years:) Also- if you haven't been to Mickey's Christmas it was SPECTACULAR!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us - would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Worrypenny
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Orlando in Nov 2010 with Virgin Holidays and choose this location as we had seen it on previous visits to the area. I'll admit if you're looking for somewhere with a variety of nightlife/restaurants within walking distance then this place isn't for you. But with a outlet shopping mall onsite and a great Walmart almost opposite and a Publix and Target down the road; we were sorted. Plus, it is very, very near to Disney property; it took us 7 minutes from car ignition to car park at EPCOT! Downtown Disney is just up the SR535 as is the Crossroads shopping/dining area. The site itself was clean and well maintained and quiet. Our appartment was in building 4 and wonderful for all our needs. (the kitchen was lacking in a few cooking utensils but that just meant we had to eat out more -shame!) Staff were helpful and polite. The pool area was well equipped with loungers/chairs and shower/toilet facilities; they also played Margaritaville radio. Excellent choice for relaxing. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: edge-trip
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers and have visited over 50 countries. I did a lot of research before booked this so called resort. I'll start with the good. Pool is really fun, bar service very friendly, but drinks are a little pricey. Irish Pub is excellent, but not part of the hotel as you're led to believe, so you cannot charge to your account. The condo was okay, but couch and chair a little dirty & worn. They did not furnish enough towels or wash clothes and will charge you for extra. You'll need to make a trip to grocery for basics. Now the BAD! These are cheap condos, not a full service hotel. This place has the worst customer service and will tell you bold face lies. We confirmed that there would be activities with the Sky Kids Club by phone & email before we booked. Was told each one was a 2 hour supervised fun time so parents could shop or visit the spa. There was a blackboard that listed the schedule each day in Grand Lobby. We waited 1 hour for the first one, but no one showed. Checked back at the 2 PM class for project number 2, but sill no show. Went to the front desk at 2:15 and was told attendant was on break but would be out in a few minutes. We waited until 2:45, still no show. Checked for the 5 PM class, same thing! Talked with other parents that was also really unhappy. The desk clerk (Steve) should find another position. He was not only rude to me on the first day, but I witnessed the same with other guests at check-out. After a few days we moved to The Caribe Royale. This had been our second choice, and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Amazing Price”
Reviews.Author: mairabu
Reviews.Content: Had the most amazing time at this hotel. We rented a 2 bedroom for 6 people. Stayed there for 10 days and had no complaints. Everybody at the front desk were really caring, always helping us with wathever we needed. Even though the housekeeping is not included, the room was really clean and we only payed one day for a full cleaning wich includes the cleaning of the room and the change of bed sheets and towels (the cost was USD 30). On the last day, we end up forgeting one cellphone at the room, and not only they found it, but they managed to deliver it to us at the airport before our plane left.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed and highly overated”
Reviews.Author: lilithepink2009
Reviews.Content: Our holiday started badly because we were told (at the booking stage) we were going to have a top floor apartment with a pool view, instead, we were the given the 'joke room' in building 1 floor 2, overlooking the shopping mall.The room was very worn out, kitchen cupboards empty (no pans or electrical items) and broken fittings. We couldn't sit on balcony as palm trees were overhanging. We paid for a 3bed 3bath and when we asked if we could change to another 3 bed apt we were told that the block for these rooms were all the same and were in need of renovation. Our only option was for 2 x 2bed rooms in building 5, which were slightly newer. The kitchen cooking equipment was limited. There was no bottle opener, no can opener., and only a cookie sheet for the oven. Although the pirate ship looks impressive, it is only a feature, you cannot access any of it. It has 1 slide but can only be used when lifeguard is on duty. The heating for the pool is only on sporadically. We have stayed in 5 star accommodation in Orlando and this definitely isn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough.”
Reviews.Author: EAM_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend and some friends in late October. We stayed in the St. Lucia Suite. 3 bedrooms (2 of the 3 bedrooms have Jacuzzi Tubs and Walk-In Showers). The third room had twin beds with a 3rd bathroom in the hall. This suite had a nice, long balcony stretching nearly the entire width of the suite. The view, however, was of the outlet shops that encompass the hotel. Honestly, this hotel was adequate. The beds were comfortable, but the furnishings in the rooms and the main room seemed dated. The master bathrooms were great with tons of closet space, if you need it. The washer dryer in the suite was a great bonus, and the kitchen was stocked with pots/pans/dishes, so that was nice. The fitness center was nothing spectacular. You can get some cardio in, but no free weights, just a few of the weight machines. The pools were fun. Though, the towels they give you are ridiculously small. Internet service didn't work in our rooms, and I was shocked to see they charge for internet use of the hotel's computers. I thought we were passed that by now with wi-fi. Anyways, we all enjoyed our stay, however, I think the complaint we all had was the location. It's really not a pretty area. The shops make half of the hotel grounds look nice enough, but the other half (buildings 3,4,5) have grounds that are pretty abandoned, like a vacant lot or something. The location of the hotel was not ideal. Not that it was far away, but there are so many other hotels for the same price that are much closer to all the parks.
