We had a rental car and used it the entire time. So, long story short. The hotel didn't blow us away. The hotel buildings themselves are pretty, but the unfinished/abandoned grounds surrounding part of the hotel and the general unfinished feel of hotel itself led to a feeling of disappointment. You could do better, you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Clean”
Reviews.Author: homer2210
Reviews.Content: Stayed with wife and 3 yr old son. We had a great time at this resort. The best thing I can say of this place is the location is perfect, near disney parks, seaworld, shops, walmart, expressways, airport. It did not take long to get anywhere that we needed to go. Rooms are very clean and large, better than the small rooms at disney resorts. The pool with the pirate ship was great, it is heated, however not much so, we did go swimming at 9:00 at night and it was about 65 degrees and it was comfortable in the pool. I will say that thought the waterslide in the pirate ship is cool, it is pitch black in there and scary at first, be prepared for this. You must be 50" tall to ride by yourself, otherwise an adult can go down with a child, the landing area in the pool for the slide is 4 feet deep, so small children would not be able to touch the bottom. Some things that I did not like were the hard pillows and the thin walls. When you take a trip to disney it is extremely exhausting, alot of walking and alot to see so you need to have a good place to sleep and recharge your system, I found this place a little lacking in this department. The walls are thin, however we were so tired that this did not prevent us from sleeping. My wife did go to the spa and got a pedicure and a sea salt scrub which she said was the best that she had ever had, she was happy and as us men know when the wife is happy the whole family is happy. Had a good time, for the price and location I would definitely go back to LBVR.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for families with children”
Reviews.Author: DebW42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the third time and the experience was exactly the same. I only gave the service 4 out of 5 as I thought the reception staff could have been friendlier. The apartment which overlooked the pool was great. Clean and large as we had a three bed apartment to accommodate our two teenages (1 boy and 1 girl). They both had tv's so there was no arguing over what to watch. The kitchen was well equiped but a couple more glasses wouldn't have gone a miss. Being located next to the outlet mall was great as we didn't lose any theme park time as we shopped in the evening. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: tractorcito100
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent hotel with very nice buildings and swiming pool. the rate is fair, and the room was equiped with all the stuff you might need, to stay comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - Great location close to all attractions & awesome accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Amanda125
Reviews.Content: I booked a one bedroom suite on the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa website taking advantage of the advance booking rate which was the lowest I could find anywhere. Upon check in we were automatically upgraded to a two bedroom suite. The room was great! The full size kitchen felt like home. The jacuzzi tub was very nice after a long day of walking around the theme parks. The in-room safe was large enough to accomodate my laptop and a few small purses. The in-room washer and dryer meant that we were able to pack lighter and take more stuff home with us. We did not pay the extra fee for housekeeping and instead decided to wash our towels mid-week along with our other laundry. The resort was a short drive away from a Walmart so we were able to stock up on some groceries for the week. We received some great coupons for the outlet mall next door and did spend some time shopping there. The resort is approximately 5-15 minutes away from everything (Seaworld, Universal Studios & Disney) which made for a quick drive home each evening. The resort does offer a small grocery store but it is pretty expensive. A small package of Ramon noodles sold for $1.99 at the resort grocery store but at Walmart the same package cost $0.28. We did dine one night at the Irish pub located at the resort. The food was average, nothing special but something close and convenient. Overall a great place to stay for the cost. We really enjoyed the fact that we had seperate bedrooms so my daughter could go to sleep early and the adults could stay up a little later. Something that can't be done in a regular hotel room. Having the full size kitchen helped us save a significiant amount on food. We had breakfast in the room before we left each morning, lunch at the parks and dinner back at our room. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend and be booking my next stay in Orlando here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it except for 1 major issue”
Reviews.Author: spooky130
Reviews.Content: LBVRV&S was an awesome place to stay. We definitely will be back and I've even recommended this place to others. I didn't get a single one of those ads shoved under the door like others have said. The restaurant onsite is ok, not great, and was overpriced. I wouldn't eat there again. Staff was professional and friendly at all times. It was very clean. The beds were comfortable. We never heard a single sound from anyone in our building (2). There was not enough parking for our building though and sometimes found ourselves parking on the other side of the building and having to walk a ways. I called a few weeks before arrival and requested a ground floor room being that we have small children and they run around. I didn't want to keep yelling at them to not run(yeah right) LOL so I thought let them do it where there isn't anyone below us! So luckily my request was granted. 1 major problem being on the ground floor in Building 2.......there is a smaller rectangular window right above the regular window. The regular window has blinds. The small window does have a curtain but it does not go all the way to the sill and it has an awning outside but both of these things only partially cover the view. Notice I said partially covers(the site is not accepting my photo, something about it being too big, or I would show you) My husband and I were shocked while undressing the first night and getting into the awesome jetted tub when we realized that we could see a couple of the upper floors of the building across the way and if we could see them they could see into our room!!!!! We took about 20 minutes to strategically place some of our towels up in the window sill filling the extra space and preventing anybody seeing in. I can't believe that no one else has complained about this. We did not bring this up with management because they obviously have to know about it, it's their hotel and design, they should be aware there is this issue, right??? It could simply be fixed with a longer curtain. The ground floor is the only one with this smaller rectangular window so none of the other floors are affected. But with that said, it was just a quirky thing and it didn't ruin my vacation and we will definitely be back to LBVRV&S.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clairecarter75
Reviews.Content: After a lovely 10 days in orlando and then moving down to Daytona for 4 nights where we had a complete nightmare, Virgin quickly moved us out of Daytona and into this hotel. The only downside was it was for only 1 night, we fell in love with it immediately and it finished off what could of been a holiday end from hell to the perfect ending. I am currently looking at the possibility to return, and as a travel agent i shall have no hesitation in telling all my customers about this resort, They were kind and helpful on our arrival, and the suites were just lovely. We were so upset we had to leave and wished we had know about it before our original booking. Thank you So Much LBV For rescuing us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: andrew32939
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is close to everything, Theme parks, and Restaurants. I would recomend this Hotel if you are traveling with the family, the pool is great for kids, the beds are confortable and you can see the cleanliness of the rooms right away.

Reviews.Title: “When can we go back?”
Reviews.Author: Flossieleeder
Reviews.Content: Our party of 6 comprising 2 over 60s, 3 in early 30s and a 2 yr old were all well catered for in this fantastic resort in the best area of Orlando for tourists! This is my 10th trip to Orlando and 4th to this area. For all wanting an easy transition to and from the various parks, look no further than this area. Furthermore, the apartment was like a second home, with 3 large bedrooms, easily accommodating 8 guests. From the pool to the spa, the Irish bar to the nearby shops, this is a fantastic place to stay. My highest commendation? My daughter can't wait to return there (visit planned already for 2012!)

Reviews.Title: “lake buena vista resort”
Reviews.Author: dannyboyHerts
Reviews.Content: hotel and pool area are impecably clean. rooms lovely , reception staff were less than helpfull , try not to get rooms above the offices on the ground floor as the locals book it out for parties and it can get loud. try to avoid the (free transfers) as we found the drivers mentally ill and should have been put on suicide watch for the way they crossed the freeways on route to the parks!) they missed a car by feet when we travelled by them. but on the whole a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “I expected more - but overall not bad”
Reviews.Author: skyhawk352
Reviews.Content: When I saw the current 4 1/2 star rating by guests on trip advisor, I have to say that my expectations of this hotel were raised more than it's actual rating of being a 3ish star resort. Perhaps it's official rating is harsh, but I wouldn't rate it a 4 1/2 star either. There are some pro's and con's with the hotel: Pros Proximity to Disney - short drive to enter Disney grounds. FYI easiest way out of the parks is to follow the Epcot and then route 536 exit. Shopping - Walmart is a few minutes away and literally within walking distance of outlets Room Size - we had a 3br (King/King or Queen/2twin) /2bath. Overall good size although the layout of the 2nd bedroom with the Queen or King was a tad small and awkwardly laid out. Although a corner unit, there is only 1 window in each bedroom so natural light is limited. Room also had a good size balcony with a plastic table and 4 chairs. Pool - Great zero entry pool for kids including a pirate ship with a slide. Cons - Kitchen Size - Great for 1 person cooking. But the galley shape kitchen does not bode well if trying to have more than 1 in that kitchen corridor. Kitchen Inclusions - the Kitchen does come with dishes, utensils, etc. However considering that this was a 3br unit and obviously meant to hold more than 2 people, upon arrival we had only a 5" pot to boil water. Definitely not big enough for a family of 6 to cook pasta. Also they didn't have any spatulas. We called the front desk to advise them of both items and they did bring up a huge pot, but only a spoon style spatula. Luckily I was only making scrambled eggs, but this wouldn't have worked with pancakes. Pool Towels - If you're planning on using the pool or visiting the water parks, you may want to bring along your own towel. The hotel does supply towels, and they are plentiful, but they are only 2' wide x3' long in size. Great for toddlers, but not for adults or older kids. Housekeeping - Part of the lower cost is that you do not get housekeeping included in the basic hotel rate. Althought I can understand not getting the beds made, I would have expected at least to have fresh towels daily as well as my garbage emptied. This is left up to the guests. So we did a load of towels in the laundry almost daily and the kids bring the garbage to the drop location at the end of each hallway. Garbage drops - As mentioned above, they are at the end of the hallways. Well, conveniently enough so are most (if not all) of the 3 br units. So we constantly heard the door opening up and people going in and dropping their garbage down the chute. Solicitations - Although you do need a key to access the buildings, each night we would have 2-3 local businesses push menus thru the door. Spa Hours - My sister in law wanted to get a massage or pedicure, but the spa closed at 6pm each night. Knowing that people are typically out all day long you'd think they'd keep the spa at least open to 8pm. Internet - This hotel didn't offer wifi service. I originally was thinking of giving this hotel a 4-star rating, but being that the cons tended to outweigh the pros, I knocked it down to a 3-star. Some of the items under cons are what you would expect with a 4-star resort. So I feel it's necessary to remember that this is a condo style hotel, not a resort complex. Hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!! VERY CLEAN!!”
Reviews.Author: SYCSU
Reviews.Content: Have been traveling to the Orlando area for 19 years now and this resort was simply great. The accomodations were large, clean and updated. Granite counters with stainless steel appliances and flat screen televisions in each room. I will say, that upon check in we encountered some troubles with what was communicated to us on the telephone prior to arrival and what we were greated with. However after explaining the miscommunication we were quickly compensated very fairly I might add. Pools were wonderful, prices at the pool bar and snack areas were very fair. Cannot wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: flip00186525
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my family for a 10 day fun holiday in Florida, we chose to stay at the LBV Resort and Spa and we were very pleased with our choice, when we checked in staff were more than helpful. The 3 bedroom apt was very spacious, very clean and we were fortunate enough to get a balcony with a view of the Disney fireworks every night. My children had a whale of a time playing at the pirate pool after a long day at the parks and we all made use of the gym also. My only criticism of LBV Resort and Spa is that the convenience store onsite is well overpriced, but having Walmart only 2 mins down the road compensated for this. Excellent value for money, ideally located and we would without a doubt return to this resort. The upkeep of the grounds onsite were impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: bradshawgirl
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with our unit at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. We got a two-bedroom, two-bath condo with a full kitchen, sitting room, and washer/dryer. We found a fabulous deal on it at the Orlando Convention and Visitors' Bureau site. The resort has a spa, a business center, and a gorgeous pool with a huge pirate ship/slide in it. Our 3-year-old LOVED the pool (one side is zero-grade entry, making it perfect for the smaller kids). Our master bath had a roomy jetted soaking tub in it, which was a divine way to unwind at the end of the day. The location, minutes from Sea World, Disney, and the International Drive area, can't be beat. Though we didn't eat on property, the resort has a couple of restaurants, and it's also abutted by a nice, big outlet mall. Couldn't have asked for a better "home away from home" on our trip. Would stay there again in a heartbeat. One note: be sure to ask for a room in one of the three buildings that surround the pool. Your access to the pool will be better, and the view from your balcony will likely be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “We keep going back,Great!”
Reviews.Author: partytimefl
Reviews.Content: We have returned to this hotel four times and everytime we have had a wonderful experience. The staff is great, the place is clean, the overall value is exceptional. I would recommend this to families with small children, adults looking for a getaway or a large group, anyone wanting a wondeful time. We have stayed all over the Orlando area in some of the best hotels and this is the best value for your money and it is close to Disney. We will return soon as we are Florida residents and love the place.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: jso9961
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bldg #2 in a 3 bedroom, 2 bath unit (Barbados suite). The master bedroom was awesome - spacious & bright with a large jacuzzi tub, separate shower, & large closet. The second king bedroom was small (comparatively) with one small window. If you have two adult couples in your party, consider upgrading to the 3/3 with two master bedrooms, so you don't have to fight over the big bedroom! The main TV was old/huge and took forever to change channels. Outside patio was nice and dinning room table big enough for 6. We ordered pizza from the onsite Pizza Hut - you absolutely pay for convenience. We had a minor issue with our safe and it was corrected immediately. We had a sink/plumbing issue and it took two calls to get it resolved. The front desk staff is very nice and efficient. The pirate pool with zero entry was awesome (my 3 year old was allowed to go down the slide with an adult). The pool was not heated when we were there (very refreshing) and is located closest to bldg #5. Outside food/drinks are not allowed, but we smuggled them in and had no issues. Overall, I would recommend the hotel based on price & convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again . . .”
Reviews.Author: joyfulmom
Reviews.Content: We would never stay here again. Pre-paid/arranged two weeks prior to arrival and front desk didn't even have our reservation listed. Others in the lobby were complaining because their rooms which were supposed to be ready at 4:00 weren't ready. We went to the room and found a space that was dark, dingy and actually had a ball of detached carpet coming up in the middle of the floor--amazed this wasn't fixed given what a liability it has to be for them. The tv was old-fashioned, an enormous floor model the size of a chaise sticking about two feet out from the wall. Asked for a room change, and second room wasn't much better--room was not clean--food sticking to the side of the coffee pot, worse stuff with the bathroom . "Managers" here don't seem to be any older than 20. Food at the pool is extremely limited and the pool isn't great for real little ones. Towels are completely worn out. If you have to work at all, be sure to bring your own wifi. Internet here is a 3/4 foot cable that can only be used in one location. This place seems to block VPN and when I called to get help with this, I was told I'd get a call from the "internet guy" maybe in the next 3-4 hours. He never did call. Concierge we spoke with is either too young or just in the wrong job. Area isn't so great. Maybe we've stayed at much nicer places and once you've stayed in really beautiful hotels, this hotel will pale by comparision but we paid about the same to stay at Hilton GV and Marriott Harbor Lakes and these rooms are awful by comparison. Front desk manager, who again seemed like she was probably around 20, tried to make it up to us by providing a basket of some sort for my friends who had just married in Key Largo, but overall, it' a dingy place compared to other properties we've stayed with for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: KatLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: Arrived a little late, and so did a lot of other people. Once it was our turn to check in, it was quick and smooth. We got to our building which faced the pirate ship pool on the 12th floor, and it had a nice view. Everything was very clean. We chose not to have maid service but it had a washer and dryer in the unit and we did our towels with no problem. The mattresses were on the new side, but were just average for comfort. I inspected for bedbugs(several times), and was relieved to find none! Overall, we had a pleasant experience, nice to have a large room safe and fully stocked kitchen. Would I stay here again??? You bet! It was only about 10 minutes from the theme parks and at least double the size of most rooms on the Disney Resort. If you need more space at a great price, here it is!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon to Disney”
Reviews.Author: amjalltheway
Reviews.Content: I am actually in our living room here at the LBV Resort & Spa. I wanted to share my experience before I left so I could remember everything. The issue that I had read that other people reviewing this hotel had was that we couldn't find it from the airport. The address that the hotel has on their website about the GPS location we couldn't find it on our GPS or on google maps so we got a little bit lost. Eventually we did find it. The service at the front desk was very good, I forgot the girl's name that checked us in but she was very kind. She went over the hotel (we stayed on the 7th floor of building 2) layout, gave us a bunch of coupons for the outlet mall, and let us know about the maid service and the shuttle to Disney. I do wish that the hotel had bigger signs for the building numbers because we got here when it was dark and had a hard time finding everything, they signs are pretty low to the ground and kind of blend in with the surroundings. The inside of the hotel is nice and secure (you need your room key to get into each building was a very nice feature). Our room looks exactly the way that it does on the website (we are in the Antigua two bedroom/bath). The suite needs a little bit of updating, the TV is pretty old (but who cares we are in DISNEY), the carpet is a little worn and on our balcony we had a bunch of bees nests. We are facing the outlet mall and not Disney, I was going to ask to be moved so we could see the fireworks but didn't which was good because Disney wasn't open long enough for fireworks and teh one day that they had them we were there. The parking was a little bit hard at night but we always found a spot. We didn't use the shuttle but we always say it running to the park. I also read that you could walk to Wal Mart, it is close but I woudln't walk it is on a really busy street. They gave us everything, pots/pans, dishes, cookware, etc even detergent for the dishes. I read that people got detergent for the washing machine, but we didn't. It wasn't a big deal we went to Wal Mart and got a small bottle for $4. We didn't use the maid service but there are a few packages that you can get, you need to call the front desk and make a reservation the day before. The prices weren't that bad, I think the cheapest was just new towels and it was $5. All in all it was a good stay here at LBV Resort & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: meldw1972
Reviews.Content: great pirate ship pool slide. A lot of space for family with young children. There was mold in grout in showers but I told the front desk so hopefullly it will be taken care of for mold allergy prone guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great deal, condos wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nbh
Reviews.Content: loved staying here. loved the spacious rooms, full kitchen and bargains prices. I'll never stay in orlando anywhere else. the pools and poolside bar were great, and the stores on-site.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY - Would not stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: JustMeFawn
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on this hotel and most were positive. It was secure, and the apartment style room was fantastic. They not on furnished everything for the kitchen, what they furnished was not cheap, it was nice things. They think of everything. Full kitchen, two full baths, 3 TV's and a balcony with view of the fireworks. EXCELLENT stay. My stepdaughter lost her wallet at the pool with her ID and debit card. It was found and returned to the front desk. That could have ruined our vacation, because without an ID she could not have gotten back on the plane. Good people stay here. Pools were really nice and bar next to the pool with restrooms was a plus. the mini mart on the property had EVERYTHING! Pizza hut was great, and the pub had good food too. Walmart 1/4 mile away Disney right around the corner. There is nothing to complain about this hotel. I did not opt for maid service, but liked that no one was coming into my room. Large closets and we had a safe in our room. Never read that on any review. Just a wonderful, wonderful stay. Would recommend this to anyone. so much better than a regular hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: scoobydooWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: What an awesome surprise this resort turned out to be. We were located across from the factory outlet mall-super deals! Our 2 bedroom condo was almost 1000 sq.ft. Super clean, very modern, had more than everything we needed. Wal-Mart was a 15 minute walk away or a $6 taxi ride each way. The security at the resort is immaculate. You could not access any door nor any floor unless you had your room key. The free shuttle service was better than what the Disney resorts offer as it took us not only to Epcot but to Universal Studios as well. Once at Epcot we rode the Disney bus to other Disney theme parks free of charge. My 2 teenage boys (16 &17) loved the pool and numerous hot tubs and the fact they had their own bedroom with 2 oversized double beds with a flat screen tv and separate bathroom. The insuite washer/dryer was a blessing. Just make sure you buy laundry detergent. The mini grocery store/Pizza Hut located in the adjacent building has almost everything you need but very very expensive. After we spent one week here, the husband and boys went home while I spent a second week at a conference located at a famous Disney Resort which was outdated, unsafe, small and not very clean. We definitely tell everyone to stay at Lake Beuna Vista Resort and Spa instead of a Disney resort/hotel. You'll be glad you did! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all Expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: kls4
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed for 8 nights from Sept. 17-25th, and I have to say that we were very pleased from the moment we arrived until the day of departure. We stayed in a two bedroom suite in building 3(overlooking the awesome pirate pool). Our suite was spotless and spacious enough for 2 adults and 4 children. The master bedroom is large and the jacuzzi tub was a hit with everyone! There are televisions in each bedroom and a large flat screen t.v. in the living room. The queen-sized pull out sofa was big enough for our 15 and 10 year old daughters and they gave it two thumbs up for comfort. The fully stocked kitchen was the best part for me. Utensils, glassware, dishes as well as every appliance you would need . The only thing that isn't provided is laundry detergent . There is a Walmart a mile away which helped us save big$$$ . There is an Irish pub on site and a Pizza Hut, both of which we visited. We had room service from the pub, and both the food and quick service were great. There is also a convenience store which came in handy, but was a little pricey. There is an outlet mall adjacent to the resort and includes two Disney outlets. There is a huge Disney section at Walmart as well. The pirate pool and slide was a hit with all of us. The height requirement for the slide is 48 inches, but a younger child can go with an adult. A great place to relax after the parks. There is a poolside bar that is expensive, but gave friendly service. Extremely easy to get to Disney and took us no longer than 10 minutes. We also visited Universal and that was a 20 minute drive. Overall, we were extremely pleased with the affordability, service, and location. We will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for better! So roomy, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: mylilnush
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July, large extended family of 9 comprising 3 kids under 6. Great experience, we couldnt ask for better, there was a balcony to kick back and relax, as well as a whirlpool tub in the master room. The kitchen was well stocked and this was a perfect place to stay; 3 grocery stores and several fast food options within a miles radius, Disney was close by, outlet mall was a 2 minute walk downstairs, and a really fun pirate pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Except”
Reviews.Author: bunzing
Reviews.Content: Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Hotel is in a great location in Orlando Florida right off of I-4. Room was great: two bedrooms, two baths, full kitchen, washer and dryer. My only complaint was "free internet access in every room". The internet access was via ethernet connection which did not work on my laptop. However, the lobby is wifi so I was able to access internet.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and still as good!”
Reviews.Author: Norfolktravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in 2007 while it was still being built, and really enjoyed our stay. This time it was just as good as we remembered! All the building work is now finished and there is a large swimming pool with pirate ship, and spa. There is a shop open from 7:00am until midnight, a Pizza Hut that delivers straight to the rooms, and Frankie Farrell's Irish bar and grill. We stayed in a two bedroom suite, with it's own living room and kitchen. There was a large balcony with a great view. The hotel is in a good location near Disney World, but it would probably be best to have a car although they do run a shuttle service to the Disney parks. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: poppy187065
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay at this resort, everything was perfect, even to the evacuation of our block due to golf buggy catching fire ! would def stay there again, it was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando makes me smile”
Reviews.Author: traveller915
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Orlando on 29th Sept 2010 and had the shuttle take me to the hotel. The staff was just go about your business attitude when checking in, no smile, no welcome to the hotel, was not told my room number, had to look at the key card to see what floor I was on and what room I was in. Upon entering the door was pleasantly surprised to see my two bedroom suite. It had full kitchen, two bathrooms, washer/dryer, the master bedroom had had its own private jacuzzi, living room, with a balcony. Great for families that want to stay near Disney and all the attractions but dont want to pay Disney hotel prices. Definately need a car to get yourself around, hotel provides a shuttle to the parks but the times are VERY limited.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place ,can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: caldrich64
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband, son of 18 and daughter of 7 and stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment in January 2010. I had seen the revues on here about the place and was'nt disappointed. Like someone else had said ,what you see in the pictures is what you get which was a great relief to me and the family. The space was amazing we had an apartment in building 5 which over looked the pool with the pirate ship in it. It is just over the road from Walmart but i wouldn't advice walking as there isn't a crossing so we used to just get a cab. The cost is only 7 dollars which isn't a great amount to pay. The rooms were all very clean and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: r3gr8kidz
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a weeklong stay at Lake Buena Vista Resort. We had a wonderful time at this hotel. Our room was clean, spacious and met our high expectations. It was perfect for recharging our batteries after long days at the parks. Our kids (age 8, 10, 13) loved the pool. The staff with the hotel and at Lani's were friendly and responsive to our needs. We had pre-paid for our room to get the best rate but had to change our plans. The hotel could've had us eat the two days rate we missed, but was agreeable to giving us one of the days as a credit to be used at Lani's, etc. The location is fabulous - very close to WDW, restaurants and shopping. We appreciated having a full kitchen as we ate breakfast in our room after having shopped at the Walmart which is less than a mile away. Walmart is also a great place to buy WDW souvenirs at a reasonable price. If you stay here, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal accomodation and location !!!”
Reviews.Author: RickandMaddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in September with husband and mum, so 2 bed apartment was perfect, enough space so not to feel overcrowded !!! Location and amenties were ideal and definately close enough to all the local attractions, i.e. Disneyworld, Seaworld etc. We also done the Busch Gardens and Kennedy Space Centre excusion. Oh yeah, I forgot to mention that we did not drive and either went on arranged excursions or taxis. I will be honest and say that the taxi fares can be quite expensive so be aware, in addition, the drivers may pretend that they do not know where the hotel is and consequently will drive around unneccesarily whilst ensuring that the fare increase to their delight. I, after a couple of times of this happening took the business card with the hotel details on so they got the correct address straight away and we asked them to assure us they knew where the hotel was before they set off. We did let the hotel know, with which they appeared surprised, however, one taxi driver knew that it was a sham and was fully aware of others doing it, so I thought I would just warn you guys. Regardless, don't let this really little issue put you off, I would go back to the same location, hotel etc at the drop of a hat and will definately be looking at returning in the not so far distant future.

Reviews.Title: “this place was fab, so spacious, i was impressed”
Reviews.Author: floridafun49
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 weeks through thomas cook ,staff were a bit confused about our booking on arrival but bent over backwards to sort it all out, we were in block 5 floor 9 with a fire work view which was the best view ever, 3 bed 2 bath condo with so much space quiet air con !! we have stayed at port orleans disney twice before but this place has changed things i would go back without a doubt, also there is a ramp up to the second floor for us to park car so its not in the sun/ rain which is a good idea, i give this a 5 star rating my only concern was the doors into the hotel at lift entrance you can open them with a sharp pull!!! you dont need your key card , my son found this out after forgetting card to come up from pool he just pulled the door and got in, i would recommend this place to everyone and i would consider a timeshare here too, luv it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: PamelaJacksonville
Reviews.Content: Four friends spent the weekend at the resort and had a wonderful time. We hated to leave and am now planning our next visit. We had breakfast around the pool and just enjoyed staying there. The accomodations were just what we hoped for. We had the best time ever. I would recommend this resort to everyone. Close to the parks and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Best Orlando Hotel I Have Stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrytravelagent
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay in this resort when i visited Orlando with Work in dec 09. I was really pleased when i found out we would be staying there and even more pleased when we arrived and i saw how awesome it was. Easy to find, close to a great selection of shops, cvs and an Irish Pub! The rooms were amazing, like your own villa, we had a two bedroom apartment, which consisted of one en suite bedroom with huge tub, another large bedroom with two double beds, a huge lounge aread with sofa, chairs and large screen tv, a full kitchen with large fridge, kettle, basically everything you need in a kitchen, another large bathroom with toilet, sink, bath and shower and a balcony. The apartment was very clean and came with cleaning equiptment. there was even your own washing machine and spin dryer! Perfect for us. We visited the Irish bar the first night and were warmly welcomed by the staff who did everything they could to keep us happy. Food was great and really reasonable. The resort was close to all the parks and i drive, just short drives away. If any one wants any infor on any of the parks in orlando please just contact me as i have been to all of them in full but cant start to write about them all now as this review would goon for ever! If you want a luxury base which a home from home feel then this is the place for you. Perfect for group of friends, families or anyone who has good taste! I cant wait to go back and stay there and will hopefully be doing so soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Federico33
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 12 nights, it is really good. I traveled in a party of 8 adults, we got two suites each one with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, kitchen, dinner and living room and washer and drying machines. The location is perfect, disney is only a 10 to 15 minute drive, universal and sea world about 25 minute drive, also there are a lot of outlets and malls near by, it is perfect to go with family or couples. I highly recommend staying here, pool is awesome it has a pirate ship to ride on, a huge pool and three jacuzzis. Overall we had a great time. :)

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: wheninrome61
Reviews.Content: we have traveled to many countries and found this resort to be the best......just avoid using the house phone! Everything you need from Towels, dish soap, laundry detergent, iron, Hoover and paper towels all supplied!! (and extra) We had a great time and if you choose to stay here i am sure you will love it!!

Reviews.Title: “a real great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gail12316
Reviews.Content: stayed here in aug to sept 5th such a great place to stay so clean and the appartment so big a great lot of space pool was very nice and there is a wallmart just around the cornerwe will be coming back we stayed on the 9th floor and could see the fireworks every night

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - this is it!”
Reviews.Author: JocP
Reviews.Content: This condo resort was perfect for us - Mom, Dad, three daughters and Grandma - on our trip to Orlando. It is a great balance between the privacy of one's own home and the luxuries of a hotel. We did not hire the daily cleaning service, so were left undisturbed while "at home", but appreciated having a front desk and concierge who were professional and sincerely friendly. We rented our 3-bedroom condo through its owner - see: www.vrbo.com listing number 224137 or the owner's website: www.krbdisneycondo.com It is clean, and very spacious. There was plenty of space in the master suite for a pack 'n' play. (The hotel had the pack 'n' play and a highchair ready for us in the condo upon request.) Suitcases disappeared into the large walk in closet. The beds were comfortable. The upright chairs in the living room, which look a little stiff in the photos, are padded and cozy. The kitchen is well-equipped, and the laundry was a great benefit. Tip: The hotel provided starter samples of dish and laundry detergent, soap, shampoo and hand cream. If you want to avoid buying large containers from a grocery store, and you have room in your luggage, bring your own detergent for sink, dishwasher and laundry; bring coffee filters, salt and pepper, sugar, etc. This condo, in particular, has a view of a lush Florida forest which displays enchanting layers of mist in the early morning as the sun rises over it. We didn't hear any of our neighbours through the walls, nor were we disturbed by any sounds from outside. The pool is perfect for all ages. The little ones who can't swim benefitted from the shallow entry, and the oldest one couldn't keep off the waterslide. The location is perfect for tourists of Disney, Universal and Sea World which are minutes away. There is a fantastic Marian shrine with a phenomenal choir just up the road next to the Prime Outlet Mall which has a greater variety of stores than the mall by the hotel. In addition to Walmart, there is a Publix close by for groceries. We had done a lot of browsing for accomodations in the area, and it was interesting to see many of the properties we had become familiar with on-line as we drove around the area. But nothing appealed to us more than this resort. Usually, despite the fact that I am pleased with an hotel, I prefer to try something else when next time in the area just to have a new experience. However, I would stick with this resort. Going back here would be like coming home. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for families with Young Children & Teenagers”
Reviews.Author: marshallrambo
Reviews.Content: The Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa Hotel on first inspection is a fantastic hotel. The rooms were of unexpected size with Ensuite to the master bedroom and TV, 2 queen size beds to the second bedroom with TV and seperate bathroom, comprising of Shower, Handbasin and W/C. The cooking area had a decent size oven/hob, microwave with built in controls for the oven light, fan and microwave, a typical large fridge freezer with dish washer and a built in washer/tumble drier.The main family room had a dining table for up to 6 people the family relaxing area had a plasma TV with the sofa unfolding to another double bed. This room had a balcony overlooking the pool and bathing area, this is to the rear of the Hotel which had a Galleon style ship built into the pool with built in slide. The pool was of ample size well maintained with life guard assist there was a pool bar which had a decent food menu, this catered mainly for the fast food junkies!. The downside of this hotel was you didn't get any maid service changing your bedding, towelling or room cleaned, this was an optional extra which you had to pay for however, their was a hoover to clean the carpets along with an ironing board and iron. On the whole I would reccommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Florida. This hotel was situated only 10 minutes from the main Disney Theme Parks with a Walmart only 3 minutes drive away and a little over 5 mins drive to Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dps19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between 6th and 20th August with our 22 year old son and his friend of the same age. As we were 4 adults we felt it was important to have plenty of space to chill and relax at the end of the day and we were not dissapointed. We had a 3 bedroom appartment and were extremely happy with the size and cleanliness of it .We were in block 5 on the 10th floor and had a great view of the fireworks on the odd occasion when we were in around 9.30 - 10pm. We used Frankie Farrells Bar on several occasions,it was handy to call in after a hectic day for a cold beer or a bite to eat (huge portions so starters were often enough!) As you would expect it was a bit pricey being the only bar/restaurant within the complex but it was convienient.The on site store was also expensive but again convienient to get a few essentials when we first arrived or ran short of something.Wallmart is just 5 minutes drive for everything else you could need.The'Pirate' pool was mainly used by familys with younger children as would be expected, we found the smaller pool between blocks 1 & 2 better for us (quieter) but did try the main pool a couple of times early in the day and was able to have a swim & read the paper before it got busy. If anything could be improved I would say a larger freeform swimming pool would be a great additon to the complex.We did have a car for our stay and really don't hink we could have done without it, we visited all the Disney Parks, Universal Studios, I.O.A, Seaworld , Busch Gardens and did an Airboat tour,plus went out most evenings either to Downtown Disney or City Walk, none of these were too far with a car,I doubt we could have done so much using the transportion system. However one night we got a taxi to Downtown Disney costing around 15 dollars,and had no problem getting one back later. The staff in the reception were always pleasant and helpful, but if you take travellers cheques they only have limited cash to exchange them, you can just use the cheques as cash in the shops but need to have ID with you. (By the way there was safe in the master bedroom free of charge & great for keeping all your vauables safe) The outlet shops right next door were handy to do some shopping, and there was a nice coffee and cake shop, but our son & his friend preferred the main outlet stores on International drive.Like most other reviewers I really can't fault this place for it's location and for the size and comfort of the appartment inparticular.We booked through Virgin Holidays and got a few extras like a daily paper,some discount vouchers and a free takeaway Pizza, which was fine, but we do have a major gripe with Virgin Holidays who changed our return flight home to an earlier one without informing us at all, it was only when checking in at Downtown Disney that we found out we were on the earlier flight and although luckily we were still in time for that flight, this ruined our plans for our last day. Apparently it had happened to a family the day before,so be wary if you have booked through Virgin Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place To Stay - A+++!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaAZN
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely brilliant. The location is perfect - close enough to Disney to enjoy the magic, far enough away to escape when necessary. It's a 5min drive to the gate of WDW. You DO need a car; the free shuttle is extremely limited and only drops off/picks up in Epcot. But on the the SR536 (the road the hotel sits on), there are shops galore, a fab dining/shopping area called Crossroads with a dozen restaurants (our family fave was Sweet Tomatoes). And with a hop onto the I4, you can be at at the prestige Outlet Mall or the Mall At Millenia in under 30mins. Plus The outlet mall attached to the hotel is very good - we had a field day in Old Navy! The suite is huge - we are a family of five and we had more than enough space for two weeks in a two-bed suite. The place was immaculately clean, the staff were helpful, the pools were delightful. The loaction was sublime. The small shop on-site was pricey, but with a nearby Walmart and a supermarket in the Crossroads area, we stocked up on all we needed. A tip - try and book via Owners Direct, and save a few £££'s!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: caguas4447
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in this apartment rooms when visiting Orlando. It has excellent location and the rooms are well equipped with everything you may need. And is next to the Outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Space, Luxury and Location.”
Reviews.Author: Englishmon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between 6th and 20th August 2010 in 2x two bedroomed apartments (my family with teenaged daughters and brother's family with young children). Found it easily (on the SR535 right off the I4) and after checking in to apartment 5909 and 5910 (Building 5, ninth floor) found them to be REALLY spacious, clean and well equipped. All the Disney Parks are within a 10 minute drive, and the on-site Frankie Farrells pub is handy - ate there 3 times during our stay. The on-site shop is VERY expensive, though Walmart only 5 minute drive away. Only (small) criticisms are - small (Pirate) pool is always busy, and whilst OK for kids is not big or deep enough to actually swim in; the room phone cost us $43 for a short call to the UK, and most annoyingly - no non-stick frying pan in the kitchen, also no real bargains to be had from the on-site Shopping Mall...............Other that that - SPOT ON!

Reviews.Title: “Better than home”
Reviews.Author: lollypopbbc
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? My husband and I wanted to go to Disney and opted for this hotel over the Disney resort. I must say we got the better end of the deal. First, the location of the hotel was WONDERFUL FOR DISNEY! We were in the park and out within 10 minutes, never caught in traffic, and only one turn away from the main entrance. Our room was amazing, clean and had more room than we knew what to do with. Since these were set up like condos they were very private, this also meant no maid service, coffee, etc. but well worth the price. We loved the fact that we were able to do laundry, cook, and relax in our room. Only downside was the internet was spotty so we had to use wired. WE WILL BE BACK AND HAVE ALREADY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO FAMILY!

Reviews.Title: “Superb - would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: T0ddy
Reviews.Content: We booked this condo hotel because we wanted to be near International Drive. We have previously stayed in a hotel on I Drive, and also in a townhouse in Kissimmee. We found Kissimmee too far out, too much time travelling to and from Orlando, but we wanted our own space and not just a hotel room. LBV Resort & Spa was the perfect location. It was 5 mins from Disney, and about 15 from Universal. The rooms are very spacious, myself and my husband had a huge room, with jacuzzi bath (which we all loved!), double sink, walk in closet and a huge walk in shower. The girls (aged 13 and 16) had their own room with twin beds with their own TV, plus they had their own bathroom (thank goodness!) The kitchen and lounge area were also spacious, with comfy sofa and chairs and a huge TV with plenty of channels. There was internet access but via a cable which you can get from the front desk at no charge. We used the laptop every day and although the connection was slow at times, we were really pleased we had that facilty. The kitchen was okay - all mod cons including dishwasher/microwave, and also a washing machine and dryer, but what let it down was the lack of cooking utensils. There was only one saucepan and one frying pan, and no wine glasses. When we stayed at the condo in Kissimmee (also 4 star) it was much better equipped. We stayed in Building 3, on the 13th floor. We did not have a view of the pool. We did ask for one at check in but they were fully booked. However, our view was fantastic. We were looking out over the LBV outlet mall, over towards Walmart. We watched a massive thunderstorm develop one evening from our balcony. Our room was clean - I was really nervous before we checked in as I had read some reports on here saying that the condos were dirty. I have to say ours was very clean, the sheets and bedding were spotless and smelled lovely. Some people have commented that there was no maid service. I would not expect maid service in a condo hotel, and was quite happy to wash/dry towels as necessary. You can opt to pay for this service but we couldn't see the point. The kids loved emptying the trash down the shute at the end of the hallway! We did our shopping at Walmart (check out the rotisserie chickens and the carribean boneless chicken wings - they are amazing!) but the girls did use the onsite convenience store for crisps and chocolate. Whilst you wouldn't do all your shopping there, it wasn't too badly priced. We didn't use the Pizza Hut - both our girls are coeliac and cannot eat gluten so pizza was off the menu for us. We did try out Frankie Farrells Irish Bar on two occasions. The first was the night we arrived. We were jetlagged and it was 10pm so we wanted somewhere close. We had a round of starters and it was really good. We went for a second time as our main evening meal and the service was terrible. The waitress was unhelpful when we told them about our daughters food allergies and when I asked for a wine list the waitress said they didn't have one. I ended up ordering a glass of wine but had no idea what I was drinking. She was just quite rude with us. The food was only adequate and the cost was high. We wouldn't go there again when there are so many other good places to eat nearby. One place we would highly recommend was Longhorns Steak House. Great atmosphere, very helpful waitresses (especially with the food allergies, they had a seperate gluten free menu) and they could not do enough for us. The food was superb (my husband had steak and I had shrimp). The cost was also reasonable. We were sad we found this place at the end of our holiday as we would definitely have gone there a few more times. We hired a car and would highly recommend doing this. Driving here is no problem - much slower than in England! We would hate to have to rely on public transport or shuttle buses. A car is just so convenient. We always found a parking space outside of our Building, bar one night when we didn't get home until very late and we had to park outside the adjacent Building, but it wasn't really a problem. Finally, the pool was great. The pirate ship is a great feature and our youngest daughter loved the slide. It was always busy but not to the point that we couldn't get sunbeds. We didn't use the spa - we were too busy! All in all, we loved LBV Resort and Spa. Location was perfect and accommodation excellent. The only thing that we would have loved to have seen onsite was a coffee shop. It would have been lovely to have been able to grab a latte in the morning or on the way home.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: motown1868
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort from August 1 to August 8. It is an excellent location, if you do not want to stay at the Disney properties. The room was very nice and there was plenty of space in the unit. And it was nice to have a full kitchen. My daughter absolutely loved the swimming pool. I had read about the exspensive prices at the pool bar. The reason that drinks seem exspensive is because they automatically charge you the gratuity (tip). It is 15%. So if you are not careful, you will actuall tip the bartender twice. I do not have a problem with the included gratuity, but they could at least let you know about it up front. If you stay at this resort, it would be wise to have a rental car. The resort does have a shuttle to the parks, but it restricts you as far as coming and going from the parks on your own timetable. Plus, you will need to drive to Walmart right down the street where you can stock up the kitchen, instead of buying from the store on the resort property. By the way, you must realize that this is a timeshare resort, not a hotel. So some things are not automatically included. I would definetly reccomend this resort to anyone who is planning on visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great all-rounder!”
Reviews.Author: Nickybum
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a two week stay at the LBV Resort and have to say that I am pleasantly surprised that it really was as good as many of the reports state. There are many reports on here that give great detail of the LBV Resort, but I'll just state the main points that we liked: 1. The apartments are huge, we were a family of 5 in a 2 bedroomed apartment and there was more than enough room. I use the word 'apartment' because the size of the pad feels very much like they are apartments. 2. When we read about the washing machine & tumble drier we thought "nice idea, but we wont use them", we're on holiday after all. However, because of the heat, we used them every day - a very useful addition! 2. It has a fantastic pool that the kids loved - right down to our 18 month old. Admittedly the much lauded Pirate ship is more show than actual entertainment vessel. There is one slide in the whole boat! However id did provide welcome shade from the searing sun. 3. Its in a great location for many reasons - if you intend doing most of the theme parks, your right on the doorstep, there's a huge Wallmart virtually round the corner and there's a shopping outlet on site if you like your shopping. 4. There's an Irish bar called Frankie Farrell's on site that is far better than you'd give it credit. We had many of our best meals in here, wonderful Irish Stews, Shepherds Pies, Bangers and Mash, etc. Don't get me wrong, I'm all for eating local cuisine, but lets be honest, the Americans aren't renowned for their 'haute cuisine' - you very quickly tire of eating fried foods, burgers, chicken, ribs, etc... They also do a reasonable pint of Boddingtons (at $6.50 a pint - ouch), however if you fancy a local beer try the Blue Moon, its rather good (and cheaper). 5. They don't advertise the fact that they have free WIFI in the reception lobby, that reached right down to the pool side. Useful for checking email, Facebook, the web, etc... There's very little to criticise about the LBV Resort, however our only gripe was regarding a cot/crib that we booked and paid for with Thomas Cook - when we arrived at LBV Resort they stated that they knew nothing about the cot as they had never had any on site, so we quickly had to drive to the afore mentioned Wallmart and buy one. We later noticed in the 'Welcome Folder' that it stated that they provided cribs for free use on request. We didn't bother complaining because what was done was done, and being typical Brits we don't like complaining. Overall our experience with the LBV Resort was a very positive one and we definitely would stay here again. However one thing I would not do again is go to Florida in July/August - the heat was so overpowering (averaged 105 degrees most days! topping out at 115 degrees on several days). You could live with this if you were just lounging round the pool, but not when your walking for many hours round theme parks - it knocks you out.

Reviews.Title: “We couldnt have asked for any more”
Reviews.Author: DorisDayGrimsby
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel this was. Staff were very helpful, nothing too much trouble. Accommodation was excellent. Master bedroom with jacuzzi, very large walk in shower, double washbasin, extremely large bed, flat screen t.v. walk in wardrobes. Lounge with flat screen t.v. leading to very large balcony. Fully fitted kitchen with american fridge, dishwasher, double oven, washing machine and dryer. Second bedroom with two very large single beds, wardrobes & T.V. Family bathroom with bath, shower and double washbasin. We were in block 5 and overlooked the swimming pool. Ate at Frankie Farrells and enjoyed all meals. Small supermarket with take away Pizza Hut. Courtsey coach service which takes you to Epcot and Universal (book the day before you go). Lake Buena Vista shopping outlet is on the complex, therefore you can walk there without any problems. Great place to go back to at the end of a tiring day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Selection”
Reviews.Author: Warsteiner13
Reviews.Content: Went with wife and 8yr old daughter, place was great. Location perfect for every park. Daughter loved the pool, every day at the parks she was asking could we go to the pool now. On site Irish Pub was nice to go to after wife and daughter went to bed. Food very good, beer selection better. On site store prices insane, pool bar beer prices hostage like for cheap beers. If you have a car a Walmart and Target are within a couple miles south miles of the place. Washer and dryer were nice to have. Wife's complaint, beds are hard. You can solve that with a couple of pints at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good size condo-style rooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: TIGGER023
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the this hotel for two weeks in August and found it really comfortable The hotel has five blocks which can be up to 15 floors high. We stayed in the third floor of block 3. The room was immaculate, it looked like it had never been used before it was that clean. One downside however was that you had to pay extra for room service. This did not really affect us as the room also had a large washer/dryer. We washed our bedding in the machine a couple of times. The hotel has 2 pools the main one having a large pirate ship as a main feature, this pool also had a bar selling drinks and snacks. For the size of the hotel the pool could have been bigger. Returning from the parks in late evening it was sometimes difficult to find a car park space, I ended up parking on the road on a number of occasion. The hotel has a Pizza Hut on site an Irish Pub and a supermarket. One word of advise is that the supermarket is really expensive the cheapest bottle of wine was $20 the same bottle could be bought at Walmart (1 mile up the road) for $5. Also this hotel is not for people who do not have a hire car it is about 3 miles from the gates of the Disney parks and it is right next door to the Lake Bunea Vista outlet mall. Overall an excellent hotel with superb rooms and a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Third Times The Charm”
Reviews.Author: dfw81
Reviews.Content: Once again our stay was GREAT! We are now referring to this as our Orlando home. The rates are great, the staff is helpful and the location is ideal! I can't say enough good things about it! One thing I really liked is that there are NO cartoon characters anywhere on the property! After a day at the Disney and/or Universal parks, it is really nice to go back to a quiet and a bit more sedate setting. When you go make sure you pack two things in particular: laundry detergent and basket coffee filters, so you won't have to buy a big package of each. They have a little store, but rightfully so, the prices are high. We drove to the nearby Wal-Mart and bought what few provisions we needed (milk, coffee, sweet n low, and some snacks.) I really love this place, and we will DEFINITELY be going back.

Reviews.Title: “OMG - Totally Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Kin1633
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks, end July beginning August 2010. Whatever bad things you read about this site - ignore them. I've been to Florida 9 times, stayed at Disney and International Drive, but I have to say this hotel is the best by far. We had a three bedroom apratment in Building 3 (I would recommend asking for Building 3 or Building 5 - but only because these have better views). The apartment was everything we could have hoped for and more - fully equipped, loads of space even for seven of us! Beds were really comfortable - even the sofa bed. Lifts in the hotels are really quick, and even though we stayed at what is probably one of the busiest times there was always carparking space available by our building entrance. Hotel Staff were really friendly and helpful. Pool was great - stayed open until 11pm on an evening which was great cus we could come back after the parks and still get an hour of fun. The Slide on the Pirate ship in the pool was a firm favourite with the kids, and the Jacuzzi was really nice. Location is great too - although you DO need a car - hotel courtessy bus is very limited, but with a car Disney, Sea-World and Downtown Disney are 10 minutes away and Universal 25 minutes. We didn't eat at the Hotel or at the nearby Irish Pub, but we had plenty of choice of Restaurants for all budgets within 5-10 minutes of every direction. We can't say enough good things about this hotel except we had a fantastic time, and would stay here every visit from now on. Oh - and make sure you look out for the Armadillos on the lawns of an evening - sooooo cute!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE - DONT - GO”
Reviews.Author: HarleyNorfolk
Reviews.Content: I have returned from my holiday today and one of the first things I needed to do was to write this review which I hope will be of use. Firstly I do not like complaining I am a fair person with good values, so please read this carefully. Before I went on my holiday with my wife and three children together with my daughter and her two children,I read the reviews and although there was a couple of bad ones I thought you will always get a few, so I continued anyway. TWO MONTHS BEFORE MY ARRIVAL I EMAILED AND CALLED THE HOTEL TO REQUEST A FIREWORK VIEW AS I WAS RE-NEWING MY WEDDING VOWELS AND I FELT THIS WOULD BE A GOOD IDEA. DAY 1- Arrived and was greeted in a very friendly manner, I asked if I had the firework view and was told No, even though I was told before hand it would be ok. The friendly lady did not like being questioned. I was then advised in a robotic like manner what the rules of the hotel were and what was available to us as guests, I was given two sets of rooms One for my wife and children and the other for my daughter and her family. We went to our rooms which were in the same block, our room was very nice apart from the worn and dirty looking carpet, anyway I decided to have a bath only to be hit in the face by the bath tap and covered in HOT water. The tap was held on by one small screw and was worn. I reported this and was told I would be contacted by a Manager,this never happened so I chased it up, only to be told that I would be contacted the next day. I met up with mu daughter who informed me that in her room one of the electric rings for the cooker was just laying on the top and the bath towel holder was on the floor. Not a good start so I went to the front desk to report this as I felt that if the ring for the cooker was not connected surely that meant that the live connection below would be uncovered, and a towel holder on the floor is not its normal place. I went to the front desk and was advised again that the Manager would contact us the next day, and that maintenance would attend to all the problems. The next day we went out and came back in the evening to find none of the faults had been repaired, so I went and spoke to the Manager who said he would look into it and call us back he never did. To cap it of I returned to my room to find the toilet flooding and marched back to speak with the Manager. I was moved to another room and compensated by my travel company for one nights stay, which I felt was a very poor offering after being covered in Hot water and being hit in the face with force by the tap, thankfully it was not my young son. By the way I had to jump through hoops to get this refund. I was advised that this was sufficient and compensated me fairly. I am now making calls to deal with this. My daughters room remained in the same state of disrepair for FOUR days, until after constant calls and reports to the travel company rep, was it eventually sorted and I was told the cooker was perfectly safe ? Not sure so I won't comment In short the pool is over crowded and shaded from all surrounding buildings, So if you fancy sunbathing by the main pool, which is the one shown in the pictures of the Hotel you wont get much of a tan. The other hotel blocks all have there own pools but they probably wouldn't hold more than twenty people each. I would summarise as, Management a joke no one comes back to you, carpets dirty. But to cap it off no one was bothered about my initial requests for a firework view I suppose it sums up the, I DONT REALLY CARE ATTITUDE. Sorry, but save your money this accommodation is awful, and although my review is rather long winded I hope it shows that this is how you can be treated at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong Location”
Reviews.Author: sueleb18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic with very large rooms and brilliant facilities but limited eating facilities with just a poolside bar serving limited food and an 'Irish Pub' selling quiet expensive food. We didn't have a car so found getting around anywhere very difficault and expensive. We had to get a taxi anywhere we wanted to go and whilst the hotel was happy to arrange a taxi for us we realised after leaving this hotel and going to another one with easier access to places, that we had been paying more than we should for taxi's as they had arranged a private hire company rather than the cheaper Yellow Cabs, We found staff on reception a bit off and the lady taking bookings for the free shuttle service was very off hand almost to the point of being rude. The hotel advertised free shuttle services to all the major parks but in fact only went to Epcot and none of the other Disney parks and the departure time from the Hotel was at 9:40am making it quite late to arrive at any of the parks. The two pool areas were also quite small taking into account the number of rooms there were in the hotel, and the larger of the two pools was always very crowded and you could never get anywhere to sit or lie as either there were not enough sunbeds or chairs or all of the bed and chairs were bagged by people early in the morning and who weren't actually at the pool. As I said at the start of this comment the hotel rooms were exceptional and the kitchen area was better than my kitchen at home but only consider this hotel if you have your own car or are hiring one, because without one, it could be a very!!! expensive holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, pity about the ticket agent desk”
Reviews.Author: Janem2584
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 3 bedroom appartment in building one, which was lovely, clean, and no complaints about dirty carpets or hard bed sheets. Having a washing machine and dryer was very helpful and it had quick wash cycles. we enjoyed having a kitcen (walmart is 15min walk down from hotel, beside official ticket center) and balcony and space to relax in the evenings after the parks. Whirlpool bath in master bedroom was excellent, especially the lights changing in it! definitely a must after walking around all day. For the park tickets I had preordered online with official ticket center which is a 15min walk from the hotel, whereas my friends and boyfriend decided to wait until we got to orlando to buy them, fair enough. My boyfriend and I decided to check out the ticket desk at the hotel, where we found unfriendliness and scare mongering about other ticket agencies, even when i had said the OTC was member of the BBB - i.e legitmate outlet. They also work on commission and sell tickets at rip off prices! We are advising everyone going to that hotel, to take just 15min to walk down the road, perfectly safe, although no zebra crossing, just wait til the lights turn red at either end and run. and you will find lovely friendly ticket agents that will help you out, and meet any ticket prices you have looked at (as i had preordered, my friends came with me to collec the tickets and also to see if they could get their tickets at same price - which the agents kindly did). Also they offer discount for those paying by cash or travellers checks and do most dinner shows except polynesian resort at disney world one. Only downside was lack of restaurants and shops within walking distance, and taxis are expensive to use all the time. next time we will most likely stay on i-drive! but if you are renting a car, lbv is the perfect place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Stay”
Reviews.Author: watsons74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 8 days in an Antigua 2 BR 2 Bath Condo. The location is great! In walking distance to the Lake Buena Vista Outlet Mall and 5 minutes away from the super Walmart. The pools are great and actually stay open later than the printed 10 pm time. Disney is a short distance and you can take I-4 or SR 535 to get there since there are two entrances. This area is loaded with restaurants for all budgets. Universal is right off of International Drive. We had a great time and you will to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and apartment”
Reviews.Author: bobbygHove
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Orlando having stayed LBV resort. This is our second time at this location. The reason why we went back is because of it close location to all parks, DT Disney and US192 where there a loads of restaurants. It also sits a stone throw from the LBV shopping mall that has one of the Nike Outlet stores!. We noticed this year there was no room cleaning service (unless you paid for it) so we had to tidy the room ourselves, which was not an issue as there was a vacuum cleaner at hand. The gym was right next door and had a good range of machines to use. If I had one tiny fault it was that the room fixtures and fittings etc were a little dated and carpets a little worn. We stayed in building one which is the older part of the complex but the newer buildings (3/4) may have been more fresher. There was Wi-Fi in the reception area that was free but you could not use laptops/itouch in the room. If you ever get to Frankies (Iris pub next door) try the French onion soup...best I have ever tried! Also took a gamble and use Sandford international airport which is a bit further to travel(about one hour) than Orlando International but longer travel time is balanced out by the quickness through check-in and immigration control.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for our family...”
Reviews.Author: pass54
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Orlando with my wife, her parents, and our two sons (ages 2.5 and 8 months). We stayed in a 3 BR Barbados suite with a view of the pool, It was so great for everyone to have their own room and still have a HUGE living space to hang out after we put the kids to bed. We loved having the kitchen so we could have breakfast in the room and a place for leftovers if we went out. Having small kids, laundry in the room was a huge plus. You have to be a little self-sufficient so don't stay here thinking all of your needs will just be taken care of, but I really didn't mind dropping our trash off in the chute at the end of the hall on my way down to the pool. Great place - we will definitely stay there the next time we are in Orlando. My bet is we will be back sooner than we would have before since we know there is such a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “we are going back in 28 days fantastic resort love it!”
Reviews.Author: KateDaulton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and were amazed by the excellent standard of the resort the rooms are huge, spotless and the furniture and fittings are of the best quality. The kitchen had all you would need and more. The resort was clean and well maintained through out. The staff were so helpful even posting our postcards on their way home. The shopping mall, which is only a few steps from the resort is one of the smaller outlets but still has many top brands. Aswith all resort shops, this one was expensive but walmart is only a few minutes away. the pizza was the best we had tasted, from the pizza shop on site. The shuttle works quite well, we did not want to drive due to a previous incident of getting lost so we used the shuttle every day. It takes a bit longer than driving yourself but look on the postive side you get to meet the other guests! The space is fantastic in the apartment, massive shower, spa bath and extra bathroom. The beds are huge, emperor size in the master, which can fit four! and good size queens in the twin rooms with televisions in each bedroom and a large flat screen in the lounge, free wi-fi connection in the room, a great fittness centre and spa, with the latter being abit pricey. We could not fault this resort in any way, hence our booked return in a few days. As it is in the L.B.V. area it is very quiet with any nightlife or restaurants only a short taxi ride or car ride away, only a few minutes. The staff were so helpful, we had a medical emergency which involed our youngest daughter having a '911' ride to the hospital and our stay being extended by 9 days and we could not have asked for more consideration and support from the staff. If you are looking for a top quality family resort, look no further, book this resort today! You wont regret it! Kate Daulton and family, Devon, England.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bagahah
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five days and it was great. We had a two bedroom suite and it had a kitchen two bathrooms and living room too. Ask for a room in building 3 or 5 because they are newer and have better views. Also ask for a higher floor as the children from the pool can be very loud. It is located next to a small little outlet mall with very few shops, but less than 10 minutes away there are 2 huge outlet malls (premium and prime outlets). There is a walmart quite close to the hotel. The location is not too far away from all the parks. We usually stay in a regular hotel, but after staying here we always want a condo. It is so comfortable and we were able to save money on the food and could wash our clothes inside the room. there were 3 tvs and a nice balcony too. It was overall very spacious and convenient. DEFINETELY recommend it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: MeMeG
Reviews.Content: This is a great family hotel option as opposed to staying in a Disney Resort. We had a two bedroom suite (1k and 2twins). Our children are girl 17/boy7 and although they shared a room, each had their own bed and space. 2nd bathroom was right outside their room. Three tv's, one in kids room, living room, and master bedroom. Master bathroom was awesome with jetted tub and separate shower. It was convenient to Disneyworld (10-15 min drive with traffic). The hotel offered a shuttle but we opted to take rent car and budgeted for parking every day at the parks. Hotel parking is free. We saved money by eating some meals (mainly breakfast) because the room has kitchen and dining room. It's really more like a condo than hotel. Negatives: carpets a little dingy/stained for my liking in rooms and hallways of resort. Parking a bit of a problem. Had to park near Irish pub and on street a couple of nights. Kitchen is sparse on utensils, and no cleaning products so you will have to go to walmart or grocery store to get a few basic things to wipe off counters, etc. All in all, it was a great hotel. These were all minor issues overall. We stayed a week and I don't know if our family could have survived in a typical hotel room of two double beds like on most affordable Disney resorts. Plus it would have cost a lot more money staying on property. For a family of 4 for hotel, airline tickets, and rent car (Honda Civic), it was $1900. Pirate ship pool was great for my 7 yr old. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SB02_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was lovely and the room was amazing, really spacious, very clean and had all amenities you could wish for. Beds very comfortable and the furniture and kitchen applicances were of a high standard. The jacuzzi was an added bonus. The pizzas from Pizza Hut were the best we had ever had. The only criticism I would make is that the pool was a lot cooler than other pools we have used in Florida hotels but it still did not stop us going in it most days.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous- and without a car!”
Reviews.Author: julieandjohn57
Reviews.Content: Amazing apartment, stayed in block 2, 3rd floor. Booked 3 bed 2 bath and were allocated 3 bed 3 bath at no extra cost. That gave us two massive spa bath ensuite rooms and a double room with separate bath. Huge apartment, clean, fully equipped and well maintained. Have no idea what previous reviewer is complaining about with regard to linens as it's quite clear on their web site that you have to pay for housekeeping and linen changes, just book it at reception. Plenty of towels provided and easily washed and dried ourselves, didn't bother with paying for towel changes. Washing/drying facilities were great, came home with no dirty laundry! Bins are provided adjacent to the lifts on each floor to empty your rubbish and recycling bins were on the ground and 4th floors of our block. Without a car the shuttle service was essential. Book it the day before and coach or appropriate number of 10 seaters sent for each park (only had to wait once when too few cars turned up and then it was only a 15 min delay - no worries).
