No you can't split your day between Universal and Disney on the shuttle, but then it's not a private chauffeur service, and of course within Disney you can use the Disney transportation to park hop. On site shop is very expensive, but Walmart is just a 2 min ride away. Without a car you need to walk out of the rear of blocks 1 or 2 and across the outlet stores carpark. You come to a large dual carriage type road which looks a little daunting but is in fact quite easy to cross. There is no pedestrian crossing but there are traffic lights at both ends of this section, so you just need to wait in the middle until the traffic stops the other way. Not much in the way of pavements so wear closed in shoes to walk along the grass verges - all in all about a 15 min walk from apartments. Costs about 10 dollars each way for a cab if you have shopping too heavy to carry. Was initially disappointed at the lack of restaurants in walking distance although the Irish pub and Pizza Hut on site were great. However, found lots of restaurants ie: Ruby Tuesdays, TGI's, rib shacks, oriental buffets, italian and chinese places on I 192. Cabs cost between 7 and 10 dollars each way, but walkable if you take the road directly alongside Walmart garden centre. A straight road (with pavement) all the way from Walmart to the top of I 192 and takes about 20 minutes. Overall an excellent place to stay, had a fabulous holiday, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family...”
Reviews.Author: LAC6201
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel alot! We asked for a room in building number 5, {it is a newer one} overlooking the fireworks. I wasn't sure if they would accomodate this but they did and we were on one of the higher up floors and saw fireworks everynight, it was amazing! The balcony has four chairs and a table and the room was really spacious, we had the two bedroom. The kitchen had everything and was really clean. Dish soap and dishwashing soap under the sink. Washer and dryer in the closet and they had laundry soap at the front desk. The first time she charged me one dollar for a little one load box and the next time they gave it to me for free. I did kind of miss the sheet change during the one week, but we opted not to have the cleaning and it was fine. You can get the cord for the internet at the front desk and it worked out great. It is close to Disney and all of the stores that you could possibly want. We did not go in the pool at all, it was FULL all the time. I think small children would enjoy the pool more than teens. The pirate ship takes up so much of the pool and is alittle hokey. The drinks at the bar are too expensive and they don't let you bring your own food and drink to the pool. All in all though it was great for us and we would return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Stuart_FLJenjen
Reviews.Content: \We arrived on a Friday for a weekend getaway until Monday. I reserved the room through the reservations at the resort saving quite a bit of money after shopping Travelocity, for the fact we are Florida residents. The hotel is clean and the property maintained nicely. We chose a two bedroom villa which was perfect for the six of us. We didn't have a room facing the pool, but it would have been nice seeing how the hotel was not completely booked. The pool is nice for all ages with a pirate ship waterslide....While we were there, my boyfriend and I decided to treat ourselves at The Spa. We chose a "couples package" for 2 hours, a little bit expensive but this was a treat and the spa staff was wonderful. The only thing about the resort I didn't like was the pool bar .Drinks an snacks were expensive. I was hoping for a bigger menu with more options for the kids, offering some salads or fruit plates would be a nice. We found an attitude with a couple of the staff members at the bar and had hope for the couple that were friendly to be working when we went to the pool. If I decided to go back to this resort, I would pack some healthier snacks and bring my own beverages in a cooler when using the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, shabby furniture, poor service,definitely not value for money”
Reviews.Author: decisionsval
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to drive don't stay here. If you want to split your days at the parks don't stay here. If you like clean bed linen more than once every 16 days don't stay here. If you're expecting an efficient, adequate shuttle to the parks, don't stay here. If you expect 4 * service do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: happywife40
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and two children along with my mother in law! We stayed in one of the three bedroom suites. The rooms were a great size, I loved that they were so roomy! The view was awesome and my children loved the Pirate Ship Pool. We had a nasty bee hive outside on our balcony, they came within an hour to get rid of it and also fixed a bathroom door handle that was getting stuck. The staff was great and the poolside bar staff was great too. A little pricey for a cocktail though, considering if they just would lower their prices a bit, they might actually have more customers at the bar! Really had no complaints, loved that it felt like you were right at home after a long day in one of the parks, very comfortable. Beds were a little hard, but I still slept well. We opted not to pay extra for the housekeeping, and it worked out just fine. Would recommend them to any other family or friends! Very close to all parks, and to Walmart, or Publix. We did not go shopping at the outlet malls, but they are within walking distance and it was pretty cool if you wanted to shop! All in all we had a great time and got a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “This place is fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: jspsailors
Reviews.Content: This resort has all you can ask for. The Rooms are clean and spacious, staff is cheerfull, helpful and curteous. The pool is fantastic for all of the family. The Spa makes you feel totally pampered. Will be our place to go when staying in Orlando...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Families”
Reviews.Author: wpd95
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our 5-day Disney trip. The hotel was like returning home each day. In fact, one day we didn't leave the grounds because we enjoyed the pool and the on site restauant. Now the breakdown.. On the plus side; nice size rooms, fully appointed kitchen, comfortable furniture with big flat screen tv's. The master bedroom is very large with a large whirlpool bath and a walk-in shower. The balcony off the living room holds 4-5 people and comes with plastic patio furniture. We had a great view of the main pool which was beautiful at night. If you get lucky, as the main desk for a view of the Disney fireworks. The 2nd choice would be the view of the main pool and the pirate ship. Last but not least, you get covered parking and your car is not exposed to the elements. The larger buildings have parking decks for the first two floors. It was great a couple of times during heavy downpours. Just jumped in the car and went to dinner. On the negative side; not like most hotel/condo's. No ice anywhere in the building. There is a small store on site but very expensive. To drop trash you have to walk to one end of the floor and enter the trash room. The trash is then dropped down a chute. Housekeeping is available but at a hefty price. Also, there is internet service but it's wired not wireless. Of course, I didn't have the cord I needed. We did have a problem the first night. The air conditioning went out and after 6 hours, they switched us to a different room. We had no choice with the room but it was similar to the original room. If you want to save a few bucks, there is a Wal-Mart just down the road. It's a madhouse depending on the time of year but you can stock up on food and anything else you may need. They also sell Disney tickets at a slightly discounted price. Overall, a great place to stay. Everything is on site and you dont have to leave unless you want to go to the parks...

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Susan75009
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so affordable. I guess we got a great deal because they could definately charge more for this place. The location was super convenient. We were across the street from Walmart, and adjacent to the Lake Buena Vista Outlet Mall shops. We were within 5 minutes to all the Disney parks. I was worried about driving to and from the parks since the shuttle is only twice a day. We have stayed on site with Disney before and the shuttles were so crowded. We drove this time and I can say it was so much more convenient. Of course Disney does it right. They tell you where to park and have a shuttle waiting there to take you to the front gate of the park...super easy. The rooms were so nice. We had a fully equiped kitchen with granite countertops and dishwasher, washer and dryer, two bedrooms, two baths, and a balcony overlooking the pool with a pirate ship. The kids loved the pool and slide on the pirate ship. The restaurant was good too. They even had a small convenient store and a Pizza Hut Express on site. The staff was extremely helpful and nice too. I would and have recommended this hotel to my friends and we would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View & walk to Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: mar_rio1225
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, the staff friendly and smiling. the rooms and the grounds were all kept very clean. The view of downtown Disney has to be the Best, and right across the street. I would definately recommend this resort to anyone wanting to stay in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious but a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: KatieBToronto
Reviews.Content: The 2-bedroom suite was great for us though our 11-year-old son wasn't as thrilled with his pullout sofa in the living room as our 19-year-old daughter didn't want to share her room with twin beds. Lots of space for us all, nice master suite for parents with its own bathroom and jacuzzi (though kid was the only one who used it). Big balcony as we were near the top though not much in the way of furniture for it. A bit hit and miss knowing what supplies to find in the room - e.g., no coffee filters (which the nice woman at the shop at the hotel warned us about so we picked some up), no laundry detergent but there was dishwasher detergent and some decaf coffee (I think it depends what previous guests leave.) We did do laundry once and had the room cleaned mid-week of our one-week stay, which worked for us. It was confusing finding our room after we checked in and figuring out which building was ours and the wait to check in was a bit long (not enough staff at that time of day.) But the pool with slide was fine, the location was very convenient to both Disney and Universal and the Irish pub restaurant was a great place for dinner (great stew, Shepherd's pie...). The phones were down the entire time we were there, which was a bit of a pain. But it was nice to breakfast in the room so we could get to theme parks faster and all in all, we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: zavalzap
Reviews.Content: I was excited to arrive at the resort because I had read good reviews about it, but when I got there it seemed that everyone got the same deal I did, there was a long line to check in, as I approached the check in counter, I was told that my room was not ready, so I was told to come back again in a few minutes, so I went to relax at the pool and it was ok but when I went to go get a drink at the bar (that supposedly was a great poolside bar) it cost me $30 for two drinks and one kids drink. Too expensive and the drinks were not even all that. The bartender took it upon himself to pour my drinks into these soveniur cups from the hotel without asking me, the cups themselves made my drinks more costly, anyways I had no choice but to take the drinks because there were people waiting behind us. So after all that, I went back to check in and my room was still not ready, at this point I am a little upset because I was tired and I just wanted to freashen up before I proceeded with my day. I had to raise my voice a little and tell them to find me another room because I was no longer going to wait for the room that they had assigned me. So finally they got me a room just like the one that I had reserved, I walk in and it was a very nice room, with all the perks inside like the granite counter tops, jacuzzi tub, etc. The only thing that didnt work in the room was the phones. None of the three phones I had in my room worked at all. I called for them to come and fix the problem and they came fast, however nothing was done about it. I stayed here for a week and the phones were never fixed. I had to call guest services from my cell phone and that alone was frustrating because no one ever answers the phones at the front desk. All in all I love Florida, and this resort is nice but it seems that it could use better customer service, more than one main entrance to the building you are in, because after hours if you cant find parking by your building you have to walk all the way around to the main entrance of the building to get the elevator and that is a long walk especially when you have young kids traveling with you. Another bad thing is that if your room overlooks the pool area you will have people in the pool making loud noises waking you up in the middle of the night or early in the morning. Not something to look forward to if you came home late for a good nites sleep. I love the outlet shops next door that is an added bonus for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: lfsmithsc
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at this resort and we love it! Very spacious condos and everything you need. Prices are very affordable and great location! We look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need all in one place”
Reviews.Author: Carmpossible
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and great for families traveling together. The full kitchen offers everything necessary to feed the family. The family pool is awesome for the kids. The location is perfect, not too far from any of the theme parks. We've stayed twice in the past year and plan on staying again for our next FL vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: tkreisch
Reviews.Content: I started researching hotels for this stay last year. I looked at every hotel (even Disney). This hotel caught my eye for value and for quality. I read the poor reviews for this hotel and I was a little leary as there were some. However, the good review far exceeded the poor ones. Let's just say, that I had nothing negative to say about my stay. We arrived late, and the staff was so helpful and friendly. When we asked staff members for restaurant choices, they were glad to help (and sometimes even game us coupons for them), The services get a BIG thumbs up. The bar staff at the pool was especially friendly. Now for the rooms, they were AMAZIING. We stayed in Building 5 (per someone's recommendation) and it did not disappoint. It was right by the pool and the rooms were very nice and appeared to be new. The Jetted tub was an awesome addition (our kids were in it more than we were). Having 3 TV's was bonus (very nice 42 inch plasma in the living room). We ate supper on the balcony one night and watched the fireworks for Sea World (very nice). Simply put, the nicest hotel room I have ever stayed in. We will never look at another hotel room the same way. We had friends staying at Disney and their room was 1/8 the size of ours and they payed about $70 more a night for theirs. The ONLY negative to the rooms were the beds were a bit hard for my tastes, although with a Disney hangover every night, I barely noticed! You all know about the cleaning. It never bothered us. We washed our own towels when we did laundry (washer & dryer in room was great!). I took trash to the shoot twice (we brough trash bags). I liked not having to worry about being out so housekeeping could come in. The pool was just awesome. My boys (4 and 8) could have stayed there all day (not to mention their love of the ice cream sandwhiches they sold at the poolside bar!!). The slide, the pirate ship, the 0 entry...perfect for families. Area was amazing. Literally 3 minutes from about 20 chain restaurants and Downtown Disney. Easy 8-10 minute drive from Disney. I would recommend renting a car. Although it close to a lot of things, driving makes things much easier. Parking was never a problem for us, although I did notice some cars parked along the road that must have belong to the night owls (even though we returned several night after midnight and never had a problem). I would recommend Bahama Breeze (great restaurant down the road). Awesome food. Also, we ordered Pizza from Flipper's per the suggestion of the hotel. Get pizza from here if you order out...so good!!! Overall, it was an awesome hotel experience for our family. My wife and I figured after 7 nights away from home with our 4 and 8 year old boys, we would be ready to come home. WRONG! We could have stayed at LBVRV for another week. The amount of space in the ENORMOUS room (we had a 2 Bedroom Antiqua) gave us more room than we probably have in the downstairs of home. This was key to everyone having their own space to avoid annoyances. When we return, we will certainly stay here. I can't say enough about this hotel. Absolutely fabulous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “2 weeks in Orlando and wouldn't have stayed anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: IdahoTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa from June 4th through June 18th and it was a really REALLY great place to stay. Keep in mind that every resort/hotel has it's problems... NOTHING is perfect, even in the town that boasts to be the "Happiest Place on Earth." Yes the power went out, but come-on people....the resort had no control over that, it was a city wide power outage. They did the best they could running minimal lights on generators, which is actually more than I would have thought a resort would do in that situation. We even had one night at the pool where a family of around 15 decided it was appropriate to swim in next to nothing (underwear, bras, etc.) As offended as I was, this was not the fault of the resort. They can't hand-pick their clientele. Had I or anyone else in the pool area chosen to take this up with management, I am sure something would have been done immediately. Honestly, I think we were all in shock at the sight, and by the time any of us came to our senses enough to complain, the family was leaving the pool area. We stayed in building 3 on the 11th floor in a two bedroom suite overlooking the pirate ship pool (very COOL!) If you are looking into staying, and want a room with a view of the pool, these rooms were great. Our balcony faced north, with Universal Studios and Sea World in the distance. You can (barely) see Universal's fireworks at 10pm every night. If you want a room with a view of the Epcot and/or Magic Kingdom fireworks, you will need to be in a different building (not sure, but I think it's building 5 on the north side.) Either way, I don't think its possible to have a room with both a pirate pool view and the Disney fireworks. The pool and hot tubs were great. (There is a smaller pool on the other side of the resort, but we only visited the "pirate" pool.) It's zero entry from one end, and gradual steps on the other. It's refreshing after a day at the parks. The pirate ship has a water slide in it... a lot of people, kids in particular, seemed to like this. The bar at the pool is well equipped, beer/wine is around $6 and a "fruity" drink will cost you $12 (I think it was) for your first one in their "Lani's Luau" plastic drink cup, and then $8 for each one after that (just keep bringing the cup with you every night.) There are signs that no outside food or drink is allowed in pool area, but it was never enforced, at least not that I experienced. The pool area also has free wifi, so that was really nice for those of us who can't live without our laptops. The condos are large - dining area, sitting area (couch and chair) fully equipped kitchen, two bedroom, (one with two twins, the other with a king) two bathrooms, (master suite has jetted tub and separate shower) and a balcony. The condo was clean and definitely served its purpose. The jetted tub was fabulous after a long HOT day at the parks. Our room had a wired internet connection. Sometimes I could get a very weak wireless signal, but being on the 11th floor, it was not enough to gain wireless internet access. We went through VRBO.com and dealt only with the owner until we checked into the resort. I highly recommend this, as the price was considerably cheaper. Our room rate per night was $100.00 - that included all taxes and the "resort" fees. I am HUGE on service... service can make or break it for me. I will say that the front desk staff was neither friendly or rude... they were just,... well... there. It wasn't all smiles and niceties, but they got the job done in a very timely manner and always answered our questions. Parking, for us, was always sufficient. We always parked in our building's parking garage... never once had problems finding a spot. We were never at the parks until very late though, so I assume that might be a problem for some. Someone else here posted that there was only one luggage carts per building... from what I saw this is simply not true. There were times that I saw as many as 4 at the elevators in the parking garage in our building. For those of you who will do what we did and buy a bunch of groceries, there is a Wal-Mart about 1/4 - 1/3 mile away... very convenient! I would definitely stay here again if we ever venture back to Disney World! Huge bang for your buck! I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great pool”
Reviews.Author: Joseph546
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort, immaculate rooms, excellent value. No daily housekeeping - extra charge for clean towels or sheets. No vacuum cleaner except for extra charge. Great pool with waterslide. Covered parking in two of the 5 buildings. Parking difficult to find if arriving late after fireworks at Disney parks. Highly recommended for those with families who could use a multibedroom suite for an excellent price. Polite, helpful staff. Plan on staying there again in the future. Free ethernet internet, no wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: rockets3
Reviews.Content: Having driven 14+ hours we requested a possible early check-in of 2 hours for our 6 night stay (normal check-in is 4:00PM). We arrived shortly after 2:00PM, we waited in a short line (15 minutes) and the young man at the front desk was very rude in telling us that we couldn't get our room until 4:00PM even though we just saw other customers getting their rooms early. We went to the Irish Pub on the property which was very nice and came back about 3:30PM as we were very tired and wanted to get to our room to rest after our long drive. This time there was more of a line and we waited 20 minutes and got the same young man. He was still rude, he told us the room still wasn't ready, it wasn't 4:00PM yet, and they were very busy and it may not be ready until sometime later that night. I told him I wasn't going to continue to stand in line. I shouldn't have to stand in line when I already have done so twice. He didn't have an answer to that. My family sat in the lobby until 4:01PM and then stood in line again. It seems the family that was waiting behind us in line was going through the same kind of thing from the same same young man even though we saw other people getting their rooms. I dreaded getting this young man again, but I could see this young man was "slow walking" the customer in front of him so he would not have to wait on us, luckly for all of us we got someone else. The young lady we got said the room was not ready but then contiuned on to see if she could get us in another room. She talked to the manager (he was working next to her) about this and he did some checking and got us a room and he also explained that there was a power outage the night before and not all rooms were electrically checked to make sure everything was working, especially the A/C. The Resort (if you want to call it that, I don't) looks very nice from the outside. The room, 2bed/2bath appeared nice and clean, but looking deeper, carpets dirty and furniture was worn. The TV in the second bedroom could be a bit larger, you can't watch it laying in bed, way too small. The bathroom in the master bedroom could use a door for some privacy (a very poor setup). The internet is NOT wireless, YOU have to have your own cable and it can only be used in the living area (not bedrooms). Nothing tells you this you have to figure that out on your own and then after midnight it is hit or miss if you can get on as the internet ran very slowly after that to the point that it wasn't even worth trying. The phones did not work. Reported it and they finally came the last day of our stay and said they would have to replace a phone as it did not work, they never did so we had no land phone available to us our entire stay. Also, one of our hair dryers was missing from the room and we called immediately so we wouldn't be charged for it as they have a list of items that the resort would charge if these items were missing from your room after your stay (I thought that was in bad taste....if you steal it you should be expected to pay for it). A new hair dryer didn't show up for 2 days. I have stayed in nearly a hundred motels/hotels/resorts over the years and there have been a handful that do not have maid/cleaning service unless you paid extra for it, but this place did not even change the towels or dump the trash (you are kidding me) We washed our towels every day to have clean ones and dumped our own trash nightly. Some residents just threw their trash out of their doors, very disquesting and smelly. Where are the vending machines?....there were none. The convenience store was a joke (things you could get from a dollar store that are priced at $10). The pirate ship was neat to see but it took up way too much room in the pool and the surrounding deck as the pool was packed every day an no where to sit (use the smaller pool, no crowds and more relaxing...isn't that why people go on vacation to relax). Forget parking at night if you come in late, you probably will have to park behind the the outlet mall next door (the outlet mall being next door was nice...that was a good idea if you just wanted to stay around the hotel area for a day). The Irish Pub (Frankie's) was excellent. The family loved it and a few of the Bartenders/Waiters were very good and made you feel at home. When the day came to check out I searched for a luggage cart, none to be found. My family and myself made numerous trips down the elevator/stairs to the car none of the service people knew where any carts were nor did they really care. Check-out time is 11:00AM, at 9:30AM we got a knock on our door from the maid service asking us when we would be leaving so they could clean our room for the next customer. Are you kidding me??? After what we had gone thorugh in getting our room you wanted us out of our room early, come on, where is the customer service at this place? The price was right, that is why we stayed at this place but will not stay here again until they get the little things taken care of, far too many of them and there are way too many other places to stay in Orlando. I rather pay a little more and be treated as I mattered to them.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: pedinurse32
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this resort for 6 nights in June. One the nioght of arrival, after a LONG drive to Orlando, we experienced a power outage. This left many rooms with no air , lights, etc. The rsort had a back up generator which kicked in , so some rooms had minimal power. We awoke the next morning to the problem being fixed. Well, after a long day at the parks in the heat, we returned to the room with it being EXTREMELY HOT once again. After multiple calls to the front desk over a period of three to four hours, we finally was able to get the maintenance man to the room. Upon arrival, he cam with the understanding that he was to replace a cabinet board.. he had no idea about the air. Weel after maybe another hour, he was able to fix the problem. By now, it is late, we are all very hot, tired, and hungry! In addition to these issues, the access door to our buidling was broken, so anyone had access to the buidling. I never saw any security person. It just puzzled me hwo a place this large had no visible security, one maintenanace guy for maybe ~600 rooms, one luggae cart per buidling, and no "management on call after hours. Someohow the management believes that problems do not exists after hours. Needless to say, we will never stay thaere again!!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous, spacious and central!”
Reviews.Author: lrb88888888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days - when it was newly opened. 2 bedroom apartment was very large and overlooked the pirate pool which the kids loved. The only thing I would say is that you would probably need to have a car for convenience - we did, so we never used the shuttles. Disney World was just a 10 minute drive away, and International Drive not that far away either. Supermarket down the road. Pizza Hut on site which was great. Factory outlets next door - but these aren't as good as ones on International Drive. Front desk we had no problems with. They were great. They recommended a doctor when my son got sick who came to the room, rang the local pharmacy down the road to order the antibiotics and we went and picked them up! Easy!. My husband left our travellers cheques in the room safe when we left. They looked after them until we got back from our cruise. We went on a Disney Cruise for a week, then had booked (& paid) to go into the Hawthorn Sutites near Universal. In hindsight we should have gone back to the LBV resort as the accommodation was so much better there! It wouldn't have taken long to drive up to the attractions near Universal, Sea World, etc from the LBV resort. We got a very good rate through the Orlando MagiCard - see website to download card. Highly recommended place to stay in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: CanadaPatgeo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from spending 5 nights at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa. We stayed in a 2bedroom condo on the 17th floor. The kitchen was fully equipped with washer,dryer, dishwasher and kitchen appliances. The huge bath and walk in shower in the master was excellent. and the other 2 bedrooms and 2nd bathroom was perfect. I wouldn't recommend a high floor suite for those travelling with small kids as I personally would be concerned with the balcony for young ones. I would opt for a lower floor for young families. The staff wer friendly. there was an outlet mall on the grounds. This was our second time there in less than a year and We will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: justda6ofus
Reviews.Content: Traveled with 4 children, ages 8 mos-10 years. It is within 10 min. to the parks. The rooms are clean and spacious. Pirate pool was a hit with our kids. The only bad part was the front desk. There aren't enough people on staff which means, you may end up having to wait in a long line. However, the staff is very friendly, including the bartenders at the tiki bar by the pool and across the street at O'Farrells :-) Overall, a very relaxing place to end up after a long, exhausting day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: NanaS32
Reviews.Content: With 2 'young grandchildren the 3 bedroom Barbados suite was perfect. Room for us to have quiet time. The pirate pool kept them busy when we weren't at an attraction. The service was excellent and the Spa visit relaxing. The resort shuttle to Disney and Sea World enhanced the visit and proved to be every economical-it's no cost. We plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “I could live here no problem!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolPipkins
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from two week at this resort. We were a party of 14 and had 3 three bedroom apartments which were lovely. As mentioned in another review the washer /dryer massive fridge, micro, dishwasher were fab we also did not return home with a case of dirty clothes. We were also in block 5 on floor 3,6 and one apartment on floor 13. This I feel I should mention though,my sister was on the 13th floor with her family one child under 10 and the other under 5. They had to move apartments as they had staff staying above them and could hear them walking about and running baths at all hrs. Also I feel the balcony areas could do with screens,although there are railings around them it is very appealing for a 5 yr old to stand on the balcony looking down at the pirate ship in the pool. I also would like to moan about Joes pizza who put a leaflet through the apartment door every night. We ordered food that took an hr and a half longer than they advised and it was stone cold I strongly advise not ordering from these takeaway leaflets. The Pizza takeaway on site is excellent. The outlet shops are fantastic with shops to cater for all, the staff in the outlet shops are very friendly and helpful. Frankie O'Farrels was a lovely friendly restaurant drinks were dear though! After a busy day at a park it was bliss coming back to this resort, it was very comfortable and spacious. I could live in a place like this the shops in the outlet made it a five star resort for me

Reviews.Title: “Excellent -wouldn't hesitate to recommend”
Reviews.Author: Beav27
Reviews.Content: I stayed with wife + two children in block 5 from 24th May - 7th June and was suitably impressed by the apartment. It was huge, immaculately clean and had everything you could wish for - air con, 3 TV's including a very large flat screen in the lounge, washer + dryer, massive fridgefreezer, dishwasher, microwave, safe, jacuzzi + two showers and /toilets. Walmart is a 2 minute drive, Disney and Seaworld about 10 minutes, and Universal about 15-20. Our balcony faced towards Disney and we could see the fireworks every night. I can only assume that anyone who has given negative reviews. I can only assume that anyone who has given negative comments did not stay in block 5 (which I presume is the newest one) or did not bother to read other reviews on this site or the resorts own web site - it is NOT a hotel - it is blocks of aprtments/condo's with all the facilities as such. You do not get maid service unless you pay extra, but you really do not need it. It is easy to wash and dry your clothes and towels and we came back with nothing to wash or iron. Rubbish can be put in larger bins at the end of the corridor when your waste bin is full and is collected every day as far as I could tell. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for family gathering.”
Reviews.Author: dunnroamin
Reviews.Content: Rooms were beautiful...kinda Pottery Barn decor. Lobby much the same. Rooms are far from the lobby and parking is a long, long way from the rooms. Pools are VERY dated. Morning buffet was not good at all and certainly overpriced, yet the server was wonderful. We stayed two nights at $300. per night. Would not pay that again. Worth half that rate at best.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: lookingeastat48
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at this hotel and I must say it was great. The rooms are huge, clean, comfortable and they have the biggest jacuzzi I have ever seen. Plus, the jacuzzi is so cool with lights around the bottom that gradually change color as you bathe (or otherwise) and make it very romantic. The outside pool has three hot tubs and a full-sized pirate ship in the middle of the pool with interior slides that zip you out the side of the ship and fire you into the water. One end of the pool is shallow so toddlers can walk in and play. No diving but I did not miss that. The staff was great and very helpful. I liked this place so much that I already booked a week in September. By the way, it's only 2 miles from downtown Disney. Very, very convenient to every attraction. If you can only do one attraction, do Sea World. Cleaner, nicer, more to do and the best water park I ever used.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal base to do Disneyworld and Orlando”
Reviews.Author: r42289
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 20 night stay in Orlanda where we did all things Disney with our 2 young children. This was the first time in Orlando for any of us so I spent some significant time up front reviewing options for accomodation and after a very detailed analysis I finally selected the LBV Resort Village and Spa. I am delighted to say I was not dissappointed with my selection. This is an excellent resort with very spacious and comfortable rooms offering great value for money. We took a 2 bedroom condo with living area, dining area and kitchen and gave us more than enough room for the 4 of us on the trip, with each room well furnished and plenty of amenties. There are 3 and 4 bedroom units available as well. I especially liked the large whirlpool baths in the main bedrooms and the fact that there was free internet access. One point I would highlight is the pool area and in particular the large pirate ship offered. This area is very nice with plenty of beds available to relax on. However from my initial research the Pirate Ship looked like an excellent play area for the kids and would be something they could spend many hours in enjoying themselves. The reality is that the (very large) ship is nothing more that an enclosure for a fully enclosed water slide into the pool, which as it transpired was not suitable for either of my young children. This was my only (slight) dissappointment with the resort. The biggest recommendation I would offer for this resort is the location within Orlando. If you are planning to do Disney then there would be no better place. After leaving the car garage, 60 seconds and 2 turns takes you onto the 536 and literally 4 minutes later you are passing the welcoming entrance sign for Walt Disney World. Just perfect. We had an absolutely fantastic time in Orlando and our accomodation had a lot to do with that. This is a great resort and a perfect place to stay, especially if travelling with family or in a large group. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC PLACE, LOCATION AND HOTEL FAB!”
Reviews.Author: powellsdisney
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks at this hotel. It was brilliant. We had a 2 bedroom apartment which had everything you needed in it. The location for Disney, Universal and Seaworld was excellent, it only took 5 minutes to get to Magic Kingdom. The pool area and bar was very good for chill days and had a nice atmosphere. Having the shops next door was great too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants easy access to disney and would suggest block 5 as this either over looks the fireworks from magic kingdom, epcot and seaworld or it overlooks the pool area. The shop on site is very handy (but a little overpriced) but walmart is 5 mins down the road so we did our shopping there. There is also a Pizza Hut shop which was also handy for quick dinners. The receptionist were friendly and helpful when needed and we had no problems checking in or out. We did have one night when car parking was a bit of a problem, but this was due to a busy night at the hotel. All in all we loved this resort and will be booking again for next year. # #

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Griff99
Reviews.Content: The 2 br. suite we stayed in was well equiped, quiet and very spacious. The beds are a little firmer than most people would like and the bed linens were clean but well worn - but that is the only thing that we weren't 100% happy with. Staff was always pleasant and efficient. You can pay extra for several different housekeeping services from towel changes, garbage removal to complete suite clean for a very reasonable price and it is well worth it. Suites have washer/dryer, but you will need to buy detergent. All dishwashing liquid, soaps, shampoos, etc. are provided. Both pools were great. Although the pool with the pirate ship is much busier as you might expect. Really short drive to Disneyworld, did not use the shuttle, but they do provide one. Nice balcony with a great view if you are higher up (we were on the 13th floor not on the Disney side).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amenities-BEAUTIFUL ROOM-Awesome Location! Friendly Service!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffy2fers
Reviews.Content: Thank you som much to this hotel and all involved. We had an awesome stay and will be back in the near future as this is truly our home away from home! Good times were shared all around with family. Pleasant service LOVE THE SHOPPING CAPABILITIES TONS OF NAME BRAND STORES I found a whole new wardrobe at an amazing price. Walmart supercenter literally down the street. Room had an extremely equipped kitchen. Jacuzzi tub, beautiful furniture. Iiterally can find nothing negative to say about this awesome beautiful resort. I didn't want to leave wonderful beds. Security measures using room keys to protect your family. I want to go back now!!!!! AAAHHH I really want to scream it from the rooftops!!!! Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Self Catering Apartment, with view of pool - Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: JUVENTUS73
Reviews.Content: We erally enjoyed our 5 night stay at the LBV resort and Spa. We were only a 5 minute drive from downtown Disney which was great for evening meals....Universal Studios was close by and took us 10 mins to get there by car.Kennedy Space Centre was a one hour drive away. Hotel / Apartment complex was very clean and tidy and our apartment was excellent. It had all the amenities you could wish for. (washer, dryer, kitchen etc) Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “ideal family rooms but beware of pub grub”
Reviews.Author: AK61
Reviews.Content: We have just spent the last two weeks at LBV Resort Village and have nothing but praise for the rooms and the staff. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment and found it excellent, spacious and well laid out. The staff are friendly and very helpful and the atmosphere is relaxed. Only downside was Frankie Farrells Pub which served slop poorly and had no idea of what makes an irish pub special. When we went in, the waiter pointed us to sit under a tv screen, I asked could we not sit elsewhere as there was plenty of room ..... only to be greeted by a grunt and our waiter calling another waiter to seat us (his words were: jeeze, these guys wont sit there and want to move). The food served was appalling to say the least ...... I asked for the chicken curry and was offered a mix of french fries (chips) and rice with it. What I got was a sort of chicken stew with the fries or chips sitting/soaking at the BOTTOM of the bowl, rice thrown on top and then the watery curry slopped over the lot in a bowl!!!! Another nag is the constant stream of pizza adverts being put in your door every evening ...... but it was funny when the second guy kept taking the first guys ad's out and putting his ones in. The resort was not too easy to find on our sat nav, but was close enough to all the action. There is an outlet village right beside the resort and it is ideal with some great value to be got. All in all, we loved the apartment and would recommend it for families looking for space and all mod cons inc a great jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and the apartments had...”
Reviews.Author: ElginAm
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and the apartments had all the facilities you could want. We had two bedroomed and it was a great size for family of 4. Location was great idrive was right turn then right turn and you are on it. Disney was right then left. No complaints at all and recommend for any family coming to do the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, Service, Ammenities, Ideal for family with young ones!”
Reviews.Author: LifestyleRealtor
Reviews.Content: If you've read the reviews about poor customer service and billing errors the easiest way around that is to book through an owner at vrbo.com. I am not an owner nor soliciting the website it's just a fact. Excellent location close to a Disney(entrance 1 mile away), designer outlet mall(not the one next door to it) wide variety of dining choices within 2 miles and a super walmart a mile or so away. The property has three dining choices, pool cafe(kid friendly), irish pub(live music and great beer choices), and pizza hut express located in the mini mart. I prefer fine dining and about 10-15 minutes away is Dellagio Town Center with boutique shopping and good restaurants. The Sand Lake Rd. developed area where Dellagio Town Center is reminds me of Naples Florida where we have our second residence. We stayed in a 3br/2bth condo in building 5 and it was spacious enough for myself, wife, two kids and mother in law. Well appointed, fully stocked kitchen. I recommend staying in buildings 3 or 5 as they are the closest to the popular pirate pool. The pirate pool is great for kids and that is where the cafe is located(Bob the bartender is a great guy!) Room service is optional, we cleaned ourselves. Elevators are plenty and uber fast. Grounds are well maintained. Parking was bountiful during our stay. Some reviews say it's hard to find from the airport, I highly disagree. I had never been to Disney and found it with ease. For $120/night with no taxes and an $80 cleaning fee upon departure I can't imagine finding a better accomodation. I am well traveled and picky where I stay, play, and dine. Is there nicer, sure, the Ritz blows it away, but for the dollar, there is non to compare in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “oh my god!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! luxury”
Reviews.Author: proudboyz
Reviews.Content: great location!!! perfect for visiting parks, rooms huge,bright airy,immmaculate on arrival,pure luxury bathroom facilities, open plan living,everything to hand, truly 1st class!!!!!!!!!!!!!! problems honestly young staff !! not helpful at all,poor very poor infact terrible coach transfers to disney parks,only 2 morning drop offs and 2 nightly drop offs and ONLY to epcot, having to give 24 hours notice to use this awful service then having to make your way to other parks from epcot. As a family with young children we were mortified when we were left stranded 1 night when the bus didnt return,thanx to epcot security we made it back!!!! staff were not at all bothered!! it definately took the shine of the lovely accomodation . The hotel needs to look for a better dedicated contractor whom can be relied upon to ferry holiday makers around even if they charged a nominal fee as we were limited to where we could go having to rely heavily on taxis which were expensive as walking in florida is just too dangerous . The bus service most definately lets the hotel down!!!! big time

Reviews.Title: “Everything the website promised”
Reviews.Author: Renee22
Reviews.Content: Our family and another stayed at Lake Buena Vista for four nights in early May. The room-really a condo-was very large. The master bedroom had a large size shower and jacuzzi-great for soaking in after a day at the park. The location was prime with Seaworld and Disney only minutes away. Not to mention the outlet shopping was a parking lot-literally 2 min.walk away. The grounds were well kept and the pool area spacious. The pirate ship was alot of fun as well. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely return if in the area. The only negative is that the rooms with a fireworks view have patios that are on the side of the highway so any time spent on the patio was not really quiet. But this would not keep me from staying there. If you are interested in a fireworks view room be sure to find out what time the fireworks are as they change nightly and my son missed them. Overall a great hotel and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: kperna1
Reviews.Content: The resort has very spacious rooms. We have stayed in the 2-bedroom and recently the 3-bedroom suites. They are clean, well layout and we have a terrific view of the fireworks. The spa at the resort is one of the cleaniest and offers many services at resonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: PrincessYaramaz
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the standard of accomodation. Good size apartments with everything you could need for a self catering holiday. The brochure only shows pictures of one large pool but there is in fact a seperate pool away from the main building which is much quiter although there is not a life guard. The Irish bar on served good food and wasnt over priced. The supermarket on site was very expensive but there is a massive Wallmart just across the road behind the second petrol station. We did walk it and got taxi back but be warned there's about 5 lanes of traffic to negotiate. We were 3 adults traveling and none of us fancied driving so we took the shuttle but to the theme parks. These leave once a day in the morning and dont keep back until at least 18:30 at night so it is a very long day especially if you have small children. We took the bus in the morning and got a taxi back when we were ready. We also took taxi's out in the evening s and visited Down Town Disney, Kissimmee and Celebration. We calculated that our use of taxi's probably mounted to the same as car hire maybe slighly less because we weren't buying fuel. So Florida w/o a car is possible. We loved the little town called Celebration. All be it very upmarket is wasnt as expensive to eat out as Down Town Disney. Seeing is believing it is all so perfect. We compared it to the film The Truman Show!

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to give this a good review.....”
Reviews.Author: horselover738
Reviews.Content: .....as the rooms were lovely. It was huge with a lovely jacuzzi tub in the bedroom & huge living space witha balcony. However the service we received from the staff was terrible. If you hae no credit card be prepared to leave a huge deposit upfront for breakages & please do not make international calls from your room-we were charged a $50 flat fee just for connection we was only on the phone for 3 minutes!! They also didnt realise we were staying for 2 weeks & on the second week we received a call at 11.30pm to say they wanted more money for the deposit-very dissapointing. We were here on our honeymoon & have to say the staff here spoilt it for us. We were in block 2 & if you are given this block you may want to ask to be moved-it backs onto the mall around the back & there are frequent trash trucks that are very noisy in the mornings-we were both woken every time as they are very noisy. The pool is good-but very cold for us would prefer it slighly heated, even in the 30degree heat! We ate at Frankie Farrells & the service was excellent, bar staff very friendly & prices not too bad. The Pizza Hut is very good also if you fancy a quick bite or something cheap & cheerful. I wouldnt stay here again unfortunately, the room was very nice though.

Reviews.Title: “housekeeping standards declining – exceeds resort suite expectations”
Reviews.Author: the_old_roadie
Reviews.Content: The architectural and transportation infrastructure of central Florida was designed for the air-conditioned auto. And - as most pilgrims on an Orlando hajj already know - you MUST have a car not only to pay homage to the post-modern shrines of American theme parks but also to stay at this “resort.” By providing an excellent hub from which to circumambulate (by car) all of the local attractions - especially Disney - and by providing above average amenities in the resort suites category, Lake Buena Vista Resort (LBVR) has proven to be an exceptional value to us. Full disclosure - one of our children has participated twice in the Disney College Program’s paid internships, and we have racked-up over 20 nights at the LBVR. Lengthy waits on-hold to book reservations are typical, but we bargain hard and ask for fees to be waived, and we stay in the 2BR/2BA Antigua suites for around a Benjamin plus tax per night and, depending on the season, sometimes we also pay a small, one-time service/housekeeping fee. (We have heard others who claim to save more by using priceline or VRBO especially for the smaller, 1BR units.) As with all things in Orlando and especially at this resort, it is wise to be prepared for over-excited and completely “knackered” families with small children - many have European accents at LBVR. While the excellent construction and insulation of the LBVR towers muffle most of the noise, the hallways and elevators always seem to have a very faint odor of baby wipes and lately have not been cleaned to the previously high standards. Unfortunately this possibly reassuring odor for some (?) is often accompanied by – at least the inference - of that which was wiped. So, despite the slightly soiled carpets (no correlation to the smell of baby wipes I hope); the noticeable decline in the previously perfect housekeeping standards of the interiors as well as the exterior grounds; the lack of a reliable shuttle; and the crazy patchwork of HDTV channels; it is unlikely that the amenities of LBVR’s suites would not please even the most jaded, 3-star pilgrim – especially with the 10-foot ceilings. All this being said though, every pilgrim should park their car for a night or two and stay at least once on-site at one of the meccas such as Portofino in the “U” (highly recommended) or at the Lodge at Disney. Once those car-free hajjs are complete – a seasoned pilgrim would be wise to consider LBVR and their car.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartments, great location can't recommend enough!”
Reviews.Author: anell03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband,11yr old son and 20 month old daughter. The apartment was very large and well equipped. Love the Jacuzzi bath it was big enough for all four of us. Both the pools were great, (poolside towels like hand towels though so we took are own down) Just over 5 min and your at down town Disney. We have been to Disney before but stayed on international drive last time, but would come here again next time. Great to have so much space special with a little one instead of been stuck in small hotel room. Internet connection not very good but you can get a cable from reception for a wired connection and it’s much better. Just love this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for for the best price”
Reviews.Author: OT2K
Reviews.Content: Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa is the best choice for the Disney vacation. The rooms are clean and big, the pool is very nice, close to Disney and a lot of stores. Yes, you need a car if you stay here, but it is worth it. Even with the price of the rental car included is thousands cheaper than a small room in a 3 star Disney resort. The bedrooms are nice, the bathrooms are large, friendly staf etc. Definitely would say here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but rooms were not well kept”
Reviews.Author: cyoung131
Reviews.Content: We just went for a 5 day stay with our 5 year-old and my 78 year-old mother. The location is perfect, being minutes to all the Disney properties and Downtown Disney, along with a Walmart and a Publix only minutes away. The problem is the first room had lights that didn't work, dresser drawers missing knobs and not opening, along with minimal towels in each room. We switched rooms and the 2nd Master Suite had a king size bed that was against a wall, which meant you had to slide out of the bed to get up. The pirate ship in the pool with the slide is great and the kids will love it. It disappointing in the lack of care given each room. Overall, great pool, great location, great rate for what you get, but rooms need to be maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: SnuffleBugg
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at LBV Resort two times. The property is beautiful, clean and well maintained. The room is comfortable, spacious and clean. However, their customer service is horrible. The check-in staff is rude and not helpful. We needed the manager once and he was also not helpful and was not friendly. Other staff that we've encountered at the pool, luau bar and other places throughout the resort have all been been unfriendly. No one seems happy to be there. That is a major turn off to me. How can you feel happy and enjoy your stay when all the staff seems unhappy and rude?? I will not stay here again simply for customer service - I want to stay somewhere where people look genuinely happy to see you and to be working there. I recommend the Disney resorts where they go above and beyond making you happy and being friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.....great property”
Reviews.Author: IS3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on May 4th, 2010 on our way for a Disney cruise out of Port Canaveral. We chose this property because of the pool with the slide and pirate ship and quality of the rooms. The rooms was huge and very clean. The grounds were well kept and the pool and bar were great additions to an already wonderful place. It was only a mile or 2 to Downtown Disney. When we go back to Disney I think we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: goaliechick1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa. There were 4 adults and 2 - 17 year olds. We had a 3 bedroom/2 bath suite & it was more than we expected. The villa was clean & spacious. We stayed in Bldg. 2, 8th floor which overlooked the smaller pool. We could see the fireworks from Epcot & Magic Kingdom from our patio which was cool. The pool was relaxing with more than enough chairs. Some have mentioned that around 5:00 it got chilly by the pool with the sun going behind the buildings but it was so darn hot when we were there that it wasn't a problem. We did go over to the main pool which was fun. It has a pirate ship with slides for the kids & there's an outdoor bar. Drinks are on the expensive side but heck, you're on vacation! We went to Walmart which was conveniently down the street & picked up breakfast stuff, snacks and stuff to make sandwiches to bring into the parks. There's outlet shopping right behind the hotel. Check in was fast & efficient. For $30.00 extra we checked in early, at noon, & checked out late (4:00) which was another $30.00. The only con I can think of is that the sheets didn't fit on either king size beds however the beds were comfortable. There's also a washer/dryer which was convenient to do some laundry (ie. towels) We didn't have housekeeping. The hotel is within 15 minutes from all parks & about 20 minutes from Universal/Islands of Adventure. We will DEFINITELY stay there again for a family trip without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Totally AWESOME, everything we needed!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gobstoper27
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed May 4th-10th and we couldn't have been happier with our choice. We booked with confidence but after reading reviews a few weeks before our trip we were a bit nervous. We googled the GPS directions and found the property with no problems. Check-In took less than 5 minutes. The only issue was that the main building was hard to pick out from the 5 buildings. There was ton of parking plus a covered parking garage. The room was ENORMOUS. We weren't expecting a two bedroom suite with 3 beds, 2 bathrooms and 3 tv's. It was awesome. The only complaint about the room was that it wasn't super clean. There were several stray hairs located throughout the room ( shower, floor) and the drain in the one shower didn't drain very well. We never heard our neighbors ever, and the elevators were always fast. We didnt use the housekeeping service but we did buy some cleaning spray from the Wal-Mart down the street. The property was well landscaped and maintained. The pools were nice but it was always freezing in the larger pool because the large buildings blocked the sun. The outlet next door was decent and the on-site convienent store was handy but a bit pricey. All in all our stay was great and we will be staying the next time we visit Orlando. A major plus was the Disney parks were 10 minutes away and Downtown Disney was about 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa - Great Place Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: CobaltFamily
Reviews.Content: During my most recent visit to Orlando we (family of 4) decided to say off Disney property. This was a big change for us from previous vacations where we have always been a fan of staying at Disney and taking their transportation around. We couldn't have been more pleased with our decision. I searched around and found the Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa on Travelocity and booked a 2 bedroom suite for pennies compared to a standard Disney room. The hotel is brand new and minutes from Disney and Sea World, and a quick drive to Universal. With the savings on the room we rented a car this time to get around, the hotel was a 15-20 min drive from the airport. Upon arrival at the hotel front desk person offered us a room upgrade for $20 a night to the 3 bedroom which we took... we have 2 teenage boys and this way they each got their own room. The room has a full kitchen and tons of space and i mean TONS, the room was the size of a small house. The hotel has a pool with a pirate ship and bar, restaurants and walking to the adjacent mall. Having the car this time we took the opportunity to venture outside of Disney this time which the boys loved, spending a day each at Universal and Sea World. We also saved a ton of money not eating only on Disney property, we inquired at the desk where to eat and the staff couldn't have been more helpful giving us close places with good food and reasonable prices. The food outside of Disney is much better and the service was much better. I can not tell you the number of lackluster dining experiences we have had in the recent years eating at Disney restaurants. We also saved time diving ourselves around not waiting around for buses, boats and monorails.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms/apartments close enough to the action but equally peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: ordbasedfltattn
Reviews.Content: I had an extended stay as I was attending to family business surrounding a recent death in the family. The staff were all very accomodating, the rooms were HUGE and i like that the complex was close to the attractions but far enough away that you could catch your breath. I found it very handy actually to downtown and other areas of the city due to its proximity to the express ways. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Key Location”
Reviews.Author: joeb728
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was recommended to me by a friend and with good reason....My experience was great from check in to check out....I felt like i was right at home, given the condo style, 3 bedrooms/full kitchen/dining area/living room/tv's in every room/large balcony/washer/dryer/2 bathrooms (def a plus having more than 1, the way my family utilizes them...)... The pool area is awesome...i think i had more fun than the kids on the slide!! Travel Plans bring me to the area once again in June, and i have already made arrangements to stay once again! Couldnt have found a better place from cleanliness...awesome staff....centrally located...i would def recommend this hotel to anyone who travels down to the Orlando area, as it was recommended to me...

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home...it has EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: babyhayhay
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for its proximity to Disney/Seaworld and its reasonable rates. The resort EXCEEDED our expectations by far! The staff was super friendly and check in/out was a snap with no wait! The rooms were gorgeous with exquisite decor and modern appliaces. The kids LOVED having their own room with a view of the Pirate Ship pool! The pool is fantastic-clean, warm, huge and a ton of fun! The icing on the cake...after a very looong day walking around the parks, the room had a jacuzzi hottub. I would ABSOLUTELY stay here again and have already reccommended it to some family and friends heading to Orlando this summer!

Reviews.Title: “I stay here everytime I'm in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: tm77rr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel at least a half dozen times, and I am always tremendously pleased with the accommodations. The front desk staff is courteous and helpful. The rooms are always immaculately clean and completely stocked with every appliance and piece of tableware that you could possibly need. The rooms feature flat screen TVs, a jacuzzi tub, a shower big enough for at least 5 people haha, comfy beds, ceiling fans, a living room/dining room area, a full kitchen, and a washer/dryer in unit. It's all the comforts of home (plus more!) while away on vacation. There's a great pool on site with plenty of lounge chairs and towels. It also includes a life-size pirate ship with water slides for the kids. I've been to the pool several times and was always able to find a comfortable spot in the sun, despite the presence of many families. In suite, you can order room service from the pub on premises or delivery from Pizza Hut. Finally, there's an outlet mall conveniently located next door where you can buy anything you could possibly needs, including cheap Disney merchandise. I will continue to use the Resort as my home away from home when I'm in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Wowed at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsch378925
Reviews.Content: I got in late after a softball game in Orlando and was checked in promptly. I was tired I got the keys from the guy and check in he was a very nice guy. Then I went to park went to the room opened the door and WOW what a beautiful room. There was two bed two bath suite darn it was great to use the Jacuzzi tub in the master site. That is the nicest hotel I stayed in. Orlando has a great place in Lake Buena Vista Resort and spa. It’s got more than my house has in it lol.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accomodations”
Reviews.Author: cjhagberg
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove up, to the moment I was dragged out, I loved this place. The rooms were magnificent and of incredible value. The FASTEST elevators I have ever seen in my life. The grounds were beautiful. The staff was incredibly accomodating. I had no idea what I was getting into, but will stay here every time I come to Orlando. Family friendly and so much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: dgbLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter with our grandchildren and their parents. Our grandchildren are age 8 and 6 and it was an ideal venue for them as it is a short easy drive to the Disney Parks and Sea World has two good pools and Walmart is five minutes down the road. My only critisism is in respect of their address. Our travel agent gave the address as 8112 Ponciana Blvd which the Sat Nav did not recognise. When we eventually arrived at the hotel we found they also gave two further addresses which were 15657 South Apopka Vineland Road and 15591 South Apopka Vineland Road and I have also found another address which is 8113 Resort Village Drive.

Reviews.Title: “A Super Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: jmj504
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Lake Buena Vista. Our room was super clean and the kids loved the pool. We will definitely stay here again on out next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “This place is worth your business!”
Reviews.Author: lisabordis
Reviews.Content: My family and I just spent the last 6 days at this resort. We were very happy with everything from the entrance, employees, room, and pool. Its close to the attractions, and has a huge shopping plaza within walking distance. The suite is clean, big, and has everything you need to enjoy your stay! They even provide, laundry soap, and dishwashing soap! Check this place out!

Reviews.Title: “Please don’t trust this hotel for your vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Fcream
Reviews.Content: I reserve from 6 month at advance to stay in the hotel. I never receive a confirmation e-mail. When I call 1 month before my vacation called the hotel and they told that the reservation is okay. The day I arrive to the hotel (after a 4 hours car trip from Miami) they told me that they had water problem and I cannot stay in the hotel. The give me a Google printed map of another hotel and told me that the other hotel is not far away and it is the same type of hotel. When I arrive to the hotel I was shocked and it was in center of now ware. And the front desk told us that what they told us about water problem was BS. They just are over booked. Please don’t trust this hotel for your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome in EVERY way”
Reviews.Author: tastethevino
Reviews.Content: This resort was absolutely awesome!! Clean, friendly and every ammenity possible. The pirate ship pool was an absolute hit with our 2 school age children!! They actually had more fun at the pool than at Disney!! The Frankie Ferrels Irish Pub was terrific food for an amazing price!! The poolside Tiki bar was wonderful and fun!! The onsite convenience store has everything you need, in addition there is a Walmart not even a half mile away. The free shuttles to the park were convenient and the drivers excellent!! The rooms were spacious, comfortable bedding and wonderful bathrooms!! The kitchen has everything you need to accomodate cooking and entertaining. Also the large veranda decks are furnished and comfortable for outside eating!! We will absolutely stay again!!! There is another quiter pool in addition to the pirate pool!! We did not utilize the spa this time but absolutely would in the future. Also should you need anything or want to spend an afternoon shopping the outlet mall is a few steps away!!! The covered parking is also convenient in the situation of rain!!

Reviews.Title: “4 day 4 bedroom stay”
Reviews.Author: ROsa50-10
Reviews.Content: Location hard to find...need to have the correct address for using GPS system. Condo was large but needs new carpet because it was very dirty, and the walls need a good painting too. Stayed in Building One on the 8th floor. Beds need new mattresses and most of the chairs and sofa are in need of replacement as well. Bathrooms were fine and kitchen well equiped with just about everything you need for your stay.Washer and dryer worked fine. O'farrels' Pub and Grill was good and very nice to have so close and easy to get into. I would recommend that you stay in one of the newer buildings until the older condos are shapped up and put into better condition

Reviews.Title: “Need to create own identity”
Reviews.Author: Integritydad
Reviews.Content: We read all of the reviews available to us prior to booking this property for our week-long vacation. There were 8 of us from our family traveling together and needed to find a suite that could accomodate us. We were thrilled to find the 4-bedroom Grand Bahama available and affordable for our trip. The on-line reservation process was a bit "clunky" but manageable. Upon our arrival and check-in we were informed that the 4-bedroom unit that we had reserved was not available and that we would would have to stay in (2) two bedroom units for the night. We were told that there had been a plumbing problem as the reason why it was not available yet while we were waiting to speak with a manager overheard another associate on the phone telling someone that they were overbooked. We called the front desk the next morning to check on the timing of our move to the correct room and was told it would be after 4:00pm. I left my cell phone number with the associate and was assured they would call when it was ready. At 4:30 we still hadn't received a call so I went to the front desk. This time we were told it would be after 5:00pm. Finally at 6:00pm and another visit to the front desk we were given our keys. No offer to help move our luggage was made even though we were moved to a new building on the 15th floor. While the suite was large the furnishings were "cheap". Beds were not comfortable, linens and bedding were thin. Coffee table had legs that were broken and propped back in place and only wired internet service in rooms. Wireless only available in area of the lobby. The balcony area was nice as we spent many nights having a drink taking in the sights. The on-site convenience store has just about everything but you pay for it. The Pizza Hut Express was quick but the food below average. The game room was decent as our younger family members used it a lot. The Irish Pub on-site was neat to visit however the food is average at best. The pool side bar makes decent drinks with an average price of $10.00 each and the Pirates Pool was nicely done again very attractive for the younger kids in our group. In closing it is my opinion that this property needs to decide what they are/want to be. It is hard to be both a time share / for-sale condo property and also be a world class resort.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect Resort for Families with Children”
Reviews.Author: mousey10
Reviews.Content: Thr apartments in the hotel are absolutely beautifuland huge, with all the facilities of a home. Ours had three bedrooms. The main ensuite had a jacuzzi bath and a separate shower. The Apartments have a living room area and a dining room area, with a washing machine and dryer. There is a balcony looking over the swimming pool. A welcome pack is provided. We went home with no dirty washing. There seemed to be a slight problem with rubbish being picked up from outside the room but this is nitpicking. Downstairs there is a very friendly supermarket with a Pizza Hut takeaway in it which was very handy for the children and for the men returning from the Irish Bar, The Irish Bar is a friendly pub with good food (sausage and mash for when you get fed up of burgers). The staff in both establishments were very friendly and welcoming. There were twoswimming pools a big one with the pirate ship in and the one which was outside our apartments which was quieter. Regarding location, there is excellent parking facilities, a Walmart a few minutes down the road and everywhere is close by. There is also a small shopping mall next to the hotel but that was a bit poor. I would thoroughly recommend this establishment, I didn't want to leave the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that great”
Reviews.Author: fishtail86
Reviews.Content: Not the best check-in experience. We weren't allowed to check in until 4pm - which I think is rather late. Our group arrived at 2 and we not greeted too cheerfully. The front desk did not have any idea when our room would be ready. We were finally able to check in at 4:30, although we had to wait in line for 30 minutes because there was only 1 desk clerk, and she was busy handing out Disney info (even though the Concierge was sitting at another desk and available). When we got to our room, it was pretty nice, although the bathroom sink was clogged and wouldn't drain and the toilet paper holder was missing. Also there are no ice machines, so you have to turn on the ice maker in the freezer and wait several hours to have enough ice for a drink. Or you can do like we did and yell across the balcony and ask another guest if they have any ice. The pool area is nice - but beware - the food and drinks are EXPENSIVE! $8 for a glass of Sangria - and all they did was mix some Cherry goo with wine and add a couple of pieces of fruit - yuk! The food is barely edible - don't bother! Go to the wonderful Irish pub across the street instead - they have a great selection of beers and delicious food. All-in-all - it was an ok stay. I MIGHT stay again if they can get their act together at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “I would most definately stay here again :)- Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: mpfootprints
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through endless rentals, which is based in Florida, you can find it if you google on-line..We got a great rate at the time we booked, we did pre-pay and got discount, which was great and helped out in these economic times. I would use Endless rentals again. We traveled with myself and my husband and 2 teenage daughters, 17 and 15 and our almost 8 year old son. There was something for everyone to enjoy at the resort itself..Loved the pirate theme pool, spent a lot of time there..The other pool is nice too, but more quiet, there is a hot tub there as well. (but quiet can be a good thing, if you want relaxation) The Pirate Theme Pool was a lot of fun, great music, great sun deck above the bar and 3 hot tubs..The whole family enjoyed all of it. There is some snacks by the pool, which was pretty good price for being at the Resort if you wanted to..You could also go to the Walmart across the street basically and stock up on your own snacks/drinks and save $$$$...The adult drinks at the pool were very good, they had some tastey smoothies for the kids..The rooms were very clean, beds were comfy, good night sleep, we were on the 14th floor with a huge balcony overlooking the Pirate theme pool, I would request this floor in building 3 with the huge balcony overlooking the pirate theme pool if available. The kitchen was great, clean and very modern..Everything worked great..we loved the idea of the washer and dryer in the room. We were in the 2 bedroom/2bathroom room.. We really could of packed less in clothing, due to the washer/dryer..we will know next time..There are several other things on the property to do and the shopping plaza is in very close walking distance and my 2 teenager daughters enjoyed this. It is close to all the Disney Parks, if you were going to them, close to Sea World and close to Downtown Disney..A great location. I would most definately stay here again, and plan too. Be sure to view the rates/special through the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa website vs Endless Rentals website...You may get a better deal through Endless Rentals..Definately a 5 star all around experience. We Will Be Back..(I am picky with clean, and this was clean) Have a great time, hope you choose to stay here, you won't regret it :) :)

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing.........”
Reviews.Author: georgebelfast
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on tripadvisor before booking this holiday. I thought it was a relatively new hotel and that it would be freshly furnished and carefully maintained. It isn`t..and it wasn`t. I have been to Florida twice before and would have to say it was pretty average. The room was furnished with all the conveniences you would expect- cooker (one ring didnt work) dishwasher,washing machine and dryer. Large TV in Living area- but old projector type and poor picture/reception. No linen or laundry service whatsoever unless you paid extra for it. 30usd for a room clean and change of toweels/bed linen. Best attribute was the poolside area- the galleon with water chute kept my son occupied on our "chill days" away from the parks.
