We went to Clearwater for a few days and stayed at a resort by the beach -"Sandpearl" which was quite expensive but worth it and when we came back to lake Buena Vista it was a stark change in surroundings. Wouldn`t go again to this place although for someone on their first time to Orlando - probably quite passable.....

Reviews.Title: “everything was as expected!”
Reviews.Author: travalerjoe
Reviews.Content: great location to everything! My children wanted to stay at the resort rather than go to the amusement parks.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately do this one again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ttschirhart58
Reviews.Content: This resort was the total package. The suites were beautiful. Two bedrooms and two complete bath rooms. Never heard anyone else around. Totally quiet. Beds were the best. Showers were great and the jacuzzi was the bomb. This is a place I would love to live. The staff were great especially the gentleman who stayed on the phone with me at 2:00 in the morning giving me instructions when the GPS failed. He was great. Will never stay anywhere else when I'm in Florida and will recommend this to everyone who travels there.

Reviews.Title: “AWSOME PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: rollercoastermenice
Reviews.Content: Lake buena vista is a great place to stay. The restraunt and lesuire facilities where excellent. One large kids pool alright if you have small children not really for teenagers. The other pool is in between two of the buildings so sometimes was a bit shaded but was quieter than the other pool. The hotel is located minutes from disney, seaworld and about 20 mins from universial studios and I drive. the rooms very clean, well equiped and quite. Big 50 inch tv for the kids. And right across the road was lake buena vista outlets which has a lot of great shops for all the family. Only one compaint the jacuzzi tap came off and smacked my dad on the head which was very funny. Overall Lake Buena Vista resort and spa is a great place to stay and i would recomend the apartments to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: stlgrlPD
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week of March 24th, 2010. When I booked the hotel I read previous reviews and I was a little worried, but I don't know where those people stayed but this place was amazing! I had my parents and my 4-year old. We had a 3 bedroom unit that was just beautiful. I have stayed in many all-inclusive resorts and I'm thinking this is the way I'd rather go. I love the idea that you can make normal meals (and not gorge on buffets) and of course can eat when you want! The pool and hot tubs were amazing, I had trouble getting my daughter to get out for meals. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We didn't have any housekeeping, but unless you are real slobs you don't need it. And any extras you need (toilet paper, bags, etc) you can get at the front desk. We knew there was dishwasher and washer/dryer so we brought supplies as needed. Having the washer and dryer was great, less packing and it was great to wash the towels for the bathrooms when needed. The restaurant on site was really good and I'd recommend it before driving around to find something else. Just down the road there is a 7-Eleven, but I warn you DO NOT EAT AT THE CHINESE RESTAURANT that is in the plaza, over priced and the food was gross. We all felt sick later. The Walmart is very close by, you could walk but I wouldn't, there are no sidewalks and I find people do not use blinkers down there. There's a guy that sells fruit and GATOR jerky under the bridge, don't get ripped off like us, I swear it was from the dollar store. I would come back to this hotel in a second, I have nothing bad to say about it, one of the best vacations I've ever had!!!! If I could bring any keepsake back from Orlando, it would be that condo! Oh and keep an eye out at night for the armadillo's they are hunting up supper on the grounds, they are hilarious to watch!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cookie075
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March of 2010. The place was a great value! Rooms were clean and very nice. We had a two bedroom suite in building number 5. Our kids' room said that it had twin beds, but they seemed either oversized twins or full sized to me. They had a bathroom with a tub/shower next to their room. The master suite had a jet tub and a large walk in shower and double sink vanity. All furniture was nice and well kept up. It also had an apartment size washer and dryer off the kitchen and a balcony with a table and 4 chairs. It was great for saving money eating in with the kitchen too. We asked to be able to see the fireworks from Disney at night from our balcony, and they were great at accomodating us. Staff were very friendly and even held doors for you if they were around. The pool with the pirate ship is huge and heated. It was also open until 10:00 which was nice. Some hotels had earlier pool hours, and it is nice to come back from the parks at night and be able to swim. I thought for how beautiful and nice the rooms were, it was a great value. However, it is no frills as far as housekeeping. You have to pay to have a midweek room service, but it is available. Also, we stayed a week, and they gave us 2 extra garbage bags, 4 rolls of toilet paper and 3 packets of dishwasher detergent. There was no laundry detergent. and no shampoo. You will need to buy more of those things if you need them. Maybe they would supply them midweek if you ask, we just bought our own. Wal-Mart is very close by and not at all hard to get to. The hotel was easy to get to and only about 20 minutes from the airport. It is right behind a factory outlet center and the entrance sign had their name on it. I saw one review that said it was hard to get to, and that is just crazy! It is close to all the Disney attractions and about 15-20 minutes from Universal. There are also eating places all over in the area and a restaurant next to the hotel, The store they advertise is VERY expensive as is the bar by the pool. It was $5 for a beer by the pool. They ask that you don't bring in outside food and drinks by the pool, but I saw people doing it without being stopped. The configuration of the pool near the tall buildings also makes the pirate ship pool have shade by 5:00 or so in March. I'm sure in the summer that is a great thing though! It was also a nonsmoking hotel, but they allowed smoking by the pool. I didn't care for that, but I'm sure smokers appreciated it. If you have young children, you need to watch them because it is a zero depth entry with lots of space for the little ones and water umbrellas, but it is not roped off where the pool starts to get deeper. All in all, the great things about the hotel outweighed any negatives. It is a great value, with great staff and very nice,comfortable clean suites. I would recommend staying there, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: par1022
Reviews.Content: My family of myself, my husband, my 25-year-old son, 20-year-old daughter and their girlfriend and boyfriend thought our room was beautiful. It was exactly as described on the website, and we are always a little leary about booking a room site-unseen. We were not dissapointed. There was plenty of room, and everything we needed. We washed our own towels and sheets because we didn't feel the need to spend the extra money on this cleaning service, so it was nice to have a washer an dryer right in our room. Just a tip: rent a car, since it is about 20 minutes from any of the major attractions, and a large chunk of our spending money was used on taxis. Loved it there though!

Reviews.Title: “Great value but suite was not clean”
Reviews.Author: Karen534
Reviews.Content: For a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit the price was very reasonable. But the suite was not clean and when we ordered a mid-stay cleaning they came on the wrong day and didn't wash the floors. Granted the front desk refunded the cleaning fee. Location is great for Disney World but bus service to the theme parks is not as good as other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: RJBOOK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week at resort with our 2 children. The unit itself was so spacious ( 2 bdr/2 bth) large kitchen/living area. Great balcony overlooking pool/pirate ship area.. Our unit was very clean, very equipped with kitchen supplies/laundry soap..Plenty of towls. Beds are comfy and bedding decent. Pool area was clean and pool was heated and quite comfy. Always adequate parking ( undergroud/outside) There is a little variety store in unit w a Pizza Hut which was very handy for kids..The Irish pub on site was just ok..Restaurant/bar area by pool had great drinks/snacks-not cheap but certainly convenient. Pricing for this resort was very reasonable and the proximity to Disney was great..Lots of restaurant choices near by including a great outlet mall < 5 miles away..When staying in Disney would return to Lake Buena Vista for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Home Base in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TravelMikeCo
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this property and cannot say enough about it. 1. Price:amazing value. We would have spent 2-3 times as much to stay on Disney property without having all the benefits we found in the LBV resort/spa. For the cost of a night at an average Orlando hotel we had a 2 bedroom condo 2. Accomodations: Very spacious 2 BR condo with nice sized kitchen and dining area. The two full baths were great for a family with one male (me) and 3 girls and my wife. Tons of space, we were never in each other's way which usually happens at your average hotel. Very Clean. Full size fridge, stove, oven. 3. Service: This may be the only place that is sub optimal. There is typically only one (sometimes two) front desk attendants. There are 4 buildings full of people and the front desk people are constantly over worked. They were always pleasant with me, but could be short with guests at times. Other than that, however, I thought everyone at the property from the maintenance to the front desk and especially Bob (the bartender at the pool) were very nice, efficient, and eager to please. 3. Cleaning: There is no cleaning included with the room rate. Room cleaning and towel service are available for a charge at your request. Change of towels $5, Towels/vacuum/trash $10 and Full Clean I think $30. 4. Pool- Great 5-restaurant- Frankie Farrells- good food, pricey...but what isn't in Orlando. 6. Location- Easy to get to from the airport (about 15-20min) and great location for Disney. A short car ride to all the parks as well as Sea World/International Drive. You need a car as there is not any real efficient shuttle or public transportation from this area. Orlando is notoriously hard to navigate due to numerous numbered highways which don't run north/south/east/west. Get a good map. Also, tons of tolls throughout Orlando so make sure you have cash and some change when you leave the airport on one of the toll roads. 7.Parking- Not good. Limited lot space near the entrance and some street parking but often had to park behind the hotel and for some reason you cannot enter from that side...so you have to walk all the way around to the front. 8. Internet- free wired internet in the rooms and wi-fi in the lobby and pool area. Overall, I would highly recommend it for a family traveling to Orlando. Admittedly, it is not the Ritz but it was very quiet, comfortable, great location, and everything we wanted for a great price that we would normally pay for one small hotel room

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: TeeHouston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a great place in Cape Coral prior to arriving here so this was a bit of a let down. It's okay, not great. I've stayed in better places in Orlando for the price. The location is a bit of a pain to get to. Check in was fast, check out not so much. My husband was arguing with the front desk about a bar charge until they realized they had the wrong room. Note in the room telling you how much the towels, coffee maker etc. will cost should you take them. That's tacky and made me wonder about the type of clientele they have. On the upside, the pool area is fun for kids and the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Overall A Good Hotel to stay while in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Warmplacelover
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very large (like apartments instead of just your average hotel room) they do provide plates and such in the kitchen. Bring dishwasher detergent or dish soap. Also, they didn't have any rags/washclothes to clean the dishes with so bring that as well. The beds are pretty comfortable as far as hotels go and the room seemed clean enough. If you wear white socks you will notice that it isn't the case though. The pool is large which is good because the complex includes five buildings, two of which are 15 stories and 3 are around eight. We went during Canadian March break and there were many people there, mostly Canadian. The week we went it was extremely cold for Florida and very windy at the hotel, maybe because of the two towers being so close together and the air had no where to travel. The shuttle to the parks...MAKE SURE YOU MAKE A RESERVATION! You have to make hte reservation a day in advance and must tell the front desk which time (if you are going to Disney) Something like 8:15 or 10:45. Sea world and Universal were about 9:30. The Disney shuttle goes to Epcot. We went to the Magic Kingdom and had to take two different monerails, wait in two different lines and get our bags checked twice to do so. A pain, and about an hour from the time you get dropped off by the shuttle to the time you get to the entrance of Magic Kindgom. If you are going to Hollywood Studios or Animal Kingdom I would imagine there would be a bus there, I'm not sure though. The front desk staff is understaffed at all times. If you call the front desk from your room it takes minutes for them to answer. They are friendly and provide a good service yes, I just wish there were more of them. Didn't use the spa but prices seemed comparable to many others in that area and even back home in Canada. There is a WalMart just down the street and a Publix up International drive (10 mins). All the restaurants you would ever want to eat at are within 15 mins. 20 to Universal, 15 to Sea World and 15 to Disney. The outlet mall beside the hotel is not as large or has the same calibre of stores as the Premium outlets and Prime outlets both off of I-4 , 15-20 mins away. But they give you a coupon book at check in and we found that this mall had the best deals. We bought our Disney tickets at WalMart so we wouldn't have to wait in line at the park...it was about 40 cents more expensive but worth it since you didn't have to wait. They have a little booth within the Disney clothes in the middle of the store. If you wish to be close to the pirate ship pool, ask for Building 3 or 5. There is a small pool, more for adults between buildings 1 and 2 if you wish to use that. There is a gym and a convienence store in building 1 along with a Pub which we did not attend to. All in all, the hotel was good as was the vacation. The rooms are fantastic and the location is pretty good. Bring a bottle of Lysol wipes to wipe everything down if you feel more comfortable. Oh, and housekeeping daily costs 40 dollars. We opted out of that.

Reviews.Title: “short vacation in orlando, fl with three teenagers”
Reviews.Author: rubymrv
Reviews.Content: We arrived late Wednesday and had to leave by Saturday. Front desk seemed a little overwhelmed at times but they always were helpful and accomodating when you brought a problem to their attention. Nice roomy two bedroom/two bath unit. Could have more cooking/eating supplies--didn't have any wine glasses or even a bottle opener. But other than that was a great price and the location was perfect for getting to and from the airport and getting to the Disney parks. There free shuttle from the hotel was not scheduled at convenient times so we drove and that worked out fine.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: Canadian4u
Reviews.Content: Dirty dirty dirty. - carpets dirty, stained, and worn. My daughter wore white socks and the soles were black after walking around without her shoes. - the sofa was all tattered -one of the hand towels provided had small pinkish stains on it (like blood from a shaving nick?). The bath towel was visibly dirty with grey stains on it. - the tiled floors in the bathroom had dirt smears on it - the room smelled stale and musty - the rooms were dusty - especially the sliding door and vent areas - the kitchen was sorely lacking in supplies - the furniture was chipped and scratched - there is no DVD player in the room. You can rent on for $10/day if there is one available (which there wasn't) -the bedding is paper thin (you can see through them) and we were concerned about bedbugs! - the pool was small and cold even though they claimed it was heated. No lifeguard. We complained about the state of our room and were moved from building 1 (older) to building 3 which wasn't much better. If you stay in building 5 it is newer and might be better. I could go on but I think you get the idea. It would be more accurately listed as a 2+ or 3- star... certainly not a resort nor a spa.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* but still nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: RoKoKoFromBC
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from Two weeks at the Lake Buena Visa Resort & Spa. I think the name is somewhat deceiving. This 'Resort' would be better named as an apartment or condo. There was nothing 'resort' or 'spa' aout it. We had a 3 bedroom/ 2 bath unit for 4 adults & 4 kids. Our unit was very spacious and the bathrooms were in very good condition. No mold & all appliances were newer and worked without problems. The kitchen had only basics (no serving spoons or vegetable peeler etc). It was fine for fixing breakfast and snacks or cold meals but I wouldn't want to prepare an actual dinner. There is not daily housekeeping unless you pay for and book it in advance which could be the reason things are starting to look a little 'tired'. The carpets & furniture need a good cleaning although they were in pretty good shape other than being soiled. When we arrived we had only one roll of toilet paper in each bathroom and one roll of paper towel in the dispenser in the kitchen. There was NO dishclothes or kitchen towels and not a cleaning product in sight to wipe down the kitchen table or counters. The hallway and unit had a bit of an odour but we got used to it. The pool area was very nice. The location was very good (10-20 minutes from all parks & downtown Disney) But not much for good restaurants close by. Walmart 5 minutes away. I wouldn't want to be without a car if I was staying for longer than a week. (although Hotel wasn't very busy and the parking lot seemed full every night) Front staff not bad but not great. Had an issue with a party in the unit next to us. Had to call front desk several times which was of no help. Using the tub for an ice bath for beer in adjoining bedroom followed by drunk person barfing in tub made for LONG night. Could hear word for word conversations in unit next door although some noise to be expected. The biggest issue we had was the Bedding & pillows. This may seem minor in print, but believe me we are talking MOTELl 6 quality!! NASTY! The bedspreads STUNK (don't think they have ever been washed), The sheets were paper thin and a bit grungy and the pillows were so flat you may as well not have used one. At the end of our stay my sister reminded me that someone on trip advisor suggested going to Walmart and picking up a comforter and I couldn't agree more! If this 'resort' changed the linens including towels (which we saw housekeeping folding on the hallway floor!) I would give them a 4.5 stars. But after 14 days of dreading crawling into bed, I give it a 3 star. If you have already booked your trip, don't panic but bring your own bedding & a few cleaning products and you'll be fine. We had a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately come back!”
Reviews.Author: Kemoswife
Reviews.Content: We didn't arrive at our hotel until 1:30am, so it was a little confusing trying to figure out which building was the main building in the dark. After driving around for awhile, my husband finally stopped and went into one of the buildings. Luckily, it was the correct one. We made our way to our condo and we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed in Building 5 and it was clean and quiet. We had two separate bedrooms and bathrooms, newer appliances in the kitchen, even a garburator! Having a full kitchen meant we could easily go to Walmart (less than 1 mile away) or Publix for some groceries. We saved a lot of money by not going out to restaurants for breakfast & supper. (The cost of food & drinks at the theme parks was expensive, so we usually packed snacks & water bottles every day too). We found the location was great since we were only 10-20 minutes away from Disney, Seaworld and Universal Studios. We were also able to watch the Disney fireworks from our balcony every night. The only complaint we had was that our kitchen didn't come with dishcloths or teatowels, so we ended up using facecloths & towels to wash the dishes. Having a washer & dryer in the room was wonderful. I didn't come home with piles of dirty laundry!We would definately come back and stay in the exact same location. Our condo was close to the pool and our kids loved watching the fireworks every night.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap pillows and beds that are hard as a floor!”
Reviews.Author: candyopals
Reviews.Content: This place would be nice if they didn't ruin it with their cheap, hard beds and pillows. We didnt sleep all night! You would think that a place that has SPA in their name would have better quality mattresses and pillows!

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: golfmannewjersey
Reviews.Content: This was very dissapointing since my expectations were so high. Two main faults were the room had a smell when you walked in that was not very pleasant. The one bathroom had a shower over tub that was clogged so that everytime you took a shower the tub would keep filling up and you would be up to your knees in water trying to shower. The one thing that bother us the most was that nothing was done by the management to correct the poblem. Four phone calls and all they kept saying was they would send someone up and never did. There was a complete lack of respect for us as customers and that is would made the situation really really bothersome. The treatment we received by the management was awful and based on that would never go back. When letting them know that they could care less.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant visit”
Reviews.Author: Spottedgurl
Reviews.Content: For young couples planning to stay somewhere quiet and away from all the Disney excitement and Orlando nightlife this is the location. My husband and I took a taxi from the airport to the suites $55, after checking in we were told no towels were provided for the pool. How silly of us to fly across the country and not pack towels items which hotels frequently supply. We were jetlagged, hungry and without a vehicle, our only food options were pizza hut and the Irish Pub. The only good that came from our stay was the free shuttle to Disney Epcot and the Jacuzzi in our room. I was unhappy with the lack of close dinning options, no hotel bar or coffee service and the layout of the hotel. There was no daily room service,no complimentary breakfast, finally the spa services were overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable....will stay again”
Reviews.Author: kokosy
Reviews.Content: Just came back and really enjoyed our stay there. Though the weather did not cooperate with us, we still used the hot tub and the pool was heated . Temp then was in 40's to 50's. Used their free shuttles to the theme parks and they were on time. Very convenient place to stay at...Sam's Club , Target, Walmart Supercenter (open 24 hours) were nearby. Walmart was a lifesaver for us, cause I was able to buy meds(OTC) for a sick traveler at 1:30 AM. Shopping was just behind us, although we didn't go there bec of lack of time. If opting to go to the theme parks with your own transportation, they're closeby too, although I don't know why you wouldn't use their free shuttle (included in the resort fee). There's no doubt in my mind, that I will opt to go back there, on my next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “It can be hard to find a romantic place in Orlando without spending a ton of money, but this place was a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: no1fromnowhere
Reviews.Content: The staff was great & upgraded us since they had empty rooms even though it was President's Day weekend. We had a 2 bedroom suite for just the two of us, but it would have been great for a bigger group as well. We loved the jacizzi tub, especially the changing colored lights. Would definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great staff; very nice suite”
Reviews.Author: auburnlake
Reviews.Content: did top-notch job for our organization's 4 day conference (@140 people). rooms (at least my suite) great. maidservice very good. all staff helpful. takes a long tiome to get from pint A to point B in hotel - especially if staying on the resort island portion.

Reviews.Title: “great experience!”
Reviews.Author: AnaS11
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed the service, the location is great and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read and Don't go during Mid Winter Break”
Reviews.Author: allyNDAlive
Reviews.Content: Well this was our first trip as to Orlando to Disney World and it was our 7 year old daugther's birthday present surprise. First I would like to say IF the week we went was not the busiest of the year we may have had a better time. Do not go during Mid winter break February 10 - 25. Unless you like standing in lines for hours and not having any options for food. Of course the weather was 40 degrees on a good day so it was not that good of weather either. Sunny but cold. But we tried to make the best of it. Also if you do plan to go during a busy week MAKE RESERVATIONS for meals inside the parks. All restaurants during this week were fully booked for both lunch and dinner. They took no walk ins so you were relegated to standing in line for 30 minutes to get a pretzel, popcorn and water or soda. We were not aware this would be an issue until we were there. And if you don't stay in a Disney Resort the concierge can not help you book as Disney wants only their facilities to book for you. The Hotel/Condo was only $129 per night for a two bedroom complete with washer and dryer and full kitchen. I had called ahead and spoke with the conceirge about shopping in the area for groceries. She stated we could walk to Walmart just across the street. They also stated on the website and when I called they had daily shuttles to Disney World and other parks in the area. Walmart is about 1.5 miles down the 6 lanes of traffic with no sidewalk or cross walks. You would need to get a cab if you were going to go there. There is a very expensive little store in the condo complex that is very over priced. A crappybottle of wine was about $20 but by the end of the week you were willing to pay that price. They have a little bit of everthing there but again very pricey. The Shuttles: You must be at the lobby by 8 am to catch the only shuttle to the Disney area and 9:40 for the Universal Studios area. There are not other runs in the morning. You must make your reservation for this shuttle by 9 PM the night before or you are out of luck. The only return options are 6:15 OR 10:20 and you must indicate which you will take upon boarding for the morning shuttle. You may not change your decision unless you call ahead of time during the day and at that point it will depend if there are any open seats. However, please keep in mind you are NOT dropped off at the entrance to any park. You are dropped off at the "Transportation and Guest Services" area. From there you must take a monorail, bus or ferry to the parks. So by the time you get there you are ready for lunch. When you return most of the parades are over by 9 PM so you have an hour and a half waiting in the "Transportation and Guest Services" parking lot. By the second day we went with taxi cabs. About $25 per trip for three people one way. The rooms were less than comfortable. The king bed is a very bad mattress with very cheap and shoddy bedding. We had to keep getting up through out the night to fix the fitted sheets as they kept coming off of the bed. The mattress cover was very thin and really was a sorry excuse for a mattress cover. Our sinks were slow draining and never got fixed. We had asked for the sinks to be dealt with and the lock to the door that you swing over on the inside was broken and also was never fixed depsite repeated requests to do so. The couch needed to be replaced. It was soiled with apparent body sweat and was very worn in the middle. There was food along the halls through out the complex that stayed there the entire time we stayed. 7 days. The trash cans through out the complex were very full daily. You must pay for extra housekeeping if you want daily service or new linens or towels. There was also a very strong smell of baby powder an apparent "cover up" of the old smokey smell as they do allow smokers and charge them $250 so you get to have that aroma each time you walk out of your room or elevator. The only restuarant is "Frankie Farrells" which is just next door to the complex. Very good French Onion soup, Shepherds Pie, Fish and chips, Hot Wings. Definetly the high light of the week to have someone actually care about your needs. Very affordable if you have a big family and just need a bed for sleeping. Even with the $50 a day for transportation it still came out to less than $200 a night for a two bedroom / 2 bth with a sleeper sofa condo as compared to one of the Disney Resorts that are just a room with two beds and no cooking options or washer and dryer. The resorts come out to anywhere between $300 and $500 a night. The master suite has a king bed and the other bedroom has two full beds and then the sleeper. The only thing I can say is it would have been nice not to have to think about transportation daily and a perk to staying in the resort is the early admission to the parks. Most lines this week were 60 - 140 minutes of wait time. Lots of strollers and scooters so be patient. Next time we are going on a cruise. I hear the Disney Cruises are great for families and focus on parents getting some time away from it all and keeping the kids occupied every minute. Good luck to you!

Reviews.Title: “...And the Winner is.....YOU!!”
Reviews.Author: Ennisgirl1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our 2 children aged 3 & 10. The two-bed apartments were fantastic - couldn't believe that it was so good and spacious for the price we paid which was €990 for 10 nights. The apartments are spacious, perfectly clean, well located and both bedrooms had huge flat screen tv's as well as one in the living area. The kitchen was exceptionally well stocked and having a washing machine and drier was fantastic as it allowed to us bring less luggage. The location we found to be great. We had a rental car which I think is necessary anywhere in the USA. You are a 5-10 min drive to the Disney parks and it is easy to access every other area. It is a quiet location at night which is great for a family with young kids and there is a shopping mall on the property which is great for the ladies. The complex has a store, bar, beauty salon and two pools one with a huge pirate ship with a slide through it, a gym and games room. One thing which is not the fault of the hotel but the booking agent hotelopia. On arrival which was at midnight I was informed that the hotel had been told my booking was cancelled at my request. He let me use the phone to contact Hotelopia and the agent was very rude and kept screaming down the phone that I cancelled the booking giving the time of my "request" as being the time I was at 30,000ft over the ocean on the plane. I was close to tears I was that angry with her and so tired so I slammed the phone down on her.n The guy on reception was very good and gave us the apartment and told us to get the kids into bed, have a good nights sleep and he would have everything sorted by the morning. When I came down to the desk next morning he indeed had everything sorted out and was apologising profusely for the mix up and advised he had complained to the agents manager who also apologised. A month after the holiday when the credit card statement arrived I had been billed $250 even though the stay was fully paid in advance. I called the hotel to find out why and the manager couldn't have been nicer. Again he sorted everyting and I was refunded immediately. Turned out hotelopia told the hotel in error that I owed the $250 and so their accounting people billed me. The great thing was that Alan, the manager, acknowledged the drop in the exchange rate between the dollar/euro in the month since the holiday and refunded me at the higher rate. This was great because the €250 refundable deposit we had to put on the rental car was refunded at the lesser rate. So this was a sure sign that the hotel treated me more than fairly. So the moral of the story is this place is fantastic but book through anyone except hotelopia.

Reviews.Title: “stayed in 09, ging back 2010 with another set of grandkids.”
Reviews.Author: mimi_linna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two of our children and spouses, 3 grand kids ages 7 months/ 3 yrs/4yrs in a three bedroom unit. two masters and a bedroom with two twin.. mimi and papa scott got this room. The couch folded down and two grandkids slept there. We had a ball. lots of room, washer and dryer in unit. went to walmart and bought food. We are staying there again in March with another son and his family. ages 5 and 3. Disneyworld here we come.. again. we did not get daily housekeeping, but got towels as we needed new ones. not a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: mjc01
Reviews.Content: 2 families with 4 young children stayed on the 15th floor of Bldg. 5 for one week in a 4 bedroom suite. FYI they do not have daily housekeeping service unless you pay extra. Pros: Very spacious (good for our toddlers to run around), basically clean, good price Cons: Building and furniture a bit worn down, problems with key card not working (inconvenient especially having to go all the way to the next building to get replacements), clothes dryer was useless...had to run clothes at least twice and only very small loads, cheap quality kitchenware Similar to an older Best Western or Comfort Suites type hotel. Probably would pay extra and stay somehere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, convient and has good value”
Reviews.Author: Andre
Reviews.Content: A true gem. The photos are reflective of reality (which isn't always a given), and the room are spacious with jacuzzi. Good value, and it's literally a couple miles from the edge of Walt Disney World. It's has an outlet mall right outside of the hotel. Wired internet inside apt and wifi in the lobby. Helpful staff. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: edmb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and loved it. Location is very convenient, only 10-15 min drive from disney resorts and seaworld. about 25-30 min drive to Universal and Prime Outlets and only about 5 min drive to Premium outlets. Kitchen is well equipped, there is a small convenience store on site which stocks everything you should need, however there is a walmart just up the street ( within walking distance if necessary). We ate at the Irish pub 3 times and found the food good and prices reasonable. I used the fitness centre on site, it is pretty small, but better than most hotels and it is not very busy. There are outlet malls sharing the same area as this hotel, but they are a little run down in comparison to the premium and prime outlets. My wife went to the spa on site and said it was excellent, you can get coupons at the front desk for discounts at the spa and the outlets. One final tip, the walmart up the street has cheap disney souvernirs and it also has a kiosk where you can buy tickets to Universal and Disney, we saved $18 per ticket for Blue Man Group by booking at Walmart. Will stay here again if I go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and can't wait to stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: chrissey79
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long stay at lbv and let me just say we loved it here, my husband and 2 kids (5 yrs old and 17 yrs old) loved it as well. We stayed in building 5 on the 14 floor and had wonderful views of the fireworks at night. My boys loved the pirate ship as well as we loved the heated spa pools. Our room was cleaned and spotless when we arrived they supply you with just enough for a few days, we rented a car and loaded up with all sorts of goods from walmart. I loved being able to cook our breakfast and dinners , this saved us a bundle. We packed water, juices and sandwiches for the parks, so this saved us alot of money on drinks at the parks. We have no complaints we were able to find the resort with our GPS with NO problem. Distance to the parks is on average of 10 mins such a breeze. The ONLY complaint we have is DONT order from a place called ROMINOS , every morning there are a ton of fast food booklets under the door and one night my boys wanted pizza so we decided to order from rominos and long sad story short, they delivered our food and our sandwiches were all wrong we called back they said they would redeliver and after 45 mins nothing, we called back the guys said he didn't remember talking to us he said they would redeliver and the same thing nothing finally at 1 am we just went to sleep. The next morning i looked at the menu they have no address on it and we couldnt find them on the internet and the phone number is not listed. WOW makes us wonder.. Anyway after eading my long post just know that this place was as wonderful as it gets. And we are very picky people and we stayed in disney 10 times so far and this is the one place we would go back to.any questions that i could help you with feel free to email me [--]

Reviews.Title: “Please keep this place a SECRET!”
Reviews.Author: canucknuckle
Reviews.Content: My family and I have a room booked for this week and I wanted to see if anything had changed in terms of quality at the place since last year. Looks like all is the same. We have 2 kids, 5 and 2, and when we stayed here in a 2BR it is was just about perfect. Overall you can believe everything you hear for this hotel. Rooms are huge, perfect location, great pool, apathetic counter staff, very difficult to find even with a GPS. VERY reasonable price, no great deal, but you fell like you really got your money's worth. Have to walk across a street to get to the pool depending on where you stay. Its all true. Oh yah, and I did have to get a cord for internet in my room, which worked flawlessly all week and was free. Parking was easy for us. I could see it getting worse during busy season, but for us we pretty much parked in front of our door everytime. I am looking forward to going again and my kids cant wait to swim (we hope). No big deal going to the pool, I think others are exaggerating the distance. We are lazy, so having a fresh made pizza ready for us at the pizza place on site (we called on our way home from the parking lot) made us feel even more lazy, but could not have been any easier. If you are more motivated of course Wal-mart is a drive around the corner. We stayed for 5 nights and got a full room cleaning once which was worth it. Who cares if the counter staff fall head over heels in love with you, they do their job. We eventually found the place and after that it is a breeze to find. The only problem we had was getting a luggage trolly when we were leaving. Not easy. Please invest in about 5 more of these things. The other negative which is a personal annoyance for me and I am only reporting because it is literally criminal and should stop immediately, was that the person at check out told me I had to pay the "resort fee" which was clearly laid out in my reservation that the "resort fee" was covered in my total I had already paid. He made me go back to my van, dig through paperwork, and present him with evidence. After which, there was no further questions asked and he simply said that all the different reservation systems do it different. Not sure he would have let it go if I didnt bring paperwork. I got my paperwork ready this time, but really wish I didnt have to bring "evidence" with me when I check out of a hotel. If this happens again I will formally complain and let everyone here know.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I'd hoped it would be!”
Reviews.Author: AHLMOM
Reviews.Content: Anytime I book a hotel online I'm always a little nervous until I get there and see for my self what it is like! This place was just what I wanted it to be. Our group was me and my husband our 3 kids 9,9, and 5 and my mom and dad. We rented the St. Lucia. Two master suites w/jetted tubs (very nice at the end of the day after walking at the parks) and a room with two twin beds. Very close to all the Disney parks 5-10 min. to any of the 4, Wal-Mart was less than a mile away, rooms were big and comfy, pools were great my kids went swimming almost everyday. We liked not having house keeping come in and out everyday. And the washer and dryer made it very easy to wash towels and keep up our laundry. Overall I would say we couldn't have found a better place to stay for the money. Not sure when we will go back to Disney but if we do this will be the place we stay.

Reviews.Title: “"exceed our expectations"”
Reviews.Author: FAMALVARADO
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Orlando with our two kids, we loved how big was the master suite, and the kids room was spacious too. Also, my 4 years old son was so happy with the pirate's ship. we are looking to come back again on winter 2010 and definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK”
Reviews.Author: Kritter42
Reviews.Content: The front desk was not friendly, almost rude in fact. We had to ask for laundry detergent. Two lamps in our condo were broken where the light bulb screwed in. Our remote in the master bedroom wouldn't work. Not ONE towel rack in the master bath and the bathtub and shower are contiguous with the bedroom so whenever someone took a shower or bath, the whole bedroom had to be locked and became very humid. I thought that was weird. The doorknob to the toilet broke. The table in the master bedroom had a big place where the finish came off; it looked like a cheap hotel table. The mattress pad on the best was very thin so it felt like you were laying right on the mattress. Now for the good news: Loved the pools, loved the location. We went to another person's room whom we knew that were staying there and theirs looked way nicer than ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a nice place”
Reviews.Author: SCSweendaddy
Reviews.Content: I had a trade show at Disney and brought the family. Stayed here in a two bedroom condo for less than a single room at Disney. Place was big, comfortable, all you need for a good stay. All the reviews are right about the space, facilities, location etc. My 6-year old asked for a high room and we got the next to top floor in building 5 so we could see the fireworks at night from Disney. Parking during the week was a breeze but the place filled up on Friday night so there was none. Pool was great fun but a little chilly for winter swimming. Sent the family to Sea World (less than 10 min.) while I worked then extended the stay through Sat to go to Magic Kindom (12 min.). Incredible value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: qt16n
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 2 other times before, and My family and I always enjoy staying here. Place is nice, spacious, great view of Disney Fireworks. The only bad thing is the parking but, we didnt seem to mind that too much. The place makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: thesoch
Reviews.Content: After searching the reviews and internet for a place to stay in Orlando, we decided on the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. We were not disappointed. It was very clean, very quiet. We especialy liked the location. Central to everything. Just minutes from Disney. It was our first trip to Florida and we will definately go back. Shopping nearby, flea markets nearby, Walmart nearby. The front desk was very helpful and pleasant. The grounds were well kept. I have absolutely no complaints. I loved the shower in the master bath and the jacuzzi tub. My husband and I took a short trip to Walmart and cooked our breakfast daily, then headed out for the day. WE loved it!

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: chev7
Reviews.Content: This condo is unbeliveable Kids loved the room. We would say this is the best hotel we ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, pool. Everything was wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: edlacross
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days. Loved the location, very close to Disney. It was beautiful, new and clean. We had plenty of room in our 2 bedroom condo. Quiet too. We loved the pool and tiki bar. It was a great stay and would definately stay again. Drove to the beach a few times too.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: J_M-wanderer
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort through AAA and received an outstanding rate for the week between Christmas and New Years. If you've traveled to Orlando you know the variety of hotel and resorts is quite diverse, some good, some not. We were very pleasantly surprised with this resort. The service at the counter was excellent, the staff very accomodating, and the room was great! The place is located very well to everything including Disney and I4, that takes you to Universal. There is an outlet mall right next to the property, and a Wall Mart very close. The pool was great!! Excellent service, good food, and the kids really enjoyed the "theme park" like ship in the middle of it. Overall this was a great find, and we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “All you need for a family stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: jetka85
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this facility was very nice. The location is convenient to Disney attractions, Sea World and shopping. Although there was no room service, the price was ideal for a large family, and it was actually quite nice not to have someone going in and out of our room. The only downside of it was that if you needed anything you had to go to the front desk to get it (i.e. extra paper towels and toliet paper etc.) The suite had a fully equipped kitchen and was perfect for being able to make meals but was also located near lots of restaurant for when we wanted to dine out. Overall it was a great spot for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home”
Reviews.Author: wifeyMiramarFl
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this "hotel" to any of my friends and family. I say hotel losely as it is so much more than a hotel. It was like staying in a luxury apartment will all the ammenities of home. The rooms were spacious, comfortable with great furturie. The pool area and resteraunt was just what you need to be away from the heticness of Dinsey and great for the kids! It's location is wonderful and very easy to get to from all the themeparks.

Reviews.Title: “Top class condo's. Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Juliaroyston
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Florida and have to say we had a fab time. The apartment was excellent and we couldn't have asked for more. Used the spa twice and it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the second time”
Reviews.Author: smudge17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks December 1-15. We had a 3 bed condo there were 6 of us 2 adults 4 children(17,5,4,2). They were clean and had everything we needed, we had stayed here last year so we didnt take the house keeping and didnt try rhe irish pub, didnt enjoy last year. the rooms were fine for us didnt feel cramped at all and it was good have 4 different tv so there were no arguments. The resort is next door to the factory store so easily within walking distance and walmart is less than a 5 min drive away. Again dont have any complaints at all and would happily stay here again. Marc

Reviews.Title: “Orlandos Hidden Secret Gem!”
Reviews.Author: brittanny_uk
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Orlando with our young daughter, and we were looking for accomodation that provided additional rooms as my mum wanted to come along too! Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa appealed to me for this reason! We stayed in a 2 bed condo, with the spacious master bedroom hosting a HUGE bed, jacuzzi tub, walk in shower, walk in wardrobe, fully lighted vanity mirror and 2 sinks! The second bedroom had 2 twin beds, a wardrobe, a tv and a bathroom just next door with a tub and a lighted vanity unit! The open plan lounge/kitchen area was spacious and clean with a Huge LCD Tv and a dining table. The kitchen had all the Mod-cons! We had a balcony overlooking the Pool! We stayed on the 1st floor (which is actually 3 floors up as the carpark takes up the first 2!) in building 3. On-site, Frankie Farrels Irish pub was excellent on a non-disney evening! The pool was fantastic with a huge pirate ship with slide and 3 jacuzzis! The barside Bar was great, (especially the nachos and hotdogs!) and one of the staff members Bob was always on hand - nothing was to much trouble! We are looking to go back again in November 2010 and will definatly be returning to this site, it is within easy access to all the parks and malls, and the wallmart down the road is easy to get to and provides plenty of food and souveniers! If you are using a SatNav from the airport, set it to the Lake Buena Vista Outlet Centre(which is just next door), as for some reason, SatNavs don`t seem to like to resort Zip code! Would definately recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations and helped make our vacation a memorable one”
Reviews.Author: allchoice
Reviews.Content: We have been in many Central Florida/Disney and Universal area resorts. By far, this place takes the top spot. It is safe, secure, convenient (to many shopping’s and plazas) and clean. Stevie Howard's assistance in selecting our room exceeded our expectations and helped make our vacation a memorable one. The rooms are very clean and great floor plans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Venue and Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: rushmore77
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa over three years. We have now stayed in three different buildings. All our rooms have been superb, as has been the staff on every trip. This trip, we booked a three bedroom suite for nine people in our extended family. We had three bathrooms, a kitchen, and a large enough living room for the entire group to watch Christmas movies on the wide screen plasma TV. The cost was significantly less than it would have cost us to stay "on property" in similar accommodations, though the suite actually provided more space than the Disney resorts where we have stayed. LBVRVS is also just as close to the Disney attractions as Disney properties where we have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely appartment”
Reviews.Author: disneymumEngland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic holiday in Orlando. We had a 3 bed apartment at lbv village and spa which was spacious and comfortable. The apartments have great amenities including a fab pool which the kids loved. Reception areas were clean and welcoming as were the staff. There was a negative however someone in a neighbouring apartment was obviously smoking in their apartment daily as when we returned to our apartment after a day out in the parks it would stink of cigarette smoke. It was obviously coming through the vents of another apartment and it made our clothes smell which was upsetting as we have a 2 year old child. It was good to have a washer/dryer which I used to wash all our clothes prior to returning to the uk. However I have had to re wash all of them now home as they still smell of smoke. We spoke to reception when we were there about this and they confirmed it was a non smoking building and advised us they would look in to it, but unfortunately it continued throughout our stay. I've still rated the apartments very good as I did thought they were very nice, we were just unlucky to have inconsiderate neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “a superb apartment and a holiday gift!”
Reviews.Author: obrien221
Reviews.Content: sayed at the buena vista resort spa for two weeks, just before the Christmas holiday. We brought along the entire family, including our special needs child. The staff were superbly accommodating, and even offered us a free upgrade to a wonderfully spacious four room apartment, with plenty of room for the grandparents! The apartment was also well equipped for our son, with a chair-access shower, railings, and a sink he could wheel right up to. We will recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “It was like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: touristBrookfieldCT
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the spaciousness and cleanliness of the 2 bedroom, 2 bath accommodations. The location was close to DisneyWorld, Downtown Disney and other attractions. It was hard to find because the address was not picked up by Mapquest or GPS. You have to ask for the street address not the mailing address. Also, it is behind a discount shopping outlet, so you can't see it from the street. I would ask for rooms with a view of the pool or the resort area. We were placed in accomodations that faced the back of the discount stores and the view was very unpleasant. When I mentioned it to the desk clerk, he was most accommodating in moving us to a condo with a view of the Epcot fireworks. We definitely would go back to the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for any age”
Reviews.Author: jaydeeNorthWeald
Reviews.Content: had a great holiday in orlando but staying here has spoilt us for staying in a hotel,we had a 3 bedroom apartment on the 14th floor in block 5,it is huge so comfy and clean, huge balcony as well we could see the fireworks at night from disney,go to walmarts just up the road for your grocerys very reasonable,lovely pool plenty of seats and sunbeds also as many clean towels as you want,it was great having a washing machine and tumbledryer in the kitchen,it was no problem not having a daily maid apartment very easy to keep clean,although there is a free shuttle for non drivers it would be handy if there was a bus service to and from lake buena vista we had to use taxi,s a lot.Would recomend this hotel to anyone who wants a smashing relaxing holiday

Reviews.Title: “perfect resort for families with children”
Reviews.Author: everruby
Reviews.Content: this place was great! the pool is spectacular-and heated!! the rooms are clean, large flat screen TV, we got a FREE upgrade to a larger room, plus we were on the 8th floor that overlooked downtown disney and watched fireworks-every night of our stay-from the JACUZZI in our bedroom. There is a great outlet mall right next door with old navy and osh kosh bgosh outlets, free transport to the parks, the fridge and stove means you can keep milk and heat bottles, and we were able to keep fruit and hot dogs cold for the kids which will save you alot of $ at the parks. we ADORED this place and our kids cried when they had to leave. p.s. eat at coco's rotiessere chicken-mmmmm

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: myhamada
Reviews.Content: We have been in many Central Florida/Disney and Universal area resorts. By far, this place takes the top spot. It is safe, secure, convenient (to many shopping’s and plazas) and clean. My family and I enjoyed the smiling faces of the staff that made us feel at home. The rooms are very clean and great floor plans. The internet is free, so bring your laptop and don't miss any emails or correspondence. The pool has a great setting with an area for the kids to play with. We enjoyed it so much and we recommended it to two of our family and friends to stay there and they all feel the same way. We plan on coming back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -no complaints”
Reviews.Author: lizbro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from nov 2nd-16th 09 ,arrived about 7pm and the lobby was empty so no check in problems ,found the room brilliant for our needs.We are a family with 2 ad and 3 children (12,10,7) and we had stacks of room.Master bedroom had a huge bed -thinks its called a queen(had 3 pillows across the width) huge walk in wardobe with an electronic safe and hanging space,iron,ironing board.The safe was big enough to fit a netbook in and would probably fit a laptop as it had a removable shelf. Second bedroom had same size huge bed ,smaller walk in wardobe,chest of drawers and tv ,third bedroom had 2 double beds with again smaller walk in wardrobe and chest of drawers.All bedrooms had a alarm clock in.Kitchen was fully equipped with large fridge freezer,cooker ,microwave,dishwasher,coffee machine and kettle.You got 2 sachets of dishwasher powder and spare bin bags on check in but we were told if we needed more bin liners or detergent or toilet roll it was available free of charge from the lobby - the lobby also had plenty of the guide books/leaflets handy and free copies of the Daily Mail for uk people! Back to the room,i took my own ethernet cable so don't know how long thier cables are but i had no problems with getting internet on my netbook ,washer/dryer comes with a small one wash box of tide but as Walmart is so near you can stock up on essentials there.The on site shop is quite expensive but its fine if you need an emergency stock up ,the pool was a bit chilly but warmer nearer the pirate ship where the jets were! Hot tub was super hot and lovely to relax in. We loved it here and would stay again def ,as we went at a quiet time parking wasn't a problem but i would imagine that at peak times there would not be much space for parking and as we booked through Virgin holidays there was no daily resort fee at check out. And for reference we stayed in room 51214 -building 5 ,12th floor and we could see all the fireworks from our room!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Mareismyluv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and I was unimpressed with the hotel and staff. The room was OK, but nothing to get excited about. There is no room service offered unless you want to pay $40 per night and the parking was atrocious. The pool with the pirate ship was amazing, but during our stay it was too cold to swim. I have been to Orlando more times than I can count and we have tried so many hotels that we have just loved, but this is not one of them. We won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain for family with teens”
Reviews.Author: brebarg
Reviews.Content: I picked this resort based on other peoples experiences here, and I was glad I did. The biggest attraction to me was value. For $109 a night we stayed in a two bedroom, 2 bath condo with kitchen and 3 tv's. Lots of space for our family of 4 to spread out and relax. There was a restaurant and convenience store in our building, and two pools on the grounds. kids would love the pool with the pirate ship...we just used the hot tub. There are various levels of maid service for a fee. We chose nothing for our 4 night stay, and took the trash out ourselves. They offered shuttles to Disney, Seaworld, and Universal, but I'd suggest having a car so you can explore the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: baggieAL
Reviews.Content: Have just came back from our amazing trip to Orlando. We went on the 6th Nov for two weeks. We had a two bed apartment in block 5 on the 6th floor which had lovely views of the Disney fireworks at night. The apartment was amazing, we have read reviews of how dirty they was, but we could'nt fault it. It was spotlessly clean, very spacious, a home from home. It had everything you needed, iron, ironing board, washer/dryer, fridge freezer microwave, cooker, dishwasher, the kitchen lacked utensils and baking trays, but got by with what we had.The 42" TV was great. In the master bedroom there was a massive bed with an equally massive jacuzzi and walk in shower. Very close to ameneties, had Walmart to the left, and a shopping mall next door. All the parks are around 10 - 20 mins away, apart from Busch Gardens, which is about an hour away. The only complaints we had was, the one man at reception when booking in was rude, and did'nt want to listen. The other complaint is, on the day of departure, we had to vacate our room by 11am. So we could check our luggage in with our tour operator we left the room early around 8am, which left us plenty of time to get back to our room to collect our drinks and snacks for the rest of the day before our flight home and take some pics of our room. When we returned the maid was in our room and had thrown everything away, even though we had'nt handed our door key back to reception. The only other thing to note is, a credit card is needed for a security deposit. If no card, a $100 cash deposit is to be paid which is fully refunded at the end of stay. This is not stated in any brochure.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Handot
Reviews.Content: The accomadations at Lake Buena Vista's resort was simply outstanding. Our suite was very nice, clean and homelike. We enjoyed our stay so much, that we did not want to leave the resort to attend the functions that brought us to Orlando. I will highly recommend this resort to my family and friends. We would definitely like to return again...

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT RESORT, HIGHLY RECOMMEND.....”
Reviews.Author: norna210977
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from this amazing trip, we went on the 7th of nov for 2 wks. The hotel was lovley, it has everthing you need from iron/ironong board to a washing machiene etc etc, fully loaded. We had the 2 bed apartment it was so spacious, 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms, one of which had a queen sized bed, and a spa bath(just what you need after doing all the parks and shopping). When we got there it was funny as i had read reports from previous people saying dont stay in room 200 and somethimg (cant remember now) above the irish pub as you have this massive fat trap, well when we got there, low and behold we was given that room, but phoned stright away and they was really happy to change.We was in block 5 on the 11th floor and the views was amazing as you could see the fireworks every night. People out there are really friendly and the weather was superb, about 83-84 most days. we got talking to some people out there and you can get you tickets cheaper out there 9 times out of 10, can save £50/60 on park tickets etc, the same for swimming with the dolphins, That was amazing, well worth every penny, everthing is inc, food,drinks,towles,snorkel,suncream.Just bring yourself and your cosie. Universal was ok, once you have been there a few times you get a bit bored, not much there, islands of adventure is better. also tipping is arond 15% of the total of your dinner as well, but some do already put it on.Invest in a sat nav, you wont get lost. pre order if you can as it cost us 184 dollars for 2 wks. most restraunts are fab out there, but we found the golden corral fab, worked out about £25 for a family of 4 all you can eat.....just make sure you try the steaks they are to die for. dont forget to do shoppin, its well cheap there, you have one on your door step and loads scattered about, the prime outlet is better than the premier. Any way getting back to hotel, i would highly recomend, the pool is fantastic, you have a pirate ship with a flume, and it is open to 10pm evernight and the spa's are open till 11pm. The rooms are clean neat and cant complain about anything, they do have a maid service but you do have to pay for it, i didnt bother as there is not much to keep nothing you would nt do at home, washed the linen myself and towels tumble dryed them quick really. oh one last thing thr pirate show is good but you are really only paying for the show, the food is not much cop, but the entertainment is good they get you involved in the show. hope this has helped you

Reviews.Title: “Loved the space and pool...”
Reviews.Author: ftl101
Reviews.Content: My family and I (husband, and two kids under 3) stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and really enjoyed the stay. Our suite was clean and had just the right amount of space for our little ones. We took advantage of the kitchen for breakfast in the morning, central location was good to come back to for the kids to nap, and the pool was amazing (didn't spend enough time there). We will definitely stay at this location again. We arrived very late our first night (after midnight) and I had called earlier that day to make sure that the pac-n-plays that we needed were already in the room and set up when we arrived...I am happy to report that they were and this helped us to make sure that the first night with the tots went smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Unit and Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: principal01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, 11/14-11/17/09 in a two bedroom unit. Upon checking in as we always do we looked at the towels and bed linens. Both beds had hair and what looked like lipstick on the sheet and pillow cases. The kitchen was stocked a total of three glasses of different sizes. Two pots and some silverware. Whern my wife called down to ask for some replacement linens and dishes we were told the "man" was busy. After two hours and 20 minutes and the third call the "man" arrived with two towels, two pillow cases, and two top sheets. We never received our dishes with the exception of a frying pan that was brought up the next day after two more calls which had dried eggs stuck all over the bottom of it. The carpet in the unit was filthy by the fact that id you walked across it barefoot your feet turned brown. We tried to get a unit at the cond we usually stayed at as we frequently visit Orlando, but it was booked. We were able to finally meet with a manager on Sunday night. We took the pan and a towel in to show we were'nt nuts. She told us that she would meet with her staff first thing in the morning and get back with us. To date we have never heard from her nor will she return our calls. The good thing is that this trip was booked through American Express and they have already refunded our points for the stay saying they had had other similiar complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Room & location”
Reviews.Author: CHICAGO049
Reviews.Content: Large 2 bedroom location. Excellent facilities and staff. Large Pool & deck. Enjoyed the jacuzzi inside the room. Full kitchen with Washer & dryer. Parking can be tight at night after Disney crowd gets back. Will stay at this location again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great family suite”
Reviews.Author: bolza
Reviews.Content: We traveled to orlando with two children 5 and 6. I didn't give it five stars as it is a bit older, and I tend to think a 5 star place would be just a bit nicer. Overall though I thought the facility was wonderful. Very quiet location that is basically your own apartment. We loved having seperate space for the kids and for us. Pools were nice, there are two. I loved the fact that there were food options on site or for delivery. I really don't have any negative to say about the facility. The kid when we checked in could have been a bit more friendly and the beds were a bit hard, but that wouldn't deter me from staying there again. Overall for the value it was an excellent choice that I would recommend to anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place! Mind blowingly good!”
Reviews.Author: Misti66
Reviews.Content: I have been to Orlando 3 times before and have stayed in the best hotels that Disney and Universal can offer. They did not match the experience we had at this resort. The apartment was amazing, We had a 3 bedroomed aprtment which was very spacious. I have never seen so much storage space! The beds were comfortable and the nice touches of luxury like the plasma TVs and Jacuzzi bath were great. Having a dishwasher, washing machine and dryer meant that I felt at home instantly! The staff were friendly and helpful and the housekeeping staff excellent (you chose when you wanted them to clean - at an additional cost). Free newspapers were nice. The pool was great and my 11 year old thought so too! Bar staff at the pool bar were the friendliest I have encountered anywhere, The grocery store and Pizza Hut were excellent as was the Pub. We were very impressed with the quality of the food served. If I am being fussy there were just a few things that could have been a little better; The transport to the parks was quite limited (and also didn't inlcude transport to any of the Disney Parks with the exception of Epcot - this wasn't made clear to me by Virgin who we travelled with ,and meant we had to use taxis at additional cost. There were a few niggles with maintainance in the apartment e.g. the hairdryer didn't work, the shower was a bit slow to drain and we had a very squeaky door. However these were all quite minor things. The other thing which could be useful is the provision of WIFI. At present they don't provide it, but will give you an ethernet cable for your laptop. All in all an excellent hotel and one that I will defintely be returning to!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay if you are on a budget, but I wouldnt stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lovelyauburn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay if you are on a budget. However, I wouldn’t stay here again for a few reasons. The front staff is young adult guys, who have arrogant attitudes. When I called the front desk they were very rude and gave me a smart answer such as, “well when you checked in, someone should have went over the housekeeping policy with you.” There were four of us here and we stayed for three nights and were only given 4 towels and 4 wash cloths. This means we had to recycle or wash them. We decided to wash them to save us the $5.00 towel charge for each additional towel they would charge. So, we had to go down stairs and get some laundry powder. I guess this was a plus; considering this wasn’t an item that we packed. They didn’t have wireless internet in the room, but if you wanted internet you had to get a plug from down stairs. The parking lot space was very limited and we had to drive around several times to find a spot, which was actually farther than our room building. They can definitely improve their parking arrangements. There weren’t any rollers available for us to transport our items on when we arrived, so we had to carry everything up. The most disturbing thing for me was that the blanket had dirt stains on it. I had to sleep with a sheet the first two nights here. On the third night, I decided to wash the blanket after I had learned they provide laundry detergent. For the most part, the prices are good for this apartment type facility; very spacious and homey. If you are just looking for a deal, and you don’t want it to be a bad one, you can go here. You won’t be disappointed this price is for a basic stay. I personally would have preferred better customer services, more towels, and cleaner linens.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Tweety80
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks at this hotel and agree with most of the positve things written about it. It was very good value and with three young children and my mum with us we all had plenty of room. It was so easy to get up and make the kids breakfast (took porridge and cereal with us to in case kids didn't like US cereal and they didn't). Also coming back in the evening we just made toast or soup having eaten out during the day, it was so much easier than the small hotel room we had last time. We had a lovely view of the smaller pool and my mum and I enjoyed a stroll over to the shops whilst my husband and kids played in the pools. Our only criticisms were as follows: we asked 4 times for our floor to be vacuumed as my toddler was picking up bits off the floor. We were told this was free even though we didn't have maid service but it was just so hard to get them to do the job and at the end of the holiday they tried to charge us $42 for a full clean which we never had nor asked for. The biggest hinderence for me was that in building 5 we had no stair access to our floor, only lifts. I do not like lifts so I had to enter via a dingy fire stair well at the back of the building which only opened from the inside so my husband had to run down and let me in each time. Overall, this was a very clean, spacious 3 bed apartment with 2 lovely pools. Shops are close by, as is Walmart and Target. Lots of fastfood places and restaurants minutes away too. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “better than a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: duckylaw
Reviews.Content: Came here with my partner, three sons and their friend ranging from 14 -23 years old. The rooms are immaculate, large and very well equipped. Anything you don't have that you need is soon brought to your room by the friendly, helpful staff. The lads loved the pool(quite cold) and jacuzzis(really warm). The pool bar is quite expensive, but most hotel bars are anywhere. The jacuzzi bath in the master bedroom is a real treat after long days trailing around the parks and the comfy, huge beds and peaceful area make for a good night's sleep. There is a Wal*Mart about 15 minutes walk away if you are brave enough to cross the big road. It's not too bad as the traffic lights up the road give regular lulls in the traffic to allow you to cross.(we consulted locals re: jaywalking and they said that it was not an issue) The only thing that stopped this hotel being "excellent" for me was its location and that is only because I am too scared to drive over here. The shuttles to the parks are a little too infrequent and intransigent for my liking. The hotel is off the beaten track, so to speak, so it is not on local bus routes etc. The shuttles run once a day in international drive direction and twice to epcot only. Taxis are available, but quite expensive. This is my only little grizzle about this hotel. If you have a car, I would say it was the perfect place to come for a reasonably priced family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome! Best place in orlando”
Reviews.Author: t22pom
Reviews.Content: Just come back today, been to orlando about twelve times now and this hotel beats everything. For three of us we had a three bedroom suite. Kenny, Brandon etc from the bar are the best ,made our holiday. THANX GUYS!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great appartment style hotel close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: FL12
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of recent reviews of the hotel I agree with some of the comments, But what I really liked about our 6 day stay in October was the amount of space you get for the same price as other hotels. We had a 2 apartment suite in block 5 overlooking the pool. It was spacious and quiet with all the facilities of home. I wasn't bothered about not having a maid for that amount of time. They had given us dish washer powder etc so you could do it yourself and it was easy to use the trash chutes - you just needed your door key. You don't have to worry about tipping a maid etc. We moved on to another disney hotel and the maid only ever really cleaned the sink and hoovered a bit. Pool was nice but a bit cold. It was handy for lots of restaurants, disney was within 10 minutes and sea world within 15 mins. I found having a car the easiest solution but that is just my preference as there is only one restaurant on site. I loved being able to make my own tea when I woke up at 3am from jet lag. Would consider this or somewhere similar next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: garyrScotland
Reviews.Content: This place was reccomended to us and we were not dissapointed, apartment was very spacious and we were left alone by the resort staff which we like. I was going to hire a car before we got there but am so glad we didnt, I mean whats the point of paying $14 to park a car everyday in disney.we used the shuttle to get to the parks in the morning and just jumped in a taxi to get back or go somewhere to eat when the kids had enough of the parks. If you do take a taxi take the address of the mall beside LBV as a few drivers we used had not heard of the resort and it doesnt show up in there gps (but the mall does). we used a taxi to stock up in walmart after we had been there a couple of days (much cheapness) as the on site shop as everyone says is a rip off , we bought some essentials when we arrived went up to the apartment and then noticed the bread was green with mould!!. The shop workers were very apologetic and replaced it though. Pizza place on site is good as is the irish pub. Pool is excellent with free/clean towels to use. We used the poolside bar ( the staff are excellent) and although expensive found it no dearer than anywhere else we went. You dont need to go to any other mall either as the one next door has nearly everything you could want. Will be going back again ( so the kids tell us) when the Harry Potter ride At islands of adventure opens , so we better start saving.

Reviews.Title: “excellent self catering accommodation”
Reviews.Author: loveflorida2009
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an excellent holiday in Florida and much of that was down to the lovely accommodation at LBV.Our room was a two bed condo on the 11th floor in block 5 overlooking the pool and was lovely.The condo was clean,spacious and well equipped and was nice to come back to after a busy day in the parks. The pool was great for kids and adults alike especially the pirate ship which has its own slide,it was always clean with enough sunbeds although we were there when it was quiet. Another plus was the hotel/resort ( noted later ) was really quiet even the rooms facing the pool and at no time were we ever awoken which was a benefit after the parks. However we had a few points to note, its described as a hotel resort and spa to be honest the only one that is really true is the spa. Hotels we have stayed in before provide services like room or maid service with rooms cleaned,sheets and towels changed etc this is available but it costs 30 dollars.There is no entertainment and the bar closes early so it does lack atmosphere. Parking can also be tricky if your back late you will struggle and again this was when it was quiet it must be Nealy impossible when its busy. Overall this is an excellent base with everything you will need and i would most definitely recommend it especially for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: travellady1966
Reviews.Content: Our family was very pleased with this resort. We loved everything about our rooms, the beds were comfortable.
