Didn't get to use the pool much because the weather was not the greatest while we were there. Have a washer and dryer was so nice, and the full kitchen. When we go to Orlando again someday. We will be sure to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, would reccomed to anybody”
Reviews.Author: ingrams4
Reviews.Content: Just returned to U.K. today, after spending two weeks in LBV resort, and would go back. We had an excellent time staying at LBV, especially because of how great the condos were. The rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable, and very well equiped. As we are a family of four, with a 15 and an 11 year old, we enjoyed not all being stuck in the same room and greatly appreciated having two seperate bathrooms. The hotel staff were mostly all very friendly and the service was prettty good. The location was very central and was very near to disney. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to Disney, Universal and Seaworld which should be very useful, but we experienced a problem returning back from disney on our last day. Coaches are sent out to the parks in the morning, but in the evenings these are replaced by small mini-buses, which sometimes leave not enough room for all the guests returning to LBV. We would advise that you should pick up youre shuttle voucher the day before and get to the bus stop promptly, to get priority of seats in the shuttle. The restaurant on site 'Frankie Farrells', was handy to have, as they catered for a wide variety of tastes, service was quick and friendly and food was mostly quite good. Although we experienced a few problems with the hotel taxi service, we had an amazing holiday and would definately book again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for extended family and children”
Reviews.Author: 10sommertime
Reviews.Content: We had 3 adults an 3 children in a 3 bedroom. Keep in mind that I consider myself to be on the verge of being a hotel snob so I'm pretty picky. But all in all I was really happy with the accomodations at this hotel. I felt we had enough room and the room for the most part was in good shape. The tile in the grout could have been a little cleaner but that would have been my only complaint. I loved the use of the kitchen and the washer and dryer and everything was in working order. Pool area was nice, the water slide was nice for the kids and the smaller pool across the way was not crowded at all. The parking in the evening was the worst. There was not enough spaces and some nights I had to drop the family off at the door and drive around for 15 min just to find someplace to park. But if that's all I have to complain about at the price we got the room for, then I am a happy person. I would go again! WORD OF WARNING - If you decide to go grocery shopping once you get there DO NOT be tempted to go to the Walmart down the street. It is a nightmare. I have never seen so many people in one place at a time. There is a grocery store, I think its a Publix, just a little further down the road and it is very nice, well stocked and not chaos! I recommend you go that route, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pp61Switzerland
Reviews.Content: Have been in this hotel with 2 sons of 12 and 15 years. Very close to the Disney resorts with free shuttle service. Hotel very clean, very big rooms, complete kitchen. Several shops in the direct area, big supermarket on 10 minutes walk. Very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Proceed with Caution”
Reviews.Author: mistykit2002
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed reviews about this facility. First, I had a room reserved at the Hawthorne Suites a couple of miles away - breakfast was included - because of its location. I was relying on relatives (not from Orlando area) for transportation & wanted to be close to where they were staying. The Hawthorne was overbooked & I was sent to the LBV Resort Village. Check-in was efficient, but I didn't feel very welcome. The map to my building was photocopied & not especially clear. Also listed were fees charged for housekeeping services. So if you are staying for several days & wanted housekeeping, remember to add in $5-$20 per day. There is a two level parking garage for building 5 & I was dropped off at the elevator - which required a keycard for entry. When I opened the door to my room, I was in awe. The intial quick look through showed a gorgeous 2 bedroom suite. A closer inspection later, proved otherwise. Pros: Pizza Hut Express on the property. Key required to gain access to the elevator from the parking garage. Washer/dryer in kitchen area. Kitchen also included several appliances I didn't expect - like a hand mixer, rather than just basic dinnerware & pots & pans. Two bedroom suite divided by living/kitchen area, with 2 separate baths. TVs in bedrooms & living area. Balcony off living area. Cons: Difficult to find at night if unfamilar with the area. Several different addresses listed for this resort. (Had I planned to stay here, I certainly would have had my own maps & directions.) Some basic features inside (lack of towel bars, slippery shower floor, one small soap dish-with no place to put shampoo, etc, except on the floor). Housekeeping services are extra. Public areas not checked for cleanliness (someone had vomited in one of the elevators-great way to start your morning). No complimentary coffee in lobby. In room coffee pot with 2 packs of terrible decaff (2 sips & I dumped it out). In short, I doubt I would stay here again - and probably wouldn't recommend it to others. Depending on the rates when you book, it might be very economical for a family of 6. But make sure you check on the extra daily costs (housekeeping, parking). Three & four bedroom condos are also available - keep in mind, they are also in the business of selling these condos. For a single person, staying only one night & relying on others for transportation, it was not an especially enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful resort to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: FloridacrazyDevon
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived to the minute we left everything was perfect here. We were in building 5 which was lovely on floor 7, plenty of space, and very clean with all the extras. Didnt use housekeeping as had own washer//dryer that we used every other day. We had a Walmart and Publix nearby to buy breakfast and drinks for the parks which saved loads of money every day, also very close to all parks and Downtown Disney. Right next door was the shopping outlet which was good. The pool area was lovely and clean plenty of beds and towels provided and a very nice bar for food and drinks which was reasonable. Overall would definately come back again on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Desire86
Reviews.Content: I live in South Florida so I spend many mini vacations in Orlando. I cannot even say how many times I have been to the parks. I have stayed in dozens of hotels in the area, from hotels in downtown Disney, to hotels in each Disney category, hotels near Universal and Sea World. The list is endless. As an experienced Orlando traveler (trust me, I don't even need directions to get around), I enjoy staying at new hotels every visit, whether it’s better than the last hotel or not, it’s just for the experience of seeing something new. I came across the LBV resort last year and decided to book. It was just my boyfriend and I, however, we got a 2-bedroom suite because it was cheaper than a one-bedroom (there was a promotion on the site we booked through). When we got there, they asked us if we wanted a pool view or a firework view. We decided on the pool view. We were just there for a weekend; however, we were extremely comfortable. We were amazed on how much space we had. The prices on the rooms are unbeatable to other hotels. The hotel is close to all the parks (about 10 minutes), the rooms are huge and they are fully equipped. You could stay at a "regular" hotel with two double beds and pay more for less space. On the other hand, you could stay at a similar condo-type hotel like LBV, but the location is far from all the attractions. I have stayed in several condo-type hotels before LBV, one of which was a 2-story, 2-bedroom resort villa (which was gorgeous), but not as conveniently located and nearly $400 a night. Also, there are a several other hotels close to the parks, in the same price range as LBV, and spacious with all the same amenities, but LBV seems to be the newest, best kept, and has better decorated rooms (more modern). I enjoyed my stay so much that I have an upcoming trip at the LBV in December 2009. I spend a long time researching hotels for the trip (because I like to stay in hotels I have never been to in the past), but I have decided to go back to LBV because of the unbeatable price and how much you get for that price. This hotel is not in the middle of the Disney scene. If you are looking for the full Disney experience from the moment you wake up to the moment you go to bed, which can be a lot of fun, stay at one of the Disney resorts. If you are looking for a place to come back to and unwind after a long day at the park, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great price, great location and kids LOVED Pirate Ship in middle of pool!”
Reviews.Author: MomStephanie
Reviews.Content: We still can't believe the deal we got on this hotel. So reasonable, and our family of four was so comfortable in a 2-bedroom suite, complete with washer/dryer and full kitchen with granite countertops, dishwasher, etc. and a "family" room with couch. Three televisions in all. All for the price of some one-room hotels I had investigated before booking. We spent most of the days at Disney, but enjoyed coming back to the resort to spend time at the pool and hot tubs. In fact, you couldn't get us to leave. Great bar staff at the pool, and convenient to order quick, cheap dinner from the Pizza Hut Express located at the resort. Really easy to get to the Disney theme parks, but nice to be away from all that, too. We'll go back again, just to enjoy the weather and the resort. Bonus -- Carol at the spa gave me the best massage of my life!

Reviews.Title: “This place is Mega!”
Reviews.Author: db1581
Reviews.Content: I travelled here at the end of august for three weeks. My (now) wife and I were joined by several freinds and family as we were here to get married. The wedding was perfect, we got married at 11am in leu gardens, what a place! It was absoluetly stunning. We chose a morning wedding because of the heat but more importantly the humidity, ive never sweat so much! The gardens were fantastic and if you visit florida it will make a nice change from the usual manic tourist attractions. The complex was fantastic, our room was awesome very big and very well furnished, my favourite part was the huge spa bath, im a big lad and could have fit in it twice over! Coming back to the room was a joy, relaxing in the bath with a bottle of wine and watching tv was the perfect remedy to the often hectic days. The location was brilliant if you wanted to go to the disney parks, literally a 5 minute drive away, the other parks such as universal were only a 10 minute drive down the I4. The only criticism I have about the location is the fact you needed to get a taxi everywhere, which although pretty good value would start to add up as the holiday went on. Of course if you dont drink then driving would solve this problem, I however like a drink! I spoke to one of the bar staff and asked him where the locals go, where is cheap etc etc. He told me about a place called ale house, brilliant! The complex is just of the sr535, along which you can find the ale house, about a $12 taxi ride. I was paying $4.5 for a beer by the pool, in here you could get a pitcher for $5 or a pint of fosters for $2. Just beware anywhere in florida baileys is extortionate! The ale house does get busy with locals who go there to watch one of the many sports being broadcasted, there must be at least 50 plasma tv's! Driving in florida may seem daunting to begin with, but trust me it is very simple. The roads are very good and undertaking is allowed, makes it much easier! The signs are a little interesting because in the US everything is done by blocks, you may see the same street sign over and over. If you are a panicker you might have some issues driving, if an american tells you its just around the corner, it could be as far as 30 miles! Trust me, I drove there for 3 weeks, the key is dont panic and you must realise the place is huge and very spread out. Although on the whole america is good value, some places are riduculously expensive! When you go to the parks do your research, some places will allow you to take food in but alcohol is generally a no no. Food/drink in the parks is expensive, seems obvious I know but we realised this and still spent a fortune in the parks, ah well it was our honeymoon after all! Walmart is brilliant! so much choice and so very cheap. I like a drop of wine and found a bottle of wine for $3 and it was stunning! The meat in the supermarket is both cheap and gorgeous, buy a new york strip steak in walmart for $8, cook it right and it will be one of the best steaks you have there. All the parks are great, the water parks are my favourite. Typhoon lagoon has an amazing wave pool that is not for the light hearted. Sea world is so much more than just the whale, manta was possibly the best ride I went on. Busch gardens is worth a visit, great rides and stunning animals, got some amazing photos. We also went to cocoa beach (dissapointing) and clearwater beach (stunning) unfortunately we missed out on daytona beach, incredibily we ran out of time. In our final week we were alone, friends and family had left after 2 weeks and we decided to explore a bit more. Many of our friends had been to miami on a day trip and raved about the day. We wanted to go to miami but also the florida keys but no travel company did a trip which appealed to us. We decided to drive ourselves and after 3 hours arrived in miami, it was huge, kind of like driving into a sunny good looking london, but bigger I think. We drove to south beach and god was it hot! However, my wife and I didnt like miami, it was too busy and summed up america, full of exteremes. You would see the richest people, the poorest (not nice), thin, fat etc etc. We wanted a city tour but missed out (time again!) and so left for the keys. The journey was very bad! We listened to instructions from a local who said it was just down the road, thanks mate! Anyway we eventually arrived at key largo and checked in to the hilton, just in time for the sunset, what a beauty! Had a great night and fantastic meal and left early for key west. When we arrived we were in for a shock, it was bikers weekend! They estimate that 30,000 bikers turn up, quite a lot seeing key west is only 7.5 miles by 1.5 miles! We managed to escape it by going for a sunset cruise, $50 each, free food (average) and drinks (champagne was awful) and the sunset was out of this world, my wife and I were nearly in tears, beautiful. Next day I drove the 6 hours back (somehow!) and we had our last night in the fantastic lake buena vista resort village and spa, altough the keys were fanstastic we both missed our 'home'. Kitchen = brilliant space = brilliant bathrooms = brilliant washer/dryer = brilliant The whole place was magical, we were there to get married which was incredible but trust me this is no exagaggeration, this place is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for families or large groups”
Reviews.Author: terie55
Reviews.Content: We chose the 3 bedroom suite. The first room they gave us had a really loud noise in the wall when you flushed the toilet so they moved us to another room, that room's a.c. wasn't working. Finally, the last room we moved to was good. It is very spacious and nice especially when traveling with a lot of family and young children. The pirate pool was very nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything more!”
Reviews.Author: toothyanky
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location for all the Orland hot spots. It was especially close to Disney. It was also convenient for shopping as it was next to outlets and a WalMart. I loved the Condo feel and the two bedrooms was great for our family. We all also enjoyed the spa tub in our room and also the TVs in each room was great for the kids when the adults were busy getting ready to go or making dinner. All of the things that were stocked in the room was nice and convenient. The pool area was great! The staff was nice and my kids loved the pirate ship slide along with both hot tubs and umbrella spouts. The front desk was especially nice when we needed their help with a personal matter. Can't say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful holiday destination”
Reviews.Author: nicelifestyle
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after reading reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. We had a two bedroom apartment in building 3 which was very spacious and clean, it had a view over the pool/pirate ship. The pool area was very safe for our 7 yr old and has a big pirate ship/slide to entertain too! the pool side flooring is made of brick like material so no slipping when running. There is no lifeguard but there is a person supervising the slide at all times. The whole pool area is gated so no escaping for little ones. Music is piped around the pool area and Lani's Laua serves cocktails etc and good food. Some reviews stated the drinks were expensive and they are slightly but the tip is included in the price. There is a small shop on the complex for emergency items but a huge walgreens about 2 mins down the road. Frankie Farrells restaurant/Irish bar was ok (on site) and Lonestar steakhouse, Landrys seafood etc only a 5 min drive. We found that all the theme parks, shopping centres, I-Drive, downtown disney, kissimee etc were all within a 15 min drive of this hotel so it is very central and not too much driving so if you do not have a car it won't cost too much to get around. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful during our stay and we did not find any problems checking in or out, we did not find we had to wait to be seen as some people have reported, maybe this is because it is not height of season/school holidays. We requested a cable to use our computer in the apartment and we then had free internet access. We decided not to pay for room service and washed our own towels etc in the washer/dryer in the apartment. There are trash shutes at the end of each corridor and we had no problem disposing our rubbish. They provide recycling bins outside too! Overall we found staff and bar staff very friendly and our apartment was superb. We would definately stay there again and if you have small kids...imagine after a long day at the parks,sipping your cocktails by the pool (open from 7am to 10pm) while the kids swim around in a safe environment. Nice way to end your day!!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations and pool close to everything”
Reviews.Author: bertAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Web site does not give justice to the hotel. Was pleasantly suprised when we drove up. Hotel is away from the hustle and bustle, but close to everything. Pool is great for kids and grownups. Great place to lounge after a day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place and everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: Kubbyp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2009 for a few nights, and should I book a Disney vacation again, I will choose this place as the only destination for staying! We rented a 2 bdrm condo off an owner privately, but hotel staff was pleasant and helpful with any requests or questions. The owner was in contact with the hotel staff prior to our arrival and they had the key ready for us. Great service! The room was beautiful and well maintained! We enjoyed every moment at this condo and enjoyed our view over the pirate ship waterslide. The beds were comfortable, and the condo was just fantastic. It was great to be able to make a good breakfast, pack snacks for the parks, and come "home" to rest after a long day seeing Mickey and friends. In suite washer and dryer was very conveinent and used more than once! Two beautiful bathrooms and bedrooms, big walkin closet that the little one thought was a great play place, and the jacuzzi hot tub in the Master bedroom (we didn't get a chance to use it) was sure tempting! There is an outlet mall within walking distance, a Pizza Hut express, and other restaurants nearby. No shortages of places to go. Disney World entrance is about 5 minutes drive away! This is a fabulous location! Our little one just loved the pools! The pirate ship waterslide was a huge hit! Parking for the rental car was about the only issue that we encountered, but even that was not that big of a deal. It just took a bit of time to find a spot depending on time of day. I would recommend this hotel to ALL familes worldwide when you plan on visiting Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: GenieEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 nights in July for 10 days, with my husband and other family members, ages ranged from 9 to 58 years old. We stayed in Building 5 in a top floor 4 bedroom apartment, and were very pleased with our whole stay. The apartment was enormous with everything you needed for a comfortable family stay. The only thing that struck me as odd was that in the wet bar area, all the cupboards were empty, not a single wine glass to be seen. So we had to buy some from the supermarket to enjoy our evening glass of wine on the huge balcony!! We didn't use the maid service - being out so much, we didn't get the place messy, and we washed our own towels etc. The fact that we had a washer/drier and dishwasher in room made it easy to look after ourselves. ( HINT - I did takesome dishwasher tablets and sachets of laundry detergent with me, to save having to buy a whole box whilst out there.) We had a couple of minor maintenance issues which were fixed almost immediately. On one occasion I mentioned something in Reception, and by the time I got back up to the 15th floor, the repair man was already there!! We found the reception staff to be polite and helpful, as was the Concierge who sold theme park tickets. My grandson loved the pool, and the room service meal we had delivered from Frankie Farrell's one night was good. The resort never felt too crowded or too noisy and we never had any problems parking. The location was perfect - close to all the theme parks, much easier to get to Disney than from further up I Drive. The Outlet Mall next door was a bonus. There was a Walmart 5 minutes in one direction and a Publix 5 minutes the other way and since we had such a nice kitchen in the apartment, we did eat a few meals at home - more of the sandwich and salad variety rather than a full cooked meat with 2 veg. We all really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again next time we visit Orlando. No hesitation in recommending LBVR.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: LindaIan
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our second holiday at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village. Last year we stayed in Block 5 on the 11th floor and this year we requested Block 5 again. This time our room was on the top floor (15th). The view was fantastic. We were able to watch the fireworks from Epcot and Magic Kingdom from our balcony. The accommodation was just as good as we remembered it from last year. The pool which was still under construction when we went last year is now open. I cannot find any fault with this accommodation at all. The staff at the reception were friendly and helpful. The huge Walmart nearby has absolutely everything you could possibly need and is open 24 hours a day (shuts at 9pm on Sundays) and you are literally only 5-10 minutes away by car to the theme parks. The fully equipped kitchen means that you can cook meals like you would at home which saves a lot of money. We made use of the washer and dryer as well. The jacuzzi was most welcome after walking round the theme parks all day. This is our fifth trip to Florida and if we go back we will definitely be staying at the Lake Buena Vista Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Good - Ignore the Bad!”
Reviews.Author: KentSteve_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of reviews, mostly good to excellent. Our opinion is that that assessment is pretty accurate. However, there are a lot of negative comments about customer services. Our experience was the complete opposite. Check in/out was fast and efficient. On arrival at the apartment we could not find linen for the sofa bed, a call to reception had replacements sent in 10 minutes (we later found the linen supplied). Our room safe had been left locked by the previous occupants, this required a visit by a manager to over-ride the combination, but was completed within 30 minutes. Bookings for the Park shuttle bus, other enquiries etc were dealt with competantly and politely by the Concierge. Cleaning staff always smiled and acknowledged us. Either this hotel has undergone a major re-training exercise or previous reviewers were unduly harsh. I am not going to repeat all the excellent comments made about this hotel, except to say that they were all deserved. We had a great time and would unreservedly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fab holiday, can't wait to come back.”
Reviews.Author: STJCUK
Reviews.Content: What a fab holiday.We usually go to Greece/Cyprus where you get a basic room.Here we felt like royalty.We had a 3 bed appartment which was almost as big as being at home!!!! It was clean, comfortable,and had every appliance we needed including iron and board and 2 hairdryers. We asked for building 5 as we heard on trip adviser this is the newest and the best.We were given a room on floor 14 with a fab view.Seaworld was in the distance and we could see the fireworks there at night. My 13 year old loved having his own room with a t.v and separate bathroom. We plugged our laptop in the frontroom and were able to skype home. As we did not hire a car we were worried about the limited bus service to the parks but didn't need to be (if you are organised) You get either an 8.20 or 11.30 bus to EPCOT then use disney transport if you want to visit the other parks.It is clearly signposted but there is a help desk if needed. Just 2 things to remember :to get to magic kingdom go into EPCOT (where they check your bags) and then get on the monorail .There is no bus to get there. To get to blizzard beach , typhoon lagoon,downtown disney you need to get on a any disney resort bus and then get a bus from there, Busses back are 6.15 or 10.30 just make sure you leave enough time to get back to EPCOT! For seaworld/universal/Islands of adventure bus departs 9.40 (you get a lie in!) it drops off at seaworld and then universal.Seaworld do free shuttles to aquatica and discovery cove. You can also get on the I ride trolley at seaworld to have a shopping day at the prime outlet mall or to travel up and down international drive.It's really cheap. Bus back from universal is 7.15 it then picks up at seaworl at 7.45 We planned on spending at least $250 on taxis but spent about $50 Do a big shop at Walmart when you arrive.A taxi was $7 each way. I was amazed how close we were to the parks 10 min to EPCOT 15 to Seaworld and 20 to Universal on the bus. The hotel shop is expensive.pack of coke in walmart $1 in the hotel shop £3.99!!! There is also a Ponderosa just down the road. The Frankie o 'Farrells bar food was nice also the take away pizza hut on site was nice and not too expensive. I know maid service is extra but you don't really need it.We washed and dried the towels ourselves and were not in the room enough to make much other mess! We were very pleased and are now saving to return in a couple of years when hopefully my youngest son will be tall enough to ride all the coasters.

Reviews.Title: “great place and location”
Reviews.Author: ukscotty_9
Reviews.Content: just got back from this resort after 18 nights. i cant understand the bad reviews and moans about no maid service etc. you know that before you go! its great for the kids with the large swimming pool and pirate ship. the appartments are large and fully equiped. dishwasher, washer and dryer. main bedroom had a jacuzzi bath. location is great. its 10 mins to seaworld and 15 ish to universal. 10 minutes to magic kingdom. depends which rooms you get but you should see either the disney or seaworld fireworks in the evening. if you want to eat out then international drive is 10 minutes or 5 minutes the other way is the 192 at main gate with loads of places. if you want to eat in then walmart is 2 minutes away and its a massive store

Reviews.Title: “The perfect condo with kitchen and separate bedroom for a napping toddler.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinDuchess
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Disney & Sea World was only 2 nights but we wish we could have stayed longer at this terrific property. The convenience of the location was good for one day in Disney, 2 days in the Sea World area parks. The separate bedroom for children is a much needed space when you come home midday for naps. The pool was refreshing and a lot of fun- wish we had more time to enjoy it. The kitchen is great for preparing breakfasts and snacks and keeping things frozen/cold for coolers. Families who don't want to or need to dine out can really take advantage of the cost savings with a kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJes
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my boyfriend, son, parents and friends. Our unit not only fit all of us comfortably but was gorgeous and spacious to boot. The granite countertops and shower for two (or three or four) made this place feel very high end however the price was incredible for a family on a budget. My only complaint would be the pool was pretty cold - but after a hot day in the Florida sun, we didn't mind. We would highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice!”
Reviews.Author: AdventurerMiami
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel I would truly recomend. I stayed with my boys for 5 days. Disney parks are very close. The apartment was very clean and spacious, plenty room for two teenagers and I; and with the convenience of a washer and dryer, I was able to wash the wet clothes from the parks every day! Saved money on food too! There is a Walmart across the street where I got enough food for a few days and was able to cook quick meals. Took the bus transportation once , no complaints. Was worried of previous coments that there would be no parking space late after the parks closed, but I had no problem finding one.

Reviews.Title: “lovely lovely lovely - I would definitely come here again”
Reviews.Author: gall6
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful, and the staff were very accommodating. All the mod coms....tv in every room, air con, wash machine & dryer. We didn't much like the food in Orlando, so we ate in most of the time.....everything is there that you need to make it a home from home. The added bonus is you are right next door to a retail outlet, and there is a very very good (good value too) restaurant on the site too called Frankie Farrells. The days we werent in Disney, the kids lived in the pool - sometimes till 10pm + There is also a bar next to one of the pools. The room was quiet, and every night we could see the fireworks from Seaworld! Great location for the parks, one tip tho...get yourself to Walmart (fantastic supermarket - so cheap and sells EVERYTHING) which you can see from this hotel - it is on the Sr 535 and buy yourself a satnav.......saves soo much time and relieves the stress of dealing with not knowing where you are going...allowing you to concentrate on the looney drivers out there - and being on the opposite side of the road! In the review below, food and drink I refer to is at the restaurant on site..

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great Room, not so great pool.”
Reviews.Author: frog369
Reviews.Content: First of all, the pool is just too small. The gigantic ship in the middle of the pool only serves as a slide and nothing else. We really looked forward to the pool and were very disappointed. We stayed in a two bedroom suite and it was very clean and spacious. Having a washer/dryer meant we only had to pack 2 days' worth of clothes for an eight day trip. No wifi but they did provide the lan cable. We had to park the car on the street on three of the nights but it wasn't bad at all because it was more like private-street parking. The hotel is 10 minutes away from EVERYWHERE - all major theme parks, shopping malls, factory outlet, Walmart(1 minute away), restaurants, etc. We couldn't use the jacuzzi because one of the jets was endlessly spewing black dirt. The water pressure of the shower head was so weak. The master bedroom is half-bedroom and half-bathroom. There's no door or partition to separate the two areas. Lying in bed, if I look to my left, I see my other half. Look to my right and I see two sinks and a toilet. Worse yet, due to this strange arragement, I can tell when the adjacent room is using the jacuzzi or the shower. Unfortunately, they were using them around 1 in the morning everyday and kept waking me up. I had to eventually sleep in the living room. Don't expect quality service from the front desk. They seem to be very unorganized. There's a fee for housekeeping. You also have to wash your own towels. There are just too many other great hotels nearby - I would only go back to this hotel for a bargain price. They really need to upgrade the whole pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterwomanUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 12 night stay here. Having previously stayed in villas in the Kissimee area we chose this because it seemed more central for all parks, not just Disney. We were proved right. Just 10 minutes to Disney and about 15 to Universal. We had views of Disney's fireworks every evening which was an added bonus. The 3 bed apartment was spacious, although there were only 4 of us. I think the lounge area might be a bit of a squeeze with the 8 people it advertises it can sleep. The pool was excellent. Parking was not an issue for us - we found a space near building 1 every time. Just one word of warning - the on site shop is VERY expensive (WALMART is 2 minutes away by car). For a holiday where most of your time is spent at theme parks or water parks this well located accommodation is just the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “All we could wish for and more!”
Reviews.Author: janluvsflorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 21 nights and loved every minute of it. My son and I stayed in a two bedroomed unit in building 3 which overlooked the pirate pool. The check in process took a while, but hey, I wasn't the only guest to arrive that day, so obviously I had to wait my turn. The staff on the desk were very polite and courteous and took time to explain the layout of the resort and where things were situated. The room we were allocated was on the 12th floor, so we had a great view. It met all our expectations and more. The rooms were clean and well furnished with plenty of space. Each bedroom had a good sized closet, and the one in the main room easily stored my assortment of clothes, footwear, two suitcases and extra shopping that I did! We couldn't access the safe as it had been left shut and locked, after ringing the front desk I was told that someone would be up shortly. Less than five minutes later someone arrived to "fix" it. This was the only (very small and insignificant) problem we had all the time we were there) The kitchen was well equipped, plenty of utensils, full size cooker, microwave, washing machine, dryer and the fridge was huge. We had two bathrooms, the main one had a walk in shower plus a jacuzzi bath. We had plenty of towels, and it wasn't a problem having no maid service as they just got washed and dried as and when needed. Rubbish/trash was easily disposed of at the chutes on the end of the corridors (on certain floors only). The main pool area was clean and well maintained, and the bar/pool staff were very friendly. It never seemed too busy and there were always plenty of sun loungers available. I heard a few complaints from people when the staff closed the pool due to incoming storms (with visible lightening in the sky!!). Myself, I was quite happy to be informed so I could leave the pool before I was struck by lightening. The resort is well situated for supermarkets and restaurants and also has the Lake Buena Vista Outlets next door. This outlet isn't as big or as good as Prime or Premium Outlets but there are a few bargains to be had. Would I stay here again..........most definitely. My brother and his family were here at the same time, and like us enjoyed every moment spent here and wouldn't hesitate to book again. If anyone requires any more info about this resort please feel free to message me.

Reviews.Title: “conveniant home from home”
Reviews.Author: PhilALeeds
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 1st trip to Orlando and absolutely loved it. We were supposed to be staying in the Omni Hotel in Davenport but our tour operator over booked us (First Choice) and initially put us in the Marriott World Centre. It was fine for a conference, massive but just not what we wanted for a family holiday (a bit intimidating I felt) After 3 days we moved to Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa which was far more appropriate. The apartment (in Block 3) was large, clean, well furnished and equipped with an enormous bath/ walk in shower and 3 TV's. We all loved the pool which was never overcrowded and always had towels and sunbeds. Its a great location, close to the parks and a massive Walmart and we ate breakfast in the apartment most days. Parking was mostly easy and I only had a problem finding a space on 1 occasion. We had a couple of problems with the A/C but the reception staff were helpful and this was fixed fairly quickly. I was nice to go back to a large/well appointed apartment at the end of a long day at the theme parks and although I was very dissapointed not to be staying in the hotel I had booked, LBV resort exceeded my expectations in every way and I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Escape from Disney”
Reviews.Author: tockholes-on-tour
Reviews.Content: Second visit to Orlando and welcomed being outside the plastic Disney world (Port Orleans, small room last time). Three-bed accommodation (Building 5) was good for 4 adults & 3 children. Equipment was excellent. Master bedroom was great. Kids loved the pool. Also benefits from decent food within walking distance at Irish pub or take-out Pizza Hut. Agree with other comments about housekeeping - you would expect change of towels at least for 2 week stay. Reception desk/housekeeping queries always involved lengthy queue (sorry, line - no, queue).

Reviews.Title: “LBV Resort & Spa - a great place for a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: thewarrensDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 16 nights from the 4th August. Stayed in Tower 5 which overlooks the pirate pool in a huge 2 Bed apartment. Simply put, everything about this resort was wonderful. From the reception staff to the maintenance crew, Frankie Farrell's bar/restaurant staff, poolside bar staff, ALL were without exception, polite, friendly and did their best to assist us satisfactorily on every occasion. I made this point to the resort manager on leaving that he has a great team working with him in the resort. Apartment - spacious, clean, all mod cons- fantastic jacuzzi bath in main bedroom, with extremely large walk in shower and his/hers handbasins. Bed very comfortable and pleny of "walk around" space in the master bedroom. 2nd bedroom for our 2 children had 2 queen size beds with ample space. The 2nd bathroom was located beside this bedroom and again was very spacious. living space area had a cool glass topped table, with a giant pineapple as it's base. balcony was great to sit in and watch the pool activities (or the occasional storm which drifted by us a couple of times!!) Kitchen - we used this extensively. Had breakfast and lunch here most days, which is great for reducing dineout costs over 16 days and the facilities in it were easy to use and all in working order. Pool - this was fantastic - great pirate shipwreck in the middle of it with slide, lots of sun loungers available at all times of the day. We tended to use the pool in the morning, before it got too hot, but it was available to use until 10pm. Pool bar was expensive however, but they serve great cocktails and really gorgeous nachos! We used Frankie Farrell's restaurant/bar a couple of times. it was really good food, plenty of it and not that expensive. Nearby - the buena Vista Outlet stores back onto this property and are nice to browse around. They're not as extensive as Prime/Premium Outlets however. There is a 24 hour Wal-Mart 1/4 mile away from LBV which was great to get supplies during our stay. Lots of restaurants within a mile of LBV resort on 535 either way - up towards vineland or down towards Kissimmee. All in All, would we return? Yes, oh yes!! tomorrow if we could!! Fantastic underground parking over 2 levels and we were always able to get parking. There is a Maid service available at an extra charge if you need it. We never got around to checking if the light switches were crooked or not...we were too busy having a wonderful holiday :-))

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, spacious two bed apartment”
Reviews.Author: TimothyTindall
Reviews.Content: Stayed in tower 3. New , clean, spacious 2 bed apartment with new equipment. I read the other reveiws and was concerned about service and houskeeping. I reserved through Virgin Holidays and expected an apartment for 14 nights not a hotel room, there is a difference. Housekeeping is available at an extra charge for those who expect clean towels, toilet tissue replacement and bins emptied every day (basic hotel services). We were looking for an apartment that provided privacy, two bedrooms and basic cooking facilities. The resort exceeded my expections in all these areas. As it is only a couple of years old all the equipment was new (washer / tumble drier, dishwasher, huge fridge, oven, hob, microwave, 42" plasma TV, iron and board, TVs in bedrooms and excellent air conditioning). Pool was great. Turn left out of the resort and there is a Walmart Superstore about 1/4 mile on the right. We stocked up with quality toilet tissue, kitchen roll, milk, bread, butter, cereals, bottled water , washing powder etc and never looked back. There was a garbage chute at the end of the corrider for disposing of trash. Again if this is bit difficult you can always pay housekeeping to do it for you. You are provided with towels (we washed them when necessary), a small bottle of washing up liquid, small amount of dishwasher tabs, toilet and face tissues, bin liners, standard hotel small bottles of shampoos, soaps, etc. It was like walking into a hotel room. This is not restocked unless you purchase the housekeeping options. I took cables for connecting my laptop to the internet and the plasma TV so we could review the days pictures and movies we had taken. I also used my IP phone on the laptop. Cups, glasses, plates, bowls, cutlerly were all spotless. Beds were comfortable. Luggage trollies were available when needed. I would recommend a hire car as the shuttle buses are not frequent. With a car the location is great for Disney and Sea World. Placed midway between Crossroads and the 192 it is ideal for restaurants. We stayed one night in Tampa in the Hyatt Place Busch Gardens. This was a very good hotel and we had a nice suite. The problems of hotel rooms (noisy air conditioning, all in one living space, one bathroom, noisy fridge in the same room) all came flooding back and we could not wait to get back to the apartment. It was everything we could have wished for and played a good part in making our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Don't quite understand the glowing reviews...”
Reviews.Author: hlo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two young children and my husband in November of 2008. I have a hard time understanding the glowing reviews. Generally, I've relied upon the TripAdvisor.com reviews and been thrilled, but not this time. Pros: -Great location -- close to Disney w/ easy highway access -Nice Pool -- not quite as great as the pics would lead you to believe, but still nice -Spacious accommodations -- second bedroom was tiny, but still a decent value for price. Cons: -HORRIBLE customer service. Our toilet backed up and despite multiple calls to the front desk and assurances that someone would come up, nobody ever did. We eventually fixed it ourselves...not pretty. Not vacation like at all. -CHEAP-O feeling about the whole place. Furniture was uncomfortable, beds were horrible, etc. Looks like it was constructed in a hurry -- with crooked light switches, etc. I wouldn't stay there again. While I appreciate that I saved a ton of money over staying at Disney, it was a bummer coming back down from the Disney "high" everytime we went back to the hotel. There has to be a better combo of value & niceness out there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, A++++++”
Reviews.Author: mickosull
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 weeks in the Lake Buena vista village resort and spa. We had 2 bed pool view appartment and it was fabulous, Everything you need. When we arrived to check in, the staff were friendly and courtious. The kitchen had all you needed exept enough utensils, contacted reception and within 10 mins we were given everything we wanted. The master bed had the biggest jacuzzi bath...."brill", twin sinks, shower room, toilet, king size bed and tv. Room 2 had 2 queen beds, tv and bathroom off it with shower. Living room / dining room had a table, 4 chairs, couch, coffee table, 55" plasma tv and balcony(with pool view). The pool was the biz, ship with waterslide, mushrooms and water jets. The slide was great for adults and kids and has a little suprise that you dont expect the first time you use it. The pool towels were a little on the small side, but you could use as many as you want and they never ran out. Pool bar was also great, Good food and drink at reasonible prices. The bar staff were brilliant and could not be more friendly and helpful, In particular, I would like to mention Bob the barman who was the best. Frankie farrells irish bar had good food and sport coverage at the bar. The shop was handy but a little expensive. Location, factory outlets nextdoor, Nike, Gap, etc. Check out world of coffee for english newspapers and great coffee. Walmart accross the road ( dont walk ). Disney 10 min drive, universal 15 min, seaworld 15 min and wet and wild ( much better than Aquatica) 15 min. To get the most out of the vacation you will need a car, Shuttles are good but the freedom a car gives is hard to beat. Each Building has ample parking and 2 floors of indoor parking. If you are going to orlando do not go past this Place. We will be back.................

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: VacRedy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to get what you paid for in your reservation do not stay here or at any other Sky Resorts for that matter. We were on vacation traveling with family and friends and made the reservation at this resort because we needed to have a 4 bedroom suite. This reservation was made and paid for in advance but when we arrived to check into our room it was not available! Not sure how that happens but apparently this is a common practice for this resort as there were 2 other families in the lobby having the same problem. Oh and we were offered free housekeeping for our inconvienence!

Reviews.Title: “Been to Florida 3 times, best hotel we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: EastMidlandsFamily
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Florida and we can say it was definatly the best, we stayed form the 28th July till the 11th August. The hotel was huge, the sat nav we got tried to send us the wrong way (it was an old one given by Alamo) the room was a 2 bed 2 bath condo facing the pool in block 1 above reception, geat view of the pool and surrounding countryside. great never having to go early to reserve a sun bed, their was always plent available no matter what time of day you went (also good not to have to take towels or pay for beds!) we went straight to Walmart across the road on first day and stocked up on grocerys and snacks we ate out most nights but the prices have definatly gone up from previous years, it cost between $54 and $80 dollars depending on were you ate for a family of 4 which is roughly the same as eating out in England. We would definalty stay here again as it is local for everything, parks, food and great facilities. Although I have looked at next year's prices and with First choice it has gone up by £900 for a family of four!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - Definite must for Orlando”
Reviews.Author: SJTUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks late July/early August. Easy to find from Sanford Airport and fantastic locations for all the parks. 2 bed room on 14th floor with wonderful views, especially of the fireworks at night. Courteous and helpful staff - had a problem with our safe on the first day and was fixed within 10 mins of reporting it. The swimming pool (pirate ship) was always clean and safe for younger children. Did'nt use the fitness rooms as always to busy! Only small drawback was parking - if you arrived late back the inside car park was full and the bys outside where full - you had to park on the street which felt unsafe. Will be there again early 2011!

Reviews.Title: “What we loved the most was the comfort of home feeling...”
Reviews.Author: blues_traveler72
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. We got a great deal on the room rate and never had to spend a dime eating out as the full kitchen provided us with all the tools needed for a home cooked meal. That was ideal for us as we are a large family. We stayed in a 3/BR 2 BATH suite with sofa bed. The view was breathtaking. Great location. Master bedroom is unbelievable (has a jacuzzi - fits 2). What we loved the most was the comfort of home feeling, tv's in everyroom, beautiful huge pool with a Pirate ship smack dab in the middle (used only as a water slide). What I liked least was having to park a little further away than I would have liked as I was in building 1 on top of the Irish Pub and parking was scarce every night. Also, couldn't enjoy the pool as I wanted to because it mostly rained. Oh, and the other thing that I did not like was a fire alarm going off in the middle of our first night we had to get out of bed and wait for the Fire Dept to come and turn it off. We never received an explanation from anyone about it. But, overall an excellent place to stay. I still highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “ohhh my its fab”
Reviews.Author: mydogsarenuts
Reviews.Content: what can say about this hotel,i could go on for hours.we went in november 08 and got a 3bdr on the 5th floor,we were ALL speechless the check in was extemley fast and effortless after a long flight .We went to our apartment (i would say house )my oh my it was just fab i cant think of a word big enough to descibe it.We have stayed in the average hotels on i drive and villas in kissamee,this one beats a villa for us,we had a our teenage daughter and teenage son with us and i think they would just cry (not cool)if i did not book there this year.We booked through first choice as we have found them to NEVER be beaten on price,we have traveled with them for 6yrs and never had a bad experience.we ate at Frankie Farrels onsite and even had them deliver to our room once too.the shop has everyday thing you need .If you have booked a holiday for to go here i dont think you will be dissapointed,i cant remember which building we stayed in (wish i did coz i would like the same building) it was not the one backing onto the shops it was opposite that .we have previously stayed in a villa which to look at was fab too but the layout was not good for us as the 2 other rooms (kids ones) were at the front of the house and my daughter hated this so much that for 13 nights we had to pull her mattress through to our room as her room was next to the front door.You also have the added peace of mind that there is someone at the front desk all the time,if your kids are old enough they can go to the onsite shop themselves too and the gym ,really easy to find if you are using the 417 toll road its 2 roads and ya there easier to go to either disney or universal as your right in the middle .i am booking this year. We landed on thanksgiving day it was manic at the shops but a few days later it was deathly quiet.we have been in march ,june ,october and november ,,november was the best for everything,hope this has helped anyone looking for reasurance,have a great one (am so envious)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Style”
Reviews.Author: NycCarmenSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here. The resort is conveniently located about 10 minutes away from DisneyWorld. We booked a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom. The master bedroom was immense with its own bathroom (separate toilet room), vanity with double sinks, jacuzzi tub, separate shower and walk in closet. The 2nd bedroom had 2 beds for our kids. All the rooms, including the living room have LCD tvs. The kitchen is beautiful, you have a stove, dishwasher, washer and dryer, coffee pot, utensils, plates, mugs and bowls; plus a HUGE dining area. Having the convenience of the plates, etc. plus the dishwasher saved us SO much money on food. We went to the nearby Walmart and loaded up! All of the decor in here is Tommy Bahama. The second bathroom had a nice linen closet and was really big. The balcony access is through the living room, and was spacious with a table and chairs. We requested a pool view so we could watch the kids from our balcony! The balcony is the only area in the resort where smoking is allowed, other than the pool which some tables are equipped with ashtrays. There are 2 pools, the smaller one almost no one goes to, but I recommend it if you are seeking privacy. The larger pool has a pirate ship with a water slide in it that kids love, a food/drink place, and an elevated sun deck. There are also a couple of hot tubs. Even when the pool was crowded, it was still spacious. There is also a gym near the smaller pool, as well as a bar and a pizza hut. There are premium outlets right across from the hotel! (You can walk there) Arby's, Wendy's, McDonalds and Golden Corral are all very close by. They have shuttles to Disney too in case you don't feel like renting a car. The first time we stayed here in 2006, they were still building. There was no second pool, or places to eat. Now there are at least 3 buildings to stay in, but you can request to stay in the building near the smaller pool and eateries, or near the large pool. The only problems we encountered while here was that the slider on the shower door was broken, and it took maintenance days to fix it. The towel rod in the 2nd bathroom was broke and fell on my daughters toe-they didn’t have much to say about that other than they would have it fixed. Also, our coffee pot broke one morning, they were sending housekeeping over to fix it and it took the guy more than an hour and a half to walk over! How far was he coming? They say there is security here, but honestly other than cleaning/maintenance/front desk people I did not see any security. Parking is free, there are spaces in front of the resort as well as a parking lot. Housekeeping is optional, you can pay an additional fee if you require this service- we didn’t, we washed our towels and took the trash out to the chute in the hallway. There is a spa here, which looked really nice but I did not try. Also, the main lobby has pamphlets about stuff in Orlando, make sure to take some. They also have menus of different buffets and restaurants. You are right by I-4 so this place is convenient to Universal, Sea World and Old Town as well. My advice, stay here, just make sure you inspect the room before you unpack! For the value you get here, it is SO worth it. Even if you came here not for Disney or but just to relax. I would def. stay here again, and hope to be able to do so soon! Please feel free to contact me with any questions, I will be glad to help!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ml3367
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in July just gone in Building 3. The facilities were excellent. The pool was great. Always towels available and it never seemed to fill up (although a lot of people would be too tired to avail of it after an all day excursion to a theme park!). The Irish Pub across the way was also excellent. We went 3 times. Sean was an excellent host and the food was some of the best we had during our stay. The mini-market/Pizza place was handy but a little pricey (pizza's good though!) so ask for directions to the Walmart for your larger shop. The Walmart is a 2 mins drive away (don't try to walk it as there are no footpaths along the way). All the hotel staff were very helpful and we were left to our own devices. The location is pretty much ideal if you like a quiet retreat after a hectic day at a theme park. It's only a couple of miles from Disney and right on the main road that brings you to Universal Studios. There is a free shuttle that runs a couple of times a day but if you can hire a car, do. Everywhere is far away (not the fault of the hotel!) so if you want to go to Walmart or one of the Outlets realistically you need your own transport. There is a small outlet place right beside the hotel but for anything bigger you need to drive there. As someone who had never driven an automatic and is used to driving on the left side of the road it didn't take long to get used to it as the layout of most of the roads make it difficult to go on the wrong side. We had 2 small children with us (3 and 7) and the hotel more than met all our expectations. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tomorrow !”
Reviews.Author: Christine1612
Reviews.Content: We (a party of six) have just stayed at the LBV Resort and Spa for 10 nights. Our 3 bed/2 bath apartment in building 2 was very tidy, clean and spacious. Our only real gripe was that the spa bath broke after the first use and despite two requests for maintenance to take a look they never did but it didnt spoil our holiday by any means and we still had two showers to use. We also couldnt find anywhere to dispose of our rubbish sacks but as we were leaving our apartment on the last day the cleaner told us to leave them outside our room and she would take care of them. The washing machine/tumble dryer came in very useful during our stay also. The accommodation is situated around 10/20 mins from Universal and Epcot. We used the shuttle bus regularily from directly outside reception (you have to book the day before but there is no charge) which ran at 8.20 or 11.20 in the morning to Epcot returning 6.15 or 10.30 p.m. and leaving at 10.40 a.m. returning early evening if you wanted to go to Universal. We found this perfectly adequate as we found 7/8 hours in the parks was quite long enough especially when it was hot and we didnt mind a few early starts. We took the later shuttle if we wanted to stay to see the fireworks in the Disney parks. Although the shuttle only took you to Epcot the bus service from there is very very efficient running every 20 minutes to Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios and for Magic Kingdom you take a monorail. Not having our own transport did not create an issue for us at all. A couple of times we needed a taxi which we took from outside the reception which was $30 to Seaworld/Discovery Cove and around the same to Florida Mall but drivers do expect a tip of around $1 per traveller as do the shuttle drivers. We walked to Walmart for provisions the first day which took around 10 minutes (although it is across a busy highway which is quite scary) and got a taxi back which cost around $9 as the grocery store on site is very expensive. The teenagers in our party used both on site pools which were clean and towels were provided. We had a fantastic holiday and wouldnt hesitate to stay at the LBV Resort & Spa again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Huge Rooms”
Reviews.Author: miztraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights, great location, massive rooms - loved the jacuzzi bath in the master suite! Ideal for disney, only 10 mins drive (if that), and straight up I-4 to Universal and Sea World. Nice pool, shallow area for little ones and the older ones loved the slide on the pirate ship. Didn't use bar next to pool but i believe it is quite expensive. Only problem we had was our dryer broke the 2nd to last day - maintenance came and looked at it, no joy, so were told we should be able to use a dryer in an empty room (going home the next day and had loads of wet cloths) - however this didn't happen and we left a message for the duty manager who never got back to us - hard to believe not one empty room in a hotel of that size! Other than that, would recommend - we only ate in the first night but the kitchen has everything you need. Bedrooms and bathrooms more than adequate and very comfy beds! If you stay in an appt you need to get rid of your own rubbish - we just used the bins outside the lift area (as did most people i think). All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms and Staff - Busy Location”
Reviews.Author: WVFoodFan
Reviews.Content: This facility was very clean, the room amenities were new and the staff was attentive and helpful. The only downside is the location which close to Disney but very busy if you are trying to relax (next to an outlet mall). We changed rooms the first night because our room faced the pool and despite the good soundproofing, there was constant screaming from kids on the slide. They were great at accomodating us but had to move us to a smoking room that faced the highway. All in all, really nice place if you are not planning on spending much time at the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!!! Very close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: nsteiler
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect, The best thing about it was that it was, wait, there were a lot of great things at the location! You can watch the evening fire works from the balcony each night, you can rest and go back to the parks whenever you like! The jacuzzi tub was awesome at the ned of a very long day! Take advantage of it! The furniture is very nice, but you are never in the condo if you are visiting all the parks in one week! Just rent the condo for a mini vacation, and go to the water parks!!! The staff was very hospitable, and gave us extra laundry detergent, faxed and printed things for us, for free!! I would definately go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, could not ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: TheLancsLad
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of friends looking to sample Orlando for the first time. We expected fake American enthusiasm and lack-lustre service, what we got was beyond belief! The service (in general) was second to none, the staff are always only too happy to help you out. Whether looking for directions, restaurant recommendations or one off requests they are always pleased you asked. The apartment was huge, not "oh this is roomy" kind of huge, I mean "you could happily move in for an extended stay" large. There is a risk you may loose children in wardrobes! The main bedroom had the largest bed in existence and a jacuzzi that easily fit two people. The shower cubicle was the size of most UK bathrooms. "His and her" sinks ensured plenty of mirror space and I'm reliably informed that the hair dryer(s), whilst not the best were more than adequate. The furniture was comfortable and perfect after a long day wandering round theme parks. The balcony / patio had views for miles, although all you could see of interest was the theme park(s) and fireworks of an evening (usually from Sea World). The Kitchen was well kitted out with a fridge, microwave, cooker / hob, kettle(!!), dishwasher and food waste disposal system. The washer / dryer wasn't the best but certainly did its job. More than anything the place was spotlessly clean. The underground car parks ensured a cool car during the day, otherwise the temps might be a little aggravating. The room air conditioning worked so well it made us too cold on occasion, something due mainly to my tinkering with the temps in oF, not oC. If you go with the expectation of a hotel you may be disappointed. For me the optional room service was great. Please note on check out you will have to pay a "resort fee". For two weeks this worked out to be about £70, payable either by cash or credit card. The hotel is next door to a reasonable shopping center, and five minutes drive from the Orlando premium outlets, a Mecca for any shop-a-holic. Walmart is five minutes away by car and was cheap for all the essentials you'd need when self catering and provided the perfect balance between eating out and eating healthy. Overall I'd be happy to recommend and will certainly stay here on our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great complex......brill pool”
Reviews.Author: Jeskie
Reviews.Content: Visited Florida as a family for the first time this year as a family of four including grandparents. I had followed previous reviews re BV on TripAdvisor after this complex was recommend to me. I was not disappointed. Our room was perfect with everything you require for your holiday. Wouldn't bother with the maid service as you have a trash area on each floor and you could wash and dry bedding etc if required as there is a washer dryer in accommodation. Pool, brilliant - it was spotless as well as the whole complex. Used Pizza Hut on several occasions and couldn't fault it. Reports on shop true, it is pricey and pub ok for a bite to eat. All in all I would definitely recommend and we have already booked it again for next year. Lets hope the standards are as high for our next visit!! Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Have returned for another vacation!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoTrips4
Reviews.Content: It's more like a condo, than a hotel. The master bedroom has a king size bed and a huge full size jacuzzi tub. The beds are so comfortable. The kids had a separate bedroom with two twin beds and a big bathroom. The kitchen is great and so is having a washer and dryer. They have two pools. There is an Outlet Mall next door, but you don't mind because you are so comfortable in your room. It's a home away from home. We came back again and stayed two years in a row. Really close to Disney and about 10 minutes from Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LuvTravel9999
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great value for the money. It was very clean, good size for our family of five, comfortable furniture and nicely decorated. Everyone was super friendly and hospitable. There were a few quirks with the room we stayed in (building 2). We were on the ground floor right in front of the parking lot, so we couldn't take advantage of our patio. Also, the knob to the dryer kept falling off, the toilet paper roll kept falling off and also the towel bar in the bathroom. Also, its very odd that building 2 doesn't have a garbage room. The front desk told us to leave our garbage outside our door and someone would pick it up. After a couple of calls back to front desk, I finally threw out our trash in the garbage can by the front door. They also didn't turn on our phone, gave us only one extra roll of toilet paper, and only just enough towels. We had to go to the front desk to request these be adjusted. These little kinks didn't dampen our stay though, we had a great time here! 80)

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the stay until we got home and got the added charge”
Reviews.Author: Donegal2007
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotel beginning of June with 3 young kids aged 9, 7 & 4. Ideally located close to Disney and all major attrations by car. Not so good if you would like to walk through International Drive and have a few drinks and not worry about getting taxi's. The two bed apartment in block 3 was excellant with loads of room and plenty of facilities. Anyone used to self catered accommodation in Spain will be more than impressed with apartment. The pool is excellant and the kids really enjoyed the pirate ship and slide. The pool side bar was very expensive at 6 dollars for 1 slushie which adds up when you have three kids who like to drink constantly! I really enjoyed the accommodation and would have recommended it however a few weeks after we returned I received my credit card bill with a charge of 112 dollars. After a couple of calls they eventually told me that they couldnt find my booking. When explained the charge the guy on the phone told me it was a service charge of 8 dollars per day for parking and maintenance of the pool area. I explained that I had paid all charges in advance through my internet company Alpha Rooms. He said that I should be contacting Alpha Rooms as they should have informed me of this additional charge. I will be contacting my credit card company to refuse payment of this fee. Unfortunately this has left a bad taste!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheryl h
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel with my sister and brother in 07 hotel was great had lots of building work going on but was no bother as did not take much notice my brother has been back to this hotel since and all work has been completed and is a stunning first class hotel near disney and all you need friendly people and great for people who love shopping as have shopping complex behind the hotel which is great also has a gym if you eat to much lovely american food like i did and i did use the gym lol and also has a large swimming pool with a big pirate ship and slids and also a smaller pool for little ones kids will love it highly recommened hotel rooms are like a apartment all you need is in the room if your gonna stay in orlando then i say book this hotel you will not be dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Large room”
Reviews.Author: cookrd59
Reviews.Content: Good stay, expensive though and the commom areas elevator, garage and lobby areas bldg 3 were dirty. Maintenace was quick to respond and the area is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, would stay again and would recommend”
Reviews.Author: neicyj
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel stayed from 7/6-7/11. This place was nice. I read up on the hotel before I booked so I was not expecting the Plaza Hotel. Rooms were spacious enough room for the 8 people I planned for and the extra person who bunked with us last minute. I booked a 3 bed/ 3 bath. It was great having a kitchen to make meals. The location was perfect for what we had planned, only a few minutes to all the parks and places to eat. Directions were a little confusing even with a GPS but we found it. The kids loved the Pirate ship pool. The jacuzzi in the the master suites were nice, a great way to relax after being in the parks all day. I loved the balcony we had was real big and you could get to it from all the rooms. My only complaint about the balcony there was not a lot of furniture on it for how big it was. I gave service a bad review even though the check in staff was nice and the check out guy, because I asked for sheets for the pull out couch on our first night. They never got delivered even though I was told twice they would be. I was told check the closet, nothing was in the closet. On the second night I went to go get the iron and the sheets were there, not sure if they were brought in when we were out. But I didn't like they were brought in put in the closet with no one even telling me they were in the room. The beds were not that comfortable either. Other then that we had a peaceful week, and the place was nice. Would come back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: travelinwithkidz
Reviews.Content: Chose as an off-site to visit Disney/surrounding area. Did not have to wait to check in. Trainee was at front desk but was quickly helped by supervisor on duty. Supervisor helped me choose room based on my family's needs. 3 bd/2ba condo, clean and roomy for under $150/nt. Basic amenities were missing in 2nd bath, probably an oversight and did not affect my opinion of stay. Stayed in Building 5 near the Pirate Pool. Buildings 1 & 2 are quieter but farther away. Had nice view of Seaworld and MKs fireworks at night. This is not your typical hotel. You must pay for housekeeping and take out your own trash. We didn't mind this at all and actually preferred the quiet, uninterrupted stay. Kitchen is stocked basic but enough to make meals comfortably. Table and chairs on balcony as well. Shuttle times to SeaWorld and Disney are a joke. I didn't care since I wasn't relying on them. You must book 1 night ahead with front desk to guarantee availability. We drove, ate the $12 parking the days we went and came/went as we pleased. Check out was quick. Woman at front was not friendly, didn't ask how stay was. Irish Pub onsite had GREAT fish and chips. Atmosphere was quiet and service was good. Overall, the place was quiet, spacious and clean. Would stay again if looking for an off-site stay near Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property that made the trip a HUGE success!”
Reviews.Author: MetroWWHS
Reviews.Content: AMAZING PORPERTY!!! I am a band director at a high school and planned a trip with 70 of my students. For our annual band trip, I generally book hotels that are in the "upper echelon" (nothing less than an upscale Marriott is my golden rule). Our tour/travel company (GTC Travel...AMAZING FOLKS BTW, Marie Sperling contact) suggested staying in Condos. When all was said and done, GREAT CHOICE!!!!! OK, now on to the property: Rooms were awesome and all suites were very nice...ten of my students shared the 4 bedroom, 4 bathroom 2600 SQ Ft. Condo on the 15th floor. It was literally the size of a GIANT home and took up half the floor. Furnishings were nice, Dining room table was able to accomodate 12 of us (felt like the knights of the roundtable), TV's were LCD and HUGE, and 2 master suites. One of our tour assistants actually did cartwheels up and down the living room floor area (HUGE) and Absolutely beautiful. My room was a 3 bedroom condo with a large master suite with king bed. Mini walk in closet, Nice size, bathroom was amazing and one of the largest bathrooms I have seen at any condo...and if my wife traveled with me (she did not) it would have been very romantic - hot tub was close to the bed and very pretty room! The POOL WAS TO DIE FOR! The Pirate ship slide was amazing and my students literally asked to give up 1/2 a day at a Disney Park to hang by the pool. PARENTS, I think your kids would love this place...as an adult, I also loved the slide and whirlpool/jacuzzis...BTW, Someone else who rated this hotel actually wrote to say the pool was not that big...I have to say that person was 100% wrong. There was room for many of my 70 students and scores of other people, and no one complained one bit. Also, they have a nice poolside "tiki bar" with lunch/snack area that was useful! Tons of tables and chairs too, as well as lounge/deck chairs to sunbathe. There were many jacuzzi's as well around the pool, not sure how many, but I do remember at least 4. Although I did not use the pool area behind the Pirate ship, I did notice many people over on that side as well. Personally, I utilized the Spa portion of this resort and was EXTREMELY satisfied. The folks there were very nice, and the Spa was truly exquisite, though a bit empty, as I was the only one using the Spa...(not a bad thing mind you). GREAT massage and pedicure (note my students "teased me" endlessly for the latter). Anyway, needless to say, I can't imagine anyone paying rediculous Disney Property prices, when for a fraction of the cost you could stay at this property! Zero complaints and I believe if they can accomodate 70 band geeks (and let me tell you, they are a tough bunch to please), they can do it for you too!

Reviews.Title: “military cheaters”
Reviews.Author: airdaleaz2
Reviews.Content: I am in the army, and our schedule changes alot. Ok, I made a reserv. of $834 in May for one date, six (6) days, for block leave in late June. I had to change because our dates for leave changed 3 times. Understandable? Yes. Ok I got my leave dates finalized and changed the reserv. by one day and they upped the price because of the 4th july. Understandable. Got down to the hotel and they totally deleted the first price of and tried to charge me $1065. I got on the phone and got my price back down to $834. I had to threaten with the BBB and Military BBB. Then found out that they only run shuttles 8:15am and 11:15am to park and return 6:15 and 10:15 pm return. What kind of BS is that, especially if you have kids?

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: cityboy_nz
Reviews.Content: I won 4 nights at this place and to be honest this would be the only time i'd ever stay here. 1. 30+ minutes wait to check in, only 2 people in line and two counter staff, one a trainee and the other his supervisor, who was not helping him, he kept telling the lady in front of us that he didn't know this and that because he has not been trained on whatever system. The process of checking in was long and painful for some reason, after what seemed forever we were given our room key in building 2 which is a good few minutes walk in the humidity. 2. We dragged our bags there only to be stopped at the entry door to the building, our room key which should have granted us access was not working. We tried for several minutes, when just about to give up someone came buy and said, it's been broken for a few days, just pull the door really hard and it pops open, sure enough it worked, so much for a secure building. 3. Take the elevator to the 7th floor only to discover that our room, door open, was yet to be serviced, the housekeeper was still working on another room and not yet started on this one. Of course there was no house phone on any floor except the lobby, I called the front desk only to be told that I was wrong and the room was showing as being serviced, after a heated discussion we were told to come back to reception for another room. 4. Of course there were now 10+ people in the queue, I made eye contact to the guy that checked in who signalled me to him, as soon as I approached the front desk the nasty supervisor yelled at me, "excuse me, you can't push in", the guy tried to explain to her what was happening and she yelled at me again to return to the back of the line. Almost 1 hour later I reach the desk, no apology or anything, just given another room key, same building as before but on the 2nd I had requested several months before. 5. Arrive at room finally and surprise, surprise the room key does not work! the guy had not reprogrammed them from our old room, so another walk back to the front desk, another long wait in the queue to get a dirty look and rolled eyes from the supervisor, we get the keys reprogrammed. 6.
