Room itself was actually quite nice, we had a 2 bedroom suite, nice and clean, surprised to find out there is no housekeeping provided for free, it was $20-30 per day if you want your room serviced. I welcome letter in the room saying thanks for staying with us and we hope you enjoy the free voucher book you received upon check in - which we didn't receive. 7. Spa bath in the master bedroom did not work either, no bubbles or lights, just water seeping out of the controls when you push them. Several lights blown throughout suite and fluro lights in the kitchen blinking on and off. 8. When we were next at the front desk we asked for the free voucher booklet we should have received at check in, only to be given blank looks by the 3 counter staff. I explained that it was mentioned in the welcome letter but again was only given a blank look. I had to return to the room to get the letter and show them, and after several calls they knew what it was and gave me a voucher booklet. 9. Internet is available in the foyer for a minimal charge for 15 minutes use, however the mouse provided is so crusty that the wheel on the mouse barely moves, spent half my time trying to mover the cursor across the screen. 10. Confusing address for the resort, 2 completly different address's provided by the hotel. We caught a taxi to Sea World, according to the hotel website is only 4.5 miles away, in taxi turned out to be 18 mins away in no traffic and was $26, that was not the bad thing, on our return we asked several taxi drivers to take us to the resort and none of them knew where it was. When we gave one of the address's I wrote down from the hotel it was not even in the drivers GPS. Overall I was disappointed with the resort, especially the service or lack there of. Lack of security, strange people walking in and out of the place, non resort people in the pool area, but that's another story.

Reviews.Title: “Oh so comfy...”
Reviews.Author: Georgiagirl1980
Reviews.Content: The suite was magnificent. It was nicely decorated and extremely spacious in the bedrooms. We were in a 3 bdrm/3 bath. The layout was great with the jucuzzi tubs being right beside the beds, just like a honeymoon suite. The mattresses were extremely soft and plenty of closet space. Only downside, you have to get the housekeeping (extra $$) in order to get more towels, trash emptied, or more tissue/paper towels. This was explained in the policy but just make sure you bring detergent and extra tissue/paper towels. There is a washer/dryer in the unit and the trash shoot in on the end of each hall. You can walk across the parking lot to the outlets and there is a wal-mart right about 1 block down the road. I will stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “relax in style”
Reviews.Author: eholt
Reviews.Content: the apartment was one of the best i have stayed at. three bedrooms (2 ensuite)lounge. dining area, kitchen.balcony. ever convenence you could think of.the spa bath in the master bedroom , well it was just supurb we we could get to it before any body else.the suites are just as showen in the advertisements .the pool was a dream for the children.plenty of space ,toels AND sunbeds

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings: Great for a large family - OK furnishings - check your bill”
Reviews.Author: ctyankee5759
Reviews.Content: My family, my sister's family, and mom (5 adults, 4 children) stayed here for 4 nights on a mini-family reunion while visiting Disney World. For us, the best thing about this hotel was that we were able to all stay together in one 3-bedroom, 3 bathroom suite. This was so convenient and fun - much nicer and a much better value than having separate, adjoining hotel rooms. Two bedrooms each had a king bed, one bedroom had two twin beds, and there was a couch in the living room. One negative thing about the sleeping arrangement is that in the king bedrooms there is no wall between the glass shower area and the bed - so if you have a child sharing your king bed with you, you have to wait until the child wakes up and leaves the room before you can take a shower, unless you don't mind taking a shower right in front of them. We did have some problems with the furnishings: refrigerator leaked, getting water on a lot of our food; dryer knob kept falling off; air conditioner didn't work. When we checked out, there was a large charge for a long-distance phone call - about $250 - which was made midday, which we didn't make. The clerk said the only people who have keys to the room are maintenence and housekeeping, so she didn't see how it could be a mistake. But it was, because we were always at Disney World every day. She believed us and removed the charge without a problem, but it made us check our wallets and luggage to make sure no credit cards etc. were missing. So overall, a great place to stay with a group, but it's not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY Great place, just needs upgrade on little things!”
Reviews.Author: EllicasMom
Reviews.Content: I am a hotel snob...i will say that first and foremost, so take my review as you will. Me, my husband and two girls 4 and 6 were traveling with two coupoles, one who had 3 small boys, aged 1, 4 and 5. One couple stayed in a one bedrooom, and the rest of us stayed in the 4 bedroom suite room 2803 in building 2. CHECKIN was fast, which is always wonderful, but it was straight up 4pm b/c the hotel was full, no problem. ROOM: Upon entering the room, we were very excited about the cleanliness, roominess and the wondeful layout. 2 master suites flank each end, complete with jacuzzi tubs, large stall shower and sliding glass doors to a balcony that stretches the full length of the suite. (which had two tables and 8 chairs outside). There were two additional full bathrooms, and two additional bedrooms, both with two twin beds. All of the bedrooms were very roomy and had dressers and closets, tvs. Living room in the center of the suite had one sofa and two chairs, large tv, sliding doors to balcony. Our room was carpeted throughout, except baths and kitchen had tile. (The neightbors across the hall from us had ceramic tile throughout except bedrooms). Master bedrooms had great blackout curtains, but the two twin bedrooms DID NOT only had slat blinds, which insured the little ones to be wide awake at the crack of dawn b/c those windows faced east! Be aware! There were plenty of extra blankets and pillows in the closets though, and that was great! Also an iron and ironing board. The pictures online did not do the rooms justice, we were very pleased. NOW for the negatives in the room: Upon beginning to cook our first meal (spaghetti) we realized the refrigerator was not getting cold so someone ended up having to come up to "reset" it twice in two days. Eventually the second day it got cold and started making ice as well. The toaster was missing some knobs, our blender (which we just wanted to use as a pitcher b/c there are no pitchers available) leaked and we had to get a new one, no cookie/baking sheets, the wine corkscrew was broken, and no frying type pans whatsoever, only saucepans. These were all little inconveniences that added up to a poorly stocked kitchen. The washer and dryer were fabulous in the rooms, just be aware that this is a hotel that runs more like a condo, as you do not get daily housekeeping service, change of sheets and new towels. You wash your own towels, etc. You do have the option for cleaning services for an additional fee. Oh, and theres no vaccuum cleaner or broom, just FYI. And our dryer took 4 cycles to dry a load of towels, bummer, but no biggie. NOW THE POOL!!! As i mentioned above, we were traveling with 5 small children and so keeping them happy is priority number one. This pool delivered! The pictures online DO NOT do this pool justice. It was awesome! The kiddie area is very large and so much fun! It's zero-entry pool with water mushrooms and a large ledge around the edge for ease of entrance and exit along the sides. The pool bottom was kinda rough, so make sure to bring water shoes! We had a baby with blisters on day two, so be aware! There are several tables with umbrellas near the water, as well as many lounge chairs. They also have the perfect low tables and chairs for sitting in the water while watching your kiddies. We moms loved these! There was a hottub and shower nearby as well as full towel service. (the towels are just kind of small). The opposite end of the pool seemed to be much quieter and away from all the little kids, it was a nice spot near two more hot tubs and a shower. BUT, the main attraction of course is the pirate ship waterslide! It was so much fun, i think we parents loved it more than our kids! It was quite a thrill that was not expected! They will let parents take their kids down on laps, so no worries, but by the end of the week, our 4, 5 and 6 year olds were doing it all by themselves! And it's even more fun at night! OH, and another main attraction, at least for us moms was the pool bar. Apparently, it is not in conjunction with the hotel, it is ran as a restaurant on the premesis, but no matter. The drinks werent cheap, of course, but the Lani's Lua Punch was fabulous for $8 with tip. And the 15% gratuity is already added to each drink, so dont throw another buck down on the bar! (One waiter , Bob, told me that I should come back later to check all my tab charges to the room, and also bring an additional tip back with me since i obviously didnt have any cash on me at the time! Whatever, not NOW buddy!) Which reminds me, there are no coolers allowed in the pool area, so do what we did and hide it under a towel! I mean come on...it was 98 degrees one day and our kids wanted cold water, we were not about to buy it from the bar! FOOD: There is a Pizza Hut on the premesis, in the bottom of building 2, across the parking lot from the pool. You can pick it up, it was $14 per medium pizza, and they DONT take Amex, btw. The bar also has wings, and personal pizzas, ice cream and other bar food that was good. My husband was the most excited about the Irish Pub that is at the hotel! It was typical American-Irish faire, but lots of beer! It was good food and best of all, close and never overcrowded. We had 12 total and never had to wait for a table. Servers were a little cooky, but overall quick, good service. Apparently, there is also this fabulous SPA but as a mom with small kids, i didnt even get to see it with my own two eyes. CRAZY: (I always seem to have a crazy category) We did have this crazy fiasco on our last day where we got locked out of our room for 4 hours, and countless members of the hotel staff were involved in fixing a broken lock on our door, but the management and maintenance staff were so friendly, helpful and just plain wonderul that they really went the extra mile to make us comfortable and compensate for our missed dinner reservations at Rainforest Cafe! They actually reimbursed us for clothes we had to buy our kids (all they had were wet bathing suits!) treated us to dinner at the pub, and then arranged for a shuttle to take us to and from Rainforest Cafe for breakast the next morning! It all worked out! LOCATION: this hotel sits in the same parking lot as a pretty great outlet mall. Came in handy when our carkeys were locked in the room and we had to walk to Old Navy to buy our kids underwear and clothes!! DOWNTOWN DISNEY is very close, only a couple of miles away. Traffic is crazy all the time, but its Disney! Expect it! WALMART is almost within walking distance, (busy highway though!) just down the road not even 1/4 mile. Liquor store in the same parking lot, too! All in all, I would DEF stay here again, the price was just fantastic as long as you dont mind huffing it to the pool a little jog, and doing your own towels and sheet! So, for a hotel snob, i was pretty impressed and overall happy with this hotel!! We all had a blast and just out and out loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an overpriced vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: ptc712
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in a three-bedroom condo -- two adults, two teens, one young adult. We didn't spend THAT much time in the rooms, but they were perfect to come back to. A TV in every room, a very usalbe kitchen with all the basic amenities to cook any meal. The dryer was great to have since we all got drenched in a monsoon one night. Each room had its own bathroom -- two of the bathrooms were in the bedrooms, which was convenient. The rooms are furnished very basic -- there's nothing luxurious about the mattresses, bedding, towels, bathroom fixtures, or kitchen appliances and plates. But, we ate our best meals in Orlando from food we prepared in the kitchen, bought from the Publix which was a five minute car ride away. Disney World itself is about a 10 minute car ride away. The resort has a small pool and a large one -- we actually didn't make it to the pools. If we make it back to Orlando, we would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PatRonNic
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 8 nights at LBV Resort Village and Spa, it is great for families or couples. We stayed in 2 bed suite and had plenty of space for three adults, the apartment was clean and had a good standard of decoration. They were well equipped although an electric kettle would have been great as the Whistling one they supply to heat on the hob took ages, this is a very minor point. Plenty of towels, struggled to find anything wrong with them. As has been mentioned before onsite shop expensive but what do you expect for convenience. We visit Orlando every year at least once and have done for the last 16 years, but the first time to suites, it met all our needs, we cannot complain. We usually stay in a private villa and in comparison there was no difference in price for the same number of nights in a private villa to the suites, so just personal choice. We enjoyed our stay there and would return anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for condo vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Brit_In_FL
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a hotel then this is not the place you want (hence some of the poor reviews) but if a condo is what you want, this place is wonderful. A condo was what we wanted for our stay and we couldn't have done any better. We had a two bedroom for 5 days, the size was great, it was clean and well furnished. We all loved the Jetted tub. We all loved the pool. Yes the on site store and bar by the pool is over prized but aren't they always? The onsite Irish place did great value food and lots of other places close by to eat and purchase food. We were very impressed and will visit again for sure. Didn't see much of the staff other than check in and out but they could have been a little friendlier. Florida residents, watch out for discounts and also early check in and late check out deals, we got almost a full extra day:-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: StitchSouthTyneside
Reviews.Content: Ive been to Orlando 5 times and this is one of the best places I've stayed. Check in very quick. Rooms very large and beautiful.Staff very polite.Pictures on website are accurate.I e-mailed the resort before we traveled and requested building 5 as I had concerns about buildings 1 and 2 they promptly replied. We were in building 5 a 3 bedroom/2 bathroom in a corner room where we could see the Disney fireworks at night. You do NEED a car to get around, 5/10 mins drive to Walt Disney World. If you do your homework before you go then you know you do not get maid service free only if you pay extra and of course which on-site shop is not expensive Wal mart is about 2 mins drive.The washer and dryer were a great convenience to do the towels and my own dirty laundry before we left for home. Overall a very nice place to stay! Ive stayed at the Springhill Suites at the Marriott Village and I would also recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jen157
Reviews.Content: What excellent accommodation! This was our 3rd time in Florida and certainly the best holiday ever. The rooms are excellent and are exactly as they are shown on the website - very spacious, fully equipped kitchen, spa bath in master bedroom etc etc - very, very spacious. The entire complex is very clean, friendly and nothing is too much trouble. Our children were in their element with the Pirate Ship in the pool. The pool is open from 7am until 10pm which is very unusual, but a godsend when you come back from the theme parks very hot. The location is great - we were in most of the parks within approx 10mins and it's not at all noisy. Another favourite was the carpark - it is undercover so you're not getting in to a scorching ho car. It was that good, we are looking to go back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: pampoll
Reviews.Content: A very nice clean Hotel. We stayed for one week and the accomindation was just what we wanted. It was very clean and comfortable.The master bedroom has a large on -suite. The bed was very comfortable . In the second bedroom there was two double beds , my 12 year old and 14 year old thought this was great. The kitchen area had everything you needed. The staff were very nice and the Lady selling the park tickets was very helpfull. Also being a big hotel complex we never heard any noise from the other people staying there, eg; no doors banging or next door or above. The location was perfect for us, this was our 5th visit to Orlando, so we know the area well , all the parks are nice and close. There is a Wal mart just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations On Every Level”
Reviews.Author: surveyrn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went Memorial Day week (Sat to Sat) to celebrate my college graduation. We were upgraded to a 3 bedroom condo without asking and it was gorgeous! It was clean, with comfortable beds, fantastic amenities, and extremely quiet for being Building 1 next to the pool. We checked in early and were allowed access to the room. It was minutes from all the Disney Parks and Kissimee attractions. Staff were courteous and extremely helpful, even printing out our boarding passes when the computers were down. We did not use the pools but they were nice and clean. We did our own cleaning and laundering of towels, which was no problem! It was kind of depressing to leave and come home. Maybe two weeks next year! Great place for a great price, I have absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: goonerman101
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with all mod cons. In the kitchen, dishwasher, washing machine / tumble dryer. In the main bedroom, jacuzzi and walk-in shower and closet. Excellent location for Disney, Seaworld and 20 minutes from Orlando international, Outlet stores on doorstep. Very comfortable and enjoyed stay.

Reviews.Title: “This Resort and its Themed Pool Area was absolutely FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: loveorlando18
Reviews.Content: We just were there over the memorial day weekend holiday with multiple family members - sort of a "family reunion". It really was great, even with some rainy days! Pool Bar was fantastic - something I would of thought belonged right in Disney World with the Pirate Ship - my granddaughter loved it. The Bartenders there was so nice...even the food was good...and since we were also spending a day in Universal it was a great location. And - the last day we were there, I checked out the Spa upstairs...it was so beautiful and peaceful. This place is now my "must stay" destination when we go up to Orlando (which we do often, we are disney passholders).

Reviews.Title: “Terrific fun at a terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ticky58Uk
Reviews.Content: This property is fantastic, the rooms must be seen to be believed. Our master bedroom had the biggest bed I've ever seen and the jacuzzi bath was great. I paid for a full clean ($35) at the start of the second week and the maid did a great job. All staff that I had contact with were great, very helpul and efficient. The free shuttle service is very efficient but as this property is not services by a bus routea car would be if not essential then extremely useful. The hotel has a very comfortable lounge area but has no wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome”
Reviews.Author: TammyH12
Reviews.Content: Not much more to say....shopping was awesome, pool is awesome, service is awesome, food was awesome, the rooms and the space in them was incredible especially having 2 small children. I would ask for 2 double beds in the spare room for the kids instead of singles as my kids roam around in bed and my 2 year old fell out and hit his head on the floor (which is only concrete under the carpet). The laundry in the room was a huge help to us and did I mention the pool. There was more to this place then what we got to see in 3 nights and would definitely go back there. No wireless internet though which sucks - but the cable does plug in next to the sofa so you can sit back and relax while looking for info like we did. Not much more to say but stay there. We booked off booking.com - dirt dirt cheap for this place - only $99 a night for a huge 2 bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: latinlady702
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort Memorial Day weekend and were pleased with the size of the suite. We had a 3 bdrm / 2 bath and had 6 people with plenty of space left over. Overall the room was very clean and had everything we needed for the weekend. The furniture was a little dated but it was still clean. The kitchen was very nice and had everything we needed. There is no daily room service but can be added for additional charge. We had to walk down the hall to dump the trash and we washed our own towels while we were there since there is a washer / dryer in each room. Walmart is less than 1 mile away so you can buy everything you need to include Disney gifts. We did take advantage of the spa and got a massage - I have had better massages but for the price it could have been better. The kids loved the pool especially the big boat slide. There was a mini convenient store located in the resort that had everything in it including a Pizza Hut Express. A good family stay but wouldnt recommend for a couple trying to have a romantic escape.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday thanks to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lannae
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the week of May5, for 8 days. We have been to Florida before but this was the first time staying at this hotel and when we first pulled up the out side appearance was nice. As we checked in we asked about the shuttle, or car rental, the front desk staff was amazing, the one staff member stepped up and said that he would find some prices for us and by the time we were to be settled he would call, sure enough he did find us a great deal and had made all the arrangements for us!! That took some stress off of us!! The same night we did notice a wasp nest being built on our deck and made it impossible for us to go out and enjoy the warm air, so we called, with in the hour someone was up, the next day our air conditioner did not work, with in 20 min someone was up, when they could not fix it, they moved us and asked if we had a preference on which building..all these little things really add up, you really notice the costumer service here. It made the trip what it was, fantastic!! GREAT STAFF!! The Pool was great for all ages,very relaxing,towels provided there, pool bar very nice, the hotel was right next to a great outlet mall with great deals, you could also see the fireworks from our balcony!!...And last but not least, great rooms, it was very neat and clean, two bedrooms,nice large T.V, pretty comfy beds. Just great!! and the location was perfect, right in the middle of all of it, and we had no problems getting around. In the end, this hotel is what made this one of our favorite trips!!! Cant wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lankylad1
Reviews.Content: My family have just had two great weeks at LBV Resort Village. The accommodation could not be faulted -the size and quality of the rooms and furnishings was excellent. But British visitors beware. Maid service is not included unlike in European self-catering appartments. There is no weekly change of bedding or towels and not even replenishment of toilet rolls. Maid service IS available at an extra charge. This was not made clear to us by the travel company when we booked. I would advise against shopping on site - it was exorbitant when compared tp WalMart 400 yards down the road eg 2 quarts milk in Pizza hut Express store $3.88, Walmart about $1.90. Also on WalMart shopping centre there are some decent eating houses. We found the Oriental Gourmet Chinese Restaurant which does a delivery service - very good and reasonably priced - a meal for 4 came to about $30. My biggest problem was finding the place on our first day thanks to misleading directions fom the tour operator. From Sandford International use the 417 {unfortunately a toll road) to Junction 6 Exit her then at next traffic lights make a left turn onto Rte 535. Keep in left hand lane, go under the 417 overpass and turn left immediarely at the next set of lights,

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable Appartments”
Reviews.Author: Baroniestad
Reviews.Content: Arrived early in the afternoon at the reception. Within 2 minutes the reception area was able to check us in. The appartments are very spacious. We booked a four person appartment which was huge. The appartment had two bedrooms and two bathrooms. The master bedroom even had a hottub which even had a light show in it. Kitchen had everything that you need for a comfortable holiday. At the time we were visiting Orlando it was very cold so we didn´t make use of the pool area. The pools however did look comfortable and clean The location of the appartments is ok. You are close to the highway. If you go for a Disney holiday it is about a 20 minute drive to the disney parks. If you go for shopping you are on the right location. The Lake Buena Vista Outlet is next to the appartments furthermore a five minute drive away there is another outlet If you want to have nice and spacious appartment and value for your money I would recommend the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent DIY Base”
Reviews.Author: gav340
Reviews.Content: The rooms were huge, with own kitchen, dining and lounge areas. Deep hot tub and large showers. In a great location, 5 minutes from Disney, 15/20 from universal. would recommend (and have done) to anyone visiting orlando. The only downside was the lack of a maid serivce. The hotel says this is to 'reduce its carbon output through washing of linens's etc". The staff other than that were great it has to be said. Will 100% be our base for every future trip to the sunshine state!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Resort!”
Reviews.Author: bibica16
Reviews.Content: I was at the Lake Buena Vista Resort on May 15,and when i entered the room i was in shock,it was beautiful,amazing,very clean and neat. Suite,living room,double queen bad room,kitchen,bathrooms,everything incredible. The view from the varanda was very admirable. Since i was there for only two nights i could not enjoy the whole resort,but two days was enough to know that Lake Buena Vista Resort is a great Resort,and has a very good assistance. Now that i know this Resort im sure that there is no other place better than Lake Buena Vista and that every time that i go to orlando i will look for the availability to stay with you guys. I will recommend Lake Buena Vista to all of my friends. Also Lake Buena Vista gave me a excellent price. I was 150% satisfied with Lake Buena Vista service and Resort! Thank You Guys!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Wiebgrandvillemi
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious for a family of seven. We all had a great experience. The children loved the pool. We definitely would go here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: jennybenny12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a one day trip to Disney. It was a perfect distance to the parks! The day we got to the hotel, we were there early so we had lunch outside at the Irish Pub right on the hotel premises. It was great! The pool was everything that it advertised as well as the TIki Bar. We had two small children (ages 2 and 3) with us and we were able to sit in the water in lounge chairs while they played in the zero entry pool. The pirate ship seperated the low end of the pool and the deep end so we could keep a close eye on the boys. We got a 3 bedroom suite for four adults and two children and it was a perfect size. It was truly like a condo style room. The only downside is that we did not stay any longer so we could truly enjoy the pool area and the daiquiri's a little more. :) Oh yeah, and we did not get time to go into all of the outlet shops but they were right there on the property and they had a lot of our favorite stores.

Reviews.Title: “affordable and elegant”
Reviews.Author: refresh37
Reviews.Content: beautiful place, nice to have an opportunity to spend a few nights at the most elegant and affordable resort that i have been to in all of the years i have traveled to orlando. staff was very friendly and welcoming i will definately keep this resort in mind when i return to orlando

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Pools, Terrible Front Desk and Maid Service”
Reviews.Author: bertola7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 1 week stay at this resort. Although I knew we wouldn't be getting daily maid service, (it's an extra $5 per day for clean towels and garbage removal) I couldn't even get fresh towels. Why should I have to use my own detergent to wash the hotel towels??? Also the rooms should have curtains as well as blinds, our room was south facing, and the light would come in the room as early as 6:30am. The people at the front desk really need some customer service training. I had to call down 3 times to try to figure out how to make a collect call, and was then told I had a block on my line. Also the internet use in the lobby area is terrible, it's so slow and uses up all your money before you can check a few e-mails. Last year we stayed at the Floridays Resort and found it a much nicer place all-round and would probably stay there next time. All in all not a bad place as long as you are aware of the little things. The pool was great, and the rooms are very spacious. Also the location to shopping is great as Super Wal-Mart is just down the street and a lot cheaper than the grocery stores.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Place at an AWESOME Deal”
Reviews.Author: cmikula
Reviews.Content: We stayed on our daughters first trip to Disney this year in April. We had a huge problem with our Hilton reservations at the last minute and in a scramble to find different accommodations, I found the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. The value was incredible for a two bedroom condo and full kitchen. The resort was clean, the property beautiful and my daughter ADORED the swimming pool. She even gave up a whole day at the parks just because she wanted to swim all day! I cant say enough about the incredible value it was for us. The resort is located about five miles away from Disney World and its location to the parks allowed for quick, no traffic driving. We were down there on one of the busiest weeks of the year and not once ran into traffic to or from the parks! We had a wonderful stay and many memories of our daughters first trip to Disney! If I HAD to complain about anything ... one would be the shuttle service. It runs only twice in the morning and twice in the evening. The morning shuttle times are fine, BUT the evening ones both leave the parks before the fireworks so if you want to see a show, you have to drive and also if you decide to leave the park early for some reason, you have take a cab to the hotel. One other strange complaint is about the pizza advertisements. We would get pizza advertisements under our door at LEAST four times a day. I am sure it is not the idea of the resort, but they should try to limit the access of the pizza place to the buildings. We ended up leaving a pile on the floor outside our room... that way they stopped putting more under our door. Those would be my two complaints! I would recommend this to anyone coming down to Disney whether is was a large family or just a couple! WONDERFUL ACCOMMODATIONS - GREAT PRICE - GREAT MEMORIES

Reviews.Title: “Definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: mischiefmegs
Reviews.Content: Just back 2 wk from 1st ever trip to Orlando have nothing but good things to say about accommodation , family of 7 (actually 2 familys) stayed in 3 bedroom condo building 2 room 202 , right over second small pool at the shallow end could literally sit out on baloncy and watch the kids . Facilities excellent for self catering everything you could possibly need and think off, room very spacious and masterbed ample .Great to be able to sit down at night and watch tv , and great not to have to worry about fitting over the tvs as there was one in all the bedrooms (have to say it was a godsent for the kids because on the days that you took to relax if it got to hot at the pool they could go to their rooms and watch tv ) Didnt hire a car it was our 1st visit so it was excellent to have the shuttle service to the park (staff whom are very pleasant and helpful) . As for location right beside the LBV outlets who could ask for more and only about 10mins walk that is from the nearest Walmart pity about lack of pavement and pedestrian crossing with means it most likly a journey by car . Excellent to have Frankies on site great for us Irish who like to have a drink at night and also offered delivery to rooms (great on nights were we were shopped out and couldnt be bothered (too tired) to go out . Staff were polite and helpful, all in all cant find any faults and location not too bad either by the end of the holiday you realise you not really as far from parks / international drive as you intitial thought you may have been . So what more can I say but roll on next year and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “haven't even checked in yet...and...”
Reviews.Author: jimmyinkeywest
Reviews.Content: i can tell the place is going to be horrible...the front desk clerk was rude...i arrived at 1pm, asking to check-in...he didn't even look at the reservation and told me 'check in is at 4pm'...at which point, after a 5 hr. drive i said 'aren't there other rooms available prior to then?'...to which he replied 'for $50...' after which i said 'no thanks...could he pls. call me to let me know when the room was available...' at that point, after he'd already copped me an attitude he said "YOU can call ME..."...i just looked at him in disbelief, and walked out...looking back, with him smirking at me, i said "really great customer service you all offer here!'...can't wait til i get back right at 4pm to have him tell me it's still not ready...mind you...the place is EMPTY! no cars in the garage...and no one at the pool! what a horrible choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more”
Reviews.Author: reefruner5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort with a group totaling 15 people. We booked 2 of their 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom suites and it met all of our needs. The room was extremely clean as well as the rest of their facilities. The pirate pool is a great place to go relax, with an excellent snack bar. I have already recommended this resort to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Exceeds expectation! Family friendly and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Lacey222
Reviews.Content: Our family travels to the Orlando area each year. We have stayed in many many hotels in and around Orlando, from high end five star resorts to family value hotels. This hotel exceeds all of our expectations. It met our needs and offered a little more. It was home away from home. This is by far our hotel of choice and we will make this hotel our destination while in Florida in the future. It offers great luxury while making you feel comfortable of enough to feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for fun thins in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: fhedigerHorgen
Reviews.Content: A good but not perfect location. Close to the different parks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place with all the amenities!”
Reviews.Author: GardenGal2
Reviews.Content: Just returned today 4/25 . Totally satisfied with my choice -- a home away from home. Our 2-bedroom suite included fully loaded kitchen, washer/dryer, TV's in every room, jacuzzi, living room and dinette area. With the Super Walmart right across the street, we saved lots of $$ by cooking some meals. A totally relaxing place with a great room. The beds were comfortable. My daughter is 6 and needs her own bedroom (or she won't sleep!). When I tried to get a suite in WDW, I was seeing prices like $550 per night (Polynesian). Here we paid $119 per night with the Magic Card discount. Magic card is free from Orlando Tourism. Some staff were excellent and some were mediocre. When I asked for laundry detergent, they delivered it free right to our room within 10 minutes. Then when I asked if they supplied more coffee for the coffee maker one night, I was told, "It depends. Under certain circumstances." (???) Not that it really mattered, hubby just ran to the Walmart, but that was a strange answer. I'm the kind of person who doesn't like Housekeeping in my room when I'm away, so it didn't matter that there was no daily Housekeeping. For $30, they will do a complete suite cleaning. For $5, they will empty all the trash and replace all the towels, which we did once. LBV Resort Village was 10-15 minutes from the parks, very convenient, and a real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the negative comments”
Reviews.Author: Rick9208
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our kids 14 and 16 and my in laws, we got 2, 3 bedroom condos. Upon check in the staff was very friendly and nice. When asked they made sure that our rooms were right next to each other in building 5. The condos were very nice, big flat screen TV's, big jacuzzi tub in the master bath. The kitchen has all new appliances, granite counter tops. I will say they have the basic cooking items, so if you have kids you may want to pick up a pizza pan and cutter while at the store getting groceries, that is my only complaint about the place. We went to walmart, which is 1 mile down the road and got stuff for breakfast and lunch, and we ate out at night. My in-laws who have traveled all over the world and stayed in many places, loved this place, they thought it was very clean and nice. The pool was great and the pirate ship was so cool, all the kids loved and it the slide that goes through the ship. Mind you we have a 14 yr old son and a 16 yr old girl, so if they liked it, it must be cool. They had a great time hanging out by the pool, in the sun with the family. Amanda the bartender at the Tiki Lounge by the pool was very nice, the kids loved the Fruit, cheese and cracker trays, and the nachos. now the drinks I thought were a little exspensive, $9 for a pina colada was a bit much, that was my only complaint about that, but still had a great time. I have to say that the staff works very hard here and it is very apparent in the grounds, they are very well manicured, and clean. We had everything that we needed and it was so nice to not have housekeeping, no one in your room everyday and there is a washer and dryer in the condo, so it was nice to throw n a load of laundry and have what you needed cleaned right there, great for kids and their messes. We rented a car, which I highly recommend, this place is off international drive by sea world, we went to universal and city walk, which is always fun, great food, great for people watching, a band was playing there in the open they are just starting out, so that was cool. We drove one day over to the Gulf side about an hour or so away, we went to Honeymoon Island state park and took a boat to Calidesi Island $10 , which we love. It is beautiful, white sand beach, clear water, we have been there the last 2 yrs and love it and the kids went kayaking in the ocean (I was nervous, but Dad thought they could handle it, they were fine) my in laws loved it, they didnt want to leave. It was an adventure, there were a few sting rays in the water and fish and it was cool. I think a vacation is what YOU make of it, if you relax and let go a little and enjoy yourself everything else falls into place, if you are negative and whiny then you will pick apart everything. This place was great and we would definatly go back. We had a great time, this place has a lot to offer. It is new development for more buildings, this is a hidden gem and for what we paid it was a steal. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: taliababe
Reviews.Content: We did have a great time here: staying ten nights at the start of April this year. I have to say I agree with bits of most of the other reviews: both negative and positive. The staff were rude and rigid: we got the 'our computer's are down so we can't check you in until 4pm' and magically they worked at 4pm!!! I did wonder if this was a ploy, clearly it is, it would be better if they said 'Your room isn't ready yet'. We'd driven up from Miami having flown in from Heathrow and it was 3pm, I don't think that it's unreasonable to expect to be able to get into your room. I agree too that the 'absolutely no late check outs' smacks of lack of care for the customer, and all the stuff about stealing is way over the top. Whilst we enjoyed the pirate ship, we feel that they could've made it so much more: more water slides, or allow the children to climb on it as an adventure play ground. It is true, the pool area was VERY busy. There was not enough parking for everyone, every night there were cars on the road. It is disappointing that there wasn't a midstay clean: after 7 nights, most places like this do do a clean after 7 nights. It wouldn't be so bad if there was a hoover/cleaning stuff in the apartment but we only had a large broom, no dustpan and brush and the security latch was broken and the lights didn't work in all the rooms. Some initial dishwasher packets/washing stuff would be a nice touch. We were in building 5 and could see the Disney fireworks which was lovely. One day the cleaner of the apartment above us, chucked water over the balcony over us sitting on the balcony below!! I rang the front desk, they said she was cleaning it, I said it was unacceptable to chuck chemicals over us: they weren't really interested. The location was great here: very close to Disney and a few minutes from Walmart and Publix. The layout was good: bedrooms either side of the lounge. the kitchen was tiny and lacked facilities and cupboard space. The large TV was great. We would stay here again as long as no extra buildings had been built, it would be too busy otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Resort!”
Reviews.Author: LTanner
Reviews.Content: There is a big difference between "Hotel-Condo" and "Resort". This is not a resort. My family stayed at this location April 4 - 10, 2009. I chose this resort based on previous reivews and the price was good. I normally stay at The Marriott Grande Vista every year. Based on the reviews, it was suggested to stay in one of the newer buildings. I called the resort and specifically requested a newer building (building 3 or 4). When I arrived, I was given Building 1, which is one of their older buildings. Luggage carriers/racks are hard to locate and it was very difficult for persons who weren't able to carry their baggage to the room. THE GROUNDS: First, the property consists of 4 "condo-like" buildings with no scenery and very little greenery. In my pinion, scenery and greenery is what makes a resort a resort. Of course, you do have the scenery choice of the outlet mall, the pool or the parking lot. The greenery can be found along the walls of the buildings. Don't get me wrong, this is not a "Bad" place it's just that if you 're looking for a "resort" feel this isn't the place. THE ROOM: The decor was average. The carpet was not clean. There was a big problem with the linen. The linen on the bed in the master bedroom had obvious stains on it (I won't even tell you what it looked like). The towels also had stains on them. I immediately went to the front desk and told them this was unacceptable. After speaking with the sarcastic front desk person for nearly 10 minutes, I got the direct number for the manager. I was finally able to reach the manager and he did have housekeeping come (with a supervisor) to fully clean the entire room at no additional charge. If you're traveling with older people or young children, the bathtub was extremely slippery. They need to put handrails in the bathtubs or at least put better grips on the bottom of the tub. We had to put a towel down in the tub to make sure no one slipped and hurt themselves. The Good News: The food at the on-site restaurant was good. The pools are nice. There is a small grocery there with a Pizza Hut inside that's really nice and convenient. The grocery prices are high (as expected) and the pizza was great. The staff in there is great. Aside from the housekeeping issues, the rooms are nice (we had a 3 bedroom). Nice outlet mall. Disney and Universal are close. Good location. The No So Good News: They need to pay more attention to people with handicaps. Customer Service people need a few more classes in "customer service". Housekeeping needs to step it up a few notches. Next year, rather than trying to save money I'd rather spend the extra per night and be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Greenface
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our 3 tween sons to Orlando for spring vacation. The hotel was easy to find from the airport and was 10 mins. from Disney and Universal. Upon our arrival, the staff was very pleasant and curteous. Our rooms were very spacious and clean. The kitchen contained pots, cooking utensils including a blender and service for 8. Our view was of the children's the pool. My kids loved the water slide boat and we loved looking out the window or stepping on the balcony to check on them. My husband and I enjoyed the jetted tub in the master suite. After a long day at the parks, the jets became a necessity. The beds were comfortable as well. The boys slept in the beds and the pull out sofa. They thought both were relaxing and slept well. My only regret was not making time to check out the on-site spa. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bsblais
Reviews.Content: This was a great value. We are Florida Residents and Travel to Orlando Often and we considered this to be one of the nicest resorts we have stay at. The suite was very clean, modern and well maintained. The resort is located with in walking distance to shopping and dining, with a convient shuttle service to the theme parks. Our children loved the pool with the piret ship water slide. It is truly a resort everyone will enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location to everywhere”
Reviews.Author: beachy66
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying outside of Disney World, however the location was great! They had a beautiful room much larger than we expected. The pirate pool theme my kids loved. The location to go to all the parks or other places was so close. Parking was in a garage with lights and the whole facility was very pretty. For the price of this "Villa Room" we will definitly be coming back! The only bummer was the spa had limited time availability.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment with Hotel Facilities”
Reviews.Author: HampshireYanni
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay in this hotel which was used as a base for our decent on Disney. We stayed on the 13th floor of building No 5 and our outlook was towards the north of the building where we could see all the parks. Our accommodation was made up of a main sitting area and kitchen with a major bedroom with en suite consisting of a spa bath and amply sized shower. We also had a further bedroom with two double beds and another bathroom, more than enough room for a family of any size. All supplimented with a balcony. The kitchen is very well equipped: fridge, freezer, oven, dishwasher, washing machine/tumble dryer. In fact all you would need to exist. You need to be aware that there is no maid service which means that the towels or sheets are not changed (you could get this at extra cost or do some washing youself). Great location, just a few metres from Vineland Road and a ten minute trip to the parks area. There's a factory store outlet village just over the road and a Wallmart supermarket 5 minutes away. We found it a perfect place to stay, had no problems with the staff or guests. Liked the pool very much which was a pleasent rest from the manic pace of the parks

Reviews.Title: “WOW I can't believe what people will find to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: 3travelersMidwest
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in March. I reviewed several hotels before selecting this one. We booked it as a package through Travelocity and it defaulted to a 1 bedroom, not 2 as we wanted. This was quickly resolved with an email. We were told that it would be a $10/night charge which we were happy to pay...in the end they gave us a complementary upgrade. This was unexpected...but welcome. Our room was outstanding. I knew what to expect based on reading reviews and looking at the website....and yes I do travel with an ethernet cable because sometimes wireless networks are down. This wasn't a problem. I also knew the layout of the master bedroom and although I too would have like a door I wasn't shocked. As far as the customer service...wow it was outstanding from our check-in (Terrell was so friendly) to a couple of calls we made in need of a couple of items. Then some people complained about having to wait to have things brought to their rooms, I say get up, take a walk and give these hard workers a break. I bet these same whiners wouldn't even tip someone for bringing supplies to their rooms. OK the pool...wow how could you complain about the water slide. Our kids (8 and 12) both loved it. They would have rather skipped the park and stayed all day at the pool. We loved the washer and dryer. We went home with very few items. That is a mother's dream. The location is fantastic. We were never in the car more than 30 minutes and traveld throughout Orlando. We were at the airport in 30 minutes. SO are you wondering if there was anything we would change and I would share the following: 1) Parking is tight on the weekends and the spaces in the garage were small 2) The prices at the convience store were way too high 3) The pizza coupons that were stuffed through our door daily were out of control. The fact that these people could gain access to a "secure" building was disturbing. We talked to the manager and owner about this concern and they said they were taking legal action to prevent this from continuing. 4) The securing doors weren't locked once while we were there..in other words we didn't have to use our room card to gain entry to the building. We addressed this with the manager as well. I wold stay here again if given the chance. Please don't let other reviews scare you off. It is a great value and is a welcome change from staying in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed !!!!”
Reviews.Author: meloned
Reviews.Content: The place (building 5) was great we had a two bedroom suite on the 14 th floor the rooms are spotless and have everything you need in them and more!!The jacuzzi bath was great the beds huge and comfortable.The shower was powerfull and the overall feel to the place was superb it was a joy to come back too after a hard day going around the parks !! The pirate pool the kids loved !!!!! The pizza hut over the road was good .I thought at first there was no prices shown for the goods in the shop but they are priced with the sticky type label usually put underneath the item,quite expensive but handy.I used wal mart over the road mostly. I would recommend this place to anyone and don't be put off by the few that knock it!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe this is rated so highly . . .”
Reviews.Author: vanillabeanHB
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a 5 night stay at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa with my spouse and 4 kids. I had spent considerable time researching our accommodations, and based on the positive reviews, had high expectations. The resort is located conveniently off I-4 and is pretty and new looking when you first drive onto the property. The land surrounding the 5 buildings is cleared and ready for development, so the surroundings are not that attractive and present a decidedly unfinished feeling. We arrived a few minutes before 4:00 and I attempted to check in at the front desk. A very rude clerk at the front desk scolded me, telling me that check-in was "technically at 4:00" and all the computers were down. It literally was 3 minutes before 4 and there was no one else in the lobby! I waited 3 minutes and magically the computers started working! I got a clue right away about customer service at this "resort". We did get a room in one of the newer buildings and when we first saw it we were quite happy. Not huge, but the kitchen was adequate and the flat screen TV in the living area was nice. The secondary bedroom had 2 full sized beds (we were expecting twin sized, so this was a bonus). The master had a king bed and a large jetted tub. We did find the layout of the master bath awkward - the tub and shower are not private from the rest of the bedroom. The only privacy is a pocket door to the toilet. There is no private area to dress and with 3 teens wandering around, the master bedroom door had to be locked to assure not having an audience while showering or dressing! We hated having to kick people out of the room to take care of things that would have been easily accomplished if there had been a door for the bathroom! No one else has commented on this, so maybe we are overly picky about privacy. The pirate pool is cool to look at, but from a practical standpoint, it really misses the mark. The days we were there were very crowded, you had to fight for a chair and guard it if you wanted a place to sit - not my idea of relaxing. The pirate ship takes up so much space both in the actual pool as well as the pool decking, it seems like a most unfortunate waste of real estate. I kept imagining how much better it would have been to eliminate most of the ship and trade it for more linear footage around the pool. My teens did not appreciate the pirate theme - seemed a bit babyish for anyone over 10 years old. The ship does serve as a backdrop for a water slide, but its main purpose is decoration - they would have been better off without it! There are plans for 5 more buildings and no more pools - the crowd at this pool was already overwhelming- it will be unworkable with 2xs as many people! There is a pool bar which is handy for snacks and frozen drinks. The service here was disorganized, but at least they tried to be friendly! It was nice to eat right there by the pool. We were busy visiting theme parks 2 of the days, and we came home tired. Unfortunately the mattresses were so hard none of us slept well. My husband thought the beds were suitable to torture hostages or death row inmates. We sleep on somewhat firm mattresses at home but these were way too hard. You know it's bad when the kids are fighting over the pullout sofa bed because it is (by comparison) the most comfortable bed available. We finally went out and bought some air mattresses for the bigger teens to sleep on. Again, maybe we are just too picky! And yes, within 5 minutes of checking in, you will have a dozen pizza coupons under your door, which speaks of a lack of security. Did not eat at the Irish Pub so cannot comment. The convenience store is outrageously overpriced, almost to the point of being amusing, but not really. I guess it's like when you're at the airport - you're paying for having it on location. There is a WalMart right down the street, so shop there instead. The outlet "mall" is actually an open shopping center and was a nice diversion. Overall, I would not stay here again. We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club in March and loved it - much better service and more of a resort. They did not have availability but next year I will book early. In summary Pros : Great location for Disney and Seaworld, Universal was a bit further. Good space for families. Cons: Crowded pool, poor customer service, scratchy sheets, strange bathroom layout

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort but a condominium”
Reviews.Author: gabysf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 3 nights last week. The rooms are great, we had the 3 bedroom suite which was ideal for our purpose: traveling with family for my brother's graduation. I would have given it 4 stars for the room which was immaculately clean, everything looked new, and had two jacuzzis. I would give it 1 star though for everything else. This is NOT a resort, so don't come to this property expecting hotel amenities. There is no room service, no daily cleaning, no bell hop to help with your luggage, not even vending machines so if you need a drink get ready to drive. I found the attitude OFFENSIVE to say the least. We arrived expecting a resort but were greeted by signs saying we would be charged for cleaning if we opted to have the apartment cleaned or the beds made, and that if we stole the coffee maker, towels, sheets (who steals sheets?), or blow dryer we would be charged. OBVIOUSLY if you steal something from any hotel room you will be charged for it, but to leave a sign in the room stating this matter is simply offensive. I wonder what kind of people stay in this place that they need to leave these nasty signs? Plus, to stay 3 nights and not even get access to clean towels if ridiculous. It would have been fine if they had notified us we were renting an apartment, not a resort. Internet: we stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment which fit 6 people. However, there was no wireless internet, only WIRED internet available for 1 computer at a time. Even worse than that: there was no cable in the room. When I called front desk the guy asked me bewildered if I didn't carry my own cable (No sir, we are living in the 21st century, everything is wireless). So then he told me they don't leave cables in the room because they might be stolen. Again with the stealing. I guess they are very paranoid with this issue, which is fine, but I don't need to know they think I'm a crook. They couldn't send the cable up, I had to go get it. There was NOTHING in the room. We arrived at 2am to find no water, no sodas, no crackers... nothing at all. And no vending machines or restaurants open in the area. So we had to drive out to buy stuff. Again, not a big deal if they had notified us it was not a resort but an apartment, then we could have arrived prepared with groceries, detergent and so forth. There is also a sign in the room (lots of signs in the room...) saying to not even bother asking for late check out. I guess they care so little about the customer they are not even willing to pretend to be accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigKidConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels for business and pleasure,, this by far was one of the nicest I have been in a long time,, locatede within a 15 minute ride to all the disney parks,, The pool is well excecuted along with a large water slide for the kids,, and for the big kids,,,,,like I was,, the Tiki bar was well versed with food and drink for all taste,, overall this was a great value and would be in my agend for the next time we visit this area,,,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelfamily0624
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience here. When we arrived, it was easy to check in and the rooms were fantastic. We travelled with another family and with 4 adults and 3 kids, the three bedroom was perfect. The kitchen, laundry, dishwasher was a must for our extended stay and it cut down on costs of eating out. We were just minutes from Disney and could even see the parks from our window. The outlet mall and restaurant was a great added bonus on our day "away from Disney". The kids LOVED the pool and wanted to stay there instead of going to Disney one day!! The staff was so friendly and answered all my questions about the parks and how to get around. I recommend if you want a DVD player or internet cable, get it RIGHT at check-in...they check-out fast!! Will stay here every year!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: xMrsTiggyWinklex
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa for two weeks in march 2009; and we loved it. The rooms were luxurious and contained everything you could possibly need. The pool area is great and it harbours a giant galleon ship which has a giant slide running through it. The pool area also has 3 gorgeous jacuzzis. This hotel also provides an excellent shuttle service to all the main theme parks, which makes your holiday a lot less stressful (if you dont want to drive). Also included in the complex is a small grocery shop, a gym, a games room and an excellent Irish pub which serves really nice food! Beyond this is an excellent shopping outlet which has some familiar highstreet shops like Gap, Nike and Reebok. Overall we had a truly fantastic stay and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God!!!!!! We had the best time ever”
Reviews.Author: addib
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, Beautiful... This is the best place to be over all. We standed in a great room with lots of room.... The pool was to great and every one there was the best. We loved being able to go just across the way to a great irish pub and the game room for kids. This is where we would stay again and tell our friends

Reviews.Title: “We had a great trip at a superb value in Orlanda. These villas are so comfortable and large.”
Reviews.Author: cachclh
Reviews.Content: I looked high and low for reasonable pricing on accommodations near Orlando theme parks. It's really the last hurrah for Mickey until they are all really old enough to come back with their own children or as adults who can appreciate the fun we had. So we needed someplace that gave everyone a great time together all day but some privacy and comfort in the evenings...all of us on top of each other in cramped quarters would not meet our definition of "Vacation". So we found out about these villas and got the three bedroom. We had kitchen, dining, living space plus a deck and three bedrooms...two had king size beds so my husband and I were as comfortable as we are at home. We bought our tickets from the consierge and rode the complimentary bus to and from some parks and drove ourselves to others. It's really nice and we also loved the Boston Lobster seafood feast not far from the resort. I didn't have as much time to shop at the outlet mall next door...within walking distance but it had a huge selection of outlets stores. The kids loved the pool with the pirate ship...this vacation was one of our best!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good deal”
Reviews.Author: travelincritic
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be a pretty good deal. What we liked...the location was good but not too trafficy. Our 3 BR suite had a lot of space and was clean. What we didn't like....they have no wireless available in the rooms. Only one cable outlet to get online. Cleaning service costs extra. Views are not great. It's more of a place for families with kids. The fitness center was small and equipment was old and not nice. It was perfect for my brother and his kids, not as great for me and my husband as we would have liked something a little nicer and better business services. All in all, we wold stay there again for a family gathering but probably not on our own.

Reviews.Title: “The Good News and Bad News about Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: mollyd2
Reviews.Content: The good news is it is very convenient to the Disney parks. The condos are spacious and the master bedrooms are very nice. However there are two distinct sets of building arrangements on the property. Two bldgs are on one side and they share a very small pool, have NO good view and look directly down on the Outlet Mall next door. That was disappointing. The other 3 are located around a very nice pool with pool bar. They are buildings 3, 4 5. The pool has a pirate ship in it with slide and a shallow end you can sit your chairs in. We rented two condos and they put one family in one section and us in another across the way. It was a hassle. We did rent from a private owner and not the resort directly. So I would be careful as I think this is pretty common. Whoever owns the condo is looking to fill it and I am not sure the needs of the renters are their priority. Building #1 and #2 are the lesser bldgs across the street from the good pool. They do have a pool and hot tub but they are really tiny. Staff at front desk seemed not that organized and I agree with previous reviews that keys seem to stop working. We replaced ours at least twice. No ID required which I found a little worrisome frankly. Good Irish bar on premises and a great pool bar with a good bartender Bob. We drove to the parks everyday as we had a rental car. Heard the bus shuttle was booked most days and has a very limited schedule. Parks are no more than 10 min away and easy to find. Restaurants around and good shopping but mostly chain dining. If we hadn't had the location we did I would have rated this higher. Good for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good choice...comfortable and a variety of great ammenities.”
Reviews.Author: Magatron
Reviews.Content: The hot tub in the master bedroom was great. Enjoyed the private balcony. It was nice to have a convenience store and bar within walking distance on the resort. Overall, we had a pleasant experience and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Just great! Beyond our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: BoboMcGurk
Reviews.Content: We have been to Orlando many times usually staying within Disney. This was our first time staying in a condo rental. Our party consisted of a grandmother, a mother , three teens and an eleven year old. We arrived on March 14th with some trepidation. for a stay of 6 nights. We were greeted warmly and escorted to our 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite. Very clean and very well furnished. Flat screen tv's in each bedroom plus the living room. The pool was very large and very clean and the surrounding area was well groomed. The location of the resort is perfect for visiting Disney, Universal, etc., etc. Shopping of all kinds is just minutes away. At no time did we feel unsafe in this area. The staff were always cheerful and eficient. Having stayed in many holiday resorts including Atlantis several times and at Disney on at least a dozen occasions we found the accommodations to be excellent. Try it you"ll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Jon099
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort from the 22nd to 31st October 2008. The holiday was organised by a local travel agent and I paid in full before the holiday and received my bed vouchers which guaranteed our beds. I want to say more about what happened when we returned but I would echo what others have said about the staff being hard to find and not particularly helpful. Specifically we arrived at midnight - after 24 hours of travelling and a bad experience in the bus from the Airport in that the driver could not find Lake Buena Visa Resort and Spa. It took an extra hour to eventually get to our destination. After booking in, presenting our bed vouchers and my debit card details being taken we were directed to another building and in the pouring rain found what we thought was the correct room. The electronic key failed to open the bedroom door. After a very indifferent security woman (only staff available at night are security and one man on the desk) also failed to get in we were allocated another room. This took another hour. No apology but by default or design we were given an upgrade. The general standard of the furnishings and the equipment, TVs, washing machine is high. If you do not have a car buying food is not that easy – there is no public transport system and the Wall-mart is a 20 minute and somewhat dangerous walk away. Some four months after we returned I received a series of automated phone calls from Nationwide Building Society saying I was £1200 overdrawn. I do not use my Nationwide account much and I thought my card must have been cloned. I discovered, however, that it was Lake Buena Vista who had, without any reference to me, debited my card three times on the 26th February. Eventually, after numerous phone calls (including over an hour to Lake Buena Vista hanging on and being passed from one person to another and being told to ring back) I was told that while Lake Buena Vista knew I had paid for my holiday a company who I now know as “Welcome USA” who are based in America and are agents for a company called Bedbank had not paid (though Welcome dispute this) so Lake Buena Vista had decided they needed their money and had simply made three (why three?) deductions from my card. They hoped this was not “inconvenient”. No; not inconvenient for me to pay again for my holiday (except I hadn’t because the accommodation charge for my holiday was £459 and Lake Buena Vista debited more than double at £1,195.01), not out of way for me to make long distance phone calls to find out why they treated me this way and a veritable pleasure to pay Nationwide charges on an unauthorised overdraft. My advice; any management that treats their customers in this discreditable way does not deserve custom – stay somewhere else. Do not expect Nationwide Building Society to protect your interest (my overdraft was £50 - 24 times less than the amount they allowed to leave my account). If you have to give your card details to register – which I think is common – cancel your card when you return.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa was an awesome place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jozaab
Reviews.Content: My family and I love to vacation in Orlando and have stayed at many different resorts in the area. Lake Buena Vista was by far the best! The staff was very friendly. The rooms were nice and clean. The pool with the pirate ship was so cool. My kids had so much fun going down the slide! The price for our stay was very reasonable. I will definitely stay here on future visits! The only negative thing about the resort is no internet service in the rooms. But, it did keep my off the computer and I was able to enjoy my vacation rather than check emails.

Reviews.Title: “Fully appointed Condo w excellent location! Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: NandG2402
Reviews.Content: This condo property was less than 2 years old. I found it on-line and booked a 1 bedroom suite. I requested a suite on a higher floor with a view of the fireworks at disney and got it. Also got a free upgrade to a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite! Perfect location, 20 minutes from Orlando International Airport and 5 mins to Disney parks and 8 mins to Sea World and 10 mins to Universal. Parking was free and had both outside and covered. Had a complete kitchen with brand new Whirlpool appliances- smooth top stove, microwave, full size dishwasher, 4 slice toaster double kitchen sink with garburetor and even had a blender and beaters and 8 piece place setting of dishes and cutlery. 2 mins to the SuperWalmart. If you want higher end meat and fish products go to the Publix on International Drive across from the Gaylord Palms Hotel about 5 mins away. You are super close to Downtown Disney with the La Nouba show which is a must see and all the niteclubs or stores and the attached Pleasure Island. The parking is free and you can use transportation to go to the parks vs. paying $12/day at the park . The convenience store on the property had good small size basics such as dairy and cereal. Nice swimming pool and hot tub area with a pool bar - We didn't use, but it was very clean and lots of family's were there and their kids seems thrilled with the pirate ship attraction in the pool. Mall next door and 8 mins to other Premium Outlets. Costco is about 15 mins away, but has no liquor - but always great food and prices. If you prefer to eat in and make your own meals as we do, this is the best property we have stayed at for the price and that includes travel to New York, Palm Springs, West Hollywood, Fort Lauderdale, Wailea in Maui, Puerto Vallarta, Toronto, Vancouver. We will definitely stay here again and recommend it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: floridaTexas
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was wonderful,we very happy with all the friendly staff and the convience of having tickets there on sight instead of having to wait in the lines at the park .We also love the room our children did not want to leave because they had there own little home away from home.We love the location it was in the perfect spot easy to get to the theme parks,also had the best shopping outlet right in your back door.But what my family love the best was the awesome pool with the ship it was wonderful i will always stay there when i visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but could have been cleaner.”
Reviews.Author: JAMERUD
Reviews.Content: We've just gotten back from our stay at LBV resort from 3/11/09 to 3/18/09. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were for the most part pretty clean although I did notice black mold in the grout of the master shower, the carpet did not look like it had been vaccumed very well, and probably the most discusting find was a thick yellow film on the floor and the toilet in the small bathroom, it looked as though someone had missed the toilet completely and it was never cleaned. I really wish they would have provided at least a broom in our room as that would have helped tremendously as we did not pay for housekeeping. They provided a mop but no broom? How are you suppose to mop if you can't sweep first? The carpet was a bit grimmy looking, if I would have had a crawling baby with, I def. would not have let her crawl on that floor! yuck!! We stayed in bldg. 2 so this may explain somethings as it is one of the older bldgs. They do need to do some minor fixing such as replace burnt out lightbulbs in our room, fix the glass closet door in the master bedroom that was broke completely off the track, fix a few dresser drawers that would not even open, and definately replace the carpet.. (doing this may even help with the musty smell) There were many positives too...the washer and dryer was great, the pools, location, restaurants, tv's in every bedroom. I would recommend this place to a friend but just not building 2

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: sunloverflorida
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and staff was attentive - location was near absolutely everything!!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: gr8lifecolumbus_GA
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando for a UCA Cheerleading Competition. The whole family was there which equaled to nine people. We stayed the first night in a three bedroom condo and we were very comfortable, the next day we moved to a four bedroom and it was perfect. The view was wonderful. The resort is close and easily accessible to all the Disney attractions. We will continue to stay at the Lake Buena Vista Resort & Spa for any trip to Orlando and will recommend it to everyone. The staff was friendly and eager to help you enjoy your stay. We loved our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Nice Rooms, Great Location, Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: yoda5150
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is the place to stay if you have a big family. We had 6 people in a 3 BR condo and it was great. The positives: The pool, the pub, the location, the rooms, the price. The only downside was housekeeping. The floors were dirty when we arrived(not that big of a deal). We asked for housekeeping to bring us towels TWICE and they never came. Not a deal killer but they need to work on it. Outside of that-this place has it all for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Liked having the space & facilities of an apartment !”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghFamilyMom
Reviews.Content: Really liked our stay - great having the washer & dryer, especially with 3 kids -6,3 & baby. Great space and loved the spa bath! Would definately return, although with car this time. We checked the transportation provided to parks and were assured that there was plenty - not exactly true as 2 shuttles to Disney in the morning (8 & 11) and 2 returning (5.45 & 8.45) which you have to book the day before. Drivers of buses were great though!

Reviews.Title: “A great resort!”
Reviews.Author: WOWMOM
Reviews.Content: We just returned for a long girls' weekend at this resort. I have been to many resorts in the Orlando/Kissimmee/LBV area, some large, some small, some memorable, some not! This resort was fantastic! We stayed in a 2 bedroom in Bldg. 3. The unit was large enough (not huge) but definetely adequate. Our balcony (again, not too big) overlooked the pool. I'm glad that we did not overlook the parking lot or outlet mall! The outlet mall next door is a +. We ate at Frankie Farrell's - thougt the food was decent. I was glad to be able to get a Stella there as well. We also ordered sandwiches from Pizza Hut express and had them delivered to the pool. It took, literally 15 minutes and cost ~$10. Can't beat that! I had read other reviews that had some complaints about the workers. We did not experience that at all! As a matter of fact, everyone that we encountered there - from the maids to the front desk to the workers straightening up at the pool - were all very friendly and helpful! We particularly enjoyed the pool. It was not too busy while we were there so there were plenty of chairs. It might be a little hard to find an umbrella during more peak times. We were not looking for umbrellas yet! There was plenty to do in the area. Many restaurants, etc. We took a cab to CityWalk because we were planning on having a few! It was a bit expensive ($28/one way without tip). If I had to post any cons: As other posters have said, there was not enough toilet paper in the bathroom, but we found a maid in the hallway and she was happy to give us more. They could buy a little better quality towels at the pool, but they were typical of most resorts. The times for the shuttles are a little "weird". I suppose if you have really little kids it would be useful, but, for example, the shuttle to Universal only departed one time in the morning and then the return was at 7:15pm. Even if I had brought my teenage kids, this wouldn't have worked for us. Overall, we really enjoyed this resort and would definetly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “second stay heer,and its even better”
Reviews.Author: planetScotland
