Reviews.Content: this was the second stay at the lbv resort,first time was the year before and what a change its fantastic.the new pirate pool was great.warm enough to use even on colder days in january!my toddler had fun playing around the shallow end with other children.bar well stocked,and bar staff very friendly,quick at serving,also make a pretty good cocktail.also serve snacks at pool which looked good.we were in block 5 which is a new block,the appartment was perfect.3 huge bedrooms,master had ensuite bathroom which was lovely.kitchen had everything youd need to cook with.we used it all the time.there is also a washer dryer,which got well used!tried not to use the hotel store to much as was quite expensive.had good pizza express tho.we got a cab to walmart whick was about $12 return.as we didnt have our own transport we uses the hotels shuttles which you booked the day before at reception.you had 2 choices of times to and from the disney parks.universal was once in morning then a return at 7.30ish.only complaint i would have regarding the transport was seaworld/aquatica closed at 6 and pick up was 7.45?we just got a yellow cab back(they are about the cheapest)shuttle drivers like a wee$ tip per person.which we didnt have a problem with as the busses saved us a fortune!we are already looking forward to returning next xmas

Reviews.Title: “Best place I have stayed in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: BennyDoran
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort with a fantastic location close to the Disney parks, and a few yards from a major outlet centre. To find faults, I would have to nit-pick, but here goes: The fixtures and fittings seemed fragile and cheap, with constant surprises such as the toilet roll holder dropping off onto the floor, or the switch arm on the icemaker coming off in your hand, the electric card key reader on the door malfunctioning etc. That said, the rooms are magnificent,(We had a 3 bedroom suite) the most spacious we have stayed in. The pools and jacuzzis were great, and the lobby and public areas were spotless. The staff were courteous and helpful for the most part, and the hotel was generally very good indeed. The location is perfect, not too near the hustle and bustle of I-Drive, but close enough to parks, outlets, Wal-Mart, any amount of restaurants and just about anything else you might want to do. The resort is similar in price and quality to others we have stayed in in Orlando, but the location sets this apart. Highly recommended hotel. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and everything you could need”
Reviews.Author: janecanadian
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week stay at the lbv resort village and spa and have no complaints at all...well, other than we had requested what they call a 'refresh' (new towels and empty garbages) and they never came but when we phoned they came the next day..other than that small issue the place was great...there were four adults and 1 child in our group so we had a three bedroom suite and it was plenty spacious and equipped with everything we could have needed...we were at the end of building three and could see the fireworks from our balcony nightly...the weather was a little chilly for a few of the days so we didn't get much use of the pool, but out 5 yr dd loved it when she did manage to use it...I would say that a car is likely a must for this location but everything is close yet you are a bit removed from the hustle and bustle of the parks and I Drive and we had no trouble getting around due to the garmin we brought with us...all in all I would recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort for Family”
Reviews.Author: coratim
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean rooms and grounds pool a lot of fun for kids poolside food and drinks good, not too overpriced make sure you are in building 5 to have easy access to pirate pool shuttle to disney was a little disorganized, but got you there and back Nearby Outlets easily in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation setting”
Reviews.Author: Mana1
Reviews.Content: Enough room for grandma to share a vacation with daughter's family. We shared a 3 bedrrom, 3 bath unit and had enough privacy and space without stepping on eachother. The 2 master suites were great for our situation. The pool was clean and kid friendly....there is a huge shallow end that allowed toddlers water fun. We took advantage of the washer and dryer, and full kitchen facility for breakfast and packing lunches for the park. We shopped at the Walmart down the road and had snacks and drinks with us for the park. Security checks all bags, but you can bring plastic bottles and cans into the park....just no glass containers, Good location and easy to get to the park. We never used the hotel shuttle as the times were not convenient for small kids and their nap times. We never felt pressured to tour time shares or use any of the other hotel facilities. Need ehernet wire for computer connection, which was provided by the hotel when requested.

Reviews.Title: “tips for non drivers”
Reviews.Author: sparklew0rks
Reviews.Content: excellent resort. pools are heated. 3 poolside jacuzzis were wonderful. bed very comfortable and huge(we stayed here for 3 weeks and slept well every night) the resort is 5 mins walk from the outlets, the shopping was good here. you can get always yellow cabs from the car park at the outlets. walmart is about a 15min walk away, but unless you want to walk down a busy road with no sidewalk (pavement) then you can't do it. jump in a cab for 7 dollars, stock up at walmart for the duration of your trip and hop in a cab (there are lots outside walmart food exit on left(ask the walmart greeter to point you in the right direction if needed) the trunk was huge and easily fitted all our 3 trolleys full of groceries!! the driver gave us a card and we called him several times during our stay to go places and he was always on time and reasonable. if you ask at reception its alot more expensive in their cabs. Hotel shuttle Buses to disney ran at 820 and 1120 pick up 615 and 845 seaworld at 940 pick up at 745 universal/islands of adventure 940 pick up at 715 don't be fooled, alot of guests who had stayed at a disney property thought transport was continous. you have to be organized and decide the day before. you have to book with reception day before. when you board the shuttle you have to tell the driver what time pick up you want. you need to get a timetable from reception when you arrive. HAVE A PLAN!!! disney drops off and picks up at epcot only as its the closest park to entrance of disney world. you get buses or monorail to all other hotels parks, waterparks or downtown disney from here. you may have to get 2 buses to hotels or downtown disney but everything in disneyworld is connected by this free transport, if in doubt ask at the information window in bus park or one of the disney bus drivers- they always know how to get everywhere. shuttle pick up does not allow for firework viewing, so you may have to get a cab, if so there are always yellow cabs waiting outside all the parks waterparks downtown disney. one bit of advice i'd give is to get a disney bus back to epcot if possible n get a cab from there it was only usually around 14 dollars to the hotel from epcot. from seaworld a cab was about 24 dollars. we tipped the shuttle drivers a dollar per person in our group and were polite to them (alot of people really were rude ) and we usually got on the buses first, and were treated really well, especially when it got busy at half term and there were lots of people waiting- treat people nice n you get rewarded!! this is our third non driving visit to orlando and we love it. its great not to have the stress of driving abroad. if that's your thing- good for you, but we found that we didn't spend more than around 250 dollars in 3 weeks on cabs, and we went to walmart, target, florida mall, we got cabs home from parks when we were exhausted or had stayed for fireworks or if we changed our plans or had missed the shuttle. If we had taken advantage of the so- called free car hire included in our package, insurance would have been approx £300 anyway so we saved money. taxis are plentiful and everywhere and if you just use the one guy for all your trip you can negotiate prices too. one word of warning-only had one bad experience with a cab driver who pretended not to know where resort was. keep a note in your purse of resort's address then there are no problems. another piece of advice i would give non drivers is get a free map of orlando (or look online)and look at the places where you want to go and see if you can take advantage of the free buses eg we went shopping on i drive and we got free hotel shuttle to seaworld and i drive trolley bus (approx a dollar each kids free,) to the places on i drive. you can get to wet and wild this way. to get to aquatica get free shuttle to seaworld then a seaworld free bus comes and takes you to aquatica. i used to brits guide to orlando when planning all my trips to disney as it tells you what days to avoid parks and has maps and tips. i always make a plan beforehand of what we're gonna do when, that way we can just go with it when we get there, i know that sounds a bit mad but orlando can be a daunting place, even to a repeat visitor, esp if you're travelling with kids like we were. one final bit of random advice if you want to do the new toy story midway mania at hollywood studios is be at the park when it opens leave hubby n the kids on a bench and race down to fastpass as they run out quick!! there were people running just to get to fastpass and there was a 20 minute wait in line just for fastpass. it was heartbreaking to see little kids crying when there were no fastpass left (about 2 hours after park opens) and the standby line was 180 minutes!!! we waited 25 mins even with fastpass!!!! we were one of the first to do american idol as it opened while we were there and we loved it. it's cheesey but fun and the warm up guy is really funny. i am more than happy to give advice to anyone planning a trip. ps will end with a word of warning. under no circumstances visit hotel shop, half the stuff in there is not priced and i think they just think of a bizarre number of dollars when you pay. we paid 37 dollars for bread, butter, water and diet coke on our first night there. would rather walk on my hands all the way to walmart and i'm no acrobat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: NjEve
Reviews.Content: We stayed feb 12-18 and I would recommend it for large families. we had a 3 bed/2bath with a full kitchen. You can save alot of money by eating in for breakfast and lunch and just eat dinner out. The only thing that needs improvement are the beds, the mattresses were all too hard, on all the beds in the unit. They also need recycling bins, we only had one for the whole bldg on the 1st level. The pirate ship was also deceiving, its just a slide. Overall a nice place to stay, and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation - would stay again & recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: Infrequentvisitor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa with my husband and two young children for 2 weeks. Our holiday was brilliant, I would recommend this resort to others and would love to go back again. Only downsides are the prices in the resort shop, some difficulty parking late at night and perhaps the differing quality in standards of accommodation throughout the resort. We had a two bedroom apartment, which was huge, very comfortable and well equipped. The jacuzzi in the master bedroom was great after a day walking around Disney, and I had no issues with the water pressure in the shower. Most of our stay was in an eleventh floor apartment in Building 5 (built most recently), with a great view of the pirate pool. However, our first night was spent in Building 2, and we had to be moved due to a problem with the air conditioning. I have to say that this building seemed much older and a bit scruffier. I have no doubt we would still have enjoyed our stay had we spent our entire holiday there, but Building 5 was far superior and my review and rating is based on our the standard in that building. We found the staff polite and helpful throughout our stay, but they were unobtrusive, allowing us to feel very independent. We intended to use the cleaning service, which is reasonably priced, on one occasion but the hours didn't suit us and in the end we just made use of the washer dryer for the bedding and kept the apartment clean ourselves. I didn't get a chance to use the spa, but they had some well priced treatments on offer. The pool is lovely, and was well used during our stay. The neighbouring outlet stores are nothing special - okay if you want to see some shops without getting in the car, but the food court didn't look very attractive. We really liked both the food options at the resort. The Pizza Hut takeaway was very good, and Frankie Farrell's was great. Both were quite expensive compared to some of the very cheap food available in Orlando, but comparable to the price you would pay in the UK. Frankie Farrell's have a kid's menu (huge portions) & offer a smaller room service menu until 11pm. The resort shop is to be avoided - the prices are extortionate. My husband went to get some basics on our arrival, and was scarred by the experience! Most notable was the $19.99 price tag for a bottle of wine that we found for less than $6 elsewhere. There is a Wal Mart very nearby (turn left on leaving the hotel and it is around 2 blocks drive on highway 535 at Poinciana Boulevard. There is also a well stocked 7/11 two blocks in the other direction at the corner of World Centre Drive, which is handy for essential shopping on the way back from Disney. Get good driving directions before you set off from the airport - we got very lost, and I find that Orlando's maps and roads don't really match up! Once I got my bearings I found the location very good. Here are some directions which I would have found very helpful before I went (don't read on if you're easily bored!) Turn right on leaving the hotel, drive for a couple of blocks and take a left on to World Centre Drive. This route gets you to the Disney parks in 5 to 10 minutes. A right turn at the same junction takes you on to international drive. From here it takes around 20 minutes to get the busy section of International drive, and about 30 minutes to Universal. There are lots of restaurants at Lake Buena Vista - continue on 535 past World Centre Drive for a few blocks - there are clusters of restaurants and shops on the right hand side, and the turn off for Downtown Disney is on the left. Highway 192/Kissimmee is easily reached in about 5 minutes - turn left on leaving and then turn right onto either Poinciana Boulevard or Polynesian something or other. Highway 192 is lined with huge restaurants, diners and shops, and will also take you to Disney. Hope those directions are of some help to others staying at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: charleetennessee
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay will stay again. Service was great, clean and friendly staff. Large rooms

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place for the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: floridalovers96
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find, gps maps don't recognize it yet. Put in 15591 S. Apopka Vineland and that should do it. The ship in the pool is just a slide. Nothing else to do in it. The pools were heated very nicely though. We stayed in the 2 Bedroom Antigua suite which was in building 3 on the 13th floor. The place was perfect. The bed was great, I usually can't sleep well when we are away but I slept like a rock here. It was wonderful having a washer and dryer, we went home with all clean laundry which was nice. Only complaints were the water pressure in the showers was terrible. They have low flow valves in them. If we went back I would bring a wrench and have my husband take them out then put them back when we leave. The tile floors were a little dirty so I cleaned those along with everything else when we got there but I am neurotic about that kind of stuff. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Awesome rooms. Perfect for a Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: cbrynolf
Reviews.Content: At $129 a night...$139 on the weekend, this place was awesome for the Family. The Disney parks were literally just a couple minutes from the Disney properties. Sea World just a short distance. The rooms were great. Full Kitchens with dining table big enough for 5 or 6 people! Laundry appliances in the room! Seperate Kids and Parent rooms with seperate baths. TV's in every room! Big two person jacuzzi in the Adult room...with King Size Bed. Walk in Shower. Where can you get all of this for $129 a night? Lots of restuarants nearby plus Downtown Disney just a couple minutes away. These restaurants with in just a couple miles and this wasn't all of them....Lone Star Steakhouse, Bahama Breeze, Dixie Stampede, Landry's Seafood house, Olive Garden, Buffalo Wild Wings, Fridays, Chevy's, and Perkins. We didn't use the pool becaue of our short stay but it was very nice with two hot tubs and a pirate ship slide for the kids. Looks like it would have been a blast but also might have been on the small side if it was peak season and very busy. That would be my only concern. Other than that the property was great with Pizza Hut Express and a convienant store on site. Also a Irish Pub & Restuarant on site that was not bad as well. We just had the fish & chips one night and it was good. Woud try other things there when we go back. Were definitly going back with rates like that!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: edimaba
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! We had a great stay!!!! Huge room, full kitchen, jetted tub even a sleeper sofa. We really enjoyed our stay with both grandmas and three kids. The pool was great, I even went down the pirate ship water slide a couple of times, My 2 year old loved the zero entry pool and I loved the fact that I didn't have to carry her around in it. THere is a super walmert down the road with everything from groceries to souveniers (don't need to by them at the expensive parks). We payed the extra for the roon cleaning and when they didn't show the first day I was reimbursed for two days of cleaning! I really couldn't say anything bad, we will most definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A great location with excellent suites”
Reviews.Author: jettyman
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort twice now and both times have been great. Between February 13th and 22nd we had a 2 bed suite in the smaller spa / reception block, the stay couldn’t have been better. With a great location, suites that are well equipped with appliances for all your needs and helpful staff, this adds up to a five star accommodation and we will be booking again. To make a balanced review, if I have to find some negatives, it would be the pool towels, they are a bit small and a little washed out. One more negative would be the fact they have put on hold the building of more blocks in the complex, but the ground work looks half started with mounds of earth and odd pieces of machinery left around, which is a bit unsightly from certain views in the blocks.

Reviews.Title: “we keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: draggingfly
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort for 3 years since it was first opened. Every year that we go back, the stay is better. We stayed in a newer building this year that was right near the new Pirate ship pool area. The staff is always pleasant and speak when they see you. THe cost is no more than a hotel room and you get a full service facility. We will definately be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, especially for kids”
Reviews.Author: FamilyfromPA209
Reviews.Content: This place was great. If you're looking for a location that's close to everything, yet off the beaten path, this is the place. The rooms were huge, clean, and modern. The pool was the highlight for the kids, they had a blast. The staff was friendly and accomodating, which surprised me based on previous reviews. I wasdissappointed with the HIGH cost of food and drinks poolside. $6 for hotdogs and $3 for soda/drinks was way too expensive. But the full kitchen was great. We went to the Supermarket and cooked most of our meals, so when we spent $60 for hotdogs/sandwiches once or twice is wasn't so bad. The addition of basketball/tennis or other activities would be nice. But overall this place is great, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lake Buena Vista is a perfect place to stay for families. We went on an extended family vacation Feb 15th-19th and we couldn't have been more pleased. It fit seven of us perfectly in a 3 bedroom and had just enough ammenities for families hitting the amusement parks. We found the restaurant good, prices decent and the pools were really neat, although we didn't get to use them. I would definately reccommend this hotel to people traveling with groups and families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: Abel88
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 1 child) stayed in a 2 bedroom condo. Booked through Virgin. The condo was spotless even the towels were laid out in beautiful shapes! The facillities were fantastic huge cooker, huge fridge with ice maker, washing machine and tumble drier. It was a home from home. Pool was loved by my 5 year old! I felt happy that he could stand up in most of it.. Every one was really helpful and friendly. We had the maid service half way through our 10 day stay fantastic idea and the best $20 spent!! We were mostly at Disney which was at most 15 minutes away. Think personally we would stay out of Disney again. Highly reccomended!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...BUT”
Reviews.Author: KimSal
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice resort. When we got there our room was not ready, when we returned and it still was not ready they were nice enough to upgrade us from a two bedroom to a three bedroom. However, we came to find that the carpets were FILTHY. Our 10 month old, who crawls, her feet were black from the dirt on the rug. You would never know by looking at the rugs that they were so dirty. Her clothes were also very dirty from crawling. Also the pack and play crib they gave us for her to sleep in was disgustingly dirty as well. I was not pleased with those two things, but otherwise it was a lovely condo. It was close to disney. There was really nowhere to grab a quick breakfast and bring back up to the condo unless you get in your car and drive.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Sammie_Johnny
Reviews.Content: I´d say that it felt like home because, after checking in, we didn´t noticed we were in a hotel/resort. We went in and out with no one noticing or bothering us. We were 4 staying in a 2 bedroom at building 5, the newest one. It was clean, big enough and new. A couple of things could be improved: 1- bigger variety of kitchen utensils 2- a sign letting people know were the trash box is as guests dropped their trash in the hallway when the building has a designated area for that. What we liked better: 1- new appliances and clean room 2-privacy 3-housekeeping if needed, not "mandatory" !

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: MMJeJona
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend in Orlando with 10 other family members. We decided to break away from the traditional hotel room stay and booked a 3 bedroom apartment in a resort type accommodation. The reviews and the nightly rate for the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa on Expedia were good so we made reservations. This property is right on 535 south of I-4. The resort is located behind the Lake Buena Vista Outlet Mall which is very nice. All theme parks, downtown Disney, Wal-Mart, restaurants and gas stations are all within a 10 minutes drive. The resort has a daily schedule shuttle service for most of the theme parks but only to EPCOT for the Disney parks. What you see in the pictures is what you get. The place appears to be fairly new construction. Everything was clean and well kept. The property is very big. There are four apartment buildings and two large pools. The pools are great. The pirate ship in the main pool is very nice and very fun for the kids. Pool and Jacuzzi areas were very clean. There is a restaurant bar at the main pirate ship pool with great service. As I opened the apartment door, my first impression was a good one. The apartment was large enough to accommodate the whole family. There are two bedrooms with king size beds, a third bedroom with 2 twin beds and a full size sleeping sofa. The master bedroom has a large bathroom with a Jacuzzi and there is a 2nd bathroom next to the other two bedrooms. Apartment amenities include a fully equipped kitchen with granite top and anything you would need if you desire to cook. A blender, a coffee maker, etc, etc, etc. you get the idea. There is a washer and dryer with provided detergent. Also, a large LCD HDTV in the living room area and a second TV in the master bedroom, a large balcony with patio furniture, dining table with 6 chairs. You can reserve with or without daily maid service. It will run for $18.00 extra a day to get you towels changed and a quick cleaning. There are other cleaning services at a higher price. Hotel staff was pleasant and so was the concierge who quickly arranged a car rental for us. If the price is right do not hesitate as it is a wonderful place to stay for an Orlando vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Surpise at check in”
Reviews.Author: natmc33076
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 5 14th floor over looking the pirate ship. We used the hotel web site to make reservation, came up with a total price with tax & charges included. Well when we checked in they said their web site hadn't updated and our printed form was incorrect. They wanted to charge $65.00 for each night extra. It took numerous phone calls, finally one manager changed our bill to the price on internet print out.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tibsCo_Meath
Reviews.Content: just back from orlando and i have never stayed in such a fantastic resort .spotless clean and i stayed in building 2 ... dont no what last reviewer was talking about ..everything you needed was in the condo it was beautiful ....the guys on reception were all great and very helpful ... frankie farrells pub was fab great food and staff .... i will most definately be returning to the resort we all loved...

Reviews.Title: “Old and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: usfg8r
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel (I use the word "hotel", not resort) through Hotwire and got a good rate for a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo. After reading the reviews, I was really excited about our trip. Upon arriving, the hotel looked great from the outside as well as the lobby. I realize now it was because the building that the lobby is in was just recently finished unlike buildings 1 and 2. I read a few reviews where travelers received a fireworks view, so when I checked in, I requested one. I was told that since I booked through Hotwire, I was not able to receive the special view. I also realize now that since I booked with Hotwire I probably got a older, dirtier room. So after we checked in, I already wasn't feeling so great about our stay. Our room was in building 2, like I said earlier, this building is one of the older buildings, but it's only 2-3 years old. By looking at the carpet and furinture, it seemed as if the building was at least 8-10 years old. The carpet was worn and stained. The couch was not in good shape either. The tile throughout the condo was dirty and didn't looked like it had been mopped recently. I was not happy to find hair on the shower walls and the shower floor dirty. Don't look at the A/C vents or A/C return - you'll just get grossed out. They haven't been cleaned in a little while. Also, don't get excited about the "big screen TV". It's the older type that you have to be seated directly in front of to see anything. If you are getting a condo with twin beds, you might want to know that they aren't big enough for the average size adult. I'm 5 feet 2 inches and my feet just about touched the bottom of the bed. When we first arrived, I went to put bottled water in the refrigerator and found water in the crisper bins and on the shelves. I called the front desk and they told me that they would have maintenance stop by. After waiting 45 mins, we left for Disney. When we got back after 11 that night, we expected to see a note from maintenance regarding the refrigerator. I called the front desk and he couldn't find any notes about the call. He told me someone could come up. At this point we are very tired from walking through Disney and now we have to stay up and wait for maintenance to fix the refrigerator. He came by close to midnight and fixed the issue. I considered seeing if the front desk would give me a different room that was a little cleaner and maybe a little newer, but after my experience with the unfriendly clerk at check-in, I decided to not waste my time since I probably wouldn't have helped anyway. Remember, I booked through Hotwire, which meant I didn't really matter. All in all, the condo was okay. It certainly was okay for the price I paid on Hotwire, but I wouldn't pay the standard rates for the condo I received. It was okay to sleep and shower (hair and all), but we really weren't in the condo much more than that. I just can't seem to understand the condition of the condos for only being 2-3 years old. Maybe they simply aren't maintained properly. Alot of my issues could have been avoided if housekeeping did a more thorough job cleaning the condo before my arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation but a couple of things you need to be aware of”
Reviews.Author: joetopps
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 16 nights from 6th to 22nd December 08. We were allocated a two bedroom apartment in building 5 overlooking the pool which was great. There were 5 adults in the party and the apartment was fantastic, the washer and dryer were a real god send and meant virtually no washing to be done when we arrived home. This is great accommodation for families of all ages and is close to all the parks. Now a few pointers for you: 1} The Irish Bar (not part of the hotel) is expensive and the prices aren't helped by the fact that they decide whether they have given good service or not and automatically add 15% tip to every bill (even if they just pull you a pint.!!) I may be the odd one out here but I like to think the size of a tip (if any) should be down to the customer. If paying by card they even leave a line for additional gratuity.... the cheek of it. 2} If you need a cab do not order one from reception, they clearly receive back handers and order cars from a limo company, they do not order metered cabs. Walk across to the mall you can always get a metered cab there. Example downtown disney with car ordered at reception $20 plus tip, same journey in a metered cab $13 plus tip. Very disappointing when hotel staff take advantage in this way and leaves a bit of a bad taste. 3} As with most places the on site Shop isn't cheap, Walmart is a 5 to 10 minute walk up the road. Avoid these pitfalls and you will have a great time.... Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “wonderful for big group”
Reviews.Author: TSC-Florida
Reviews.Content: This property is an excellent value for the money. This is the third time we've stayed on the property and each time we've been happy with the stay. The rooms are actually like a condo and not a hotel and include kitchen, dining area, living room along with the bedrooms and baths. If you visit the sites website, you can pull up actual floor plans. We took my son and our 5 grandchildren to Orlando for a one night stay and stayed in the St. Lucia 3 bedroom, 3 bath model. This model has two large king bed master suites, with jetted tubs, and separate showers. The third bedroom has two twin beds - but the beds were pretty small. They easily fit the kids, but my 28 year old son's feet would not fit on the bed. He opted for the sofa bed in the living room. He survived, but the mattress in the sofa bed was pretty marginal. The mattresses on the beds were fine and we all slept well. There were not enough extra pillows and blankets when we arrived - but they were delivered quickly after our call. The third bathroom was standard and is right next to the twin bedroom. Towels were soft and clean. Each bedroom had a TV and there was a big screen TV (not flat screen) in the living room. The condos are very nicely appointed, but do not expect luxury. I think the quaility is good - to very good. You get a very nice place for a very reasonable price. Building selection. We were in building 2 on the ground floor. If you are staying longer, I would recommend trying to get in a different building. #2 is older and right next to the shopping mall. We had a lovely view of the outlet mall parking lot from our patio. But - we didn't care one bit, because we really only used the room to sleep and have breakfast before going home the next day. I'd brought the breakfast things with us on check-in. But on our previous trip we shopped at the Wal-Mart and the Publix down the road. For us - being able to stay with all our grandchildren in "one room" is the best advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Do not overlook this Property”
Reviews.Author: Surfnorthwest
Reviews.Content: Just returned form a 8 night stay at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village. This was our sixth trip into Orland for the parks and previously had stayed at the Hyatt, Embassy Suites, Wilderness Lodge, Vistana Resort, this one is now our favorite. Location Location - Pefect! One quick block north take a left and you’re on World Drive into Disney (5 minutes and avoids traffic) , Take a left at that same intersection and you hit International Drive which will get you to Sea World and Aquatica fast. There is a good factory outlet next door you walk to with excellent prices and deals. A huge Wal-Mart is just one mile down the road for groceries. Also many food options up and down from the resort. We thought the location was perfect. Rooms - We had a two bedroom. Huge clean and had everything you could need. We were a family of four and it was so nice to have all this extra room. Kids had their own bedroom as we had our privacy. We got the maid service trice during our stay at $30 each. Other than that we took out the trash and made our own beds. Having a washer and dryer in the room was nice. Resort – Had a pretty good size grocery store but expensive, also there is a Pizza Hut there for quick eats and they serve breakfast. The resort has wireless but only in the main lobby. There also is two pay computers you can use. The game room was fun for the kids with many things to do. There is a ATM machine. The resort has five buildings and two pools; also there is a onsite restaurant that was very good and reasonable. Landscaping was good and they kept the place very clean. There also are park garages which I liked. Pool – Big and heated to about 86 which all the kids loved at night. There is a large play area for smaller kids and the rest of the pool is 4-5 foot deep. One water slide inside the Pirate ship which was fun. Pool bar has good drink and eats and Bob the bartender is great. There also are three hot tubs to use. Could not think of anything missing from this pool area as we really enjoyed it. In the end this is a great place to stay, huge rooms and convenient location. The price of the room makes up for anything extra you might pay here. We were never bothered with Time Share speeches. I really recommend this place for large families, it is a bargain. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Resort, location and the store area”
Reviews.Author: pjswanmitch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on numerous occation not just the date mention above. We have been staying at this hotel since they completed the first building in 2007. I live here in Florida and everytime we have relatives from the States or England, we book in the hotel for a few days. The new pirate pool is great for the grandkids and the Irish Pub is very good for a meal or a drink. We just love it and so all the company we took there. We already booked for the end of Dec 2008 . Great, great suites and we find the location unbeatable for area golfing or Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly close to Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: FredNWOhio
Reviews.Content: CHECK-IN - good but didn't explain housekeeping options (must purchase) - I waited several days for the garbage to be emptied before I went back thru all the paperwork.... also, only one of our keys was activated :( I also requested lower floor, but got 7th :( Limited parking near our building and no luggage cart available to use - be prepared for multiple trips! ROOM - we got the 2 bedroom. Master very nice with tub and shower and king bed and TV. However, the sheets/mattress pad were torn and came off every night - very annoying! Other bedroom with 2 twins and TV with own bath. Living room with sleeper sofa and TV, and small patio with chairs and table. Also has apt-sized washer/dryer. Kitchen was nice, but lacking necessities like spatula, frying pan, cookie sheet, etc. that we could have used. Definitely check out supplies before planning your meals there.... POOL - never got to use - too busy and mostly cool while we were there. The kiddie pool was very far from our room -it's near main building. Adult pool was by building #2 and Pizza Hut. INTERNET - be sure to get an ether cord at check-in if you have an older laptop - NO WI-FI! And it only worked in living room - bedroom jack didn't work. LOCATION - not the best signage out front to find it - had to relay on outlet mall to find it. not far from Disney complex, but be sure to map it out to get directions - roads here can be confusing! Wal-Mart is just south of here and we found a SuperTarget not far on 192 East. Plenty of restaurants south too... OVERALL - very quiet and rarely saw or heard any neighbors. We were there to visit the parks, so only really used it as a place to sleep and do laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: TykeMunki
Reviews.Content: Well laid out in a great location. One strange thing was the main TV as it didn't seem to behave the same 2 days running, but we weren't there to watch TV. Helps to have a little Spanish if you need anything from housekeeping as they're predominately Spanish speakers, but they are very helpful if a little self concious. Some minor room niggles like missing pots and pans but it was soon sorted mainly due to having a fluent Spanish speaker in our party who knew the word for frying pan. A kettle proved more of a challenge, but sign language etc saw it obtained. Apartments are well kitted out with even a liquidiser in the cupboard. Rooms are good sized and I haven't a single complaint that I'd class as annoying. Beware of the prices in the on site bar "Frankie O'Farrells as they're on the steep side. There's another bar in walking distance and a Walmart over the road too, so don't rely on the on site shop too much (again it's very expensive). For what they charged I was amazed by the quality. In the UK you'd be sleeping in someones garage. If you're the sort of person who gets annoyed at less than perfect you might not like it because of the very minor little things (like the TV) but then you will never like anywhere you stay will you? I'd stay there again and if you're offered a cheap deal there then snap it up as it's cracking.

Reviews.Title: “What a great holiday”
Reviews.Author: meg300
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay here, it was great! Having the full kitchen made it easy to eat in when the kids were theme-parked out, the walmart down the road made life easy as well. we had a 3 bedroom/2 bathroom condo for 3 adults, 2 kids and grandma, it was nice and clean, spacious, and very well equipped. the only internet access was in the living room, but it was fast and unlimited, so the pros outweighed the cons. we booked for extra cleaning, the friendly, helpful reception staff advised on what we would need.. I would have booked/spent more, but they said less would be fine, they were spot on. I used the spa facilities. the staff and treatments there were excellent. In fact all the staff we dealt with were polite and helpful, we had a slight problem with the heating/aircon one day, they had some-one up to us within 1/2 hour. We also ate in frankie farrels, the food was okay, the service once again couldn't be faulted.Many a night we crawled across for a drink/food after the theme parks! I would definately go back, we had friends from fort lauderdale rent an apartment while we were there, they thought it was grand too.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: christinep25
Reviews.Content: My family and I (8 adults) stayed here for Thanksgiving weekend. We got a 3/2 condo in Bldg 5. The condo itself is pretty clean. The hallway, though, is not as inviting. It feels like I was in a really cheap hotel. I did ask for a room that has a view to watch the Disney fireworks but they gave me one on the other side of the building looking at 417 instead. No big deal.... It was good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “We Had a Great Experience Here”
Reviews.Author: davenlu2000
Reviews.Content: We had a 10 day Disney trip in late Nov/early Dec 2008. We had booked 9 of the 10 nights through Priceline. One problem--we missed a day. The accommodations we had gotten through Priceline were not all that great and we were tired of the kids fighting/playing when sharing a bed and in the same room with us so looked for the best rated hotels in Orlando (within reasonable/affordable price range, which to us was in the very low $100 range). We didn't use Priceline because we wanted to pick the hotel. Found this 'room' for $122 for the one night and booked it through the hotel's web site. It was the best bargain of the trip even though we paid $38 for one hotel, $45 for another, and $99 for another. (Keep in mind those were Priceline prices.) Anyway, for the $122 we got a spacious room with a kitchen/living room main room and two separate bedrooms with their own bathrooms. The main room had a big screen TV, the master bedroom had a 27" TV, and the other bedroom had a 20". The master bedroom also had a nice whirlpool tub with separate shower. The kitchen had a full size refrigerator, a microwave, and a dishwasher. The room also had a washer and dryer, which was a godsend mid-vacation. We didn't have time to the pool, but we did check out the pool area and it was great, with a pirate ship, a tube slide, and a nice bar area. The pool was nicely heated and there was also a hot tub. There was also a smaller pool on-site between two other buildings. It would have been a great place to stay the whole time we were in Florida, although our budget didn't allow for $122 x 10 days. Based on other prices/reviews we saw, we could have gotten far less for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Unresponsive Management”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler111
Reviews.Content: My experience was mixed. The condo itself was very nice for the price, and the pool is great. The location is good, as long as you realize that even though it may only be a few miles from the Disney World area, it is generally a 10-15 minute drive to the actual parks themselves. My main complaint is the horrible lack of responsiveness on the part of management. The first night we arrived, we were put in a condo that had a non-functioning heating / cooling system. The temperature was 84 degrees in the condo. They had us stay there in the heat, late at night, while someone tried to fix it for a hour and a half. Finally, I insisted that we be moved to a different condo. My baby son was hot, his face was all red, and he got to bed hours late. We completely re-packed and moved. I called that night and asked to speak with management. I was told someone would get back to me. No response. The next afternoon, I called again. I was told management would call me back in 10 minutes. No response. When I checked out, I mentioned the issue again. I was told management would call my cell phone that day. No response. I never received any type of apology from management for our ruined first night. Apparently, management has the mentality that If they ignore a complaint, it will go away. So, in my experience, this is a fine place to stay, as long as nothing goes wrong. If something goes wrong, do not expect the courtesy of even an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyQueen0102
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I as well as two friends stayed here for the weekend and loved it. We stayed in a 3 bedroom/2 bathroom unit. Rooms are very spacious. Decorated very nicely. We are going back again in January. The only complaint I would have is the lack of parking and the walls are vey thin. We were woke up one morning at 6:30 by the kids screaming next door. Besides that everything about this place is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: PWD2008
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 parents, 2 kids, 1 grandmother) were visiting Florida recently and needed a place to stay for a couple of days (extended our time share stay). The Lake Buena Vista Resort and Village & Spa was a perfect fit for us. We stayed in the 2 bedroom and it was very spacious for the 5 of us. The resort is newer and in excellent condition, very clean, and has good furnishings. Location is great - only 10 minutes drive from all the Disney parks. The pool area is one of the best we've seen. Large pool, water slide, play area for small kids, very clean. Best of all, the water was nicely heated and as it was only 65 degrees during our stay - a very welcome feature. The water was warm enough for our 2 young kids to play endlessly without getting chilled. Check in / check out as very easy and efficient. The price of a stay was soothing on the wallet as well. We would certainly stay here again when we come back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JulesGazza
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in a 2 bed/2 bathroom condo and were so impressed! It is a fairly new hotel and the condo was spacious, well decorated and clean. Our children (age 11 & 14) had their own room, tv and bathroom. We had a huge bedroom, tv, walk in wardrobe, whirlpool bath, Jack & Jill sinks, and huge walk in shower. The 55 inch tv in the front room went down well too. There was a dishwasher and washing machine & tumble dryer too. We had a great view and could see the fireworks at Epcot in the evening. We chose not to hire a car and used the complimentary shuttle buses most days. You have to pre-book (only the day before). Although there is a shopping outlet and Irish pub(food very good) just across the road, you do need a car or taxi to get to any other restaurants and supermarkets. Be careful if you ask reception to call you a taxi because they favour certain drivers who are definitely more expensive than the yellow metered cabs. Staff on reception are very helpful and knowledgeable. We did stay by the pool a couple of times and it's very nice. No problem with sunbeds and small towels are free to use. Pool quite cold even when 80degrees. Overall a fantastic holiday and accommodation that will be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Condo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coffey2go
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a week in Orlando and I am very fussy about most hotels, I have to say how impressed I was from the moment I arrived at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa, it was beautiful, clean and tastefully decorated,everyone of the staff was helpful and friendly they made you feel like they were happy you were there. I could not believe the value we got for $99.00 a night, a master suite with a whirlpool tub, and full bathroom and another bedroom with a full bathroom next to it, also a living room with a large screen TV, a full kitchen with granite counter tops, a dining area, washer and dryers in the condo and every condo had a balcony plus the pool was beautiful. The location was perfect about 7 minutes from Disney World's entrance. I can't recall when I was so impressed by a hotel especially for the price we paid, I will defiantly return. They also have a complete salon and spa which I'm sorry I didn't take advantage of, but I will when I return. This condo hotel was so much more than I expected, I am so glad I found it Shirley

Reviews.Title: “the Spa lets this place down ........”
Reviews.Author: alexa310168
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 apartments #51509 (changed to 51503 during stay) and # 51502. All of which I would recommend. They are on top floors, overlooking orlando, WDW or South Intl Drive. Units were a good size. Master lovely. Jacuzzi, great and fills quite quickly too. Lots of storage for clothes, etc. kitchen/utilities good. general positives ..... booked this for location. Approx. 4 mins to WDW, 6 mins to Seaworld and 2 mins from Super Target and WalMart - easy to walk (about 10 minutes) Walk to the Outlets in 2 mins Reception staff were very responsive to the few probs that we had and no complaints from us on that level. Pirate Swimming pool lovely, could have been a little warmer (given the season) and at half capacity of people on sunloungers was MORE than enough people in pool, so beware in HIGH season - it WILL be crowded. Kids enjoyed the slide. when our jacuzzi broke in the 3 bed, we were moved (after some gentle pushing from me) to a 4 bed (HUGE) appartment - see below for more on that!! Be aware that if you stay in buildings 4&5 these are near reception and BIG pool. Buildings 1 & 2 are across a road - we saw a lot of children making their way to the pool across the road. Not my cup of tea, but each to their own. Patrick is a credit to the place. VERY helpful The spa had a great Feel to the whole area, very nice furnishings, etc, however (read below before you book with them) now for the NEGS. sorry!! The trivial comments .... the area surrounding the hotel is clearly where all the construction things were stored. It still looks like an abandoned building site (see pics) Security, well there isn't any. The security locks to elevator areas aren't turned on. You get all sorts of junk mail posted into your appartments Wifi, yes, however, you need to either pay BIG bucks to use theirs, or with our own laptop we had to pay $25 to 'loan' a connection line - for wifi in our appartment!! WHAT!!! Parking a disaster if they have a function there. When we were moved to the palacial sized 4 bed unit, we were thrilled. HOWEVER, it was actually quite daunting, when there were only 3 of us. My 5 yr old was scared of the 'other end'. It is designed so as 2 families could live togehter but far enough apart that they wouldn't be all over each other. Excellent, for large parties, but not for us little lot :-) Pics uploaded of the huge place/balcony, etc. the main NAG for me was the spa ....... I booked an appt for my daughter to have her hair cut. She is 5 and it was a real treat to have a cut and dry in a hotel spa/salon, etc. She enjoyed it, but I did NOT enjoy the attitude of the lady on Spa reception (who, as it turned out was actually the spa manager). She made it clear how 'inconvenient' it was to have a customer and she huffed and puffed on the phone to her friend about it and then to the stylist to get him from his break to meet with his next appt with us!! the spa was EMPTY, not one customer, why he needed a tea break? not sure!) I booked an appt for my 1st treatment (with intention of having 2 more) ... I changed the time (with the required notice) as 'we are on vacation' and weather/plans change, etc. I am not about to make excuses to some pumped up lady in a spa as to why I am changing my plans!! When I called to rebook a day or so later, she made a point of mentioning 'she remembered me, I had cancelled on her!!' and also that I would need to be sure of my plans this time as it is inconvenient for them, etc. and they get busy .......... WHEN? Everytime I entered that spa there was noone there and I mean ..... most times I wandered around on my own and didn't see even a staff member! SUmmary, she is rude, not the standard I would expect from a 'resort spa' and quite frankly I am not surprised that it has no clients. I NEVER DID rebook a treatment with them. They lost out on $350 worth of treatments there!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fantastic Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: annie2156
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in August. OMG this place is fantastic! 2 bedroom apt was extremely spacious, all mod cons, plasma tvs, kitchen has every utensil and appliance you could ever need. Walmart just down the road which saved us a few dollars on not having to eat out 3 times a day as parks are expensive enough. Very clean. Jet tub in bedroom was a great extra. Pool was relatively quiet, always a spare lounger. Truly cant think of anything negative to say about this hotel. All I would say is you need a car as not many other restaurants in walking distance though in easy driving distance from all major parks. Make sure you try Bahama Breeze in LBV - mmmmmm!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: travelerplus2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 2 kids(5 yr, 2yr) stayed in a 2 BR/2Bath Oct 23-26 in Bldg 3. The unit was very clean and spacious. The location is great - very close to Disney and Sea World. We wanted use of a kitchen for some meals which was a great time saver. I was surprised to find a lot of the amenities, to include extra trash bags, paper towels, dishwashing soap, and lots of towels. We brought our own detergent and did some laundry in the room too. The kids loved the huge pirate pool - especially after 3 days of rain. The market in the complex is convenient and had lots to offer, but was pricey. My only complaint would be the service. I had called a week before and requested a crib, and mentioned it again when checking in. The crib didn't arrive after an hour of checking in and we called the front desk again. They said one would be brought up, but we didn't have to wait. We went out for the night but it never came. We ended up putting the dining room chairs around the twin bed and luckily my 2 year old was too exhausted to climb out each night. I would definitely stay here again though. It was a great value and I would recommend it. However, be aware that this is not a normal hotel. If you looking for a more personalized service this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loove it!!”
Reviews.Author: threeshinyjs
Reviews.Content: Wow! This place was great! First, it's a condominium not really a typical hotel. It doesn't have a hotel feel at all - you feel more like you are staying in a home. The room was very clean and large. We stayed in the 3-bedroom and there was plenty of room for 6 adults and 2 kids. The pool was AWESOME!!! They have a huge gorgeous pirate ship in the pool with an awesome slide, a wading area of the pool for tiny kids and a great (but over priced) Tiki bar. Fun fun fun. There is also a game room with pool tables and a little grocery store with lots of good selection. We cooked one night and that was the best after a long day at the parks. The Irish Pub that is part of the hotel is very nice (but over priced again). There is no housekeeping unless you pay a fee of about $18-40 depending on how much cleaning you want done. There is a washer/dryer in each unit which was great! There is a free shuttle to the parks but they only run 1-3 times in the morning and evening depending on which park it is (there is only one shuttle to Sea World in the morning and one that returns at night and a few for Disney) - and you have to make reservations ahead of time to use the shuttle - first come first serve. We just drove because we didn't want to get stuck at the parks if we wanted to come back early -- Sea World was about 15 minutes away and Disney was about 10 minutes drive. Great great place and I will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place at a Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: Blueboro
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2BR/2Ba unit from October 15-20. 4 adults...my wife and I and our two 20+ sons. The development is very nice and new. Plenty of room. Front desk staff was friendly and efficient. We did not opt to have housekeeping since it is extra and how much trouble is it to make a bed. The unit was decorated very nicely. The new pirate ship pool looked really nice even though we never got in. It seemed very crowded and big groups seemed to take over. The only complaint we would have would be the lack of parking. Cars were lining all the streets and if you got back late you had trouble even finding a place on the street. I guess it was Fall break because we were surprised at the crowds during this time. The economy does not seem to be hurting Disney. With interior halls the condo was a little noisy at times with kids running up and down the halls and a Bachelorette party close by. You could also hear noise from adjoining rooms. But it was still a nice place and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Place-whole family loved it”
Reviews.Author: blosspugs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa.This was a family trip with my twin grand daughers and their friend.After driving 1200 miles and taking kids to Disney this resort cut down on some of the expence of eating out.We had a full kitchen-washer-dryer,big screen tv and the hot tub the girls loved as much as the pool.We were very close to the parks and out shopping in our parking lot.The Resort was very clean and very friendly staff.I was very impressed with the whole layout and service that I will really like to stay there again next year on our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend at LBV Resort Village and Spa”
Reviews.Author: Coralstone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a weekend to spend without the kids for the first time ever. When we arrived the check in was fast, the room was roomy, well decorated, and more than we expected for the price we were paying. I was especially taken by how clean it was. I get the willys at hotels, but this one was so different. Checked in on a Friday and by Saturday we were ready to get the kids, especially when we saw the pool. It is a perfect pool for any age child. We kept to the plan (the plan to be alone for the weekend) and had a great time. No one bothered us in the room. We had a room with a view to see the disney fireworks at night. That was really romantic. We watched from the balcony. The balcony was huge and totally private. Due to the wonderful weather we had, we spent a lot of time on the balcony. It really was a perfect weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jackmanvirginia
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort. We stayed in a 3 bedroom condo in one of the new buildings that overlooked the Pirate pool with a 2 year old and a 5 year old. The kids loved the place. It was very clean and roomy. The staff was very friendly. We were able to see the Disney fireworks each night. Very convenient to Disneyworld. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: cjb1065
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Very clean. Staff was very helpful. Only problem we had was with the shuttle service. It only runs to Epcot 2 times a day at 8;20 and 11;20 and returns at 6;15 and 8;45, so we didn't get to see the fireworks which start at 9 PM. The hotel needs to have at least one more time added in the morning and in the evening. We only stayed 4 days .I suggest if your staying longer to rent a car. Epcot is only 5-7 minutes away from the complex. Loved Frankie Farrells Pub and Grill on the premises. The food was excellent and reasonably priced. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: vixen32655
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 2 year wedding anniversary at this Resort. It was the most beautiful resort that we have stayed at. We always travel to Orlando but we didn't hear about this place until I called hotels.com. We had a hotel picked out but once I read the reviews I decided to cancel that hotel. I asked the operator what she would recommend for us. She recommend the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. We ended up getting into a 3 bedroom 2 bath. The room was very spacious even for the two of us. We didn't get a chance to get into the pool but we did get into the jacuzzi tub in the master room. We were able to relax and enjoy ourselves. My husband and I only stayed for one night but we did not want to leave the next day. We are planning on our next trip very soon to the same resort. Once we stayed there we don't plan on staying anywhere else. This is the best place to stay in Orlando. The only problem that we had was we decided to rent a dvd player and the remote didn't come with a battery inside so we called guest services and they checked the other dvd players but the other one didn't have a remote to it so the didn't charge us to rent it. They do put a $50 hold on your credit card and once you check out they release the hold. We didn't have a problem with that at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ryck
Reviews.Content: We had booked on the internet from New Zealand and were anxious as to what we had booked and how we would get around as we weren't hiring a car. We need not have been. The resort was fabulous in many ways and exceeded all of our expectations. We stayed there for 14 days in a two bedroom, two bathroom condo. The master bedroom was huge with large drawers, TV, king bed, huge spa bath, separate shower, sink, and separate toilet. The second bedroom had two beds that appeared to be doubles - my two large teenagers appreciated that and having their own TV. The second bathroom had shower over the bath, sink and toilet - all very nice. The kitchen was well equipped with full stove/oven, huge micromave and fridge, dishwasher and to the side a very large washer and dryer. The living area had a sofa, two arm chairs, side tables/lamps, flat screen tv and dining table with six chairs. We were in building 5 and our room on level 7 overlooked the new pirate ship pool facilities but was next to the building that housed the lobby. The room and buildings all appeared to be new and were in excellent condition. We checked in at 10pm at night and the clerk was very nice. All of the staff were nice the entire stay and we talked to them every day to put our names down for the free shuttles to the various parks. Nothing was too much trouble. The shuttles leave at set times every day and pick up at set times so Disney parks 8.20am and come back 6.15pm or 8.45pm. Universal/Seaworld leave later 9.20 I think from memory and come back 6.45pm. All free with small tip daily. We used the shuttles nearly every day and they saved us a fortune. Occasionally we caught taxi back - cost $17 including tip from Disney Epcot and from Seaworld about $35 with tip. Resort is next to the Lake Buena vista shops - right next door so that was fabulous as could get all shopping there. We did catch taxi to Florida mall which is a big place $35 each way but found that the factory shops had most of what we were looking for. Walmart costs about $7 including tip by taxi and has all the supplies you could need including groceries so went there several times. You can use the shuttle service but that is a fixed rate of $8 plus tip. We walked to factory shops and got taxis from there. There is no housekeeping but that didn't worry us as we were out a lot during the day and we are reasonably tidy family. If you want housekeeping you can book a light clean for $15 or a full clean for $30. The pirate pool complex is wonderful and very relaxing. Plenty of room, plenty of chairs/loungers, towels even on a busy day. Overall a very pleasant experience - I would recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and well equipped apartments”
Reviews.Author: loversofsunshine
Reviews.Content: We were a party of six (four adults and two children)and we had booked through Virgin a two bedroom apartment but upgraded when we got there to a three bedroom and wow! The Two master bedrooms had en suite bathrooms with Jacuzzi and separate showers, each bedroom had its own tv as well as a very large tv in the lounge. There was a fully equipped kitchen with a large American style fridge/freezer, a cooker, washing machine, tumble dryer, dishwasher and a microwave but strangely no kettle. Because the apartments are only a couple of years old they can be difficult to find. It's best to aim for the Lake Buena Vista factory shops (as the apartments are right behind them) On-site there is a small quiet pool as well as a larger pool area with a bar and an interesting water slide on a pirate ship and towels are supplied at both pools. There is an Irish pub that does very good meals. Try the teriyaki chicken and the house curry. There is also a small Pizza Hut express located inside a small convenience store. They do provide transport to the parks, but we did not use it as we had a hire car. I believe the pick up times were a bit limited unless you wanted to stay in the parks all day. About 5 minutes drive away there is a Wal-Mart and a few other stores, (turn left onto main road which is the 535). Turning right takes you to all the main theme parks and International Drive and if you continue up the 535 you will come to Crossroads which has a variety of restaurants including McDonalds and a 24hr supermarket. This was far less busy than International drive and Downtown Disney). All in all excellent apartments with excellent facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun!”
Reviews.Author: DeputyDogTallahassee
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister, brother-in-law and I stayed at the Resort and had a great time. It was convenient to Epcot and all surrounding attractions. We would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Orlando for Families”
Reviews.Author: nanniex2
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. Our family of 5 stayed at this hotel last week for our Disney vacation. We had reserved the 3 BR suite, but changed to the penthouse 4br on the 15th floor for a view of the Disney fireworks display. This hotel suite was spotless and made you feel so good. The two master suites had whirlpool tubs, which was very relaxing. Every bedroom has a tv. The balcony went across the entire suite and had furniture. We had a complete kitchen, only lacked a few cooking items. The pool was great for my granddaughter and we enjoyed it after a long day of walking. Epcot was only 2 miles away and Magic Kingdom was 5 miles. There was no traffic and no wait lines. This is the time to go to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: peterdbrooks
Reviews.Content: We actually got to stay at Lake Buena Vista as a result of Hurricane Ike (we were due to be staying on the Keys), so it was not planned. The apartment had been arranged by Virgin Hilidays, and as soon as we arrived we knew we were not going to be dissapointed. The staff on the front desk were very helpful and pleasant. The apartment itself was very impressive,with a large living/dining space and a newly fitted out kitchen area.The biggest surprise was the master suite which was bright and airy and had an open plan en suite bathroom with a whirlpool spa bath - totally unexpected for this type of unit. There was a further bedroom and full bath. As we were there just out of season the resort was quiet which meant most times we had the pool to ourselves. There is a Walmart Supercenter and a Publix supermarket about 1 mile away, which was very convienient. I would recomend this resort to anyone,we had no complaints and the apartment was very clean on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell040
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. My partner, mother in law and i stayed at the hotel in a 2 bedroom apartment for 2 weeks and we all agree that we had a lovely stay and will definatly recomend this hotel. The apartment its self was massive, clean and the jacussi tub in the main bedroom was very much enjoyed. The hotel itself is only a 5 minute drive from disney , 20 minutes from seworld and then walmart is a couple of minutes down the road. The irish pub food which is on the complex was very good but slightly pricey as when we ate in lake buena vista restaraunts (10 minute drive) we were roughly saving ourselves $20 each time we ate. The new pirate ship pool was excelent and there is plenty of chairs and beds (dont worry if you havent any bath towel as you can pick up clean towels down by the pool and then put them in the designated bin when you have finished). Service from all the staff was excelent and friendly and yet again we all recomed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Solid,”
Reviews.Author: thlayne
Reviews.Content: We live in Tampa and spend about 5-8 night a year over in Orlando going to the Disney parks. We have stayed at a lot of hotels since we usually get Florida resident deals. We stayed at this hotel with our 2 kids since we like to have a separate room for them and this hotel has 2 bedroom suites. We found this deal online and since we know the area we were willing to give it a try. There are a lot of hotels around Disney that I would not stay at however I had driven by this one in the past during the contruction phase and it looked nice. The hotel itself has a lot of suites and is built for families coming to disney. The room was nice. It was not as nice as the rooms at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club but there was nothing wrong with them. They were clean, had flat panel LCD TVs, a large jacuzzi tub in the master and a solid kitchen area. The second bedroom was also a nice little room. The resort itself is big but the pool was quite small so if have a great pool is a requirement you may be disappointed. They have a restaurant on premise that we ate at and it was above average. Overall I would stay here again. It is about 10-15 minutes from Disney but for the price you pay it is worth it for a nice, big room. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Pirate Pool”
Reviews.Author: kazmataz
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back to-day after spending 14 nights in a 3bed/3bath condo-all I can say is WOW! This is our 12 th holiday to Orlando and everyone in our party agreed it was the best, we would not hesitate to come back. The high-lite of the resort is the incredible Pirate Pool Complex. Excellant bar service from Amanda and Bob. Nothing was too much trouble. Bar snacks made fresh to order, can recommend Cheese Nachos. Plenty of beds around the pool both in sun and shade. 3 large spa pools. The pirate ship looks stunning and is the centre piece of the resort, the slide from the pirate ship is not for the faint-hearted. At night the pool and bar remained open and it was possible to view the disney fire works whilst sitting at the bar. The rooms themselves were very large and clean everything was provided. We used the on-site pizza hut, this was excellant. Everyone we spoke to at this resort was curteous and genuine. I cannot recommed this resort highly enough and plan on returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for the Parks”
Reviews.Author: Pipkins56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 5 nights in Orlando (2 Adults plus 2 teenage children) . Perfect location even though we spent 3 days at Universal and Seaworld and one day at Disney (we've done most of disney in paris and LA) and Disney is closer. Must have car to get to parks early though We rented one of the 3 bedroom apartments for £63 per night for perhaps more than some pay but it was spacious comfortable and cool. Irish bar was great for late night food after parks and on arrival from UK. We did not use pool as we were out most of the time and pool was busy. On site shop was useful if you ran out of things such as beer and wine or even food although relatively expensive!! Would definately recommend as base for week in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: BX-ray
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the accommodations were excellent. The tremendous amount of room per suite was unbelievable. Everyone had plenty of space to be comfortable. We had all the comforts of home at our finger tips. We had 4 children in our room with soccer equipment and we still had space for everyone to be comfortable. The employees were very accommodating. Parking was ample and the security of getting into the various buildings was impressive. We have reccommended this hotel to several people, in fact our oldest daughter spent last Labor day weekend there and she too was impressed. The new pirate boat pool area is finished and the children love it. We plan to make this resort our first choice when visiting Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities”
Reviews.Author: ViBoLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked for a week in late August for a family holiday to WDW. We were a party of five, three adults and two children. Unfortunately our flight was cancelled and our party arrived in two parts. I had made the booking in my name but when the others arrived first, the check in staff helped get them settled and all it took was a phone call to me to enable the booking to go ahead. We stayed in building 1 and therefore the room was not brand new and did look slightly lived in but everything was clean and well maintained. We used all facilities, microwaves for sterilising, washing machine and dryer and we had no complaints here. TV in living room is massive and is bigger than my dining table, definitely not sleek. Location is fab, it took about 20 mins to get to most Disney parks and about 30 mins to Universal but we were not driving super fast. Walmart is very close and the mall next door has some good shops. We used the new pirate pool, though the ship itself had not been completed. Spa facilities worked well and they have even opened a kids club - though we did not use this. The hotel is also offering their own mini makeover for children before you visit the parks if you are into that kind of thing - we didnt use this. Only gripe is walls are slightly thin and given every single room has a TV, we could hear every line from the TV show the people next door were watching. They checked out one night after we checked in, so was not a problem for us, but it would have been if they had stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place as a home base !!”
Reviews.Author: bill_jensen32
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week and were completely satisfied. The place was clean, huge, and comfortable. If you wanted to stay in all it felt like home, If you were out all day it was relaxing to come home to such a place. Definitly would like to return again !

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: greattrip08
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. We were a family of 4 in a 2 bedroom unit. The condo was beautiful, clean and met all of our needs. The new pirate pool opened that week and the kids LOVED it. The price was very family friendly. By staying here and using the kitchen for 1-2 meals per day, we saved a great deal of money. We had friends in Florida this same week staying in Disney and using their meal plan, our accomodations and cost was a far better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation, would return agian”
Reviews.Author: Malcky
Reviews.Content: Read the Tripadvisor reviews at this resort before we booked a 10 day stay with Virgin holidays. The reception staff were always polite and very helpful and we were given accomodation in block 3 on the 10 floor. The apartment was very spacious and had 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and was equipped with everything we needed including a jacuzzi and walk in shower in the main bedroom. It was great to have your own laundry facilities and also nice to have 3 separate bedrooms especially for our older children. We were only in the apartment for 10 days so we went without the extra cleaning but it seemed a reasonable price to pay if needed. The apartments also have free internet and all you need is the extra connection lead which you can borrow from the reception desk. The parking is a little limited depending on what time you return to your apartment but we always found a parking space. We used the small supermarket which was reasonable priced as well as the Irish pub which had decent food and friendly staff. We did not use the pool as it was small and very crowded sometimes and seemed to be situated in the wrong place and out of the sun most of the time, which would be our only criticism but there is new pool built and has now opened just after we left so this should solve this major problem. The complex is in an excellent location to get to Disney, Universal and Sea World as well as Aquatica Water Park. Also the Lake Buena Vista Outlet Mall is next door which was very useful, it is also close to a Walmart and other stores on the 535 as well as being close to Kissimmee on the 192. We Eat in such places as TGI Fridays, Ruby Tuesdays, Perkins on the 192 and also Tony Romas, Dennys on International Drive, all these were OK but nothing outstanding. We would return to this resort again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: littleiko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in Oct. 2007. Found it to be an excellent value for the money. At that time, I believe we only paid $125/night + tax for the 2/bdrm but I think the rates have gone up since they opened the spa, pirate pool, etc. The property was not that busy at the time and was under construction but our view was toward the outlet mall next door so we weren't bothered by the work. Found the location to be great since we could get to the Disney parks without messing with I4 or 192, which tend to be extremely congested. Kind of a hike from Universal/Sea World area, though. The kitchen was very well equipped and even had an electric hand mixer and baking pans. We could have baked a cake if we wanted to! I was surprised that there was no DVD player for any of the TVs. Also, no stereo. Maybe those were coming later? It's true that housekeeping is not included but I suppose that helps keep the rates down. For only 3 nights, we didn't need it anyway. My only gripe was that the mattresses were kind of hard. Did not visit the on-site restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Would we stay here again?”
Reviews.Author: Wishitwastheholidays
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a 3 bed, 2 bath condo for two weeks in early August. This was our fourth visit to Orlando in the last five years and we could compare our stay to our holidays in a villa with pool, in resort at the Portofino Bay Hotel and at the Crowne Plaza. The blocks are impressive from the outside and the complex is very well located. Check in was quick, easy & friendly and we were allocated to Building 5. Our room on the fifth floor was virtually brand new and when we walked in we all smiled - until we looked over the balcony and saw the cement mixers, cranes and other construction materials surrounding the unfinished Pirates pool.
