Our friends had already arrived in the resort earlier in the week and when we contacted them to say we'd arrived and which room we were in, they let us know that they had been allocated to the exact same room on arrival and had complained on the second morning because of the construction work going at all hours (our friend has video footage of work being done at 4am!!). We asked to be moved but were told that there were no other rooms available because it was the weekend and the hotel was at full capacity. Other guests who had checked in at the same time as us and who had been allocated to the same building had been a bit quicker and were moved straight away so it wasn't that we were being overly picky. We were given an alternative room overlooking the smaller pool the following evening. Our second condo in building 2 was not as new but it was clean and tidy. Everything was in working order and there was everything we needed. There was a lively buzz of children playing at the pool each day which is exactly what we expected but what was less pleasant was the noise from the pool in the middle of the night (3am!) on a couple of occasions from adults. The pool was very small and the Pirate Pool was far from finished on our arrival - though closer to completion when we left! We found some good places to eat close by (five minutes or less in the car) including Perkins for breakfast, Red Lobster (our favourite this time), Chilis, Lone Star and Pizzeria Uno for dinner. A tiny bit further afield we enjoyed Tony Roma's and The Outback. What did we like best? The location, being able to do the washing & drying (sad but necessary with two teenagers!), approachable & professional staff. What did we like least? the unfinished Pirates Pool. Would we stay here again? Only if all of the glitches had been ironed out - the complex is still new and is still suffering from some teething troubles

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Emo27
Reviews.Content: Firstly I must say what a fabulous place Florida is, we had an absolute ball. The hotel is excellent, we couldn't of ask for more. All the staff were friendly and the reception staff were very helpful on the few occasions that we did use them. Our room was 2 bedroomed and was massive. You never think that rooms will be as good as they look in the brochure, but this was better, in fact I didn't want to come home. I have never done so much washing in 2 weeks!! The rooms had TV's in each room, which pleased my kids no end, big walk in wardrobes and the jacuzzi bath was fab. The only thing missing for us was an oven tray but we made do. The site was very quiet and is in a great location being 10-20 mins away from Disney, Seaworld, International Drive, Univeral and the interstates. The hotel is a stones throw away from the new outlet mall which has new shops opening all the time. The onsite shop is well stocked but there is a Walmart literally 2 mins down the road and that is definitely well worth a trip to stock up. The irish pub is well worth a visit too, the food is lovely and the staff are really friendly with a great atmosphere. The only thing that let us down was the pirate ship pool not being ready and I doubt it will be by this time next year unless they get a move on. The existing pool is very small but my kids (12 & 9) still loved it and it was extremely clean as was the rest of the hotel. All in all I would stay in this hotel again without a doubt, in fact I would go back tomorrow. It really is fantastic value for money, in a fab location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGers08
Reviews.Content: Just returned after two week stay at the Lake Buena Vista Resort. What a great time we had. The hotel was perfect, spacious and clean. The master bedroom was huge, with a big jacuzzi bath in it which the kids loved. The kitchen is well equiped with a dishwasher, microwave, American fridge/freezer and a washer/dryer which was great for washing through your clothes, so dont take a lot with you, we never wore half the clothes we had. The only thing I would complain about is having to pay an additional $15 per week if you wont a basic clean or $30 per week for a full clean, and when I say basic it is basic, we went for the $30. I think this should be included in the price of your stay. They have a games room which my boys loved (6 and 12) a shop which is open until 2am in the morning, I found this very handy, great pizza. Frankie Farrell’s Irish Pub was also handy for a quick drink and a bite to eat, the staff were very freindly. The pool was a bit small and cold, but my boys never complained. They just opened a new pool with a pirate ship plunge on our last day, which was a bit dissapointing, however it looks great. The hotel is idealy situated for all parks, the closest being Disney only about a 10min drive. The LBV outlet shops accross the road was handy to, get great bargains on trainers. For the size of the hotel which has 5 block was very well maintaned and piecefull, most folk are out at the parks all day. If you want to be next to the new pool, try booking block 3,4, or 5 as 1 and 2 are accross the road. Would I return, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: nikkiWill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks with kids aged 11 and 12. We usually stay in villas so the accommodation seemed very average. Beds were comfy. Kitchen very small with not much workspace for making sandwiches etc. Swimming pool overcrowded and sometimes very noisy at night in the first week. By the second week they seemed to be controlling night time swimmers situation. Swimming pool area was not where we spent much time due to it not being a very inviting area and unsupervised kids running round pool. New pool nowhere near ready. Pizza Hut not impressive. Location is excellent. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectation”
Reviews.Author: mobyrik
Reviews.Content: The apartment we stayed in was spacious and offered privacy, when needed, to the people in our party. We stayed in a three bed apartment with enormous fridge, cooker, microwave, dishwasher, spa bath and tv in every room with a large tv in the main living area. The master room is en-suite. On-site amenties included a friendly convenience store with a built in Pizza Hut, which offered a standard service. The irish pub was described as a family pub but at times was rowdy with a mix of locals and holidaymakers. Saying that, there was never any negative or hostile atmosphere generated. Big screens shown all major sporting events. When booking in, you will need to supply credit card details to cover a $20 charge minimum for non-local phone calls etc. Obviously no charge is debited if you don't use any services. Cleaners have to be booked for a separate fee so be aware of this. This is because LBV is a "green" hotel. Trash chutes are at the end of each fllor of the blocks. The resort offers spa facilities and information is available at Reception and numerous recorded invitations will be left on your phone e.g 3-4 over two week stay. My main gripe is that the main pool facility was not open or even completed. The other pool was stuck between two blocks and seemed to be overcrowded probably because the larger pool was unavailable. All things considered I would recommend this resort as a well placed base for all major parks and easily accessible to Disney especially.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doublemalkie
Reviews.Content: This is a first class place. We booked a two bedroom appartment (through Virgin Holidays) and it was in excellent condition. It is self catering but there is a shop/pub restaurant and pizza takeaway on site. The 2 bedrooms were big with the main one having ensuite toilet/ shower and jacuzzi bath. The other bedroom had a separate bathroom and shower. The living room and dining area is spacious. Each bedroom has a TV and there is a large flat screen TV in the living area. The kitchen is well appointed with all the appliances needed and also has a washing machine and drier. Reception staff and concierge were polite and helpfull. There is a small pool and they are building another at the moment. There is a huge Walmart 1/2 mile down the road and Disney is about 15 mins away. I would not hesitate to stay there again on my next trip. Mike Harding (UK)

Reviews.Title: “the property has alot of growing up to do”
Reviews.Author: cockerlover1
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at alot of properties in the orlando area. the location is great right in the middle of all the action. great location if all you have in mind is dining and shopping. as reviewed previously the pool situation is terrible. the pool presently is very small. we were told by the staff that the big pool is to open presently. we were not told of this when we booked the accomadation. this was a get away trip mainly to catch some rays and kick back. needless to say it did not happen. you can only get the rays of the sun from one side of the pool. the surrounding buildings block the sun. the unit was a two bedroom unit. it was clean and nice. nothing spectacular at all. the water pressure is very slow so it took a long time for the jacuzzi to fill up. the furnishings are nice but again very ordinary. not alot of extras. you will need to bring plenty of supplies. an irish pub is located on property as well as a store and pizza hut dining. when we visited for three days the property was booked to capacity every night. parking is a luxury as well as luggage carts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved LBV Resort & Spa!”
Reviews.Author: rdg919
Reviews.Content: Just loved LBV Resort & Spa! The property is beautiful and the units are clean and extremely spacious for an outstanding price. And the staff is very friendly and helpful. Going back again in September!!!

Reviews.Title: “First class accommodation”
Reviews.Author: mally93
Reviews.Content: We were in a 3 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment in block 5. The accommodation was very spacious and well equipped. The kitchen had enough crockery for up to 8 people and also had a food mixer! We were on the top floor and couldn't hear anyone else except on one occasion when the apartment next door had the jacuzzi on at 6am! The pool is too small for the size of the complex but we did always manage to get a sunbed on the odd occasion that we used the pool. The new pool is still under construction and when we left at the end of July it still looked like there was a fair amount of work still to be finished. The onsite shop which encompassed Pizza Hut was very handy particularly when we first arrived. There was also a games room with 3 pool tables and various arcade type games which was very popular with my 11 year old son. The location is great for shopaholics as you can walk to the LBV factory outlets and Premium outlets are 5 minutes drive away. When we checked in we were given discount vouchers to use in the LBV outlet stores. The location is also ideal for Disney and Sea World, which were the parks we visited. A wide choice of restaurants are all within easy driving reach of the complex. Walmart, Publix and Target are left along the 535 and Goodings is right along the 535 within the Crossroads shopping area. We had a fantastic holiday and I would definitely recommend this accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL experience”
Reviews.Author: nonnie51
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from a 5 day trip to Orlando and stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Village and absolutely loved it. I've gone to Orlando 5 times previous and stayed on the Disney property and loved the convenience of the transportation to the parks, but this time we rented a mini van, we had 4 adults and 2 small children, and this was much more enjoyable. The washer and dryer and full kitchen was what made the stay here so pleasurable and saved us a ton of money on food because we could go to the Wal Mart right up the street and buy groceries and eat in our room at least one meal a day. The kids loved having room to run and play in the condo's. A hotel room is so cramped and there is no way to entertain them. The only negative is the promised new large pool was still not open and we were looking forward to having it open for the kids. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Gwenprose
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious with nice amenities, but that's the only thing nice that can be said. On arrival our room was dirty: dirty carpets, dirty dishes, hairs in the bathroom, one toilet was plugged, etc. The kitchen pots and utensils were scant. Not even a salt shaker. We had to ask for a frying pan. The front desk staff looked tired and were disinterested in our comfort. The worst thing was that there is a giant, noisy cooling system fan of some kind right outside our window that made it hard to sleep. For the money, I'm sure I can find a nicer place in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Massachusetts2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at this hotel for 4 nights (8/1/08-8/5/08) and found it to be a wonderful experience. The checkin process was fast and efficient. It took less then 5 minutes! The property was spotless. The room was awesome. A king size bedroom and a second bedroom with two twins. A Plasma TV in the living room, and two other TV's in the bedrooms. The suite, (2 bedroom, kitchen, living room, two bathrooms, and even washer and dryer) was well appointed and clean. The property had security staff on site during overnight hours. The staff helped me out everyday with printed out directions to all attractions including return directions. The checkout process to less then 2 minutes. I high recommend this well managed hotel. The Hotel is close to everything! John from Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Not Recomended”
Reviews.Author: UnitedStatesSally
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience with our reservation. We arrived only to find out that our stay had not been paid for by the company that we booked through. The management was not at all concerned and in fact did not contact us back for three days. We had to pay twice for our reservation. We were never contacted by Lake Buena Vista Resort regarding the problem; in fact, we called the day before our arrival to be sure everything was fine with our reservation. They told us that it was paid in full and that they were expecting us. The management is horrible. The condo itself was spacious and clean. It was nice having a washer and dryer in the room. This resort would be fine provided you do not encounter any problems, because if you do you will not get any assistance from management, they simply do not care. The pool was overcrowded and really not even worth using. The crowd at the hotel was a little "rough" , and the neighborhood seemed unsafe. Close to the parks, but make sure you lock your car and stay inside away from the crowd at the hotel. We won't return here. Pluming leaks in bathrooms and cheap fictures

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel and units are very claen and our room was quit large. It was a 2 bedroom, 2 bath with a living area and kitchen. It was so spacious I would consider it a condo. The staff was very friendly. The English pub was a little disapointing as it smelled of condiments and we thought to by a bit untidy. It did not match the resort at all. I would highly recomend the Hotel but avoid the English Pub.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ferribytiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroomed condo in building 5 which was furthest away from the pool but it seemed the quietest building. Fisrtly the current pool is totally inadequate and very busy, a new one is being built but is well behind schedule. The room was spacious with a nice spa bath & good shower unit. Dishwasher, washing machine provided ( take your own washer tabs though). Large tv with 50 channels and one in each bedroom. You do get noise from the condo above and from outside , people do shout at 1am and make sure you are away from the lifts. I did email the resort twice for a quiet room I never got a reply but was quite happy and the real noise issue was over the 4th July weekend when it was busy. Its very handy for Disney and close to the Interstate. The shop is open 24 hours with a pizza hut inside its very overpriced but handy. Nearby are the Factory stores which has a food court. Overall we felt it was good value for money with good facilities just needs the pool sorting out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Pompanogrammy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with 2 grandchildren, ages 8 and 12 spent 3 nights at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa. The staff were extremely helpful, especially a young man, Mathew Schwartz. The condo was immaculate and very spacious. The location was ideal for all the Disney Parks and local attractions. I would highly recommend staying here for all groups and families.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at LBV Resort Village & Spa”
Reviews.Author: Mondo5280
Reviews.Content: What a steal we had at this place! For $199 a night, we had a two master bedroom with bath rooms, plus a regular bedroom for kids to use, total bedrooms was three and total number of bathrooms was three. The place has its own dining and living room space with big screen tv, plus the full kitchen with sink, stove, micro, fridge and everything else you can think of minus the food and items to fill into the fridge. Don't let me forget, it had a balcony too! This place was awesome, we had four adults and four children occupying this condo and it was well worth it. There was plenty of room, we never felt as if we were disturbing anyone with our noise and no one ever disturbed us. Each room had a TV, the master rooms had a big hot tub in it, plus separate shower area and a dual sink, it worked great. The complex is spread out, but we were in building 1 (where the bar is at) and up on the 7th floor and never had any problems with our room. Our views were of the LBV Outlet Mall and was not bad. The building was secured by having the doors lock after 10p, although we noticed after a couple of days that it was changed for all day. The only way to get into the building was with your room key. The elevators were a bit slow, since it only had two and plenty of people moving in and out of them, especially when checking in or out. The biggest problem we had was after coming back in the evenings after being at the parks all day, we were always struggling to find parking in the 'safe' areas. There was always plenty of parking in the back of the building which was on the same side as the LBV Outlet Stores, but you were looking at the rear of the outlet stores and there was no entry from the back of the building to get to the elevators, you had to walk around and wasn't always lit up very well to feel too comfortable. The other disappointment was the pool. We read everything that said the big pool would be opened by end of May 2008 and we were there the 2nd week of June and still not complete. It didn't really matter as we hit the beach, SeaWorld and all the Disney World parks during our stay so there was never really a chance to take a dip anyway. We will definitely return if the prices remain the same. It is conveniently located near shopping areas, to include Walmart and Target for groceries, plus it is right down the road from Disney. SeaWorld is not far off either, Universal is the only one that is the farthest away. We had a rental car and got around fine, we did look into the shuttles that are offered by this resort but the times were just not convenient for us. Staff was very accomdating and helpful and provided us with everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: Katieyorkshireuk
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 weeks in this resort. First trip to Orlando from uk did'nt want to drive but wanted space for family.This resort fitted our requirments extremely well!Stayed in building 5 all brand new very well finished.Granite work tops american fridge two bathrooms whilpool bath excellent after a very tireing day at parks.Very well situated for disney and other parks still near.Shuttle buses organization towards the end of our stay did fall down slightly although buses booked in advance still tended to not send enough were not hotel run but does reflect badly if system not good.Iris pub food excellent.take out pizza hut on site good prices not like uk.It is possible to walk to Ponderosa and other shops resurants on world centre drive.Also Walmart just over road from factory stores.New pool being built which looks good for kids pirate ship and slide.I was slightly concerned about not driveing in U S as everyone seems to but worked out well for us

Reviews.Title: “Mickey's Haven”
Reviews.Author: AsiaSue
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay when vacationing in Orlando. Very convenient to Disneyworld (approximately 7 miles from the parking lot). Condo spacious and with all the amenities of home. Right next door to the Outlet stores. Just down the street from Wal-Mart. This is a real convenience because the Property store charges 2-3 times as much for a lesser amount of an item. Being a fairly new resort area, some of the furniture appeared a bit worn and there should NOT be an extra charge for cleaning. Otherwise the room was great. With the exception of one, the property staff was courteous and helpful. The biggest negative is that the property does not have internet service (neither wired, high-speed or wireless). There's a coffee shop in the Outlet area that charges $5.00 for 30 minutes of use. Would definately stay here again and would also recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “It was our best vacation EVER!”
Reviews.Author: PipinGA
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando to take a friend to the airport there and decided to stay for several days to make a vacation of it. After scouring sites online, I came across this hotel. It is only a couple of years old and that appealed to me. Also, I read quite a few reviews of it and it was rated top-notch. I am not used to reserving a room this way so was a little anxious about not seeing the room in person before booking for such a long stay. WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED! The condo looked like it had hardly been used and it was simply but beautifully decorated. Very clean and comfortable. There were plenty of towels and tissues/toilet paper etc. However there was washer/dryer. We had planned on going to one or two theme parks but only ended up going to one because we preferred to just "chill" in the room because we were so comfortable. The pool area was a little small with not quite enough lounge chairs. However, they are in the process of building a HUGE new pool area. We definitely want to stay there again and will highly recommend it. Another amazing thing is the low price for such a comfortable and clean place with 2 bedrooms and 2 full baths! The Disney parks are 10 min. to drive to and there's a Wal-Mart right down the road for groceries if you plan to cook there in the condo.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thebalshaws
Reviews.Content: This truly is a fantastic condo-hotel, the accommodation is enormous,3 beds were great especially with 2 teens could not understand sharing two double beds in a single room in other hotels, the facilities in the rooms are great, the pool although presently rather small is adequate for post theme park relax although the sun has disappeared behind the buildings by then, the new pool when it eventually opens will be stunning!, the on site shop is more expensive than supermarkets but thats what you would expect isn't it? Location wise most attractions are very close and easy to navigate to although i would certainly recommend a car as essential. not much else around the accommodation yet! so need to drive everywhere else but it really is not far to restaurants shops and supermarkets. The Pub is fine but when will americans learn that english bitters and guiness should be served at room temperature!!! the staff did try to try to warm the glasses before pouring to try and help. Only used reception to book in and sign out, this was fuss free and dealt with very effecently. Our only couple of grumbles would be the need to book room cleaning, why not just include a change of sheets towels etc once an week with the option of more regular cleans at extra cost and the other grumble no internet access unless you have your own computer with you, a computer in reception for guest use would be useful. Tip - there is an internet cafe in the shopping village next door, shame reception staff didn't mention this when i asked about internet access! We had a great time in Orlando and would thoroughly recommend this accommodation to all friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Flosutt
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort for our Annual Family Vacation on June 2, 2008 for a week stay. I was very skeptical at first about what to expect from this property because I knew nothing about it except what was on the internet and you know how that can be. As a travel professional I have had the opportunity to stay in a lot of 4 and 5 star properties, so I know what I should have expected. Well I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. My family booked 6 condos from 2br to 4 br and everyone was just blown away with how spacious and clean they were. I stayed in the 4 bedroom condo with 2 master suites. Both suites had sliding glass doors that led to a balcony that extended from one end of the condo to the other. They put all of my family members as close together as possible, on the 7th & 8th floor of Building 2. Since I had all 3 of my grandchildren we were able to save a lot of money by cooking some of the meals. And when we got to hot from being at disney all day, we could come home to a quick dip in the pool. I only heard positive comments from everyone that went on this vacation. I will definitely recommend this resort to my clients and I will come again. Next time I will leave the grandchildren at home so I can enjoy the Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Pictures!”
Reviews.Author: PopeyesGirl
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in Florida with the entire family. It was our first vacation and we were cautious about booking a hotel we had seen on the Internet. The pictures seemed too good to be true but when I called the hotel directly they were courteous and offered me an amazing deal. When we arrived (it was easy to get there from the airport) we noticed how beautiful and new the entire village appeared. The rooms were even better. They were huge condos, well-kept, clean and luxurious. The children never wanted to leave. The staff at the hotel were always willing to lend a helping hand and when we checked out there were no hidden costs. We will definitely going back next year except for 10 days not 7.

Reviews.Title: “Our little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Lancslass50
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the LBV Resort Village 3 times now and we love the place, however we have noticed that the units in the older buildings are not looking quite as shiny and new as they did originally but it doesn't make much difference, we still class it as our little bit of luxury. My husband loves the huge TV and the fact that he has a choice of 3 ! I love the ease of having the kitchen and washer/dryer facilities and also the huge bedroom with large walk in shower and jacuzzi bath. We feel that the size, facilities and layout of the units are excellent value for money. I know some have mentioned that the on site shop is expensive and it is but we just shopped at the nearby Wallmart or Publix on our way home. The pool is also small and doesn't get much sun during the day but we wouldn't spend a lot of time at the pool and I know there are further pool and sunbathing areas planned to be ready soon. There are no room cleaning facilities unless you pay extra but it is very easy to put the trash out every couple of days - there is a room at the end of each corridor. We also prefer not to be disturbed by housekeeping at different times of the day and there were plenty of towels provided in the unit. The location suits us perfectly - very close to the Disney complex and within easy reach of pretty much everything by car. The shopping complex next door is not the biggest but still with a huge range of bargains. We will continue to return unless the price shoots up when the full complex is finished. The fact that there is building work still going has not been disruptive in any way any of the 3 times we have stayed, it is hardly noticable. I wouldn't hesitate to recomend this place !

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: peppermintcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for 11 nights (in mid May). We found the 'resort' to be just average - there were both positives and negatives. The 'resort' (if you can call it that) is located within a short driving distance of Disney and the International Drive area. You really do need a car if you stay here, as the only thing really within walking distance are the factory shops next-door. Our apartment was located in building 2 (one of the older buildings, although I believe only a couple of years old). I will start with the good points....... It was spacious - especially the master bedroom/bathroom. The wardrobes are a good size. There is a large safe. 3 TV's. Large fridge. Good location. Balcony (although it overlooked a building site and busy road). And the bad points........ The tiled floors were very dirty when we 'moved in'. Although the kitchen has a large oven, we were unable to use it because there were no ovenproof dishes or baking trays. The general finish of the apartments is below average - the drawers didn't close properly and kept getting jammed, some lightbulbs did not work, the sealant around the shower was missing. The TV made a very loud constant humming noise - even when turned off! We couldn't unplug the TV to get rid of the noise, because the plug was directly behind it (and the TV is far to big to move). The air conditioning was so so noisy (the noisiest we've ever heard). Also, the noise from other apartments was very easy to hear, as the walls and ceilings are so thin. When the people above us had the jacuzzi bath on, it was very loud in our bedroom. One evening, one of our neighbours could be clearly heard being sick in their toilet - not very nice when you are trying to relax in the evening. The bedrooms didn't have curtains (only venetian blinds) which meant you woke up when the sun did. That's if you weren't already awake by the sound of the lawnmowers - which started at 7.30 am!! The swimming pool is tiny (maybe 10 metres long) and it was unheated when we were there. As the pool is situated between 2 high rise buildings, it is often in the shade, and therefore was ICY cold. The rubbish chutes were locked off - this meant us having 12 days worth of rubbish in our apartment - despite calling reception to collect it (they never did). And to top it off, our car was badly scratched one night, in the car park (this was not caused by another car, but by a person or object) - luckily our insurance covered the damage. No security - anyone could have walked up to our apartment door, or go in the pool. We did not use the spa or restaurant facilities. We tried to buy stamps from the resort - but this seemed impossible. reception didn't sell stamps, and the on-site store had a broken stamp machine. Taking everything into consideration, I think we will probably go back to the Sheraton Vistana Villages next time - the service is way better and the swimming pool and general surroundings are much nicer there. We only stayed here as it was slightly less expensive - but I think at the end of the day you get wat you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Jurzgurl19
Reviews.Content: The condo was beautiful! It was very clean and well taken care of. I loved the jacuzzi jet tub in the master bedroom which was huge. I was very pleased with the fireworks view and the view was wonderful (especially at night). The second bedroom was also very spacious with 2 double beds. I also like that there is a restaurant/pub and pizza hut/convenience store right on sight. The outlet center is also right behind the resort within walking distance. I did not use the shuttle service but I like the convenience of having a shuttle bus available to take you to all the attractions which are within a few miles away. I will definitely go back and I will recommend the resort to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: mbbrum
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 16 nights at LBV R&S here are my comments: Positives: Spacious Suites. Two bathrooms, walk in lit wardrobe with safe. Staff were polite and seemed keen to help. Cleanliness of my suite on arrival was good. Sofa converts to double bed so a 2 bedroom suite could sleep 6. Kitchens with every possible convenience and tableware and chairs for 6. Controllable air conditioning. Washer/Dryer Negatives The suites are only serviced when empty unless you pay for a full ($30) or a basic ($15) service. We were given 7 sets of towels however. Some of the cleaning staff did not speak English. Our suite was starting to look a little shabby despite it being pretty new. E.g. Furniture is clearly pretty low quality since there is peeling veneer on bedside cabinets and some drawers cannot be easily opened and closed. There were screw holes on the wall where something had been removed. There are no mattress covers on the beds just a bottom sheet (yuck!) Pillows were thin. Bathroom/toilet room fans are very noisy. Master shower pressure was the lowest I have ever had in America. The pool gets minimum sun and when we were there appeared to have little heating. The new pool/pirate ship was advertised as opening in May on the resorts website, as at 17 May 2008 there was piping and conduit, but no tile or paving - and no builders at work....The expected opening date has since been revised to June 2008 which will remain to be seen! Convenience store was expensive. Avoid rooms in Building One and Two that overlook the Outlet Mall, the row of dumpsters are emptied early most mornings - you will hear them. Although there is plenty of parking at the rear of Buildings one and Two, there is no entrance to the suites, so you will have to walk around the front to gain access Avoid rooms 1203/1303 and upwards since these not only look over the mall but also overlook the air conditioning systems and kitchen outlet to the pub. During our stay a routine clean of the kitchen outlet grease trap was carried out at midnight. Three maintenance men equiped with a searchlight took an hour and a half to complete the job the problem being that they were only 4 foot away from the bedroom window . We did of course complain about the disruption but were told they could only carry out the clean whilst the kitchen was closed hence the advice to avoid room 1203. To sum up I suspect I paid a lot less than similar suites in Orlando, the room had every convenience, but often the niggles outweighed the benefits. I would have preferred a few less facilities, the room be less noisy, have better finish, be serviced daily and have a better pool. Would I return? No, the competition is just too great in Orlando...

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT find!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinky0208
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel by looking online through hotels.com & tripadvisor. I found most reviews to be above average so we took a chance and cancelled our reservations at the Renaissance at Sea World & booked at this resort. Upon checking in things went easy. I had called & asked for a high floor to see the Disney fireworks at night & to be in bulidings 4 or 5 because of the reviews I read on line. We were booked on the 10th floor #5 looking toward Disney in a beautiful, clean, smoke-free room. My husband almost fell over when he walked in to our condo. He could not believe how nice and new it was and he stays in very high end hotels when he travels. Everything you see online is accurate. The kitchen is beautiful. The master with the tub & a shower you could fit 10 people in. My daughter had her own bedroom with 2 full size beds & a nice size closet plus her own full size bathroom. I loved the washer and dryer. Everything was in the room for us. We did go to the super Walmart down the street for groceries. Not a big deal. There is a market on property that has what you need but it is more expensive. If you don't want to drive then its for you. They are not outrageous though. If you want the convenience than your paying for the convenience. We did our own cleaning. As it says, they do charge for housekeeping. It was not that hard to take the trash out. You could leave it in the trash can by the elevator and it was gone by the afternoon. VERY small pool. Have to say that. It is not a resort pool. They were finishing a kids wading pool. It was not done when we checked out. Bottom line...I will go back again. Call and tell the resort what your looking for. Do your homework and if its not right be nice & they will take care of you. They did us.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation resort I've ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: tink1983
Reviews.Content: We didn't want to leave th Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. The rooms were perfect. The master bedroom had a 27" T.v and the other bedroom had a 20"T.V. They have a very well kept,very nice heated pool and hot tub. In the master bathroom there was a jucuzzi tub that had a light in it that changed color, my little brother thought it was the coolest thing in the world! The shower in the master bathroom was huge and so was the master closet. There was a washer and dryer so that made things more convenient. The kitchen was wonderful it had a nice oven, a full size fridge,granite counter tops and a garbage disposal. The furniture was beutiful and they did a wonderful job with the lobby and landscapping. Did I mention they have a spa onsite. I got a facial message/lip service ther and it was wonderful. The spa is very elagently decorated with relaxation inevitable. The spa offers so many treatments you feel like your in heaven. From kids to adults(including men, they didn't leave the guys out so go ahead guys you deserve it) there is certainly relaxing and invigorating tratments for everyone of all ages and genders. They have facials,body treatmens(including wraps), purifing baths,stone treatments,scalp treatments,waxing,nail care, make-up services,and lots of different massages and packages to fit every need and price range. There are to many services to list them all, but trust me they all sound wonderful. The staff was wonderful though out the whole resort. They had a conveience store onsite and a pizza Hut Cafe. They also had a Irish pub and grill located on site that was wonderful. We ate there twice and the french onion soup was the best we've ever tasted, in fact all of the things we had were wonderful, but the french onion soup really stood out. They also have transportation to Disney,Universal Studios and SeaWorld. There is also a very nice shopping center within easy walking distance that was very nice. We spent one day shopping and having coffee there it was great. I have told all my friends about my exsperience and will be going back hopefully very soon. I would reccommend anyone going to the Orlando area to go check it out,you will certainly be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort Village”
Reviews.Author: davenval
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the accomodations, room was spacious and clean, great view of the fireworks from W.D.W., about a 5 minute drive from Downtown Disney, walking distance to shopping. The staff were friendly and helpful. Only drawback was that there is only one small pool for such a large complex, I saw some contruction of a new pool being built, which will fix this. We liked this resort and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at lbv”
Reviews.Author: mommy6
Reviews.Content: We are just returning from another great stay at LBV. This is our third stay and the resort has really changed since the last time we were there. Now they have a pizza shop right on property as well as the irish pub. We stayed with another couple and had many small children with us, with absolutely no complaints at all of the resort. Everything seemed clean and in very good condition. The kitchen is just right for getting breakfast or a light meal together. Also, the staff was friendly, and when I asked if we could drop our bags earlier than the 4pm check in they were very helpful. Overall, a great stay and we will be returning in the fall, we hear there is a great kid friendly pool that will be ready early this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: AJY8
Reviews.Content: Can't say I shared the same experience here as some of the earlier glowing reviews. Here were my issues with the LBVR: 1) Cleaniness of unit (3 bedroom, 3 bath). Stains on carpet; tiled floors were disgusting after wiping down with a damp towel (white towel turned completely brown); showers had hairs on wall. 2) Check-out process. I'm not sure if I've checked out. No bill on hanging on my door knob or slipped under my door in the morning of check-out. I phoned and the front desk said I can give him my instructions verbally. 3) Security. None to speak of. Daily pizza flyers under my door since the pass card reader to our building wasn't working. 4) Pool. If you could call it a pool; more like a wading pool since it was so small. Also, any guests (in unit #2) wanting to walk to the outlet mall behind the hotel had to actually walk through the pool area to get there. Again, no security pass required to get into the pool area. 5) Nit-picking, but only one luggage buggy for the entire building. Needless to say, I didn't get the morning of my check-out. Overall, I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: KGD'sMOM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after our disney cruise, April 23-27 and May 1-4. There was four adults and two kids in a three bed/two bath condo and the space was perfect. As stated before the pool is too small for the amount of rooms currently available but this will be fixed when the new pool is finally finished. The front desk still say it will be done by the end of May but we saw little to no work being done while we were there. Our second condo was missing a few items, we had lids but no saucepans, no dish towels or dish cloths but they were delivered very quickly. We booked with the resort using magicard discount from Orlando info. Great location to Disney parks and the Walmart down the street is convenient. Special thanks to Patrick at the front desk who found our passports that I inadvertantly left after the first stay. He kept them safe until our return and let us check in early on our return. All in all a great experience and really loved the washer and dryer. One last thing Frankie Farrells the onsite restaurant was so so with the food, okay the first time and not so good the second.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the LBV Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: Lu_Rio
Reviews.Content: We just loved our 16 nights stay at the buiding #5 at the LBV resort and Spa. The suite is bigger and better than the pictures show. Everything is so new you feel like you are the first one to use it. If I knew the washer/dryer would be fullsize it would have saved me tons of luggage. The living room has a huge LCD TV, and th rooms have their own TVs too. My kids just loved it and my younger boy calls it "our new home" The staff is friendly and helping, I asked for a crib and they sent me one in about 2 minutes. We have asked for a Fireworks facing room and Patrick, ate the front desk managed us one. We had an early check in and late check out due to international flights hours, and there was no extra fee for it. There is a fee for room cleaning, but we prefer not having a stranger into our room daily. We didn't use the pool or the Spa services, but the pool looked too small. Another great point is that the parking is conveniently located inside the building. It really is close to everything and very easy to get everywhere (and back!). The 24hour market located on the resort is expensive, but what should one expect? Anyway there is a 24h Wal-Mart just across 535. The Pizza Hut is very convenient, quick and delicious. Stay here. You will love it too.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended if you just want to use it as a base, not resort”
Reviews.Author: Alpha_Delta
Reviews.Content: We booked with Virgin Holidays and were very happy with the Virgin service and the VIP treatment by Dollar Car Rental. The only issue with Virgin is that they give the incorrect address for the resort! It is definitely Poinciana, not S. Apopka Vineland Road. The check-in was efficient and the aprtment was very comfortable and clean, although curtains in addition to the venetian blinds would have been welcome in the bedrooms. The washing machine, tumble drier and dishwasher were welcome and the crockery and cutlery was clean. There was no internet PC in reception, but the check-in staff were more than happy to check us in for our return flights using their PC. We booked a $30 room clean and change of bed-linen and towels that was not carried out on the requested day. A quick call to reception resulted in an apology and a complimentary clean the following day. The resort is very close to Disney World and we found it relatively quiet with plenty of parking. The pool area is small and the on-site convenience store is relatively expensive. In summary, we had a very comfortable stay for 9 nights, but might not return for 14 nights, as the small pool area rules out any "chill-out" days.

Reviews.Title: “LBV is definately worth visiting”
Reviews.Author: Mickey90
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 days in LBV. We booked it via expedia and used the experiences from Tripadvisor.com. Everything they say is true. The rooms are specious, nicely decorated and very clean. The location is very comfortable and close by all the Disney parks. The only disappointing fact was that the “promised” new pool was not ready yet. This is still under construction. But the other pool was just okay. One thing we would recommend to the Management is; please hang curtains the bedrooms. Now there are only blinds and they wake you up early in the morning. We will definitely come back for a next visit and can recommend this resort to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, terrific, awesome, perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrchadg1
Reviews.Content: I'll never stay at the Disney World Resorts again! Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa was absolutely the best decision I've made in a long time. We reserved a 3 bedroom condo for my family of 4 and my parents. There was so much room that we probably could have gotten by with a 2 bedroom condo. The master bedroom had a jacuzzi tub and separate shower and a king sized bed. The 2nd bedroom had a king sized bed and the 3rd bedroom had two twin beds. Each bedroom had its own TV. The TV in the living room was a 55" plasma. The kitchen came in handy as we ate in to eliminate the cost of the park food. The washer and dryer was awesome. We didn't have to pack as much because we just washed a load of clothes halfway through the trip. The staff was unbelievably helpful with any request we had. The location is excellent - it took us about 5 minutes to get into the parks. I can't say enough about the pleasure our stay here added to our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: jlbIndiana
Reviews.Content: Two bedroom condo was very nice and clean. Location was very convenient ot disney. Only problem was customer services. Online help was rude and on location when we decided to stay another night you would have thought I was asking the impossible. They were not full, the room was available but the front office staff was clueless and not the least helpful. Not a restful experience to an otherwise pleasant stay. Spa overpriced and special pirate swimming pool not completed months behind expected date on their web page.

Reviews.Title: “More for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Goldenchickster
Reviews.Content: I couldn't get a room in my sister's hotel on the Disney property, so I chose Lake Buena Vista Resort. I'm so glad I did! I paid a whole lot less than what my sister did and I had three times the space! It was so convenient to have a washer and dryer in the room and it was just like being at home. I had free shuttle to Epcot, and I was able to take to Monorail to the Magic Kingdom. I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and spacious beautiful rooms. I'm already planning another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Accomodations for Disney Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Scotiascott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa and were very impressed. The resort is brand new and is of a very high quality. The layout of the units are excellent and furnished to a very high degree. The pool is small and crowded but when the new large pool opens it promises to be a great addition. Keep in mind that this resort is a condo development and not a hotel. The condo buildings themselves are not secure as we had pizza flyers put under our unit door a couple of days. We felt that it would be more secure if you were required to use your room card to gain access to the building. As it is currently set up, anyone off the street can walk into the resort buildings and pool area. Depending on how you feel about security, this may be somewhat of a minor complaint. We were very happy with our stay and found it to be nice and quiet. We stayed in building 5 on the 14th floor with great views of the nightly fireworks at Disney. The resort is located very close to all the Disney parks as well as a Wal Mart SuperCenter just 2 minutes down the road. We found this great for stocking up on groceries. As a side note, we rented our vehicle with Budget Car Rental at the Orlando airport and everthing was handled smoothly. We recommend that you enroll in the Budget RapidRez Program before you go. This allows you to skip going to the Budget rental counter inside the terminal and go directly to the Budget kiosk in the parkade instead. This will save you a lot of time waiting in line at the terminal counter.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rcebulko
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 days in Orlando to go to Disney with our kids and were THRILLED with our choice of hotel. We were looking for a place where my husband and I could have a little privacy and this place was WONDERFUL! We paid $149 per night for almost 1,300 sq ft. We had a king size bed in our bedroom, jacuzzi bathtub, tiled shower and walk in closet. The kids had a room with 2 full beds and their own tv and bathroom. The living room had a huge flat screen tv and the kitchen was gorgeous - granite countertops, full refrigerator, dishwasher, stove, microwave, pots & pans, dishes etc...and a washer and dryer! The hotel also has a convenience store that is open until at least midnight every night, which is extremely convenient. Plus, the hotel is conveniently located on the corner of 535 and 536, so you basically pull out of the hotel and jump on 536 and you're at the Disney gates in less than 2 miles. We will never stay anwhere else on our trips to Orlando!!!

Reviews.Title: “love lake buena vista resort village & spa”
Reviews.Author: momof343
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, lovely acomodations, would gladly go back for another stay and recomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Village Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: CapAnn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location April 10 - 14, 2008. I will start by saying that I am extremely picky and will usually look for 4 to 5 star hotels/resorts (the newer the better). My absolute favorite in Orlando is the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on Internation Drive - adjacent to the Premium Outlets. Having said all that - this resort was comfortable, in a good location and the price was great. However, we did not receive any of the special requests that we had emailed and called ahead for - top floor, end unit (due to being late sleepers) - and the front desk staff was not accomodating - period! We experienced several bouts of power surging - this would occur at all hours - I was awakened several times throughout the night by the surges as the alarm clock buzzed - after the first night I just unplugged it. Overall it is an average hotel - view was of the parking lot - building 5, eighth floor (right next to the elevator! - do much for requesting an end unit!!!). I personnally will not stay here again - I would much rather pay another $50 per night and stay in luxury and a gated hotel. During our stay we had several pizza and chinese restaurant menus tucked under our door - therefore people are allowed to roam freely. The pool was a joke - just one small pool for 5 buildings!!! Although a larger, themed pool is in the process of being built - no construction while we were there however! As for Frankie's - it was mediocore - okay for nighttime cocktails, again I prefer the pool bar at the Hilton - much better atmosphere! And the service at the Hilton cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: fourstaronly
Reviews.Content: Very close to Disney and Sea World. Only 10 miles from Universal Studios. The two bedroom apartment was excellent We were pleased with all aspects of our stay The layout of the apartment suited us. The bedrooms are seperated by the living room, all areas of the apartment are large. Safe walking distance to a lot of shops including small resturants. Many buses left the resort in the morning for attractions in Orlando. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Roadtripper2008
Reviews.Content: This resort had all the amenities and at a great value. My family stayed here recently (4 adults, 1 child) and we had plenty of room with two bedrooms and two full bathrooms. Open kitchen area with everything you could need, stocked there to use. Our room was beautifully decorated and the beds were very comfortable. We used the pool and gym and ate at the on-site Irish Pub for dinner, which was excellent. Garage parking was available for no extra charge. We are planning our next trip to stay at this resort - it was new, clean and very close to all theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing facility.”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan41
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort around 3:00 p.m. and unable to check in until 4:00 p.m., which was fine because it's a short walk to the outlet mall or just across the street is an Irish pub. The young man at the front desk, Chris, was more than cordial and very pleasant inspite of numerous phone calls. When we entered the room we were thrilled. Clean and very spacious for a family with children and I can't imagine what more you would want. Full kitchen, washer/dryer, dining area, two bedrooms, living room and a balcony with a gorgeous view. The jacuzzi tub was a huge plus at the end of a full day at the Magic Kingdom. There are also two floors of garage parking and well-lighted for evening coming and going. The price was more than reasonable for the accommodations and we will certainly book a room here on our return visit to Orlando. We were truly impressed with the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ddmd1213
Reviews.Content: Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa was a wonderful place to stay. The 2-bedroom suite was clean and spacious and the Resort was just a 15 minute drive Disney attractions.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Going Back !”
Reviews.Author: Frozenfingers
Reviews.Content: Just an incredible place. Great location and very easy to find. Easy drive to WDW and SeaWorld. The main pool is under construction still, but looks to be finished soon. We found our two bedroom to be very spacious and the furniture comfortable, including the beds! The staff were extremely friendy, and we had two great meals at Frankie Ferrels. Our waiter was an entertainment onto himself, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great home from home experience”
Reviews.Author: Richard06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the above and were very happy with the experience. Good location to all the usual Orlando attractions although the hotel transport we found limited with only one collection and return to Universal and Sea World. Although this complex is still being developed we were not disturbed at all by construction works. There is no free housekeeping and this could get expensive at $35 a time, we only booked it once and to be honest that was OK (for 3 of us). Amenities in the room were excellent and we wouldn’t hesitate to go back again .

Reviews.Title: “Want to go back soon !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CJCash23
Reviews.Content: I have to say before we went to Florida I did a lot of reasearch into places to stay. We were looking at suite hotel and decieded this was a better deal. We arrived on the 8th of april. We flew into the Sanforda airport got on I-4 and got off on 535. It was really easy to find. Reading some of the reviews I excepted a lot worse. We to the front desk and checked in very easy to check in. We had a room on the 12th floor. We booked a 2 bedroom. Parked in the parking ramp. (Spaces were quite small) Got on the elevator into our room. I was quite suprised by the fact they leave you little shampoos ect. Towel were folded nice and the master bedroom was nicely done. We had a great view. Nice big walk in closet in the master. We had some minor issue with the room. The closet light did not work in the master bedroom but really did not bother us. If you wanted to use the whirlpool tub there was never enough hot water. We decieded not to complain about that also. We figured the had the hot water heater set for safety regulations. My only other minor complaint would be to close of the shower and sink area some how in the master bath. It was great being able to eat 2 meals a day at the condo and it was relaxing and felt like home. Someone on a review said the internet service was terriable we actually had no problems with it and with a 14 year old that was very important. I was not sure I would like not having maid service but it was actually quite nice not having someone enter our room every day. It was a great trip and I would deffintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sizzler10
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a wonderful 10 day vacation in Florida made so by an excellent stay at the LBV Resort Spa and Village. We originally booked a 4 night stay at the hotel and then were due to transfer to St Petes beach for 5 nights. The first 4 nights were spent in a 2 bedroom apartment which was sufficient for a family of five. It was extremely spacious and maintained to a high standard, the jacuzzi bath being a firm favourite with all the family. We were sad to check out and travelled over to the beach, but were in for a shock as the hotel was of a very poor standard(Alden Beach Resort), so my husband rang the LBV Resort and rebooked us back into a 3 bedroomed apartment on the 14th Floor which was fantastic. The views were great, and the hotel was so peaceful. We didn't see or hear any other guests during our stay and the building work at the new pool complex was very quiet. Parking was easy and there are 4 lifts per building. The shop was handy and opened late, but the prices were extremely high, but you are paying for the convenience. Walmart just over the road great value for money and selection. The shopping outlet next door was great especially for sports clothes ieNike shop and Reebok. Much quieter than the Orlando Premium Shopping Outlet nearby. Overall, excellent facilities and would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort--Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: busedteach
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom, two bath condo for two nights! The property and condo are just beautiful and I can't say it enough. It is not far from Disney. It is great for a family of four or more. Much cheaper than staying on Disney's property. The only two drawbacks would be the lack of parking for building 1and the prices at the "convenience" store.

Reviews.Title: “Great home from home”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_family39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February. The room was great, roomy, clean..and the television wow it was huge! Few minor problems, we had to call reception as the patio door wouldnt lock, lighting which surprised me as it was a new hotel. There was a lack of kitchen utensils..no cooking trays to cook on and only 6 chairs at the table for a room that slept 8 so two people had to sit at the breakfast bar and eat. No broom, dustpan or brush or anything like that and with small children this caused problems. We stayed for two weeks so we ended up paying $40 +tax for a clean. Upon returning to the room after it had been cleaned, my son couldnt find his favourite cuddly toy which has been on his bed when we left that morning he was very upset. I rang downstairs straight away and was told they would look into it. I had to keep chasing it up and even took my crying son downstairs to them, but still they didnt really seemed bothered, they did look but there was no apology. Everyday my son wanted to go to reception and ask if they had found it but we kept getting told the cleaner said she put them all back on your bed (It was the only toy on his bed!). They faithfully promised me an email when they had heard from the laundry but I never got one. For my son this ruined his holiday (And i had to pay for the clean and a replacement teddy) Other than that it was fine. Builders waking us up at 6am every morning, no facilities on site other than a very expensive shop (I understand there is a bar there now). Great room, great location and has the potential to be a great hotel(When it has finished being built) but customer relations need to be improved a little.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, great value minutes from Disney attractions”
Reviews.Author: Smertios
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Disney with a large group this place is great. We were 4 adults and 4 children, we had an apartment with 3 bedrooms and three full baths (including 2 big jakuzis). Big flat screen TV and modern appliances. Microwave, toaster, fridge, the works. Everything was new and clean. Space: Big appartment, everything new and tasteful. Cleanliness. Spotless when we arrived. If you want daily cleaning service you have to pay a little extra. We didn't select the option as it wasn't worthy for a short stay (one week). Location. Within minutes of all major Disney attractions. There is a convenience store on site and an Irish pub. There is a walmart down the road a mile or so to get goodies. We didn't use the pool, but looked kind of small for the size of the complex. They are building a big pool with a pirate sheep playground in the middle. I highly recommend the place. I stayed before in Port Orleans in Disney. This is a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: ahent
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and all the aminities were very nice. The rooms are large and spacious and very clean. My children loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place but don't use the shop!”
Reviews.Author: fuzzballpooh
Reviews.Content: First holiday to Florida and this was a fantastic place to stay. We had the two bed apartment in one of the original smaller buildings - didn't want a hotel as we wanted small person to have his own room so we didn't all have to go to sleep at the same time. Mega size bath ensuite in master bedroom was great to relax in after a day at the parks - and deep enough for son to swim in! Convenient for Disney - our tip for navigating back to the complex is to always follow the signs for Downtown Disney until you get to the road which takes you to I-4 and SR535. If you try to follow a map you'll probably get lost! Not too far to Universal parks either. Definitely do not use the convenience store on site - we referred to it as the inconvenience store. We arrived late in the day and needed a few supplies for breakfast - we got charged $15 for 2 bottles of water, a loaf of bread and a tub of butter/marg. And stamps for airmailling your postcards - there's almost a 50% markup! The walmart supercentre is so close - turn left out of the site, turn right at the next set of lights, head over to the left lane and turn left into a shopping area - Walmart is at the rear. and there's a Western Union just round the back for stamps - airmail is 90cents. We found the staff helpful - and Chris at the front desk was always chirpy and amusing! Nearly everything in our apartment was great - fantastic supply of towels and pretty much all you could want for a nice relaxing place to unwind. But don't expect to do much cooking - though there's a nice cooker and dishwasher, there's a lack of utensils / pots & pans / baking trays so you are kind of expected to eat out - or buy what you need at Walmarts! We had a good meal at the Irish pub downstairs - yes it'll be bit more expensive that going to McD's but we found it reasonably priced and equally as friendly as other places. So book your holidays there now and enjoy your stay - when we save up enough cash for another visit would definitely consider going back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Would loved to have stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: MarkSouthWalesU.K.
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Village resort for 22 nights (13th March to 4th April) and could have stayed another 3 weeks no problem, we loved it. It was certainly home from home with a washing machine, tumble dryer, dishwasher etc. We had a 3 bed/ 2 bathroom condo and as other reviews have said we were not short of space, it was by far the best property we have stayed in whilst on vacation in Florida. The only negative thing I can say about the place is the size of the swimming pool although a new one which is huge is in the process of being built and I`m told will be completed by summer 2008. It just is not big enough for the size of the resort despite the fact that so many guests visit the theme parks on a daily basis some people as we did liked to chill out by the pool. I can`t comment on the shuttle bus service as we never used it . I can`t comment on the food at Frankie O`Farrells Irish bar, it seemed the ideal choice for us on the night of our arrival for a nice quiet evening meal but were greeted by an Elvis lookalike (not sound alike) singing at the top of his voice so before we glanced at the menu we knew it was time to leave and never went there again !! The resort is a great location for all the theme parks and so easy to get to from the airport, Take the 417 south to exit 6 and turn left and the resort is about 300 yards on the left, will take you no more than 15 minutes and you will need some cash to go through 2 raod tolls 75cents each.

Reviews.Title: “You Must Go And Stay At This Place”
Reviews.Author: CptnJacksPrincess
Reviews.Content: Well where do i start!!! F A N T A S T I C the apartment was very modern and had everything from an iron to dishwasher tablets to a plunger!!! Beautifully clean on arrival! The staff were helpful and effecient! We were in a block right beside the new pool which is being built but were never disturbed by builders! Pool at the minute is quite small but as we went entirely for Universal, Seaworld and DISNEY we didnt use it! Shuttles unfortunately do not give you enough flexibility to stay late and watch shows and fireworks as the last pickup is 8.45 Epcot! so for Fantasmic, Spectromagic and Wishes Fireworks we paid for a taxi! That was our only disappointment! We found the Irish restuarant staff very rude, food was cold and waitress service very poor, although they were busy as it was St. Patricks Day and then Spring break i found this inexcuisable! Absolutely loved the little shop and pizza hut they made the best breakfast muffins, sandwiches and pizzas freshly made as you wait! Cooked to perfection a welcomed snack after a long day at disney, quick and easy also!!! I found LBV a really home from home and will definately be returning when it is complete. I sure it will be 5+ by then!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, and pleasant, but ominous problems in the details”
Reviews.Author: NYCPocket
Reviews.Content: For around $150 a night, we considered Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa to be a great value. It's brand new (in fact, most of it seems to be in the process of being built, though there was no construction during our visit), very clean, and in a GREAT location for a drive into Disney World. Overall, our family of two adults and two small children enjoyed the modern two-bedroom, two-bath suite during our four-night stay. Things like the marble countertops, terrace, and comfortable furnishings really added to the experience. HOWEVER, there were problems in the details that might suggest that there could be trouble looming for this brand new property. We had lights that didn't work and lamps with missing bulbs. One of the toilets didn't flush properly the whole time we were there and clogged completely the day we left. There wasn't nearly enough hot water for the spa tub (very frustrating!). The Internet, provided through a cable in the living room, was totally unreliable. It was slow or didn't work at all (and the problem was not our computer, as our next hotel showed). That right there could be a dealbreaker for us. The seal on the drain of the smaller bathtub was bent so the tub wouldn't hold water and therefore couldn't be used for my daughter's bath. She had to be bathed in the spa tub, instead. Also, no dish soap was provided. We have stayed at suites like this in the past and they always provide dish soap and often detergent for the dishwasher. I don't mind buying it, but I also don't like having dirty dishes sitting around the first night I arrive. To be fair, we didn't bother complaining about any of these things during our stay, so I can't say how the staff would have responded. I did find the staff to be extremely helpful the one time I did need them, but in general, you don't get the impression that it's a full-service, customer-care type of place, like you would in a regular hotel. Again, we had a pleasant stay. And for about the same amount of money we could have been crammed into a single tiny room at Disney's Pop Century about a mile or two away, so I'd probably stay here again. But if they're having these kind of problems now, what's this place going to be like in a couple of years?

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort Village Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: SplashNottm
Reviews.Content: Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa was absolutely fantastic, we holiday as a family or with groups of friends nearly every year and often stay in houses along the US27. I have to say we will never stay in a house again. These apartments are ideally located within 5 minutes drive of Disney and 7 minutes from Seaworld. You spend minimal time driving to get to attractions ( sitting in traffic on the 192 or I4 as you would with a house). We stayed in a 3 bed condo, which had excellent facilties, were spacious and well equipped. Plasma TV in the living room, jacuzzi in main SuperKingsize bedroom which was massive!! Another king size room and twin room located at the opposite end of the apartment, so great if you were a family as parents and kids room could be next door with friends feeling like they had their own space, Plus with tvs in each room they weren't woken by the kids early in the mornings!! Only disappointment would be the pool, which given the size of the complex was extremely small. Not a problem for us as we had annual waterpark passes, but I imagine would not be ideal if on a two week vacation and you wanted chill out lazy days by your pool, only must improve for me. Location right next to a shopping mall is great for those of you who like to shop!! Reebok, Gap, Tommy Hilfigger, Nike etc. Whilst there is an Irish pub serving food breakfast lunch and dinner, you have to drive to restaurants, although this might improve over time as more developments underway. Check in was seamless even though young was training and all staff were courteous and helpful. People didn't like keeping the apartment clean but if you're used to renting houses, not a problem. You receive complimentary dishwasher tablets and washing utensils so no biggy for us. Not like you've booked a Hotel guys so chill out!! We are already looking to go back and will definitely stay here again. DEFINITELY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Rest assured... nobody cares”
Reviews.Author: smallvilleCanada
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons we booked this hotel is because it had a wheelchair access. room that would hold all seven of our group. We also liked the fact it had a free shuttle to Disneyworld and Universal/Seaworld. We were told that there would be a wheelchair shuttle available for us everyday. The shuttle company that LBV uses never had a wheelchair van available for us. In fact they don't even own one! The staff at the hotel and the drivers of the shuttle did not care at all. We ended up folding my nieces wheelchair up every time and my brother-in-law lifted her up into a seat. She is 20 years old so you can imagine that this was not easy. If we had caught a wheelchair taxi it would have cost us at least $40 a day. We know this because we caught a taxi a few times because the shuttle times are also inconvenient.. They only go to Disneyworld at 8:20 or 11:20 and pick up is at 8:45 (before the fireworks!). The shuttles usually were not on time and they would have one van come to the hotel first to see how many people were waiting and then they would call for more. So much for getting to the parks early. The vans can only hold about 13 and there were times that they had 14 or 15 people inside. Even if they weren't over filled they never had enough seat belts because they were broken or not even available. This put a definite damper on our view of this hotel but the staff could have tried to fix this for us. Oh and don't let me forget about the fact there is no spa at the hotel either. It will not be opening until later this year. Also the one computer to use in the lobby for the internet was useless as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: Disney_Nana
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant experience. We defiitely would stay there again. Travelling with a young child it was very nice to have room for moving around. The facility was immaculate and very well equipped. It was more spacious than we expected and thus we were able to make the most of our stay at the resort. The pool was good as well. The 2 bedroom suite was larger than my first apartment!

Reviews.Title: “Nice units, but badly managed”
Reviews.Author: lol88
Reviews.Content: The buildings are in a setting similar to a street with multiple condo buildings. This is not my expectation of a resort setting. We stayed at a 2 bedroom unit in the newest building, the unit is really nice and large. The unit, towels and beds are clean. The bed is comfortable. This is one of the best unit I have seen. However, my stay was overshadowed by following. Many things not working properly: Coffee machine, two living room lights, telephone. When I first reported that phone was not working to front desk. The men told me they will send someone, but no one came. A few hours later, I went to the front desk again, and this time, a lady took the info and wrote up a work order. The maintenance person came a few hours later and confirm that phone is not working, he told me that phone lines were being moved and many units' phone are not working. I wonder why they did not tell me this earlier since it is a known problem with most of the units. We went without phone service for our entire stay. Fixing the phone did not seem to be a priority to the resort, leaving guests without a vital service did not seem to bother them. But this is a major inconvenience for our family. When we first attempted to call our children, we were not able to reach them. My wife was not able to call me to pick her up from the mall, etc. The living lights were not working because the electrical outlets does not work at all. The website advertised tennis courts, but there were no such facility. The website advertised 4 swimming pools, but there was only one pool, and it is a long walk from our building to the pool. We were hoping to 'enjoy' the resort, but we had to change our plan in view of the lack of facilities. Would I stay here again. I will consider staying here again, if : -I do not plan to use any resort facilities. -Only if I have real good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: LBlack14
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW! The convenience of the "Village" shopping mall, the proximety to Disney, Frankie Ferrell's prices and atmosphere and the cloeness to Golf Courses made my stay absolutely one of the best vacations I've had ever!!! The rooms were huge. Plenty for My wife, my daughter and myself. The pool was great for them and I can't wait 'til next year when the main pool and everything else is finished. We will definately be back! We're tryin to get some other friends and there families to join us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: DaSaint
Reviews.Content: The lake buena vista resort and spa is a cross between staying in a hotel and staying in a villa. Don't be fooled by the drab looking decor when you first arrive in the communal areas. I was initially very worried and hoIding my breath to see what I'd let myself in for, but the suite was fantastic, and you will not be disappointed. It has almost everything that you want and need in a very spacious apartment with all the domestic appliances and facilities you would get in a rented villa, plus some conveniences of a hotel like having someone you can call 24/7 and meals etc if you need it. I stayed here for over a week with my partner and 4 kids in a three bedroom suite and it was excellent. True you have to pay for extra cleaning but with the facilities and location, it is definitely better value than the hotels I've stayed in Orlando in the past, and the villa's i've rented. They have almost a 100 channels on the TV. There's a walmart and many shops and restaurants neraby. I'd advise that you keep your money and valuables well locked away or close to your person however. All in all, pretty excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Location”
Reviews.Author: Lope43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Thanksgiving Holiday for 4 nights. The rooms are decorated beautifully and have everything you could need. We had a 3 bedroom and had so much room! We had 3 adults and 2 teens & a grandmother with us so it worked out great. There were plenty of tv's for down time too. A cute little balcony was an added bonus although it looked over a vacant plot of dirt. There is a parking garage so we had the car cool in the shade. I dont know why it has spa in the name? It is more like an apartment building with no amenities except the pool and a small gym. There is a convienence store that we did grab items from a couple of times.
