Location is easy and away from the traffic. The price was excellent! We had family members in the room next to us and they loved it too... they were 6 adults and 2 kids in a 3 bedroom .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value - a great holiday”
Reviews.Author: Harbron
Reviews.Content: We stayed 15 Nights from 15/2/08 to 1/3/08 in a 2 bed appartment in building 2. The appartment was great. Clean, well furnished and maintained. Check in was smooth with no delays. There is building work going on but it was nearer the other building so there was no noise. Ideally positioned for Disney parks and not far to travel to Universal/seaworld. Don't use the onsite convience shop - very expensive. We found it to be about double the cost of the Walmart which is 2 minutes along the road. Maid service costs $30 but we had one mid holiday and found that to be enough. If you run out of soap, dishwasher powder etc you just have to ask. The rooms have a great Spa bath with only one disadvantage - the noise. Not only could you hear your own but some evenings you could hear others in room around you. We would definatly return to this accomodation. We travelled with Virgin holidays and you got all this space for little more than a standard motel style room. Fantastic. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Funtime009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent 4 days staying at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. Wed. February 7th thru Sat. March 1st. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The master bedroom was huge with a great spa tub. The second bedroom was just as spacious with an adjoining bathroom that was also good size. The 2 bedroom condo also included a washer and dryer. The pool and the gym were also above average. Service was excellent. Excellent location to Disney and all other Orlando attractions including restaurants and entertainment. The outlet mall within walking distance was also a plus. The Premium Outlet mall is also within a 10 mile radius. Shopping is a must. Highly recommended for families and will certainly be at the top of my list when we go back to Orlando. Price per night was reasonable considering what was provided. Pleasantly surprised!!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: DisneyfamVA
Reviews.Content: LAKE BUENA VISTA resort village & spa Orlando Florida. FEBUARY 2008 We were very suprised when we arrived to find out that there were no kids activites, playground, childs pool, etc... There is no DVD player, VCR's or any thing for kids to do in the room. The concierge service was a joke - we knew more about the area than they did - and we were even advised the wrong theme park closing time and fireworks show. ANd by the way-dont get excited about spa services as it is not even open for business! The rooms only get cleaned if you pay extra, no new towels, they do not come in and make the beds like other resorts do and the kitchen is not stocked well at all. There were no extra trash bags or sponges to wash dishes with, and our request for extras resulted in only two extra trash bags to be delivered for our 7 night stay. Also, the resort boasts "room service" from their pub located downstairs - but our request for a meal to be delivered was turned down due to the fact that there was "no one to run it up to us, but we could come pick it up" which does not work well when you have babies sleeping in their beds! We stay at least two times a year at orlando and we will never return to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at LBVR”
Reviews.Author: JSSZ
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at LBVR from 2/22 to 2/29, 2008. We booked a 2 bdr suite, but, got a 3bdr instead, no extra cost. The room was VERY clean, the staff friendly and helpful and MOST importantly, the hotel is located at short distance from all Disney parks (5-10 minute drive) and very close to the access to the I4, which basically makes your trip to anywhere in Orlando very easy and fast. Close proximity to WalMart, Target, Walgreen's so you can get all your basic supplies and make it your home away from home. If they are able to keep the same service and price, will definitely return with family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back again”
Reviews.Author: ARKonVacation
Reviews.Content: We, 2 parents & 2 almost adult children from Canada, stayed in Building 1 in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom with a full kitchen unit; we loved it! The 3 TVs, washer/dryer and balcony were added bonuses. We looked at a 3 bedroom/3 bathroom unit for possible future visits with extended family members. We often have an issue with hotel mattresses, but such was not the case here; we slept very comfortably. The hotel was close enough to the theme and water parks to make it easy to get to them but far enough to feel we were in a secluded, quiet area. The hotel is moments away from State Road 536, which goes right over I-4 and straight onto Disney areas. It was not far to get to Universal Studios either. The Walmart Superstore was so close that we went there a number of times to get some quick meals. We found some really amazing bargains at the Lake Buena Vista Factory Store Plaza which we walked to from the hotel; the plaza even has a small food court that serves really good pizza among other meals. There is a mini-mart and Irish restaurant in the hotel but we could not comment on them since we didn't go there. There is a concierge desk at the hotel who were very friendly. We always felt safe on the property no matter the hour and it was good to see security personnel walk around anyways. The use of a computer in the lobby for checking our emails was helpful. The Spa will be completed in the next little while and another pool will be added in the late spring. Though the hotel is a time-sharing establishment, there was no one trying to make a sale to us. Our only small dislike was that often when we called the Front Desk, we got no answer; that was directly related to them not having enough staff working. I would go down to the Front Desk when that happened and they were more than happy to help us with our requests. We will most definitely stay at Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa the next time we stay in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my (high!) expectations”
Reviews.Author: Sharon39
Reviews.Content: This holiday was 10 months in the planning so we really worked hard at finding the right resort for us. We couldn't have chosen better. Firstly the location is so central. We could get to Disney in ten mins max (if it takes you longer you are going the wrong way - we know we did it too!).10-15 mins SeaWorld/ Aquatica and 20 mins Universal/Wet and Wild. Check in was efficient and friendly, and the condo - wow. So much space, very clean and obviously new. Only slight problem was that the condo smelt strongly of smoke - and the whole resort is supposed to be non-smoking. I did report this to reception who said that they would get somekind of machine to "de-contaminate" the condo, which didnt arrive, but a can of air freshener later and I hardly noticed. The fittings are good quality, but be aware there are no curtains only blinds in the bedrooms, so if you need to sleep in the the dark take eyeshades! There were loads of towels and toilet rolls and soap for the dishwasher to get you started. It was Presidents week when we visited so the start of our holiday was quite busy. As the pool is very small it did get a little busy, but the new on eis due to open next month and should be great. We did visit Frankie Farrells on two occasions. Both times the food was OK and cetainly ideal if you can't be bothered to go further afield after a hard day at the parks. My only issue was the apparent lack of security. There is no main gate that you eneter to get into the resort and the buildings are not accessed using keys. Meaning that anyone can get up to the door of your condo without challenge. My husband was not at all bothered by this, but having seen other resorts with gated entrances and security staff I personally felt a little exposed. However, we have been burgled on a previous holiday (no here) and so security is something that I now consider important. The acid test is would I go back? Definately. This is going to be a huge resort when it is eventually finished (construction by the way seem to happen magically - we didnt hear it but we noticed changes every day), and I think the amenities will be excellent. These are lovely condos in a great location - book with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: beagleWales
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here from 31st January to the 14th February 2008. The apartment was furnished to a very high standard and the decor was amazing. Our bedroom had a king size bed with a jacuzi bath, walk in shower, separate toilet and two sinks. Our daughter had a twin room and a separate bathroom. Everything you would need for a self catering holiday is supplied including a balcony. To mention everything we had in the apartment would take too long. We were on the thirteenth floor in block 5 facing all the firework displays which takes place every night at different parks, great! You will need a car to get to international drive but there is a complimentary bus which will take you to Epcot and Sea world. Once you get to Epcot you can easily get to all Disneys parks from there. This location is more quiet than other areas which was just perfect. The staff were very helpful and most polite as was the staff and owners of the irish pub on site. Designer shops are on your door step, no need to drive and if your man gets fed up with shoping he can go for a pint while you 'shop until you drop'. We will use LBV Resort village and Spa the next time we go again as we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “great!!!”
Reviews.Author: OhioAmy
Reviews.Content: This was a great place at a great price for a family of 6 going to Disney. The accommodations were spacious and clean. We asked for more towels and coffee and they were sent up immediately. We would recommend this place to anyone and would definitely stay here again. Amy - Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Great room, well managed, still under construction”
Reviews.Author: ShadowCinnamon
Reviews.Content: Our family stays in a number of Orlando area hotels because we visit theme parks six to eight times a year. We typically stay in condo hotels - usually time shares or vacation clubs although we aren't members of any time share group. This hotel is still under construction but several buildings are open as is the restaurant. We were very pleased with our two night stay. Check-in was quick and the crib we requested was delivered quickly to the room. The condo itself was a 3 bedroom 2 bath unit and was very nice. Several features of the condo made it superior to a number of others we've stayed in. First, the dining table was larger and could seat more people that most. Second, instead of the usually 8 place settings this kitchen had 12-16 - better for large families. Also, the kitchen had more drinking glasses than we were used to. The master bedroom had an over-sized California king. The second bedroom is listed as a queen, but my husband and I both believe it to be a normal-sized king - it was the same size as our king bed at home. The third bedroom where our children slept was very roomy - lots of area for them to spread out their toys. Like many condo hotels, this one has a convenience store on the property. Unlike most others, this one was really a mini grocery store and had almost anything you'd need to prepare quick meals in your condo. We also liked the on-property restaurant - an Irish Pub. Most condo hotels don't have restaurants so this was a nice feature. The hotel was in a very convenient location for access to Disney property because it sits next to state road 536, which goes right over I-4 and straight onto Disney property (from I-4 this is the Epcot exit). Also, the hotel adjoins an outlet mall - the Lake Buena Vista Factory Stores. We often shop at this outlet mall on our trips because the parking is easier than other outlet malls and the layout reduces pedestrian congestion that you experience in the closed-in and semi-closed in malls. The outlet center has a nice children's playground, too. The spa and water park at this hotel aren't open yet, but we saw the plans and they look great. Overall, the hotel seems well-managed and the location can't be beat. The master suite in each condo is luxurious and romantic, too. We'll definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: palmplace
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful two week holiday at LBV resort village and Spa. We went with our two sons aged 22 and 19 and youngest son's girlfriend. We stayed in the three bedroom/two bathroom Condo. We were in building 5 on floor 15, (I did ask for a high floor!!! It was ideal as a base and we did most of the parks using the shuttle service. We are first timers to Disney (although my son has been before).and we found the shuttle a bit limited, but don't know whether this is the same for all hotels, there was only 1 shuttle in the morning, (two for Epcot) and the return journey didnt really fit in the closing time for the parks. We used taxis quite a bit but had some trouble as not one knew the hotel until we said it was next to the LBV outlet Mall. Having the mall next door was a bonus and we got some bargains using the discount vouchers given to us by the hotel . A 24hr Walmart is very near, we walked there, and got a taxii back. The Condo was exceptionally clean, I found it very useful being able to wash and dry clothes as we needed to. They provide plenty of towels, bath products and even some washing up liquid and there are towels at the pool. They will also give you extra if you need them for the water parks. The staff were very friendly and Jesse on reception was a real help. They are doing a lot of building work but this did not affect us at all and they are working very quickly (and only mon to fri) every day we could see a difference. The spa is due to open on 15th March and the new swimming pool is due for opening in April. They are also moving reception to a new building which will also house the Spa. The gym will move to a bigger room and a Pizza place is opening near the small pool. We had several meals at the Irish pub and found them to be reasonable. Would definately go back and would like to go back to see the finished product.

Reviews.Title: “B+”
Reviews.Author: sdillon
Reviews.Content: clean, spacious, great location, friendly staff. great irish restaurant. would deff stay here again. View not that great still under construction. can see fireworks but from a distance. no wifi in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: juliegt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks over extremely busy xmas and new year period 07/08. Had 3 bed apartment for myself and husband and 4 children from age 15 to age 2! Was superb, well equipped, clean, fantastic view from top floor balcony in block 2 (15th) of skyline plus disney fireworks. I cannot fault anything except not enough parking in busy periods, on new years eve we returned at 2.30am and not a space left! We had to park in shopping area and walk across! will def return here next time in Orlando. Location fab, Irish bar food great and good service.

Reviews.Title: “very well planned holidaydisney”
Reviews.Author: groovychick17
Reviews.Content: I liked the idea of the resort being next door to the shopping mall it made acess very easy for guess who have special needs and are to walk but not to far, so atleast you can acess the shops especially if no one in your party drives. the bedroom facilities first rate as i suffer from osetioarthritis i found i was able to use everything without any problems. walmart was close by so all your needs where food shopping is and any you required was in walking distant. disney was minutes away and so was all the other shopping malls and universal and other places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Break”
Reviews.Author: EMMLEE
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at the Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa. My family and I stayed in a two Bedroomed Suite it was very nice and my three year old had a fantastic time in the whirlpool bath with the coloured lights!!! My only real complaint was noise we were kept awake most nights by noise from other hotel rooms we could here evreything. The pool is very small for the number of rooms and I think that would be my concern if booking here again. Evreything is well maintained. Staff are very friendly. Great location. Great price. The Hotelopia website had the lowest prices by far. I have also stayed at the Residence Inn Seaworld and must admit I prefered the location and outside space.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: mmoore62
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late Jan.08, loved it. Had a very nice 2 bedroom suite. Very clean and quiet. Everything worked as expected and the staff was pleasant and helpful. Paid $100.00 a night with a "RoomSavers" coupon. Once you learn the layout, it's easy to get to Disney or rest of Orlando. We are very pleased with our stay and recommend this hotel. thanks, Mark Moore

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but perfect”
Reviews.Author: hope99r
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay! Close to everything! A home away from home!!! Excellent customer service!!! WILL BE RETURNING SOON!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic resort village”
Reviews.Author: tommyboy2008
Reviews.Content: the room and staff were absoutly terrific they had some construction going on for the new buildings but they didn't make enough noise to disturb our stay great close distance to all parks great shops and food near by the store down by the lobby was a little expensive but they have the things you need if you forgot anything there were plenty of towels in the room. beds were comfy and the whirlpool tub was fantastic for the body we only stayed for two nights but we will definitly refer this resort to others and we will be back in april.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above the rest!”
Reviews.Author: molekanami
Reviews.Content: Very spacious, very clean accommodation. Highly recommended and far better than most of the other hotels on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jsilva12
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom for $149 and it was a good value. It had a gaint flat screen and a nice little hot tub for two. The kids had a blast in it. The place is still under contruction and the expansion of the pool looks like it's going to be great. We'll probably look into this place again when it's completely done. It's just a 2 minute walk to the Buena Vista Outlet Mall next door and just a 5-10 drive to downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous accomodations”
Reviews.Author: AMP120
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect for families. The property is new, comfortable and very clean. We had a 3 bedroom suite which was perfect for us. The children had space to unwind. We had the comforts of home near Mickey and friends. The property is less than 5 miles from Disney and has a great outlet mall right next door. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: bbg8r
Reviews.Content: If I could mark in between above average and average, I would. My family and I stayed at this hotel Jan. 18 - 20, 2008. We booked two condos and although they said we would not be charged until our stay, we were charged right away for half of the stay. My husband happened to call two days before our stay and the resort no longer had the reservation for one of our condos and stated that we had booked this room for Jan 1-2. The employee on the phone was somewhat rude and reluctant to help us. However, we still had our confirmation email with the dates we had booked and the resort was eventually helpful. We had to bring our credit card statement to prove that the room was already booked and paid for. Regardless, when we arrived at the resort, they had our rooms. Half of our group arrived a day after the rest of us. We had requested the rooms be on the same floor but when they arrived they were told there were no more rooms on our floor and had the staff known earlier they could have accomodated us. ??? The rooms/condos in the resort are lovely and GREAT for families. The bedrooms are spacious and the full kitchen is wonderful. You save so much $$$ being able to eat a meal or two in your own condo. The condos were clean and the decor was nice. The resort is under construction so the big pool is not available but there is a small pool that looked nice (too cold for a swim when we were there). You can't beat the price, $150/night for a 2 bedroom condo. The Irish pub at the resort stated it had breakfast starting at 7am, however, when we arrived at 8:30 there was no one in the place and the waitress had to be fetched from upstairs. The staff trickled in as we were eating and began sweeping and mopping the floors. The food was ok, however, it took at least 45 minutes for us to get it. This interfered with us trying to get to a park early. Overall, we liked the resort a lot and would go back. It was a great value and the rooms were nice. There are just a few things that need to be worked out.

Reviews.Title: “This is the one”
Reviews.Author: Tgirl32
Reviews.Content: I will definately stay at this hotel again!!! The rooms were beautiful... The hotel staff was so nice and helpful. They went out of their way to make sure our experience was very pleasant. We plan on taking another vacation to Florida this summer and we will definately be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: mojosnake
Reviews.Content: We(wife,daughter-7 and myself) stayed here Jan 13th and 14th,2008. This place is nice and new.The rooms were large and roomy-2 bedrooms. Walls are well constructed to keep the noise down.Noise was not a problem here.TVs throughout the rooms and a large projection tv in the living room area..A spacious balcony for sitting outside . Full kitchen area with a walmart right down the road to stock the pantry..There's also an Irish pub next door that has pretty good food and Harps. Parks are close by. There's a whirlpool in the master bedroom that is spacious and a joy after a day at the parks. The fitness center has all new equipment that work great.The pool is bigger then I thought it would be. A pizza hut express will soon be open next to the pool. The spa is getting ready to open soon.This place is new and in a nice quiet location. Be warned it is not easy to find especially if your using a navigational device, my garmin nuvi350 did not give us the right location.It's next to and behind an outlet mall(wife loves) but back off the main road 535. I got a great price through expedia and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa is a great hotel in Walt Disney World”
Reviews.Author: izzysmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for New Year's weekend. The hotel is magnificient and we have never experienced a great stay in years. We visit Walt Disney at least 3 times a year. The rooms are very clean , roomy and very quiet. I have a 7 year old son and he really enjoyed the pool. It was very clean. The Irish Pub Restaurant has great food and the service was excellent. I recommend this hotel to everyone. We will always stay there while visiting Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: RonPeoria_Illinois
Reviews.Content: We had an extra day to spend and found the Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa by driving around the area. We stayed in a 2 bed, 2 bath room for one evening. The price was incredible at $150 with AAA. The rooms were very clean, very spacious, and the decor was very upscale. The large walk-in shower and additional bathtub in the master was a pleasant surprise. The square footage was well beyond what I was expecting, and was a tremendous value for that area. This is spite of the fact we were walk-ins without reservations. The front desk was extremely pleasant. A late-night mini store on sight was very convenient, as well as the restaurant. We ate at about 11:00pm at night and were accomodated nicely despite it being closing time for the kitchen. Overall, I would stay at these accomodations over any other except Disney Resorts (would only stay at Disney due to my children). Take advantage of this value! (First time review writer, as typically I would not spend the time writing reviews).

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: hartherd
Reviews.Content: The resort is comprised of two large buildings with ongoing construction for a third building. Rooms were nicely appointed, clean and spacious. Kitchen was well equipped and clean. Suite also included a washer and dryer. Even though construction was occurring, we never heard a thing! Our building had a garage, which was nice because we had inclement weather during our stay. There's also a very nice convenience shop with a very pleasant and helpful clerk. It is only a few miles from the main entrance to WDW and is surrounded by shopping and restaurants. Would have no hesitation staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: DANIEL_BRASIL
Reviews.Content: FIrst I was worried about the price. 02 bedroom suite ofr US$ 109,00 per day ?? Then we were surprised about condo. Everything was new. Even the appliances still had their owner manual. The location is fantastic: right a discount mall, a few meters from WalMart. Close to everything. Nothing went wrong ! I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class resort”
Reviews.Author: neilgsxr69
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 15th trip to orlando from England we have stayed in all types of accommodation in orlando and found this one to be one of the best. We stayed in a 2 bed appartment on the 13th floor of building 3 the open plan living room and kitchen are well furnished with a large plasma tv in lounge tvs in each bedroom. We had seen the photos on the net but they don't do the place justice! jaccuzzi style bath in master bedroom is fab! you get a large walk in shower as well.Balcony was larger than most with a table and chairs,depending on which building you get there is a chance to see the disney fireworks from your balcony we could just see them but you will get a better view from building 5 with a northern outlook.All the staff we met were very friendly and helpful and would do what they could to help. This is a growing vacation village and more buidings are planned so some building work may be in progress.There is a large theamed pool under construction which is need as the only pool at the moment is too small for the ammount of guests, it is very clean though and we never failed to get a sun bed. There is a well stocked shop on site and a good Irish theamed restaunt and bar. The location is second to non and you can get to most Orlando attractions in a matter of minuites (use I4 to bypass local traffic) We have had a great christmas at the lbv resort & spa and will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: calle248
Reviews.Content: This facility is spacious,clean and quiet. The staff is very friendly and there are no long check in/out lines. The pool was uncrowded and warm. Very close to all the attractions. Having the restaurant and variety store in the complex is very convenient. This is our second stay first with 4 people and most recently with 7. We'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Condo living with hotel convenience!”
Reviews.Author: kelb
Reviews.Content: We are at the resort right now, finishing up a five night stay. We could not believe that we found a brand new 3 bedroom 2 bath condo right in the middle of everything in Orlando for about $160 a night on Expedia. We are five adults, and felt totally comfortable in our unit. They also offer two and four bedroom choices. We enjoyed the full condo experience, but if we had a question - or wanted a shuttle to Disney or Universal - we just had to dial up the front desk. Our unit was pristine clean and everything worked. Be sure to ask for a network cord at check-in for a free high speed Internet connection. There are not a lot of extra implements in the kitchen - just the basics in terms of plates, glasses, and some pots and pans. No broiling pan, no baking sheets. If you need anything at all, including groceries, there is a WalMart a half mile away and a terrific Super Target a half mile beyond that. The cable TV went out for about 12 hours during our stay, but that is not the fault of the resort. When we called they politely told us that they had already reported the problem and were hoping for a quick fix. There is still construction going on at this resort, but we saw or heard nothing during our stay. We were on the 7th floor of Building 2, and our view was of miles of Florida forest. The convenience store, Irish bar/restaurant, and 50 outlet stores are steps away. The entire resort has a very rich feel...super quiet, little evidence of other guests! The pool and workout center are very nice, and well maintained. The choice of this resort made our vacation very low stress and enjoyable. We simply did not have any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Disney and universal trip”
Reviews.Author: Universaldisney
Reviews.Content: We recently visited both Universal and all of the Disney parks and stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa. It is perfectly located between both parks so getting to any of the parks is a short car ride. It was also nice that we stayed in one of the 3 bedrooms suites with two families so both families were able to have one side of the suite and then there is a great space in between the bedrooms for watching TV, preparing meals and all eating together. Another nice part of the rooms is the complex is very quiet and secluded with much less commotion that you would find at a regular hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Just like Home”
Reviews.Author: bly4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our annual trip to Disney. For the past 10 years we have spent a long weekend in Orlando and enjoyed the decorations at the parks during the holiday. I neeeded a room for 5. I found a great deal at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. For $149 I had a three bedroom split plan with a full kitchen and living room. My daughter and friend shared a room with 2 twin beds .My son stayed in the 2nd room with a queen bed, both rooms had a flat panel TV. They shared a nice sized bathroom. The master suite was roomy with a king bed and nice size TV. Their was a large bath and seperate shower. The unit was like new and the beds were very comfortable. Even though we didn't use the pool we could see it from our window. It was nice size and had adequate number of chairs. The location was centrally located(close to Disney) to restaurants and shopping. This will be our home away from home when visiting the orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Prices!!!”
Reviews.Author: bcd44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. The rooms are brand new and Huge. You could see the Disney fireworks from our corner condo. We had 3 Bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. I did not want to leave. They just opened up a new Irish Pub on the 1st floor which has a great atmosphere. We stayed for 7 nights and got a great deal for $135 including tax at [--]. We already booked our next stay for the summer of 2008. Their new pool and spa should be open by then.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: suzycuzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Disney World to celebrate my 50th birthday. This was my 13th trip to Orlando and most of the time we stay at the Downtown Disney hotels. When we discovered we could stay in a condo for less than we would pay elsewhere we decided a change was in order. We had read many reviews and some people had issues with the ongoing construction of other buildings in the complex.We had no problem and we did not leave the room until at least 11:00 AM The condo was spacious and the full kitchen and washer/dryer were oh so convenient. We had a wonderful plasma TV in the living room and all the perks of home but in Florida instead.. We are already planning on staying here the next time we are in the Orlando vicinity!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with this Resort and Location”
Reviews.Author: jsonghas
Reviews.Content: With the use of the Internet, it is much easier to see what you accomodations will be when you arrive at your destination. However, there is always that fear that "something" will be crazy. This is not the case with Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. I have just spent Monday through Friday in the 3 bedroom at the resort during Thanksgiving and was totally pleased with everything. The location convenience of the surronding area was excellent. The outlet in walking distance and restaurants and most importantly a WALMART just minutes away made it even better. The facilities are still under construction and I am sure it will be even better upon completion. I would recommend this place 100%. During this visit, I actually purchased a time-share at another location (to get Disney tickets), so I will probably not stay there again, but I will definitely recommend it to others. Also please check the Travelers Candid Photos as I included some better angles to give a better description of the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MegsmumOxford
Reviews.Content: We loved the layout of the apartment (except for the open plan shower arrangement in the bedroom) but were suprised to find no screening on the balcony., we were on the 10th floor so I wouldn't let the children out there! The lack of housekeeeping showed and we couldn't work out how to get rid of the rubbish as the trash chute didn't open, eventually we found you just had to leave it outside in the corridor. On coming back very late from the parks on a Saturday night we found the parking horrendous as there were no spaces anywhere near our block so we were driving around the back of the other block and walking around in the dark-not terribly pleasent. The pool was far too small and felt like it was in the carpark but I believe a new one will be built sometime. We will not return here as it provided no opportunity to relax outside after the days at the park. However if you just want a base close to Disney you can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “4th time”
Reviews.Author: mikecru2000
Reviews.Content: this was the fourth time i have stayed there. it's always been excellent. super clean, super friendly staff. and you're so close to all the parks. you can't go wrong staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFam-o'-5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 young children during our Walt Disney World vacation. We had read both good and bad reviews of the property but decided that for us the price, location and size of the units fit our family the best. While there we some problems with our stay here, they were all minor and were fixed promptly. We had issues with our safe and with a very small yellow jacket nest on our balcony...when I called the front desk we had a maintenance person in our room within 20 minutes. We did have 2/4 elevators out of service for a couple of days on the weekend which caused some longer waits. (Nothing that affected the "quality" of our vacation though). There are also not enough parking spaces for the units. Once the units were busy on the weekend we had to park on the side of the road as all parkade and lot spaces were occupied. I will comment on the housekeeping.....we did not use the resort's housekeeping. Did not feel it was needed with in room washer/dryer to freshen up towels. I was however disappointed with the level of cleanliness upon our arrival. Since I had an infant who was crawling I was disgusted to find food from the previous guests not vacuumed up well and "discovered" by my 3 year old while he was playing. After that I always ensured there was a blanket underneath my children while playing on the floor. The positivies of the property are the size of the units and the proximity to disney and shopping. The pool area was very nice. Always clean and well stocked with towels. I agree that the pool area was small, but for our family that was an advantage! I would recommend the property despite the few minor problems. Once all the construction is complete it will be even better as a huge new pool area is planned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Time”
Reviews.Author: resil1ent
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Resort (although the spa) is under construction. We had no problems at all and no complaints. Loved the location, the rooms were clean and neat. We had a Sorority gathering and we were accomodated rather well. I'm looking forward to bringing my Mentor Program girls here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Don't Expect anything else”
Reviews.Author: LLC
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the location. It's only about a 15 minutes drive to get to any park entrance either Sea World or Walt Disney World. As stated, it is only about 3 miles from either location... LOTS of traffic and LOTS of traffic lights, so keep that in mind. What they don't tell you is that this hotel is far from being completed, so you are awake by 7am to the sounds of construction. Bring earplugs. I feel sorry for the guests that are on the other side of the roadway. We are the furthest away. Considering that this is brand new, I was shocked to find the furniture worn, dressers damaged, and AC not working. It was to have internet, but I had to call to the front desk to get information only to find out that I had to go to the front desk to get a cable. At least it was free internet, unlike Disney at $10/day. Our AC didn't work, it took 4 attempts to reach someone at the front desk before they answered. I told them about the problem and assured me that it would be fixed that night... That was about 4pm in the afternoon... It is now 8am the next morning they still haven't shown and it's still rather humid in here, even after the night. I am feeling a bit frustrated at the moment. We typically rent a home for our family, but this time it was just my husband and I, so we wanted something "special" and this isn't it. The large screen TV is nice, but our DVD player won't connect (there isn't one provided, so we brought our own). Bring ear plugs, bring a fan, then you can enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Business before vacation”
Reviews.Author: UkJ_h
Reviews.Content: This hotel (not a spa) will be fantastic when finished, but that seems a long way off. The facilities were not as advertised in our travel brochure and left our party of 10 quite disappointed. No spa for the mums, no games room for the teenagers and the pool and it's surrounding area is quite small for the size of the resort. The reception staff are very business like and in short supply. However, the rooms were perfect. Plenty of room and, even though the even numbered rooms face the building work, we had a great view of the fireworks every evening. The odd numbered rooms get the sunshine on their balconies all afternoon. In a great location for the Lake Buena Vista outlet, you just walk across the car park, and the Walmart is only over the 535. Once completed I think this would be the perfect place to stay, but that appears to be some time off yet.

Reviews.Title: “A great new place!”
Reviews.Author: BradleyWooten
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando VERY often, and finally decided to give this new place a try after driving by it several times. They are still under construction, but don't let that stop you! The rooms are absolutely BEAUTIFUL, and they have everything you could possibly need. Full kitchen, jacuzzi, private balcony, its amazing, and a STEAL for the price. THey don't give you daily housekeeping, but it's such a home-like feeling, you really don't need it. I called and asked for them to take the trash out, and they were happy to do it. Nidia from housekeeping and Paul from the front desk were super friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really awful housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2/2 condo -- it was decorated beautifully and had great amenities. However, I do not recommend their housekeeping service. They did an awful job! Didn't replace the toiletries they removed from the shower that weren't all used up (so we were left with nothing), didn't clean the kitchen well at all, and actually took the pillowcase off of one of our personal pillows for some reason and did not return it. Great location though and overall a great place to stay. Still under construction, and they don't budge on late checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: wgjonz
Reviews.Content: I should probably start off by saying that I'm sorta picky....The condo units were very spacious. My family rented a 2 bed/2 bath condo. The rates at this hotel were more reasonable than the Hilton Resort where our family normally stays, but the reasons for the affordability became evident (keep reading). My primary reason for choosing this resort/condo was that is was new , the price was reasonable, and it's convenient to the Disney theme parks. I've passed by the hotel/condo on a previous visit to Orlando. The outlet mall next door to the resort was also a plus, however it is small compared to most outlets. What didn't I like about the hotel? First the walls were thin and there were no darkening window treaments in the bedroom, so if you are a light sleeper this could be a problem. Secondly, you must pay extra for cleaning, which means the sheers are not changed, no new towels, no trash pickp-up unless you pay an additional fee .... not a major problem for a short visit. I ended up washing my own towels since there is a washer/dryer in the unit. Continuing with the negatives, the air conditioner unit was LOUD and the shower and tub leaked in both bathrooms (also some evidence of mildew), another traveler mentioned the mildew and leaks also. The units should be clearner since this is a new hotel. The impact of non-inclusive dailiy room cleaning is already starting to show. Oh I almost forget, the fridge was not positioned well, everytime we opend the door it slammed against the wall making a loud bang! If you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your hotel room, then the negatives may not be a big problem for you. If you are on a budget and need the space this is hotel maybe a good value. However if you are planning an extended trip, or will be spending time relaxing by the pool ( it was small compared to most), or if you are a clean freak you may want to consider spending a little more money and staying somewhere else. P.S. If you bring a laptop be sure to ask for a cable at the front desk. They do not keep them in the room and you have to sign a paper stating you will pay $25 if not returned at checkout. No wireless.

Reviews.Title: “LBV made our holiday !!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LARAMiddlesbrough
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things. We had a 3 bed 2 bath condo. a FANTASTIC jacuzzi roman tub in our en suite which was lovely to relax in after a long day at the parks. Beds were very comfortable and everything was new and very clean. Tv's in all 3 bedrooms and huge tv in lounge. Had read on someones review that there wasn't a kettle so contemplated taking one, glad I didn't as there was a hob kettle. Also iron and ironing board, hairdryers, cups, glasses cutlery, plenty of towels and pillows and coat hangers, in fact everything that you could possibly need. We only actually used the kitchen once to cook in but the washing machine and tumble dryer were in constant use so all our clothes were clean to come back. Massive fridge/freezer was handy and we froze drinks to take to the parks. Also the air conditioning was a godsend but there were also ceiling fans in all of the rooms. There was a reasonably sized balcony and we were on the fourth floor overlooking the pool. There were always spare sun loungers and plenty of towels by the pool. We visited the Irish bar a few times and had a couple of meals there which were very nice and it was only a 10 min drive to Disney and about 20 mins to Universal. Stayed in a hotel on I drive last time we visited but definitely would not consider it again after staying here, loved this condo in fact I could have stayed and lived in there. The complex isn't finished yet though there is work going on all the time, it doesn't bother you, you don't hear any noise. Will definitely be returning

Reviews.Title: “Just like home!!”
Reviews.Author: medaddio17
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay as a last minute "get away" and could not believe how much we got for so small a price. The resort is very new ,and the room featured 2 bedrooms, 2 full baths, a kitchen, table, and small living room w/plasma screen TV and also contained a washer and dryer, and a small balcony. This place is perfect for families on a budget. Bring your own drinks, snacks, cereal, coffee, paper towels, and anything you want to prepare for meals, as all the cookware, plates, silverware are there. There is an Irish Pub on site with good food at reasonable prices. Also, right next door is an outlet mall. You are only 10 - 15 minutes away from the parks, but a shuttle is available too. We were very happy with this resort and will definintely book in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality room at the Lake Buena Vista Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: podsquad07
Reviews.Content: I have just had one weeks stay in the Lake Buena Vista Resort & Spa with my 18 year old son, we stayed in a huge 2 bedroomed apartment which we though was "The Business", we have stayed in many other resorts over the past years in Orlando many of good quality John Wynds. and Mystic dunes to name but two and the apartment at LBV was superior in many ways. The well equiped kitchen was to be expected the lavish on suite in main bedroom also expected but combined with comfortable good quality seating and bedding and great LCD large screen TV and gym was an added bonus. The staff were helpful and even let us stay as long as we wanted for a very notional charge on our last day. The resort is convienent for Universal and Islands of Adventure also for great shopping and eating. I personally would not entertain going to the states and not hiring a car so I cannot comment on the free buses to the theme parks. The resort is not yet finished but every effort was made to make peoples stay comfortable- As much washing powder needed and extra towels were available on a single phone call. I will definately be back when the new pool is finished and the spa is operational. The Resort was a bit hard to find But I checked with Trip advisor before leaving England and printed off some helpful notes from a previous review. Basic instructions are come off I-4 at junction 68 SR-535 turn right and resort entrance is about 5 sets of lights on your right just look for a flashing coloured sign on right advertising NIKE, Reebok and the other factory outlets, if you go past it just pull at the LBV FACTORY outlets which is the next right turn and work your way through. Great apartment, would recommend it as ideal base.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It amazing”
Reviews.Author: Cazkatjoe
Reviews.Content: We returned from a two week stay at this amazing new hotel in July 07. I have been to Disney Orlando 5 times now and have stayed in Hotels, Disney Hotels and private villas. I have to say this is the best place we have stayed. We were transfered here as our initial hotel had seperated me from my children who they placed 8 rooms away. Not very safe, so our package rep, moved us here. It looks just like a hotel from the outside and the corridoors, however once you open your door you are in a villa with all the luxury's, we had 3 bedrooms 2 bathrooms, a kitchen, living room and a balcany overlooking the pool. The pool was very small, but we loved it, just right for us. It was clean and the staff were friendly and very helpful. One evening my son aged 12 and his friend aged 15 who i had taken with us decided to go to someonelses apartment without telling us and as it was 1.30 in the morning when we realised they were not in their beds we paniked. The staff were amaszing and immediately sent out all security staff and any other staff they had available out looking for them. We were just about to call the police when they appeared it was now 2am in the morning. The staff were amazing. Just a lovely mix of hotel and villa perfect. There is a small shop but found it a little expensive, however come out the front of the road turn left and about 100yrds down the road is a Walmart, we could walk it in 5 mins if it was not for the busy road. The Lake buena vista outlets were just a 1min walk out the hotel and Disney resort was just a 10min drive. A perfect location and a perfect hotel, there is building work going on but w never heard a thing. Will defently be staying here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home for Scottish Family”
Reviews.Author: mcdougalls
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! This place is just like a big four star hotel, but instead of rooms it's full of luxury flats. My family from Scotland - 2 adults, my daughter (10) and son (4) - stayed here for 14 nights during July 2007 and it was superb. We stayed in the 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment which was huge, beautifully cleaned and very well equipped. The master bedroom has a bed which must be at least 6 feet wide, a jacuzzi, walk in shower, his & hers marble sinks, BIG mirros with hollywood lights all round, a toilet room, walk in wardrobe complete with electronic safe (free) and 25" TV. Bedroom area is carpeted, en-suite area is just as big and has marble floor. Bedroom 2 has a king size bed, walk in wardrobe, chest of drawers, chair, table & 21" TV. Bedroom 3 had 2 single beds, table, walk in wardrobe (single), chest of drawers, and 21" TV. Bathroom 2 has normal shaped bath with power shower, linen cupboard, marble sink, big mirror, shave point, toilet, marble floor. Dining area is spacious with a beautiful glass topped table & six chairs. Lounge area has a 3 seater settee + 2 arm chairs and 50 inch rear-projection TV, glass topped coffee table, lamp table + lamp, standard lamp and french doors opening on to the balcony (we were on the 5th floor). Kitchen has everything: double sink with garbage disposal & squirty hose thing. Huge American fridge / freezer with ice maker. Electric hob, electric over, microwave, dishwasher - all appliance are integrated into the fully fitten kitchen. Balcony has white table and 4 chairs and offers good views if high enough. A washing machine and seperate tumbler drier are tucked away in a closet. The apartments are 15 minutes from Disney by car and 20 minutes to the center of International Drive (beside Ripleys, etc). We'll definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “hotel fab”
Reviews.Author: vickyBelfast
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be one of the best hotels me and my family have ever stayed in, it was clean and all the mod coms for living in and the pool was great for the kids. The only problem we had about this resort was the irish pub ( not irish owned either) on site, they are far from helpful and are not the most friendliest of people plus the food constantly arrived cold, the beer was expensive and we constantly got overchrged on our bills. But on the whole this resort is fab, and has all you need almost on your doorstep. Altimas family 18 th july -9th aug Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Lake Buena Vista Resort Village is Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: fe79
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 people, stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa for two night in the weekend. We had a room with 3-bedrooms/2-bathrooms. The room was like new, very clean, has enough space for 6 people, a big balcony, nice view, equipped kitchen. Right next to the reception building, there is a convenience store opens till 11pm, and a bar open till 2am. We like this resort very much!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Freaks ”
Reviews.Author: lovelygran
Reviews.Content: My family consisting of husband, daughter, son-in-law, and two grandchildren travelled to this hotel from our home here in Scotland in June 2007 for our first ever visit to the states. We found the hotel and our suites to be very good in most aspects, despite the work on the other blocks being very obvious. Our only main problem was one of theft from our suite of many of our personal toiletries. We ignored it when two wash cloths went missing, followed by a sponge and bottles of shampoo and conditioner. When our expensive electric toothbrush went, closely followed by my husbands silver razor then we tried to take action with housekeeping. They were less than helpful despite being oh' so nice to our faces. To cut a long story short my husband had a very stressful time trying to get monetry compensation from the hotel for our missing goods. We only got closure about one hour before we left the hotel on our last day. We were told that new staff had been servicing our rooms, and they shouldn't have been let loose on occupied rooms. They hadn't been fired, they had been asked 'not to return'. If this isn't being fired I don't know what is. We found the staff at the front desk very unhelpful in this area, and spoken english was a real problem for most of them. Would we stay here again, I doubt it somehow. It's a real shame because until our things started going missing we were all planning to go back at Easter 2009. We will be back in Orlando but sadly not at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl888
Reviews.Content: We went to the hotel w/ 2 other families (3 kids, 6 adults) in a 4 bedroom, 4 bathroom. It was very spacious. The kids loved the jacuzzi. It was very close to all the attractions. It was very affordable probably because all of the construction nearby. The pool was very small though. The customer service was not so great. They double charged us. That was the only problem, but we got it fix. The first lady we talked to we could barely understand. It was a great hotel. I would defitnetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: LoveRVacation
Reviews.Content: My family of four and I just returned from the Lake Buena Vista Resort and Spa after a six night stay and we absolutely LOVED it! I don't think that it can be beat for the price. We booked it on Hotwire.com as we wanted to stay in a condo unit with our three kids (ages 8 years, 2 years, and 7 months). Having the kitchen was fantastic as it allowed me to cook meals on some evenings and prepare my baby formula. The kids enjoyed eating breakfast on the balcony every morning. Even though construction was ongoing on the weekdays, it was not noisy or bothersome and ended usually by 5 pm. My husband and kids took advantage of the pool and hot tub every day, and after the long hot Orlando days we took advantage of the Whirlpool tub in the master bathroom every evening. The 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit that we stayed in was spacious and the kids loved having their own room and bath to share, just like at home. There are televisions in both bedrooms and a big screen television in the living room. A sleeper sofa is included in the living room and a King Size bed is included in the master bedroom. The secondary bedroom fits 2 twin sized beds comfortably. And the distance to Disney World is just minutes away by car. Though our next visit to the House of Mouse will include a stay in the Disney Resort, we thoroughly enjoyed this resort. If you don't mind doing your own housekeeping (dishes, laundry, etc) then I would advise against paying the $30-$50 charge for housekeeping. A washer/dryer is included and is great for washing your swimwear and other clothing. I also recommend attending the time share presentation (though it is not required and we were never pressured to do so.) We ended up getting free tickets to Arabian Nights, which is an excellent family dinner show, and saved nearly $200 in the process.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our Greatest Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: signingagent4u
Reviews.Content: Talk about the "hook up"! The resort's 3 bedroom/3 bath condo was larger than most apartments, with every amenity imaginable: stocked kitchen, big screen t.v., 2 large jacuzzi tubs, huge walk-in showers, patio, washer/dryer so no need to take dirty clothes home. We could have easily brought four more people with us and still had privacy. There is even an outlet mall next door with great bargains! The Irish Pub downstairs was just opening when we left so unfortunately we didn't get to try it out. Close proximity to Disneyworld and lots of restaurants. You will have an amazing time! The Bell Family San Antonio, TX

Reviews.Title: “Nice four bedroom for the price”
Reviews.Author: yum64
Reviews.Content: we had 2 master suites with jacuzzi tubs in each and 2 more bathrooms for the other 2 bedrooms. what a conveniance. the rooms are pretty new and clean. if you stay 2 or more days,you have to pay for housecleaning. but there is a washer & dryer if you need clean towels (bring detergent). every bedroom has a tv plus a big screen in living room. but no dvd player(only thing i didn,t like about room). they,re still building but construction did not bother us. an outlet mall is right behind the building in walking distance. book early to get a good rate. our room doubled in price close to arrival. walmart super center right down road if you forgot anything. i will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the customer Service?”
Reviews.Author: burkesintexas
Reviews.Content: We were a 2 familly party a total of 8 of us stayed in the 3 bedroom/3 bathroom condo. Four adults and four children. I was very impressed with the size of the condo and the amenities in each of the rooms. 2 Master Suites (king beds) and a bedroom with 2 twin beds. For a new motel it is not very clean. There is mold in all of the bathrooms and showers (which are full size) and there was leakage in the bathrooms and the wall paper on the walls was coming off. The customer service was very poor. NOT very friendly at all and anytime you contacted them for things such as towels, etc there was a problem or the staff did not bring you what you asked for. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this condo, would have been better if the staff had had some customer service training. There is a charge for your cleaning daily or you have to clean yourself. Bring mold remover and bleach... Nice size for large families and multiple families. Still building. Great location. Would consider staying again if the situations above have changed. Price was very affordable... Pool is small..

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Nightworker50
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Disney and need a great place to stay then this is it. We rented a 2 bedroom condo and it was huge! Master bedroom had a huge oversized king bed with a juccuzi bath tub and even bigger shower. Double sink with marble countertops and tile floor. The Master bedroom also had a new flat screen tv/alarm clock/ceiling fan/ and programable safe inside the huge closet area. The living area had a couch which opened to a queen bed size a large table and a new LG plasma tv (42"). There were plenty of chairs in the dinning room(6) and large table to eat on. Kitchen had new appliences ( stove/frig/micro/dishwasher/garbage disposal/coffee maker/4 slice toaster and all utensals to cook with. Kitchen was fully stocked with everthing you needed. Second bedroom had 2 double beds and closet as well as a new flat screen tv. The second bathroom had double sink as well and shower/toilet. Every room has a balcony with table and chairs and the A/C worked great. Lets not forget the washer and dryer in the room! That was a life saver! We had 5 people in the room and could have fit more! Did many loads of laundry. Chris at the front desk was very nice and fast to get us into are room ( three hours early!) The room was spotless on are arrival with plenty of towels. The room was almost brand new, and they are building plenty more. The construction did not bother us at all, very rarely did we hear them. There is a general store type place near the main office which has everything(pricey though). and an outlet mall behind the condo's. The one pool that is built now is very small and not nearly as big as it should be, that could very well be my only complaint of the place!!. Rates are reasonable, and for what you get, they are a bargain!!!. Located approx. 15 minutes from the orlando airport, two tolls of $1:00 each on the way. The entrance to Disney theme parks is only minutes away ( 3 or 4 miles at most) and there is a wall mart within a quarter mile. We stocked up on things we needed for breakfast/snacks and soda's and saved a bundle of money! Directions from airport to condo- take 417 south to exit 6 ( I believe) 535 intersection at red light take a left (route 535) and the condo's are on the left approx. quarter mile( just before the outlet stores) circle around the fountain and the office is on your right. Directions to Disney- right out of condo lot to red light , take left at that light and straight into Disney entrance . Universal studios is approx. 15/20 minutes away and easy to get to.(Right out of the condo's onto 535 and approx 5 minutes to route 4 east exit and 10 minutes on route 4 till the universal exit! also route 192 is just up the road past walmart, with numerous places of interest and places to eat. We caught a dinner show(midevil times) which was a good time. You can opt for maid service for everyday or get a quick clean(towels/garbage etc) with a min. of two days, but we did everything ourselves.( took out garbage/washed towels etc. Overall I have to say I will be telling all my friends to stay here and would have to give it 5 out of a 5. every thing was awesome and I was very impressed, and I am very picky when I am on vacation with my family. Everything we needed was close by and most of all it was very clean and spacious for the price. You really cant go wrong! Any questions you have, shoot me an email, I will try to answer it the best I can. The location and overall stay here made my family Disney vacation a great success and I would not hesitate to stay again! and I most surely will!

Reviews.Title: “Luv-Luv-Luv!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TeeMIA
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I accidentally came across this hotel looking for another....I booked a 3BD/3BA....All I can say is very huge!!!! If you are traveling w/ children great place to book and save on spending out at restaurants because you can cook a little....Spacious! Clean! Humungous! Only negative, the DIRECTIONS SUCKED!!!! Pool could be bigger!!

HotelInfo.Name: Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 8113 Resort Village Drive, Orlando, FL 32821
